title: 第一章 不要燒我！
content:
Scooping a handful of water and splashing it on his face, Zhou Ze slowly raised his head, looking at himself in the mirror, slightly haggard. As an emergency doctor, this haggardness seemed to be a standard feature.

"Doctor Zhou, a new patient is arriving soon. It seems they fell from upstairs, I wonder if it's a suicide!" Nurse Wang Ya shouted from the entrance of the men's restroom.

"Got it, I'm coming," Zhou Ze responded, then pulled out a tissue to wipe off the water droplets and started walking out.

The ambulance quickly drove into the hospital. Lying on the stretcher was an elderly man in a gray Tang suit. The elder was coughing incessantly, occasionally spitting out blood foam and fragments of spleen. His whole body was covered in blood.

Zhou Ze immediately ran over, pushing the stretcher cart while observing the patient's condition, and at the same time shouted to those ahead, "Prepare surgical instruments, quickly!"

The patient's condition was very bad.

"I... I... don't want to die."

The elder opened his eyes, looking at Zhou Ze, who was closest to him.

"Don't worry, you'll be fine. We'll help you, you won't die."

Most critically ill patients say these kinds of things at such times. After all, only a minority can truly face death calmly. And as a doctor, it's certainly not the time to analyze the illness with the patient and tell them what percentage chance they have of surviving. What the patient needs at this moment is psychological comfort.

"No... no... down there... down there... it's really too scary down there..."

The elder suddenly grabbed Zhou Ze's wrist, looking at him with a serious expression.

"Calm yourself, relax. Your life won't be in danger." Although his wrist felt a bit sore, Zhou Ze didn't try to pull free.

"I don't want... don't want to go down again... They... they found me... I... they found me..."

"Hiss..." Zhou Ze suddenly felt a sharp pain in his wrist.

"Doctor Zhou, your hand!" The young nurse beside him immediately cried out.

The elder's fingernails were very long, and for some unknown reason, they were black, a translucent black similar to amber, not like dirt accumulating inside.

And at this moment, the elder's fingernails had already dug into the flesh of Zhou Ze's wrist.

"I won't go down... won't go down... won't go down... haha... cough cough cough..."

The elder suddenly sat up and coughed violently. Immediately after, his body trembled, the hand gripping Zhou Ze's slipped away, and he became still.

"Prepare for resuscitation!" Zhou Ze shouted.

The elder was wheeled into the emergency room. Doctors and nurses began resuscitation efforts, and the defibrillator was also ready.

"Doctor Zhou, let me treat your wound." Wang Ya walked over at this moment.

As doctors, they weren't really worried about this minor injury. Their biggest concern was if the elder had other diseases, which could put the doctor at risk of occupational exposure. After all, there was a lot of blood on the elder's hands just now, and no one knew if he had any infectious diseases.

Some illnesses, once contracted, could ruin a lifetime.

After the wound was bandaged, another doctor walked out of the emergency room and shook his head at Zhou Ze.

This meant that the person couldn't be saved.

Everyone was a bit disappointed, but for them, this kind of thing was already common, and they would adjust quickly.

"Doctor Zhou, let's get you checked," Wang Ya suggested.

"No, I have something else tonight." Zhou Ze shook his head, walked directly to the changing room to change his clothes, then went to the hospital parking lot, got in his car, and drove away.

As soon as the car drove under the elevated section of Jianghai Avenue, Zhou Ze's phone rang.

"Hello, this is Zhou Ze."

"Doctor Zhou, the children are all waiting for you."

"Sorry, Principal Wu, a patient held me up. I'm on my way now. Please ask the children to wait a bit longer for me."

"Okay, okay." The call ended quickly.

Zhou Ze glanced at the time again; it was already 8:30 PM. The children at the orphanage usually went to bed early.

The red light turned green, Zhou Ze stepped on the gas and drove on.

"Honk!!!!!"

Just at that moment,

A heavy truck ran a red light and drove over. Zhou Ze only had time to turn his head and look out the window at the dazzling high beam lights,

Then,

"Bang!"

The world spun,

The small car, like a fragile piece of white paper, was directly flung away by the heavy truck, tumbling several times in the air before crashing to the ground.

...

"Ugh..."

Zhou Ze woke up,

He found his body completely unable to move, as if it was stuck.

At the same time, his eyes couldn't open. He knew he had been in a car accident, a very serious one. Out of professional habit, he really wanted to examine his injuries right now, but he couldn't move.

All around, there were occasional sounds of other vehicles passing by, and various honking noises.

Am I still at the accident scene?

Am I still in the car?

Zhou Ze thought to himself.

Soon,

The siren of a police car sounded, and the sound of a fire truck,

Finally, the familiar siren of an ambulance sounded, which was comforting to Zhou Ze.

Zhou Ze felt his body being moved. The surrounding temperature was a bit high; they must be cutting open his car to rescue him.

Zhou Ze had participated in many such rescue operations and was familiar with some of the procedures.

What a pity, the cake in his trunk and the Children's Day party for the orphanage kids would have to be canceled.

"Doctor Zhou!"

A familiar voice.

It must be Doctor Chen from the hospital.

Zhou Ze let out a long sigh of relief in his heart. At least, he had saved his life. This could be considered a sudden, unexpected disaster.

There were also sounds of a few nurses beside him. Because the surroundings were too noisy, Zhou Ze couldn't hear clearly.

But then, Doctor Chen's next sentence plunged Zhou Ze's heart into a deep abyss!

"Doctor Zhou has lost vital signs."

No,

I'm not dead!

I'm not dead yet!

I'm not dead!!

Zhou Ze screamed desperately in his heart!

He wasn't dead, he was still conscious, he wasn't dead!

Next, Zhou Ze felt someone performing CPR on him. He felt those heavy compressions again and again, but he couldn't open his eyes, nor could he speak.

He wasn't dead,

He hoped they would quickly realize he wasn't dead!

But after a flurry of activity,

Zhou Ze heard the crying voices of a few nurses he knew,

Doctor Chen punched the nearby car door, looking very distressed.

Hey!

Don't give up!

Don't ever give up!

I'm not dead!

I should be in a state of suspended animation right now,

Excessive blood loss?

Severe injury?

But I'm really not dead!

I should still be breathing, I should still have a heartbeat!

Zhou Ze roared wildly in his heart.

But then, he felt himself being lifted onto a stretcher and, presumably, carried into the ambulance.

Then came the sound of the ambulance driving off.

The nurses in the ambulance were still crying.

But their crying sounded particularly harsh in Zhou Ze's ears,

He wasn't dead,

Why cry!

Why are you crying!

Look at me again,

Look at me again,

Check again,

I'm not dead!

The ambulance stopped,

Then, Zhou Ze heard the hospital leaders speaking:

"Is little Zhou really gone just like that?"

"The car accident was very severe. Doctor Zhou was excessively injured, lost too much blood, and has been confirmed dead."

"Really? He's just gone?" Another vice president still didn't believe it.

"Little Zhou is gone," came the voice of a department head, "I just checked again."

I'm not dead!

You quack doctors!

I'm not dead!

You bastards!

Bastards!

Zhou Ze cursed incessantly in his heart. At this moment, these people beside him were no longer his colleagues, nor his friends, nor his superiors and elders,

They actually believed he was dead,

But can a dead person still hear and perceive?

I'm not dead!

You bastards,

You mongrels,

You sons of bitches!!!!!

This was Zhou Ze's most frenzied outburst, his most desperate one.

He knew,

Once he was cremated,

There would be no turning back!

He would face death directly!

A complete and utter end!

He was unwilling, he truly was unwilling. He was not yet thirty, he hadn't started a family, he didn't have children, he still had a life, he still had a long way to go!

"Mommy, I just saw this uncle's hand move," a little girl's timid voice sounded nearby.

"Slap!" A small slap landed.

"Don't talk nonsense, I'll deal with you when we get home," the girl's mother scolded.

Zhou Ze despaired,

Because no matter how much he struggled,

How much he roared in his heart,

The people outside couldn't perceive it.

He was placed on the conveyor belt,

The machine started,

He was being pushed forward,

He knew what he was about to face,

And because of that, he was utterly terrified!

No,

No,

No!

I'm not dead, I'm really not dead!

Don't burn me!

Don't burn me!

I'm really not dead yet!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

You beasts,

You mongrels!

You sons of bitches!!!!!

No one could hear his cries,

They were only responsible for feeling sad,

Only responsible for being grief-stricken,

Only responsible for completing this process,

Then going home for dinner, and continuing on tomorrow.

Finally,

Zhou Ze felt himself being pushed into a narrow place full of a greasy smell,

Then,

A sticky liquid sprayed onto his body,

He knew what it was,

It was gasoline,

Then,

"Sizzle..."

Hot!

Very hot!

Pain,

Intense burning pain!

Fire,

Fire,

Big fire,

Fire everywhere...

title: 第二章 地獄！
content:
冷，



  好冷……



  周澤不知道為什麼這裡會這麼冷，



  他行走在一條幽徑的小路上，小路的兩邊，開滿了鮮花，卻沒有絲毫浪漫美好的氣息，花朵嬌艷，像是一道道嘲諷，也像是圍觀的看客。



  花開彼岸，人去往生；



  周澤記得自己之前最後的記憶是火，大火，恐怖的火焰將自己完全吞噬，那令人心悸的炙熱溫度將自己烘烤成灰。



  但轉眼間，



  他卻來到了這裡。



  在這條路上，其實還有許多人，



  有老人，



  有孩子，



  也有年輕人和中年人，



  有男有女，



  大家穿的衣服各不相同。



  有的人穿得很簡單，有的人穿著大紅大紫的衣服，臉上也畫著過分的腮紅。



  大家都是踮著腳後跟在走路，



  沒人說話，



  也沒人發出其他聲音，



  只剩下偶爾傳出的「擦擦擦」鞋底摩擦聲響。



  周澤也在跟著所有人一起麻木地前行著，他不時地在張望，也在不時地回首，他隱約間意識到自己來到了什麼地方。 



  他，已經死了；



  而這裡，



  是地獄。



  這裡，是死者的世界，是亡者的歸宿，



  自己，



  終究還是死了。



  他不知道該怎麼辦，也不知道該做出何種選擇，



  他不想死，人，都是不想死的，但在這個地方，他完全不知道自己又該如何是好，他很迷茫，也很無助。



  「咿呀……………………………………」



  清冷的小調自遠處傳來，



  周澤撇過頭，看見遠處走來一朵朵的鮮紅，而周圍其他人對此都熟視無睹，繼續麻木地踮著自己的腳後跟往前走去。



  等近了之後，周澤看清楚了，那一朵朵鮮紅是一把把桃花紙傘，遠處，有一群女人，排著一條隊伍，撐著紙傘，婀娜走來。



  她們身材高挑，體格風、、、騷，全都穿著紫色的旗袍，走動間，大腿的肉色不時露出，隱約的魅惑，讓人心悸。



  女人們盤著髮髻，一絲不苟，甚至連她們的步履，都整整齊齊，仿佛世間最優秀的歌舞團，而且，她們已經排練了超過百年。



  她們在走，



  她們在行進， 



  從小徑的一端，走向另一端，



  無巧不巧地，



  自周澤面前經過。



  精緻的妝容，雪白的肌膚，那哼出來的清冷長調，營造出了一種煙雨朦朧的老上海氛圍。



  每個女人的手腕上，都戴著手鐲，顏色不一，大小也不同，襯托著她們的雪白皓腕，更令人目不暇接。



  可惜，



  她們不是行走在南大街商業步行區，



  也不是金碧輝煌的高端會所瓦台，



  她們腳踩著黃泉路，



  掠過的是彼岸花海，



  她們目不斜視，後者盯著前者，



  最前者，



  則目光空洞。



  當最後一個女人自周澤面前經過時，



  女人忽然側過頭，看向了周澤。



  原本世界最美麗，



  現在，



  直接跳轉到另一種極端。



  恐怖？



  當然恐怖！



  噁心？



  當然噁心！ 



  但周澤，已經是一個死人了，人會被嚇死，但鬼呢？



  女人看著周澤，



  周澤也在看著女人，



  二者目光短暫交匯，隨即，女人繼續往前走，身段搖曳，背影裊裊，旗袍的緊緻，將其秀美的身材勾勒得淋漓盡致。



  「你們……要去哪裡？」



  周澤下意識地跟著這一隊女人往前走，也就脫離了原本的隊伍。



  而小徑上木訥行走的人，



  卻沒有一個看向這裡，他們似乎不會思考，也沒有感知，而周澤，仿佛是其中的異類。



  一行女人，步步生煙，一直在往前走，呢喃哼調，似淒似冰；



  原本壓抑的環境，因為她們的出現，反而更讓人覺得蕭索。



  周澤繼續往前走著，他跟著她們。



  然後，周澤看見她們一個一個地走入了前面的水潭裡。



  水潭不大，



  宛如鏡面，



  她們的進入，似乎打破了這種平靜，吹開了一層層漣漪。



  最前面的幾個女人連頭都已經沒入了水面之中，後面的女人也在繼續跟著。



  周澤走到了水潭邊，他沒有跟著一起下去，他只是站在邊上看著。 



  這裡的一切，對於他來說都是一個絕對陌生的地方，任何人，一輩子，只有一次機會進來，而進來後，也就無法再出去了。



  潭水中央，有東西浮出，



  是一雙手，



  甲紅手白，



  纖細青蔥，



  兩隻手翩翩起舞，如夢似幻，讓人的視線瞬間被其吸引，再也無法挪動開。



  美，是吸引人的，而這種美，卻勾人心魄。



  周澤的眼眸里，慢慢地顯露出迷醉之色，甚至連自己已經情不自禁地開始往前走都不知道。



  先是腳面，



  緊接著是膝蓋，



  隨後腰部，



  到最終，



  水面沒入了脖子，



  乃至於，整個人都進入了潭水之中。



  潭水不冷，甚至很溫暖，水面清澈，能見度很高，當你進入這裡之後，你連窒息的痛苦感都沒有。



  周澤看見了先前那一隊撐著紙傘的女人，她們在水面之下依舊裊娜動人，還在繼續地往前走著。



  而距離自己最近的位置，



  則有一位身穿著紅衣的女人，她站在水下，但雙手卻在水面之上起舞翩飛。 



  周澤開始向這個紅色女人靠近，



  不是因為美色，



  也不是因為其他的虛妄影響，



  而是因為，這個女人身上仿佛有著一種說不清道不明的魔力，讓你靠近，讓你貼近，讓你情不自禁。



  終於，



  周澤靠近了她，



  而她的手，也慢慢地從水面上收了下來。



  女人頭髮很長，也很茂密，在水波之中飛舞蕩漾，讓人看不清楚她的臉。



  「終於…………又等到…………這樣子的人了…………」



  女人聲音清脆，甜甜的，糯糯的，



  迷人心酥。



  女人美麗的雙手伸出來，搭在了周澤的肩膀上，這動作，很是親昵。



  「你…………來陪我…………」



  下一刻，



  女人的頭髮開始飄散開，縷縷青絲開始吹拂在周澤的面龐；



  美人拂面，這似乎是很有情調的一件事，但接下來，女人的頭髮卻化作了世間最為堅韌的鋼索，開始捆綁周澤的脖子。



  「你來…………陪我…………」



  頭髮披散，不再遮掩， 



  女人的面容終於顯露出來，



  她沒有面容，



  她的臉，是平的，沒有波瀾，也沒有褶皺，這是一場很平滑的臉，足以讓萬千少女去嫉妒和羨慕，



  但她沒有鼻子，也沒有嘴巴，沒有眼睛，更沒有耳朵，



  無面……女。



  周澤感知到自己無法呼吸了，自己胸膛都快炸裂開來，同時，他的身體仿佛即將崩潰。



  無面女的笑聲依舊清脆空靈，但在此時的周澤耳中，卻像是魔音貫耳。



  周澤已經清醒過來，



  他不知道在這個地方被以這種方式糾纏住到底意味著什麼，



  但總之，



  不會是好結局。



  「你在這裡…………陪我…………！」



  無面女繼續笑著，頭髮亂舞。



  周澤下意識地伸出手，去抓住纏繞在自己脖頸位置的頭髮，他想要努力去將其掙脫。



  無面女對他自不量力的表現感到很是有趣，



  「你掙脫不了的，別掙扎了，能走到這裡來的，都有靈，有靈的人，我吞夠了，就有機會回去！



  你註定， 



  將成為，



  我的祭品！」



  但就在話音剛落的瞬間，



  無面女發出了一聲驚呼：「怎麼可能…………不可能…………」



  周澤的十指指甲開始慢慢地變長，漆黑通透的顏色，在這個水潭之中，閃爍著屬於它的異樣光輝，這個指甲的顏色，和周澤死前救治的那位老者指甲顏色一模一樣。



  「滋滋滋滋滋………………滋滋滋滋滋…………」



  熱水下油鍋的聲音傳來，



  無面女糾纏著周澤的頭髮在觸碰到周澤指甲時直接融化崩斷，而周澤的身形則開始慢慢地後退，開始脫離無面女的束縛。



  「不可能……不可能……這不可能…………為什麼！為什麼你也能離開！



  為什麼你也能離開我不能！



  為什麼！



  為什麼！



  這不公平！



  不公平！」



  無面女用手去攔住周澤，



  但當周澤用手去擺脫時，指甲一旦觸碰到無面的手，無面女原本完美無瑕的玉手當即被燙出一個洞。



  「啊啊啊啊！！！」 



  無面女發出了一聲慘叫，



  身形開始後退，自此，也失去了對周澤的掌控。



  周澤的身體開始上浮，



  即將浮出水面。



  「你跑不掉的……你會被……會被抓回來的！



  這裡，



  才是亡者的歸宿！



  你們，你和他們，哪怕是走了，也終究會被抓回來！」



  無面女在下方歇斯底里地吶喊咆哮著，



  她嫉妒，



  她羨慕，



  她瘋狂！！！



  而不斷上升中的周澤，



  則慢慢地失去了自己的意識，



  幽冥黃泉小路，



  彼岸花的炫目，



  無面女的咆哮，



  旗袍女的婉約，



  一切的一切，



  似乎都正在漸漸離他遠去…………

title: 第三章 贅婿
content:
On the midnight street,

The streetlights glowed yellow,
And people were terrified.
The weather was cold, with a wind like a knife cutting into one's skin.

Zhou Ze also felt cold.
He didn't know where he was again,
But he knew one thing,
This was... the human world.

He had died, but he had come back.
He didn't know what to do,
So he could only mechanically and numbly continue walking forward.

He didn't have the time to think about too many other things right now,
Such as the place he had just been to,
Such as the old man he had saved before his car accident,
Such as the faceless woman in the pond wearing a red dress,
Such as... his fingernails.

He had come back, which should have been a joyful thing, but even when people occasionally walked past him, and no matter how hard he tried to greet them, no one could see or hear him.
He was excluded, isolated by this world.

Those who haven't experienced being put in "solitary confinement" won't understand the pain of complete isolation. For Zhou Ze, the entire world right now was his prison, and a black cloth had been draped over it.

No one could see him,
No one could communicate with him,
He couldn't pick up any solid object,
In fact,
Even the wind could easily blow through him.

He was so frail,
The phrase "weak as the wind" was truly no exaggeration for him.

Moreover, what shocked and horrified Zhou Ze the most was that
He could see faint specks of light constantly scattering from his body,
In other words,
His body was slowly fading.
Perhaps in another quarter of an hour, he would completely disappear, every last insignificant trace of him erased.

He didn't know how any of this had happened, but he knew that he truly didn't have much time left.

Among the Eight Immortals, Tieguai Li entered the body of a man who had starved to death as a soul, which is how he became known in later generations.
Zhou Ze had also heard stories about ghosts "possessing a body to return to life." He also wanted to possess a body to return to life. He was very cold and very panicked; he needed a physical body to attach himself to.
He didn't even care whose body it was.

At times like these, people are always selfish, and Zhou Ze was no exception. Moreover, he truly couldn't take it anymore.

However, whenever he tried to approach someone, lights would appear above their head and on their shoulders, directly preventing him from getting close. He even suffered harm as a result, accelerating his "evaporation."

He was a little tired, and a little numb,
He was waiting for his end,
Waiting for his termination.

As someone who had already died once, facing death again made him more composed.
Furthermore, given Zhou Ze's current situation, the longer he lingered here, the longer he would endure suffering.

"Creak..."
Ahead, a shop was still lit, it seemed to be a bookstore, as rows of bookshelves could be seen through the glass door.
Someone pushed the door open and walked out; it was a man in a hoodie. The man wore a hat, so his face was unclear. He looked around for a while, then left in a hurry.
Of course, the man couldn't see Zhou Ze standing less than five meters away from him.

Initially, Zhou Ze didn't feel anything unusual, but shortly after the man left, Zhou Ze suddenly sensed a warm aura from inside the bookstore.
Yes,
A warm aura.
This warmth bewildered Zhou Ze, but he was like a person about to freeze to death who suddenly finds a box of matches; even though he knows the matches won't save his life, he'll still strike one to feel the last warmth before dying.

Zhou Ze walked towards it, his body passing directly through the bookstore's glass door, continuing inward, and arriving behind the bookstore's bookshelves.

Behind the bookshelves,
Lay a person,
It was a handsome young man, perhaps twenty-three or twenty-four years old. Because the air conditioning was on in the store, he wasn't wearing many clothes, just a long-sleeved shirt and a light jacket.
He lay on the floor, but on him, Zhou Ze felt a warm sensation, like a pauper walking down the road at night and picking up a bag of gold coins.
This attraction was irresistible, and Zhou Ze, in his current state, had no right to refuse!

Zhou Ze walked over and crouched in front of the young man.
He didn't know how to enter the other person's body, but he knew how to access the warmth he needed.
He extended a hand and placed it on the other person's chest.
Zhou Ze saw his fingernails slowly embedding into the other person's body.
It was a very strange feeling, different from when a "breeze" previously blew through his body as he walked down the street. This was a fusion, a merging using his fingernails as a medium.
Slowly, Zhou Ze's entire being began to enter the other person's body; the two began to overlap.

..................

"Xu Le! Wake up, wake up!"
Zhou Ze was awakened by a series of shoves. No, to be precise, he was "startled." He opened his eyes and found himself sitting behind the bookstore counter, where he had been resting his head on his hands.

"Hey, wake up!"
The woman's voice was sharp and high-pitched, carrying an air of bossiness.
Raising his head, Zhou Ze looked at the woman in front of him. No, to be precise, she should be a girl, probably high school age. Although she was a big girl, she still had a bit of childishness about her.

"Hey, Xu Le, what do you mean? You think you're tough, huh? You want to show face to my parents and my sister, huh? How dare you not come home all night!
Who gave you the guts?!"

Xu Le?
Who is that?
Zhou Ze spread his hands in bewilderment, realizing his hands were smooth. His old hands used to have calluses from long hours of practicing surgical instruments, but these hands didn't.

"Hey, I'm talking to you!"
The girl slapped the counter with a fierce look.

Zhou Ze frowned slightly, stood up, and walked to the glass mirror by the shop door. He saw his reflection, an unfamiliar face. No, he had seen this face before, it was the face he saw last night.

This body,
Is mine now?

"Hey, what do you mean? My parents are both angry. My mom is throwing a fit at home. I'm telling you, everything you eat, drink, and use now is from my family. What right do you, a live-in son-in-law, have to put on airs in my house?
Who are you trying to impress?!
If you dare not come home tonight, do you believe I'll come over and slap you directly?!"

The girl raised her hand as if to slap him, but she suddenly noticed that the man in front of her, her "brother-in-law," didn't dodge or beg for mercy as he usually would. Instead, the look in his eyes made her feel a little scared.
At this point, she checked the time and realized it was already seven-thirty.

"Hmph, I'm going to school first, I'll settle scores with you tonight!"
The girl stomped off angrily.

Zhou Ze slowly sat back down in the chair behind the counter. There was an old laptop here, and a mobile phone next to it.
Even now, he hadn't fully adapted to the change in his identity.

He was Zhou Ze, a famous young surgeon in Tongcheng, and he was an orphan.
Now,
He had become this person.
What did that girl just say?
I am... a live-in son-in-law?
Do I have a wife?
And a mother-in-law and father-in-law?

And judging by the attitude and tone of his "sister-in-law" when speaking to his "brother-in-law" just now, his status as a "live-in son-in-law" truly conformed to ancient traditions.
A live-in son-in-law, also known as a "daochamen," was not only looked down upon by his wife's family but also by everyone around him in ancient times. Their status was even comparable to that of criminals, and during the Han and Tang dynasties, those forced into border garrisons often included赘婿 (a man who marries into his wife's family).

Picking up the phone, he found it wasn't password-protected. He didn't know if the guy was lazy or didn't dare to set a password, but at least it allowed Zhou Ze to easily open his WeChat and QQ.
There were very few people on his QQ list, just a few middle school, high school, and college classmates, and then a family list with only one person, labeled "Wife."
He opened his QQ chat history with her; it was empty.

Alright,
Zhou Ze opened WeChat and tried to find the woman labeled "Wife." There were replies here, mostly Xu Le asking about things like what to eat tonight, what to prepare for tonight, how much money was needed for inventory, how much the bookstore had sold recently, how his body was, a whole bunch of questions.
And the other party's replies were often perfunctory and aloof,
Like:
"Oh"
"Hmm"
"Okay"
To substitute.

Zhou Ze tossed the phone aside. This relationship was a bit complicated. He suddenly looked at his palm; his fingernails were no different from an ordinary person's.
However, in the events involving the old man he saved before his car accident, his escape from the faceless woman, and his entry into this guy's body, his fingernails played a crucial role.

With a thought,
Just then,
Zhou Ze found his fingernails slowly growing longer, and at the same time, they became dark and translucent. There was even a faint black mist swirling around them.

"Whew..."
He let out a long breath,
Closed his eyes,
And when he opened them again,
His fingernails had returned to normal.

From morning until noon, Zhou Ze sat there, trying to adapt to his new identity and calm the discomfort caused by his identity change. He didn't eat lunch, either forgetting or simply not feeling hungry.
This was still Tongcheng. Zhou Ze's old home was in Chongchuan District; now he was in Gangzha District, not far away.

By afternoon, Zhou Ze sighed and slowly stood up. "When in Rome, do as the Romans do."
He began to try cleaning the bookshelves; at least he could find something to do for himself.

The old man who had choked him before he died had said "he was discovered," and the faceless woman in Hell had said "you'll be caught eventually," which instilled a sense of crisis in Zhou Ze.
His current state was considered "barely surviving." Coming back from the dead was a stroke of luck, so he cherished it. At least, before fully understanding the situation and gathering enough clues, he had to embrace this identity and ideally not cause too much abnormality, so as not to attract the attention of those "who want to catch him."

The business of this shop was truly terrible. The slump in the traditional book market hadn't been a one or two-day affair for a long time, and this place wasn't on the golden strip right outside a school.
One could only say that Xu Le choosing to open a bookstore here made it questionable whether he could even break even.

It wasn't until three o'clock in the afternoon that the first customer of the day walked in.
The customer browsed the children's books section for a long time.
Zhou Ze waited a while, then walked over and asked, "What kind of topic are you looking for?"
Although, Zhou Ze didn't really understand either.

"Just looking around," the other party replied.
"Okay." Zhou Ze stopped bothering, he hadn't yet settled into his role as "bookstore owner."

But just then,
The other person suddenly walked behind him and said eerily,
"You really don't recognize me?"
"What?" Zhou Ze asked.
"Last night I hit your head with a baseball bat and stole your money,
And I even specifically checked,
You clearly weren't breathing then."

title: 第四章 打工是不可能打工的
content:
Zhou Ze was stunned. So, the reason he was able to use Xu Le's body for a soul transmigration last night was because Xu Le had just been killed?

Because the body was still warm, he could enter it?

Looking at it this way, he seemed to be quite lucky.

Without disgust, anger, or even panic about possibly having his identity exposed, Zhou Ze turned around and looked at the man, who was about his age.

The man was taken aback.

He saw something unusual in Zhou Ze's eyes.

It was joy.

It was relief.

And even,

a hint of appreciation.

As the host, Zhou Ze clearly understood the difficult situation he faced last night. If this guy hadn't happened to commit murder at that time, he might have been annihilated, never to see the sun today.

"Sorry, I passed out last night, and my head feels terrible this morning, like I'm drunk. I've forgotten what happened yesterday," Zhou Ze explained casually.

He didn't think the other party would guess he was a ghost that had transmigrated into a body, unless the other party was crazy.

"You don't blame me?" The other party pointed to his nose, a bit absurdly. "Even though I've told you I clubbed you yesterday?"

"It's fine. I even thank you for not taking my phone and computer from the table."

"Uh... I forgot." The man scratched his head. "It's good that you're okay. This is the money I robbed from you yesterday."

The man voluntarily took out three hundred yuan from his pocket, then rummaged further and pulled out another eight hundred yuan.

"Eight hundred yuan is for your medical expenses, and three hundred is what I robbed yesterday." The man pursed his lips. "Yesterday, I gambled online and lost all my salary to the bookie. When I passed your bookstore, I suddenly wanted to get some money. After I knocked you down, I found you weren't breathing, and it scared me to death.

I ran home and couldn't sleep all night, just thinking if the police would suddenly break in and arrest me. Robbery and murder, I only took three hundred yuan, I felt so foolish, it wasn't worth it."

The man reached out and patted Zhou Ze's shoulder.

"Buddy, it's really good you didn't die. Seriously, I've been walking around outside since morning, waiting for someone to call the police, waiting for the police to come. But then I saw you were still in the bookstore.

You know, at that moment, I almost knelt down and kowtowed to you. Thank you. You're tough; you didn't die. Otherwise, I'd be finished. There are so many cameras here; if you had died, I definitely wouldn't have gotten away."

Zhou Ze looked at the eleven hundred yuan in his hand, then at the "murderer" in front of him, who was repenting with tears in his eyes. He felt that this scene was very bizarre.

To be honest, Xu Le *did* die. Because he died, Zhou Ze could take over his body. And because Zhou Ze took over, this guy in front of him was absolved of murder.

Both Zhou Ze and this guy benefited; only Xu Le, the unlucky one, got screwed.

"Alright, it's fine. Maybe I just had a stitch in my side last night." Zhou Ze moved the other party's hand from his shoulder. He used to be an emergency doctor; what kind of filth hadn't he seen? But in that extreme environment, he developed a slight潔癖 (germophobia/mysophobia). In fact, most emergency doctors have varying degrees of洁癖.

It was precisely because they had witnessed too much dirt and filth that they knew how to cherish "cleanliness" even more.

"You really don't blame me?" The man said with some joy.

"No, I don't blame you." Zhou Ze nodded. "Go live your life and work hard. Don't make mistakes next time."

"Okay, thank you, buddy. You're a straightforward guy."

The man nodded heavily, left the bookstore, and went to embrace his "new life."

Zhou Ze, meanwhile, picked up his phone. He thought about it and decided he should still call the police, not to report the other party for killing him (Xu Le), but to report them for suspected theft.

Anyway, let the police investigate. If the other party really had a criminal record or had done other bad things and was caught by the police, it would serve him right.

He occupied someone else's body; he had to do something for that unlucky guy.

Although, given the other party's good attitude of admitting fault and even paying for his medical expenses, reporting him by name was indeed quite unethical, a real case of 生兒子沒* (having a son without an ass)¹.

However, just as Zhou Ze dialed 110, and the voice from the operator came through,

at the bookstore entrance,

that guy suddenly returned.

"There's something else..." As soon as the other party walked in, he saw Zhou Ze holding his phone. He paused, then pointed directly at Zhou Ze, "You're still calling the police, aren't you, you son of a bitch!"

Zhou Ze shook his head.

"Let me see your phone! Give it to me!"

Zhou Ze could only continue to shake his head.

"You're going back on your word, you bastard! I'll kill you! Let's see if you die this time!"

The man instantly entered an excited and agitated state. He must have had some mental issues, perhaps due to a long-term gambler's lifestyle and being out of touch with society. He tended to enter extreme states when provoked.

The other party lunged. Zhou Ze put down his phone and began to retreat.

He was a doctor in his previous life, not a fighter, nor had he practiced martial arts. His body in this life was also a bit frail. When it came to a face-to-face fight, he was indeed a bit flustered.

"Bang!"

The man slammed Zhou Ze against the wall, his hands tightly gripping Zhou Ze's neck.

"I'll let you call the police! I'll let you call the police! I'll let you go back on your word! Fine, I'll let you die, really die! This time I'll strangle you to death and then drain your blood! Let's see if you still don't die!"

The man roared through gritted teeth.

Such a pathetic bookstore business; in the afternoon, let alone customers, there weren't even many pedestrians outside the door.

His neck was almost numb, and he couldn't breathe. Zhou Ze struggled with all his might. As he struggled, Zhou Ze's fingernails suddenly turned black and elongated.

Immediately after, Zhou Ze wrapped his hands around the other party's back.

"Hiss..."

The man suddenly shivered, his eyes rolling back. He immediately released Zhou Ze's neck, stumbled back a few steps, knocking over several bookshelves, and then collapsed to the ground.

Zhou Ze was freed. He reached up and rubbed his neck. He hadn't been too panicked earlier. After all, his fingernails could even harm ghosts in hell; dealing with an ordinary person shouldn't be a problem, right?

But Zhou Ze still wasn't entirely clear about the specific reason or use of these fingernails. He only knew they were likely "infected" from the old man he saved before his car accident.

It's truly,

"得了灰指甲，一个传染俩" (got gray nail, infects two)².

He walked over, squatted down, and patted the man's face. Thankfully, he wasn't dead; he was still breathing. Zhou Ze shook his head, picked up his phone, and called the police again.

...

After the police station completed the report, the police officer asked Zhou Ze to wait in the small hall because the matter Zhou Ze reported was a bit odd. He said someone came to rob him, but the one who was knocked unconscious turned out to be the "assailant." And now this assailant was still in the hospital; they had to wait for him to wake up for further confirmation.

However, the police officer at least didn't put handcuffs on Zhou Ze.

Squatting next to Zhou Ze was a middle-aged man whose left hand was locked to the radiator.

"Brother, you're awesome! That guy tried to rob you, but you took him down?" The rather disheveled middle-aged man said as he rubbed his long, muddy bangs. "You really have that vibe I had when I was young. For these clueless petty thieves, you have to beat them to death!"

"Hey, you behave yourself." A young police officer walked over and reprimanded him. "This is your how many times stealing electric bike batteries since winter started?

I'm telling you, the New Year is coming soon. Can't you just settle down? Or find a proper job and earn some money to send home? You're a grown man."

"It's impossible to work, not in this lifetime. I don't know how to do business. Stealing electric bike batteries is the only way to make a living. Going to the detention center feels like coming home.

Everyone inside is talented, and they speak so well. I love it in there!"

"Hmph." The young police officer didn't want to bother with this guy anymore and turned to leave.

"Brother, how was my speech just now?" The greasy middle-aged man winked at Zhou Ze.

"Quite interesting." Zhou Ze smiled.

"Che Guevara is my idol. Che Guevara, do you know who that is?"

Zhou Ze nodded.

"Let me tell you, life has to be..." The greasy middle-aged man paused, looking towards the doorway. "Oh my goodness, she's so beautiful! Is she a police officer?"

Zhou Ze turned his head and saw a woman in a blue down jacket and long leather boots walking towards them with another female police officer at the door.

"She should be a police officer," Zhou Ze said.

The woman was very beautiful, with a delicate figure and fair skin. Most importantly, it was her temperament that was the biggest plus.

"But she's not wearing a police uniform," the greasy man retorted.

"Maybe plainclothes," Zhou Ze guessed.

"You're right, a beautiful police officer, tsk tsk. Looks like I'll have to come in more often in the future." The greasy middle-aged man smacked his lips, still wanting more. "If I could marry her, I'd be willing to shorten my life by ten years."

Zhou Ze shook his head. He dared not joke about lifespan and longevity anymore.

"You disagree?" The greasy man, seeing Zhou Ze shake his head, said anxiously, "You're blind, you know. For a woman like that, losing ten years of life is absolutely worth it..."

At that moment, the female police officer and the woman in long boots walked up to Zhou Ze.

"Xu Le, your wife is here to pick you up. The investigation there is clear; you're free to go," the female police officer said, pointing at Zhou Ze.

"..." Zhou Ze.

"..." The greasy middle-aged man.

***
¹ 生兒子沒** (shēng ér zi méi pì gu) - A very crude and strong Chinese idiom that literally means "to have a son without an ass." It's used to describe someone who is extremely unethical, despicable, or heartless, implying they lack the basic human decency that even an "ass" would represent.
² 得了灰指甲，一个传染俩 (dé le huī zhǐ jiǎ, yī gè chuán rǎn liǎ) - A play on a well-known advertising slogan for a foot fungus medicine, which originally said "得了灰指甲，一个传染俩" (got gray nail, one infects two), implying the highly contagious nature of fungal infections. Here, it's used humorously to suggest that the "infection" of special abilities (the black, long fingernails) also spread from the old man to Zhou Ze.

title: 第五章 陌生的夫妻
content:
"Officer, may I ask what my wife's name is?"

This thought only crossed Zhou Ze's mind for a second; he wasn't that stupid. But he genuinely didn't know his "wife's" real name. In this era, few people used their real names for QQ or WeChat accounts.

The greasy man, however, cast a mournful glance at Zhou Ze: "Brother, that's not cool. We said we'd be each other's broken-winged angels, remember?"

Zhou Ze returned the look, equally helpless: "I'm surprised too."

The greasy man lowered his head, sighed, and murmured softly, "My dumplings are delicious."

"Let's go."

His "wife" said coolly, then turned and walked out.

Zhou Ze could only follow.

She drove a Porsche Cayenne and got straight into it.

Zhou Ze opened the door and sat in the passenger seat.

To be honest,

it was a bit awkward.

If that unfortunate soul, Xu Le, had a more normal marital and family life, then Zhou Ze wouldn't be in such an embarrassing situation. If his wife showed concern, he could make excuses, like he felt dizzy and couldn't remember some things.

But this woman clearly had the vibe of an ice queen, seeming completely uninterested in engaging with him. Even picking him up from the police station felt like a mere formality.

It was like his dog got lost, was found by a security guard,

and he went to pick it up.

That's how it felt.

The woman started the car. She was actually quite young, probably around the same age as him (Xu Le), a few years younger than the original Zhou Ze.

As the car drove onto the elevated road, the woman finally broke the silence:

"Are you alright?"

"Oh, I'm fine," Zhou Ze replied.

Then,

silence again.

The woman thought her husband was unusually quiet today, but she had no desire to explore why.

Just then, the woman's phone rang. She put it on speaker, and the voice from the other end came through the car's audio system:

"Dr. Lin, there's just been a school bus collision on Youth Central Road. Casualties are already being transported to our hospital. The director wants you back urgently."

Zhou Ze was slightly stunned.

So his wife was also a doctor.

And,

his wife's surname was "Lin."

"I understand, I'll be right back." The woman hung up, exited the elevated road at the next exit, made a sharp turn at the traffic light, and drove towards the hospital.

She didn't ask Zhou Ze if he wanted to be dropped off at home first, or if he wanted to get out and take a taxi back himself. Instead, she drove all the way into the parking lot of Chongchuan District People's Hospital.

Honestly, Zhou Ze was actually worried she'd make him get out and take a taxi home. He imagined having to shamelessly ask:

"Wife, where do we live again? I forgot."

It felt so stupid.

The woman got out of the car, and Zhou Ze followed. The woman entered the hospital building and got into the elevator, and Zhou Ze followed her into the elevator. The woman entered the women's changing room, and Zhou Ze...

Zhou Ze sat down on a bench by the corridor.

Just then, the first batch of accident victims arrived. One was critically injured, and five other children also had serious injuries.

Watching his "wife" change into a white coat and immediately busy herself with treatment,

Zhou Ze could only sit on the bench, lost in thought.

It felt a bit like a mother bringing her son to work; the mother worked while the son watched and played by himself.

However,

the unique smell of disinfectant in the hospital and the stuffy feeling from the central air conditioning were truly nostalgic, a familiar sensation.

The emergency room was ahead. The critically injured and dying person seemed to be a girl.

It was a kindergarten school bus accident. Seeing the little ones crying out in pain on the operating table, the scene was indeed heartbreaking.

Zhou Ze pursed his lips. Normally, at this time, he would have already changed his clothes and joined the treatment. He was the most famous young surgeon in Tongcheng. But now, he could only be an onlooker.

This feeling was uncomfortable, but he could only endure it. Moreover, this People's Hospital was publicly known as the best hospital in Tongcheng, and the number and quality of its doctors were unquestionable. They should be able to handle it.

Soon, the next batch of children were also brought in. Their injuries were minor, only requiring wound treatment or simple bandaging.

Traffic police were specifically guarding the entrance to this floor. Some parents who had been notified had already arrived, their emotions very agitated. However, letting parents in at this time could hinder the treatment, so they had to be held back for now.

Zhou Ze shook his head, stood up, walked to the window at the far end of the hallway, raised the window, then pulled out a cigarette from his pocket. He smoked, and Xu Le also smoked, so this was convenient.

"Uncle, you can't smoke in the hospital."

Just as he put the cigarette to his mouth, a crisp voice of a little girl came from behind Zhou Ze.

Zhou Ze turned around and saw a little girl in a lily dress standing behind him, pouting and glaring at him.

Cough, cough,

a bit awkward.

Zhou Ze could only put the cigarette away. No matter what, being lectured by a little girl about public etiquette was always a bit embarrassing.

"Little one, aren't you cold dressed like that?" Zhou Ze bent down and asked.

The little girl had delicate skin, a touch of baby fat on her face, and big, lovely eyes, like an enlarged Barbie doll.

"Not cold at all." The little girl shook her head. "Uncle, you can't smoke in the hospital anymore, okay?"

"I know."

Zhou Ze nodded earnestly.

"Are you alright?" Zhou Ze asked again.

"I'm fine. The other children are all injured, and they're in a lot of pain."

The little girl turned sideways and looked at the children behind her who were having their wounds bandaged. Most of them were crying, not necessarily because the pain was unbearable, but because if one person cried, the others followed suit.

Nurses were not only treating wounds but also comforting the children.

Outside, the parents, temporarily held back by the traffic police, were constantly yelling and cursing.

In short,

that entire floor felt chaotic.

"Then you're really lucky," Zhou Ze exclaimed.

The little girl didn't even have a single scratch on her.

"Yep, I was sitting in the back row, so I'm fine." The little girl nodded, then actively ran over to comfort her classmates, checking on them here and there, and encouraging and soothing them.

She was a very sensible and strong child.

Zhou Ze turned around, instinctively took out a cigarette again, but then thought better of it and put it back.

When he returned to the bench and sat down, three nurses and two doctors walked out of the emergency room.

One male doctor and one female doctor, the female doctor being his wife.

"It's okay, we did our best," the male doctor said, reaching out to put a hand on Zhou Ze's wife's shoulder to comfort her.

As her husband,

Zhou Ze was sitting right there,

but he wasn't bothered by this scene...

That scoundrel Xu Le had left him in such a complicated mess: a live-in son-in-law, an extremely short-tempered sister-in-law, and clearly ill-tempered in-laws.

Zhou Ze wished his wife would quickly have an affair, dump him, and divorce him so he could have some peace and quiet.

Anyone who had just died and been resurrected into a new body wouldn't want to deal with the complexities of a modern urban son-in-law's life, right?

However, to Zhou Ze's surprise, his wife directly blocked the doctor's "salty" hand and pointed at him, saying:

"This is my husband."

There was no tenderness in her voice, just simple, stiff words, like she was saying: This is my pet husky.

"Oh, hello, sir." The male doctor's face was a bit awkward. No matter what, flirting with someone's wife in front of them always made one feel a little sheepish.

Zhou Ze smiled, acknowledging him. It seemed his wife was quite virtuous... but he couldn't bring himself to be happy. It wasn't about being cuckolded.

It was simply, how nice would it be if life were simpler.

"I'll go check on the other kids. They've all been taken care of, so there shouldn shouldn't be anything else. You and your husband should go back and rest early," the male doctor said before walking away.

Dr. Lin sat down on the bench next to Zhou Ze. She took off her mask, removed her gloves, and dropped them on the floor.

Zhou Ze noticed her eyes were a little red, and she was gently biting her lip. Clearly, she was in a very bad mood, which meant that critically injured child hadn't made it.

She looked quite 'pitiable'.

Zhou Ze felt a bit of understanding for Xu Le now. This live-in son-in-law at least earned a lot more than his peers, with his in-laws' better financial conditions as a prerequisite. And indeed, this Dr. Lin was truly beautiful.

"Don't take it to heart. You'll experience much more of this in the future. Just seek peace of mind."

Zhou Ze, as an experienced person, offered comfort. His experience was far richer than his "wife's," and his psychological resilience was naturally much stronger.

"Shut up."

The woman replied with those two words. If Zhou Ze had spoken those words in his original capacity as a senior, it would have been guidance.

But Zhou Ze was now Xu Le, and for him to say such a thing to Dr. Lin, it just sounded like pure, detached advice.

"..." Zhou Ze shrugged, mentally scorning Xu Le again. Look how cowardly you are; your wife dares to tell you to shut up in public.

Dr. Lin, her eyes red, slowly stood up: "I'm going to change clothes. Let's go home."

"Okay," Zhou Ze nodded.

At this moment, two nurses pulled open the curtain of the emergency room, revealing the bed inside. A small body lay on the bed, covered with a white sheet.

Zhou Ze's gaze swept over it. He had seen many dead people; in all his years of practicing medicine, he had saved many lives, but he had also seen many patients die before him, helpless.

"Dr. Lin, is this your husband?" a young nurse asked teasingly. They knew Dr. Lin was married, but her husband was different from the boyfriends of other female doctors and nurses; he had never shown up at the hospital.

You can't blame them for joking in the face of death. It's like asking those fresh-faced people who go to Tibet once and post on WeChat Moments about their purified and pious souls to stay there for ten years; they wouldn't be able to handle it. It's unrealistic.

"Yes," Dr. Lin nodded, her emotions having somewhat calmed down by now.

"Then you two should hurry back. Maybe you'll have some 'activities' when you get home, right?

Let me tell you, our Dr. Lin really loves children. You two should hurry home and..."

"Damn it!"

"..." The little nurse paused.

Zhou Ze saw the hem of a lily dress peeking out from under the white sheet. His mind buzzed, and he suddenly realized that the unharmed little girl he had just seen,

she wasn't human!

title: 第六章 見家長了！
content:
That single expletive, "Fuck,"

After it was uttered,

The two young nurses were at a loss, and Dr. Lin was also stunned for a moment.

It was just too simple and crude a response.

Zhou Ze offered no explanation, reaching out directly to pull back the white sheet covering the girl's head.

It was her, it really was her!

No wonder she had no injuries at all just now,

Not even a single scratch on her body.

This wasn't because she was lucky to be in the back row.

In reality,

She was the most severely injured among all the children; the doctors had been working frantically to save her.

Her soul had floated out, yet she was unaware, still reminding herself not to smoke in public, and even comforting the other children who had minor injuries.

Actually,

Those children couldn't see her at all.

In the entire hospital,

The only person who could see her,

Was Zhou Ze!

"Is she dead?" Zhou Ze asked, his gaze scanning the surroundings.

"Xu Le?" Dr. Lin looked at her husband. She didn't want to dwell on his recent cursing because she noticed her husband was acting strangely.

"She's not dead yet, keep saving her, keep resuscitating!"

Zhou Ze suddenly grabbed Dr. Lin's arm, pulling her closer, and shouted:

"The resuscitation time limit hasn't passed, she still has a chance to wake up, keep resuscitating!"

"Sir, sir!"

Seeing Zhou Ze roughly grab Dr. Lin, the two nurses immediately stepped forward, ready to pull Zhou Ze away. In their eyes, Dr. Lin's husband was a bit inexplicable, and also showed tendencies towards domestic violence.

Zhou Ze pushed the two nurses away from his side, also releasing his grip, and muttered softly:

"Where are you, where are you, where on earth are you!"

Zhou Ze rushed out, running, searching.

Just a moment ago, the girl's soul was still moving among the children, comforting them. Now, she was nowhere to be found.

Had she already gone to hell?

Was she already dead?

Was it already too late?

Zhou Ze felt a bit lost. He didn't know why he was so agitated, nor why he was so anxious.

Perhaps, it was because of his profession; it was his duty to save any patient who had a chance of survival. Moreover, that kind and resilient girl had interacted with him just now.

"Uncle, are you looking for me?"

A familiar child's voice sounded behind Zhou Ze. Zhou Ze immediately turned around and saw the little girl again.

However, the little girl's body was not as solid as before; now she had become semi-transparent.

"Uncle, I'm a little cold." The little girl hugged her arms and squatted down. "I went to find the nurse sisters to ask them to lend me some clothes, but the nurse sisters ignored me. Do they dislike me? Am I very annoying?"

Specks of light continuously overflowed from the little girl's body. Zhou Ze had seen this scene before; it had happened to him back then.

"Xu Le, come back with me!"

Dr. Lin walked over at this moment.

The little girl turned her head, looking behind her.

"Don't look!"

Zhou Ze took a step forward, reaching out to cover the little girl's eyes. No one knew what would happen if she saw her own body lying on the hospital bed.

Would she break down?

Would she realize her death and then simply dissipate?

When Zhou Ze's hand touched the little girl's body, Zhou Ze's fingernails became slightly warm at that moment. They didn't lengthen or turn black, but Zhou Ze felt they were very hot. At the same time, the little girl's body began to twist, turning into a circle of light that revolved around Zhou Ze's fingertips. And this light, others around clearly couldn't see.

"Get out of the way, she can still be saved!" Zhou Ze rushed towards the hospital bed again.

"Xu Le!" Dr. Lin's chest heaved. The deceased was gone; she didn't know why her husband was still rambling and acting insane, especially since her husband studied civil engineering and had no connection to medicine whatsoever.

This time, when Zhou Ze rushed over, the two young nurses didn't dare to stop him. Zhou Ze pulled back the white sheet and placed his hands on the girl's chest.

Yes, that's how he came back to life himself.

Your soul has come out,

It can go back in,

You can live!

After seeing the light from his fingertips completely enter the girl's body, Zhou Ze began to perform CPR, pressing down on the girl with his hands clasped together.

"Wake up!"

"Wake up!"

The two nurses dared not approach, looking at Dr. Lin instead.

"She's dead."

Dr. Lin walked up to Zhou Ze and said.

"The golden hour for resuscitation hasn't passed, I've been keeping track of the time," Zhou Ze shouted, still pressing. "She can live, she can live!"

Dr. Lin pursed her lips, then directly reached out and pushed Zhou Ze away. After that, she began to press on the girl's chest with her own hands clasped.

"Your force is too great; she has injuries. Ah Chun, hook up the instruments again, continue resuscitation."

Zhou Ze was pushed away, but he didn't get angry; he just kept staring at the little girl on the bed.

The only blessing was probably that the parents were stopped by the traffic police, and there were so many other children making noise outside that no one noticed what was happening here.

Dr. Lin continued pressing, beads of sweat already forming on her forehead. She didn't know why she was going along with this man's madness, but for some reason, she had seen something unusual in his eyes just now.

And this man was her husband; today, she found him somewhat unfathomable.

The instruments were reconnected, but the display screen still showed a flat line.

The two young nurses stood by, somewhat at a loss.

Couldn't be saved?

Even if he put the soul back,

Still couldn't be saved?

A sense of loss spread through Zhou Ze's heart.

"Beep...beep...beep..."

Just then,

The previously flat line suddenly wavered,

Dr. Lin looked at the display screen with shock,

This,

Was it a medical miracle?

..................

It was already evening when they drove home from the hospital. Zhou Ze sat in the passenger seat, and Dr. Lin drove. They still weren't speaking.

Silence seemed to be the default for a married couple's relationship. However, usually it was Xu Le who tried to break the silence, but today, it was Dr. Lin.

"Have you studied medicine?"

"No."

"Your technique just now was very professional." Dr. Lin could tell.

"I had some training when I was learning to drive," Zhou Ze casually made up an excuse.

"But you don't have a driver's license." Dr. Lin frowned slightly.

"..." Zhou Ze.

Hmm, Zhou Ze silently scorned Xu Le in his heart again.

Dr. Lin didn't intend to delve deeper, only saying, "Today, thank you for your persistence."

"No need to thank me." Zhou Ze waved his hand. As... at least he still considered himself a doctor. Saving a patient really didn't require thanks.

The girl still hadn't woken up, remaining in a coma, but at least there was hope.

"I'll thank you on behalf of that girl." Dr. Lin picked up her phone and checked the time. "It's almost eight, my parents are still waiting for us to come home for dinner."

Parents?

Zhou Ze suddenly felt a headache coming on.

Was he about to meet his in-laws already?

The car entered a high-end residential complex. Tongcheng is close to Shanghai, geographically located on opposite sides of the Yangtze River estuary from Shanghai. While it's not as astronomically expensive as Shanghai, housing prices here are still not cheap.

Dr. Lin parked the car and walked inside, Zhou Ze following behind her. They entered the elevator, came out together, and Dr. Lin unlocked a door.

The house was well-decorated, with a split-level layout. Actually, one could tell from the car Dr. Lin drove that her family was quite well-off.

Of course, his current status as a "live-in son-in-law" also served as proof; after all, a family without some money or backing wouldn't take in a live-in son-in-law.

In the living room, a half-gray-haired old man in a sweater was sitting on the sofa watching TV, a rerun of the News Broadcast. He was watching with great interest.

Even when his daughter and son-in-law returned, he merely glanced at them and said nothing.

"Wanqiu, you're back."

The kitchen door opened, and his mother-in-law peered out. Perhaps, Dr. Lin and her younger sister's heights were inherited from their mother. His mother-in-law was tall, slightly plump now, but still the type who could dominate the "Sunset Glow" square and make countless old men and grandpas swoon.

Pencils out, take notes, mark this down,

Zhou Ze finally knew his wife's full name — Lin Wanqiu.

His mother-in-law's gaze swept over Zhou Ze, clearly deepening.

"Old man, dinner's ready, Wanqiu's back."

"Finally, we can eat," his sister-in-law walked out of the study. She shook her fist at Zhou Ze, then pursed her lips, signaling Zhou Ze to pay attention to his parents.

This small gesture was quite good; although this girl was a bit bossy, she wasn't too excessive.

Zhou Ze went to the restroom to wash his hands. As he was washing, Lin Wanqiu also came in. They both used hand soap to scrub their hands, both very thoroughly.

Lin Wanqiu glanced at Zhou Ze a couple more times, then rinsed her hands and walked into the living room.

Zhou Ze also finished rinsing his hands, dried them with a paper towel, and walked out of the restroom.

Everyone had taken their seats. Zhou Ze sat on the chair next to Lin Wanqiu.

His mother-in-law, with a stern face, brought out the rice bowls one by one, placing Zhou Ze's with noticeably more force.

Luckily,

She wasn't so petty as to not serve him rice.

Zhou Ze thought to himself.

"Xu Le, do you think we treat you badly?" His mother-in-law asked, even before starting to eat.

"Quite well," Zhou Ze replied.

"Then why didn't you come home last night? Who are you giving attitude to—"

"Mom, let's eat. He had some things going on at his shop, he told me about it." Lin Wanqiu spoke up.

His mother-in-law and father-in-law exchanged glances, a bit surprised that their eldest daughter was actually willing to speak up for this son-in-law. This made them somewhat unaccustomed, and for a moment, they forgot to continue their scolding.

His sister-in-law, watching from the side, was also a bit surprised. Her sister usually didn't care much about this so-called brother-in-law. Had the sun risen from the west today?

"Let's eat," his father-in-law picked up his chopsticks and motioned. "You eat too." His father-in-law specifically pointed at Zhou Ze with his chopsticks.

Hmm, this action was a bit impolite, but it was fine. It indicated that last night's incident was over.

"Wanqiu, have a piece of braised pork. Mom stewed it for a long time."

His mother-in-law put a piece of meat in her eldest daughter's and younger daughter's bowls, then hesitated for a moment and put a piece of meat in her son-in-law's bowl as well.

Only then did Zhou Ze realize he hadn't eaten anything all day, not since his body had been reanimated last night, through the morning and noon.

He didn't stand on ceremony,

Picked up the meat, put it in his mouth,

Immediately after,

Zhou Ze's expression stiffened,

An unexpected wave of nausea surged from his heart, even his stomach began to cramp wildly.

"Ugh..." Zhou Ze dry-heaved directly, as if what he was eating was poison.

"..." Mother-in-law.

"..." Father-in-law.

The atmosphere at the dinner table,

Instantly turned to ice.

title: 第七章 嚇尿了！
content:
"Excuse me."

Zhou Ze reached out, indicating he hadn't meant it, because it was too much of a slap in the face, especially without knowing why "Xu Le," this live-in son-in-law, was so disliked by his in-laws.

"Feeling unwell?" Doctor Lin asked, putting down his chopsticks.

"No, no."

Zhou Ze picked up his chopsticks again and shoveled rice into his mouth.

But just as it reached his mouth and before he could swallow,

His stomach spasmed again, and a strong sense of nausea rose from deep within him, as if what he was about to swallow wasn't rice, but its son, *mitian'gong*.

"Pfft..."

This time,

Zhou Ze spat out all the rice from his mouth,

Spraying it onto his in-laws' faces, who were sitting opposite him.

His father-in-law's glasses and hair were speckled with rice,

His mother-in-law's coiled hair was also shiny with white flecks.

"Splat!"

His father-in-law's chopsticks fell, and his face twitched a few times, seemingly still processing what emotion to display in the current situation.

His mother-in-law, however, took a deep breath, her eyes burning with fury!

This was,

Giving face only to have it rejected!¹

"Snap!"

His mother-in-law pushed her chair back and stood up.

"Xu Le!"

His mother-in-law was a retired head nurse, so she knew that even if someone was sick, they couldn't spray rice so exaggeratedly. Moreover, Xu Le didn't look like he was "on the verge of death."

He was doing this on purpose,

He must be doing this on purpose!

He was rebelling!

Rebelling!

Zhou Ze clutched his chest, left the dining table, and rushed into the bathroom, lifting the toilet lid and dry-heaving desperately.

This time, he even vomited bile, leaving a bitter taste in his mouth.

This meal was ruined.

Doctor Lin looked at Xu Le, who was still vomiting in the bathroom, and directly told her younger sister:

"Xiao Yi, go cook some noodles."

"Oh, okay."

Her sister-in-law stuck out her tongue. She also felt that her brother-in-law was taking things a bit too far today, so she immediately left the table to prepare some plain noodles in the kitchen.

"Outrageous, that scoundrel!"

His father-in-law slapped the table and took off his glasses to shake them clean. Xu Le's father-in-law was a retired vice-dean and always paid great attention to his demeanor. Today, it had really crossed his line.

"I'm going to ask that fellow what we ever did to him! We didn't ask for a single penny of betrothal money for the wedding, and we even paid for him to open that money-losing bookstore. Where did we ever wrong him?!"

His mother-in-law was about to go to the bathroom.

"Mom, clean this up. He's not feeling well."

Doctor Lin began clearing the mostly untouched plates from the table.

"He's like this and you're still defending him?" His mother-inlaw, seething, pointed at her daughter and scolded.

"What else? Who was it that forced me to marry by threatening to hang themselves?" Doctor Lin looked directly at her mother, her beautiful face looking particularly resolute at this moment.

His mother-in-law was speechless for a moment. Indeed, it was they who had forced their daughter to marry. They were desperate for a grandson, so they went to great lengths to recruit Xu Le as a live-in son-in-law. Their reasoning was simple: she and her husband only had two daughters, so they had no choice but to take in a live-in son-in-law so that their grandson would carry their family name. Xu Le's parents were gone, and he was a college graduate, which met their criteria.

"I'm not eating."

His father-in-law avoided his daughter's gaze. He had been the one who had personally made the decision, and now, thinking back, he did feel he had wronged his daughter. He stood up and returned to his study.

"Oh, old man, you have stomach problems!" His mother-in-law called out anxiously.

"Mom, later take a bowl of noodles to Dad."

Doctor Lin cleared the table, then walked towards the bathroom.

His mother-in-law watched her daughter's back and said no more.

Pushing open the glass door of the bathroom, Doctor Lin saw Zhou Ze kneeling by the toilet, one hand gripping the rim, the other clutching his chest.

"Are you uncomfortable?"

"I'm fine." Zhou Ze replied. He had been perfectly fine before dinner; who knew he'd become like this just as he was about to eat?

"I told Xiao Yi to cook some noodles. You can eat them later..."

"Ugh..."

At the thought of noodles, Zhou Ze felt a strong wave of nausea again from deep within him, and he started dry-heaving.

Lin Wanqiu frowned slightly,

"Should we go to the hospital?"

"No need, it's fine. I won't eat."

Zhou Ze waved his hand, stood up with difficulty, and went to the sink to rinse his mouth and wash his face.

Tonight's dinner was destined to end unhappily.

His in-laws and sister-in-law lived on the first floor, while Zhou Ze and Lin Wanqiu's bedroom was on the second floor.

After cleaning himself up, Zhou Ze took a quick shower. Since he didn't know where his change of clothes was, he decided not to change yet, still wearing his previous clothes with wet hair as he went upstairs. Just as he exited the stairwell, he found Lin Wanqiu showering in the second-floor bathroom.

Zhou Ze stood outside the bathroom door for a while, looking at the graceful figure reflected inside, and lightly licked his lips.

People are always most impulsive at such times, and of course, also most grateful.

"Thank you."

Zhou Ze muttered to himself,

This was the first time in two days since his soul had possessed this body that Zhou Ze had praised that unlucky ghost Xu Le.

Although you left behind an incredibly troublesome interpersonal relationship, your wife is truly beautiful.

With a touch of fantasy, a hint of excitement, a bit of impatience, and some anticipation,

Zhou Ze pushed open the bedroom door,

Then,

Zhou Ze's expression changed, and he bit his lip,

Internally, he once again dragged out the Xu Le he had just praised and lashed him furiously ten thousand times.

The bedroom was large,

With a large bed,

And next to the large bed,

There was a floor bed!

What did this mean? Even an idiot would know!

Was that guy's brain sick?

Was that guy an imbecile?

What was the point of being a live-in son-in-law like that?

Zhou Ze took three deep breaths, then silently lay down on the floor bed.

Sleep,

No more fussing,

No more thinking.

See if he could make some money, become independent, and then whether it was divorce or something else, resolve this complicated relationship. He had many problems to face after coming back to life in someone else's body.

Lin Wanqiu finished her shower and walked out, wearing a loose blue nightgown that looked a bit baggy on her.

Zhou Ze, lying on the floor bed, subconsciously swallowed.

"Get up," Lin Wanqiu said.

"Huh?"

"You've always slept on the bed, and I've slept on the floor," Lin Wanqiu said.

"..." Zhou Ze silently got up and went to the bed.

Lin Wanqiu turned off the light and lay down on the floor bed.

Perhaps this was her compensation for not wanting to share a bed with Xu Le; she slept on the floor.

Zhou Ze sighed,

And prepared to sleep.

Half an hour later, he wasn't asleep, so he turned over.

An hour later, he wasn't asleep, so he turned over.

Until three hours later, it was already past midnight, and he still wasn't asleep.

His eyelids were heavy, but he just couldn't fall asleep.

Lin Wanqiu, on the floor bed, was breathing steadily, probably asleep.

Zhou Ze swore it wasn't because a beautiful woman was sleeping next to him that he was restless and couldn't sleep;

He was very tired and exhausted, after all, so much had happened today.

But he just couldn't sleep.

Lying in bed, Zhou Ze simply opened his eyes and looked at his hands.

Today, he had used these hands to save that little girl's life. Although she hadn't woken up yet, her vital signs were back; she could still be saved.

Was this a special ability he gained after going through hell?

Or,

Was it something the old man left behind when he grabbed his wrist before he died?

However,

It felt pretty good.

As a doctor, with such a pair of hands, how many lives could he save?

This was an ability that transcended medical technology and understanding, capable of even allowing him to surpass the likes of Hua Tuo and Bian Que. Practitioners in every field hoped to one day surpass their predecessors; perhaps it wasn't for money or fame, but a kind of... sentiment.

But it was at this moment that,

Zhou Ze suddenly felt a spasm in both his arms, and intense pain rapidly struck.

"Hiss..."

Zhou Ze gasped, curling up on the bed.

But the pain continued, and it was escalating!

Zhou Ze was in so much pain that cold sweat poured out of him. Unable to bear it, he got out of bed and walked out of the bedroom.

He went into the bathroom. Without turning on the light, he sat on the toilet. At this moment, Zhou Ze saw veins on both his arms, all the way to his fingernails, that looked like they were about to burst.

The pain originated from them, as if something was pounding on his bone marrow.

Damn it,

What in the world was going on?!

Zhou Ze's face began to contort.

This feeling made him wish he were dead, even making him feel the urge to grab a cleaver and chop off his arms.

In a trance, he seemed to recall the scene of himself lying in a frozen coffin, about to be pushed into the incinerator,

And he also recalled fragments of stumbling aimlessly through hell towards the end.

Was this a curse?

Was this a punishment?

Why was I being punished?

What did I do wrong?

Because I smuggled myself back?

Because I'm not alive, so God is punishing me?

Or... was it because I used it to save someone today?

Yes, that must be the reason.

Zhou Ze took a deep breath. Because he used that ability to save someone, he broke some rule and suffered a backlash?

Then,

If he were to go kill that girl now, would the pain stop?

In Zhou Ze's eyes, a hint of black mist began to gather, though he was completely unaware.

"Uncle, you can't smoke in the hospital."

The little girl's voice reappeared in Zhou Ze's mind.

Zhou Ze shook his head violently,

No,

I saved her, I saved her!

I don't regret it,

No regrets!

...

"Mom, are you still not done?"

"I just started. You can go to the second-floor bathroom."

"Alright."

His sister-in-law went up to the second floor. She really couldn't hold it anymore. The second-floor bathroom light wasn't on, so she pushed the door open and walked in.

Then,

At that moment,

Zhou Ze looked up at her,

And she looked at Zhou Ze,

In Zhou Ze's eyes, black mist swirled, carrying an immense deterrent force—a gaze like that of a malevolent spirit crawled from hell, resentful and deranged.

"Ah ah ah ah ah ah!!!!!!"

His sister-in-law screamed,

Then she fell to the floor,

She looked at Zhou Ze,

Zhou Ze was also looking at her,

Then, Zhou Ze saw that under his sister-in-law's pajamas—it was wet, and there was an unharmonious liquid on the tiles...

She had been,

Scared so badly she wet herself?

---
¹ Literally, "giving face but not wanting it," an idiom meaning to reject someone's kindness or goodwill despite having been given an opportunity to accept it gracefully.

title: 第八章 冰冷的推手
content:
A scream woke the family;

It was understandable.

Walking into a dark bathroom late at night, needing to pee, and suddenly opening the door to see someone inside—that’s startling enough. Most people have probably experienced something similar.

What’s more, what the sister-in-law encountered was a ghost.

Lin Wanqiu came out of the bedroom and pulled her younger sister up.

"What's wrong, what's wrong!"

Her father-in-law and mother-in-law also came up from the first floor. They saw their younger daughter crying in her sister’s arms, then looked at Zhou Ze, who was still sitting on the toilet.

"You scoundrel, Xu Le, you’ve lost your mind! You’re putting ideas into my younger daughter’s head!"

The mother-in-law picked up the broom from the bathroom doorway, ready to hit Xu Le.

The father-in-law was the same, fuming and ready to come in and teach his scoundrel son-in-law a lesson.

It was understandable,

Seeing this scene,

Everyone would naturally jump to that conclusion.

The brother-in-law had gone mad,

And was acting improperly towards his sister-in-law.

After all, as the saying goes, half of the sister-in-law is the brother-in-law’s*.

"Dad, Mom, Xiaoyi was scared when she went into the bathroom," Dr. Lin said.

The mother-in-law froze, the broom in her hand raised but unsure where to put it.

The father-in-law also paused, then awkwardly backed away a few steps.

Distracted by the commotion, Zhou Ze suddenly realized that the blue veins on his arms had receded at some point, and the intense pain had also disappeared.

He felt so tired, so sleepy, and wanted to sleep.

He stood up, ready to leave the bathroom. As for his in-laws, Zhou Ze was too lazy to fuss about it; he had no interest in cleaning up the mess left by that coward Xu Le.

However, when Zhou Ze stood up, his sister-in-law immediately shivered several times in fright, hiding deeper into her sister’s arms.

"Ah! Don't come near me! Don't come near me!"

Zhou Ze frowned slightly. What did she see just now?

"What exactly is going on!" The mother-in-law put her hands on her hips, asking her younger daughter. This didn’t look like just being scared. "Xiaoyi, my dear, tell Mom, what exactly happened? Did he… did he do something to you?"

The sister-in-law was still very honest, and she knew that she couldn't lie about this, otherwise the situation would become very serious.

"No, I came to use the toilet, opened the door, and saw him sitting there. It was too scary!"

After gathering her courage to say this, the sister-in-law buried her head in her sister's arms again.

Alright,

It was ultimately a misunderstanding.

"You blockhead, going to the bathroom at night and not turning on the light?

Do you think my house is your house? So stingy,

Can't bear to spend a little on electricity!

If you scare my daughter into something serious, what will you use to compensate..."

The mother-in-law began to scold Zhou Ze, her finger almost poking his face.

Zhou Ze was very tired at this moment. When a person is severely sleep-deprived, their temper tends to be very irritable. Moreover, Zhou Ze was already fed up with the terrible relationships Xu Le had left him.

If they hadn't been sleeping in separate beds,

Zhou Ze might not have erupted,

But now that they were even sleeping in separate beds,

Zhou Ze was too lazy to endure this snobbish mother-in-law’s anger any longer.

"Slap!"

Zhou Ze waved his hand, directly swatting away the mother-in-law’s finger pointing at him,

"Don't bother me."

The mother-in-law's eyes widened. She clearly couldn't believe that her son-in-law, who was always so timid, dared to speak to her like that.

"How dare you speak to your mother like that? Have you no manners!" At this moment, the father-in-law spoke up, scolding him.

"If you want your daughter to be a second-time bride, then keep talking to me about manners!"

Zhou Ze retorted directly, then elbowed his father-in-law aside and walked back to the bedroom.

With a "bang!", he slammed the door shut forcefully.

"Outrageous, outrageous!" The father-in-law's chest heaved with anger.

The mother-in-law quickly came to her husband's side to soothe his chest.

But neither of them dared to continue the argument,

After all,

Zhou Ze’s words just now held great deterrence for them.

Although they didn't know what was wrong with their timid son-in-law, who usually couldn't even fart with eight sticks, he was right. If their eldest daughter divorced, her next marriage would be a second one, which would harm her reputation and their family's.

Moreover, in their eyes, a woman who remarries is worth less and won't find a good family.

In truth, a person's character and whether their thinking is feudal have little to do with their education or family background; it really depends on the individual's own moral standards.

For instance, at this moment, Xu Le's parents-in-law, no matter how angry they were, dared not provoke their scoundrel son-in-law anymore, fearing he might really jump up and demand a divorce.

Zhou Ze lay on the bed, breathing deeply, eyes closed, intending to sleep. He was truly exhausted.

About fifteen minutes later,

Zhou Ze heard a knock on the bedroom door:

"Xiaoyi is scared, I’m going to sleep with her tonight."

It was Lin Wanqiu's voice, and then she left.

As if you actually slept with me;

…………

The next day at noon,

His in-laws were having lunch.

"Did he go to the bookstore?" The father-in-law asked the mother-in-law.

"He hasn't gotten up yet," the mother-in-law said resentfully.

"Unbecoming," the father-in-law commented.

"Exactly..."

At this moment, the mother-in-law suddenly stopped speaking, because she saw Zhou Ze coming down from upstairs. Zhou Ze's eyes were red, and he had severe bags under them.

The atmosphere was a bit stagnant.

Perhaps because of what happened last night, Zhou Ze's status as the live-in son-in-law in this household had somewhat risen. At least, at this moment, his in-laws didn't say anything more to provoke him.

Of course, it was also because Zhou Ze’s current appearance looked exactly like someone who might pull out a knife and start cutting at any moment.

His gaze swept over the dinner table.

Zhou Ze covered his chest with his hand.

The aroma of rice,

The aroma of meat,

So disgusting,

He felt like throwing up again.

Zhou Ze walked out of the house, breathing in the slightly cool, fresh air outside, and felt a bit better.

His head felt a little muddled. Zhou Ze began wandering and strolling alone on the street. He needed to quietly think about some things, but his current state of extreme sleepiness yet inability to sleep made it difficult for him to truly calm down.

It was complicated,

And uncomfortable,

Like walking out of an internet café after two consecutive all-nighters, or like a middle school student who had stayed up all night reading novels under the covers and then had to get up early for school the next day.

Walking and walking, Zhou Ze suddenly stopped. The surroundings felt somewhat familiar.

Then he saw the sign ahead,

Tongcheng First Affiliated Hospital.

He had actually walked to his old workplace. Ha, perhaps it was because Tongcheng was too small.

Zhou Ze walked into the hospital, not for a stroll down memory lane, but to try to get some sleeping pills;

Not eating, he could still manage for a while, at most drinking enough water to feel full for now, but not sleeping was prolonged torture.

The familiar hospital, the familiar work environment. Zhou Ze saw his own photo on the photo album of the emergency department on the ground floor of the building had turned grayscale.

Then he subconsciously walked to his original office. His desk had been taken over by someone else. A middle-aged doctor with a lot of pockmarks sat in his spot. He glanced at the nameplate on the desk; the last name was Kang.

He let out a long sigh, feeling a little nostalgic.

Zhou Ze temporarily forgot about getting sleeping pills. Perhaps this feeling of "things are not what they used to be" temporarily suppressed the torment of sleepiness. Zhou Ze began to stroll around the hospital.

He was savoring every bit of his life here,

His work,

His life,

And,

His past,

Or rather, his previous life.

He couldn’t go back, he really couldn’t go back, Zhou Ze murmured to himself.

Then, unknowingly, he found himself walking down the stairs and arriving at the basement.

He stood still. As a doctor who had worked here for many years, he knew the layout of this floor.

Some equipment storage rooms, and then, the morgue.

He remembered lying in the hospital morgue once, and then being made up by a mortician there.

He started walking again, heading towards the morgue.

Zhou Ze wanted to see the place where he once lay. This was his self-explanation for walking there, but in reality, a special, mysterious feeling was guiding him forward.

As he walked, Zhou Ze saw the morgue door. It had an electronic password lock. Coincidentally, Zhou Ze remembered the password. Other doctors might not have much interaction with this place, but Zhou Ze used to be in the emergency department. People sent to the emergency room were usually severely injured or ill patients, and some inevitably wouldn't survive, needing to be placed here.

In fact, this hospital also served as a police morgue. Some unidentified bodies or those requiring further "processing" would be temporarily placed here. This was common practice in many places; if local police departments lacked sufficient facilities or forensic personnel, bodies were often kept in local funeral homes or hospitals.

He entered the password.

The lock clicked open.

Zhou Ze walked in.

A chill permeated the air,

Not a kind that pricked the skin,

But a profound coldness that seemed to mask the warmth of one's very core.

Inside the morgue, of course, lay corpses. This was a temporary resting place for the deceased.

Logically, there should have been an attendant outside, but for some reason, Zhou Ze didn't see anyone when he walked in. Perhaps the person had gone off somewhere.

Zhou Ze walked among them. Several bodies were laid out on cold gurneys, covered with white sheets. One body was wrapped in a flowery household quilt, and judging by the silver hair on the exposed head, the deceased was likely an old grandmother.

Due to his profession, Zhou Ze was not particularly afraid of corpses, and moreover, he was now a ghost himself.
