"Anywhere is better than here," Xu Qinglang smiled. "I'm planning to move the noodle shop to the county town below. It's a smaller scale, but at least the foot traffic is higher."

"I'll think about it." Zhou Ze replied dismissively.

"Alright, I'm off."

Xu Qinglang collected the dishes and left the冥店.

Zhou Ze, meanwhile, was trimming his nails while looking at the symbol on his palm. It was evening, and no customers had come yet. Zhou Ze was a little anxious. Before, he hadn't seen hope and just drifted along, but now that he saw a glimmer of earning money, his motivation naturally surged.

What, still no customers?

Didn't they say I was a white-hot lamp,

able to blind their ghostly eyes?

Come on,

Were they all blinded and got lost?

"Squeak..."

The bookstore door was pushed open, and two women walked in.

One was very young, about the same age as Zhou Ze (Xu Le), and the other was probably close to fifty, appearing to be mother and daughter.

Zhou Ze recognized the younger woman.

She was his first customer since he opened for business. He remembered she had a Corgi with her then, sat for a while reading a book, and even left him a hundred yuan, which was his first income.

This time, however, the woman wasn't with her Corgi, but with her mother.

"Oh, sit here, be careful, see if there's anything dirty on top," the older woman said to the girl.

The girl bent down, took out a tissue, wiped the plastic stool, and then sat down dejectedly.

"Grab a book and read, daughter. There's no problem that can't be solved in life, and no obstacle that can't be overcome. Just look on the bright side," the older woman advised from the side.

"Sigh." The girl sighed, her face still dejected, clearly not listening.

"Daughter, grab a book and read, read a book and you'll forget about time." The older woman squatted beside the girl, continuing to persuade her, a picture of a loving mother.

Zhou Ze was still trimming his nails, paying them no mind.

At this moment, the girl looked at Zhou Ze and said:

"Boss."

The girl called out softly, looking pitiful, as if she had just gone through a breakup and was at her most vulnerable.

Of course, to an experienced person, this was the easiest time to "insert" themselves.

"You're the boss, right?" The older woman looked at Zhou Ze, like a mother hen protecting her chick.

"What's wrong?" Zhou Ze asked.

"What do you want?" The older woman said warily, "Daughter, don't mind him."

The girl was silent for a moment, but finally spoke:

"Beibei is lost."

Beibei was probably the name of the Corgi.

"Lost?" Zhou Ze asked.

"Yes, lost." The girl's eyes were red, as if she was thinking of her beloved dog, and tears welled up again. "When I was cleaning the house, it secretly ran out, and I didn't notice."

"If it's lost, it's lost. Just buy another one, why cry?" the older woman advised.

Zhou Ze stood up and walked over.

"What are you doing?" The older woman pointed at Zhou Ze.

"You'll find it." Zhou Ze ignored the older woman and comforted the girl.

"Mm."

The girl cried, then reached out and hugged Zhou Ze's shoulder.

"You rascal, she lost her dog, not her man, what are you getting involved for!" The older woman made as if to rush over and hit Zhou Ze.

"Is this your place to speak?"

A trace of black light appeared in Zhou Ze's eyes,

The older woman immediately let out a scream and curled up on the ground, not daring to utter another word.

"What's wrong?" The girl looked up blankly; she didn't know who Zhou Ze had just been speaking to.

Zhou Ze let go of the girl. When a person's emotions are at their lowest, their three spiritual lamps are at their weakest, making it easy for something dirty to cling to them.

Fortunately, this older woman, perhaps lonely for too long, enjoyed chattering, but she wasn't a bad person.

"I posted a lost dog notice online, I want to find it." The girl took out her phone and showed Zhou Ze a picture of the dog.

"Boss, have you seen it?"

Zhou Ze gave a bitter laugh. His business was so slow here, even people didn't come, let alone dogs.

But the older woman, who had been scared paralyzed on the ground by Zhou Ze, now cried out:

"I've seen this dog, I've seen this dog, right in my neighborhood;

When my husband and that little vixen were doing their thing, I couldn't stand being at home anymore,

So I went to the neighborhood for a walk and saw someone walking this dog!"

title: 第三十一章 門當戶對
content:
"Where?" Zhou Ze asked.

"Xingfa Residential Area, led by a man and his daughter, I remember." The woman said with certainty, "I knew that man when I was alive, and I even argued with him! He tried to take advantage of me, tried to flirt with me!"

Zhou Ze frowned slightly and warned, "If you're lying to me or playing some kind of dirty trick, I'll make sure you can't even be a ghost."

"How could I, big brother? Even though I'm dead, I'm still a good person. Go ask around my neighborhood; who doesn't say Sister Hong is a kind-hearted person?"

Zhou Ze waved his hand, signaling her to be quiet.

The girl didn't know who Zhou Ze was talking to; of course, Zhou Ze's voice was also very low, like he was murmuring to himself.

"It seems a friend told me that there's a family in Xingfa Residential Area that has a dog like this or similar. You can go there and ask." Zhou Ze said.

"Really? Okay, I'll go right now."

The girl finished speaking and took out her wallet to pay.

"Forget it, it's on the house."

"It should be. Thank you, boss, for the information." The girl took out five hundred yuan and insisted on giving it to Zhou Ze.

"Let's talk about it after you find it." Zhou Ze still refused to accept the money.

"Then, thank you, boss."

The girl wiped her tears and left the bookstore.

"What a good girl," the woman was still sitting on the bookstore's tiled floor.

"You can get lost too."

"Big brother, I finally found someone who can hear me. Can't you chat with me a bit longer?"

The woman looked like she was really憋得很辛苦 (holding it in, enduring) and忍得很辛苦 (suppressing herself).

"No time."

Zhou Ze sat back behind the counter, picked up his nail clippers, and continued trimming his nails.

"Big brother, you opened this bookstore here; I'm afraid business isn't good, right?" The woman was still trying to make conversation.

Zhou Ze seemed to suddenly remember something and asked, "Want to go down?"

"Down?" The woman froze, seemingly not understanding.

"To where you should be now." Zhou Ze just remembered that he seemed to still be a part-time ghost messenger.

"Can I not go down?" The woman said with some difficulty, "My son is taking his college entrance exam this year; I want to stay with him until he finishes."

What a parent's heart.

"If your son knew his dead mother was still studying with him at night, he'd surely be moved to tears." Zhou Ze quipped.

Moved to tears might not be certain, but being scared sick and failing the college entrance exam is very likely.

"I'm just staying to watch." The woman said somewhat aggrieved.

"Suit yourself." Zhou Ze waved his hand, too lazy to say more. The little loli had told him when assigning the job that unless he deliberately overstepped his bounds to act as some kind of judge, he could do as he pleased at other times.

Anyway, the little loli hadn't given him any performance reports requiring him to collect how many ghosts a month or a quarter.

"Big brother, how did you become a human?" The woman asked curiously.

Zhou Ze frowned slightly.

The woman's body shivered a few times, and she immediately dared not speak again.

About fifteen minutes later, the woman muttered to herself that her son should be back from evening study hall and left the bookstore.

After she left, Zhou Ze deliberately walked over and flipped over the stool she had just sat on, but he didn't see any ghost money.

"Truly a woman who knows how to manage a household."

Zhou Ze sighed, feeling if his temper was too good?

He was, after all, a temporary ghost messenger, a person within the system. How dare she come empty-handed and leave empty-handed?

Does she really think temporary workers aren't cadres?

Pushing open the door and stepping out of the bookstore, Zhou Ze pulled out a cigarette and lit it. Xu Qinglang next door seemed to have just finished cleaning, walking out in an apron. He looked at Zhou Ze, then squatted beside Zhou Ze and asked for a cigarette.

Two men squatted in a row.

Behind them,

was a commercial center that was almost completely defunct; ahead of them was an empty road.

"That little girl was picked up by her mother?" Xu Qinglang asked.

"She went down." Zhou Ze replied.

"Oh, she went down." Xu Qinglang exhaled, "Once you go down, it'll be hard to come back, right?"

"I don't know either." Zhou Ze shook his head.

Just as the little loli said, when he went to hell, he only walked a short distance on the Yellow Springs Road and came out; he had never experienced the true horrors of hell.

"What's hell like?" Xu Qinglang asked, blowing out a smoke ring.

"I don't know much about it."

There was nothing much to talk about, but going back into their respective shops felt even more boring. After they finished their first cigarette, they naturally lit a second one.

"Where's your wife?" Xu Qinglang brought up a sensitive topic.

"Separated." Zhou Ze pouted.

"Hehe."

Then, silence again.

Next,

was the third cigarette.

"I'm going back to my hometown in a while. I'll make some plum juice for you tomorrow and leave some."

"Thanks. You're not from here?"

"I'm from Menhai."

Menhai is a county-level district under Tongcheng.

"A relative of mine is getting married. To be honest, I don't want to go, but I can't not go. After all, it's a friendship from when we played in the mud together as kids and shamelessly followed wedding processions to ask for red envelopes and lucky money."

"Does he want you to be a bridesmaid?" Zhou Ze asked.

"Yes, bridesmaid..." Xu Qinglang understood and immediately glared at Zhou Ze, "It's best man."

"Were you married in your previous life?" Xu Qinglang suddenly asked.

"No." Zhou Ze replied.

"That's great. This life, you're practically getting a wife for free."

"She's not getting..."

Zhou Ze paused, not continuing.

Obsession,

Xu Le's obsession,

is still there!

Hmm, it must be like that.

"If you're alive, live well. My parents are gone, completely gone. I've also come to terms with it. I have to grow up, I have to find my own life.

Maybe, in a while, I can also find a girlfriend."

"A boyfriend is more likely." Zhou Ze blew out a smoke ring, adding a cutting remark.

"Hehe, I've been designing my future wedding in my head since I was very young: what style, what kind, what grandeur..."

"Isn't that what girls think about?" Zhou Ze asked.

"Can't men dream a little? Shut up, or you won't have any juice to drink tomorrow!"

Zhou Ze nodded. Alright, I'll shut up.

"I plan to have a traditional Chinese wedding, the very retro kind.

I don't want any luxury cars; I want an eight-bearer sedan chair, just like in the movies.

I'll rent a horse then, wear a mandarin jacket or Hanfu.

That atmosphere,

do you understand?"

Zhou Ze reached out and pointed forward.

"Is it like that?"

Xu Qinglang froze for a moment, squinting his eyes forward, and said, "What is it?"

"You can't see it?" Zhou Ze asked.

Xu Qinglang's expression hardened. He quickly returned to the shop. Soon, he was rubbing something shiny on his eyes, and then he let out a gasp.

Indeed,

on the empty street ahead, a red eight-bearer sedan chair was moving toward them.

The sedan bearers had red ropes tied around their waists and red ceremonial hats on their heads. Eight bearers, their movements perfectly synchronized;

As they moved, they performed a "nine shallow, one deep" step,

and because of this, every now and then, the sedan would jolt, and the bearers and the two suona players in front would all bounce together.

It looked very festive.

But in this desolate area, such a sudden sight would be enough to scare passersby to death.

Even Xu Qinglang, facing such a scene, opened his mouth for a moment, somewhat at a loss.

"Your wife?" Zhou Ze pointed at the wedding procession ahead and asked.

"Nonsense." Xu Qinglang retreated a few steps, almost going back into the shop. Seeing Zhou Ze still squatting there, he shouted, "Aren't you going back? This is a ghost wedding procession!"

"Will they throw a绣球 (embroidered ball)?" Zhou Ze patted his pant legs and slowly stood up.

"If you're caught, you'll become a 'bandit chief's husband'." Xu Qinglang snorted, "Do you want to be a bookstore owner or be caught and become a ghost woman's husband?"

"That serious?"

Zhou Ze was a bit surprised. The ghosts he had seen before didn't have such great abilities, or more precisely, such great influence.

If the person in the sedan could truly seize a person's soul and take them back to "get married," should he intervene or not?

He could turn a blind eye to the previous woman; after her son's college entrance exam, she would probably lose her obsession and dissipate to report to hell. But this one,

such a grand procession, was definitely not a simple character.

Zhou Ze still didn't move. Xu Qinglang stood inside the shop, looked up at the talismans pasted above him, and still felt uneasy. But seeing Zhou Ze still unmoved, he angrily cursed:

"You're just a rookie ghost. They're all experienced ones. If you retreat, she might not bother you."

Zhou Ze still didn't move. Vaguely, he felt the mark on his palm heating up, as if reminding him that the one in front of him needed to be sent down, otherwise it would affect the human world.

The previous woman, Zhou Ze let her go, and the mark had no reaction, which meant it was tacitly allowed. But this time, the mark reminded him.

Temporary worker,

it's not easy to be one.

Usually, when something goes wrong, or there are work omissions, temporary workers are usually the ones who take the fall.

Zhou Ze was now in this very awkward position.

The wedding procession stopped about ten meters from Zhou Ze.

Two sedan bearers reached out and lifted the sedan curtain.

It was empty inside.

The suona player walked towards Zhou Ze, bowed and stooped about a meter away from Zhou Ze:

"My mistress heard that the esteemed superior has been promoted and ordered us to invite the esteemed superior to her mansion for congratulations."

The suona player had a handsome, refined face, but his skin was very pale, and his blush and lipstick were a bit excessive, like a paper figure sold in a paper funeral effigy shop.

"You became a ghost messenger?" Xu Qinglang walked out of the shop, looking as if his poor neighbor, Wang Xiaodan, had suddenly become the mayor, an unreal feeling.

"If you get rich, don't forget me! You actually kept it from me!" Xu Qinglang walked over, complaining to Zhou Ze. That particular charm, crisp to the bone, was enough to make poplars bend.

"I have something I'd like to ask the esteemed superior," the suona player asked respectfully, bowing.

"Say it, what is it? No problem, he'll take care of it! From now on, this area will be under his management!" Xu Qinglang assumed a delightful, overbearing posture, completely seductive.

"My mistress ordered us to pick up the esteemed superior and also to capture a man to join in matrimony;

It is said that this man has more than twenty properties in the human world, which perfectly matches my mistress's status.

May I ask the esteemed superior, do you know where this person is?"

"..." Xu Qinglang.

title: 第三十二章 吃好，喝好
content:
"The world's morals are declining, and people's hearts are no longer what they once were!"

Many lament that in this era, the entire society is scourged by the tide of money worship, to the point where even marriage is placed on a scale for equivalent exchange.

However, these days, even ghosts getting married are starting to care about such things!

You have over twenty private houses.
What a coincidence,
My lady has over twenty ancestral tombs.
A perfect match!
Joy, joy,
Everyone is joyful!

After the suona player asked this question, Zhou Ze's mouth twitched instinctively.

He was suppressing a laugh, and at the same time, his heart felt truly content.

Zhou Ze had long wanted to punch his neighbor, who constantly said, "I have over twenty apartments." This ghost lady had truly arrived at the perfect time.

Heaven's way has its cycles!

Xu Qinglang was so scared he was sweating. He was a玄士 (Xuan Shi), but he could only open his yin-yang eyes, play with puppets, and incorporate some Sichuan Opera face-changing tricks. He wasn't truly a Celestial Master like Zhang Tianshi; otherwise, he wouldn't have been so cowardly when facing the little loli.

Xu Qinglang, quickly regaining his composure, began to look up,
gazing at the sky.
What did you say?
I don't understand.
That person,
I don't know him.

Then, Xu Qinglang's eyelids suddenly twitched because he saw Zhou Ze's right hand, which had been at his side, raise an index finger and point directly at him.

"@#￥%……*&*!!!!!!"

Ten thousand bottles of sour plum juice surged through Xu Qinglang's heart!

The two suona players walked directly to either side of Xu Qinglang and said respectfully:
"Please, young groom, enter the sedan chair."

Ah, so this sedan chair wasn't for picking up the ghost messenger; it was the ghost lady's special arrangement to welcome her new groom.

Zhou Ze inwardly re-evaluated his status as a "temporary worker."

"Don't pull me, don't drag me, don't force me!
Be careful, or I'll turn hostile!"

Xu Qinglang was pushed towards the sedan chair by the suona players, but he kept struggling.

He had just said he wanted to start a new life and find a partner, but he hadn't intended to get involved with ghosts!

"Zhou Ze, you're setting me up, you're harming me!" Xu Qinglang cried out, much like an innocent woman being forced into prostitution.

Prefer to die than surrender,
Chastity forever!

"Go take a look, maybe that ghost lady looks like Joey Wong; you wouldn't be at a disadvantage, would you?" Zhou Ze laughed.

Xu Qinglang was pushed into the sedan chair. The suona player said to Zhou Ze, "Officer, you may follow us. We will lead the way."

After speaking, the suona player also pointed to the electric scooter parked at Xu Qinglang's door:
"Officer, you may ride it."

Zhou Ze remembered that last time he rode the ghost driver's paper car, he was still safely delivered to the bookstore. So, it was clear that some ghosts indeed possessed abilities similar to Qimen Dunjia, and some physical theories likely didn't apply to them.

The electric scooter belonged to Xu Qinglang. Zhou Ze didn't stand on ceremony. After locking the shop door, he rode the scooter and followed the sedan chair ahead.

The sedan bearers walked very quickly,
Their steps were still "nine shallow and one deep,"
Each time they took a "deep" step, all eight sedan bearers and the two suona players would bounce, causing the wedding sedan to sway.

Immediately after,
Xu Qinglang, seated in the wedding sedan, would let out an "ah" sound;
Like a nightingale's soft cry, melodious and alluring, inviting imagination.

When Zhou Ze rode his electric scooter alongside the sedan chair, Xu Qinglang lifted the curtain of the sedan. Looking out, Xu Qinglang's face was flushed, and his eyes seemed to be casting alluring gazes, as if moistened.
His pearly teeth bit his red lips, a truly charming and delicate sight.

Just then, the sedan bearers took a "deep" step, and the sedan chair suddenly lifted.
"Ah!"
Xu Qinglang instinctively cried out again, a look of anger on his face, glaring fiercely at Zhou Ze, truly embarrassed!

Zhou Ze held the electric scooter's handlebars with one hand and waved the other dismissively, saying,
"Shameful."

"This sedan chair affects the soul; it stimulates the soul!" Xu Qinglang had to explain. He was genuinely worried that Zhou Ze would think he was enjoying himself and couldn't stop.

"Explanation is concealment," Zhou Ze said. "Saying one thing and doing another."

"............" Xu Qinglang.

Casting a final resentful glance at Zhou Ze, Xu Qinglang lowered the curtain.
That glance was as if he were looking at a heartless man who had even willingly sacrificed himself for fame and fortune!

Zhou Ze could actually see that the sedan bearers and suona players were moving to a special rhythm. They were just puppets; their true forms were likely paper figures from a paper craft shop, somewhat similar to the wooden ox and flowing horse designed by Zhuge Liang in the Three Kingdoms period.

The sedan bearers continued their "nine shallow and one deep" steps,
Xu Qinglang would "ah" every now and then,
Zhou Ze followed along on his small electric scooter.

Unbeknownst to them, the procession had already passed the city center and entered the Tongzhou district.

A few years ago, Tongzhou District was still a county under Tongcheng, having only recently been upgraded from a county to a district. Zhou Ze had been to this place once before when he helped the old woman in the morgue find money.

Finally, the sedan chair procession entered a desolate area diagonally below Jianghai Avenue. This area was surrounded by tall buildings, and it was likely a construction site put on hold for special reasons.

The road inside was not easy to drive on anymore, so Zhou Ze had to get off his scooter and push it forward.

After another few dozen meters,
Suddenly,
It became wide open!
The previously dark and desolate area was suddenly adorned with lanterns and streamers. Ahead, over twenty outdoor banquets were set up, with ten cold dishes neatly arranged on each table.

People bustled about, women in elegant attire, laughter and joy filling the air.

Someone eager to please loudly announced, "The groom has arrived!"

In an instant, ladies in powder and hairpins swarmed over. Zhou Ze felt surrounded by a flurry of beautiful women, a lively scene. Some of them passed directly through him and his scooter, moving back and forth, tirelessly.

Zhou Ze's right hand remained tightly clenched, the mark still burning.

Actually, Zhou Ze didn't need the mark to remind him that this place was where the ghost messenger needed to take care of things.
Because the ghosts here, under the call of that ghost lady, had already become organized and structured, which was, of course, intolerable!

But Zhou Ze kept enduring. Firstly, he had just become a temporary worker, so he wasn't in a hurry to ignite three fires upon taking office; otherwise, he might burn himself. After all, in the human world, temporary workers usually ended up taking the fall when something went wrong in a department. Zhou Ze figured it was probably similar in the underworld, given that people from the human world went to the underworld after death.

Furthermore, Zhou Ze also understood that if it were truly easy to handle, why didn't that little loli resolve it herself?
The other party even dared to invite him, a ghost messenger, to celebrate, which also showed their fearlessness.

"Set down the sedan!"

The sedan bearers lowered the sedan chair together. Xu Qinglang was pushed out; he was very reserved and shy, yet also filled with shame and anger.

"Madam requests your presence."

A woman in a black ancient-style dress walked up to Zhou Ze and Xu Qinglang, bowing deeply.

"Let's go."

Zhou Ze patted Xu Qinglang's shoulder.

Xu Qinglang disdainfully swatted Zhou Ze's hand away but still followed Zhou Ze forward.

Passing through the banquet, seeing all sorts of ghosts pointing and whispering around him, Zhou Ze felt a bit unaccustomed. Fortunately, when they reached a small red two-story house, the various杂七杂八 (záqīzábā - hodgepodge) noises finally faded away.

This building was adorned with lanterns and streamers, large lanterns hung, and new Spring Festival couplets were displayed, creating a lively and festive atmosphere.

The house layout was very similar to modern houses. The main entrance opened into the living room, and the black-dressed maid gestured for Zhou Ze and Xu Qinglang to enter.

"Excited?" Zhou Ze suddenly asked. "What if she really has Joey Wong's aura? Don't get so carried away you forget to go home."

"I hope she likes 'one dragon playing with two phoenixes'."

Xu Qinglang said fiercely, clearly implying he wanted to drag Zhou Ze down with him if he was unlucky.

It was truly because Zhou Ze had been relentlessly gloating and adding insult to injury along the way, as if he had been determined to make fun of him!

He just usually liked to say "I have over twenty apartments,"
Wasn't that the truth!
Had he intentionally flaunted or showed off?

Entering the hall, they stepped onto a large red carpet, and the four walls were adorned with exquisite cross-stitch embroidery.

A woman in a red wedding dress sat gracefully by a small table.
On the small table were exquisite dishes and wine.

"Officer, my lord, please be seated."

The woman stood up and gestured for them to sit.

Because the woman's face was covered by a veil, it was unclear.
But her voice was truly beautiful.

Zhou Ze took a seat, pulling Xu Qinglang, who reluctantly sat down.

Since they were here, they might as well make the best of it. Let's see what tricks she had up her sleeve.

The dishes on the small table were exquisite and fragrant, and the wine was rich and alluring.

"Officer, my lord, please help yourselves." The ghost lady gestured for them to eat.

Zhou Ze didn't move, maintaining his composure.

Xu Qinglang, looking distraught, drank three cups and then exclaimed, "Good wine!"
Afterward, he kept eating, completely turning his grief into appetite.

Zhou Ze watched from the side, his chest heaving, covering his mouth with his hand.

"What's wrong? Eat, it's delicious, better than what I make myself." Xu Qinglang, being a chef himself, could naturally discern the quality of the dishes.

Have you never watched a ghost movie?
Zhou Ze thought to himself.
But he still said nothing, instead picking up his chopsticks and helping Xu Qinglang put food into his bowl, instructing him:
"Good boy, eat more. There's no sour plum juice here, and I can't eat anything, you know."

Xu Qinglang grunted twice, suspecting nothing, and continued eating, determined to die a well-fed ghost!
And, it was truly delicious!

Xu Qinglang was even thinking about whether he should find an opportunity later to discuss and learn recipes with the ghost lady. These dishes, if put on the market, even the top chefs of five-star hotels couldn't make them this delicious.

After Xu Qinglang had eaten his fill,
Zhou Ze nodded in satisfaction,
And asked the ghost lady, "Madam, may I ask how these dishes are prepared?"

"You're too kind, officer. This wine was brewed by your humble servant using the urine of passersby;
These dishes were carefully prepared by your humble servant using the freshest snakes, insects, rats, and ants..."

Xu Qinglang's face instantly changed.
He pointed at Zhou Ze, but before he could say anything,
He directly:
"Ugh............"

title: 第三十三章 趁熱
content:
Xu Qinglang vomited so hard his head spun, almost throwing up his gall.

Zhou Ze shook his head slightly. This kid was still too young. He probably hadn't watched enough ghost movies as a child. Encountering a ghost in the wilderness and eating with it was actually the most classic scene.

The delicacies originally served on the plates were actually maggots, earthworms, cockroaches, ants, and so on.

This trope had been overused.

Even if he didn't have an eating disorder, Zhou Ze wouldn't touch it with a chopstick.

Did they expect the ghosts here to go shopping for groceries every day? And then set up a stove to cook for him?

Zhou Ze remembered a case from before: a person visited a friend, and the friend said his wife was traveling, so he had to entertain him alone. He stayed at the friend's house for a week. The only regret was that the friend's house had too few vegetarian dishes, only meat, but the meat soup was really delicious.

When he bid farewell to his friend and went out, he met a neighbor who said the friend hadn't left the house for almost a month, staying cooped up inside all day.

The person immediately vomited upon hearing this.

Zhou Ze subconsciously picked up the wine in front of him, then put it down.

He almost forgot.

It was passerby's urine.

"My husband isn't feeling well, so he should go rest first." The Ghost Lady looked at the black-dressed maid beside her.

The maid nodded and walked over to help Xu Qinglang.

Xu Qinglang pushed away the maid's hand directly, sat up straight, and said,

"Just say what you want to do quickly. I don't want to play any more roundabout games."

Yes, Xu Qinglang was angry.

He was thoroughly angry.

The Ghost Lady stood up and walked in front of Zhou Ze. Zhou Ze could clearly smell the faint fragrance emanating from her. Her graceful figure and voluptuous curves made one's imagination run wild.

Zhou Ze let out a long sigh of relief in his heart.

He had been with Xu Qinglang for a long time, but he was still normal.

However, Zhou Ze didn't have the courage to lift the Ghost Lady's red veil.

A beauty reduced to a skeleton was only natural.

Looking at the layout and decorations here, it was clear that this Ghost Lady had been dead for a long time. If he lifted her veil and she was in a good mood, she might show him her face from when she was alive.

If his luck was bad, she'd just blind his dog eyes with a skull face corroded with maggots everywhere.

Zhou Ze remembered reading a report in his previous life that it was popular for husbands to accompany their wives into the delivery room back then.

Many hipsters thought this would make husbands understand their wives' sacrifices and greatness. Later, a Japanese husband became depressed directly after accompanying the birth, developing a psychological shadow. He could no longer live a normal married life and eventually had to choose divorce.

And now, Zhou Ze knew he had a neighbor who was prettier than a woman. If he were to be startled by this Ghost Lady's face again, his orientation might truly spiral into an unfathomable abyss.

In both his previous and current lives, he seemed to have never truly gotten what he desired from women. Zhou Ze didn't want to skip ahead and play advanced games in this life.

"Esteemed Emissary, this concubine invited you here instead of visiting you directly, not out of impoliteness or intentional disrespect, but truly because this concubine has no other way to leave this place."

The Ghost Lady tearfully told Zhou Ze.

"As for this gentleman, the reason he was invited was only because over a decade ago, when he was a mere child, he once passed by here and left a jest. He told his companion at the time that if a female ghost was truly like Joey Wong in the movies, he would be willing to marry her."

Xu Qinglang opened his mouth wide at these words.

He had forgotten this entirely?

Zhou Ze, on the other hand, glanced at Xu Qinglang, meaning: "I didn't realize, you look so effeminate, but you were so precocious."

"Specifically, what is the matter?"

Zhou Ze didn't directly say, "You're very disobedient, I'm taking you back to Hell."

Little Loli had said he was the most self-aware person she had ever met.

Indeed,

Zhou Ze truly had self-awareness now. Without benefits, performance metrics, or missions, he really didn't need to sacrifice himself for the prosperity of Hell.

"Esteemed Emissary, do not worry. This concubine will depart today, returning her soul to the netherworld." The Ghost Lady smiled and continued, "This concubine's surname is Bai. I was a daughter of a scholarly family during the Daoguang era. Alas, my fate was ill-fated, and I died prematurely on the eve of my wedding, buried here. It has been nearly two hundred years since then.

Though this concubine is a ghost, I have never done anything harmful. I once protected the local villagers, allowing them to live in peace and contentment. Mr. Secheng once inscribed a plaque for this concubine's shrine, and from that time on, this concubine gained a temple body and could receive incense.

However, in recent sixty years, the shrine has fallen into disrepair and is no longer traceable. No one knows that such an *yin* shrine once existed here."

"Who is Mr. Secheng?" Xu Qinglang blinked and asked.

"Zhang Jian," Zhou Ze replied.

"Oh, him." Xu Qinglang understood now.

Zhang Jian was a prominent figure in Tongcheng during the late Qing Dynasty. He drafted the abdication edict for the Qing emperor, was a top scholar in the late Qing, and also a national entrepreneur.

The *yin* shrine the Ghost Lady mentioned didn't refer to a dubious place, but rather a shrine not recognized by the imperial court's rites, belonging to illegally worshipped deities.

"Then you're quite impressive." Xu Qinglang had recovered from his earlier vomiting. After the Ghost Lady said she invited him only because of a jest he made as a child, he relaxed. As long as she wasn't forcing him to be her husband, it was fine.

Cultivating for two hundred years and having a shrine built to receive incense offerings — this should already be beyond the level of a mere ghost, right?

"Now, this concubine's cultivation is complete, and I am about to descend into the netherworld. However, there is one matter this concubine cannot ignore."

The Ghost Lady bowed slightly to Zhou Ze, pleading:

"This concubine's former body, due to the circumstances of its burial, has remained uncorrupted for two hundred years, as if alive. This concubine's soul is now about to enter the netherworld, but this concubine's body cannot be taken along.

Moreover, for these two hundred years, this concubine's body has been affected by this concubine's soul, showing signs of becoming a *sha* (corpse demon). This concubine does not wish for her body, once her soul has departed, to potentially reanimate and cause harm. Therefore, I earnestly request the esteemed emissary's help."

"How do I help you?"

Zhou Ze rubbed his hands. Since this Ghost Lady intended to go to Hell herself, that was for the best; it was like surrendering.

No, not like surrendering. It was more like ancient rebels, after gaining enough strength, accepting an imperial amnesty, washing their identities clean, and gaining official positions.

But no matter what, it was good that she wasn't trying to fight him head-on.

"This concubine asks the esteemed emissary to help watch over this concubine's body and incinerate it with bamboo and wood on the next Cold Clothes Festival night," the Ghost Lady said.

"Help watch over?" Zhou Ze thought for a moment, then nodded.

"Has the esteemed emissary agreed to this concubine's request?" The Ghost Lady confirmed, "This concubine thanks the esteemed emissary here."

"You're welcome."

Zhou Ze subconsciously picked up his wine glass again.

Hm,

He put it down again.

"Then this concubine will take her leave." The Ghost Lady's figure began to slowly disappear, leaving quite decisively.

Zhou Ze pursed his lips. The next moment, Zhou Ze found that all the surrounding scenery vanished. He and Xu Qinglang were sitting on two stone blocks.

The banquet tables all disappeared without a trace. All that was visible were jagged rocks and dense weeds.

Xu Qinglang lit a cigarette, feeling a bit melancholic.

"Disappointed you didn't see what your wife looked like?" Zhou Ze asked.

"Why don't you lift the veil and look yourself?" Xu Qinglang snorted coldly.

A long road tests a horse's strength, and time reveals a person's heart.* Zhou Ze had kicked him when he was down countless times tonight; Xu Qinglang had kept a mental note of it all.

"She's your wife, how could I overstep?" Zhou Ze looked around, then tapped his shoe on the ground. "Is Madam Bai's corpse buried under this ground?"

"Probably," Xu Qinglang was also unsure, but soon, his eyes spotted two rusty shovels lying in the grass ahead. "It must be, then. They even prepared shovels for us."

Zhou Ze walked over, and he and Xu Qinglang each took a shovel. There was nothing more to say; time to dig!

They both dug until dawn, drenched in sweat, finally hitting something hard below. Pushing aside the dirt, they could see it was a red wood coffin.

After about another half hour, they completely cleared the coffin.

"Open the coffin," Zhou Ze said. "It's almost dawn. Let's finish early, or if someone sees us and calls the police, they'll think we're grave robbers."

"You do it," Xu Qinglang wiped his sweat. "I find it disgusting."

"Didn't she say her body wasn't corrupted?"

"Who knows if that's true?"

Zhou Ze shook his head. No choice; it was something he had promised. Xu Qinglang was just helping as a friend. If he wasn't willing to do it, Zhou Ze had to.

Prying open the coffin nails, Zhou Ze stood to the side and pulled hard. The coffin lid was lifted. Then, Zhou Ze took out his phone, turned on the flashlight, and shined it down.

"Heh... she really is quite beautiful."

Xu Qinglang also leaned over. Indeed, the woman lying in the coffin was dressed in a white gown, with long hair draped over her shoulders and a dignified and beautiful face. There wasn't a single flaw on her body; she looked as if she were merely sleeping.

"She's your wife. Do you want to take advantage of the warmth... "

Xu Qinglang suddenly pushed Zhou Ze, "What nonsense are you talking about? Hurry and carry her out and take her back."

This time, Xu Qinglang was very proactive. He jumped down and picked up the female corpse.

But as soon as he lifted her off the ground, Xu Qinglang's face immediately changed. He quickly put the female corpse down and then rubbed his hands continuously on the side.

"Hiss... So cold, bone-chilling cold. This corpse has such heavy *sha* energy; it's clearly on its way to becoming a zombie. That Madam Bai definitely didn't tell the complete truth.

She must have been intentionally nourishing her body for these two hundred years out of a woman's natural vanity.

Now that her cultivation is complete and she's ready to leave, she leaves behind such a huge problem."

When Zhou Ze personally went down and picked up the female corpse, he immediately felt that chilling sensation that seemed to stimulate the soul.

But the next moment, Zhou Ze found his fingernails beginning to lengthen. The coldness, which Xu Qinglang had referred to as *sha* energy, began actively pouring into Zhou Ze's fingernails.

For a moment,

The sensation of exhilarating numbness made Zhou Ze's soul tremble completely; it seemed to be a form of nourishment.

"Hoo... uh... hiss... ooh..."

Xu Qinglang, who was still checking his palms for frostbite on the side, heard Zhou Ze's sounds and immediately looked shocked, pointing at Zhou Ze:

"You beast,

You really took advantage of the warmth!"

---
* The idiom "路遙知馬力日久見人心" (lù yáo zhī mǎlì rì jiǔ jiàn rénxīn) literally means "A long road tests a horse's strength, and a long time reveals a person's heart." It implies that true character is revealed over time and through challenges.

title: 第三十四章 農夫山泉
content:
Before dawn broke, Zhou Ze rode his electric scooter back to the bookstore with the female corpse, while Xu Qinglang waited there to hail a taxi.

After all, he had arrived in a sedan chair; there was no sedan chair for him to ride back in.

Upon returning to the bookstore, Zhou Ze placed the female corpse in the freezer on the second floor of the shop. Then he went downstairs to take a shower. By the time he finished showering and changed into a fresh set of clothes, Xu Qinglang, who had finally managed to hail a taxi, had just returned. He walked straight into the bookstore, looked at Zhou Ze's wet hair, and quipped:

"You need to control yourself."

"Heh heh." Zhou Ze only responded with those two words.

Xu Qinglang shook his head and left the bookstore without saying anything more. He was tired from the events of the night.

Zhou Ze locked the shop door and went up to the second floor, standing by the freezer and looking at the female corpse inside.

The female corpse's face was exquisite, and her demeanor was remarkable. People in ancient times married quite young; it was common for girls to become mothers at fifteen or sixteen. Therefore, the body of Madam Bai, who had died before marriage, looked about the same age as an average high school student, but she exuded a natural allure.

Xu Qinglang's beauty was enchanting, like a blooming peony, whereas Madam Bai's was a delicate, reserved daisy.

Of course, Zhou Ze wouldn't harbor excessive fantasies about a corpse. What he was pondering was something else.

As he held the female corpse while riding the electric scooter back, his ten fingernails were constantly in contact with her, as if currents were flowing into his body, continuously stimulating his soul and fingernails.

Thankfully, Xu Qinglang wasn't around when they returned, otherwise Zhou Ze probably would have screamed just like Xu Qinglang did when he arrived in the sedan chair. Such matters are best kept private.

When he carried her back to the bookstore, Zhou Ze noticed that most of the chill emanating from her body had dissipated.

It was like a rechargeable battery; he had just drained its power, but it shouldn't be a big problem. Lying there, she should be able to recharge herself naturally.

He held his palms in front of him, and his fingernails slowly grew out. The originally black and translucent nail beds now had a blood-red pattern. This must be a change from the nails absorbing the corpse's malevolent aura.

It looked quite good.

Zhou Ze smiled, reaching for the cup of warm water he had brought up earlier, only to find the water had grown cold.

Because of the female corpse, the temperature on this small second floor was even lower than outside, and Zhou Ze himself had a somewhat diminished perception of "cold."

It was a pity it wasn't summer. If it were summer, having a female corpse here would save his shop air conditioning costs, and it would also repel mosquitoes.

That night, Zhou Ze made a makeshift bed by the freezer and slept very soundly.

The little蘿莉 (loli) had once said that if Zhou Ze held her, he could fall asleep without needing the freezer. It seemed the female corpse had a similar effect.

When he woke up the next morning, Zhou Ze stretched. He placed his fingernails on the corpse's lower abdomen, and immediately, the icy sensation returned.

It was very comfortable,

very enjoyable,

but this feeling only lasted for about half a minute before dissipating. This meant that the female corpse had only recharged this much overnight.

Madam Bai had mentioned concerns about her corpse moving, and Xu Qinglang had also said that the strong malevolent aura from the corpse, if stimulated externally, could turn her into a *jiangshi* (hopping zombie). However, it seemed unlikely now. Whatever malevolent aura she accumulated, he would absorb it daily.

Although he didn't know what this thing was for him, the sheer comfort it provided was enough to keep Zhou Ze tirelessly engaged.

After eating at Xu Qinglang's shop next door, Zhou Ze sat idly in his own shop, still pondering which book to read, when his phone rang.

It was his sister-in-law's call.

"Xu Le, come back for a moment."

"What's wrong?" Zhou Ze didn't believe his sister-in-law would suddenly call him out of concern. The young girl was still in her rebellious teenage phase, a bit self-centered, or rather, somewhat selfish and overbearing.

"Your eldest uncle is at my house. Come pick him up," his sister-in-law said impatiently.

"Eldest uncle?" Zhou Ze frowned slightly. He remembered Xu Le, like himself, was an orphan. Of course, Xu Le didn't grow up in an orphanage; his parents had passed away one after another after he was born.

"Okay, I'll be back."

He hung up the phone, told Xu Qinglang next door to watch the shop for him, and then called a taxi to go back to the Lin family's house.

Wang Ke's treatment suggestion for him was to temporarily sever ties with his existing social network. But circumstances had changed; before, Zhou Ze was a "black household," like a rat crossing the street. Now he was a temporary civil servant, so he had far fewer things to worry about and less danger.

Moreover, Zhou Ze had previously read Xu Le's private journal entries in his space, which mentioned his eldest uncle. All along, it was his eldest uncle who had supported him through school.

Since he had taken over someone else's body, some necessary explanations still had to be given. What's more, Xu Le had already gone to hell and reported for reincarnation. The changes in his own temperament earlier had nothing to do with Xu Le; they were side effects of his soul possessing another's body.

When Zhou Ze returned to the Lin family's house, before he even entered the door, he saw an old man with a wrinkled face, dressed in a cotton padded jacket, sitting on the steps in the stairwell, smoking a dry pipe.

Next to the old man were several fertilizer bags; one bag likely contained chickens and ducks, and the other probably held sausages and the like.

"A-Le!" The old man saw Xu Le approaching, immediately stood up, walked to Xu Le, and patted him hard on the shoulder: "The child has grown taller again."

Zhou Ze grinned. He didn't ask why his eldest uncle was sitting in the stairwell smoking. In fact, there was no need to ask.

Even if his eldest uncle had voluntarily gone out to smoke his dry pipe to avoid polluting their house, the local produce he brought wouldn't still be outside. This could only mean that the Lin family didn't welcome him, and perhaps hadn't even let him inside.

Recalling his sister-in-law's tone and attitude when she called earlier, it was enough to infer the Lin family's attitude toward his eldest uncle.

Of course, there was nothing to resent or hate. His relationship with the Lin family was already on the verge of collapse; it wasn't about who was right or wrong.

"Have you eaten?" Zhou Ze asked.

"Not yet," the old man was honest.

"I'll take you to eat."

"Alright."

Zhou Ze chose a restaurant, entered, ordered a few dishes, and also a bottle of baijiu.

The old man poured for himself and drank a few sips. It was clear his mood was heavy. Evidently, he felt the Lin family's coldness. They were in-laws, after all, and now they weren't even bothering with courtesies.

"Le-wa'er, if you're not happy, just come home and live here," the eldest uncle patted his chest. "Now the national targeted poverty alleviation policy is very good, and our family doesn't have to worry about not being able to make ends meet. You've also been to college, so if you come back, we can also get into some characteristic farming or something. Our life won't be worse than others."

"Okay, let's talk about it later," Zhou Ze replied perfunctorily.

"Alas." The eldest uncle knew Xu Le didn't drink alcohol, so he didn't ask Zhou Ze to drink with him. He slowly finished a bottle by himself, then ate two bowls of rice. After Zhou Ze paid the bill, he carried his things and walked out of the restaurant with Zhou Ze.

"Take these things with you. They don't want them, so you eat them," the eldest uncle handed the several woven bags to Zhou Ze. "I'm catching the afternoon bus back."

"Alright." Zhou Ze didn't try to make him stay.

His eldest uncle must have had a good tolerance for alcohol. Zhou Ze called a taxi for him, paid the driver in advance to take him to the bus station. Afterward, Zhou Ze carried the things back to the bookstore.

Xu Qinglang was sitting by the door, sunbathing. Zhou Ze placed a pile of local specialties in front of him.

"Oh, what's this?"

"For you to use as ingredients," Zhou Ze found a chair nearby and sat down.

"Alright," Xu Qinglang didn't stand on ceremony either; he hadn't charged Zhou Ze for meals before. "By the way, you told me your real name is Zhou Ze, but you never really talked about your past. What did you do before?"

"Doctor," Zhou Ze replied.

There was nothing to hide from Xu Qinglang about these matters.

And now that his identity was cleared, he wasn't afraid of official scrutiny.

"A doctor? Then you and your wife truly are a pair." Xu Qinglang leisurely exhaled a puff of smoke. "Haven't seen your wife come by in days."

"No chance," Zhou Ze said with a nonchalant air.

"Heh heh."

The two smoked another cigarette together, then Zhou Ze stood up, pushed open the bookstore door, and walked inside.

He had told Xu Qinglang to look after the shop when he left that morning, so he hadn't locked the door.

Sitting behind the counter, Zhou Ze opened his computer and clicked an icon. Then, video footage appeared on the desktop.

Zhou Ze had recently bought two pinhole cameras for the shop. One was placed at the staircase entrance, and the other in the upper left corner of the bookstore. They weren't expensive; usually, peeping Toms bought them.

He casually picked up the cup from the counter, took a few sips of water, and began to adjust the playback time on the video.

When he left that morning, Zhou Ze had deliberately not locked the door and asked Xu Qinglang to look after the shop for a reason.

Yesterday, Madam Bai had invited him over and also sent a sedan chair for Xu Qinglang. Although she had explained it was due to a childhood jest by Xu Qinglang, Zhou Ze didn't fully believe her.

He had brought the corpse back and kept her with him. If Madam Bai and Xu Qinglang had any other connection, Xu Qinglang should have made some move this morning.

It's better to be safe than sorry. He wasn't even human anymore, so he naturally had to be more cautious.

At 11:30 AM, the footage showed Xu Qinglang entering his shop.

Zhou Ze took another sip of water, feeling that the water in the cup was a little sweet, exceptionally delicious.

It must be a psychological effect, because he was secretly pleased that he thought he was right?

However, in the footage, Xu Qinglang merely entered the shop, picked up a few newspapers, sat there reading for half an hour, then returned the newspapers to their original place and left. He didn't go upstairs at all.

Had he guessed wrong?

Was he being petty towards a gentleman?

Zhou Ze pursed his lips and chuckled to himself, draining the water in his cup.

Just as Zhou Ze was about to close the footage and go wash his face, he suddenly thought of the camera placed at the staircase entrance. This camera's position allowed it to observe the staircase and the counter area on the first floor.

However, since Xu Qinglang hadn't gone inside, watching it probably wouldn't matter much.

But these types of cameras were cheap and had small memory, so Zhou Ze still had to delete the used memory to free up space.

At the same time, Zhou Ze also casually opened the video recorded by the second camera, dragging the timeline from beginning to end, just to go through the motions.

However, at that instant, Zhou Ze seemed to see a white shadow fleetingly.

"Hmm?"

Zhou Ze instinctively pulled back the mouse. With his other hand, he reached for the teacup, only to realize the water in it was already gone.

He immediately disregarded refilling the water,

and instead, dragged the mouse little by little,

Finally,

The footage captured that moment:

A woman dressed in white slowly walked down from the second floor!

That corpse,

She could move!

Zhou Ze felt a rush of blood to his head, and a sense of crisis immediately overwhelmed him. His heart and breathing became rapid.

Just as Zhou Ze was pondering this,

The footage continued to play.

In the video,

Madam Bai's corpse walked to the counter, picked up the water cup placed on it,

Then,

Like a dog drinking water,

She stuck out her tongue and swirled it a few times in the cup,

Afterward, she put down the cup and, like someone getting up at night thirsty for water,

She slowly walked back upstairs.

Zhou Ze took a deep breath, looking at the cup beside him that he had just emptied.

No wonder when he drank the water just now,

it tasted a little sweet...

title: 第三十五章 您回來啦
content:
Second floor,

Next to the freezer,

Zhou Ze stood for about half an hour.

Lady Bai still lay inside, exactly as she had been when Zhou Ze got up and went out that morning, with no change whatsoever. But the images recorded by the camera couldn’t be wrong.

Especially,

That cup of water,

He had felt it was a bit sweet when he first started drinking it.

This wasn’t a psychological effect, because he hadn’t watched that video before drinking the water.

Actually, Zhou Ze didn't feel too disgusted about drinking the other person's saliva, especially after seeing Xu Qinglang eat so many "delicacies" last night.

Compared to Xu Qinglang, his experience this time was just a drop in the bucket.

Of course, he didn't find it "sensual" either;

The woman before him, no matter how beautiful, was just a corpse, a two-hundred-year-old corpse lying underground.

The thought of her not having brushed her teeth for two hundred years made Zhou Ze, who had a slight obsession with cleanliness, a bit uncomfortable.

She could move, and she went downstairs to drink water, then came back up.

Lady Bai didn't tell him the truth?

Or there was another possibility: because of his fingernail last night, this corpse had undergone some slight changes.

Currently, Lady Bai's soul had already reported to hell, so she shouldn't intentionally leave any bombs in the human world.

The little loli once said that ghosts in the Yang world had to "behave themselves" like a mouse. Anyone who wanted to cause trouble was simply tired of living, or living too comfortably.

However, the feeling of having a corpse on his second floor was completely different from having a moving corpse on his second floor. No one wanted a dangerous and unstable element at their bedside.

"Hey, big sister, how about you wake up, and we have a chat?"

Zhou Ze leaned against the edge of the freezer and said.

He hoped that the female corpse would open her eyes at this moment, either fight him or talk to him. They could agree to disagree, at least tear open the paper curtain, and stop playing mysterious.

However, the female corpse remained unmoved, still lying there.

Zhou Ze took a deep breath, then reached in and began to roam his hand over the female corpse's body. He even desecrated some sensitive areas,

He only hoped that the female corpse would be unable to tolerate such "impertinence" and angrily open her eyes.

Unfortunately,

The female corpse still lay there, cold and unmoving.

Zhou Ze estimated that even if he truly took off his pants and went up, the female corpse would still maintain this state.

Withdrawing his hand, Zhou Ze pursed his lips, feeling somewhat at a loss.

You can't wake a person who is pretending to sleep.

The next moment, Zhou Ze's fingernails began to lengthen. Immediately after, Zhou Ze thrust his index fingernail into the female corpse's arm and slowly applied pressure.

"Pfft..."

The fingernail, like a sharp blade, pierced the female corpse's arm. No blood flowed from the female corpse; instead, a cloud of black mist began to emerge. For a moment, the entire second-floor room became eerily ghostly.

"Zhou Ze, what are you doing!"

Xu Qinglang's shout came from downstairs.

Immediately after, Xu Qinglang rushed up to the second floor without a second thought. Zhou Ze withdrew his hand at this moment; his fingernails seemed to be coated with a layer of frost, feeling a bit stiff and a little painful.

"You're crazy!" Xu Qinglang looked at the narrow wound on the female corpse's arm and roared, "Do you know that when a *hanba* appears, it causes a thousand miles of drought!

This female corpse certainly can't compare to a *hanba*, but if the aura stored within her leaks out, it's enough to cause a plague in Tongcheng!"

Zhou Ze didn't rush to deal with the exasperated Xu Qinglang. Instead, he continued to stare at the female corpse's arm. The wound he had just pierced was slowly healing.

This female corpse,

Aside from her body being cold and lacking breath, everything else was truly indistinguishable from a living person. In fact, her body had even more vitality than a living person's!

"Hey, this thing was dug up by both of us. If it causes any trouble, I'll also be in trouble, lose lifespan, and even bring misfortune to my descendants!

The same goes for you. If you make a big mess, even if you're a Ghost Messenger now, you won't get off easy."

The slight trace of black aura that had just leaked from the female corpse slowly dissipated. Because the amount was small, and only Zhou Ze and Xu Qinglang were present, their resistance was stronger, so it wouldn't cause any harm.

But what had just leaked out was merely the tip of the iceberg of what was inside the female corpse.

Zhou Ze sighed, "Xu Qinglang."

"What?"

"Why don't you keep your wife at your place? Your parents just left, right? Let her keep you company. After all, she was married to you with a grand procession."

"What, what do you mean by that?" Xu Qinglang was baffled.

"This thing, she can move on her own," Zhou Ze explained the reason. "She went downstairs today, by herself, and even drank some water."

Xu Qinglang's face also showed a look of horror, and his mouth twitched as he retreated two steps.

He had said last night that once this corpse had an accident, it would turn into a zombie, and not the weak, "oo-wah-oo-wah" brainless types from Western movies that could be easily headshotted, but a true "flesh-eating" zombie that might even possess some supernatural powers.

"Thanks, I'm getting used to being alone."

What a joke, how could Xu Qinglang take this hot potato, no, this hot atomic bomb?

"Don't you have some talismans? Why don't you stick some on her?" Zhou Ze asked.

"The talismans on my two swords would only have a counterproductive effect if I put them on her, irritating her," Xu Qinglang said with a bitter smile.

"Then what do we do?" Zhou Ze felt a headache. "Transport her to the sea and throw her away? Even if she turns into a zombie, at most she'll go cause trouble for the Dragon King."

"She can't leave Tongcheng. She was a Tongcheng person in life, and after death, she's a Tongcheng ghost. If her body leaves the Tongcheng area, she'll still run into problems. Otherwise, why didn't Lady Bai deal with her before going to the underworld after achieving spiritual enlightenment?"

"Slap!"

Zhou Ze directly closed the lid of the freezer. Clearly, this problem had no solution.

Can't burn her,

Can't transport her,

Afraid of an accident if she's thrown somewhere else,

Can he only keep her in his room and watch her at his own risk?

Zhou Ze now seemed to somewhat understand why the little loli "biu-ed" her way to hell. Being a civil servant in the underworld wasn't that easy either.

Even within the system, those working at the grassroots level are always the most miserable.

Just like himself right now.

"Look on the bright side. I'll make you more plum juice tonight," Xu Qinglang comforted.

"And then?"

"Then I'm moving. Didn't I say I was going to open a shop in the county below? I plan to accelerate my plan." Xu Qinglang had the attitude of sacrificing others for his own benefit.

After locking the freezer, Zhou Ze and Xu Qinglang walked downstairs together.

Xu Qinglang again exhorted Zhou Ze not to mess around, then returned to the noodle shop. He was probably busy with his own affairs just now, but when he sensed the leakage of evil aura, he got a fright and rushed over.

Zhou Ze sat behind the counter,

He shook the water glass in front of him.

His phone rang. He took it out and saw it was an unknown number.

"Hello, may I speak to Mr. Xu Le? This is Chongchuan Traffic Police Department."

"Yes, that's me, what's wrong?"

"Is Xu Dachuan your relative? He was just in a car accident and is currently being transported to People's Hospital."

"Okay, I'll be right there."

Zhou Ze closed his eyes and let out a dissatisfied hum. He was already annoyed enough, and now something else had happened. Xu Dachuan should be the uncle he treated to lunch today.

But he couldn't just not go. Although the person came to the city specifically to visit Xu Le, not him, Zhou Ze had given all the local produce he brought to Xu Qinglang for ingredients.

Zhou Ze looked at his fingernails,

If Xu Dachuan was really in life-threatening danger,

Should he save him or not?

Thinking of the severe backlash he suffered last time after saving the little loli, a shiver ran down Zhou Ze's spine. Forget it, he hoped he wasn't seriously injured.

He walked out of the store, hailed a taxi, and in the car, Zhou Ze sent Xu Qinglang a WeChat message, indicating that he was going out and Xu Qinglang should watch the shop.

By the time he arrived at People's Hospital, it was already eight in the evening. Zhou Ze asked at the front desk and learned that Xu Dachuan was not in life-threatening danger and had already been transferred to a ward. He felt relieved.

Pushing open the ward door, Zhou Ze entered and was surprised to see Doctor Lin standing by Xu Dachuan's bed, chatting with him.

One of Xu Dachuan's legs was propped up; it was likely broken. He also had a few scrapes on his face, but his spirits were good. He was quite energetic while chatting with his nephew's wife.

Zhou Ze's gaze met Doctor Lin's as he approached.

"Thank you, I appreciate it," Zhou Ze said.

"It's nothing," Doctor Lin stood up and explained, "I wasn't home during the day, I'm sorry."

"It's fine," Zhou Ze waved his hand.

Doctor Lin left the ward. Zhou Ze chatted with his uncle for a while longer. The long-distance bus had crashed before even leaving the city. Xu Dachuan was just unlucky, falling and breaking his left leg. The other passengers only had minor scrapes.

Xu Dachuan didn't seem to care much about his injuries. Instead, he kept repeating, "My nephew's wife is still a good person."

Zhou Ze smiled, told Xu Dachuan to rest well, and then walked out of the ward.

Doctor Lin was currently standing by the front desk, where a female nurse was sitting, seemingly unwell.

Zhou Ze was about to leave, but he had to say goodbye to Doctor Lin. The two hadn't contacted each other for a long time, but appearances still needed to be kept up.

However, as soon as he got closer, Zhou Ze heard the faint cry of a baby, very weak, like a kitten.

Zhou Ze initially didn't think much of it, but as he got closer to Doctor Lin, he noticed the baby's cry was clearer.

Could it be that Doctor Lin was being haunted by a little ghost?

Zhou Ze was still observing, deliberately standing to the side behind Doctor Lin and looking.

"It's alright, Sister Lin. My stomach has been bad, an old problem. I'll take some medicine later and I'll be fine." The little nurse thanked Doctor Lin for her concern.

"Take good care of yourself," Doctor Lin comforted.

At this moment, Doctor Lin noticed Zhou Ze standing behind her, somewhat... "sneaky."

"You..."

"Wait a moment." Zhou Ze raised his hand, listened carefully again, and finally looked at the little nurse's belly.

The sound wasn't coming from Doctor Lin; it was coming from inside the little nurse.

Zhou Ze, who used to be a doctor, immediately understood what was happening.

"You're pregnant," Zhou Ze said to the little nurse. At this moment, Zhou Ze couldn't afford to be subtle or worry about politeness.

"What?" The little nurse looked bewildered.

"What nonsense are you talking about? Xiao Chen isn't even married and doesn't have a boyfriend," Doctor Lin glared at her "husband."

"I don't know who you got pregnant with, but you'd better go get checked out now. Also, a word of caution, you're at risk of miscarriage," Zhou Ze said with certainty.

The fetus was very unstable, and the faint crying indicated the instinctive sadness of an unborn little one. This was also why Zhou Ze didn't consider the other person's feelings.

A human life was at stake.

Nurse Xiao Chen immediately stood up, her face showing anxiety. Clearly, she hadn't known she was pregnant before, but she knew she had engaged in "high-risk" behavior, making conception very likely.

Doctor Lin also understood and quickly rushed off with Xiao Chen.

Zhou Ze stretched, thinking it was a pity that Xu Le studied civil engineering. If Xu Le had studied medicine, then he would probably soon become the most famous doctor not only in Tongcheng but throughout the entire Su Province.

He went downstairs, bought a box of milk and some daily necessities for Xu Dachuan, delivered them to Xu Dachuan's ward, and then came out again. This time, he really intended to leave, as the person at home truly made him uneasy.

Coincidentally, Doctor Lin emerged from the elevator, her expression somewhat solemn.

"What's wrong?"

"How did you know Xiao Chen was pregnant?" Doctor Lin asked.

"I studied some traditional Chinese medicine," Zhou Ze lied. "How's the situation over there?"

"Xiao Chen intends to keep the baby, but whether she can keep it is hard to say. She didn't pay attention at all before," Doctor Lin said, then turned to Zhou Ze. "Are you going back? Wait for me to change my clothes, I'll drive you."

And so, Zhou Ze left the hospital in Doctor Lin's Cayenne.

Throughout the journey, neither of them spoke much. Their "marital" relationship had plummeted to freezing point due to the previous incident.

As they neared the bookstore, Zhou Ze felt he should find a topic to chat about, otherwise, it would be too stifling. He said, "You posted quite a few *Hanfu* photos in your Moments. Do you like them a lot?"

"Mm," Doctor Lin nodded.

"I like them quite a bit too," Zhou Ze touched the tip of his nose. "Do you have any *Hanfu*? Would you wear one for me sometime?"

Doctor Lin didn't answer, seemingly disinclined to engage in the topic.

The car stopped at the bookstore entrance. Zhou Ze got out, and to his surprise, Doctor Lin also got out, seemingly intending to enter the bookstore with him.

Heh, this woman is really strong, isn't she afraid of being "that-ed" by me again like last time?

"I'm going to get some magazines to read at work," Doctor Lin said.

"Mm," Zhou Ze nodded. He knew this was Doctor Lin's indirect way of expressing a desire for reconciliation. This woman truly wasn't easy.

In Lu Xun's style, it would be: This woman, once again, bowed to feudal rites, that is, to this nominal "husband."

In ancient times, Doctor Lin would be a typical pitiable woman deeply poisoned and persecuted by feudal rites.

Pushing open the bookstore door, Zhou Ze was somewhat surprised to find Xu Qinglang sitting on a plastic stool, reading a book. But the book in his hands was clearly upside down. What in the world was he reading?

Xu Qinglang managed a smile at Zhou Ze, but it was uglier than a cry.

Doctor Lin took a couple more glances at this man, who was more attractive than most women, then walked directly towards the bookshelf to pick out magazines.

Zhou Ze offered Xu Qinglang a cigarette and whispered, "What's wrong with you? You're so distracted."

Just then,

Footsteps sounded from the stairwell. A woman dressed in an ancient white gown gracefully descended, her posture elegant and naturally tender.

When she saw Zhou Ze,

She bowed slightly,

And said respectfully:

"You're back."

The magazine Doctor Lin had just held,

Fell to the floor,

And at the same time, she said coldly:

"It seems, I don't need to wear it for you to see."

title: 第三十六章 我是鬼！
content:
"It seems I won't need to model it for you."

Doctor Lin was indeed a very traditional woman, but not the ancient kind who wouldn't dare utter a word even if her husband took concubines, fearing a reputation for jealousy.

She had her compromises, and she also had her principles.

She could force herself to accept Zhou Ze's previous transgression against her, and she could slowly force herself to accept "Xu Le" (Zhou Ze) becoming increasingly autonomous and assertive.

But she could not accept Zhou Ze having an affair; that was her bottom line.

She was angry.

Extremely, furiously angry.

She even wanted to turn around and leave.

At that moment, Doctor Lin hadn't left because she was waiting for Zhou Ze's response. Regardless, Zhou Ze should give a clear stance, and then things between them could finally be resolved.

Even if she had to face her mother's accusations and her father's rage over her marriage disgracing the family name, she would accept it.

However, Zhou Ze did not respond.

No explanation.

He seemed to be tacitly admitting it.

The light in Doctor Lin's eyes immediately dimmed.

Did he not even need to explain anymore?

In truth, Doctor Lin had misunderstood Zhou Ze. Zhou Ze hadn't reacted at all, nor had he even noticed Doctor Lin's feelings.

From Zhou Ze's perspective, he felt a shiver of terror run down his spine.

This female corpse,

had actually come alive!

And it wasn't as simple as just coming down for a drink during the day. She had actually walked brazenly in front of him, speaking to him, interacting with him!

Recalling his "finger exploration" on her body earlier to "wake" her up,

Zhou Ze immediately felt an urge to rush out of the shop and flee as far as possible.

Now he could understand why Xu Qinglang was sitting there like an idiot, holding his book upside down. He simply didn't dare to move!

The scene fell into an awkward silence.

"Hello." The female corpse smiled, and after greeting Zhou Ze, much like a Korean or Japanese wife greeting her husband at the entrance with "Welcome home," she deliberately looked at Lin Wanqiu with a playful gaze.

"Hello." Doctor Lin responded coldly.

Zhou Ze took a deep breath at this moment. He reached out and pulled Xu Qinglang up, forcing him to stand.

"Wanqiu, let me introduce you. This is my good friend and neighbor, the owner of the noodle shop next door who has twenty-odd demolished houses—Xu Qinglang!"

"Hello." Xu Qinglang said to Lin Wanqiu, but his gaze remained fixed on the female corpse beside him.

He was truly as delicate as could be, like a startled little quail.

"Hello." Lin Wanqiu.

"This one..." Zhou Ze pointed at the female corpse, "is Xu Qinglang's wife."

"Right... what?" Xu Qinglang was stunned, but the next moment, Zhou Ze applied a little force, and Xu Qinglang stumbled, leaning directly against the female corpse.

"Yes, this is my wife. Her surname is Bai, and her name is Bai Su Z... Bai Susu." Xu Qinglang looked at Lin Wanqiu, while one hand casually and intimately rested on the female corpse's shoulder.

In an instant,

the same icy coldness as last night stimulated his very soul.

"Ah... oh oh oh oh... phew phew phew... uh..."

Xu Qinglang shivered several times before releasing his hand, saying, "Haha, wifey, you're so soft. I love touching you,

hahahahahaha!"

"You two continue. Wanqiu, come out for a moment. I have something to tell you."

With that, Zhou Ze directly took Lin Wanqiu's hand and, regardless of her willingness, pulled her out of the bookstore.

"Oh, Xu Le, I suddenly remembered something very important I need to tell you too, like how I have too many houses and want to give you one."

Xu Qinglang waved his hand, making a move to follow Zhou Ze out,

The female corpse stood still beside him, elegant and serene.

However, Xu Qinglang only felt a terrifying chill wrap around his neck, as if stepping one more foot outside would instantly tear him apart.

Xu Qinglang wisely chose to stop, then chuckled,

"Don't be angry, wifey. How could I give away houses? We'll wait until the country allows twenty children and then we'll pass them all down to our kids. You'll even get a 'Heroic Mother' medal then."

Xu Qinglang's face twisted in bitterness as he sat back down on the plastic stool.

Zhou Ze pulled Doctor Lin's hand and walked out of the bookstore, all the way to where Doctor Lin's car was parked.

"What is it, speak." Doctor Lin asked.

"You seem to have gained some weight recently. Don't eat late-night snacks."

After saying that, Zhou Ze pushed Doctor Lin towards the car,

"Hurry up and drive home. If you have nothing to do tonight, go for a run or skip rope."

"What exactly is going on?" Doctor Lin grabbed Zhou Ze, who was about to turn back into the bookstore.

"Don't worry about it, just go." Zhou Ze urged.

Doctor Lin said nothing more, got into her car, started the engine, took one last deep look at Zhou Ze, and drove away.

Zhou Ze let out a long sigh, then squatted by the roadside and lit a cigarette.

Honestly, he didn't want to go back to the bookstore, and his理性 told him that leaving with Doctor Lin was the wisest choice. But there was no alternative; he had dug the female corpse out of that plot of land himself.

Zhou Ze had no saintly compassion; he was actually very afraid of trouble. But no matter what, even ignoring his current temporary identity as a ghost messenger, if the female corpse were to truly run rampant and cause trouble in Tongcheng, in his hometown, he would genuinely feel guilty.

As for Xu Qinglang, who was still in the bookstore,

Oh,

Xu Qinglang was still in the bookstore. He almost forgot.

Still cheap*,

Even dead,

Still cheap.

He exhaled a puff of smoke, tossed the cigarette butt on the ground, stepped on it firmly, and then Zhou Ze walked straight into the bookstore.

As he pushed open the bookstore door, a black light began to swirl in Zhou Ze's eyes, and his fingernails elongated.

"You're back again."

The female corpse still stood there, graceful, but the mockery in her eyes was even clearer than when Doctor Lin was present.

"Get back upstairs and lie down properly."

Zhou Ze pointed at the female corpse and scolded her. Whether he could win or not, putting on a show of power was always a good idea.

"Do you prefer Durex or Jissbon? I have both. I'll go get them for you."

Xu Qinglang said, trying to stand up and leave again.

He regretted it greatly.

He should have moved out during the day. Why did he have to stay here?

However, the female corpse directly reached out and grabbed Xu Qinglang.

Xu Qinglang let out a delicate cry from his throat: "Heaven and Earth without end, Profound Heart Righteous Law!"

A bronze mirror appeared in Xu Qinglang's hand, pointed at the female corpse.

But at that very instant, the bronze mirror shattered, and Xu Qinglang was swept backward, crashing into the bookstore wall.

The might of the female corpse,

was terrifying!

Zhou Ze directly charged forward. This was his first real fight, and he was unsure of himself.

However, the female corpse specifically stared at Zhou Ze's hands, then began to retreat, not daring to take a single step forward.

"Cough cough..."

Xu Qinglang picked himself up from the ground, one hand on his waist. He had initially thought Zhou Ze would also be swept away like him, but then he saw Zhou Ze relentlessly pushing the female corpse back. His heart immediately felt unbalanced.

"Damn, no going easy!"

Finally, the female corpse was pushed back to the wall, but the next moment, she finally became enraged and lunged at Zhou Ze.

Zhou Ze instinctively reached out and grabbed forward.

"Crash..."

With a crisp sound,

the female corpse was slammed heavily against the wall, causing a slight indentation in the wall.

The white dress on the female corpse's chest was torn open as she rolled onto the ground. If she hadn't been wearing undergarments, she would have been completely exposed.

"Damn, so fierce!" Xu Qinglang watched, dumbfounded.

At the same time, remembering how he had once planned to force Zhou Ze to reveal the secret of his ability to borrow a corpse to return to life, he felt a sudden wave of fear.

This neighbor of his really hadn't fought before. Xu Qinglang knew that Zhou Ze's previous fear and apprehension of the female corpse were absolutely not feigned.

The reason was simple:

This neighbor, he himself didn't know he was so good at fighting!

Indeed, Zhou Ze wasn't a fighter.

Growing up in an orphanage, that orphanage was clean, and the children had good relationships, understanding and encouraging each other. Later, he became a doctor, a job that saved lives, and he had no interest in boxing or mixed martial arts in his spare time.

Therefore,

when Zhou Ze actually had to fight now, he himself felt a bit clumsy.

Because the female ghost was afraid of his fingernails, Zhou Ze's fighting style resembled a shrew scratching at faces with her nails, completely lacking any ghost messenger's bearing.

It was far, far less cool than the little loli opening her mouth and murmuring, "The Underworld has order, the Yellow Springs can be crossed."

But now, none of that was an issue. Effectiveness was key.

For Zhou Ze, who had walked back earlier with the mindset of being torn apart by the female corpse, the current situation was truly wonderful.

"Ah!"

The female corpse was flung away again. Every time she got close to Zhou Ze's fingernails, the black energy from the nails would instantly pierce her body, causing her immense damage.

"Heaven and Earth without end, Profound Heart Righteous Law!"

Two talismans appeared in Xu Qinglang's hand, both stuck to the ground. For a moment, the chill in the bookstore seemed to lessen. And each time the female corpse landed, the talismans would tremble, and the ground beneath her would feel hot, as if a ball of fire was burning.

The female corpse's gaze sharpened. She dared not face Zhou Ze again and chose to phase through the side. Her speed was incredibly fast, attempting to shatter the bookstore door's glass and escape.

However, Zhou Ze was now getting more and more into the zone.

As the saying goes, if you haven't eaten pork, haven't you at least heard a pig grunt?

From Hong Kong movies in his childhood to later Wuxia and cultivation films, everyone had seen the general gist of things.

Zhou Ze crossed his arms, his dark eyes looking towards the door.

When the female corpse attempted to shatter the glass door to escape, black light suddenly appeared on the glass door, as if scratches made by fingernails.

The female corpse let out a shrill scream, bounced back heavily, and landed on the ground.

Zhou Ze slowly walked forward, simultaneously regulating his breathing.

However, the female corpse, having been "captured" back, immediately knelt on the ground, one finger pointing at Zhou Ze, and one hand covering her face,

"Ying ying ying ying ying..."

"I'll beat you to death, you whiny monster!"

Xu Qinglang pulled out another talisman from his hand.

But the female corpse began pointing at Zhou Ze, crying out in extreme grievance:

"You touched me, and you hit me. You're not human!"

Zhou Ze's mouth twitched instinctively.

The female corpse, who had just brought immense pressure and deterrence to him and Xu Qinglang, suddenly acting like this truly felt like a breakdown in character.

But Zhou Ze still said, seriously and deeply:

"I am a ghost."

——————

PS: Please vote with recommendation tickets, throw them all at me. Long just found out our new book rank one was surpassed.

Then, let's take it back.

---
* The word used is 贱 (jiàn), which can mean "cheap" but also "inferior," "lowly," "worthless," or even "shameless." In this context, it carries a sense of "still annoying" or "still a pain in the ass" despite being dead.

title: 第三十七章 人生如夢
content:
“I only meant to tease you, Officer. Why did you have to be so cruel?

You truly are a heartless, ungrateful man. You touched me, you made advances;

Yet you turn around and deny it, and then you take out your anger on me because of your original wife.”

The female corpse wept to herself, miserably. Coupled with her white dress, now nearly in tatters, she looked even more pitiful.
