She was very clever; from details like Lin Wanqiu buying Zhou Ze's former house, she had already deduced many inside stories.

"It's not a Qiong Yao drama; why would I make it so melodramatic?" Zhou Ze shrugged.

Although there was a small interlude on the road that left Dr. Lin somewhat distraught, Zhou Ze didn't intend to abandon his original plan.

Such a woman, and the legal wife of his current body,

If he didn't tell her the truth so she could sleep peacefully with him tonight,

Was he out of his mind?

Concealing things, taking roundabout paths, making it a song and dance, then being hysterical—that was Aunt Qiong Yao's preferred style. He, Zhou Ze, didn't like it.

Dr. Lin sat down on a long bench at the parking lot exit, and Zhou Ze sat beside her.

The female corpse very tactfully didn't approach them.

They sat side by side.

Lin Wanqiu took a deep breath. Her beautiful face appeared even more exquisite in the moonlight.

Zhou Ze admired her from beside her.

To have such a beautiful woman, and such a good-looking married woman…

who had been longing for him, who had died more than half a year ago,

The sense of accomplishment was truly overwhelming.

"Is what happened just now really alright?" Dr. Lin clearly hadn't fully detached herself from the recent events.

"We didn't do anything wrong, did we?" Zhou Ze comforted her.

Dr. Lin nodded.

"Just like those brave anti-drug police officers, they also conceal their identities, and their families do too. This is to ensure their safety. It's a great sacrifice they make."

"So, you're afraid of retaliation?"

"Mm."

"Okay, I understand." Dr. Lin nodded.

Zhou Ze raised his hand, preparing to embrace the woman, and then it would be "time to witness a miracle." But Dr. Lin spoke first:

"What exactly is your relationship with her?

Xu Le, please answer me seriously. This time, no matter what you say, I'll believe it," Dr. Lin asked Zhou Ze, "and I'll forgive everything."

"It's really nothing," Zhou Ze said with a wry smile. He could only say that both times were too coincidental.

Dr. Lin fell silent again. Just as Zhou Ze was about to speak, Dr. Lin actively reached out and clasped Zhou Ze's hand. Zhou Ze was stunned for a moment.

"Xu Le, I'm sorry. I've always loved another man. You must have already realized it, otherwise you wouldn't have appeared in that house.

Although that man and I are innocent, I admit I cheated emotionally. I'm sorry, because you are my nominal husband."

"It's no..."

Just as Zhou Ze was about to speak, Dr. Lin spoke again:

"I've thought through our situation.

I'll give you two choices:

One, we get a divorce. I'll compensate you one million, and the bookstore is also yours."

"What divorce?" Zhou Ze said.

"Two, I will try hard to forget that man, and I will genuinely choose to live with you, to be your... true wife, to make up for what I owed you before.

Xu Le, I am willing to try and give you everything I have, fulfilling a wife's duties and responsibilities."

As she spoke these words, Dr. Lin's eyes reddened. She had resigned herself to her fate.

"Okay... wait a minute."

Zhou Ze's mind was a bit muddled for a moment; this relationship was a bit tangled, and he needed to sort it out. Then Zhou Ze finally understood the details, and in anger, he immediately stood up, pointing at Dr. Lin and speaking somewhat incoherently:

"No,

You have to keep cheating!"

"..." Dr. Lin.

"Pfft..." The female corpse, who had been pretending to look at the scenery but was actually eavesdropping on the gossip with her superhuman hearing, burst out laughing directly,

Then she clutched her stomach and squatted down,

"Hahahaha, my tummy hurts from laughing!"

————

title: 第四十四章 周澤醫生！
content:
"No, you must continue cheating!"

"............" Dr. Lin.

Dr. Lin's red lips parted slightly, a mix of bewilderment and confusion on her face.

Had her "husband" not forgiven her yet?

Or did her "husband" simply have a certain affinity for being cuckolded?

Under the weight of guilt and pressure, Dr. Lin had chosen to compromise. In truth, of the two conditions she offered, any choice-maker who wasn't foolish or overly naive would surely pick the second.

The first was to take a million plus a failing bookstore.

The second was to get both her person and her money. With her person, why would a million *yuan* still be lacking?

Besides, she wasn't an ugly rich woman.

However, for Zhou Ze, the situation he faced was even more difficult.

*I've been busy for half a day, and now you say you want to forget me and contentedly settle down with that little bastard Xu Le?*

Zhou Ze absolutely couldn't allow this to happen.

Originally, he was the one cuckolding someone else, feeling great, a sense of accomplishment *biu biu biu*.

Now that he was the one being cuckolded, it wasn't so pleasant.

Zhou Ze reached out, pointing at his own face, and said very seriously:

"I'm not Xu Le, I'm Zhou Ze."

Dr. Lin was stunned.

After a long silence between the two,

Dr. Lin finally sighed and said,

"No matter what you choose, I admit I'm sorry for you, but you shouldn't play tricks on me like this. Or, do you still hold a grudge?"

Zhou Ze shrugged. "I really am Zhou Ze. I died in a car accident, but woke up inexplicably and transmigrated into this guy's body. I don't know if you usually read novels and TV shows, but transmigration plots shouldn't be that uncommon, right?"

"Whatever you say... I guess that's what it is." Dr. Lin humored him.

But Zhou Ze knew that the woman in front of him probably planned to contact a psychologist for him tomorrow. If she were more extreme, she might even forcibly send him to a psychiatric hospital.

In the distance, the sound of an ambulance echoed, and the hospital building suddenly became a hive of activity.

"I'll go check." Dr. Lin stood up, intending to temporarily abandon her conversation with her "husband." In her opinion, her "husband" had suffered a considerable mental shock.

But precisely because of this, she felt even more guilty towards Xu Le.

The female corpse, who had been eavesdropping on the gossip, came up behind Zhou Ze after seeing Dr. Lin walk away and said,

"Boss, why didn't you let her see your nail fungus?"

"Or let her check if you're cold?" Zhou Ze retorted.

The female corpse pouted and said, "It's not impossible, I guess. If she stuck her hand in and felt, she'd understand."

"I want it to be more aesthetic," Zhou Ze said. "As gentle as possible."

"Pretentious," the female corpse dared to mock her boss at this moment.

"Yes, pretentious. Weren't you also pretentious when you, a young lady from a good family, secretly met with a poor scholar?" Zhou Ze stretched. "Come on, follow me in."

"To the hospital?"

"Nonsense. With such a big commotion over there, it must be a major accident. There must be many injured, and the chief resident in the emergency department must be short-staffed. Those interns don't have enough experience or guts to handle this situation."

Zhou Ze spoke as he and the female corpse walked into the hospital and directly turned into the staff changing room.

"But boss, what does that have to do with you?"

Zhou Ze chose a white coat roughly his size, put it on, and tied on a mask.

"I was a doctor in my previous life. Dr. Lin was an intern I supervised back then."

"Hehe, teacher-student romance." The female corpse also put on a white coat, her voice tinged with excitement. "Boss, what should I do?"

"Pick some background music for me," Zhou Ze said, pulling on his gloves.

"BGM?" The female corpse paused.

"Because I'm about to show off."

Zhou Ze took a deep breath, then exhaled heavily.

A familiar feeling.

*I'm back.*

............

"Doctors today are so different from doctors in my time," the female corpse said, feeling a bit awkward in her nurse's uniform.

"Mhm," Zhou Ze said noncommittally.

"It makes me feel a bit lost," the female corpse mused. "I feel like I'm out of touch with this world. Looks like I'll have to go out more often in the future." The female corpse said tentatively.

"Stop messing around. You even know what Wanchai Pier* means, and you still have the nerve to say you're out of touch?" Zhou Ze quickly countered.

The female corpse stuck out her tongue and said, "Boss, what kind of doctor were you before? I hear being an obstetrician is quite good."

"You read novels in your coffin?" Zhou Ze retorted.

"What?" The female corpse was confused.

"Golden ophthalmology, silver surgery, dirty and tiring obstetrics and gynecology."

Zhou Ze smiled. "Only those outsiders who don't know, or those influenced by other literary works, would think that obstetrics and gynecology is wonderful and leisurely."

Just then, the elevator opened, and a stretcher cart was pushed out by several porters.

Zhou Ze immediately walked over and asked, "What happened?"

The intern instinctively replied as if addressing his "master," "Patient is unconscious."

Zhou Ze's gaze sharpened. He immediately flipped onto the stretcher cart, performing chest compressions while shouting,

"Quick, push to the emergency room!"

At that moment, several porters and nurses pushed the stretcher cart inside together. Many patients and family members in the corridor had to quickly make way.

"Clear the way!" Zhou Ze shouted.

Dr. Lin, who had just finished treating a patient's wound, wiped the sweat from her forehead and walked out. She froze at the sight of the figure kneeling on the stretcher cart, performing CPR.

Then she immediately ran over.

*What is he trying to do?*

*This is a hospital!*

Upon reaching the emergency room, Zhou Ze immediately ordered, "Push the crash cart, prepare for intubation!"

"Yes!" the intern responded. The surrounding nurses, seeing the intern comply, naturally followed the orders.

They each assumed that others knew this new doctor, which was the biggest misunderstanding. Of course, this was also because of the urgent situation, plus Zhou Ze's tone and command truly didn't give away that he was a "fake doctor."

Zhou Ze stood at the head of the bed, personally performing the intubation.

At the same time, he extended his hand to the left: "Stylet."

"Yes!" The nurse immediately handed the item to Zhou Ze.

Zhou Ze then said to the intern beside him, "Listen for placement."

"Okay." The intern, who had been a bit nervous before, was no longer nervous. Many young doctors are like this: technically proficient but not suited to lead alone, more suited to be a grunt under someone's command.

He put on his stethoscope and began to listen for placement, then nodded to Zhou Ze, "Placement is fine."

Zhou Ze nodded. "Switch, keep compressing."

"Yes!"

Another nurse immediately came over to replace the previous one, continuing the CPR.

At this point, a nurse looked at the monitor next to them and exclaimed, "Patient is in ventricular fibrillation."

Zhou Ze looked up. "Prepare for defibrillation."

"Understood."

The intern immediately took out scissors and cut open the patient's clothes. Zhou Ze took over from the previous nurse and began to personally perform CPR, saying at the same time,

"Charge to two hundred joules."

"Understood." The nurse immediately prepared, then said, "Charging complete."

At this moment, Dr. Lin pushed aside the curtain and walked in, seeing the figure organizing the resuscitation.

Yes, it was Xu Le, her husband.

Dr. Lin pointed at Zhou Ze. She was furious. She didn't know what was wrong with her husband. He had just told her he was Zhou Ze, and she thought he might be delusional, but she absolutely would not allow him to gamble with a patient's life!

"Prepare to discharge, clear!" Zhou Ze warned those around him, then specifically stared at Dr. Lin.

Dr. Lin's body trembled, a familiar feeling washing over her.

A familiar scene,

A familiar tone,

A familiar style.

At this moment, she couldn't even speak.

After the first defibrillation, Zhou Ze continued CPR, his gaze fixed on the monitor.

But the situation didn't improve. Zhou Ze directly said, "Again, charge to two hundred joules!"

"Yes!" The nurse prepared again, then said, "Charging complete."

"Clear!"

Zhou Ze performed defibrillation again.

Under the electrical shock, the patient's entire body trembled.

The intern beside him continued CPR.

Zhou Ze looked at the monitor, which finally showed a return to normal.

"Restore power, get an ECG." Zhou Ze said to the intern beside him.

"Okay."

The intern immediately went to prepare, then handed the ECG report paper to Zhou Ze.

Zhou Ze took it and glanced at it, saying, "Acute myocardial infarction. Contact cardiology. Prepare for emergency PCI immediately."

"Okay, understood." The intern wiped his sweat and let out a long sigh of relief.

Zhou Ze also walked out of the emergency room at this moment.

Dr. Lin stood outside, looking at him with suspicion, disbelief, excitement, and also fear.

Zhou Ze directly reprimanded,

"What are you standing around for? There are so many patients. Go save people!

If you want to cry or be scared, wait until after work and go home and hide in bed, hugging a doll and crying."

Dr. Lin immediately burst into tears.

He had lectured her like that back then too.

The next moment,

Dr. Lin rushed over, wrapping her arms around Zhou Ze, pressing her face directly against his chest.

Zhou Ze was stunned.

He had anticipated many reactions from Dr. Lin after his confession:

Fear?

Breakdown?

Terror?

But he had never expected this scene.

*Holy shit,*

*She's throwing herself into my arms just like that?*

*That's it? It's okay now?*

Zhou Ze had always been curious how he, such a blunt and unromantic person, had managed to win the heart of Dr. Lin, who was a little innocent girl back then.

Now he seemed to understand a little.

Did Dr. Lin have Stockholm Syndrome?

After being lectured and scolded, she actually fell for him instead?

However, it seemed women with this syndrome might also accept certain bedroom "tastes" that ordinary people find unacceptable...?

Hehe;
Translator's note:
*灣仔碼頭 (Wanchai Pier): A famous brand of frozen dumplings in China, often sold in supermarkets. The reference here is to the female corpse knowing about this modern product, implying she's not as "out of touch" as she claims.

title: 第四十五章 兇手！
content:
The twilight sun was like a crimson apple, or a little sister’s face, baked till rosy.

Zhou Ze sat in the bookstore, organizing the latest batch of bills. The bookstore's operations had fallen into financial straits, the key issue being the meager inheritance he received from Xu Le. If not for reclaiming his share from the pirated booksellers, the shop might not have been able to continue operating.

The night he returned from the hospital, Zhou Ze burned all the remaining Hell Bank Notes. He then squatted at the doorway, smoking half a pack of cigarettes and waiting for a while. Indeed, no one came to drop off money.

According to the female corpse, this was called using yin de (merit from good deeds) to ward off disaster. The Hell Bank Notes given by a ghost were equivalent to yin de; when you needed money, you could "exchange" them for it, and when you needed to avoid trouble, you could use them to cancel out problems.

The previous incident had been reported in the news: a wealthy man hired someone to murder his wife. There was a rumor that the suspect claimed a high school girl appeared and beat them up, though no one believed it. It wasn't like she was a Sailor Moon character. In any case, that matter concluded, and Zhou Ze’s Hell Bank Notes weren't burned in vain.

Xu Qinglang came over from next door, holding two cups of tea in his hands. His lifestyle was becoming increasingly refined. Originally a diligent and aspiring young man, after acquiring over twenty properties, he finally succumbed to indulgence and a decadent pace of life.

The two sat by the counter, drinking tea together.

"What happened with your wife in the end?" Xu Qinglang asked.

"She said she needed some quiet time and some time to think," Zhou Ze replied.

The confession process was very smooth, almost too smooth. Dr. Lin’s affection for him had even begun to verge on the "pathological," but fortunately, she was still a rational person. Xu Le was dead, and he, Zhou Ze, had returned to life in Xu Le's body. With all these incredible things happening before her, it would be difficult for her to accept it all at once and continue a shamelessly happy life with her "dream lover" and "current husband."

"That's already good. She's stronger than I imagined," Xu Qinglang smiled. "Most people would probably be scared out of their minds."

Zhou Ze was noncommittal. Xu Qinglang shouldn't have known about this, so someone obviously leaked it. The leaker didn't need to be sought out; it was clearly Ms. Bai Yingying.

"By the way, I have a question for you," Zhou Ze asked seriously. "Was Xu Le so hard up when he first opened the shop?"

"No, I thought he lived quite comfortably. But I didn't interact much with him before he died; he was a very dull guy, totally boring. But he must have had a lot of money; I remember he often helped out his relatives at the bookstore, very generous."

After speaking, Xu Qinglang glanced at Zhou Ze again, even sticking out his tongue and licking his lips. "You're much more interesting."

For a moment, his waist swayed, and his eyes were like waves, truly captivating.

"It's a shame you didn't become a gigolo; you could have been the Gigolo King of your generation."

"Can we not have a proper conversation?" Xu Qinglang said, annoyed.

"That's a compliment."

"Heh..." Xu Qinglang pointed at Zhou Ze. "You should worry about yourself."

"Worry about what?" Zhou Ze gestured to the bookstore. "Business hasn't been good lately. Not only are there few living people, but there are hardly any ghosts either."

"How do you plan to develop your relationship with your doctor wife? I think she just needs some time to adjust, and then she'll accept it. After all, with a woman like her, honestly, you've hit the jackpot. Who would've thought that in this day and age, someone like an ancient young lady from a good family would appear? Her parents must be eccentric too."

"Hmm." Zhou Ze nodded. His in-laws were indeed eccentric. His father-in-law had been a hospital director and had also run a medical company. By all accounts, he should have been an absolute success, yet in some ways, he was very feudal and stubborn.

"Once you tame a woman like that, she'll willingly be a good wife and mother," Xu Qinglang said with a look of yearning. "I want a woman like that too."

"You already are one," Zhou Ze quipped.

"Let's get back to your problem. You're going to live with her, right?"

"Probably," Zhou Ze said.

"Then you'll definitely sleep together, right?" Xu Qinglang stretched out his hand, wiggled it, and continued, "When I say 'sleep,' I mean a verb that includes many complex actions and special positions. You understand, right?"

Zhou Ze nodded, still not understanding what Xu Qinglang was getting at.

"Okay, so here's your problem: you're currently using Xu Le's body. If you two actually 'sleep' together, doesn't that mean Xu Le is cuckolding you?"

Xu Qinglang narrowed his eyes; at this moment, he smiled mischievously.

Then, Zhou Ze fell into thought.

"Even your DNA isn't your original DNA; it's Xu Le's. So, the child you have after going through this extremely complex and rich verb, 'sleep,' isn't actually your child, but Xu Le's and Lin Wanqiu's. Right?"

Then, Zhou Ze fell into thought again.

Xu Qinglang spoke with increasing enthusiasm, watching Zhou Ze remain silent, feeling an unspeakable delight! When Mrs. Bai had her subordinates carry him over in an eight-man sedan chair, it was Zhou Ze who secretly pointed a finger at him. He had written down that grudge!

Zhou Ze took a sip of water, showing no emotion.

"Do you feel very anxious and bewildered?" Xu Qinglang asked.

"I'm the one who's enjoying it," Zhou Ze replied.

Xu Qinglang frowned and continued, "But this body is Xu Le's. When you sleep with her, it's Xu Le's body."

"I'm the one who's enjoying it."

"But the child's DNA..."

"I'm the one who's enjoying it."

Xu Qinglang slapped the counter hard and snapped, "Damn it, you can't be so open-minded!"

"Anyway, I'm the one who's enjoying it. That guy Xu Le has long gone to hell, who knows where he ended up. Maybe he even drank the Meng Po soup and reincarnated. Why should I care about that? As long as I'm enjoying it."

Xu Qinglang's chest heaved with anger. He didn't know why he was angry, but he was just so frustrated!

"Alright, let's stop this. Any more and it'll turn into a debate about the spirit and the flesh, reaching the height of philosophy," Zhou Ze said, signaling an end to the somewhat boring discussion.

"Whatever makes you happy," Xu Qinglang said, full of resentment.

"Oh, by the way, there's something else I need to ask you," Zhou Ze remembered another matter.

"Speak."

"Do you know any other ghost messengers?" Zhou Ze asked.

"I used to live with the souls of my parents; would I dare to get to know ghost messengers?" Xu Qinglang retorted.

"Okay, I understand."

It seemed he still needed to find time to go to the Confucius Temple. The drumming dwarfish old man he saw last time should also be on the payroll.

"What exactly do you want to ask?" Xu Qinglang asked.

"I want to ask if ghost messengers have performance reviews or anything like that—promotions, raises, benefits."

"They should... have them, right?" Xu Qinglang thought for a moment. "Look at Mrs. Bai; she was able to accumulate merit and go from a ghost lingering in the human world back to the Underworld to seek an official position. You should have something similar. Didn't that little loli tell you?"

Zhou Ze shook his head.

"I also think your ghost messenger role came a bit too easily. I reckon she probably had some other serious matter to deal with, so she temporarily dumped the job on you to handle."

"You mean, I'm really just a temporary worker?"

"Heh heh, once she's done dealing with her affairs, you'll probably have to vacate the position. If she's in a good mood, she might turn a blind eye; if she's in a bad mood, she could just drag you back to the Underworld."

"What exactly is she going to deal with?" Zhou Ze muttered to himself.

Immediately after, a scene flashed in Zhou Ze's mind: the young man eating porridge in the old Taoist priest's livestream.

Rongcheng,
冥店 (Underworld Store/Paper Incense Shop)?

Considering the little loli's reaction when he mentioned Rongcheng, it seemed quite possible.

But no matter what, he couldn't easily give up this temporary worker status. Living as an unregistered ghost was not comfortable.

Xu Qinglang went back to his shop, telling Zhou Ze "Happy Lantern Festival" as he left.

Zhou Ze was also tidying up, while instructing Bai Yingying to go out and buy him a few packs of cigarettes and some yuanzi (glutinous rice balls). He had to change his plans; he would go to the Confucius Temple tonight to chat with that dwarfish old man.

Just then, the bookstore door was pushed open, and a man in a white down jacket walked in.

"Brother A-Le! I'm here to pick up my dad from the hospital."

Zhou Ze paused, then began to ponder, roughly guessing the man's identity. He must be the son of his elder uncle, younger than him, and a paternal cousin to Xu Le. Xu Dachuan had come to the city to see him last time and suffered a minor fracture in a car accident on his way out. Zhou Ze had visited him once, and Dr. Lin had covered the medical expenses, so he hadn't paid much attention since.

"Hello," Zhou Ze responded somewhat coolly.

"Brother A-Le, I'm a bit short on cash lately. You see, my dad fell, and he'll need at least two months of recuperation at home; he can't go out and work to earn money."

The cousin smiled at Zhou Ze.

"I've already given Uncle some nutritional expenses," Zhou Ze had given some, but Xu Dachuan refused to accept them, so Zhou Ze secretly tucked them into his clothes.

"Hey, Brother A-Le, I recently started dating a new girlfriend, and I'm a little tight on cash. Brother, could you help your little brother out?" The cousin was asking directly.

"Business isn't good here," Zhou Ze had no intention of giving him money.

"Brother, that's not cool," the cousin said unhappily. "I was the one who helped you with that thing last time."

"What thing?"

"Brother, don't be ungrateful, forgetting about it after the job is done? I'm telling you, I'm not shamelessly asking for money; have I come to you to ask for money at all in the past six months? Last time, that driver promised he wouldn't spill the beans. Besides, he's been locked up for six months already and will be out in another half a year or so. He'd be stupid to blurt it out, right? He's definitely tight-lipped, or else it would have changed from illegal driving to intentional murder. Little brother is really short on cash this time, Brother. Just lend me a thousand or two; I'll pay you back when I have money, okay?"

Zhou Ze picked up the teacup on the counter. Hearing this, he suddenly frowned slightly and said, "What are you talking about? I don't understand."

"Brother, are you really planning to kick me to the curb after crossing the river?
Six months ago, you asked me to find a truck driver and pay him to deliberately run over that doctor,
You can't forget my contribution..."

"Crack..."

The glass cup in Zhou Ze's hand was directly crushed.

title: 第四十六章 憤怒和悲傷
content:
“Brother Ah Le?” The cousin watched Zhou Ze crush the glass and saw blood continuously dripping from Zhou Ze's palm. The cousin was so scared that he instinctively took several steps back.

“Brother Ah Le, if you’re short on money, just forget it, really, just forget it.” The cousin was clearly scared, his voice tinged with a slight sob.

They were like grasshoppers tied to the same rope, so there was no question of one threatening the other. Of course, he initially just wanted to leverage this favor for more money.

If he pushed his cousin too hard…

Yes, his cousin was the mastermind, and he?

He was also a participant, even acting as a go-between. His crime might not be lighter than his cousin’s. As for the truck driver, he was practically the killer.

So, he didn’t dare to push his cousin too hard. He was also afraid.

Zhou Ze finally understood why Xu Le had so little money after Zhou Ze’s soul possessed Xu Le’s body. The bookstore’s losses were one reason; the other was that Xu Le had spent most of his money on that matter.

How absurd,

How ridiculous,

In the end,

The cause of his own death turned out to be such a result.

Zhou Ze slumped back into the chair, looking at the glass shards stuck in his palm and his blood continuously dripping.

He didn’t try to stop the bleeding, nor did he feel much pain,

In fact, he found it quite interesting.

Even the most excellent black comedy couldn’t write the irony he was feeling right now, could it?

The man he had always thought was so cowardly,

So spineless,

So useless,

Even so humble that he felt a little pity for him,

Was actually the mastermind who hired someone to kill him!

Everything, in a circular fashion, seemed to have returned to a complete circle.

Yes,

You could say that karma is a bitch!

Yes,

You could interpret it as fate’s decree!

Yes,

You could cheer that heaven has eyes, that what goes around comes around!

But these were all the views of bystanders. From their perspective, they expected to see a story of evil conclude with a villain being punished and a good person being compensated.

This would make bystanders feel very secure and good,

Making them feel good during dinner and eat a few more bites of rice.

However,

Who could pay for his original life?

Zhou Ze slightly lowered his head. His body began to twitch slowly.

An intense feeling of anger began to consume his entire being.

Dr. Zhou,

Director Zhou,

He had walked out of the orphanage, every step fraught with thorns, every step difficult!

He had no connections, no background, yet he had climbed the ranks in the hospital system purely by his own effort and ability, adhering to his medical ethics while hoping to achieve greater success and a higher position.

He had been trembling with fear, walking on thin ice!

He had finally reached that position at that age,

He had finally made a name for himself in the field with his medical skills,

How much sweat had he poured into it?

Night after night, lying in bed, he would motivate and encourage himself,

Even, how many times had he bitten his teeth and swallowed his frustrations!

It’s all gone,

All gone!

All because of this bastard, this good-for-nothing,

He discovered his wife’s secret crush on him,

His own wife wouldn’t sleep with him,

He felt wronged,

He was angry,

He was indignant!

He wouldn’t reflect on why he had lost all dignity and willingly became a live-in son-in-law,

He wouldn’t reflect on why he was looked down upon everywhere,

He wouldn’t reflect on himself,

Nor would he introspect,

He directed his anger at himself!

If he truly had an illicit relationship with his wife, then it would be understandable,

But at that time, he had long forgotten the little intern girl he had mentored years ago!

He was completely unaware,

But on his way home from work, at a traffic light intersection where he was carrying a cake and gifts to celebrate Children’s Day with the kids at the orphanage,

That truck driver, who had been paid,

Simply stepped on the gas,

And directly crushed the life he had so hard fought for!

“Brother Ah Le, um, I’m leaving now. Please take care of yourself.”

The cousin didn’t dare to stay there any longer. He turned and pushed open the bookstore’s glass door, leaving. He still had to pick up his father from the hospital. Besides, with Zhou Ze in his current state, he was genuinely afraid of irritating his cousin, who usually seemed a bit sickly and gentle but could be terrifying when he got serious!

“I’m going to kill that guy, kill him! With the money I got from her, kill him AHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHH!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”

The cousin still remembered that evening half a year ago, when his cousin placed several stacks of money in front of him, his face contorted as he said those words.

This cousin, whom he had secretly ridiculed behind his back, thinking he was spineless, cowardly, even willing to marry into a wealthy family as a live-in son-in-law, so much so that his own children couldn’t even bear his surname,

On that dusk,

Completely changed the image he had of him in his mind.

Watching his cousin’s retreating back, Zhou Ze’s bleeding hand, his fingernails repeatedly growing out and receding.

Wisps of black energy continuously swirled around his fingertips.

Zhou Ze’s eyes also showed a violent intermingling of blood red and black light.

This was his enemy,

One of the masterminds who murdered him.

He wanted to keep this person forever,

He wanted Bai Yingying to treat this person as food, suck all the blood out of him, and turn him into a dried corpse!

But he, just walked away,

And Zhou Ze, from beginning to end,

Did not strike.

He didn't even stand up and shout “Stop.”

Reason,

This damned reason,

This desperate, almost maddening reason!

Zhou Ze knew he couldn’t kill him.

Even if he didn’t consider the other consequences of taking revenge as a ghost messenger,

Just speaking of killing him,

What would the driver in prison think after learning about it?

Would he think he was eliminating witnesses?

Then, would he have to kill that driver too?

Yes, the driver was the primary killer who murdered him!

It was that damned bastard who, that night, kept staring at him, then ran a red light at the intersection and intentionally hit him!

His cousin deserved to die,

And that driver deserved to die even more!

But if both of them were killed, no matter what method was used to hide or arrange an accidental scene,

The police would definitely find something unusual.

At that point, a clear line would emerge!

Actually,

The most crucial thing was that the person who truly spent money to hire a killer was the current Zhou Ze!

He was the true mastermind!

If he sought revenge and killed them, it would expose him.

They had already ruined his first life,

So,

Should he ruin the opportunity he had so painstakingly obtained through soul transference because of them?

Ruin himself,

His second life now?

Zhou Ze clenched his fists and slammed them heavily on the counter.

“Bang!”

A wave of dizziness,

Zhou Ze staggered, retreating several steps, his back against the corner of the wall, and slowly sat down.

His bloodied hands covered his eyes,

His other hand unconsciously scraped against the tile.

You are furious,

But you have no way to vent,

This,

Goddamn life!

This dog-day justice,

This utterly bastardly karma!

In my past life, I saved many people, and helped many people!!!

Tears streamed down Zhou Ze’s face,

Everyone has their moments of weakness. The only thing they can do is cover their tear-filled eyes with their hands;

Everyone also has moments when they curse heaven and earth and complain about injustice. Not everyone is a pure robot who can always calmly analyze themselves when facing difficulties.

In his previous life, Zhou Ze believed he had never done anything to be ashamed of. In his hands, many patients’ lives were saved, and many people’s lives and families were rescued by him.

He didn't let himself go, nor did he join the corrupt. Even with a strong ambition to climb and advance, he still adhered to his duties as a person and a doctor. Because of this, when he climbed, the difficulties he faced and the effort required were greater than those who were willing to humble themselves!

In the corner of the counter, there was a piece of ghost money,

It must have been one of the remaining pieces of paper he burned after returning that night.

As Bai Yingying said, ghost money given by the dead is equivalent to Yin virtue.

Heh,

Perhaps it was because heaven saw he had accumulated too much virtue in his previous life, so this life, it gave him compensation.

Allowing him to "reincarnate," directly having a beautiful wife, a bookstore, and even, to show its "enlightened ruler" wisdom,

Allowing him to come out of hell, his soul swaying on the roadside, on the verge of collapsing and dissipating,

And stumble upon Xu Le, who had been accidentally killed by a petty thief.

Allowing him to inherit Xu Le’s life.

Making this person, who was originally the mastermind behind his murder, pay the price that, in the eyes of Heaven, was deserved.

But… who asked Zhou Ze if he agreed?

So much so that,

He is now,

Unable to even exact revenge!

When that bastard walked up to him and talked about hiring someone to run over that doctor,

He could only sit there dejectedly,

Motionless!

The lingering glow of the setting sun,

Fell on the corners of the bookstore entrance,

Taking away today’s,

Last trace of warmth.

“Oh, right, I just developed a new strawberry juice. Do you want to try the flavor first so I can make some improvements?” Xu Qinglang pushed open the door and walked in, holding a wine glass.

Seeing Zhou Ze sitting in the corner, his hands covered in blood, he froze for a moment, then immediately put down the strawberry juice and ran over, crouching beside Zhou Ze.

“What happened to you?” Xu Qinglang asked.

“Why… this isn’t fair… no… this damned fairness.” Zhou Ze murmured to himself.

Xu Qinglang fell silent. He didn’t know what had happened to Zhou Ze to make him like this. The Zhou Ze he had always known was always very rational and composed, no matter what.

Even amidst his strictness and rigidity, he would occasionally crack jokes. He was a very disciplined person, but disciplined people, when they break down after a setback, are often more helpless.

At this moment, Zhou Ze made Xu Qinglang feel as if he was seeing himself that day when the little girl took his parents’ souls in the shop.

He complained about the unfairness,

Because the Zhou Ze next door was also a ghost,

But the little girl allowed his existence, while taking his parents’ souls instead.

Xu Qinglang sighed,

He reached out and put his arm around Zhou Ze’s shoulder, letting Zhou Ze’s forehead rest against his chest, and then echoed:

“Brother, I don’t know what happened, but I can empathize with your current emotions.

Even the greatest Chopin can’t play our sorrow.”

title: 第四十七章 得償所願！
content:
In her left hand, three packs of cigarettes; in her right, a bag of tangyuan.

On her back, a beautiful shoulder bag.

Bai Yingying wouldn't waste any opportunity Zhou Ze gave her to leave the bookstore. Heaven knows how she managed to buy a shoulder bag so quickly after purchasing cigarettes and tangyuan!

Pushing open the bookstore door,

Bai Yingying saw two men embracing. She immediately dropped her things and covered her eyes,

while simultaneously peeking through her fingers,

not forgetting to stomp her feet and coo shyly:

"Yingyingying,

did I come back at the wrong time?"

Xu Guiren—

oh, no,

Xu Qinglang glared back at Bai Yingying, a look of mournful charm that was almost dripping like summer dew.

This overwhelming sense of a maiden's resentment,

it was terrifying!

It made Bai Yingying wonder if she was the zombie, or if the noodle shop owner in front of her was the zombie.

"Did you get the stuff?" Zhou Ze stood up.

He straightened his clothes.

Xu Qinglang also stood up, pretending to button his shirt.

"Boss, it's all back," Bai Yingying answered obediently.

"Good, I'm going out for a bit."

Zhou Ze walked over, picked up the cigarettes and tangyuan, and said to Bai Yingying, "You watch the shop."

"Alrighty."

After Zhou Ze left the shop, Bai Yingying and Xu Qinglang stared each other down.

"What are you looking at, corpse?" Xu Qinglang said grumpily.

"If you kept hiding in the cabinet, I wouldn't be able to see you," Bai Yingying retorted.

"You're an ice cube, an ice cube! An ice cube that can freeze into a popsicle!"

Xu Qinglang continued his counterattack!

"Heh, your water passage is blocked,

taking the dry path makes you prone to encountering robbers and experiencing a bloody disaster."

Bai Yingying retaliated sharply.

"Hmph!"

"Hmph!"

The two parted ways unhappily. Xu Qinglang returned to his noodle shop, while Bai Yingying imitated Zhou Ze, sitting on the boss's chair behind the counter, pouring a cup of hot water, and then casually picking up a book, pretending to read it with an air of sophistication.

............

Zhou Ze intended to go to the Confucius Temple. No matter how much sorrow life throws at you, you always have to endure it first, and then continue living as you should.

It's like the last night of a short holiday, the thought of waking up early for work tomorrow is despair-inducing,

you want to give up, but you still have to set your alarm.

This is life. For some successful people, everyone is always eager to know the secret to their success, envying their current triumphs.

It's like when a pregnant woman has just given birth, friends and relatives come to congratulate her, but no one cares how many times she was fucked to get pregnant with this baby.

Crude words, but not unreasonable.

Zhou Ze could only comfort himself.

As for his so-called cousin and the truck driver, how to respond to them needed careful consideration. At the very least, Zhou Ze wasn't such a magnanimous person.

He couldn't be as arrogant and overbearing as that colleague in Rongcheng, but this matter involved his "murder case," so it definitely couldn't be brushed aside lightly.

He took out his phone, ready to call a taxi, but then he happened to see a WeChat message:

"What are you doing?"

It was a message from Doctor Lin.

Zhou Ze hesitated, and was also a little unsure. To be honest, his mood was complicated right now, because the reason Xu Le wanted to kill him was also because this beautiful female doctor had a secret crush on him.

Alright, being secretly liked by a beautiful woman,

being secretly liked by a beautiful... married woman,

being secretly liked by a beautiful, and still chaste, married woman,

was indeed something to be proud of.

But in his last life,

he was killed by her this way!!!!!

"In the shop." Zhou Ze still replied to the message.

He wasn't Xu Le, he wouldn't be so irresponsible. His and Xu Le's twisted karmic retribution had nothing to do with Doctor Lin.

And honestly, after discovering Doctor Lin's infatuation with him step by step after his death, it was impossible for him not to have a good impression of this woman.

Especially her confession at the hospital last week,

she was very scared,

and very flustered,

even her body was trembling,

but she still embraced him without hesitation.

Whether God was blind or not, Zhou Ze didn't know, but Doctor Lin's existence was indeed the biggest highlight in his life since his rebirth.

"I'm on the road outside your shop."

Zhou Ze looked up, scanning his surroundings, and indeed, he saw a white Maserati at the street corner.

The previous Cayenne had been scraped against a utility pole when he was driving that night. Clearly, Doctor Lin had gotten another car.

The scourge of materialism!

Zhou Ze walked over, opened the car door, and sat in the passenger seat.

Doctor Lin was a little reserved, and somewhat at a loss, but it was clear that she had come to see him with great courage.

After all, he was a ghost.

"Xu Le, he's already..."

Zhou Ze frowned slightly. He didn't want to hear anything about "Xu Le" right now.

"Don't mention him. Just pretend he never existed," Zhou Ze interrupted stiffly.

"Then... will that make you think... I'm a bad woman?" Doctor Lin asked.

Three obediences and four virtues,

although not as rigid and dogmatic, Doctor Lin was indeed deeply poisoned by feudal ideology due to her parents' influence.

Now her husband was Zhou Ze,

so what about the original Xu Le?

"Don't think too much."

Zhou Ze shook his head.

It was truly this comical:

When Doctor Lin realized Xu Le was Zhou Ze, her tone and demeanor became much softer, as if she had returned to her intern days, and Zhou Ze was still her teacher.

At that time, Zhou Ze was far from polite to his interns, male or female. He simply used them as "intern dogs," making them do all the dirty work, heavy lifting, and coffee runs.

And Zhou Ze, after the confession, gradually began to display that "superior" attitude in front of Doctor Lin.

His chauvinistic tendencies became increasingly apparent.

The one who is loved is always fearless.

"Okay." Doctor Lin nodded.

Then,

silence.

Zhou Ze didn't want silence. He looked at Doctor Lin and saw that she was wearing a pink down jacket and jeans today. While her figure was perfectly accentuated and her temperament made her look truly beautiful, Zhou Ze felt something was missing.

"Next time, wear stockings. I like to see women in stockings," Zhou Ze said.

Doctor Lin was stunned, her pretty face flushed.

She felt that she should be sad. After guessing that Xu Le was likely dead, as a wife, she should be grieving, not being teased by Zhou Ze in the car like this.

But that feeling of shame and annoyance made her unable to resist.

Perhaps,

she was actually a bad woman.

A bad woman who cheated emotionally.

Doctor Lin closed her eyes, resigned to her fate in her heart.

"I'm talking to you," Zhou Ze reminded her.

"Oh... okay," Doctor Lin replied, her face even redder.

Zhou Ze's lips curled into a smile.

He knew that his outrageous words were also partly a deliberate retaliation against Xu Le. Perhaps he wasn't a good man either.

Alright,

one person thought she wasn't a good woman, and the other thought he wasn't a good man.

In ancient times, they would almost be a replica of Pan Jinlian and Ximen Daguanren.

As for the Wudaliang in between,

who cared?

"Are you hungry?" Doctor Lin asked.

"No," Zhou Ze replied.

Then,

more silence.

Zhou Ze now genuinely felt that his being single in his previous life wasn't just because he was obsessed with work and had no time for anything else; it was probably because his emotional intelligence was inherently low.

It's normal to have awkward silences when talking to a strange girl,

but if you're still having awkward silences with your legal wife, there must be something wrong with you.

"Let's just live like this, okay? Don't tell anyone about my situation. Just pretend I'm... Xu Le," Zhou Ze said through gritted teeth, speaking those two words.

"Okay," Doctor Lin nodded. This was also what she wanted.

Everything, as before.

"But there's one thing I need to remind you."

"Yes?"

"In bed, you're only allowed to call me Zhou Ze." Zhou Ze picked at his ear with his pinky. "I don't want to suddenly hear you call out 'Xu Le.' When no one else is around, you can only call me by my name."

In bed?

Doctor Lin's heart suddenly skipped a beat.

Although she was already a married woman, she was still a virgin.

This kind of topic and innuendo,

was truly shameful!

But she still nodded as if by a ghost's impulse, softly responding,

"Okay."

Zhou Ze truly felt that Doctor Lin had a bit of Stockholm Syndrome.

If the original Xu Le hadn't been so timid, but instead simple and direct,

he might have gotten his wish, and it wouldn't have been so convenient for him.

But thinking about it from another perspective, if Xu Le had been simple and direct, he wouldn't have hated him and hired someone to kill him, right?

So, was it better to have a chaste Doctor Lin?

Or was it better for him to have lived in his previous life?

Which one was truly better?

Zhou Ze reached up and patted his forehead.

"What's wrong?" Doctor Lin looked at Zhou Ze with concern. "Is your body having some issues because of that matter...?"

Oh my goodness,

she used the honorific "您" (nín)!

Old Master Zhou felt a rush of self-importance.

This Doctor Lin might not just have Stockholm Syndrome; she might also be a masochist.

No,

wait a minute,

something felt off?

Body issues?

Zhou Ze immediately looked at Doctor Lin.

How could a man's body possibly have issues?

Impossible!

Zhou Ze looked at the car seat; it was a bit cramped in the front.

"Get out of the car," Zhou Ze said.

"Mm."

Though Doctor Lin didn't know what they were going to do, she still got out of the car.

Zhou Ze opened the back car door, pointed inside, and said, "Get in."

Doctor Lin, utterly bewildered, got in.

"I need to prove that I'm fine," Zhou Ze muttered to himself.

It was already dark,

and the area around his bookstore was deserted.

"Aren't you not feeling well?" Doctor Lin, sitting in the back seat, asked with a puzzled expression.

Zhou Ze's body stiffened.

She meant his inability to eat when she said he had body issues?

Phew...

He let out a long breath,

relieving the psychological pressure,

but he still had to charge ahead!

But Zhou Ze still said, "I need to prove that another aspect is also fine."

"What problem?" Doctor Lin still looked confused.

Then, Zhou Ze also climbed into the back seat,

and closed the car door.

It was very dark,

the car shook violently,

and they had a blast.

title: 第四十八章 三百年好品質
content:
"They're in the car."

At the bookstore entrance, Bai Yingying sat on a small stool, intently watching the Maserati in the distance.

"Oh, a Maserati's interior space isn't as big as a Cayenne's. I remember last time she drove a Cayenne, didn't she?"

Xu Qinglang also sat on a small stool at his noodle shop entrance.

"The Boss scraped it while driving; she probably got a new car."

Initially, both were busy with their own tasks, but the female corpse was no ordinary person. As someone who had lain underground for two hundred years, her hearing was incredibly sharp.

During those two hundred years, Madame Bai would occasionally visit her, chatting and telling her about the outside world, like close confidantes.

Hmm, much like college girls in a dorm might sometimes gather to discuss lengths and hardnesses,

Or perhaps watch educational action films from a certain Eastern country.

Because of this, even though the female corpse hadn't been out for two hundred years, she hadn't become out of touch with the times. When Madame Bai wasn't around, she would listen to the sounds from both underground and above, thus cultivating an incredibly terrifying sense of hearing.

Upon "hearing" that the plot seemed to be sliding in an indescribable direction, she immediately carried her stool over, while patting the wall, signaling Xu Qinglang next door to come out and watch the show with her.

It must be said that although the two usually bickered quite a bit, in crucial moments, they knew how to share.

"Oh, the Boss got out of the car," Bai Yingying whispered.

"Huh, that doctor also got out," Xu Qinglang narrated.

"Oh, the Boss opened the back car door," Bai Yingying continued to whisper.

"Huh, that doctor got into the back seat," Xu Qinglang continued to narrate.

"The car's shaking," Bai Yingying covered her mouth, her eyes fixed on the car without blinking.

"They must be having a blast," Xu Qinglang took a deep breath.

"The air is filled with a sour smell. Did your sour plum juice leak in the kitchen?" the female corpse waved her hand, covering her nose.

"Heh, bullsh*t. Come on, let's place bets. How long will it last?" Xu Qinglang checked his watch. "I bet ten minutes."

"Fifteen minutes!" the female corpse replied.

"One, two, three, four... eight, nine, ten seconds!"

*Pay attention,

Note the unit of time.*

"Huh, the car stopped shaking," the female corpse asked curiously.

"Did they change positions?" Xu Qinglang frowned; he refused to believe that terrifying conclusion!

"Ten seconds to change positions?" the female corpse giggled. "You're a greenhorn too, aren't you?"

The female corpse was experienced. Back in the day, Madame Bai and the impoverished scholar had trysts and stolen forbidden fruit; she had experience.

Xu Qinglang's expression was displeased. As a man with over twenty properties,

Was it not okay to take his first time a little more seriously?

"The car's moving again!" Xu Qinglang exclaimed.

"One, two, three, four... eight, nine, ten seconds!"

"The car stopped moving again," Bai Yingying sniffled. "Did they change positions again?"

"Did your boss never marry before?" Xu Qinglang frowned. "Wait, I think I looked up Zhou Ze's information. It said 'unmarried.' Could he be a virgin?"

"He probably hasn't married," Bai Yingying replied.

"That doctor's brows aren't open, and her legs are together; she should also be a virgin." Xu Qinglang slapped his forehead. "Hahahahaha, I'm dying of laughter. I get it. Two virgins, and their first time they're playing such high-level games."

Bai Yingying remained silent beside him.

"What's wrong?" Xu Qinglang asked.

"I remember when Madame and that scholar had their first time, the scholar seemed very experienced," Bai Yingying said with a hint of sadness.

"Ancient scholars were all cunning devils; they loved to trick you young ladies. In reality, they were all shameless old hands."

Xu Qinglang had a world-weary expression. "Holy sh*t, the car's moving again."

Ten seconds, stop.

Ten seconds, move.

Ten seconds, stop.

Ten seconds, move.

Every time the car moved, the female corpse and Xu Qinglang would tilt their heads; when it moved again, they'd tilt back.

Eventually, both felt their necks aching.

Finally, the back car door opened.

Zhou Ze and Doctor Lin got out, drenched in sweat, then both moved to the front seats.

"I don't get it," Xu Qinglang shook his head.

"Me neither," Bai Yingying also looked bewildered.

"Is Zhou Ze's rhythm different from ordinary people?" Xu Qinglang shook his head again.

"Perhaps," Bai Yingying guessed.

Finally,

The Maserati drove away,

The excitement ended.

Xu Qinglang and Bai Yingying exchanged a glance,

Each snorted,

And mentally scorned "hussy!"

Then, they each turned and left,

One to the kitchen,

One to read.

..................

"Huff... huff..."

In the passenger seat, Zhou Ze was panting heavily, his hair on his forehead soaked with sweat.

Doctor Lin drove the car, also with many beads of sweat on her, which added to her charm.

"I'm sorry, it's my fault. I wasn't attractive enough," Doctor Lin bit her lip, blaming herself. "I don't have experience; I don't understand this aspect, which made it... not enjoyable for you."

Zhou Ze leaned his head back and shook it.

"It's my fault. Given all that, it must be my fault."

Zhou Ze pulled out a tissue from the front and wiped his wet hair.

"We are both doctors. This matter, in fact, we both understand. It's on my end; I indeed have a problem," Zhou Ze took a deep breath, then exhaled heavily.

He now wished he could go straight back,

Grab Xu Qinglang,

And hang him from a tree to whip him a hundred times!

Just now,

Zhou Ze suddenly remembered what Xu Qinglang had said to him.

*You're using Xu Le's body,

So are you cuckolding Xu Le, or is Xu Le cuckolding you?

Your body is Xu Le's, your DNA is Xu Le's, and the child is Xu Le's.*

Normally, he wouldn't feel anything,

But at that moment,

Zhou Ze even found his own *thing* down there,

A bit disgusting, as if he was holding someone else's.

Under this psychological pressure,

After many attempts,

He finally surpassed Yu the Great in terms of achievement.

Utterly unenthusiastic!

"Give me some time," Zhou Ze lit a cigarette, then, thinking better of it, threw it out the window.

It wasn't that Zhou Ze felt it was impolite to smoke in a lady's car, but rather that he didn't feel he had the right to smoke a post-coital cigarette.

"Next time, I'll wear stockings," Lin Wanqiu said very seriously.

"Then that would completely prove it's my problem," Zhou Ze said with a wry smile, but looking at Doctor Lin's solemn expression beside him, Zhou Ze's heart softened instantly.

He even felt like he was being a jerk,

Having somewhat vented the anger he had just been enduring onto this woman.

"I'm sorry," Zhou Ze said inwardly.

Regardless of the complex hatred between Xu Le and himself, at least this woman was innocent, and her feelings for him were very pure.

In his previous life, he seemed very successful, but six months after his death, it seemed only she remembered him.

"Stop up ahead. You go back, get some sleep early tonight," Zhou Ze said.

"You should also rest early," Lin Wanqiu stopped the car.

Only after Zhou Ze got out did she drive away.

Zhou Ze had said before that their life rhythm would continue as before, as usual.

There was no way not to continue as usual; even if Zhou Ze was willing to go back and face his in-laws and even his sister-in-law's bitter faces,

He couldn't sleep in the same bed as Doctor Lin at night.

Was he supposed to ask Doctor Lin to sleep in the freezer with him?

He wouldn't freeze to death, but what about Doctor Lin?

Or call Bai Yingying over and have them all sleep together?

Zhou Ze wasn't that beastly.

Eating and sleeping, the two biggest things in life, were now restricted for him, making it really hard to let loose.

The Temple of Literature had long since closed. It wasn't like that "door-washing" incident when everyone vied to offer the first incense, with people bustling about.

Chinese people have always been quite pragmatic about ghosts and gods; of course, this seems to be a kind of advantage.

Zhou Ze opened the pack of cigarettes he brought.

Although there had been a little mishap in between, Zhou Ze still knew what he had to do.

No matter what, he couldn't just wait for the little loli to finish her business and then strip him of his temporary status, with his own fate depending on her mood.

One by one, the cigarettes were placed in a row on the ground. Zhou Ze lit them one by one, then arranged the tangyuan. After doing all this, Zhou Ze cupped his hands and called out to the front:

"Junior has brought some offerings to honor your elders; please show yourself."

After speaking, he waited for a long time, but there was still no sound.

Zhou Ze then took out another carton of cigarettes, preparing to light them, when he noticed the long row of cigarettes he had just lit suddenly extinguished themselves collectively.

Looking up, Zhou Ze saw the dwarf elder sitting on the mound in front, his pockets bulging, grinning from ear to ear.

"Young man, you're certainly being overly solicitous for no reason."

The dwarf elder had a gong on his back and a face full of wrinkles.

"Indeed, I have something to ask you," Zhou Ze's posture was very humble.

Someone capable of leading patrols by the Temple of Literature certainly wasn't a lonely ghost; he should be someone within the system. Therefore, he should know a lot about ghost messengers.

"Don't fret. Let this old man calculate," the elder pinched his fingers, looking at Zhou Ze meaningfully, pondering, "This old man has served at the Temple of Literature for sixty years, so I have some skill. I can certainly calculate what it is your heart desires and craves."

Zhou Ze listened, waiting quietly beside him.

Finally,

The elder slapped his thigh, saying:

"I've calculated it!"

"Please, senior, enlighten me," Zhou Ze asked respectfully.

How could he remove the "temporary worker" prefix from his ghost messenger status?

And what should his path be from here?

The elder chuckled, a look of "I've seen through your heart" on his face,

As if everything was within his grasp.

He slowly stroked his beard, saying, "The matter you crave most, this old man already knows.

Very well, seeing your meticulous etiquette this time, I shall point you to a clear path."

Zhou Ze waited attentively.

"Jiu Zhi Tang Concentrated Liuwei Dihuang Pills," the elder said.

"............" Zhou Ze.

"Hmm, no, that's not right? It shouldn't be. That stuff has good quality for three hundred years;

This old man even took it when I was young and alive, and it worked."

At this moment,

Zhou Ze suddenly wanted to strangle the smug old man in front of him.

title: 第四十九章 天乾物燥，小心火燭！
content:
"Uh, did I guess wrong?"

The dwarfish old man tilted his head.

"My cultivation has regressed again, oh dear."

The dwarfish old man pulled out a cigarette and started smoking it, looking very melancholic.

Zhou Ze calmed his emotions. He couldn't very well say, "You seem to have a point?"

"Senior, I came to ask about the Hellish Constables."

"Hellish Constables?" The dwarfish old man frowned. "Why are you, young man, asking about Hellish Constables? Those people are not easy to deal with. If you encounter them, you'd better steer clear.

You have a physical body and managed to come back to life. This is a great fortune; you should just secretly enjoy it."

The old man said, clearly puzzled.

Zhou Ze slightly frowned. This old man in front of him couldn't tell that he was a Hellish Constable?

Although he was a temporary worker, given the old man's previous divination skills, he was definitely not some half-baked practitioner, yet he couldn't detect Zhou Ze's Hellish Constable identity.

Did this mean that the little loli indeed treated him as a temporary worker, and besides the so-called "Gate of Hell," she actually withheld other important things from him?

Xu Qinglang once said that the loli came and went in a hurry, definitely not just to hand over duties. She simply had things to attend to and temporarily grabbed him to be a free laborer.

As for the reason she chose him, it was simple: she valued his non-troublemaking nature, that he wouldn't cause problems while subbing for her.

But this identity was something Zhou Ze had to grasp. His life had been ruined once, and this time, he had to completely control it. The Hellish Constable identity was the best protective charm, preventing him from becoming an unregistered ghost, living in perpetual fear.

Zhou Ze opened his palm to the old man, revealing the symbol.

The old man's expression immediately hardened, and his breathing paused for a moment. His eyeballs then darted around before he suddenly realized:

"I understand. That long-tongued girl pulled you in as a substitute."

The dwarfish old man paced back and forth on the mound with his hands behind his back, as if contemplating something. Zhou Ze stood quietly beside him, not interrupting.

Finally, the old man asked again, "You ask this old man about Hellish Constables, what is your intention?"

"To contribute my strength for the harmony of the underworld and the peace of the mortal realm."

"Oh." The old man shook his head, then nodded. "Heh, this old man knows what you want to do. You want to replace that long-tongued girl?"

Zhou Ze didn't refute him.

Not refuting meant acquiescence.

"There is a way, and it's very simple," the dwarfish old man pondered. "Considering you brought me so many gifts tonight, I'll tell you."

"I'm all ears."

"Inside the Confucius Temple, there live sages. The sages are above; humans walk the human path, and ghosts cross the Bridge of No Return. The sages see everything clearly.

Is that not right?"

"It is," Zhou Ze nodded.

"The long-tongued girl gave you this key, which is equivalent to half an identity, but she can take it away at any time." The dwarfish old man mused, "But as long as you enter the Confucius Temple, and I personally pray to the sages for you, and you then express your stance, make your promises, and show your determination before the sages.

That is to say, you repeat those pretty words you spoke earlier, but even prettier. As long as one of the sages nods, your identity will be solidified.

But there is one crucial point: the sages' gaze is like a torch, discerning everything. Should you harbor ill intent, or commit any outrageous acts in the future, then what will punish you, besides the laws of the underworld, will be the wrath of the sages!"

The dwarfish old man's expression was serious.

"It's that simple?" Zhou Ze asked in return.

"How difficult it is," the dwarfish old man sighed. "To gain the sages' favor and be granted an identity, this is merely one method, a method to just give it a try."

Zhou Ze nodded and said, "Then let's try it."

The dwarfish old man walked to the entrance of the Confucius Temple and blew a breath inside. A "click" sound came from behind the door, which seemed to be the latch of the large red wooden door falling into place.

"You go in first and speak well before the sage statues. Next, this old man will make the arrangements for you."

Zhou Ze reached out and pushed the door open, then looked at the dwarfish old man beside him. Seeing him standing still, he asked somewhat strangely:

"Senior, aren't you coming in with me?"

"You jest. I am but a lackey under the sages. How dare I idly wander before them? You have half an official status; you may enter."

Zhou Ze hesitated for a moment, then stepped inside.

The old man gently clapped his hands together, and the wooden door closed again.

"Speak well to the sages!"

Afterward, the old man took out another cigarette and put it in his mouth. He didn't need to light it; the cigarette spontaneously ignited.

After finishing one cigarette, the old man smiled, took out his gong, and struck it forcefully!

A crisp sound rang out.

The old man stretched his voice and shouted:

"Dry weather, beware of fire!"

Immediately after,

Another gong strike:

"Dry weather, beware of fire!"

The old man beat his gong and danced joyfully at the entrance of the Confucius Temple, much like a shaman performing a ritual in Northeast China.

His short stature made him appear even more endearing as he hopped.

"Kid, you continue to chat with the sage statues, express yourself more. This old man will help you reach heaven's ears!"

The dwarfish old man yelled into the Confucius Temple.

"Alright, thank you for your trouble, Senior."

Zhou Ze's voice came from behind the wall.

"No trouble, no trouble at all. Just bring me a few more packs of cigarettes and visit me occasionally in the future. This old man has no descendants left, and my incense offerings have ceased. It's difficult to even get a cigarette now.

There's no shortage of food and drink in the Confucius Temple, but I wouldn't dare touch anything from the Sage Lord's altar, not with ten guts."

The dwarfish old man burst into hearty laughter,

Then happily continued beating his gong.

"Dry weather, beware of fire!"

"Boom!" The gong rang!

"Dry weather, beware of fire!"

"Boom!" The gong rang.

Each gong strike was lower than the last,

At the same time, the dwarfish old man's club, which had been wrapped in white cloth, began to seep blood.

At first,

The blood was just faint specks, but with each gong strike, the blood spread.

It became thicker and more dazzling,

Until finally,

Every time the dwarfish old man struck, a large amount of blood spattered, staining his clothes and giving his formerly endearing appearance a touch of ferocity!

"Dry weather, be! ware! of! fire!"

"Boom!"

With the last gong strike,

The dwarfish old man threw the bloody red gong and drum into the Confucius Temple, and at the same time, he shouted at the top of his lungs:

"Sages, open your eyes! Evil spirits, face judgment!"

After shouting that last phrase,

The old man was shocked as if struck by lightning. His body became much blurrier than before, even showing signs of dissipating.

But he still laughed wildly, and at the same time, he shouted inside:

"Do you feel good? Do you feel good now?"

"No, I don't."

Zhou Ze's voice came from behind the wall.

"It's good that you don't feel good, young man! This old man will teach you today what it means for things to be impermanent and for hearts to be unpredictable!

A human's heart is separated by their belly, let alone a ghost's!

This old man will sacrifice sixty years of meritorious service as an attendant to have the sages kill you!"

"Do I... have a feud with you?"

Zhou Ze's voice came from the other side of the wall, full of confusion.

"A feud? Of course, there's a feud!" The dwarfish old man's body flickered, but he continued to shout, "This old man doesn't want to reincarnate, doesn't want to enter the cycle of rebirth, doesn't want to go to the next life!

Night and day, I serve this Confucius Temple, waiting on these ancestors,

All for,

Is it not to accumulate some yin virtue for my descendants and bless them?

My lineage suffered from wicked deeds committed by my ancestors, leading to sparse offspring. That's why I was forced to stay here, only wishing for the continuous flow of incense!

But a year ago, my last descendant, my only descendant, died!

What meaning does my sixty years of humble service have then?"

The dwarfish old man cried out,

"Is it fun to be with these clay statues every day?

Hahaha, Heaven has eyes! That day during the 'door-opening' ritual, when I just glanced at you and borrowed a cigarette from you.

I didn't see anything at all then.

But just now, when I properly calculated, to hell with your Liu Wei Di Huang Wan!

You made this old man realize that your death is inextricably linked to the demise of my last descendant!

This is the cause you created, and today, you will face the consequence!

This old man will trade sixty years of meritorious service for your soul to scatter!

You're worth it! You're not losing out!"

"That descendant of yours, did he die on the operating table?" Zhou Ze asked from behind the wall.

"No, he didn't die on the operating table; he died in a car accident."

The dwarfish old man wiped away tears. Although his figure was much blurrier, his tears seemed to have red specks.

"I wasn't a driver in my last life."

Zhou Ze wanted to add that he was also killed by a car in his previous life.

"That drunk driving bastard, he should have died, his lifespan should have ended, but you forcefully saved him on the operating table, propping him up for half a month!

Finally, his time came, and he died in a drunk driving accident, but he also dragged my lovely great-great-great-grandson with him in the crash.

Tell me,

Isn't this your karma?

Isn't this the evil you created?

Isn't this the debt you owe?!"

"Your thought process is truly powerful," Zhou Ze marveled.

The dwarfish old man, who was slowly recovering from his initial vengeful exhilaration, suddenly discovered an extremely strange thing. Logically, by sacrificing sixty years of his attendant's merit to make a sage in the Confucius Temple open his eyes once.

According to the usual temperament of those clay sages, who were extremely lazy on weekdays, any ghost in front of them, even a legitimate Hellish Constable, would be suppressed and killed if they opened their eyes, let alone Zhou Ze, who wasn't legitimate.

Zhou Ze, at this moment, should have his soul shattered, his spirit dispersed, and be suffering immense pain under the sage's gaze, shouldn't he?

Why did he respond with such a relaxed tone every time?

This wasn't right.

Something wasn't right!

"How can you be fine? How can you be fine?!"

The dwarfish old man suddenly roared,

He had sacrificed sixty years of his attendant's merit, all at once!

Zhou Ze walked out from behind the wall,

Looking at the dwarfish old man.

The temple of the Confucius Temple was surrounded by a rectangular wall. When Zhou Ze spoke earlier, he was standing outside the wall, so when the dwarfish old man stood at the main entrance, it sounded as if Zhou Ze was speaking to him from inside the temple.

The dwarfish old man was struck as if by lightning, looking in disbelief at Zhou Ze, who had appeared outside the Confucius Temple,

"How are you outside? How did you get out?"

Zhou Ze gestured with his chin towards the back, saying:

"You've been working at this establishment for so long,

And you don't know there's a back door?"

title: 第五十章 那一雙……赤紅的眼眸！
content:
"You've been messing around in this unit for so long, and you don't even know that you can actually use the back door here?"

The "back door" here doesn't refer to the unwritten rules of social connections, but rather that the Temple of Confucius, besides its front gate, indeed has a back door.

In this world, there is no love without reason, and pies falling from the sky can kill people according to physics.

If the dwarfish elder had just given him a few pointers and said some mysterious, veiled words, imitating Patriarch Bodhi tapping Sun Wukong three times on the back of the head, Zhou Ze might have pondered it carefully and found it more realistic and reassuring.

But the strange thing was that the dwarfish elder was simply too enthusiastic, so enthusiastic that Zhou Ze found it unreal.

Had ghosts recently started a trend of learning from Lei Feng and doing good deeds?

Especially after the elder refused to enter the Temple of Confucius with him, Zhou Ze became a bit more cautious. The Temple of Confucius wasn't very big; Zhou Ze went in through the main gate and immediately came out through the back door and circled around.

Facts proved that Zhou Ze's choice was correct.

As the elder himself said, hearts are separated by stomachs, let alone ghosts?

Furthermore, what Zhou Ze found somewhat absurd was that the reason the elder wanted revenge on him was because of that...

He had saved a patient, and half a month later, that patient got into a car accident due to drunk driving, causing the dwarfish elder's grandson to also die in the accident.

The dwarfish elder actually blamed Zhou Ze, believing that if he hadn't tried his best to save that patient's life, his grandson wouldn't have died.

What a peculiar way of thinking.

"I was a doctor in my previous life; healing the sick and saving lives is my duty," Zhou Ze smiled. "I don't believe I did anything wrong. Your hatred for me, even to this extent, is really unreasonable.

Perhaps, you just feel that your descendants have been cut off, that you've wasted sixty years* serving these clay figures, and it's all come to nothing, so you have resentment in your heart and want to find someone to vent it on, and you chose me?"

The dwarfish elder stared fiercely at Zhou Ze, licked his lips, and said hoarsely:

"This is the evil you created! Why did you save someone who should have died!"

"In a doctor's eyes, only those who die after full treatment are truly dead. I don't accept your reason, and that so-called karma is utter nonsense."

If everything the people he saved did had to be attributed to him, wouldn't that be a global absurdity?

Zhou Ze remembered reading in a British veteran's memoir that during World War I, he personally captured the Fuehrer and had the chance to turn a blind eye and shoot that little man, but he didn't and took him as a prisoner of war.

Does that mean all the evils committed by the Third Reich later should be attributed to that British veteran?

Zhou Ze shook his head. There was no reasoning with this guy. The next moment, Zhou Ze's fingernails began to lengthen, and black energy swirled around his fingertips.

"Are you going to eliminate the young ones and take out the old ones in one swoop too?" the dwarfish elder said exasperatedly. "This is the Temple of Confucius, the resting place of sages. Even proper ghost messengers wouldn't dare to be presumptuous here!"

"Fuck you."

Zhou Ze walked directly toward the dwarfish elder,

"I only adhere to one principle: you just tried to kill me, so now I'm going to kill you!

It's inconvenient to get revenge for past lives, but if I let go of the current grudge, then Zhou Ze's temper would be too good!

I can't deal with living people for now, but can't I deal with ghosts?

The dwarfish elder tried to run away, but Zhou Ze's hand directly grabbed him and then yanked him violently backward!

"Whoosh!"

The dwarfish elder let out a scream, and his body became even more transparent.

"I don't want to go to hell, I don't want to go to hell! Sage, save me, save me!"

Unfortunately,

The clay figures in the Temple of Confucius remained motionless. If they truly had spirits, how could they allow the dwarfish elder's family to completely lose their incense and lineage?

"Who said I was sending you to hell?" Zhou Ze smiled. "Do you think you still have a chance to go to hell?"

After saying that, Zhou Ze thrust forward, then spread his hands. The pent-up malice in his heart erupted at this moment, and the dwarfish elder's soul body disintegrated directly!

It was very simple,

And very decisive.

Before dealing with Bai Yingying, Zhou Ze didn't know he was so capable;

And now, he had a very solid confidence in his own strength, especially his ability against ghosts, though the dwarfish elder's easy defeat was also largely due to his soul body being weakened by sacrificing sixty years of devoted service.

Zhou Ze didn't know if doing this would have any side effects, nor was he sure if not even giving the old man a chance to go to hell complied with the little loli's "know your limits" route.

But if he kept holding back like a turtle, he felt he'd eventually cause himself problems.

Dusting off his shoulders, Zhou Ze pulled out his phone and hailed a taxi.

After getting in, the driver was very friendly and even offered Zhou Ze a cigarette, which made Zhou Ze feel a bit "flattered" for a moment. Then, while smoking and chatting casually with the driver,

He secretly used the burning cigarette tip to touch the car door,

The car door wasn't burned through.

Zhou Ze felt at ease. The last paper car incident had truly exhausted him.

When he returned to the bookstore, it was already past one in the morning. Bai Yingying was sitting behind the counter, looking at the computer and awkwardly operating the mouse.

Zhou Ze showered and changed, preparing to go upstairs to rest, when he saw Bai Yingying still sitting motionless behind the computer.

How was he supposed to sleep if she didn't go up?

Zhou Ze walked behind Bai Yingying and found that this female corpse was actually playing a single-player game of Beach Head 2000, playing very excitedly.

"Time to rest," Zhou Ze reminded her.

"Oh," Bai Yingying responded, not fully comprehending.

"I said, time to rest," Zhou Ze emphasized his voice.

"Oh, okay!" Bai Yingying stuck out her tongue, exited the game, and then obediently went upstairs.

There were two straw mats on the second floor. The freezer had temporarily been moved to a corner. With one straw mat each, if an outsider accidentally came upstairs, they might think there were two corpses lying on straw mats.

"Boss, you must be tired today, right?" Bai Yingying asked tentatively.

Zhou Ze didn't reply. He didn't want to talk much about what happened tonight, especially his multiple instances of passing by his own home without entering; there was really nothing to brag about.

Seeing Zhou Ze ignore her, Bai Yingying obediently closed her eyes. A faint chill began to emanate from her, lowering the surrounding temperature and allowing Zhou Ze's mind to slowly relax.

Hmm,

Time to sleep.

…………

"Gurgle... gurgle... gurgle..."

Like the sound of boiling water,

Zhou Ze slowly opened his eyes and found himself floating on a pond. Hot air billowed around him, like lying in a large public bath.

In the distance, there was a very wide but also muddy road, and groups of white figures were moving along the road numbly.

This place was so familiar.

Zhou Ze slowly sat up, realizing that he could actually sit on the water surface without sinking.

"You've come too."

A man's voice sounded beside Zhou Ze.

Zhou Ze abruptly turned his head and saw a young man wearing a hoodie standing beside him.

Beside the hooded man, there was a small, crouching figure, like a cat.

The man had his hoodie pulled up, so his face wasn't clear, but he gave Zhou Ze a very familiar feeling.

However, Zhou Ze couldn't remember who he was for a moment.

"Don't be nervous, this is a dream," the hooded man said. "Just like Zhuang Zhou dreaming of a butterfly, for us dead people, dreaming of hell is quite common."

"Who are you?" Zhou Ze asked.

"Does a name mean anything here?"

The man retorted.

Zhou Ze was momentarily speechless. Indeed, the hooded man had made it clear: only the dead would dream of hell. Everyone was already dead; what was the point of exchanging names?

"They're coming for me," the hooded man said.

"Coming for you?" Zhou Ze was startled. "Coming for you back to hell?"

"Heh..." the hooded man chuckled.

Immediately after, the hooded man turned to leave, and the cat beside him slowly followed him.

Suddenly, something clicked in Zhou Ze's mind, and he immediately said, "Are you that person from Rongcheng?

The employee of the old Daoist's underworld shop?"

The hooded man stopped, turned his head, and looked at Zhou Ze, "Employee?"

"Is... isn't that right?"

"If it is, it is. You know that old Daoist?" the other party asked.

"Something like that," Zhou Ze responded.

"Oh," the hooded man said, then pointed around. The white mist around them grew thicker. He said, "The dream is about to end."

"This is my first time having a dream like this," Zhou Ze said.

"You'll get used to it," the hooded man seemed to want to say a few more words because of Zhou Ze's connection with the old Daoist, no longer in a hurry to leave. He pointed to the pond water beneath their feet. "Do you remember this pond?"

Zhou Ze looked down at his feet and nodded.

"Go down!"

The hooded man walked to Zhou Ze's side, placed a hand on Zhou Ze's shoulder, and then both of them sank into the pond water.

The pond water was incredibly clear, and visibility was high underwater.

"Did you notice anything missing?" the hooded man asked.

"That... that woman... she's gone."
