Zhou Ze looked around the pond and found the problem: the faceless woman he had encountered the first time he went to hell was gone!

"Oh," the hooded man responded. Immediately after, Zhou Ze saw two reddish glows appear beneath the man's hood—his eyes.

Blood-red eyes!

In an instant, an overwhelming sense of dread began to wash over him.

A terrifying sense of crisis suddenly descended,

Zhou Ze's fingernails also grew long, and a black halo appeared in his eyes.

"What are you going to do?" Zhou Ze asked cautiously.

The hooded man smiled and pointed at him, "Look at yourself."

Zhou Ze lowered his head and looked at himself,

He was astonished to find that

His body was entwined with layer upon layer of black hair. He hadn't even noticed when this hair had appeared.

"She's already come for you," the hooded man reminded him.

…………

The morning sun felt warm and comforting. Xu Qinglang brewed a cup of tea, moved his rattan chair to the shop entrance, and basked in the sun. At this time, no one would be ordering takeout, so he was content with the leisure.

A taxi stopped at the intersection ahead, and a high school-aged girl got out.

The girl was very pretty, with a slightly chubby face, already half-grown into a beauty.

The girl walked to the bookstore door. Seeing it locked, she immediately kicked the door:

"Xu Le, you bastard, get out here!"

But there was no reaction.

Xu Qinglang took a sip of tea and said, "What do you need him for?"

"My sister's been on sick leave at home for over a week, cooped up in her room every day, not eating or drinking. It must be that bastard Xu Le who made my sister angry again!

I'm here to make him come back today and apologize to my sister."

"Your sister?" Xu Qinglang figured it out. "Your sister must have been very tired last night."

"What do you mean by that?" the younger sister asked with a frown.

"Nothing. Adults' romantic matters, children shouldn't interfere. Just manage your own little boyfriend," Xu Qinglang said in a lecturing tone.

"You're so weird. Don't think just because you're handsome I won't hit you!

Our family matters, it's none of your business!"

The younger sister raised her hand, indicating she was really going to hit him!

Xu Qinglang "hmph"-ed, saying leisurely, "Don't worry, your sister and brother-in-law's relationship is fine."

Actually, there was something Xu Qinglang didn't say, but thought to himself: that Doctor Lin seemed like a very traditional woman, who knew she could be so open-minded.

The speed at which she overcame her inner struggles and embraced a new life was astonishingly fast.

Tsk, tsk,

Indeed, the power of love is truly immense and inexplicable. Throughout history, how many lovesick men and women have become moths drawn to this flame called love?

"What do you mean by that?"

"Nothing. Never mind, let me give you a small piece of advice: tell your sister that her Cayenne has more space than that white Maserati, so it's more comfortable for doing things inside."

"Maserati?" the younger sister asked, puzzled.

"Yeah, isn't it your sister's new car?"

"My sister hasn't left the house for over a week. Where would she get a new car, and a Maserati at that?"

The younger sister looked at Xu Qinglang in confusion, then seemed to realize something and suddenly kicked the bookstore door again:

"Alright, Xu Le, I get it now!

You eat my family's food,

Use my family's things,

The money for this bookstore also came from my sister,

And now you're too confident, you've found another rich woman, haven't you?

And that rich woman drives a Maserati to meet you, right?

Xu Le, that's called biting the hand that feeds you, you're heartless!"

"Slap!"

A crisp sound echoed,

The younger sister jumped in surprise,

Turned her head to look at Xu Qinglang, who was lying in the rattan chair beside her,

It was the sound of Xu Qinglang's water cup falling.

Xu Qinglang's mouth hung open, his face filled with horror,

Then he suddenly leaped out of the rattan chair,

And furiously kicked the bookstore door:

"Damn it,

Wake up, you bastard,

What the hell are you still sleeping for,

You really did something ghostly that night!"
***
**Translator's Notes:**
* "一甲子" (yī jiǎ zǐ) literally means "one sexagenary cycle," which is 60 years.

title: 第五十一章 鬼涎香
content:
Not long after Xu Qinglang kicked the door, Zhou Ze came down and opened the bookstore. His forehead was sweaty, and he looked a bit tired, as if he hadn't rested well.

To be honest, he had just woken up himself, but not naturally as usual; he had been startled awake.

The last image in his dream, those black strands of hair wrapped around his body, still made his scalp tingle even now, recalling it.

"Xu Le!"

The sister-in-law stood with her hands on her hips, in a posture that demanded an explanation!

Zhou Ze nodded at Xu Qinglang, motioning for him to come in. Then, in front of his sister-in-law outside, Zhou Ze locked the bookstore door again, isolating her outside.

The sister-in-law looked incredulous.

Xu Le actually dared to ignore her!

The young girl's princess temper flared up. She had come this time to demand an explanation for her sister and had even learned about the Maserati woman from Xu Qinglang. How could she just leave?

Fine, you lock the door, do you?!

The sister-in-law bent down, found a larger stone on the ground, and prepared to smash the glass door. But just as she was about to take a running start, Zhou Ze, inside the bookstore, turned and glanced at her.

At this moment, black light swirled in Zhou Ze's eyes.

The sister-in-law shivered, stumbling back several steps, and instinctively clamped her legs together.

The scene from that night in the bathroom, when she was scared, resurfaced in her mind.

That night,

She had been so scared she wet herself.

"Xu Le, you... you just wait!"

The sister-in-law uttered one last threat, then left in a panic, silently blaming herself for meddling. She should just go home and tell her parents about all this.

She would say that their obedient son-in-law, whom they had chosen themselves, had another woman outside!

…

Inside the bookstore, after Xu Qinglang entered, he had been organizing his words, swallowing his saliva. He had seen his share of big scenes, but at this moment, he still felt a deep sense of lingering fear.

Because at that time, neither he, nor the female corpse, nor Zhou Ze, had recognized the true identity of that woman!

This was too terrifying,

And it made one deeply ponder!

It was like watching those impressionists on variety shows imitating celebrities singing; you might find it quite interesting.

But suddenly, someone imitated your parents, your husband, or your wife, and lived with you, yet you remained completely unaware.

How terrifying would that be!

"Last night, the one who came in the Maserati wasn't Doctor Lin, wasn't your wife!

Your wife didn't change cars at all. She took leave from work after you confessed to her."

Xu Qinglang finally spoke.

Zhou Ze's pupils constricted slightly.

He didn't say anything but sat down on the chair behind the counter.

In his dream, the man in the hoodie from Rongcheng had already given him a warning, so even though he was indeed surprised by Xu Qinglang's words now, he could still handle it.

"How can you be so calm?" Xu Qinglang asked, somewhat strangely. "Or do you know who that woman is?"

Zhou Ze shook his head, "At the time, I really had no idea. I thought it was Doctor Lin.

But thinking back now, many things don't add up.

She suddenly came to me, seemingly having accepted everything.

I suddenly became very proactive and impulsive.

She was also very cooperative, every movement, though appearing shy and hesitant, perfectly managed to stir the most sensitive part of a man's heart."

"What kind of ghost was that?" Xu Qinglang pursed his lips and asked again, "Which kind of ghost?"

"A woman from the Yellow Springs Road in Hell who likes to dance with both hands in the pond. This woman has no face."

Upon saying this,

Zhou Ze suddenly felt a sense of realization.

The Faceless Woman,

Those who saw her appearance always found her facelessness horrifying and bizarre,

But they overlooked that,

She had no face,

Because she had the ability to transform into any face she needed!

This was the essence of being faceless.

From nothing, something can be created!

"The Faceless Woman?" Xu Qinglang frowned. "I think I read about her in a Qing Dynasty ghost story. It's said she's a ghost formed from the resentment of the deceased on the Yellow Springs Road, always waiting for a chance to return to the mortal realm."

"Something like that," Zhou Ze nodded, adding, "Find that ghost story, and let me read it too."

"I'll look for it when I get back. It's something I read as a child, so I probably won't find it.

By the way, did you have a relationship with that female ghost?

Just as you said, she came to you to seduce you, right?"

"No." Zhou Ze shook his head, picked up the new teacup on the counter, and took a sip of tea.

He said gravely, "At the last moment, I sensed something was wrong.

I beat a retreat."

Zhou Ze couldn't admit that it was because Xu Qinglang, that damn bastard, had talked to him so much that afternoon about body, soul, DNA, and being cuckolded, causing him to have a psychological block and thus preventing him from being successfully seduced.

In fact, Zhou Ze himself was baffled. His bookstore mostly stocked online novels and physical books, with plenty of rebirth and transmigration stories.

In those books, it was normal for protagonists to have children, and it seemed natural, without any sense of incongruity.

Why, when it came to him acting out the plot of a novel, were there so many complications?

Was he...

Too idle?

No, Xu Qinglang should be the idle one.

Only this buffoon would be so bored as to help him analyze and ponder such philosophical questions.

But it seemed he couldn't blame Xu Qinglang. If Xu Qinglang hadn't said those things to him that afternoon, he would probably have already sealed the deal.

And the consequences would be severe.

If someone was fishing, and he bit the hook, his fate would be to become meat on the chopping block.

"She failed?" Xu Qinglang asked.

"Mm." Zhou Ze nodded.

"Then why did she target you?"

"Maybe she's not like that Madam Bai, who values matching status," Zhou Ze chuckled.

"......" Xu Qinglang.

"It's probably out of jealousy. Because I could come back, and she couldn't. And now, I have a physical body and a new life," Zhou Ze speculated.

"She's back now too, and clearly, her target is you," Xu Qinglang analyzed. "This means her return isn't so pure; there might be other restrictions."

"For example, for some special purpose, someone intentionally allowed her to return?" Zhou Ze considered the problem from a different angle.

"I always feel like you know something, so, am I worrying for nothing? Do you actually have everything under control?"

"I found out in a dream."

"Do you think I'm stupid enough to believe such nonsense?" Xu Qinglang retorted.

Zhou Ze gently rubbed his forehead.

The little loli hastily handed over the Ghost Catcher's duty to him, and the Faceless Woman was released from Hell.

It was highly likely that this was to catch the man from Rongcheng, the one who had warned him in his dream.

But that Faceless Woman clearly intended to use her official duties to carry out some personal schemes.

For example,

To set him up?

"Anyway, for now, I'll try not to leave the bookstore until this blows over."

"That's understandable." Xu Qinglang nodded, then leaned closer and said to Zhou Ze, "Hey, do you still have issues with the body and DNA stuff?"

Zhou Ze shook his head, "Am I that boring?"

"Actually, it's easy to get over this. DNA is just a code, but offspring are also the crystallization of one's soul. Anyway, I can't explain this topic clearly.

In short, even normal people who haven't transmuted or possessed bodies, whose children with their wives might not even be their own,

You don't need to care too much about this."

"I never realized you were so good at comforting people," Zhou Ze stood up and said to Xu Qinglang, "Come with me to the bathroom."

Xu Qinglang followed Zhou Ze to the bathroom.

Zhou Ze directly took off his jacket and the clothes underneath.

"You need to exercise more," Xu Qinglang shook his head, looking very displeased.

Just then, the female corpse came down the stairs. The bathroom was next to the staircase, and Bai Yingying immediately saw the two men together in the bathroom!

"Oh, I suddenly realized I haven't had enough sleep yet."

Feigning a yawn, Bai Yingying pretended to go back upstairs to rest, not wanting to disturb the two men's private time downstairs.

"Bring the first-aid kit from upstairs and get some gauze and antiseptic ready," Zhou Ze said to Bai Yingying.

"Got it, Boss."

Bai Yingying hurried upstairs to get the items, thinking to herself, *Are the boss and them going to be that intense?*

*They're preparing for blood already?*

"What exactly are you doing?" Xu Qinglang crossed his arms, looking at Zhou Ze, with obvious distaste in his eyes.

Zhou Ze smiled, "You're clearly not gay, so why do you usually act that way?"

"It's for the fun of life, don't you get it?" Xu Qinglang pointed at Zhou Ze's abdomen, "Even if it's someone else's body, you should still exercise more. Look at this flab, tsk, tsk, disgusting."

Zhou Ze's fingernails immediately grew long.

Xu Qinglang froze for a moment.

*Shit,*

*I just made fun of your body, is that really worth getting so angry about?*

However, in the next moment, Zhou Ze directly used his index fingernail to lightly slice downwards from his jawline. A streak of blood slowly appeared, and beads of blood seeped out.

At the same time,

From Zhou Ze's neck to his abdomen, lines of black powder appeared. These powders were like the chalk lines used by carpenters, very fine, and previously invisible.

As the fingernail passed, these chalk lines also fell off.

Zhou Ze let out a long breath,

Looking at himself in the mirror, and the long bloodstain on his chest.

"What is this?"

Xu Qinglang held his breath, bending down to examine the fallen black powder.

"It's hair," Zhou Ze replied.

Hair wrapped around,

His soul.

"Boss, I'm coming in." Bai Yingying walked into the bathroom with the first-aid kit. When she saw the black powder on the floor, a strange look immediately appeared on her face, saying:

"Boss, are these things you use for foreplay?"

"Do you recognize this?" Xu Qinglang pointed to the black powder.

"This is Ghost Saliva Incense. It's resentment formed from ghosts over a hundred years old. My Madam used to have some too."

"Tell me the effects," Xu Qinglang asked.

"It incites a person's impulses. For example, if you want to do something, and you also inhale this stuff, it can make you ten or even a hundred times more eager to do that thing."

Upon hearing this, Xu Qinglang's mouth twisted into a smile, then he glanced at Zhou Ze.

He chuckled:

"Old Zhou, is this Faceless Woman trying to breed with you?"

title: 第五十二章 有辱斯文！
content:
Zhou Ze didn't believe the Faceless Woman would do anything evil. Her restrictions would only be more numerous than his, otherwise she wouldn't have needed to "disguise" herself as Dr. Lin to get close to him.

It was just that being targeted by someone like her was truly uncomfortable.

She could become a security guard in a mall, a bus driver, an old granny by the roadside waiting for you to help her up,

or a caring big sister in an alley calling you in for tea.

As long as you had a social network, as long as you needed to go out, she had the ability to approach you, and you had to be constantly ready for an ambush from anyone around you.

What exactly she wanted from him, Zhou Ze didn't understand, but judging from many examples in supernatural novels where female ghosts liked to absorb men's yang essence to replenish themselves, the Faceless Woman probably had nothing more than these few motives.

Or, she wanted his body?

Or, she wanted his current temporary employee qualification?

Zhou Ze wasn't sure if the little loli knew about this, but even if she did, she probably wouldn't intervene, because it was very likely that the Faceless Woman was deliberately released by the little loli's group of ghost-catchers to help them with things.

The Faceless Woman hadn't directly attacked him, perhaps because she had other concerns. Of course, looking at the now incredibly well-behaved Bai Yingying, perhaps the Faceless Woman was also very wary of his fingernails.

When he first entered the Underworld, the Faceless Woman wanted to keep him, but he managed to escape by injuring her with his fingernails. Perhaps that incident indeed left a deep impression on her, forcing her to use a honey trap to deal with him.

But one thing also made Zhou Ze a little sad:

Ghost Drool Incense,

ten or a hundred times the urge,

yet he was still able to restrain himself.

Zhou Ze felt no pride in his strong willpower,

only a faint, elusive melancholy.

Sitting at the counter, casually flipping through some books, Zhou Ze also searched online for information about the Faceless Woman, to see if he could find any valuable clues.

He didn't find any valuable information, but he did find Stephen Chow's movie "Forbidden City Cop."

Then Zhou Ze and Bai Yingying spent half the afternoon rewatching the movie.

There was a villain BOSS in it who also had no face and could transform into other people.

After the movie, it was already evening. Zhou Ze motioned for Bai Yingying to open the shop door.

Bai Yingying hesitated and said, "Boss, aren't you afraid she'll come again?"

"Are we not doing business?" Zhou Ze retorted, "Or can you contribute some burial goods for me to exchange for money to
circulate the shop's funds?"

The female corpse pouted and still went to open the door.

She was rich. When Madam Bai was buried, she was at least a rich young lady, so she should have had a lot of burial goods. Plus, Madam Bai had stayed in the human world for two hundred years, and she couldn't have taken those *mammon* into the Underworld, so they were naturally left behind.

Seeing how many bags Bai Yingying had bought during her limited few outings, Zhou Ze knew well enough.

At first, Zhou Ze suspected that the female corpse might have stolen money from the shop to spend, but later, when Zhou Ze found that all the money in the shop combined wasn't enough for the price of a few of her bags, he stopped suspecting.

Madam Bai, in her time, had wanted Xu Qinglang, who owned more than twenty *yang houses*, to marry her in an eight-person sedan chair.

Bai Yingying was obsessed with brand-name handbags.

This was definitely not good news for single people in the world, meaning that even after you died and became a ghost, it was still tough.

Soon after the shop door opened, while Zhou Ze was just making a cup of tea, a middle-aged man walked into the shop.

Bai Yingying stood still, staring at him.

Zhou Ze also subconsciously looked at him. Although his rationality told him it was unlikely the Faceless Woman would be so eager to change into another appearance and come back, he always had to be wary.

The middle-aged man was wearing a leather jacket that was faded in many places, and on his feet, he had a pair of somewhat old leather shoes. His trousers were casual pants, not very flashy.

On his head, he wore a tall hat, which looked a bit comical.

The middle-aged man walked to the bookshelf, subconsciously rubbing his hands, ready to find a book to read. But as he looked left and right, his brows furrowed deeper and deeper, and he complained:

"Boss, your place is all novels and other random stuff. Don't you have any other readable books?"

"Here they are."

Zhou Ze motioned for Bai Yingying to move the box from behind the counter.

Bai Yingying did as told.

The man squatted down and continued to choose books from the box. He flipped through several, and the covers were all indecent.

For example, "A Bin,"

for example, "The Doorman,"

for example, "Chen Pipi,"

The middle-aged man's fingers trembled with anger as he pushed the box forward.

"Why are you giving me these things!"

The middle-aged man was furious. He stood up and pointed at Zhou Ze:

"Are all booksellers nowadays so shameless!

Filth and corruption!

Filth and corruption!"

Zhou Ze lit a cigarette, one foot propped on the counter, and ignored the guy.

The middle-aged man angrily turned to leave. When he reached the shop door, he turned his head and saw that there seemed to be some relatively serious books on the small bookshelf by the door. He stopped then and there, picked out a copy of Mr. Qian Mu's "A General History of China," and sat down on a small stool to read.

Zhou Ze didn't bother him. His bookstore, anyway, welcomed all comers, humans and ghosts, and even those who were neither. It was just that the current period was a bit tense, and he needed to pay more attention to the Faceless Woman's movements.

Just then, Zhou Ze's phone rang. He took out his phone and saw that it was his sister-in-law's call.

"Hello." Zhou Ze listened carefully to the call.

Last time, it was Dr. Lin's WeChat. This time, it was his sister-in-law's phone call. It wouldn't be surprising if the Faceless Woman played the "half-ass" trick again.

"Brother-in-law..." his sister-in-law's voice purred from the other end of the line.

Zhou Ze immediately hung up.

Problematic,

very problematic!

When had his sister-in-law ever been so gentle?

This was clearly the rhythm of offering herself up on a silver platter,

just like Dr. Lin saying she'd wear stockings next time in the Maserati that night.

Zhou Ze didn't think he had... no, Zhou Ze didn't think "Xu Le's face" could possess the ability of a female killer.

The phone rang again, still her number.

After thinking about it, he answered the phone again:

"Hello."

"Xu Le, you bastard, how dare you hang up on me!"

Now the persona was normal.

"What is it?" Zhou Ze replied coldly.

"My friend and I went to KFC to study, and my wallet was stolen. Do you have any money? Just seven or eight thousand would be enough for an emergency."

Zhou Ze hung up the phone again.

Hmm,

it must still be the Faceless Woman.

Even if it wasn't the Faceless Woman, when he heard "seven or eight thousand" being enough, Zhou Ze was convinced she was disguised by the Faceless Woman.

Yes,

that's right.

The phone rang again, and Zhou Ze was getting annoyed. The middle-aged man sitting there reading frowned and looked at Zhou Ze; clearly, Zhou Ze's repeated phone rings had disturbed his reading.

"Sorry, I'll put it on silent," Zhou Ze said.

The man lowered his head and continued reading.

However, his sister-in-law kept calling, so Zhou Ze had to answer again.

"Xu Le, you can't abandon me! I can only ask you for this money. Can I borrow it from you?

What if I don't tell my parents and my sister about the Maserati woman?"

"You'd better tell them."

"…………" his sister-in-law.

Holy cow, don't just give up like that! You still have a chance to be saved!

After paying all sorts of fees last time, he only had a few thousand left in his pocket. If he gave it all to her, he'd be left with nothing.

"Xu Le, please, help me out. I'll tell you the truth. My friend and I went to a disco, and both our wallets were stolen. My parents and sister can't know about this, or they'll kill me.

My friend also needs to pay her painting class fee tomorrow. Her tuition was already in her wallet, and this can't be delayed."

"Tell her to ask her parents," Zhou Ze said.

"Her family's not well-off. This tuition money was earned by her working during the winter vacation. Her family won't agree to give her money, Xu Le, can I borrow it from you? I'll pay you back next month when I get my allowance."

Zhou Ze still wanted to refuse,

but just then,

the middle-aged man who had been sitting there quietly reading suddenly stood up,

his breathing began to grow heavy,

veins bulging on his neck,

like he was in heat!

Zhou Ze pressed his hand directly on the man's shoulder, holding him down.

At the same time, he told Bai Yingying, "Get the money."

Bai Yingying took out five thousand yuan from behind the counter and handed it to Zhou Ze.

Zhou Ze took the money with one hand and gave it to his sister-in-law, while also instructing her:

"You have to pay it back."

"Got it."

His sister-in-law, having received the money, her gaze lingered on Bai Yingying, saying, "Who is she?"

"A shop assistant, your sister knows her," Zhou Ze explained.

"Oh, okay."

His sister-in-law, being beholden, pulled her female classmate and directly turned to leave the bookstore.

Meanwhile, the middle-aged man next to Zhou Ze made to chase after them but was directly pressed against the glass window by Zhou Ze, who had turned around.

If this guy hadn't suddenly gone crazy, how could Zhou Ze have given the money so readily?

"Are you incapable of changing your ways?" Zhou Ze said in a deep voice, "I was still hesitant, but now there's nothing to hesitate about. I'll just send you back to the Underworld."

The middle-aged man was still struggling.

"You won't believe it until you see your own coffin, will you?" Zhou Ze laughed in extreme anger, pointing directly at the glass window in front of them and saying, "Look at what hat you're wearing on your head."

The middle-aged man looked at the glass window and saw his "reflection,"

In the reflection,

he was wearing a tall hat,

on which were written four large black characters: "Dignified Beast."

The middle-aged man froze,

instantly stopped struggling,

and murmured:

"Disgraceful... disgraceful..."

title: 第五十三章 眾口鑠金
content:
"Yo, a wolf in sheep's clothing?"

Xu Qinglang was just about to close the door when he saw a "customer" in Zhou Ze's shop and came over to tease,

"Brother, your outfit is quite trendy."

Zhou Ze pointed to the tall hat on the middle-aged man's head and asked, "What does that mean?"

"A definitive judgment, you know."

Xu Qinglang stretched,

"It's like how emperors, empresses, and high-ranking officials in ancient times would receive a posthumous title after death, or like how elementary school students get 'excellent,' 'good,' 'pass,' or 'average' on their final report cards."

"So, this hat is an evaluation given to him by his social network after his death?"

"Pretty much, yeah. It also depends on luck. Most people aren't famous after they die, so they don't get this kind of thing. Even famous people rarely do. Anyway, it's about luck, just like how you could crawl out of hell, while ninety-nine percent of other ghosts have to go and reincarnate peacefully.

Oh, I remember reading in a book that Qin Hui also had a tall hat on his head after he died, with 'Framed Loyal Officials' written on it."

"Then Yue Wumu's hat would say 'Serve the Country Loyally'?"

"Nonsense. People are paraded with tall hats for infamy. A good reputation doesn't need a hat."

Zhou Ze let go of his hand, looked at his right palm, and prepared to open the Gates of Hell to throw this guy in. This guy had acted like a bull in rut when he saw the young girl earlier. He really was a wolf in sheep's clothing, looking quite refined and scholarly.

"Are you sending me down?" The middle-aged man seemed to have quieted down now.

"Otherwise?" Zhou Ze retorted.

"Can I finish the last volume of this book?" The middle-aged man took out a piece of hell money from his pocket.

"Heh, are you trying to bribe a beggar?" The female corpse on the side couldn't help but sneer, "Looks like you were quite a failure in life, not even your relatives gave you any incense offerings."

Hell money given by a dead person themselves is different from hell money burned by living people. Of course, the amount of hell money a dead person has is usually related to how much their relatives offer, but there are also limits, otherwise, couldn't one just burn a lot and become the richest person in the underworld?

The middle-aged man pursed his lips, looking at Zhou Ze with pleading eyes: "Please."

Xu Qinglang lit a cigarette beside them, saying nothing. This was Zhou Ze's business; it wasn't appropriate for him to interfere.

Zhou Ze glanced at the *Outline of National Studies* in the middle-aged man's hand and said, "I've read this book before. In my opinion, there are several obvious errors in it."

"Any book with academic research value will have its own errors. Errors are also the accumulation of predecessors," the middle-aged man said seriously.

"But what's the point of a book that's all praise?" Zhou Ze retorted.

"Zeng Guofan once wrote to Zeng Jize, 'One must not lightly criticize ancient people.' Boss, although you run a bookstore, you are not, after all, a scholar.

Mr. Qian Mu wrote this book during the Anti-Japanese War, preparing for the worst-case scenario of national subjugation. He wrote this book hoping that if the nation truly fell, there would still be people who could secretly read and savor it in the dead of night, recalling our ancestors' civilization and heritage.

Books of criticism and satire are naturally more satisfying to read, but if the nation truly falls in the future, and someone sees such a book, filled with nothing but ridicule and criticism, who would still feel a connection to their former country and to China?"

The middle-aged man spoke eloquently, gesturing continuously with one hand while holding the book in the other.

Like a teacher on a podium explaining his theories to students,

He was very agitated and deeply engrossed.

"You're a teacher, aren't you?" Xu Qinglang asked with a smile, "Oh, I mean, when you were alive."

"I was a middle school Chinese teacher," the middle-aged man replied.

"A wolf in sheep's clothing, indeed." Xu Qinglang snorted, "I'm going to bed. Good night, Boss Zhou."

Xu Qinglang waved his hand and left the bookstore, walking back. His swaying posture was quite graceful.

Zhou Ze turned his head to look at Bai Yingying, "Was his back just now very much like a pimp in the pleasure houses of your era?"

"My era, huh." Bai Yingying thought hard, then shook her head, saying, "Even the courtesans weren't as pretty as him."

Zhou Ze pursed his lips, not too surprised by Bai Yingying's answer.

The middle-aged man sat down again to read, seemingly not caring if Zhou Ze had agreed or not. Reading a little more was the most important thing; perhaps he could savor it a bit longer on the road to the Yellow Springs.

Thinking of this guy's agitation when he saw the young girl earlier, Zhou Ze felt agitated for him.

"Boss, I think he's quite learned," the female corpse whispered.

"Was your mistress's old poor scholar quite learned too?" Zhou Ze asked.

Bai Yingying nodded.

"That's hard to say." Zhou Ze also found it difficult to quantify, so he just said, "Mr. Ji Xianlin recorded in his diary, 'I have no other wish in this life, I only wish to sleep with more women and interact with women from various places.'"

"Literati are truly lustful," Bai Yingying muttered.

"Men are all lustful," Zhou Ze corrected.

Bai Yingying looked at Zhou Ze and said coquettishly, "Boss, you have such great self-control."

"Go scrub the toilet in the bathroom."

"............" Bai Yingying.

Zhou Ze didn't know why, but he wasn't in a hurry to open the Gates of Hell and send the middle-aged man in. Instead, he sat down opposite the middle-aged man, pulled out his phone, and idly browsed the web.

"What's your name?" Zhou Ze asked.

The other party didn't answer, seemingly absorbed in reading.

"If you don't answer, you won't get to read the book."

"Ren Xindu."

Zhou Ze nodded. Just as he was about to try searching for this guy's name to see if there were any scandalous news about him, the bookstore door was pushed open again.

His sister-in-law, having left, had returned.

"What are you back for?" Zhou Ze stood up, instinctively reaching out to press down on the middle-aged man's shoulder. He was afraid this guy would go into rut again.

However, to Zhou Ze's surprise, the middle-aged man remained quietly seated, reading, with no signs of agitation whatsoever.

Hmm, has he learned his lesson this time?

His sister-in-law took out her phone, took a photo of the bookstore and Zhou Ze, then sent it, and then clicked on a voice message:

"Sis, I told you I was reading at Xule Bookstore all afternoon, but you just wouldn't believe me.

Alright, alright, I'm going back now, right now, okay?

Honestly, I just wanted to read in peace, and you had to disturb me."

After sending the voice message, his sister-in-law stuck out her tongue and let out a long sigh, saying:

"Phew, that was close. Good thing I hadn't hailed a taxi yet, or I would've been busted."

"At your young age, don't go to those shady places; it's easy to get taken advantage of."

Zhou Ze still gave a reminder, even if she wasn't his sister-in-law, this was purely a middle-aged man's advice to a younger relative.

"Alright, alright, Xule, how did you become just like my sister?" His sister-in-law clearly didn't listen.

"Where's that girl?" Zhou Ze asked.

"She went home. I just watched her take a taxi; her home is a bit far. I was planning to take a taxi too, but then my sister WeChat messaged me to check up on me."

"The money?"

"Of course I gave the money back to her!" His sister-in-law said somewhat nonchalantly, "Don't worry, it's just five thousand yuan. I'll pay you back when I get my allowance."

"You pay it back?" Zhou Ze asked.

"Yeah, who else would pay it back, me or her?

Her father is paralyzed at home, and her mother runs a breakfast stall. Life is very hard for them. I don't want to see her suffer working part-time anymore.

Oh, and she was sexually harassed by her homeroom teacher in middle school, which is why she's so quiet now.

I consider her a good friend, so I should take care of her a little more, right?

Alright, Xule, that's enough for today. I'm going back now."

His sister-in-law waved her hand, pushed open the bookstore door, and left.

Zhou Ze sat back down on his chair, glancing at his phone for a moment, then at the middle-aged man engrossed in his book.

Then he muttered to himself:

"He molested a student in his class, and after being discovered, he committed suicide by jumping off a building."

The middle-aged man continued reading, as if he hadn't heard anything, but his tall hat was so clear, so glaring.

In ancient times, criminals had characters tattooed on their faces to mark them as lower-class citizens, which had a similar effect to this tall hat.

Bai Yingying worked very fast. There was nothing she could do; she was once a lady from a wealthy family, but now she had to humble herself. Plus, Zhou Ze was a bit of a germaphobe, which undoubtedly increased her workload.

"Boss, I'm exhausted."

Bai Yingying took off her jacket. She wasn't afraid of the cold, coming out in just a short-sleeved shirt with a rag in her hand.

She looked very young, but was well-developed.

"Boss, why doesn't he react to me?" Bai Yingying asked, puzzled.

"You're dead."

"But I'm still very pretty!" Bai Yingying struck a seductive pose.

"Forget it. You're so cold down there, any man who goes in will probably freeze stiff and become eternally erect. No need for Viagra."

"No boss talks down to people like you do." Bai Yingying rolled her eyes at Zhou Ze. "By the way, did your sister-in-law come back just now? I heard her voice from the bathroom."

"Yeah, she came back and left again."

Zhou Ze suddenly thought of something.

No, wait,

If this middle-aged man had no reaction to Bai Yingying because Bai Yingying was a zombie,

Then why did he also have no reaction to his sister-in-law?

By elimination, one could easily arrive at an answer:

This guy only had a reaction to the girl next to his sister-in-law.

The news reports found online had no photos to protect the privacy of the victimized girl.

Some things,

Cannot withstand scrutiny,

Nor consideration.

Slowly,

Zhou Ze began to figure it out.

His sister-in-law seemed feisty, but she was actually incredibly naive, like a big dummy.

"Hey, was that girl your student?" Zhou Ze asked.

The middle-aged man continued reading, not answering.

Zhou Ze directly snatched the book from his hand, "I'm asking you a question."

The middle-aged man looked up at Zhou Ze, then nodded.

"Did you or did you not molest her?" Zhou Ze asked again.

The middle-aged man still didn't answer.

"If you don't answer properly, I'll send you to hell right now," Zhou Ze threatened.

"I've finished the book, I can go now." The middle-aged man stood up, looking quite unburdened.

"You're trying to be like Wen Tianxiang, huh?" Zhou Ze sneered.

"No matter what she is, she is ultimately my student. It's my responsibility for not having educated her well," the middle-aged man replied.

"So you're saying the news report I just read was false, that you didn't molest her, and she deliberately slandered you to get compensation from the school?" Zhou Ze pursed his lips.

Then it was easy to imagine what happened: his sister-in-law's wallet was probably stolen by that girl, who then concocted a reason and got his sister-in-law to give her five thousand yuan.

Would a girl from a poor family who worked a winter holiday job carry five thousand yuan in tuition money and go wild at a disco?

His sister-in-law had been played.

"Tell me, did you or did you not molest her?" Zhou Ze grabbed the middle-aged man's shoulder, asking very seriously.

The middle-aged man was silent for a moment, then said, "That's my business, it has nothing to do with you."

"Screw you, that's my five thousand yuan!"

Zhou Ze really wanted to slap him, but he held back, raising his hand and hitting the man's hat. But upon touching the hat, Zhou Ze felt a burning sensation in his palm; it hurt a little.

This hat,

So hard,

It actually caused a slight stinging sensation in his fingernails,

And looking again, even though the entire person was flung away, the hat remained firmly rooted on the middle-aged man's head.

Zhou Ze remembered what Xu Qinglang had said earlier: "Many mouths can melt metal."¹

This hat,

Whether true or false,

Could not be removed.

---
¹ "眾口鑠金" (zhòng kǒu shuò jīn) is a Chinese idiom that literally means "many mouths can melt metal." It refers to the power of public opinion or gossip to influence, slander, or damage someone's reputation, even if it's unfounded. In this context, it implies that once a reputation, especially a bad one, is established by common consensus, it's very difficult to change, regardless of the truth.

title: 第五十四章 還錢！
content:
“Mom, I’m home.”

The girl pushed open the front door and called out. From the inner room, she heard her parents arguing.

Whether she was home or whether she had eaten dinner was irrelevant to her parents.

Her father was paralyzed in bed. Although he could move a bit, he couldn’t do anything other than barely managing to relieve himself into a spittoon.

Her mother went out daily to set up a breakfast stall, working from dawn till dusk.

Logically, their family atmosphere should have been as depicted in many TV reports and newspaper articles:

Impoverished, resilient,

Yet not lacking in family warmth and harmony.

And she, too, should have excelled in her studies, bringing honor to her parents.

But perhaps fairy-tale stories are, after all, rare.

Her home was truly very different from the similar reports she had read before.

Her father, paralyzed at home, had not cultivated his character. He had a very violent temper, especially towards her mother who worked outside every day. He often cursed her, saying she had found another man outside, a paramour.

He called her mother shameless, a whore.

Her mother would always argue with her father, and then her father would throw things and roar.

This man’s strength for the rest of his life was likely spent on lying in bed and cursing.

Yet, she couldn’t fully sympathize with her mother, because the small pieces of jewelry and some clothes her mother occasionally wore back were clearly not the kind her mother would buy herself;

And once, when she was with her boyfriend at a hotel, she ran into her mother, who was supposed to be getting ingredients, with another man, entering the same hotel.

At that moment, both parties almost entered the same elevator. If she hadn’t reacted quickly and told her boyfriend she needed to go to the restroom first, a terribly awkward situation might have unfolded.

This was a broken home,

Appearing to be precarious, and in fact, it was indeed drafty everywhere.

She didn’t know why her mother didn’t divorce her father, nor did she know why her father, who lay in bed, having lost the ability to work and earn money, or even do housework, had no self-awareness whatsoever.

In short,

She habitually unlocked the door with her key,

Habitually heard her parents arguing,

Habitually walked into her small room in the attic,

Habitually poured herself a glass of cool boiled water,

Habitually opened her latest Apple laptop,

Habitually took out her newly bought gentle makeup remover,

Habitually opened the beauty vlogger videos she often watched,

Habitually logged into Zhihu.

This was her life, and her current rhythm.

The *gaokao* (national college entrance examination) was already an unreachable dream for her, because her grades were so poor, so terrible that she had already despaired.

She felt some regret,

Regret that in junior high, she shouldn’t have said her homeroom teacher molested her just for those tens of thousands of yuan.

At the time, her mother was very agitated, her father very agitated. After she told them about it, her mother didn’t go out to set up her stall for several days. She called a few relatives, who carried her paralyzed father on a stretcher to the school gate.

The couple cried, embracing each other,

Miserably, pitiably, sorrowfully,

Reporters arrived upon hearing the news, like sharks scenting blood.

Morality and ethics, the lack of humanity,

Were often the hot topics most favored by reporters at the time, because they didn’t cross lines, carried very low risk, but the hot topic effect they could reap was immeasurably huge.

In short,

The turn of events in that matter caught her somewhat off guard.

Initially, she just wanted a bit more pocket money to buy clothes.

Her homeroom teacher, who was also her Chinese language teacher, knew about her family situation and had helped her out a few times, even paying some of her miscellaneous school fees in advance.

Occasionally, Teacher Ren’s mother would also invite her to their home for dinner.

Teacher Ren was not yet married,

Plus, she often ran to his office and home,

Which indeed gave many people an opportunity to speculate.

Rumors had already started before she exposed the incident, but at that time, she didn't care.

Although, she had heard them.

After she was caught by the teacher on her way out of a bar where she had secretly gone to play, the teacher became cold towards her. He seemed very disappointed, in her.

His mother no longer called her over for meals,

He even stopped paying some of her miscellaneous school fees in advance,

Nor did he help her out anymore,

This made her furious.

Then she used the threat of being molested to demand money from the teacher. She needed money; the lipstick she coveted, the clothes she coveted, the proxy-bought items she coveted, all required money to buy.

But the teacher refused her, even when she threatened to expose the matter.

Even now, she still believes that her middle school homeroom teacher was indeed a scholar.

At the time, he even pounded on the desk and admonished her: “Justice resides in people’s hearts.”

However,

Was that truly the case?

After the matter blew up,

He was directly suspended from school.

The immense pressure from public opinion eventually led to his collapse.

He had angrily fought back,

Responded at length online,

Full of classical Chinese expressions,

Even though she was just a middle school student at the time, just a poor student, she could see then that the teacher’s rebuttal was very pale and powerless.

Although seemingly forceful, full of righteous integrity, fearless of rumors.

But in the eyes of outsiders, this was a dead duck quacking, self-important, trying to muddle through by relying on his teacher status.

The teacher had taught Chinese for a lifetime, teaching generation after generation of students how to write good essays, but his own “essays” were not well-written.

What the outside world and public opinion wanted to see was not his style of writing, and his forceful, “Lu Xun”-esque rebuttals and sarcasm further irritated the nerves of public opinion.

What?

Are we all wrong?

Only you are wise?

Impossible.

Then, there was an even stronger backlash.

Nowadays, when celebrities get embroiled in scandals, they immediately hire public relations firms to calm the situation with various maneuvers.

If simply stating reasons and presenting facts were all it took, if things were truly that simple,

Then most public relations firms today would starve.

And at that time, another piece of news was unearthed: one of the teacher’s uncles was a section chief in the local education bureau.

A very minor section chief, over fifty years old, who usually adhered strictly to morals, and was also an old pedant, fond of studying the School of Mind. Because of this, his interpersonal relationships were very poor, and at fifty, he had no chance of further promotion.

But for this news, the outside world only needed a short headline: “Beast Teacher’s Background Exposed!”

Everything exploded completely.

People indulged in venting their “anger,” feeling they were fighting against dark forces and worldly powers,

The media fully exploited the traffic and exposure,

This was a grand feast initiated by her.

In the end, it concluded with the teacher’s leap from the teaching building.

And the several tens of thousands of yuan the school initially compensated her family to smooth things over and resume normal teaching served as the “final verdict” for the incident.

If you weren’t guilty,

How could you compensate?

Right?

After learning of the teacher’s death,

She suffered for one night, then regretted for a month.

Suffering for one night was because she still had a conscience;

Regretting for a month was because she realized that if she had waited until after she went to university to do this again, she could have profited more, such as securing a master’s recommendation, or even more compensation.

She took out her wallet from her pocket; it belonged to a girl named Lin Yi, a classmate of hers.

The wallet contained a good amount of cash and many VIP cards.

A sarcastic smile played on her lips: Hmph, rich people.

Rich bitch.

Then she took out the five thousand yuan from her pocket and placed it in her locked small drawer. She felt today’s harvest was good; in fact, she had received many donations afterwards, which she and her parents had split evenly.

She removed her makeup, washed her hair,

She reopened the webpage,

Logged into Zhihu,

Today, she was preparing to write about her day’s life.

For example, she had a brother-in-law who owned a bookstore, a sister who was a doctor, and a father who owned a pharmaceutical company and had once been a hospital director.

She wrote that today, a classmate who had claimed to be molested by a teacher, but was actually a “green tea bitch,” had lost her wallet. She despised her in her heart, yet still took five thousand yuan from her brother-in-law to give to her.

Because five thousand yuan, for her, was just a fraction of her monthly pocket money.

Just consider it pity for this “green tea bitch.”

She had a large group of followers who paid attention to her updates. As soon as she posted something, many people would comment and like it. She liked this feeling; here, she found her new life.

Sometimes, she even had trouble distinguishing between the virtual world of the internet and the reality of real life.

She felt she was Lin Yi.

Of course, some people also mocked her for looking down on the poor, being snobbish just because she came from a wealthy family.

She calmly replied: “Who cares?”

She closed her laptop, preparing to rest. Staying up late was a woman’s enemy; she needed to take care of herself. Her appearance seemed to be the only truly valuable thing her parents had given her.

She went to the bathroom to wash up.

Her parents’ argument continued. Her father was throwing cups, cursing her mother, and her mother cursed him back, calling him a good-for-nothing, asking why he didn’t just die,

To find a car on the road, lie down under it, and then pay the family a sum of money, thus fulfilling his duty as a man.

She chuckled listening to them,

After washing up, she returned to her bedroom.

Opening the door,

She found someone sitting on her bed,

A man,

The man was smoking a cigarette,

The ash falling into the lid of her newly bought skincare product.

For a moment, she didn’t know how to face this man.

Her closed laptop had been reopened by the man,

He was looking at her posts on Zhihu.

Silence,

Lasted about three minutes.

She finally asked tremblingly, “What are you doing here?”

She knew him, had just seen him, Lin Yi’s brother-in-law who owned the bookstore.

Zhou Ze stubbed out his cigarette in her skincare product.

Her mouth twitched. That one was very expensive; she had only bought it after spending time with an old man.

Zhou Ze looked at her with a half-smile,

Then said very seriously,

“Time to pay up.”

title: 第五十五章 哦
content:
屋子裡，女孩沒說話，周澤則是慢悠悠地點了第二根煙，然後又拿出女孩的一盒粉底，扭開蓋子，看來是打算繼續當菸灰缸用。



  當然，外面女孩父母的吵架聲還在繼續，女孩母親開始哭起來，說男人沒良心，隨後男人也開始哭起來，說女人變了。



  女孩慢慢地抬起頭，看著周澤：



  「大哥哥，我不知道你這是什麼意思，我和林憶是好朋友，你是她的姐夫，那我們應該……」



  「嗡！」



  周澤從口袋裡取出了一把匕首，倒刺在了女孩書桌上。



  這是女屍的陪葬品之一，說削鐵如泥，誇張了，但確實很鋒銳。



  周澤不想在面對普通人時也跟梅超風一樣玩「九陰白骨爪」，因為那意味著很多的麻煩，而周澤，最怕麻煩。



  一把匕首，



  一聲「嗡」響，



  賽過了千言萬語。



  女孩的臉色開始慢慢地變化。



  周澤原本以為，事情也應該了了，他來，只是想拿回自己給出的錢，另外把傻妞小姨子的錢包拿回去。



  他沒想過多的節外生枝，哪怕他也覺得，這個女孩兒出門直接被車撞死似乎是最好的結局。 



  蓉城那位的前車之鑑還在，



  周澤懶得去搞什麼法律外的懲罰，



  他沒那麼閒，也沒那種情操。



  他只要錢，因為他窮。



  有時候，生活真的需要很大的勇氣，尤其是當周澤環顧四周時，



  自己的老婆很有錢，買自己房子當紀念品，開著卡宴，自己小姨子也很有錢，五千塊無非是一個月零花錢的一部分。



  許清朗有二十幾套房，



  白鶯鶯還有陪葬品，



  自己身邊都是有錢人，但就自己錢磨子壓手。



  然而，周澤還是低估了這個女孩兒。



  一個早就步入社會，早就經歷了「錘鍊」的女孩兒，在這個時候，所表現出來的冷靜，



  幾乎可以讓人膽寒。



  女孩兒解開了自己的衣服扣子，



  只剩下一套內衣，



  但接下來，



  她卻連內衣都準備解開。



  「你是要殺人麼？」女孩兒嘴角露出了一抹笑容，眼神里，也不見了驚慌，反而很深邃，深邃得讓人有些不可思議。



  「你來殺吧。」 



  女孩兒主動向周澤走了一步，



  「我父親癱瘓在床，他沒能力阻止你。



  我和我母親都是女人，也打不過你。



  你來殺吧，



  殺了我們全家。」



  女孩兒走到了周澤面前，聲音平緩。



  周澤側著頭，看著女孩，順帶欣賞著對方的身體。



  只是，



  的確是有些頭痛啊。



  這位，



  生冷不忌的樣子。



  而且，



  她似乎篤定自己不想殺人。



  周澤有些後悔了，早知道應該讓白鶯鶯上來，讓女人來對付女人，似乎是最合適的方式。



  「又或者，我現在喊一嗓子，就說你非法入室打算強、、、、奸。」女孩兒低下頭，讓自己年輕的臉湊到周澤面前。



  「然後，我父母會聽到我的聲音過來，鄰居們也會來，也會有人報警，你就會身敗名裂。」



  周澤笑了笑，道：「是不是這次我不光討不回我的錢，還得另外再給你錢消災？」



  「你不缺錢吧？」女孩微微抬起下顎，她下顎圓潤，鎖骨也很精緻，連那眼睫毛，都帶著些年輕女孩迷人的姿態，「林家，很有錢的。」 



  但我窮啊。



  周澤有些無奈地嘆了口氣。



  「一千塊，我陪你睡一次。」女孩盯著周澤，伸出舌頭舔了舔自己的嘴唇，「就在這裡，就在我家，就在我父母房間的隔壁，怎麼樣？」



  周澤感知到一種老司機的氣息撲面而來，



  羞愧，



  萬分羞愧，



  有了上次的三過家門而不入之後，



  周澤覺得眼前這個女孩經驗豐富到足以引領自己入門。



  只是她的皮囊很好看，



  但內在，



  卻有些陰毒。



  「當初你的老師，也是這樣被你逼死的麼？」周澤問道。



  女孩愣了一下，微微皺眉，有些驚訝於周澤為什麼會知道這件事。



  「他對你不錯，還經常接濟你，還請家裡不方便的你去他家吃飯，他沒碰過你，你卻誣陷說他侵犯了你。」



  「我對不起他。」女孩聳聳肩，「他確實沒碰過我，但我真的沒想到他會傻到直接跳樓自殺。我當時只是想要學校賠一點錢而已。」



  「你父母，也知道吧。」周澤問道。



  「當然。」女孩微微一笑，站直了身子，看著周澤，「你怎麼知道這些的。」 



  「你這樣做，是不對的。」周澤很認真地說道。



  手微微抬起來，模仿起了書店裡看書的中年男子說話的架勢：



  「他對得起自己的良心，也對得起自己的職業道德，而這些，都是他最看重的東西，你卻把它們都毀了。」



  「你是來說教的？」女孩有些不能理解周遭的腦迴路。



  自己衣服都脫了，就剩他親自解開自己最後的扣子了，結果眼前的這個男人，卻在這裡和自己上課。



  她以前倒是遇到過一個客人，是一個好為人師的教授，出手也很大方，做事兒前還教育她應該好好學習，不應該做這個，女孩要自重，諄諄教導她。



  然後那個教授一晚上要了自己七次。



  這種人最虛偽了，明明打算解開皮帶了，卻依舊要跟你裝一下正人君子。



  「你應該給你老師證名，他是被誣陷的。」周澤說道。



  「憑什麼？」



  女孩後退兩步，將衣服穿起來，她知道了，眼前的這個男人對自己並不感興趣。



  「憑良心，做人的良心。」



  「做人的良心？」女孩攤了攤手，故作調侃道：「我沒想當人啊，如果有的選，我想當鬼的。」 



  「哦，是麼。」



  周澤慢慢地站起來，



  雙手負於身後，指甲已經完全長出來，



  同時，周澤的眼眸里開始有黑色的光圈流淌，整個人的氣質也瞬間改變。



  當初，性子大大咧咧的小姨子見到這樣子的自己，嚇得直接尿失禁。



  而眼前的女孩也是臉色驟然一變，「噗通」一聲坐倒在了地上，手指著周澤，害怕得說不出話來。



  「你……你是人是鬼……」



  周澤從抽屜里取出了五千塊錢，還有小姨子的錢包，放入自己口袋裡。



  至於裡面的其他東西，他沒興趣。



  他只是回來取走自己被騙的錢，



  合理合法。



  其他的事兒，他不想去做。



  離開時，周澤彎下腰，伸手提起女孩的下巴，很認真地對她道：



  「我多麼希望你現在是一隻鬼，那樣的話，我會讓你連投胎的機會，都沒有。」



  說完，周澤離開了這個烏煙瘴氣的家。



  而女孩，則一直癱坐在那裡，身體不停打著擺子。



  ………… 



  走到外面，白鶯鶯在那裡等著，她在嚼著口香糖，當周澤出來時，她主動剝開一片口香糖討好似地送入周澤嘴裡。



  「老闆，錢拿回來了？」



  周澤點點頭。



  「那女的呢？」白鶯鶯不在乎錢，這點小錢，她隨便拿自己陪葬品賣一件都不止了，她只是關心那個女孩的下場。



  當初自己的老闆可是把自己虐得很慘，所以她很期待自己老闆如何料理那女孩的。



  「在家啊。」周澤開始準備打車。



  「在家？死在家裡了？」白鶯鶯問道。



  「我沒對她怎麼樣。」周澤回答道。



  「為什麼啊！」白鶯鶯很不解，「那種女人，就該受到懲罰。」



  「那也不是我應該做的事。」周澤很平和地說道。



  「老闆，你好慫唉。」



  「人家老師都對我說不關我的事了，我幹嘛要自找麻煩？」



  說著，周澤伸手指了指四周的花圃草叢，繼續道：



  「再說了，這裡面不知道藏了多少雙通紅的眼睛，等著我犯錯呢。」



  蓉城的那位到底日後如何，周澤不清楚，也不確定，小蘿莉可能聯合了其他鬼差一起去圍剿他了，甚至連黃泉路邊的無面女也被放出來參與這次行動。 



  當然，因為自己在夢中欠了對方一個人情的原因，周澤希望那位能夠安然度過這次事兒。



  但是，讓自己去學他一樣直接做判官，他做不到。



  前世他是一個醫生，只會救人，可不會殺人。



  打車回到了店裡，一路上，白鶯鶯一句話都不說，顯然，她對周澤的消極應對很不滿意。



  回到書店時，周澤看見那個中年男子仍然坐在那裡看書，他沒跑，哪怕周澤說要把他送入地獄，他也依舊沒跑。



  「幫我倒杯水。」周澤對白鶯鶯道。



  「我累了，去休息。」白鶯鶯哼了一聲，直接在櫃檯後面坐了下來。



  周澤沒說什麼，在中年男子面前坐了下來。



  「你家裡還有什麼人麼？」



  中年男子聞言，抬起頭，「父母都已經過世，只有一個姐姐。」



  「你姐姐聯繫方式告訴我，或者告訴我住址。」



  周澤拿出了手機，點開了一個視頻，聲音從裡面傳出：



  「又或者，我現在喊一嗓子，就說你非法入室打算強、、、、奸。然後，我父母會聽到我的聲音過來，鄰居們也會來，也會有人報警，你就會身敗名裂…………」



  手機視頻里錄製了當時的情景。 



  中年男子嘴唇微張，有些激動，也有些彷徨，然後戰戰兢兢道：



  「這個公布出去，會毀了她的人生的。」



  「那麼，誰來給你的人生負責？以及，被你牽連的學校和你的親戚婦人之仁？」周澤很不客氣道，「以及，對教師這個職業名譽負責。」



  中年男子面露掙扎之色，然後點了點頭，「好吧，我把我姐姐地址告訴你。」



  在中年男子說出了地址之後，他的身體開始慢慢的虛化，慢慢地像是融入了地下。



  書看完了，



  執念也了結了，



  他不需要周澤強制送，自己就步入地獄去了。



  真正的讀書人，走得灑脫。



  周澤把視頻發給了白鶯鶯，白鶯鶯有些驚喜道：「老闆，只要他姐姐把這段視頻交給警方，他走在黃泉路上時應該就不用戴帽子了吧？」



  「呵……」周澤笑了一聲，「帽子，摘不掉了。」



  「怎麼會呢？這件事反轉了呀。」白鶯鶯有些不理解，「公道自在人心。」



  「通常來說，在網上一名消防員戰士殉職的新聞點擊和討論量遠遠比不過一條寵物狗被虐殺的新聞。」



  「這是什麼意思？」白鶯鶯顯然有些不了解，她剛接觸網絡才只會玩一些單機遊戲。 



  「你知道，人們對一件事的關注度取決於什麼麼？」



  「比如這件事麼？肯定是事情的真相啊。」



  「不，人們只關心他們所看見的『真相』是否有趣。」



  周澤伸手指了指頭頂，



  「當初給他戴上那頂帽子的人，其中能有多少會看見闢謠反轉的消息尚且不得而知，哪怕其中有一小部分人看見了，你猜他們會有什麼反應？」



  「羞愧，難受？」



  「如果是面對面做錯了事被別人當面批評了，正常人都會愧疚和難受。」



  「那不就對了麼？」



  「但隔著一個屏幕的話，大部分人通常只會有一種反應。」



  「什麼反應？」



  「哦。」



  「哦？」白鶯鶯不理解，追問道：「然後呢？」



  「然後該幹嘛幹嘛。」

title: 第五十六章 官說
content:
The sister-in-law's wallet was sent back by Zhou Ze via anonymous express.

Yes,

the shipping was cash on delivery.

The two thousand yuan that was originally inside had been swiped by Zhou Ze. Anyway, that girl had plenty of spending money, so he just considered it his hard-earned fee for helping her find her wallet. Zhou Ze felt his charge was very reasonable.

Then, the next day, Zhou Ze saw his sister-in-law post on WeChat Moments:

"This thief has such professional ethics. They stole my wallet but mailed back all my cards and documents. This society still has many good people."

Zhou Ze read the post and was silent for a while.

Forget it, it's better for a silly girl to stay silly. Simpletons are blessed.

Bai Yingying secretly delivered the USB stick with the edited video (trimmed at both ends) to the middle-aged man's sister's house. Her sister reported it to the police station that same day. A few days later, the local police's official Weibo also published the news.

This incident caused quite a stir. Many people denounced the girl's shamelessness and heartlessness, but its popularity couldn't compare to when the incident first happened.

Moreover, those who are scolding this girl now probably also called that teacher an "animal in human clothes" back then.

In short, days passed peacefully. Business was still slow. Bai Yingying became even more engrossed in the internet, making rapid progress, and also gradually became addicted to online games. She would sit there for a long time every day, just reading dungeon guides.

She was a complete internet addict.

At dusk, as usual, they ate at Xu Qinglang's place, accompanied by Xu Qinglang's newly developed strawberry juice.

Zhou Ze felt that he was slowly starting to taste the flavor in his meals.

After dinner, Zhou Ze and Xu Qinglang, as usual, shared a cigarette.

Xu Qinglang was holding his phone, scrolling through Weibo, leisurely.

Zhou Ze noticed that Xu Qinglang's restaurant business had been getting quieter lately, and there were fewer and fewer delivery riders coming and going. Of course, this wasn't due to a business downturn or a decline in Xu Qinglang's restaurant's reputation; it was simply because the man in front of him was getting lazier and lazier.

But according to Xu Qinglang, the problem lay with Zhou Ze.

How could he possibly be balanced inside when he himself was toiling from dawn till dusk, while the neighbor just sat in the bookstore, not moving at all?

Please, he was a man with over twenty properties!

Why was he not living as comfortably as the pauper next door?

So, he should also live well, enjoy himself, and rest when he needed to.

He's fallen from grace, Zhou Ze sighed internally.

"Hey, there have been a lot of strange things happening in the East District lately," Xu Qinglang said, blowing out a smoke ring.

The East District was to the east of Tongcheng's urban area, slightly off-center. The Confucius Temple and City God Temple were located there, usually only lively during festivals, as many people went to offer incense.

"What's wrong?" Zhou Ze asked, flicking his cigarette ash.

"Look at this one. Someone posted on Weibo saying that last night, while passing by the Confucius Temple, they saw a few cosplay enthusiasts dressed in ancient costumes. When they went to say hello, the people suddenly disappeared."

"There's another one here, saying that while taking a walk with their parents after dinner in the woods behind Confucius Temple Street, they saw someone composing poems there."

"And another one, posted by a driver, saying that when they drove past the Confucius Temple, they heard many people crying by the roadside."

Confucius Temple?

Zhou Ze frowned slightly. This matter seemed to be somewhat related to him.

"However, these incidents have made the Confucius Temple popular again. It's said that more people have been going to offer incense lately, all saying it's become more 'efficacious'," Xu Qinglang remarked with emotion.

"Heh heh," Zhou Ze pondered his own affairs.

"Logically, it shouldn't be. The Confucius Temple is where Confucian sages reside; it's impossible for any wandering spirits to cause mischief there," Xu Qinglang said.

"There probably were, but someone might have been managing them before," Zhou Ze said.

"What about now? What happened to the one managing them?"

"I killed him."

"............" Xu Qinglang.

——————

Left with no choice, Zhou Ze and Bai Yingying came to the Confucius Temple after nightfall.

The last time, Zhou Ze had utterly annihilated that dwarfish old man here, then simply brushed off his sleeves and left, leaving no trace.

But linking it with recent events, it was clear: without the dwarfish old man's control, those scholar-ghosts who previously served as an honor guard were slowly becoming restless, gradually letting themselves go.

Zhou Ze was a ghost messenger, so this matter naturally fell under his jurisdiction. Not to mention, he was the one who took out the dwarfish old man, so it was indeed up to him to clean up this mess.

"Boss, these lingering spirits can't really amount to much. They'll just vanish in a couple of months. Previously, they were only sustained by the Confucius Temple's system, and if they didn't cause trouble, the ghost messengers would just turn a blind eye and ignore them.

Now that they've lost their restraints, once they've bounced around for a few days and vented their grievances, those who are destined to vanish will vanish, and those who are meant for hell will go to hell."

Bai Yingying, having been personally taught by Madam Bai, actually understood these matters of ghosts and gods more clearly than Zhou Ze.

"I can't rest easy without seeing the situation here. It's better to take care of them all if possible," Zhou Ze tilted his head slightly, searching for any lingering scholar-ghosts nearby.

Those who failed to pass the imperial examinations, or who committed suicide due to setbacks in their studies throughout history, many of their souls, carrying immense resentment, came near the Confucius Temple. From then on, drawn by the spiritual energy, they became the "honor guard" of the Confucius Temple.

Of course, there were certainly others mixed in who were just there to make up the numbers, not all of them were "scholars," after all, a large forest attracts all kinds of birds.

Those scholars mostly just composed poems and cried. Li Baojia of the Qing Dynasty once wrote in the sixth chapter of his "A Brief History of Civilization":

"Scholars rebelling, it won't succeed in three years. Whether they're involved or not, there's no need to pay them any mind."

But Zhou Ze was worried that if other entities also gained "freedom" there, they might cause trouble. If something really happened, and it was traced back, he would definitely be partly responsible.

Yet tonight was perfectly quiet. Zhou Ze had smoked half a pack of cigarettes, and Bai Yingying was simply lying on the grass with her eyes closed. Not a single ghost could be seen.

Growing somewhat impatient, Zhou Ze reached out and slapped Bai Yingying's ample, rounded behind, watching the ripples of flesh.

He said:

"Shout a few times and call those ghosts out."

Bai Yingying rolled her eyes at Zhou Ze, clearly ignoring the suggestion. Having spent more time together, Bai Yingying had also figured out some of Zhou Ze's personality traits and habits, and dared to put on a dignified air just enough so as not to displease Zhou Ze.

"Human life is like a dream; I will toast the moon over the river. Revisiting the old country, indeed, things are no longer the same."

A man's voice came from behind the tree.

Immediately after, a man wearing long boots and an official's robe walked out. The man had a long beard, symbolizing dignity, a square face, and a straight posture. He looked like an official.

No, he looked like someone who was an official in his previous life.

And he still had a long queue braided at the back of his head.

Bai Yingying slowly stood up, looking at the man in front of her, and then exclaimed in surprise:

"Boss, I was wondering why we hadn't seen any of those scholar-ghosts tonight. So he swallowed them all!"

Zhou Ze also saw it. The man appeared to have an extraordinary demeanor, but inside his stomach, many small points of light could be seen, which must have been the scholar-ghosts he had swallowed.

"Heh heh, a prime minister's stomach can hold a boat. I'm not a prime minister, but I was once an official of the nine chief ministers. This belly of mine has no problem holding these fallen scholars from past imperial examinations."

"Alright, it's you. Go down."

Zhou Ze prepared to open the Gates of Hell and drag this guy down.

The other party had indeed swallowed quite a few scholar-ghosts, and he seemed to be in good spirits, much better than the usual ghosts who frequented his bookstore.

But he was not formidable enough to make Zhou Ze wary.

They were all ghosts; having a physical body or not was truly two different matters.

And he still had his fingernails.

"Are you the local ghost messenger?" the man looked at Zhou Ze and said with reserve, "You do have the qualification to sit as an equal with this official."

"Oh, quite the big talk. Did the Great Qing Dynasty fall?"

Bai Yingying scoffed.

"When men are speaking, is there a place for you women to interrupt? Retreat, this official commands you." The man reprimanded with considerable authority.

Bai Yingying cracked her knuckles, making a crisp sound.

The man looked at Zhou Ze, who was preparing to open the Gates of Hell on the other side, and said:

"Esteemed constable, this official held a scholarly degree and once held significant influence. Even if I am to be sent down, it shouldn't be done so casually, should it?

Moreover, this official encountered a judge of the Underworld in the human realm during my lifetime. That judge said this official would die on the nineteenth day of the third month of the Jiashen year.

This official was trembling with fear, anxious day and night, finally enduring to that very day. But after that day, this official did not die.

This is proof enough that this official is blessed with great fortune; even the rules of the Underworld are ineffective against this official. Therefore, this official advises you not to waste your efforts in vain.

When this official's tour of the old country is complete, if I wish to go down, this official will naturally descend. Perhaps after this official goes down, I might even secure a position as a supervisor in the Underworld. In the future, if we meet, you will still have to kneel and respectfully address me as 'Lord'."

"You, you really are asking for a beating," Bai Yingying said with a laugh.

"No, that just shows that his hometown's customs are simple. Otherwise, he would have been beaten to death before he even grew up."

"Preposterous! Hmph, this official is too lazy to engage in such verbal sparring with the likes of you. This official speaks no falsehoods. If you intend to forcibly escort this official to hell, then be prepared to incur this grudge.

Even a judge of the Underworld couldn't accurately determine this official's death date, let alone a mere ghost messenger like you?"

Zhou Ze wasn't in a hurry to open the Gates of Hell anymore. He just found the person in front of him quite interesting, and honestly, modern ghosts weren't that rare, but ancient ghosts,

They were truly uncommon.

People often say precious cultural relics are records of history; the one before him was truly a historical repeater.

"You have a queue at the back of your head, but you're not wearing a Qing Dynasty official's uniform," Zhou Ze observed for a moment, then continued, "It should be a Ming Dynasty official's uniform.

No, wait, you just said you were once a Nine Chief Minister, but this Ming Dynasty official's uniform isn't one of a Nine Chief Minister; rather, it's the attire of a low-ranking official."

Upon hearing this, the man said proudly, "This official served in two dynasties, a censor in the former dynasty, and a Nine Chief Minister in the latter. I brought great benefit to the common people, and my reputation as an official was outstanding.

As for what clothes this official wears, what right do you have to comment?"

Zhou Ze took out his phone, typed "nineteenth day of the third month of Jiashen year," looked it up, and then smiled:

"That judge was not wrong; you really should have died on the nineteenth day of the third month of the Jiashen year."

"Nonsense! This official did not die on that day. This official ultimately died of old age and enjoyed a beautiful posthumous title!" the man said with disdain.

"You were supposed to die that day, really," Zhou Ze repeated, then a mocking smile appeared on his face, "But you shamelessly refused to die."

"Arrogant words!" The man flicked his sleeve. "Ignorant!"

"Think again about what day the nineteenth of the third month of the Jiashen year was! Should you have died or not!"

Zhou Ze emphasized his tone, reprimanding him.

The man frowned slightly, seemingly pondering and recalling.

Finally,

Suddenly,

His body trembled, revealing a look of shock.

Then he glanced back at the Confucius Temple.

At that moment,

He finally understood why, after his death, when his soul returned home, he had been imprisoned within this Confucius Temple, and had spent several centuries in a daze with those he called failed imperial examination candidates!

"This... this... this..."

The man slumped to the ground, utterly disheartened.

The nineteenth day of the third month of the Jiashen year,

This was precisely the day the Ming Dynasty fell, when Emperor Chongzhen hanged himself on Coal Hill, and Ming officials followed their emperor to their deaths.

title: 第五十七章 是個東西
content:
The man remained silent, somewhat lost in thought at that moment.

Zhou Ze had initially expected him to turn into a malevolent spirit, just like the victims' souls who had been burned to death by the delivery man in his bookstore.

The existence of ghosts—once they transform into malevolent spirits, their obsession solidifies completely, severing all paths of reincarnation. Their only fate is to dissipate into thin air.

It's somewhat like a person taking a hundred times the overdose of a stimulant; they'd certainly be high as a kite, but after the high, all that's left is a corpse.

However, the person before him seemed unusually calm.

Very lost, very bewildered, very helpless, and very conflicted.

He turned back to look at the Confucian Temple behind him and sighed, "So, to the sages, am I, who grew up reading their books, no different from those destitute scholars who failed the imperial examinations?"

He had once thought himself unique, believed he was blessed by fortune, that even the Ghost Judge couldn't determine his fate. Who knew, in the end, it was merely his own self-importance.

In fact, he should have realized it long ago; otherwise, he wouldn't have been imprisoned here for hundreds of years, constantly in a stupor, unable even to possess self-awareness, only able to follow successive generations of night watchmen circling the Confucian Temple.

The man looked at Zhou Ze: "Do you think I deserve to die?"

Zhou Ze did not answer.

"I had a close friend, surnamed Liu. After learning that the former emperor had hanged himself on Coal Hill, he led his entire family, old and young, to commit suicide in their residence, following the emperor."

The man spoke softly,

"The day before it happened, his thirteen-year-old granddaughter secretly ran to my mansion, hoping to seek my protection. Her mother was a concubine and wanted to find a chance for her to live.

Then my old friend personally came to my door and took his granddaughter away.

Finally, over twenty members of the Liu family, young and old, committed suicide for the nation. That little granddaughter was killed by a precious sword; she didn't want to die, but she died nonetheless."

The man smiled, "Do you think that was right?"

This time, Zhou Ze didn't remain silent but said, "She shouldn't have died."

"Yes, she shouldn't have died, which is why I believe that whether to live or die, everyone has their own considerations. I knew my family didn't want to die, and my children didn't want to die, so I had to grit my teeth and live, to survive.

I wasn't just living for myself; I had to live for their entire family.

Furthermore, during my tenure in the succeeding dynasty, I saved countless lives and reduced much bloodshed.

It's like Li Shimin knew after the Xuanwu Gate Incident that he would undoubtedly leave an indelible stain on history, so he painstakingly strove to be a wise and good emperor.

I was in the same state of mind then.

I always felt that by doing more good deeds, by saving more lives, even if I couldn't sacrifice myself for the nation, at least I would keep my useful body to do things beneficial for the country and its people, which could be considered as making up for my mistakes in another way."

The man said a lot; clearly, he was unconvinced.

Ancient scholars referred to themselves as disciples of the sages because they read the sages' books and learned their principles. But now, it was evident that the sages in the Confucian Temple had deemed him an unfilial disciple.

He was originally a member of a ducal clan of the Nine Ministers, yet his treatment after death was the same as those who had failed the imperial examinations and committed suicide in the Confucian Temple.

This already showed the attitude of the sages.

Zhou Ze slowly squatted down, looking at the man before him. After a moment's thought, he said, "What you just said sounds a bit familiar to me. Less than a hundred years ago, someone said something similar to your argument.

His name was Wang Jixin.

During a time of national crisis, he became a traitor, acting as a tiger's accomplice, under the beautiful name of 'saving the nation through a circuitous path.'"

The man opened his mouth slightly, wanting to say something, but didn't know where to begin.

"You went from being a censor in the previous dynasty to a Nine Minister in the succeeding dynasty; there's no need to make excuses for yourself anymore.

The most fundamental reason is actually very simple:

'The water is too cold.' "¹

Upon hearing this, the man's face showed a mix of shame and anger, and he glared furiously at Zhou Ze.

Zhou Ze spread his hand, his fingernails grew, and then he drew out the symbol in his right palm, drawing a circle, and the gate of hell opened.

"Please, what you want is nothing more than dignity, isn't it? Walk in yourself.

If I were to seize you myself, you would lose even that last bit of dignity."

The man stood up and walked forward step by step. Before stepping into the gate, he cast a final meaningful look at Zhou Ze:

"Do you think the water is cold?"

"A clear conscience is enough."

The man appeared thoughtful, then shook his head, unsure whether he had finally understood or not, but ultimately took that step and entered the gate.

Zhou Ze waved his hand, the gate dissipated, and everything here concluded.

It seemed he also had to thank that official, who had swallowed all the scholarly ghosts nearby, saving Zhou Ze a lot of trouble.

"Boss, is that it?" The female corpse said with disappointment, "I thought you'd give him a beating."

"Beating him or not, it's meaningless." Zhou Ze gave a deep look at the Confucian Temple not far ahead and said, "Besides, the sages in the Confucian Temple have already held him here for hundreds of years; he's been punished enough."

Bai Yingying pouted, "It seems these clay figures in the Confucian Temple are somewhat useful; they're not all blind."

"Yes, they held that former imperial censor's soul here because they felt this censor wasn't their disciple, that he did something shameless, disgraced them, and needed to be punished.

They punished him,

Then, the dynasty changed; the Ming dynasty became the Qing dynasty. Many things changed, but the Confucian Temple remained the Confucian Temple. These sage clay figures still enjoyed the incense offerings of the new dynasty."

"............" Bai Yingying.

"Boss, your words are becoming more philosophical now. Are those clay figures in the temple good or bad?"

Bai Yingying still remembered when she last helped someone get the first incense stick into the Confucian Temple, and she felt an uncomfortable sensation of being "watched."

"They're just... things."

After taking a taxi, it was already ten o'clock at night when they returned to the bookstore, but usually, this was Zhou Ze's real business hour.

Probably because there were fewer ghosts during the day, and ghosts were more active at night.

In recent days, he had earned some hell money, but after giving out that video last time, Zhou Ze had burned a lot of hell money to avoid trouble.

That video, of course, couldn't be used as direct evidence, but as long as the relevant parties knew the truth of the matter and put in some effort to investigate thoroughly, the truth wouldn't be difficult to uncover.

That video was merely an opening; it couldn't be used as real evidence.

Zhou Ze didn't read but listened to music with headphones, casually flipping through some news. Bai Yingying sat behind Zhou Ze, playing games on her phone.

Master and servant, each enjoying their own pleasure. In the eyes of the man next door, who was even more beautiful than a woman, this was a sign of depravity!

The bookstore door was pushed open late at night, and a girl walked in, leading a Corgi dog.

A familiar girl, a familiar Corgi.

Zhou Ze stood up and poured her a glass of water. As his first VIP customer, she naturally deserved such service.

Zhou Ze also leaned in to take a look.

The person was alive,

The dog was also alive.

It was genuinely late at night, and the probability of a living person entering his bookstore was quite low.

"Boss, my dog was found!"

"Congratulations," Zhou Ze said.

The Corgi excitedly circled Zhou Ze twice, then joyfully ran to Bai Yingying.

Bai Yingying was playing "Honor of Kings" when she was suddenly startled by the dog. She immediately glared, and the Corgi froze in fear.

As the saying goes, dogs look down on people, but in reality, dogs can see things that humans cannot.

Immediately, the dog slumped to the ground, its urine and feces coming out all at once.

"I'm so sorry, boss, I'm really sorry," the girl immediately stood up, ready to clean.

"It's fine." Zhou Ze gestured for the girl to calm down, then told Bai Yingying, "Clean it up."

Bai Yingying put down her phone and went to the bathroom with a mournful expression to get a mop and rag.

"Boss, your bookstore's business has always been poor, hasn't it?" The girl pulled her dog back to her feet, not letting it run around.

Of course, the dog didn't dare to run around now, not even daring to breathe loudly.

"Just getting by," Zhou Ze said.

"Thanks to you telling me where my dog was last time, I was able to find the person who took it and pay to get it back."

"How much did it cost?"

"Over ten thousand yuan, I guess. The person wouldn't return it, saying she raised it, but after we agreed on a price, she still gave the dog back to me."

Zhou Ze nodded.

"Boss, I think you could add more things to this bookstore. For example, these chairs are really uncomfortable; you could change them to sofas."

If I had money, I'd want to change them too.

"How about I invest? You can spruce things up here," the girl said to Zhou Ze, stroking her dog's head.

Zhou Ze understood that she merely wanted to repay him, so she wouldn't mind losing money. But Zhou Ze couldn't agree.

He couldn't very well ask her, "Do you mind receiving dividends in hell money?"

"Hell money that accumulates Yin virtue when burned, you know?"

When that Taoist priest said that to him, Zhou Ze considered the other party a fool.

Hmm,

So Zhou Ze didn't want the girl in front of him to also think he was a fool.

Just then, a "loud laugh" came from the noodle shop next door. Immediately after, Xu Qinglang, dressed in pajamas and striking a seductive pose, ran out to the bookstore next door and shouted to Zhou Ze and Bai Yingying, who was cleaning dog feces:

"I won! The lottery! One hundred thousand!"

Xu Qinglang was very happy. When people are happy, they always want to share. The only place he could find living people nearby was the bookstore next door.

However, it seemed the two people in the bookstore next door weren't living people either...

"Congratulations, congratulations," Zhou Ze offered.

"Tsk tsk, buy me a bag, Boss Xu," Bai Yingying took the opportunity to ask for some lucky money.

"Small potatoes, small potatoes," Xu Qinglang began to act reserved, then, seeing a young and pretty girl next to them, he became even more reserved:

"It's just one hundred thousand yuan. After tax, it's only eighty thousand. It's just a bit of prize money. For someone like me who has over twenty resettlement apartments in Shiqiao District, it's just a drop in the bucket, with no real impact on my life."

"Shiqiao District?" the girl asked.

"That's right," Xu Qinglang replied.

Shiqiao District was close to the city center, and house prices there were higher than in other places, so naturally, one could be more ostentatious—oh no, one could be more reserved.
