In our usual social circles, it's hard to find like-minded people. Our club also provides an opportunity for everyone to communicate.

And, I've already arranged things for tonight. I had someone set up things earlier today in the cinema where the arson happened. Tonight, Mr. Chen from our club will confess to Miss Liu."

"Confess?"

"That's right. Actually, the rest of us are aware of tonight's plan; only Miss Liu doesn't know. Our club has been established for five years, and we all have good relationships, so everyone is very willing to help."

"Are you Japanese?" Zhou Ze asked the black-rimmed man.

"Yes, I'm considered an overseas Chinese in Japan, returned to the country five years ago. This kind of hobby club is very common in Japan. After returning home, I found everyone too introverted, so I usually organize activities like regular book clubs or haunted house explorations."

The man slapped his forehead and handed over his business card,

"My Chinese name is Cui Yilang. Please treat me well."

Zhou Ze took the business card from his hand.

"Then we'll go organize the activity now. Thank you again, Boss, for your hospitality."

Cui Yilang walked out of the bookstore. Xu Qinglang, who had been standing by the side without speaking, immediately clutched his stomach and burst out laughing:

"Hahaha, I was dying trying to hold it in. They really encountered a ghost this time."

Xu Qinglang laughed and laughed, then noticed Zhou Ze wasn't laughing. He reached out and punched Zhou Ze's chest, asking:

"Isn't it funny?"

Zhou Ze immediately bent over, one hand covering the spot on his chest that had just been hit.

"This... are you okay? He didn't use much force, did he?"

He just lightly punched your chest, that's all.

"No," Zhou Ze gestured for Xu Qinglang not to come closer, and said at the same time, "I just laughed so hard my chest hurts."

"That exaggerated?" Xu Qinglang pouted. "Are you hungry? I'll go make you... a bowl of egg fried rice?"

"Not hungry, I've eaten."

"You ate outside?" Xu Qinglang asked curiously, "Don't you usually dislike eating out?"

"That thing, it was very tasty."

"What kind of dish was it? If you can eat it, I'll buy some tomorrow and make it for you?"

Zhou Ze shook his head,

A person only has one heart.

Zhou Ze couldn't just produce a whole basketful for Xu Qinglang to "fry, deep-fry, boil, steam."

"Then what do you want to eat lately?" Xu Qinglang asked.

"Water spinach, I guess." Zhou Ze looked at Xu Qinglang and said very seriously, "I suddenly really want to eat that lately."

"Alright, I'll get some tomorrow."

Just then, the lights in the bookstore suddenly went out.

"Ah ah ah ah ah ah ah!!!!!!!! The final circle, the fated circle!!!!

I was about to get a chicken dinner! My dog's grenade, three-tier armor, three heads, fifteen times scope!"

Bai Yingying rushed out of the noodle shop, wailing loudly outside.

Zhou Ze felt that even when she was drowned in a pig cage back then, she probably didn't yell as intensely as she was now.

The power was out,

Zhou Ze and Xu Qinglang also walked outside.

Xu Qinglang made a call, then hung up, saying helplessly:

"Damn it, they said no one will come to fix it until tomorrow. Old Zhou, this place of ours is really going downhill. The power's out and people can't even be bothered to come check. Now it's become a ghost house for hobbyists and ghost hunters."

Xu Qinglang pointed to the high-rise windows above their heads. "How could they think of proposing in that cinema where people died?"

"It's very romantic. In a horrifying environment, coupled with the suddenness of love, this contrast can be intoxicating for those who enjoy such things."

"Why do you sound so strange today?" Xu Qinglang looked at Zhou Ze.

Zhou Ze shook his head.

"You really look like you've been emptied out. Did you take that step with your wife today?" Xu Qinglang asked cautiously.

"You're overthinking it."

But the word "emptied out" made Zhou Ze's eyelids twitch slightly, a detail Xu Qinglang caught.

Zhou Ze looked up, at the sky above.

"Hey,

Looking at the sky won't help.

Are you feeling guilty?

Did I really guess right?"

Seeing Zhou Ze didn't answer, Xu Qinglang also looked up,

At the sky.

Then,

They saw what looked like a person in white standing at the fifth-floor glass window.

Because of the power outage, there was no light around, but the moon was bright tonight, and the color of the person's clothes was easy to distinguish in the night.

"Could they have even found someone to dress up as a ghost to set the mood?" Xu Qinglang exhaled a puff of smoke. "They're really going to extre..."

Xu Qinglang stopped speaking,

Because he saw the white figure above fall,

Very fast,

And landed less than ten meters from him and Zhou Ze.

"Thud!"

A heavy thud sounded,

A person fell face up onto the ground, unmoving. Blood slowly spread out from beneath her.

Zhou Ze felt a chill on his face,

A little blood spattered onto his cheek.

Xu Qinglang immediately ran over to check the condition of the fallen person,

While Zhou Ze reached into his pocket for a tissue, intending to wipe the blood from his face first.

Someone died... I need to save them... I need to check the situation...

Zhou Ze's eyes showed a struggle,

But his hand still trembled as he pulled out the tissue,

Slowly and carefully wiping away those few drops of blood.

"Hey, come here quickly and see if there's any chance of saving her!" Xu Qinglang looked up and shouted at Zhou Ze. Then, when he saw Zhou Ze standing there, not moving a step, just wiping his face, he roared:

"Do you have any conscience? Wiping your face at a time like this!"

Zhou Ze froze for a moment,

That's right,

His heart,

Was gone...

title: 第七十二章 第二個死者
content:
"Alright, the statement is done. You're free to go."

A young police officer closed his notebook and smiled at Zhou Ze.

Zhou Ze nodded, stood up, and prepared to leave.

Just then, the middle-aged police officer, who had been sitting beside the young officer, accompanying the statement, suddenly asked,

"Mr. Xu, your bookstore is located there, is business good?"

"Not very good," Zhou Ze answered honestly.

Many people had asked him this question; they were asking about business for the living, so Zhou Ze naturally answered in terms of business for the living.

"Then why do you continue to choose to keep that shop open there?" the middle-aged officer asked.

"I'm a live-in son-in-law. My in-laws are very rich, they don't lack money. I'm just passing the time."

The middle-aged officer was stunned for a moment, then nodded, and motioned with his hand, "You may leave. If there's anything else we need to consult you about, we'll notify you."

"My pleasure."

Zhou Ze left the interrogation room.

The young officer twirled the pen in his hand and said, "Captain Sun, this guy is quite interesting."

Yes, openly admitting to being a live-in son-in-law and to freeloading, just passing the time, indeed required a lot of courage.

"Let's go see the interrogations in other places," the middle-aged officer stood up, glancing again at Zhou Ze's retreating back. He always felt that the young man who had just sat before him gave him a feeling of being pricked by thorns.

During interrogation, the police should be the cobra, and the interrogated person the prey. The venomous snake should break through the opponent's defenses in the quickest, most precise, and ruthless way to get to the truth of the matter.

But just now, he had the illusion that his cobra, in the other's eyes, was like an ornamental snake dancing to the sound of a flute in an Indian street performer's basket.

The other party, it seemed, didn't care at all.

…………

"Out already?" Xu Qinglang had also just finished his statement and walked out. "Such bad luck, having to run to the police station in the middle of the night for a statement.

Also, that young officer was so annoying, he asked my gender three times. Is there something wrong with his brain? Can't he tell what my gender is?"

Zhou Ze glanced at Xu Qinglang,

Thinking: Don't you have any self-awareness about what you look like?

Zhou Ze and Xu Qinglang were both shop owners, and they had witnessed the fall firsthand, so they needed to give a statement. However, there was basically nothing else. The other members of the Horror Story Enthusiasts Association were all considered key suspects by the police, which was to be expected.

"Oh right, who do you think the killer is?" Xu Qinglang asked, smoking.

At this time, the sun was about to rise; it was already morning.

"That's not our concern. The police will investigate and solve the case," Zhou Ze said calmly.

"Hey, don't be so negative, alright?

Didn't you read Sherlock Holmes or Detective Conan when you were little?"

Everyone, more or less, has a little detective dream or detective complex in their hearts.

That feeling of peeling back layers of mist to find the truth, and then, like magician Lu Chen,* extravagantly spreading one's hands and dramatically shouting, "Next is the moment to witness the miracle!"

That would definitely hit a lot of people's G-spot.

"I'm not interested in people."

"Still obsessed with ghosts," Xu Qinglang said sarcastically.

"Yes, with ghosts." Zhou Ze took out his phone to call a taxi, and at the same time said, "Do you still remember what color clothes the female victim was wearing when she jumped?"

"White."

"And after she fell?"

"Red, of course." Xu Qinglang shrugged. "It looked like it was stained red with blood. Sigh, how pitiful."

"After she landed, she was wearing a red skirt to begin with," Zhou Ze reminded him. "Don't delude yourself with the 'stained with blood' trope."

Xu Qinglang nodded silently, then reached up to touch the tip of his nose, and said, "You mean, there's some secret behind this incident, it's not simply an accident or murder?"

"I don't know, but I really hope it's for that reason. Previously, the ghosts I've encountered that could cause a cold were already extremely powerful characters. If I could really encounter one that could cause an accidental death, it would be a huge harvest."

This kind of ghost, one could be worth dozens, right?

The achievement of sending it to hell could also be counted as ten or even more, right?

"You're overthinking it, aren't you? Oh, speaking of which, I forgot to mention to the police that the clothes were white at first." Xu Qinglang clapped his hands. "Maybe the key to solving the case lies in the change of clothing color. The killer must have designed some extremely clever..."

"Are you possessed by Agatha Christie or Arthur Conan Doyle?" Zhou Ze asked.

"No." Xu Qinglang looked at Zhou Ze with great resentment. "Old Zhou, I'm finding you more and more boring. You used to at least play along a bit."

"Not in the mood."

"So, are we just going back now?"

"Yes."

"Back to catch ghosts?"

"To play Ouija board."

"Why are you so childish?"

"Ever heard of... entrapment?"

………………

The bookstore wasn't sealed off, but there were many police lines set up around its perimeter, and several police officers were wandering around, searching for clues.

This made the bookstore, which already had little business from the living, even quieter.

Zhou Ze had Bai Yingying buy an Ouija board set. He searched for a seller in Tongcheng on Taobao, then had Bai Yingying take a taxi directly to pick up the goods.

Paper was spread out,

A pile of seemingly useless items was placed to one side.

Xu Qinglang squatted nearby, watching Zhou Ze busy himself, and said somewhat helplessly, "Actually, I have a few methods for summoning spirits that I think would work better than this game."

Zhou Ze shook his head and said, "It's different."

"How is it different?"

"Last night, I didn't sense anything coming," Zhou Ze looked at Xu Qinglang. "Did you sense anything?"

"Did something come over last night?"

Xu Qinglang's mind recalled the scene of the long pen sliding towards Zhou Ze when that group played Ouija.

"That must have been a coincidence. Didn't that overseas Chinese say that their activity last night was just a prelude to a confession? So, someone among them must have deliberately exerted force to point at the position behind you, which is that building, not actually at you."

"Excellent analysis." Zhou Ze reached out, lifted the paper from the floor, and then ran his fingernail over the tile, saying, "Was this also deliberate?"

Xu Qinglang's eyes immediately widened.

On the tiled floor, there was indeed a groove less than half a meter long, which might not be noticeable if one was standing.

Zhou Ze took out a pen, placed its tip on the groove, and slid it along the direction. He and Xu Qinglang also slowly turned in that direction.

Subsequently,

The position his fingertip pointed to,

was Bai Yingying, who was currently sitting behind the counter playing *King of Glory*.* Zhou Ze had been sitting there last night.

Zhou Ze threw the pen down and looked at Xu Qinglang.

Making a small groove on a tile floor, that difficulty was extraordinary.

Xu Qinglang said in disbelief, "No way, did something really get summoned last night? How come neither you nor I saw it?"

"When Director Zhao came over last time, did we realize he was already dead?

When the faceless woman disguised herself and came over last time, did we realize her true identity?"

"This..." Xu Qinglang trailed off.

Zhou Ze silently unfolded the paper again and picked up the pen. "You think, given my identity, I might not be able to summon a Ouija spirit?"

Zhou Ze was, strictly speaking, a grim reaper. He was different from the people in the Horror Story Enthusiasts Association last night.

"I don't know, but what I want to know is, did you notice something was off last night when you were sitting there watching the show?" Xu Qinglang asked, pointing at Zhou Ze.

Zhou Ze nodded,

"Although I didn't feel any special fluctuations, nor did I see anything I shouldn't have, when they pushed that pen in my direction, I felt a tremor in my heart, like something was staring at me."

"Then why didn't you tell them beforehand!"

Xu Qinglang grabbed Zhou Ze's collar directly.

"You felt something was off, something that could even make *you* feel a tremor!

When they said they were going to play that damn adventure game or confession game in the building behind, why didn't you stop them or warn them!"

Zhou Ze reached out, not pushing away Xu Qinglang's hand that was gripping him, but instead wiped the saliva off his face that Xu Qinglang had sprayed while shouting furiously. Then, he looked at Xu Qinglang:

"What does it have to do with me?"

Yes,

What did it have to do with him?

Letting go of Zhou Ze, Xu Qinglang stumbled back two steps. He suddenly felt that the person in front of him was somewhat unfamiliar.

"They are customers in my shop. According to commercial regulations, I naturally have an obligation to ensure their safety while they are reading books or having tea parties in my shop.

But since they have already left my shop, what happens next, what does it have to do with me?"

"You weren't like this before," Xu Qinglang murmured.

"What needs to be done now is not to lament the past, nor to sigh about how things have changed, but to find that hidden thing and send it to hell."

"You're keen on this?"

"This is performance. Didn't you always mock me for not having goals in life?"

"You..." Xu Qinglang licked his lips. "Alright, you can investigate slowly. I'm done serving you."

Xu Qinglang waved his hand and stormed out of the bookstore.

Bai Yingying came out with tea at this moment, looking somewhat surprised.

"Boss, did you and Mr. Xu have a fight?"

Zhou Ze didn't answer. Instead, he silently squatted down, continuing to look at the groove and the Ouija board diagram in front of him.

"Boss, I'm going to play games then," Bai Yingying placed the tea next to Zhou Ze, stuck out her tongue, and ran to the next door.

She didn't notice that Zhou Ze, squatting on the ground and looking at the Ouija board diagram, was constantly sweating on his forehead, while one hand was clutching his left chest tightly.

Damn it,

I must find that guy as soon as possible,

Otherwise, more people will die,

Damn it,

Why does it hurt so much!

When Bai Yingying entered the noodle shop, Xu Qinglang was sitting there smoking. Seeing her come in, Xu Qinglang directly said,

"Is something wrong with your boss these past two days?"

"I actually think he's become normal," Bai Yingying sat down and opened her computer.

"Become normal?" Xu Qinglang scoffed twice. "You didn't see someone fall to their death right in front of us yesterday, and he just stood there wiping his face with a tissue!"

"That person fell to his death instantly, right? Could wiping his face have saved him?"

Bai Yingying disdainfully entered the game. "He was an experienced doctor in his previous life. He could tell if someone could be saved at a glance. Instead of running over and making useless noise, it's better to wipe your face clean first."

"Hey, I'm saying, you're on his side? Are you even human!"

"Neither of us are human, actually."

"Smack!"

Just then,

The computer screen suddenly flickered, then went black.

Another power outage.

"Clang clang clang clang!"

Bai Yingying furiously hammered the keyboard. "I had a 98K upon landing, you know!"

Xu Qinglang, who had been sitting there smoking, immediately ran out of the shop,

Looked up,

At the sky,

At this moment,

By the window on the fifth floor,

Stood a man in white.

Many police officers around were frantically making calls and using walkie-talkies to urge their colleagues inside the building to stop him, while a middle-aged police chief roared,

"How did someone get into the crime scene? What are you all doing!"

"Thud!"

A dull, familiar landing sound,

Xu Qinglang stood rooted to the spot,

Staring blankly as the person fell from the air.

Everything,

Seemed exactly the same as last night.

He instinctively closed his eyes.

At this moment,

Lives were falling like dumplings,

One after another,

Worthless.

---
*Lu Chen is a famous Taiwanese magician.
*King of Glory is a popular mobile multiplayer online battle arena (MOBA) game.

title: 第七十三章 故人相逢
content:
Hearing the clamor outside, Zhou Ze, who had been squatting, slumped onto the floor. The tiled floor was cold, but colder still was his heart.

Oh, he forgot. He had no heart.

Lifting his shirt, Zhou Ze saw that the place where his heart had been excavated was now restored. It had fully recovered in just one night. This made Zhou Ze wonder if he had fallen under some illusion, and perhaps, his heart was still there.

Because he could feel his heartbeat, his body still maintained vitality, and there seemed to be nothing wrong with it.

But it seemed that some emotion had been extracted. Some of his primal reactions had been marked with a forbidden symbol, as if an invisible wall had trapped him.

Last night, he should have rushed to the deceased's side, like Xu Qinglang, even if his first reaction was that the deceased was definitely dead. But the original him would have reacted that way.

Just like a moment ago, when Xu Qinglang reprimanded him, he retorted, "What does it have to do with me?"

Actually, given his state last night—after fighting that monkey and then being inexplicably pulled to a dining table by that strange old man to savor a unique meal—he was already a bit dazed. Even if he sensed something while that group played the Ouija board game, he couldn't have made any clear reactions.

Last night, he was a startled bird, seeing enemies everywhere, and any so-called "stirring" was rather vague.

Of course, these were all excuses. Zhou Ze now clearly felt like he was undergoing "orthodontic treatment": he could still eat and drink, but he was always restricted and just felt uncomfortable.

People are like this: no matter how great the misfortune or oppression you face, as long as there's still hope before you, you'll always cling to it desperately and continue to move forward.

Zhou Ze in the orphanage was like this, Zhou Ze in the hospital was like this, and even now, he was like this.

To put it nicely, it's resilience; to put it bluntly, it's that a bad life is better than a good death.

Supporting himself with both hands, he looked up and let out a long sigh.

He hadn't made it in time.

He had been telling himself he needed to find that thing soon, catch it, throw it into hell, and earn a good performance bonus. This was definitely a lucrative one.

But he also clearly knew that until that thing was found, if one person died, there would surely be a second and a third.

Once a ghost really kills, it only becomes more insane. For a ghost, repentance means vanishing into thin air. And because of this, people would continue to mysteriously end their lives in this manner.

But Zhou Ze couldn't think that way, couldn't make that his goal to worry about, otherwise, the agonizing pain in his chest would make him wish he were dead.

Just as the old man said at the dining table: a person, once without a conscience, can't be good for anything.

Just then, his gaze fixed on the ceiling, where he saw a faint black line.

Suddenly, Zhou Ze's body trembled.

He found it. He found that thing.

It hadn't entered at all. It wasn't in this bookstore last night.

It was above. Its gaze was looking down, watching everything here!

And its extended hand even influenced the pen tip, little by little, joining the game in this manner.

This was an inconceivable method, a method beyond Zhou Ze's comprehension.

"Now, finally, no one else has to die!"

"Hiss... so painful..."

Zhou Ze, who had just stood up, had to bend down and squat again.

"Now, the performance bonus can finally be earned."

Alright, it doesn't hurt anymore.

Damn it!

...

"The deceased is Chen Yinong," Xu Qinglang said to Zhou Ze, who had just walked out, chewing betel nut.

"The guy who was going to confess last night?" Zhou Ze asked.

"Yes, that's him. I just overheard some police officers. He must have just finished giving his statement. Who knew he'd appear here right after leaving the police station, and then jump down."

The police hadn't identified any specific suspects, so after Zhou Ze and Xu Qinglang gave their statements, the others were also allowed to leave after their investigations were concluded. The only restriction was that they were not allowed to leave Tongcheng during this period.

"So he returned from the police station and committed suicide for love?" Zhou Ze sighed. "What a terrifying wedding."

"Hey, can you be more considerate with your words? The person is dead," Xu Qinglang told Zhou Ze.

"Considerate? Do you need to be considerate? I still have some冥鈔 (underworld money)<sup>1</sup>; if you need them, you can burn some," Zhou Ze shrugged.

"This idiotic method of accumulating virtue by burning underworld money, I wonder who invented it. Do you think burning underworld money can make you accumulate virtue and solve all problems?"

"That sounds like saying money is the root of all evil. Then why don't you sell all your twenty-something apartments and donate them to Project Hope<sup>2</sup>?"

"............" Xu Qinglang.

"Accompany me somewhere," Zhou Ze said.

"Where?"

Zhou Ze pointed to the tall building on the west side and said, "There."

...

This commercial center has several tall buildings, all connected by passages. Of course, with the decline of this commercial center, the businesses in these tall buildings had long since moved out. This is one manifestation of urban overdevelopment, where the construction of high-rises exceeds people's daily needs, often resulting in these massive, 'ghost' buildings, also a waste of resources.

The elevators were out of service, so Zhou Ze and Xu Qinglang had to take the stairs.

"Hey, those two jumped from across the street," Xu Qinglang reminded him. "It was across the street, directly above your shop and mine. Why are you coming here?"

Their current location was west of Zhou Ze and Xu Qinglang's shops, nearly a hundred meters away from where the suicides occurred.

"You're also a玄修 (mystic cultivator)<sup>3</sup>, so what makes even you, an insider, mistakenly believe that a ghost killing someone requires it to stand in front of them and stab them with a knife, just like a living person?" Zhou Ze retorted.

"Then what makes you so sure that thing would be here?"

"The groove on the tile."

The two had already reached the fourth floor. Zhou Ze chose a spot that was directly aligned with his shop and shortest in distance, then gently slid his index finger across the floor.

"What does this mean?" Xu Qinglang asked.

"If you're just going to be a curious baby asking 'why' next to me, I suggest you go act in a suspense TV show, because they always need a clueless assistant standing next to the protagonist, constantly asking 'why' to set up the protagonist to show off."

"Damn it, you're getting more and more sarcastic," Xu Qinglang grumbled.

"Because I've always treated you like a brother, not a woman," Zhou Ze said, patting Xu Qinglang's shoulder.

"But you don't seem particularly gentle with Bai Yingying either."

Zhou Ze made another index finger sliding motion, then said, "Actually, this should be a parallel line, do you understand?"

"You mean when that group of people played the Ouija board game last night, they really summoned something, but that thing didn't get close. Instead, it stood roughly where we are now. And then, using its finger, it controlled the movement of the pen tip, pointing at you?"

"That's right," Zhou Ze said with a slight smile. "So, that bold entity, when those amateur association members asked if they could see a ghost tonight, the pen tip was controlled to point at me. It didn't mind offending me, and it didn't even mind killing someone right next to me."

"That arrogant?"

"No, in my eyes, that means its value is greater, and the performance bonus obtained after taking it in will be even more significant. This is a big fish, a big fish that doesn't even put a鬼差 (soul reaper)<sup>4</sup> in its eyes."

"Then isn't that very dangerous?" Xu Qinglang muttered somewhat.

"That's why I called you," Zhou Ze looked at Xu Qinglang. "I said I treat you like a brother, so if the other party is terrifying, we'll die together. Isn't that romantic?"

"............" Xu Qinglang.

"Romantic my ass, you pervert!"

"It's fine, at worst, we go to hell. I've been there, I know the way."

Zhou Ze gestured again, then took out his phone to look at the line in the photo, continuing to estimate the angle in his mind, and then pointed to the roof, "On the fifth floor, it shouldn't be too far off."

"Hey, you should have at least told me earlier so I could bring some magic tools!" Xu Qinglang complained as he followed Zhou Ze up the stairs.

"Remember that night you subdued Bai Yingying, whether you had magic tools or not, it didn't make much difference."

Xu Qinglang was momentarily speechless and cursed, "You heartless bastard."

Zhou Ze paused in his steps and smiled.

Then, the two walked together to the easternmost window on the fifth floor.

This place was originally supposed to be an amusement park, but it was now covered in dust. Some unremoved machinery and facilities were still left there, creating a desolate atmosphere.

Xu Qinglang was a bit nervous, while Zhou Ze continued to walk unhurriedly.

It should be around this spot.

Suddenly, Zhou Ze stopped in front of an inflatable toy castle.

"Oh, long time no see!"

A familiar voice came from behind the inflatable bed.

Zhou Ze looked up and saw an old man in a dirty, stained Taoist robe jumping down from there.

"Brother, long time no see! I've really missed you. Come, come, let's drink tonight. My treat. I'll repay you for last time!"

The old Taoist walked over and greeted Zhou Ze.

At that moment, Xu Qinglang instinctively formed hand seals:

"天地無極，玄心正法 (Boundless Heaven and Earth, Profound Heart Orthodox Law)!"

He bit his index finger, then touched the old Taoist's glabella. The speed was incredibly fast, without any hesitation.

But what happened next shocked Xu Qinglang. The old Taoist merely glanced at Xu Qinglang twice as if nothing had happened, annoyed:

"Is this woman of yours crazy, or is this your family custom? Do you like to smear blood on people's faces when you greet them? This is even cooler than the Dai Water Splashing Festival! Come, come, allow this humble Taoist to teach you our hometown customs."

Saying that, the old Taoist reached down to scratch his crotch, as if to return Xu Qinglang's gesture.

But at that moment, Zhou Ze suddenly reached out, his nails extending, and directly grabbed the old Taoist's neck.

And in the old Taoist's hand, which had just been in his crotch, he had somehow pinched a bright yellow talisman, looking at Zhou Ze with surprise:

"Damn it... you're faster... than me..."

Zhou Ze glanced at the talisman, then exerted force with his nails. The old Taoist felt as if he had been electrocuted. Finally, with a gentle push from Zhou Ze, the old Taoist fell to the ground and rolled several times.

Ignoring the old Taoist who lay on the ground, unconscious, Zhou Ze directly leaped over the inflatable bed.

Behind the inflatable bed, lay a person, covered in injuries.

He found it. It was indeed here.

***
<sup>1</sup>冥鈔 (míngchāo): Spirit money or hell money, burned as offerings to the deceased in Chinese traditional religion.
<sup>2</sup>希望工程 (Xīwàng Gōngchéng): Project Hope, a Chinese public service project that aims to help children in poverty-stricken areas to continue their schooling.
<sup>3</sup>玄修 (xuánxiū): A term for a practitioner of mystical or esoteric arts, often related to Taoism or other forms of spiritual cultivation.
<sup>4</sup>鬼差 (guǐchāi): In Chinese folklore, a soul reaper or an emissary from the underworld, responsible for guiding or capturing souls.

title: 第七十四章 人的名樹的影
content:
This was a woman, covered by a white dress, but beneath the white dress, her body was riddled with injuries, seemingly every inch bearing different wounds, a truly shocking sight.

From Zhou Ze’s professional perspective, it was a miracle this woman was still alive.

In typical gunfight movies, tragic characters, after being shot multiple times, can summon a final surge of inner energy for a lengthy, melodramatic flashback, then repeatedly shout, “You go!” “I’m not going!” “If you don’t go, I won’t either!” before finally grabbing a gun and mowing down a few enemies. This is practically impossible in reality.

Humans are, in fact, very fragile.

The reason this woman was still alive, still breathing, with a slight rise and fall of her chest, was related to her unique nature.

Zhou Ze walked straight over, then tapped his palm with his fingernail, preparing to open the Gates of Hell.

“So direct?” Xu Qinglang asked from behind. “Aren’t you going to ask her anything?”

“Nothing to ask.”

While she was still unconscious, pulling her soul out of her body and sending it to Hell would be perfect.

However, just then, the old Taoist, whom Zhou Ze had thrown, got back up and rushed towards Zhou Ze.

Xu Qinglang stepped forward, extended his arm to block the old Taoist, then flung him aside. The old Taoist had just been “electrocuted” by Zhou Ze’s fingernails, and his body was still weak, so he was no match for Xu Qinglang.

“Don’t… don’t do this, spare her, please spare her.”

The old Taoist, lying to the side, began to plead.

But Zhou Ze was unmoved. A string, resembling black syrup, was pulled out, forming a circle.

Then, Zhou Ze reached out, intending to pull her soul from her body. Although this soul was currently very weak, Zhou Ze could already sense its formidable strength.

This was a big fish, a much plumper prey than the small fry and shrimp he had caught before!

“Buzz!”

At this moment, a fountain pen suddenly floated up and shot directly towards Zhou Ze.

Zhou Ze, quick-witted, leaned back slightly, dodging the pen. But the pen’s true target was not Zhou Ze, but Xu Qinglang. Its tip touched Xu Qinglang’s throat.

Though Xu Qinglang’s Adam’s apple was not very prominent, he now stood with his hands spread, daring not to move.

The woman on the ground still had her eyes closed. She was still in a coma, but she was controlling all of this.

“Lao Zhou, don’t rush, don’t rush!”

Xu Qinglang shouted, fearing Zhou Ze would disregard his life. After all, his life was hanging by a thread, no less than someone pointing a pistol at his temple.

However, Zhou Ze truly disregarded his life and reached for the woman’s forehead.

The pen tip, at that moment, pierced Xu Qinglang’s neck, creating a small cut, and blood began to flow.

“Ugh…” Xu Qinglang felt the pain from his neck but dared not reach for the pen. He had a premonition that if he made any sudden move, the pen would instantly pierce his neck.

The woman was still unconscious, but to Zhou Ze, it was a silent threat.

She couldn’t harm Zhou Ze, but she could threaten him with the lives of those around him.

“Those two who jumped to their deaths were very pitiful,” Zhou Ze suddenly said.

Xu Qinglang was stunned, unsure what Zhou Ze meant by suddenly bringing that up.

“You cursed me this morning for not warning them last night, and said I had changed,” Zhou Ze continued.

“Huh?” Xu Qinglang.

“So, I think you’re willing to sacrifice yourself to avenge them, right?”

“…………” Xu Qinglang.

Zhou Ze suddenly clutched his chest with one hand and pressed the other to the ground. Cold sweat broke out on his face, and he made no further moves.

The fountain pen also fell weakly to the ground. Xu Qinglang clutched the small wound on his neck, gasping for air, muttering something unintelligible.

The old Taoist quickly ran to the woman’s side, checking her condition, looking anxious and bewildered.

Zhou Ze glared at Xu Qinglang with resentment. If he had known, he wouldn’t have brought him. He had only thought that an extra person could help him find the target faster. Who would have thought Xu Qinglang would become a bargaining chip for the opponent to threaten him?

Originally, Zhou Ze should have disregarded Xu Qinglang’s life to complete his task, but he forcibly changed his mind. This caused a sharp pain in his chest, almost killing him.

Damn it,

This is a transaction, isn’t it?

Is this also about conscience?

And it hurts me?

Besides, if he dies, who will make me sour plum juice?

I’m just thinking about myself!

The old Taoist fumbled in his crotch again, pulling out a talisman. This guy’s talismans were truly inexhaustible, and he specifically liked to hide them in that spot. Who knows if there’s some special significance to it.

“Brother, I’m sorry, but I must protect this person. She finally escaped from Rongcheng, and I can’t let her fall into your hands.”

The old Taoist said to Zhou Ze, holding the talisman, finally apologizing:

“I’m sorry.”

With that, the old Taoist was about to press the talisman onto Zhou Ze.

Zhou Ze abruptly looked up, a black glint flashing in his eyes. However, before Zhou Ze could act, two figures appeared directly behind the old Taoist.

Xu Qinglang clutched his neck, but the syllables he uttered began to become clear.

The old Taoist was lifted up. He turned his head to find that a man and a woman had appeared behind him at some point—two empty human skins, yet possessing strength no less than ordinary people.

“Bang!”

“Crap!”

The old Taoist was thrown out again, crashing onto the tiled floor.

Writhed his body, clutching his waist, the old Taoist cried:

“My back…!”

Zhou Ze slowly calmed the sharp pain in his chest and raised his hand again. He knew the woman before him was very weak; her previous resistance and stalemate were the limits of what she could do.

“Brother, I beg you, spare her, let us go.”

“Let you go?” Xu Qinglang, one hand clutching his neck, the other controlling the two puppet skins, slowly walked towards the old Taoist. “Then who will settle the score for those two who jumped to their deaths?”

“Those two weren’t killed by us! We didn’t touch them! We even wanted to save them! They wanted to die themselves!” the old Taoist explained.

“Do you think we’d believe such words?” Xu Qinglang scoffed.

Seeing Xu Qinglang’s appearance, as if possessed by a “light bringer,” the old Taoist disregarded him and looked at Zhou Ze, pleading:

“Brother, she’s also one of our冥店 (Underworld Shop) people, a friend of our boss. She was injured helping my boss.”

The old Taoist remembered that when he first met Zhou Ze, Zhou Ze was quite interested in his boss’s affairs. At this point, he could only try to bring up his boss.

Zhou Ze’s hand had just touched the woman’s forehead, not yet exerting force, but upon hearing the old Taoist’s words, he immediately stopped.

She was that man’s companion?

The man who was struggling to drink porridge behind the Underworld Shop counter in the old Taoist’s live stream video?

The man who had warned him about the Faceless Woman’s scheme by the pool in his dream?

He owed him a favor.

“Hiss…”

His chest began to ache again.

Zhou Ze took deep breaths repeatedly, then retreated two steps, staggering to his feet.

Fortunately, the pain did not last too long, but every time he made a choice that went against the principle of self-interest, whenever he started to be burdened by personal relationships, it would remind him.

Like a venomous scorpion, always hidden in his chest.

There was a famous monkey cage electric shock experiment.

Perhaps, the cost and purpose of having no conscience were like this: to make you develop a conditioned fear reflex, and then slowly break your old “bad” habits.

“You didn’t actually believe him, did you?” Xu Qinglang looked at Zhou Ze.

Zhou Ze waved his hand.

“Hey, who’d be stupid enough to jump to their death one after another? You even said earlier…”

“I trust that guy.” Zhou Ze glanced at Xu Qinglang, then looked at the old Taoist. “Take the person with you. Don’t appear before me again.”

The reputation of a man precedes him. Zhou Ze no longer believed that the incident of the two lovers jumping to their deaths on consecutive days was the woman’s doing. This woman might have participated in the Ouija Board game and acted in it, but she was definitely not killing people.

The little loli once said that the man in Rongcheng had gone too far, acting as a judge, operating outside human law to carry out his so-called righteous judgments, which led to a ban from the Underworld.

Therefore, a friend of such a person could not be a casually murderous evil spirit. Otherwise, with that guy’s personality, he would be the first to kill the woman himself.

This deduction was truly more credible than any so-called evidence, because even when the little loli spoke of that person, she only mocked his overconfidence but never spoke ill of his personal character.

The old Taoist immediately got up, clutching his waist, profusely thanking him. But when he reached the woman, he grimaced and said:

“Brother, we have nowhere to go! She told me to bring her here, thinking that by staying close to you, we could hide in plain sight and those who are after her wouldn’t notice us here.

If I take her away now, wouldn’t it be like walking into a trap?”

“You… are being hunted?” Zhou Ze asked.

“Uh, something like that. Anyway, those guys are elusive; they can pop out anywhere—from mirrors, crowds, even bushes, underground. We were lucky to escape alive.”

“That’s pointless. Her injuries have severely worsened, and she won’t last much longer,” Zhou Ze rubbed his fingers. “Once this physical body is destroyed, if she remains purely in soul form, she’ll either be discovered quickly or fall directly into Hell.”

“We went to a hospital earlier to try and treat the injuries, but as soon as we entered the room, the doctor, who seemed perfectly normal, stripped off his clothes and turned into a hideous creature intent on killing us.”

The old Taoist said, looking very troubled.

“It was only in these two days, staying near you, that we’ve found some peace.”

“I can’t help you,” Zhou Ze shrugged.

He admired the man from Rongcheng, and the favor he owed him had been repaid by turning a blind eye this time. He was unwilling to cause any more complications; otherwise, next time, the little loli would come with a group of ghost officers directly to his bookstore.

At this moment, the fountain pen that had fallen to the ground suddenly stood upright. Xu Qinglang’s face changed, showing alertness.

But the pen merely wrote a few words on the ground:

“Save me, I’ll give you my heart.”

Seeing these words, Zhou Ze’s gaze suddenly sharpened.

“Shameless hussy!

How confident is this woman in her looks? Save you and you’ll give your heart to whom?”

Xu Qinglang scoffed from the side, “No matter how beautiful you were before, in this monstrous state, what idiot would want your heart?!”

“I would.”

“What?” Xu Qinglang was stunned, looking at Zhou Ze. It was as if, at this moment, Xu Qinglang truly saw Zhou Ze clearly. Doctor Lin was so beautiful, yet he could pass her door three times without entering. It turned out he had this kind of taste.

“Brother, didn’t you just say there was no way?” the old Taoist asked, puzzled.

“Oh, I forgot. I just remembered, in my past life, I was Tongcheng’s best surgeon.”

title: 第七十五章 唐詩
content:
"Hey, Zhou Ze, you've changed. Are you still human? You're the one who said she killed those two people before, and now you're the one who wants to save her! One minute you want me to go with you to catch the killer, the next you want me to help you move the killer back.

What exactly do you take me for?!"

Back in the bookstore, Xu Qinglang muttered, directly pointing at Zhou Ze's back.

No, to be precise, ever since they came down from the building, Xu Qinglang hadn't stopped his verbal assault, rambling on like he was scolding a scumbag husband who had been out fooling around for several nights, not coming home, and not even providing living expenses.

Bai Yingying sat behind the counter, playing on her phone. She didn't dare to open the computer to play games now; the occasional power cuts were truly unbearable.

Zhou Ze hadn't intended to pay attention to Xu Qinglang; he didn't have the time. But Xu Qinglang seemed to be addicted to running his mouth, so Zhou Ze turned around, pointed a finger directly at the other's nose, and said:

"What do I take you for? Haven't you heard the saying, 'No investigation, no right to speak'?

I don't know her, but I know her friend. I owe that person a favor. I'm just asking you, is that reason good enough?"

"What about those two who died..."

"Do I know those two who died?" Zhou Ze retorted, "What do they have to do with me? Am I Joan of Arc or Hai Rui? Do I demand the locals build me a temple for my merits and incense?

I'm just an unlucky ghost, bought by an idiot who ran me over and killed me, and then by some twist of fate, I possessed this idiot's body!

I'm not a human; I'm just a ghost. So please, Xu-boss, with your twenty-something apartments, don't use your set of universal values to demand things of me!

You want me to sacrifice? You want me to pursue truth and reality?

Then please, when that pen was poking your neck just now, yell: 'Fire at me!'

You can't even do it yourself, and you have the nerve to criticize others?

I'm a ghost. For a long time, I didn't even have a legal identity. Under such circumstances, you still demand that I be 'for all,' but when will 'all' be for me?"

"You..."

"What 'you'? Didn't you yourself violate the rules to forcibly keep your parents' souls here to enjoy some kind of family reunion atmosphere?

When you were doing that, why didn't you think about how many families who lost loved ones in this world don't get that kind of treatment?

I don't care if she killed anyone or not. The favor I owe that person in Rongcheng is enough for me to turn a blind eye!

I don't care if she's the killer or not. She promised to find my heart, so I'm willing to help her heal!

It's that simple!

So, please, take your arrogance, your self-righteousness, your high-mindedness, and roll smoothly to the next room!"

Zhou Ze finished these words in one breath, letting out a long sigh. To be honest, he had been very annoyed lately, especially after the Monkey incident. Truly, very, very annoyed.

He shouldn't have meddled. He could have even covered his eyes and pretended not to see anything, so he wouldn't have to make any choices, and that old hag wouldn't have taken his heart.

Learning from the ostrich, burying his head in the sand, sticking his rear up, waddling around,

Shouting, "This world is so beautiful, so beautiful, so beautiful!"

How good would that be,

How comfortable.

Xu Qinglang swallowed hard. Faced with Zhou Ze's verbal counterattack, he was somewhat at a loss.

The atmosphere suddenly turned cold.

Bai Yingying had been watching for a long time, not daring to interject.

Xu Qinglang pointed a finger at Zhou Ze, his despair greater than a broken heart, truly like a gale-torn begonia, somewhat disheveled. Then he flicked his sleeve and turned to walk towards the door, but stopped when he pushed open the glass door and said:

"What do you want for lunch?"

"Tomato beef rice bowl with strawberry juice, please," Zhou Ze replied without hesitation.

"Okay."

Xu Qinglang left to go make food.

Bai Yingying stuck out her tongue, then covered her nose.

Zhou Ze looked at her, "If you want to say you smell something sour again, then the toilet is clogged again. Brush the toilet three more times."

Bai Yingying immediately shook her head, "It smells sweet."

Just then, a van stopped in front of the bookstore.

"Go move the things."

Under Zhou Ze's command, Bai Yingying went out and carried two boxes in. The van dropped the things off and left.

"What's in here?" Bai Yingying asked.

"Simple surgical instruments." Zhou Ze opened one of the boxes and took out a pair of gloves, putting them on.

"Boss, how did you get these delivered?"

"I was a doctor in my last life."

"Uh, and then?"

"Then, of course, I know which director smuggles medical equipment, takes kickbacks, and enriches himself. It's quite simple to make a call and threaten him, making him send over some inexpensive instruments."

"You can do that?" Bai Yingying was stunned, taking a while to react.

"Bring the things upstairs." Zhou Ze said, then went upstairs first.

On the mat on the second floor, the woman lay there, and the old Daoist priest squatted beside her, a cigarette in his mouth. When Zhou Ze came over, the old Daoist priest said somewhat worriedly:

"Brother, do you have a plan?"

"Then you can send her to the hospital and be discovered by those ghost officers."

The old Daoist priest said nothing more.

Bai Yingying carried one box in each hand, not bothered at all. Sometimes Zhou Ze would feel he was losing out; if he had opened a construction team instead of a bookstore, having Bai Yingying as an employee would definitely be a profit, saving on excavators and bulldozers and the like.

Everything was ready. After sterilizing the instruments, Zhou Ze began to prepare for the surgery.

"Brother, no anesthesia?" the old Daoist priest reminded from the side.

"She doesn't need anesthesia. Her mental fortitude is terrifying."

Zhou Ze shook his head and directly used scissors to cut open the wound that had been hastily bandaged after the woman's injury.

These wounds were not poorly treated, but the injuries themselves were unusual; ordinary bandaging would have no effect.

"That's true. They say she once went half a year without sleep and still pulled through," the old Daoist priest mumbled beside them.

Zhou Ze propped open a wound on her left arm, then poked inside with forceps. The woman remained unresponsive; she seemed to be in a deep sleep.

Immediately after, Zhou Ze used the forceps to pull out a black feather from inside the wound and dropped it onto the metal tray Bai Yingying was holding.

"Clink..."

The feather was very soft, but it made a crisp sound when it fell.

"This humble Daoist remembers that this feather should come from a black feather duster. A pale-faced guy in black clothes chased us with it."

"Black Wuchang?" Zhou Ze asked.

"Don't know, a bit like it," the old Daoist priest replied.

Zhou Ze was noncommittal and continued to clean the wound.

Good heavens,

Who knows how many strange things were embedded in this woman's body?

In the following time, Zhou Ze successively extracted broken talismans, dart blades carved with runes, and let out silver mercury fluid. It was like opening a general store; there was everything.

Bai Yingying and the old Daoist priest on the side watched, their eyes wide with amazement.

During the process, although the remaining debris inside the wounds was cleaned out one by one, for this body, it was no less than a secondary injury. Therefore, Zhou Ze was also constantly monitoring the woman's condition.

Finally, when Zhou Ze removed two pieces of red broken glass from the wound on the woman's lower abdomen, he noticed a faint black mist rising from her body, and a shadow seemed to be floating out.

Only Zhou Ze could see this phenomenon.

This was a sign that the body was almost collapsing and unable to sustain the soul. Interpreted from a scientific perspective, it meant that the patient was about to die from ineffective rescue.

Zhou Ze's right fingernail grew longer, and he directly grabbed the black shadow, pushing it back into her body.

"Mm..."

A faint sound, almost imperceptible, was heard.

"Just hold on a little longer. There are a few more wounds that need to be treated, and then apply some medicine. If you get through this, your body will slowly recover."

This was the most unique surgery Zhou Ze had ever performed in his medical career. Not to mention the complexity of the patient's injuries, just the fact that he was simultaneously treating and pushing the patient's nearly-departing soul back into her body, if publicized, would shock the entire medical community.

This was almost like cheating, like playing an arcade game where you have countless coins to continuously revive yourself.

Of course, Zhou Ze also knew that this was also because the woman's soul was inherently strong. An ordinary person's soul might withstand one such ordeal, but repeated instances would likely lead to immediate collapse.

From this perspective, the woman's resilience was indeed terrifying.

Zhou Ze even felt a bit curious: if a woman beside him was so resilient and terrifying, what kind of person was that fellow stirring up trouble in Rongcheng himself?

Birds of a feather flock together, after all.

After treating the last wound and applying the medicine, Zhou Ze let out a long sigh.

Next, it would be up to her own willpower to endure. Once her body slowly recovered, the problem shouldn't be too big.

In fact, if that old geezer who had dug out his heart was still around, getting some medicine from him would be best. Zhou Ze's own chest wound had already healed, without even a scar.

Of course, Zhou Ze sometimes wondered if the other party had truly cut him open and dug out his heart.

Or perhaps, he had just been under some kind of illusion, but then where did that feeling of pain come from whenever he tried to go against his own interests and do something else?

The woman was settled upstairs. The old Daoist priest went to the restaurant next door for a meal, and Bai Yingying went to play games. Only Zhou Ze remained, checking on the woman's condition.

About a few hours later, Zhou Ze, who was sitting by the side reading a book, suddenly noticed the woman's eyelids move, and then he saw her open her eyes.

The woman was looking at him,

He was also looking at the woman.

"How do you feel?" Zhou Ze asked.

The woman nodded slightly, indicating that her body was recovering.

"Heh, what's your name?" Zhou Ze asked.

The woman was silent for a long time. Just as Zhou Ze was wondering if her physical condition didn't allow her to speak, the woman opened her mouth:

"Tang... Shi..."

"My name is..." Zhou Ze paused, then asked with a bit of curiosity:

"When you introduce yourself to others, do you often encounter jokers who reply that their name is Song Ci?"

title: 第七十六章 不要浪費
content:
The days passed unhurriedly, neither quickly nor slowly, for three more days.

During these three days, Xu Qinglang was busy looking for a new shop. This long-abandoned commercial center had already seen two deaths. Setting up a shop here again would simply be asking for trouble. He had consulted Zhou Ze about whether he would be willing to move with him, and he could help Zhou Ze find a new storefront as well. Zhou Ze's response to this was noncommittal.

On one hand, Zhou Ze didn't really care much about the living human traffic around the bookstore. But on the other hand, without the juices prepared by Xu Qinglang, eating would become a problem again.

Another thing happened during these three days: the police found suicide notes at both Mr. Chen and Ms. Liu's homes, along with their wedding photos.

However, the wedding photos were black and white, and the contents of the suicide notes were even harder for ordinary people to comprehend.

They had agreed to commit suicide together, in a terrifying manner, to end their lives. In their suicide notes, they apologized for the trouble and investigation caused to other members of the Horror Story Enthusiasts Association, stating at the same time that this was the true horror story.

They had met because of their love for "horror," so naturally, they had to prove their love in the most "horrifying" way.

These messages also spread online, causing a public outcry and reigniting debate. Many prominent online personalities once again wielded their whips to criticize horror and suspense films and novels, saying, "Look, this is misleading; these things should be banned."

But in reality, what should be banned are ancient love stories like "Liang Shanbo and Zhu Yingtai," because these stories glorified the theme of suicide, leading to continuous emulation of suicide in later generations.

The woman named Tang Shi had stayed upstairs. After her injuries were treated, she waited for three days. Zhou Ze finally came to her and said that he had done what he promised, and now it was her turn to fulfill her part of the agreement.

"Those two, they really committed suicide, right?"

Tang Shi was still lying there, bandaged in many places, looking like a female mummy. There was no way to consider aesthetics, simply because her original injuries were too severe and too numerous.

"Yes," Zhou Ze nodded.

"When they were playing the Ouija board game, I sensed it," Tang Shi looked at Zhou Ze. "At the time, I found it very interesting. They wanted to see a ghost but didn't realize that the owner of the bookstore they were in was a ghost, and a ghost messenger at that.

In fact, on the first night, when that woman was about to jump, I tried to control the white dress on me to stop her, but her mind was made up, and I was very weak, so I couldn't stop her. She still jumped."

Zhou Ze said nothing.

"Ignorant men and women always think death is a beautiful thing, but I guess they must be regretting it bitterly in hell now. Hell is a very terrifying place, enough to make most suicide victims regret their past foolish selves."

Saying that, Tang Shi paused, then continued, "You are much luckier than us; you haven't experienced the true horror of hell."

"It's time to get down to business," Zhou Ze reminded her.

"Your heart, is that it?" Tang Shi asked.

"Otherwise?"

"Don't you think your heart is gone?"

Zhou Ze nodded.

"But it can't be gone. There are many incredible things in this world, but generally, there's a line that balances things out.

For example, my injuries, as you've seen, those ghost messengers who escaped from the underworld, they left behind black feathers, mercury, talismans, and such on me. Their image appears mysterious and noble to ordinary people;

But in reality, just like even a goddess eventually needs to use the restroom, setting aside their mysterious ability to enter and exit hell, they are actually very ordinary.

Even, they are far from having the ability to move mountains and fill oceans as described in so-called superhero movies or cultivation fantasy novels.

Of course, I'm not saying no one has this ability, but I'm certain that any being with such an ability cannot leave hell."

"So, what exactly are you trying to say?" Zhou Ze asked.

"Regarding the matter of you losing your heart, you told me that you shouldn't be able to eat, just like us. These past few days, I've seen you eat only with extremely sweet and sour drinks, barely swallowing."

Zhou Ze nodded.

"But you said that when you ate your own heart, you didn't feel the slightest discomfort; you even found it a bit delicious."

"Are you saying that what I ate wasn't actually my heart? No, that I wasn't eating anything substantial at all."

Zhou Ze quickly understood and continued, "The meal, the table, the knife and fork, in fact, were all fake, all an illusion."

Tang Shi nodded slightly. She seemed a bit tired, but still spoke:

"No matter how mysterious or terrifying an existence is, they don't have the ability to bring flesh to dry bones, much less to turn decay into wonder and extract a heart from a body while keeping its physical form as vital as before.

So, you must have been hypnotized, a very profound hypnosis, one from which you couldn't extricate yourself."

"Hypnosis?"

"Yes, hypnosis. The dining environment, every word, every action of the other person, all of it was giving you psychological suggestions. Otherwise, why wouldn't he just pick up some firewood by the roadside and have a barbecue with you?"

Zhou Ze nodded. In fact, Tang Shi's words largely coincided with his own previous suspicions.

For example, every time he made a choice that went against his immediate interests, his chest would ache. But as long as he endured it for a while, he could still continue with his original choice.

Because he subconsciously believed that he had no conscience, every time he did something based on "conscience," he would remind himself:

Oh, I shouldn't do this, and then it would hurt.

It was like someone who had suffered hardship in childhood and had psychological trauma; when they encountered similar situations or scenes again, it would still cause physical and mental discomfort.

"So, I should see a psychologist?"

"I know a very skilled psychologist who can help you solve your problem," Tang Shi said.

"That one?" Zhou Ze naturally thought of who it was.

"As long as he can come back alive, he can solve your problem."

"Who knows where he's run off to now?"

"He didn't run," Tang Shi corrected him, "He went to find them."

The conversation ended there. As Zhou Ze prepared to go downstairs, Tang Shi said again, "Can you call that female zombie up?"

"What for?"

"To let her sleep with me."

"I'll ask her if she agrees."

Downstairs, Bai Yingying was playing a mobile game behind the counter. Zhou Ze ignored her, and he didn't ask Bai Yingying for the woman upstairs's opinion. He just walked out of the store and hailed a cab.

A psychologist, he really did know a very good one.

Last time, Wang Ke had told him that he wouldn't seek Zhou Ze out again, but if Zhou Ze needed anything, he could come to him.

He was right, after all.

It was already eleven in the morning when the cab reached the entrance of Wang Ke's villa. Zhou Ze pressed the doorbell.

The door opened, and Wang Ke, dressed in pajamas, appeared at the doorway. He was surprised to see Zhou Ze, then motioned for Zhou Ze to come in.

The smell of meat wafted from inside the house; something was simmering in the kitchen.

"Want to eat something?" Wang Ke suggested. "Just bought some big bones, been simmering for a long time. I remember when we were kids at the orphanage, it wasn't easy to get a meal with meat."

Zhou Ze shook his head. "I don't have much of an appetite."

"It's okay, then just have some soup. By the way, you came to see me for something, didn't you?"

"I was hypnotized. The hypnotist told me I had no conscience. Now, I want to get my conscience back," Zhou Ze said straightforwardly.

Wang Ke frowned, looking somewhat awkward and uneasy, and said,

"I tried last time, but I couldn't hypnotize you. You said you couldn't sleep under normal circumstances, so the most direct and effective method, I can't use on you. I'll have to try a roundabout approach to see if it works."

"Give it a try."

The two went to Wang Ke's study.

Wang Ke changed into a formal suit and sat behind his desk, then handed Zhou Ze a pocket watch.

"You use this to swing in front of me to try and hypnotize me. Then we can establish a reverse psychological connection."

Zhou Ze didn't hesitate, immediately holding the pocket watch and swinging it in front of Wang Ke.

Wang Ke watched very intently. As he watched, he closed his eyes.

At the same time, Zhou Ze also felt a little tired, as if Wang Ke's "sleep" at this moment had more or less affected him.

"Are you asleep?" Zhou Ze asked.

Wang Ke didn't answer.

"What's your name?"

"Wang Ke."

It was a very novel feeling. Zhou Ze didn't have much experience in this area, but at this moment, he seemed not to need any experience.

"You..."

Suddenly, Zhou Ze felt his vision blur. Vaguely, he seemed to hear a man asking him:

"Do you think you need a conscience?"

Zhou Ze was a bit confused, but still said, "Doing good things might not lead to good outcomes."

"So, deep down, you're actually very resistant to the behaviors you've always upheld," the man's voice came again.

Next, there was a long conversation. Zhou Ze himself felt somewhat bewildered, as if the dialogue and questions had nothing to do with him.

In front of him, there was a pot, with soup simmering inside, boiling big bones. The aroma of the soup was rich.

*Thump!*

The pocket watch fell from Zhou Ze's hand onto the floor.

Zhou Ze slowly opened his eyes.

Wang Ke, behind the desk, also opened his eyes, which were bloodshot and looked very tired.

"Was it successful?" Zhou Ze asked.

Wang Ke nodded, then shook his head, apologizing:

"Your problem is a bit complex. Actually, the one truly struggling with whether or not to have a conscience is yourself. Perhaps some recent events have shaken your original beliefs, and with external forces pushing, it formed a knot in your heart."

Zhou Ze nodded at the words, lost in thought.

"By the way, did you ask me anything?" Wang Ke suddenly asked.

This kind of hypnosis was inherently reciprocal. In fact, Wang Ke was performing a shallow hypnosis on Zhou Ze, while Wang Ke, on the other hand, had completely bared his soul to Zhou Ze.

"I didn't ask, because I only saw a pot of meat soup. Are you very hungry?"

"Yes, hungry," Wang Ke nodded.

Immediately, Wang Ke pulled Zhou Ze into the kitchen and opened the pressure cooker, where spare ribs were stewing.

"Come, let's eat a little together, just like reliving childhood."

Zhou Ze suddenly felt a bit unreal.

A wealthy psychologist happily stewing a pot of spare ribs for himself at home; this scene always felt a bit off.

In fact, Zhou Ze even felt a slight nausea and revulsion in his chest.

"I'm not eating."

Zhou Ze subconsciously stepped back a few paces, retreating from the kitchen.

Wang Ke, meanwhile, was meticulously preparing the dipping sauce, saying, "Accompany your brother and eat a little."

"You eat it yourself," Zhou Ze still refused, his gaze occasionally sweeping towards the pressure cooker and the spare ribs tumbling within it.

"Don't be shy, this is meat I carefully selected; it's definitely going to taste good," Wang Ke continued to invite.

"Where's sister-in-law?" Zhou Ze asked.

Wang Ke's hand, holding the plate, suddenly trembled, and his expression became somewhat unnatural,

but he still said, "She went to get her hair done."

"Oh," Zhou Ze said noncommittally.

Then, Zhou Ze looked at the pressure cooker again.

The nausea and revulsion in his chest seemed to be intensifying.

"Honey, are you cooking meat soup again?" At this moment, a woman's voice came from the entryway.

Zhou Ze turned his head and saw her. A feeling of a great weight being lifted off his shoulders suddenly came over him.

I was overthinking it.

"Yeah, this is my only hobby," Wang Ke said with a cheerful laugh.

The woman walked beside Zhou Ze, saying somewhat helplessly, "Isn't it incredible? A master psychologist's hobby is finding free time to simmer a pot of meat soup for himself, even if he can't actually eat it, he still enjoys the sense of satisfaction."

"It's alright," Zhou Ze pursed his lips. "Conditions weren't good when we were little, so we're fulfilling a dream now that we're grown."

"Here, have a bowl."

Wang Ke scooped a bowl of soup, sprinkled it with minced garlic and chopped green onions, added two drops of sesame oil, and some white pepper.

Zhou Ze picked up the bowl of soup, hesitating whether to force himself to drink some,

but then he suddenly noticed,

the woman standing beside him,

she was walking on her tiptoes,

one step, two steps, three steps,

she walked to the pressure cooker, helped Wang Ke scoop more soup, and at the same time, admonished him:

"Eat more, don't waste it."

title: 第七十七章 別減肥了！
content:
Should I drink this soup?

Zhou Ze furrowed his brow slightly, then put the bowl down and looked at Wang Ke, and at Wang Ke’s wife.

Wang Ke’s wife pulled up a chair and sat down, then massaged her heel, complaining:

“Hubby, my heel still isn’t better.”

“Who told you to be so careless? It’s a blessing your bone is fine.”

Wang Ke carefully examined his wife’s heel, smiled, and said:

“You should go back to your room and rest. Don’t run around outside these days. It really looks tiring for you to be walking on tiptoe all the time, especially in high heels.”

“Alright, alright, wasn’t I just trying to make myself look better so you’d enjoy looking at me at home?”

The woman rolled her eyes at her husband, then smiled slightly at Zhou Ze, “You two chat, I’m going up now.”

After the woman left, Wang Ke pointed to the bowl Zhou Ze had just put down, reminding him:

“The soup’s getting cold.”

Zhou Ze, however, took out a cigarette, lit it, and paid no mind to being in someone else’s home, smoking leisurely.

After a while, Zhou Ze asked:

“What do you mean?”

“Just on a whim.” Wang Ke shook his head, then pointed to the pot of meat soup, saying: “Did you previously think that this pot of meat soup contained human flesh?”

Zhou Ze didn’t speak.

Wang Ke also took out a cigarette, lit it using the stove flame, and said:

“This is psychological suggestion. Everyone encounters situations of psychological suggestion to varying degrees in their daily lives. For example, you just left home, and suddenly an auntie next to you tells her child to lock the door after people leave, or the house will be stolen.

You will subconsciously reflect on whether you actually locked the door, then repeatedly recall and agonize, and finally run back to personally check if the door is indeed locked.

This is relatively common and simple. A slightly more advanced form operates continuously through repeated psychological suggestion behaviors and consciousness, thereby achieving this effect.

For instance, you believe that I, of all people, cooked a pot of human flesh soup in my own kitchen, and you dare not drink it.”

Wang Ke shrugged,

“Is it absurd? Yes, it’s very absurd, but you believed it. That’s the most absurd part, yet it’s also the most normal thing.”

Zhou Ze asked, “Is this also part of the treatment?”

Wang Ke shook his head, “No, this isn’t an illness. We psychologists rarely refer to psychological problems as ‘illnesses.’ This is your own inner knot.

Just like why you would think I would cook human flesh, this psychological suggestion has actually been going on for a long time. For example, my wife here, who always likes to go out to get her hair done but her hairstyle never really changes when she comes back.

You think I have a motive to kill her. What’s the reason?

I was cheated on. She found another man outside, giving me a cute green hat.”

“Cute…”

“Alright, we can ignore the adjective ‘cute’ for now, but undeniably, this was the biggest suggestion that led you to mistakenly believe I was cooking my wife’s flesh at home.

Because you thought I already knew about it, and in fact, I did know about it long ago. Then you naturally assumed I would be angry. Well, I was indeed very angry.

After that, you believed I had a motive to kill her and eat her flesh, because I should vent my anger in that way.

Of course, there were also some auxiliary suggestions, such as my identity. My greatest hobby is cooking a large pot of meat soup that I, alone, cannot possibly finish, simply to satisfy a childhood regret of not being able to eat enough meat when conditions were poor in the orphanage.

This contrast made it difficult for you to accept, and your brain naturally began to form your own line of thought, a line of thought that you felt could be explained.

That is what we often call your perceived ‘truth,’ just like many online bystanders. A very simple event can often be exploited and amplified by those with ulterior motives, based on this very reason.

Everyone has a Shakespeare and a Sherlock Holmes living inside them.”

Wang Ke picked up a piece of meat with his chopsticks, dipped it in the sauce, then put it into his mouth and chewed with his eyes closed.

“Are you really not going to eat? It’s very delicious. I remember you used to fight with me over meat when we were in the orphanage.”

“In the end, you always left your drumstick for me,” Zhou Ze said.

“Haha, who told you you were younger than me, who told you to call me big brother?” Wang Ke waved his hand indifferently, “Actually, at that time, I really loved eating meat too, but I always couldn’t get enough.

Now I have the means to eat as much as I want, but every time I excitedly and wholeheartedly prepare a large pot, I get full after only a little.

My body isn’t as good as it used to be. I’m not the young man I once was, and ever since I started working, my living conditions have also gradually improved.

Now, instead, I feel that watching you eat my share of the drumstick at the orphanage when we were kids was the most delicious.”

Wang Ke picked up another piece of meat, put it into his mouth, and after eating it, let out a sigh.

Zhou Ze exhaled a smoke ring, saying nothing, just leaning silently against the kitchen wall, watching the white smoke billowing inside, watching the middle-aged man’s vicissitudes and sighs.

“Let’s talk about your problem. Actually, the problem still lies with you. Honestly, wasn’t it most comfortable when you were a doctor before?

No matter what problems you encountered at work, no matter the infighting, no matter the exclusion and suppression,

When a patient was sent to you, treating and saving lives was always the right thing to do.

It aligned with the nature of your work and with the moral ethics of human society.

The phrase ‘doctors have a parent’s heart’ allowed you to disregard the patient’s identity, their personality, what they had done before, whether they were good or bad, rich or poor.

As long as they were sent to you, the only thing you had to do was cure them.

But now, you’ve encountered decision-making paralysis. In some choices, you need to consider more situations, and you have to gauge the appropriate extent yourself, which makes you very uncomfortable and troubled.

You want to stubbornly be yourself, like a character in a Wuxia novel, free and unrestrained, but you are also inevitably bound by the immediate struggles.

Actually, this is the normal state for most people, Ah Ze. You used to live a bit too self-centeredly. You and I both grew up in an orphanage. We both suffered childhood misfortunes and endured the pressure and low self-esteem of missing family in our youth.

In fact, both of us have some psychological issues to varying degrees. These were seeds, and now they have blossomed in you.

You say your conscience is gone, but it is actually still there. You are instinctively rejecting it, instinctively disliking it, but you can’t let go of it.

So your subconscious created this situation: your conscience was eaten by you, and thus you can perfectly ignore it.”

“How do I solve it?” Zhou Ze asked.

“Unless a master psychologist emerges who can completely transcend your consciousness and break the shackles in your mind, allowing you to be hypnotized without resistance.

Otherwise, you can only slowly wear it down yourself. Perhaps you wear it down, or it wears you down.”

Wang Ke took another sip of soup. It must have been delicious, as a look of satisfaction appeared on his face. “Big brother’s skill isn’t enough, or rather, I might have some ways with ordinary people’s psychological problems, but you’re not ordinary.”

Zhou Ze nodded, “So, all of this can only take its natural course?”

“You don’t have to resist it. Instead, you can accept it, even treat it as a person, as your other side.” Wang Ke tried to offer his solution, “What I’m saying is a bit abstract. It’s best if you can understand it, but it’s fine if you can’t. Letting nature take its course is also an option.”

Putting down his bowl and chopsticks, Wang Ke and Zhou Ze walked into the living room. Wang Ke brewed another pot of tea.

The local news of Tongcheng was playing on the TV. Coincidentally, a face somewhat familiar to Zhou Ze appeared in the news—a simple, honest face. He was crying, he was raging.

However, most of the news had already been broadcast; this was the end.

Wang Ke saw Zhou Ze watching the news and explained: “This matter has been widely discussed recently. His son got leukemia, and he wanted to find his second daughter, who he gave away years ago. After mobilizing the media, he finally found her.

But the second daughter and her adoptive parents refused to donate. He and his wife went to confront them, blocking them at their community gate and yelling at their daughter for being heartless. Then they even went to the second daughter’s high school to put up big-character posters, listing her faults and forcing her to come out and donate.”

“Oh.”

Zhou Ze picked up his tea and took a sip.

“These days, all sorts of strange things are happening,” Wang Ke lamented.

Zhou Ze looked at Wang Ke and said, “Actually, they happened before too, but there wasn’t such a developed information network back then.”

“Are you implying something?”

“No.”

“Don’t look down on your big brother,” Wang Ke suddenly said seriously.

Zhou Ze shook his head.

“Everyone has their own difficulties. I don’t want to, but I can see the bigger picture.”

“I’m leaving. Thank you for your diagnosis today.”

“Don’t mention it. I told you, I won’t look for you again, but you can always come to me if you need anything.”

Accompanied by Wang Ke, Zhou Ze walked out of his house and looked back at his second-floor balcony. The little loli wasn’t there.

Yes,

The little loli couldn’t be there. She must have already gone to Rongcheng with the Faceless Woman and the other ghost messengers.

He hailed a taxi, got in, and the driver turned around: “Buddy, where to?”

“Take me to the unholiest place you know.”

Zhou Ze felt he should proactively go out and do something, get some performance.

“Oh, are you a writer, buddy? Looking for inspiration?”

“Something like that.”

“Alright, I actually know a place.”

The driver guaranteed to find a good spot for Zhou Ze, a place that had been eerie lately, so much so that most people wouldn’t dare to pass by at night.

And then,

The driver dropped Zhou Ze off at the entrance of “Midnight Bookstore.”

That damn crow appeared again, cawing as it slowly flew through the air. It seemed very adept at appearing when it was most needed.

A gentle breeze stirred fallen leaves, making them swirl at Zhou Ze’s feet with a rustling sound.

Zhou Ze looked back at the taxi that had already driven away,

Suddenly feeling he should talk to Xu Qinglang about moving.

…

Pushing open the bedroom door, Wang Ke walked into the bedroom. His wife was lying on the bed playing with her phone. Seeing her husband approach, she changed into a graceful posture.

“He left?”

“Yes, he left.” Wang Ke smiled and sat down by the bed, reaching out to caress his wife’s cheek, saying:

“You’ve lost weight, too thin. You’re not as delicious.”

“Oh, you men are all the same. You want your wife to have a good figure to save face when you take her out, and you want her to have a little flesh in bed to make you comfortable.”

“Getting old, lean meat gets stuck in your teeth.”

As he spoke,

Wang Ke used his finger to pick out some meat threads from between his teeth,

“Don’t diet anymore.”

title: 第七十八章 要幹什麼！
content:
Xu Qinglang's shop was currently closed, but not entirely; the rolling shutter was halfway down, and Bai Yingying was inside playing a game.

Zhou Ze had heard that the game called "PUBG" seemed to have many cheats, where cheats were referred to as "Immortals." Because of the rampant cheats, the game also earned the nickname "War of Exterminating Immortals" (a pun on "War of Many Immortals").

But looking at Bai Yingying, who was completely engrossed, Zhou Ze suddenly felt very sorry for the players of this game, because they might not know that in this game, their opponents weren't just cheat-using "Immortals," but also real zombies!

Xu Qinglang should be looking for a new shop location, and Zhou Ze decided to do the same. If money was short, he could borrow from Xu Qinglang for now. Besides, the girl who had given him her business card last time had also mentioned the idea of investing.

In short, if he let go of his so-called high-mindedness, money would be easy to raise.

This place was truly unlivable. Perhaps in a while, it wouldn't just be taxi drivers; Zhou Ze might look out from the shop and see a large bus pulling up.

A director would lead a group of tourists off the bus, and the tour guide would wave a small flag and explain with a megaphone:

"Travelers, friends, travelers, friends, we have arrived at our next scenic spot.

Tongcheng has Langshan, known as one of the Ten Lesser Buddhist Mountains, but Tongcheng also has 'The Midnight Bookstore,' known as one of the ten most haunted tourist destinations in the country.

This place is very dangerous; people often die inexplicably here, and people often see dead people appearing. Everyone, do not get too close. You can take photos from outside.

Absolutely do not include yourselves in the photos, just like you shouldn't take photos with the terracotta warriors at the Mausoleum of Qin Shi Huang. Those are funerary objects, things for the dead, and taking photos with them is bad luck!"

Zhou Ze felt that this day might not be far off. The last group of horror story enthusiasts who came here to commit suicide had heard whispers about this place, and then, the suicide pact of two of them added a special atmosphere to it.

Pushing open the bookstore door and stepping inside, Zhou Ze saw the old Daoist dozing off. The old Daoist's live stream hadn't been on for a long time.

Just as you can't be sure whether the person playing a game with you is a cute girl with a *diao* or a zombie,

You also can't be sure if everyone watching a live stream is alive.
