In fact, among the online viewership numbers of major live streaming platforms, the number of living people accounts for only a very small portion.

The old Daoist had been quiet for a long time. Now, he simply guarded the woman named Tang Shi. He wasn't inseparable, but he was very responsible.

"Boss, you're back."

Zhou Ze's footsteps woke the old Daoist, who wiped the drool from the corner of his mouth.

Zhou Ze nodded and walked directly to the second floor.

Tang Shi was still in her mummy-like state, but her recovery was truly good. When Zhou Ze came up, she was awake, seemingly looking at the ceiling. Beside her were water and White Rabbit candy.

She didn't need anyone to serve her food and clothes; she could manage it herself with her "telekinetic" ability.

When Zhou Ze approached, a White Rabbit candy unwrapped itself and flew to Zhou Ze's mouth. Zhou Ze opened his mouth and took the candy.

Then, Zhou Ze sat down next to Tang Shi.

Neither of them spoke. There was nothing to say. They spent half an hour in quiet like this. Zhou Ze stood up, preparing to go downstairs.

Tang Shi spoke, "Did you go to see a psychologist?"

Zhou Ze nodded.

"Was it useless?"

"It was still somewhat useful," Zhou Ze replied.

However, he still refused to eat Wang Ke's family's meat soup.

"Mmm." Tang Shi closed her eyes, as if tired, but still managed to say, "Help me call that zombie up here."

Zhou Ze nodded, preparing to go downstairs.

"Are you going to trick me again?" Tang Shi asked.

"You found out." Zhou Ze didn't feel embarrassed. "I don't really like lending out the pillow I'm used to sleeping on."

"But not being able to rest greatly affects my recovery."

"And what does that have to do with me? I've done what I should. If you want to get more from me, you'll have to offer more valuable things in exchange."

"I can tell you the location of another Ghost Catcher in Tongcheng." Tang Shi looked at Zhou Ze. "When the old Daoist took me to escape before, I had intended to hide there, but unfortunately, he seemed to have some problems, which is why I eventually chose to come to you."

"That doesn't seem to be of much value to me." Zhou Ze shrugged.

"According to common speculation, Tongcheng is just a small city. It should only have one Ghost Catcher; it's impossible for there to be two. So, the other one must have been replaced. You can go there and see; perhaps you can inherit some assets."

Zhou Ze remained unmoved. "I'm still not interested."

If she could inherit it, wouldn't the little loli have done it herself?

Zhou Ze wouldn't believe that the little loli was sentimental, especially since the driver she scared into a fatal car accident still hadn't been settled.

"Then I have nothing else to give you."

"Let's leave it at that for now."

Zhou Ze went downstairs. He didn't call Bai Yingying. As he said, he would feel uncomfortable lending out the pillow he was used to sleeping on.

"Boss, what should we eat tonight?" The old Daoist pointed to next door. "The boss next door doesn't seem to be back yet."

"You figure it out. Can you cook?" Zhou Ze asked.

"Yes."

"Then go to his kitchen and find ingredients to cook."

After saying that, Zhou Ze sat down behind the counter.

The old Daoist went next door to cook, and the bookstore suddenly became quiet.

However, not long after, a figure appeared at the bookstore entrance. It was a girl, wearing a black jacket and a scarf, wrapped tightly.

Although Tongcheng had cooled down recently, it wasn't cold enough to dress like that.

The girl looked at Zhou Ze through the glass door. Zhou Ze ignored her.

Finally, the girl pushed open the door and walked in. She came to Zhou Ze, stopped, removed her scarf, and pleaded:

"Help me."

Zhou Ze picked up his teacup, took a sip of water, and still ignored her.

"Please, help me." The girl knelt down in front of Zhou Ze, her hands on Zhou Ze's thighs. "As long as you're willing to help me, I'll do anything you want."

As she spoke, the girl's nimble, pale hands tried to flirt with the man in front of her.

Zhou Ze reached out and grabbed the girl's wrist, pushing her back slightly with force. The girl sat on the ground, looking somewhat bewildered.

Putting down his book, Zhou Ze said with some surprise, "I thought you would have been taken in."

Yes, Zhou Ze had originally thought this girl would face some repercussions after her false accusation against the teacher was exposed, but it seemed she truly hadn't.

Thinking about it, Zhou Ze understood. The girl was a minor, and the teacher had committed suicide. Even if she were charged with false accusation, in the end, it would be settled leniently because of her minor status.

"Did you see the news? My biological parents found me, so I could save my so-called younger brother."

When the girl said this, a malicious glint flashed in her eyes.

She wasn't a good person to begin with. Even though her middle school teacher committed suicide because of her false accusation, she still lived happily.

Therefore, the sudden appearance of so-called biological parents, if they were rich, with a mansion, a villa, or a huge inheritance for her to inherit, would have been fine. But they were just ordinary biological parents, so it wasn't very interesting.

Moreover, the purpose of her biological parents finding her was to ask her to donate to save her younger brother.

What a joke!

Were they out of their minds!

"You're quite familiar with Lin Yi, so you should know that I'm just a live-in son-in-law, with no money or ability, only able to run this unprofitable bookstore. I can't help."

"I'd like to ask you, like last time you came to my house, to go to my biological parents' house."

The girl bit her lip. As she said these words, the scene from that night seemed to resurface in her mind. She had been terrified, truly so scared that she hadn't recovered for several days.

"Oh, just that?" Zhou Ze asked.

"Yes, that's all. Just to make them stop bothering me, stop annoying me," the girl affirmed.

"To be honest, when I saw the news before, I felt that second daughter was very pitiful, truly very pitiful. Those biological parents are really not good people."

"Yes, they are jackals, they are beasts, they are bastards!" The girl gritted her teeth.

Zhou Ze lowered his head, looking at the girl still sitting on the ground. "But when I found out that pitiful girl was actually you, I suddenly felt great."

"..." the girl.

But the girl had seen storms, after all. She could endure the unbearable and bizarre fetishes of those old men in bed, which showed her resilience.

In fact, she was like a flower blooming among the wild grass outside the window, constantly enduring wind and rain, and the constant moistening of her pistils by dew.

She was indeed much stronger than a flower in a greenhouse.

"I can make you feel even better."

The girl looked at Zhou Ze. "As long as you can help me, just like you did at my house last time."

"Do you think Lin Yi is pretty?" Zhou Ze suddenly asked.

"Well... she's very pretty."

"Compared to you?"

"She's a bit prettier than me," the girl replied.

"Then I can tell you, her elder sister is even prettier and more elegant, and she can wear a white lab coat, and also... she's a gentle woman. So, please tell me, why would I fancy you?"

Zhou Ze had originally intended to say that Dr. Lin was also a virgin, but suddenly felt that saying so seemed a bit off, so he changed his words.

"Help me, or I'll die in your bookstore!"

A small knife suddenly appeared in the girl's hand, aimed at her neck.

"Heh, please do. I couldn't be more pleased. I just need more karma..."

"Pffft!"

The small knife directly stabbed into the girl's neck,

Very abruptly,

Very decisively,

Even too abruptly, and too decisively!

Blood splattered onto Zhou Ze's face, leaving him momentarily stunned.

The girl's eyes were wide open, a look of disbelief on her face, and then her body slowly fell backward.

Zhou Ze suddenly stood up and roared upstairs:

"What the f*** are you doing!"

title: 第七十九章 大掃除！
content:
"What the hell do you think you're doing!"

Zhou Ze was asking Tang Shi.

Clearly, the girl's previous threat, "Ah, if you don't help me, I'll die right in front of you!" was just an empty one, like a homeroom teacher always telling their students, "You're the worst class I've ever taught!" The truth is, they say that to every class, so you can't take it seriously.

Zhou Ze hadn't expected her to actually commit suicide. And a woman like her, she wouldn't kill herself. She valued herself too much; how could she? But she suddenly, even without a second threat, without even having time to fake tears, plunged a small knife into her own neck.

Her astonished expression at that moment further indicated that even she, the one doing it, was completely bewildered.

Who am I?
Where am I?
Oh my god, I actually committed suicide!

There was only one explanation left: someone had manipulated her knife, making her "commit suicide." And the person capable of doing that was upstairs.

Perhaps that murderer was still chewing on a White Rabbit candy.

"What's wrong! What's wrong!"

Old Tao, cooking next door, immediately rushed back upon hearing Zhou Ze's shout. Seeing the girl on the floor, he was startled.

"Good heavens, little girl, what's wrong with you!"

Old Tao quickly went over, preparing to help.

Zhou Ze, however, went straight upstairs. He saw Tang Shi still lying on the bamboo mat.

"What is the meaning of this?"

"Calm down." Tang Shi smiled. She still couldn't move her body, so all she could do was talk and smile. "Now, can your maid come up and sleep with me?"

"Are you trying to kill me!" Zhou Ze demanded.

Tang Shi was slightly surprised. "Shouldn't you be thanking me?"

"I'll thank you for nothing!" Zhou Ze kicked over the teacup in front of him. The water spilled everywhere, and the cup flew against the wall and shattered.

"I don't believe you didn't see it, otherwise how could you not try to save her? You're a doctor; saving people should be your instinct! You didn't directly perform resuscitation but came up here to question me. Are you trying to welch on a deal or play dumb?"

Tang Shi said in a deep voice.

"It's precisely because I, your father, saw it that I couldn't bother with her. Do you know who gave me the mark on my hand? Do you know whose side that Faceless Woman is truly on now? Do you know who led the other ghost servants to specifically cause trouble for your family in Chengdu? You think you're so capable, don't you? You think you're so smart, don't you?

You think everyone else is drunk and only you are sober, don't you?!

As soon as you act, aren't you just telling her you're here with me?"

Tang Shi fell silent. She suddenly felt a bit awkward and embarrassed.

It seemed Zhou Ze had already seen through it. He was deliberately playing along, while she, in her self-proclaimed cleverness, had intervened and pushed things into an unpredictable abyss.

"Oh, momma, don't cling to me, don't cling to me! I can't breathe!!!"

Old Tao's shouts came from downstairs.

Zhou Ze gave a deep look at Tang Shi, who was still lying there motionless, and shook his head.

"Stupid woman."

Then, Zhou Ze went downstairs and saw Old Tao in the bookstore, wrapped in clumps of hair, like a large black *zongzi*, while the girl who had fallen was gone without a trace.

Zhou Ze's fingernails grew long, and he walked over, directly clawing at the hair.

"Whoosh! Whoosh!"

The hair snapped instantly and floated away.

But the remaining hair on the ground twisted into a human face, like a traditional Chinese ink painting—very beautiful and classic, but upon closer inspection, one could see that the features of this face were not clearly defined.

"Object control, is that your new ability?"

A woman's voice echoed from around the bookstore, empty, as if a chant from hell.

"Or perhaps, I've made a new discovery? A very, very unexpected discovery?"

The Faceless Woman seemed to be talking to herself, but in reality, she was demonstrating, a show of catching her enemy in a vulnerable position.

Zhou Ze had always been unclear why the Faceless Woman hated him so much. Was it merely because he had scratched her in the Hellish Pond? Or did she have other intentions for him, like her hysterical, unwilling roar when he left Hell?

But any normal person would be enraged by such unprovoked, sudden attacks.

Zhou Ze had actually seen through it earlier because everything was too smooth, too natural.

The clues all connected to this girl, who appeared before him in the most appropriate way and for the most appropriate reason, almost seamlessly fitting into his previous life and trajectory.

There was no abruptness at all, yet it was the greatest abruptness; she pursued perfection too much, and it was too deliberate. With her previous disguise as Doctor Lin as a precedent, it would be difficult for Zhou Ze to fall for another inexplicable trick.

Of course, most importantly, Zhou Ze didn't believe that girl would dare to appear before him, flirt with him, or ask for his help after seeing him in that state last time.

Last time, she had actually tried to seduce him, but he had coldly rejected her. Did she think she was Yang Guifei, to try again?

In hindsight, if he had calmly thought about it, the Faceless Woman had actually shown many flaws when she pretended to be Doctor Lin last time. But at that time, Zhou Ze had just learned about Xu Le's attempt to hire a killer, and he was in a state of mental confusion, which allowed her to seize the opportunity.

Overall, the Faceless Woman was an anomaly formed by the convergence of countless resentful souls on the Road to the Underworld; she was not human.

How many tricks can beasts play? They only invite ridicule.

"You're finished. I'll let her know what you're doing. Don't forget, your current status was given to you by her."

The Faceless Woman's voice carried clear schadenfreude, like a kindergarten child who had caught a classmate's secret and was going to tell the teacher.

And just then, Zhou Ze suddenly noticed the water droplets on the ground floating up and sticking to the glass door frame.

"This is just her clone puppet. If you leave her, what happened here won't be known."

This was Tang Shi's reminder, perhaps her way of paying for her impulsive self-righteousness. In an instant, the surrounding water droplets began to surge, shooting directly at the hair on the ground.

The Faceless Woman also saw the words. She let out a sharp shriek, her hair gathered together, and a cold wind swept in, directly rushing towards the door.

However, the mist condensed by Tang Shi acted like a barrier, slowing the movement of the hair.

Bai Yingying also sensed something was wrong at this moment and ran over from next door. Seeing the scene in the bookstore, she slightly parted her lips, somewhat confused.

"Trying to stop me?" The Faceless Woman let out a disdainful cry. "Let's see how you stop me!"

"Buzz!"

The hair that had gathered together suddenly exploded, and for a moment, the bookstore became like a barbershop, with numerous strands of hair darting in all directions.

Some attempted to go through the vents, some tried to go upstairs, and others tried to go into the bathroom to escape through the sewer.

Even if just one strand of hair got out, it could transmit the news of what happened here to the main body, exposing Zhou Ze's act of harboring a "wanted criminal."

Zhou Ze's fingernails ceaselessly slashed through the air. Each strand of hair he caught turned to ash and vanished.

Old Tao, once again reaching into his trousers, pulled out two talismans and wildly waved them in the air. Any hair that touched the talismans was stuck, like on a fly trap, proving very effective.

A practice workbook disintegrated, its pages flying out like curved blades, sweeping through the air. Strands of hair were severed, falling to the ground and withering.

Tang Shi, lying upstairs, coughed, blood spilling from the corner of her mouth. She was already injured, but she knew that at this moment, she absolutely couldn't hold back.

Bai Yingying, quick-witted, kept extending her hands, each time grabbing a strand of hair and immediately tearing it apart.

The usually quiet and almost business-less bookstore was now undergoing a vigorous and bustling spring cleaning, as if a leader was about to inspect it.

Finally, everything seemed to settle. The Faceless Woman let out a final, unwilling roar, and not a single strand of hair could be seen.

Zhou Ze sat down on a plastic stool. The bloodstains on his face had long disappeared, because everything, except for the hair, hadn't been real.

"Boss, done working. I'm exhausted." Old Tao collapsed onto the floor, panting heavily.

Bai Yingying, however, poured Zhou Ze a cup of tea. She didn't seem tired. "Boss, was that the same one from last time?"

Zhou Ze nodded, took the tea, and took a sip.

"She's fallen for you, huh? She's really persistent." Bai Yingying stuck out her tongue.

Zhou Ze didn't say anything, but his mood was heavy. The Faceless Woman wasn't a huge problem, but she made you restless. No one wanted to be targeted by such an opponent.

According to her, her main body had gone to Chengdu with the little loli, leaving a few strands of hair as a puppet to target him.

Even if the targeting wasn't successful, it would still disgust him!

Such a low-brow enemy was truly maddening.

Now, Zhou Ze's only thought was that the person in Chengdu would best deal with the little loli and the Faceless Woman together, and incidentally flush all his troubles down the toilet, leaving them completely clean.

Although that difficulty was quite high, dreams must always be had.

In a subtle spot that no one noticed, a strand of hair stealthily moved out from a gap in a magazine, then fell to the ground, finally drifting towards the crack under the door.

"Creak!"

The glass door was pushed open,

And the hair happened to be stepped on by a leather shoe.

Xu Qinglang bent down, picked up the strand of hair, and then snapped it directly.

In the void, a woman's final, frustrated roar seemed to echo, as if her efforts had been in vain!

Xu Qinglang froze for a moment, as if he heard someone cursing him.

But then, he angrily pointed at Zhou Ze, who was sitting inside, and yelled:

"Alright, I'm out here running around in this cold weather, looking for a new shop location, and what are you doing? Look at this hair!

Did another beautiful female reader come into the shop to chat with you?"

The implication was,

I'm out here working hard for our future,

And you're hiding in the shop, enjoying the air conditioning and flirting with long-haired girls!

Are you worthy of me?!

title: 第八十章 遺容
content:
"Are you asleep?"

"No."

"Didn't you call me to sleep with you?"

"Can't sleep."

"Oh."

"How long have you lived?"

"Two hundred years, but I've spent most of that time lying in a coffin. Actually, if you do the math, I've only truly lived out in the world for less than twenty years."

"What do you think of your boss?"

"Not much, he's very petty."

"I think so too."

"Did he scold you today?"

"I made a mistake."

"Oh."

"Actually, I've always been curious, what kind of person is your boss and that one you often talk about?"

"What kind of person?"

"Mm."

"Let me put it this way, if yesterday's situation, he and your boss had switched places, he wouldn't have needed me to act. He would've killed that puppet himself, wouldn't have been afraid of exposing anything, and certainly wouldn't have come up to ask me about meddling."

"Oh, I see." Bai Yingying mused for a moment, then said, "Someone like that wouldn't live long, would they?"

Tang Shi fell silent.

"Actually, the boss has many flaws. Sometimes he's not manly enough, and he's always indecisive, and even after doing something, he keeps fretting over it. But all in all, he's actually fine. Everyone has their own different life, and naturally, their own different personality.

He likes to be cautious, like a squirrel. He enjoys bringing things home, savors that feeling of accumulation, and protects it, because he came out of an orphanage before; he originally had nothing."

"You understand him?"

"I wouldn't say understand, but honestly, I don't want to become like you are now. I like playing on my phone every day, playing games, watching movies, enjoying my current life, making up for the two hundred years I spent in a coffin. In that regard, the boss is quite indulgent and satisfies me."

"Is a life without pursuits or ripples interesting?"

"Not everyone yearns for ripples and passion. Everyone should have their own way of life, as long as they like it.

To be honest, sometimes I can see the boss holding himself back, and I'm very worried that he won't be able to, and will become like you and the one you talk about."

"Scared?"

"Yes, scared."

"You've died once already, what more is there to be scared of, what more is there to fear? He's not to my taste. He looks very peaceful and cultured, but deep down he's filled with petty male chauvinistic self-interest, only considering himself. To put it plainly, he's selfish."

"The boss is alright."

"You disagree?"

"I disagree. I know when my lady achieved enlightenment and went to hell, she must have told the boss to dispose of me, but he never did.

And, I also know that because I'm in the shop, fewer ghosts come to visit, but the boss hasn't driven me away."

"That's because he uses you as a pillow; he wants to sleep soundly at night."

"Isn't someone who's willing to sacrifice performance for sleep quality good?"

Hearing that,

Tang Shi was stunned.

For some reason,

The image of that person who liked to sit on a chair by the entrance of the Underworld shop, basking in the sun, appeared in her mind.

Sunlight fell on him,

Like an old grandfather.

………………

The Faceless Woman's problem, no matter what, was at least temporarily resolved. Now, they just needed to wait for the final outcome from Chengdu.

Of course, this matter could wait, but moving couldn't. Xu Qinglang had found a new location, near South Street in the center of Tongcheng City, which was considered the commercial hub by the old Tongcheng residents, with a high flow of people.

Zhou Ze received an invitation yesterday to attend Miss Liu's memorial service. Zhou Ze wasn't sure why he was invited and originally didn't plan to go, but after seeing the sender's name, Xu Qinglang strongly insisted that Zhou Ze must go, because the shop he was eyeing belonged to Miss Liu's family.

Discussing business at someone's funeral with their family seemed a bit inappropriate, but in the spirit of saving as much as possible, Zhou Ze still agreed.

Driving according to the address on the invitation, Zhou Ze realized they weren't going to a funeral home, but driving into a more rural area, to a villa built amidst fields.

It was the season for rapeseed flowers to bloom, and the villa was nestled within a sea of flowers, giving it a very desolate feeling.

Not many people had come; there were only four or five cars parked at the entrance.

When Zhou Ze got out of the car and walked in, he saw Cui Yilang and several other members of the Horror Story Enthusiasts Association standing in the courtyard, chatting in low voices.

No one greeted Zhou Ze, nor did anyone come to collect condolence money. A few scattered groups were there, as if on an outing.

The house looked no different from a typical three-story rural house built in the Tongcheng area from the outside, but once inside, it was clearly decorated in a Western European style.

From the ceiling beams to the coffee table and cups, it made one feel as if they had walked onto the set of a British drama.

Music started playing at this moment, not the usual "funeral music," but Chopin's "Farewell Waltz." Although it spoke of parting, the melody was much lighter than domestic funeral music.

Several women in black veils came down from upstairs; these were the hosts.

A man dressed as a priest, holding a Bible, walked to the center.

Everyone gathered around, sharing their grief.

Zhou Ze poured himself a cup of coffee at the self-service counter and sipped it slowly.

Domestic funeral customs have undergone several reforms in modern times, one could even say several upheavals, and most regions have long prohibited burial.

In the countryside, funerals are usually held by setting up a tent in front of one's own courtyard and carrying out the rites, while in cities, some do it in their own community or simply rent a venue at a funeral home.

This kind of Western-style funeral was the first Zhou Ze had encountered.

Zhou Ze remembered hearing someone say before that in some Western countries, many families had "funeral workshops," where the first floor of their own house was used for normal living while also being rented out as a memorial service venue, along with services like body retrieval and corpse beautification.

Looking at this place now, it seemed to be along those lines, but in China, most people still found it unacceptable.

When it was time to pay respects to the deceased, everyone queued up one by one. If you were close, you could hold the coffin lid and talk. If you weren't close, you'd walk by, sigh, and pretend.

When it was Zhou Ze's turn, he glanced into the coffin and saw Miss Liu lying neatly dressed in a black gown, truly looking as if she were asleep.

What surprised Zhou Ze was that Miss Liu had fallen from upstairs in front of him. No matter how you embellished it with words, you couldn't hide the fact that she had died a tragic death, yet Miss Liu's remains looked very exquisite, with an excellent degree of restoration.

This made Zhou Ze think of when he died, that mortician with the eyebrow pencil, putting on makeup forcefully with an impatient expression. He had never received such treatment.

The deceased can't leave bad reviews, how unfair.

After paying respects to the deceased, everyone went to the side hall for a meal. It was a buffet, but there wasn't much food, just some pastries and sausages, serving as afternoon tea to stave off hunger. It wasn't meant for a lavish meal or heavy drinking.

Zhou Ze poured himself a glass of wine, drank some, then walked out of the side hall. He intended to find Miss Liu's family members to discuss the shop rental.

Xu Qinglang said he would rent it for a year first, and then Zhou Ze would pay him rent monthly. This was also considering that Zhou Ze couldn't afford so much money all at once, so Zhou Ze also had to reciprocate; if he could help negotiate the price, he would.

But after searching around, Zhou Ze couldn't find the family members wearing black veils who had appeared earlier. Instead, he saw the priest standing by the staircase, smoking.

When Zhou Ze walked over, the priest offered Zhou Ze a cigarette.

The two men stood together, smoking.

The priest was not a foreigner; he was also Chinese, about thirty years old, with a rather youthful face.

They didn't exchange any words. After finishing their cigarettes, the priest walked away. Zhou Ze put out his cigarette and happened to notice another staircase leading downwards, below the main one.

It must be a basement.

Ordinary Chinese families generally didn't have the habit of building basements. Out of curiosity, Zhou Ze walked down and saw an elevator inside. Beside the elevator, there was also a metal door.

The door was open. Pushing it open and stepping inside, Zhou Ze immediately felt the temperature drop significantly.

In front of Zhou Ze were two steel slab beds and a freezer, similar to those found in a hospital morgue, but with some additional equipment.

It gave one the feeling of a slaughterhouse.

Walking beside the steel slab bed, Zhou Ze reached out and touched it. This place must be where the dead lay. Miss Liu must have also laid here to receive her final beautification.

This was a beauty salon for the deceased.

"Sir, this area is not open to the public."

A young man in a gray suit stood at the doorway and said.

Zhou Ze nodded apologetically; he had been presumptuous.

"Have we met somewhere before?" Zhou Ze asked, feeling that the man looked somewhat familiar.

"Perhaps. Here's my business card. Of course, we hope you won't have the need to use the number on it."

The young man handed Zhou Ze a business card.

The card read "Chen Zesheng" with the note "Director of Tongcheng Western Funeral Home."

"Is business good?" Zhou Ze asked.

For a long time, it had always been others asking Zhou Ze, "Is business good?" Now Zhou Ze finally found a chance to ask someone else.

Of course, Zhou Ze also knew that when others asked him, "Is business good?" what they really thought was:

This idiot opened a rotten bookstore in this broken place; business being good would be a miracle!

"It's a bit slow. After all, not many people in China accept this kind of funeral custom," Chen Zesheng said with a bitter smile.

"Mm."

Zhou Ze had asked, and felt satisfied.

"Oh, the deceased's family is on the second floor," Chen Zesheng reminded him.

"Okay, thank you."

Zhou Ze left the basement.

However, as Zhou Ze had just started up the stairs, the hand holding the business card suddenly trembled. He looked down at the name on the card again:

Chen Zesheng.

It seemed,

The one who had committed suicide with Miss Liu the next day,

Also had the surname Chen?

…………

Closing the metal door,

The young man in the suit and tie lay on the steel slab bed.

He reached out and gently rubbed his right cheek. His skin was already wrinkled and cracked, with green shaping fluid oozing out.

He shook his head,

Sighed:

"As soon as I die, those two morticians at home start slacking off.

At this rate, what will happen to the business?"

title: 第八十一章 一家人，整整齊齊
content:
Upon reaching the second floor, Zhou Ze saw Miss Liu's family. What was strange was that he didn't see any men, only three women.

One with white hair, already in her twilight years; one dignified and poised, in her middle age; and another around Miss Liu's age.

When Zhou Ze walked in, he found the priest there too, talking to the elderly woman, seemingly comforting her.

The old woman listened, the priest spoke, and everyone seemed to be going through the motions, fulfilling their duties. To say there was much sorrow in the room would be false.

Of course, one cannot blame the living for their indifference to the dead, because the living must face the problem of how to continue living.

"Hello, may I ask if you are Ms. Liu Yanhua?"

Zhou Ze walked up to the middle-aged woman and asked.

"Hello, I am."

Ms. Liu took out a handkerchief and wiped the corners of her eyes.

Zhou Ze thought she looked more like she was wiping away sleep crusts than tears, as he couldn't see any sign that she had actually cried.

The woman's collarbones were very distinct, her figure a bit gaunt, and her forehead protruded, giving her a rather uncomfortable appearance.

In fact, this was a face that *clashed with one's husband's fate*.*

Culture is a carrier, a unified entity. In every era, all aspects, including politics, economics, and even such low-class things as *feng shui* and physiognomy, are influenced by culture.

For example, in ancient times, there was the saying "clashing with one's husband's fate." This is a typical example of treating women as appendages to a patriarchal society, which is a very unfair and incorrect assertion.

Zhou Ze didn't believe in this originally, even though he was a *ghost messenger*.

But thinking about it,

Three generations of a family,

Not a single male heir,

It's genuinely hard not to believe it.

Zhou Ze explained the purpose of his visit. Xu Qinglang had already communicated with her and reached a preliminary agreement, but they hadn't progressed to discussing the specific price.

"Mr. Zhou, for coming to my daughter's funeral, I, on behalf of my daughter, express my gratitude. As for that shop, since Mr. Zhou has taken a liking to it, please go back and think of a number for the rent. As long as it's not too outrageous, I won't refuse."

So easy to talk to?

Zhou Ze was stunned. In his previous life, he was a doctor and had never done business, so he was a bit rusty at negotiating prices for the first time. But this Ms. Liu seemed very generous.

Zhou Ze nodded, said a few comforting platitudes about grief, and then discreetly left. All that remained was to discuss a price with Xu Qinglang and send it over, and the matter would be almost settled.

He went down the stairs, came to that corner again, and once more arrived at the metal door. He reached out to push it, only to find it locked.

Zhou Ze knocked on it,

No one answered from inside.

It was frustrating,

And quite conflicted,

As a *ghost messenger*,

To be stopped by a door or a wall, this *ghost messenger* seemed to be losing too much face.

Unfortunately, Zhou Ze couldn't be like the little loli,

"Biu,"

Out she came,

"Biu,"

Back in she went.

This door, Zhou Ze really couldn't open it.

Returning to the main hall, the mourners had mostly left, and the hall was being tidied up. The coffin had also been carried away. As for Miss Liu, she would likely be sent to the crematorium for cremation very soon.

When a person dies, it's like a lamp going out, ultimately ending up as a mound of earth.

Funerals always tend to bring about such pessimistic emotions.

Zhou Ze stopped a cleaning lady and asked, "Excuse me, do you know Chen Zesheng?"

"Ah, he was the former boss here," the cleaning lady replied with some surprise. "He's already dead. His funeral was yesterday."

"Oh." Zhou Ze nodded, then asked, "May I ask who your current boss is?"

"It's the former boss's younger brother. He just went down to the basement," the cleaning lady answered. Then, worried that Zhou Ze might not understand, she explained, "There, by the staircase. It's where they specifically prepare the deceased."

"Thank you."

"You're welcome."

Zhou Ze walked back to the metal door again.

He had to go in,

And catch that clown who, for some unknown reason, was still lively and handing out business cards to *ghost messengers* after dying.

But this door,

How on earth was he supposed to open it?

He knocked on the door several times with force,

The door still didn't budge, and there was no response from inside.

The cleaning lady had just said that their current boss had just gone in, which was clearly not right. Of course, Zhou Ze wasn't concerned about whether the current boss would encounter any accidents inside; he wasn't that compassionate.

Just as Zhou Ze was about to look for a tool to try and pry the door open,

Zhou Ze found the door open,

And a young man stood inside, dressed in a black suit with a white flower pinned to his chest.

"Can I help you?" the young man asked.

This wasn't the one who had just slipped him the business card. Unless there was a mistake, this should be the current boss, Chen Zesheng's biological younger brother.

"There's something I'd like to talk to you about, regarding your brother," Zhou Ze said, already determined that if this guy couldn't be reasoned with, he'd just knock him out and go in to find Chen Zesheng.

"Oh, alright, please come in."

The man seemed easy to talk to and immediately gestured for Zhou Ze to enter.

Zhou Ze gave the man a deep look, then walked in.

The two steel slab beds were still in their original positions, and the freezer morgue was also there.

"Where is your brother's body?" Zhou Ze asked.

"My brother's funeral was held yesterday, sir. Are you a friend of my brother's?"

"You could say that," Zhou Ze replied evasively.

"My brother's body was cremated yesterday."

Are you lying to a ghost?

Zhou Ze nodded, indicating he understood, then turned and left.

The man in the suit watched Zhou Ze's retreating back, a hint of deep thought in his eyes.

…………

The evening breeze was cool, and the rapeseed flowers around the villa, under the moonlight, created a desolate atmosphere, like a grand funeral, with everything here serving as embellishment and prelude.

The workers had all left. This place didn't provide accommodation, even though it was large and spacious. Of course, the workers didn't want to stay here either.

The man in the black suit arranged dishes on the round table in the hall. They were all cold dishes, without any warmth.

Then he poured old yellow wine into the wine glasses on the table.

Immediately, he walked to the stairwell and called out upstairs:

"Dinner is ready."

Three women,

From young to old, came downstairs in order. They didn't stand on ceremony and took their seats directly.

The priest hadn't left either and stood by the table.

The man in the suit went to the basement again and pushed out a stretcher cart from inside, covered with a white sheet. Then came the second, third, and fourth carts.

In the hall, a strong smell of plastic and disinfectant began to permeate the air.

The elderly woman started coughing,

The middle-aged woman's expression was displeased,

The young woman covered her nose and waved her hand.

"Why are there so many people?" Ms. Liu asked unhappily.

"Since we agreed to hold a *ghost marriage* for my brother and sister-in-law, it's only proper to invite our father and mother to attend for it to be formal."

"Your family, you're truly perverse," the elderly woman muttered. "No wonder your brother incited my granddaughter to jump off a building with him."

"This matter isn't my brother's fault. My brother has always managed the family business; he didn't want to die. It's your family that has a tradition of men committing suicide. My sister-in-law, influenced by her upbringing, then took my brother with her to commit suicide."

"Hmph." The elderly woman didn't bother to argue, urging, "If you're going to do it, hurry up. I'm getting sleepy."

"Alright."

The man in the suit first lifted the white sheet from one stretcher cart, revealing Miss Liu's corpse.

He picked up Miss Liu and placed her on a chair, then used several plastic ties to secure her there, keeping her in a dignified sitting posture.

Afterward, the man in the suit lifted the white sheet from his brother's body, picked up his brother, and had him sit next to Miss Liu.

However, his brother's sitting posture seemed to be very well maintained and didn't require any ties to secure it.

The man in the suit was a bit surprised but didn't take it to heart.

"These two poor children, why bother?"

The old woman squeezed out a few tears, truly a performance.

Ms. Liu comforted her mother,

And Ms. Liu's daughter comforted her mother,

The three women huddled together, crying, comforting, and lamenting.

The bridal couple sat coldly in their seats,

Eyes tightly shut,

They couldn't see.

This table of dishes was prepared for them,

But this table of drama had nothing to do with them.

The man in the suit tied red flowers on his brother's and sister-in-law's chests, wanting them to look more festive, but it only gave off a colder aesthetic.

"Don't open their eyes, don't disturb them too much."

Ms. Liu saw the man in the suit about to use tape to prop open the corpses' eyelids and immediately spoke to stop him.

She had already overcome a great psychological barrier by agreeing to the *ghost marriage*; now sitting at the same table with two corpses, she felt like she was on pins and needles. If the corpses' eyes were also opened, she really wouldn't be able to sit there anymore.

The man in the suit froze for a moment but nodded in agreement.

Immediately, the man in the suit called out to another stretcher cart:

"Mom, it's brother's happy day today, please come and see."

With that, the man in the suit lifted the white sheet, revealing the corpse of a middle-aged woman.

She was wearing a *qipao*, looking very opulent and dignified, but she must have been dead for many years. No matter how good the embalming, it couldn't fully restore her appearance.

Beneath the skin, a greenish hue had already appeared. This was just a shell, a shell that had undergone too many special treatments to preserve its living appearance as much as possible.

He settled his mother into a chair, letting her sit next to the old lady.

The old lady shivered in fear but didn't say anything.

Ms. Liu glanced at her "mother-in-law" but didn't dare to look a second time.

Finally,

The man in the suit spoke to the last stretcher cart:

"Dad, brother's getting married today, please wake up..."

"Hey."

An answering sound came from beneath the white sheet.

The man in the suit's body trembled, and a look of horror appeared on his face.

The three women at the table also began to shiver with fright. The young girl almost screamed but quickly covered her mouth.

Even the priest looked up suspiciously, truly not understanding what was happening.

The man in the suit no longer dared to lift the white sheet,

But the person inside actively lifted the white sheet themselves.

Zhou Ze stretched, moved his neck, and a few crisp pops were heard. He said apologetically:

"Sorry, my pillow was taken over by a silly woman today, so I just borrowed your freezer for a nap.

It wasn't bad,

It's just that I've been living too comfortably lately, and sleeping in a freezer makes my body feel a bit stiff."

---
* *clashed with one's husband's fate*: A traditional Chinese physiognomy concept, usually referring to a woman whose appearance is believed to bring misfortune or even death to her husband. Here, the translator chose to explain the meaning rather than literal translation.

* *ghost messenger*: Translates "鬼差" literally. In Chinese folklore, these are beings who escort the souls of the dead to the afterlife.

* *qipao*: A traditional Chinese dress.

title: 第八十二章 童年陰影！
content:
"I'm very sorry to interrupt your family gathering. I'm just here to do my business, and then you can continue," Zhou Ze said.

With that, Zhou Ze got off the stretcher and walked to Chen Zesheng's corpse. He reached out and gently patted his shoulder. A black halo appeared, forming Chen Zesheng's shadow.

Only Zhou Ze could see this shadow; ordinary people couldn't.

"We haven't gotten married yet," Chen Zesheng said to Zhou Ze. He himself seemed calm and composed, seemingly unsurprised by the fact that Zhou Ze was about to take him away.

"Your wife is waiting for you downstairs."

Zhou Ze then forcibly grabbed him and walked directly out.

"Stop right there!"

The elder brother didn't argue further, but the younger brother, at this moment, gathered his courage and pointed at Zhou Ze, shouting, "What exactly do you want to do?!"

"I've done what I needed to do. Now, you may continue."

With that, Zhou Ze deliberately glanced at the priest standing silently beside the three women and smiled at him.

The priest also smiled back at Zhou Ze, lowering his head even more.

Zhou Ze remembered the little loli once commenting that he "knew his limits"*. Now, it seemed this priest understood them even better.

Without further words, Zhou Ze turned and left. The younger brother was still pointing at Zhou Ze, but he didn't dare to follow because he clearly understood one thing: he had personally wheeled the stretcher out of the freezer. This meant the person in front of him had been lying in a freezer for a long time.

He felt that this world must be crazy, truly crazy.

Holding Chen Zesheng, Zhou Ze walked out to the road, flanked by lush rapeseed flowers.

Chen Zesheng then spoke, "My lord, I came to you for help."

"Then why didn't you say so earlier?" Zhou Ze asked.

"Because I found that you, my lord, didn't seem willing to help," Chen Zesheng said with a smile. "My younger brother has some mental issues, and I'm a bit worried about him. Our family business isn't good to begin with, barely breaking even. If I leave, he might not be able to handle it alone."

"I've seen your brother's mental issues."

Yes, it would be strange if a person who could arrange for a whole family to be together, even in death, had a normal mind.

"But you say you're worried your brother can't handle it alone, yet you were the one who jumped from the building before?" Zhou Ze retorted.

"Heh, actually, I chickened out. At the time, we agreed to jump together, but after she jumped, I got scared," Chen Zesheng said honestly.

"And then?"

"And then I felt I owed her. The next day, after finishing my police statement, I jumped too. I thought I'd find her on the Road to the Underworld**, but for some reason, I found myself back home. Perhaps it's because my younger brother repaired my corpse so well; although those two morticians had some issues with quality, at least on the surface, they restored me perfectly."

After saying this, Chen Zesheng squatted down and pulled out a cigarette, lighting it.

This was a cigarette burned as an offering; ordinary people couldn't smell the smoke.

Zhou Ze also took out a cigarette. To be honest, Zhou Ze actually had a good impression of this guy. He was straightforward in his actions and speech. What a pity that such a person was already dead; otherwise, it would have been comfortable to be friends with him.

"Am I attracting you with my personal charm?" Chen Zesheng fluttered his eyelashes at Zhou Ze. "People who appreciate life and beauty are usually not bad."

"That sounds a bit disgusting coming from you."

"Heh, from the age of ten, my father kept me by his side. My brother didn't want to; he was afraid of corpses, so I had to inherit the craft. At first, I was also afraid of corpses, but then I discovered their beauty, a quiet beauty. This beauty can immerse you in a certain emotion, like listening to a beautiful piano piece. I tend to their last appearance, and they tend to my emotions. I grant them their final dignity, and they grant me a moment of peace. Actually, I still didn't want to die. If she hadn't been so determined to die, and if I hadn't truly loved her, I genuinely wouldn't have wanted to die."

"I also regret that you weren't my mortician when I died."

This was Zhou Ze's true feeling; the woman who did his makeup last time had hurt him so much.

"Heh, my lord, one more question: If I go down now, can I still find her on the Road to the Underworld? I'm a day late, I'm afraid I won't find her when I get there."

"You probably won't find her; the Road to the Underworld is very crowded."

He didn't say that people on the Road to the Underworld, except for special cases, generally walked forward numbly on tiptoes, like shapeless walking corpses.

"That's truly a shame," Chen Zesheng shook his head. "I'll try my best to look for her."

Zhou Ze's fingernail pricked his palm, then drew a square. Black light swirled within the square, and the aura of hell slowly seeped out.

"Go in, go to where you belong."

"Thank you."

Chen Zesheng walked to the square, and his form was sucked inside.

Dust to dust, ashes to ashes, the underworld in order, the Road to the Underworld passable. This was probably Zhou Ze's most peaceful time sending someone to hell.

Quietly finishing his cigarette, Zhou Ze looked back once more at the villa nestled among the rapeseed flowers, thinking of the expressions on the three women's faces and the bizarre scene of the living and dead sitting together at the dining table.

Even as a dead person, as a Ghost Messenger, Zhou Ze felt a shiver down his spine at the two families' behavior.

Dead people like Chen Zesheng could leave with such ease and naturalness, while the living seemed like clowns with heavy makeup on a stage, constantly primping and posing.

This world, it seemed, had always been this way, and had never changed.

...

"Ah ha ha ha ha ha!!!!!"

It was the middle of the day, and Xu Qinglang's laughter echoed. He laughed exaggeratedly, as if he'd found tens of thousands of yuan; in fact, it was something similar.

Zhou Ze had returned late last night and rested late, so he had only napped for a while on Bai Yingying's lap in the morning. He was woken up by Xu Qinglang's laughter shortly after falling asleep.

"Old Zhou, you really are capable! Just now, the Liu family called me. They're renting that shop to us for fifty thousand yuan a year, fifty thousand yuan a year, on South Street! That's practically giving it away!"

"Oh," Zhou Ze wasn't too surprised. He had gone to catch a ghost last night, slept on the way, and stumbled upon the two families' ghost marriage ceremony. This was probably their hush money.

"Come on, let's go check out the shop."

And so, Zhou Ze was pulled by Xu Qinglang into a taxi to South Street. The shop was across from South Street, opposite Wenfeng Department Store and the Department Store Building.

The shop was over a hundred square meters, and it used to be a clothing store.

"Are you still planning to open a noodle shop?" Zhou Ze asked.

"Yes, my noodles are delicious!" Xu Qinglang replied.

"Then you see if their noodles are delicious."

Saying that, Zhou Ze pointed to the shops on either side of their new place.

Xu Qinglang looked over, and his face twitched. On the left side of the shop, there was a "Chongqing Noodle" shop and a "Qishan Saozi Noodles" shop. On the right side were "Lanzhou Lamian" and a "Wonton Noodle Shop."

"Didn't you notice when you looked at the shop before?" Zhou Ze asked.

Xu Qinglang shook his head, looking utterly dejected.

"We'll see then. You move your bookstore over first. If it really doesn't work, I'll just make coffee and sell some snacks in the bookstore," Xu Qinglang said.

"That's what you planned all along, wasn't it?" Zhou Ze wasn't so easily fooled.

"As a man with over twenty apartments, letting my hands and skin continue to be ravaged by cooking fumes is a crime!"

"Then whose sign will it be?" Zhou Ze asked.

"Let's use your 'Late Night Bookstore'."

"That works."

"Are you hungry?" Xu Qinglang asked Zhou Ze, while taking out a thermos from his pocket. "Let's go have a bowl of noodles. I want to see if the noodles here are good. If they're really bad, I'll consider whether or not to challenge them."

The thermos contained plum juice.

Zhou Ze didn't refuse. He hadn't eaten since getting up, so he followed Xu Qinglang into the wonton noodle shop. They ordered two bowls of noodles and sat at a small table, waiting for the food.

"Oh, it's actually a bit exciting to think about moving the business to this bustling area," Xu Qinglang said, looking eager.

Then he noticed Zhou Ze didn't seem to be listening attentively. Instead, he was looking up slightly.

There was a ceiling fan directly overhead, spinning rapidly.

The temperature had obviously risen recently, and the sun was strong. Moreover, because the noodle shop's kitchen was actually inside the store without a partition, charcoal smoke and steam lingered in the air. If the fan wasn't on, it would be stuffy and unbearably hot.

"What's so interesting about that?" Xu Qinglang asked Zhou Ze.

"When I was a kid in school, I'd often look up at these ceiling fans in the classroom during summer, afraid they'd fall and hit me," Zhou Ze said.

"Hey, what a coincidence, I worried about that too when I was little."

"Oh, right, can you read Feng Shui?" Zhou Ze asked.

"Half-baked," Xu Qinglang admitted openly, then continued, "It's actually very simple. If you don't feel particularly comfortable living here, it means the Feng Shui is pretty good."

*After all, you're a ghost.*

Zhou Ze pondered for a moment and found that Xu Qinglang made a lot of sense; he couldn't find a reason to refute him.

Their noodles arrived.

Xu Qinglang picked up a strand and ate it slowly.

Zhou Ze opened his thermos, took a sip of plum juice, then ate a large mouthful of noodles.

Looking at his own wolfing down the food, and then at Xu Qinglang's leisurely strand-by-strand eating, Zhou Ze shook his head and said,

"Affected."

"What do you know? I'm savoring the taste of my competitor."

Zhou Ze heard this, pushed away the noodles in front of him, and couldn't eat anymore.

"..." Xu Qinglang.

Just then, a young man at the next table answered a call and said into the phone:

"I'm at the wonton noodle shop. I arrived early, have you?"

The young man looked like a college student, very green.

At that moment, a girl with a satchel ran into the shop entrance. She stood at the doorway holding what looked like a notice, excitedly shouting to the young man:

"I passed! I passed!"

Then the girl ran directly towards the young man, opening her arms, asking for a hug.

"I really envy college students' lives," Xu Qinglang said enviously.

The girl ran towards the young man and jumped directly into his arms. The young man instinctively caught her and lifted her. This was probably how these two young lovers habitually expressed their affection.

This was the taste of youth, the beauty of being young.

However, the ceiling fan was low.

After the boy habitually lifted the girl, her head precisely hit the ceiling fan above.

"Thud..."

A head landed on the table in front of Zhou Ze and Xu Qinglang.

---
* The idiom "很懂逼數" (hěn dǒng bī shù) literally translates to "understands the coercive number" or "knows the score (in a difficult situation)." It means being very self-aware, knowing one's place, or understanding the appropriate behavior in a given context, often used with a slight, playful irreverence. Here, "knew his limits" or "understood the situation well" captures the nuance.
** "黄泉路" (Huángquán Lù) is the "Road to the Underworld" or "Yellow Springs Road" in Chinese mythology, the path souls take to the afterlife.

title: 第八十三章 白日追兇
content:
The police arrived, and so did the ambulance.

Of course, whether the ambulance came or not was already meaningless.

Zhou Ze and Xu Qinglang squatted on the opposite side of the road, surrounded by a throng of onlookers.

Xu Qinglang hadn't recovered from the previous scene; his hands were still trembling. He wasn't afraid of ghosts, and he often saw them, but many things couldn't be measured by simple fear. It was the visual impact at the time, whether it truly stimulated you.

For Xu Qinglang, who had just been savoring the taste of his competitor, the sudden change in style was truly stimulating.

"That was too scary."

A moment later, Xu Qinglang finally came to his senses, lit a cigarette, and then asked:

"Can that ceiling fan really cut a person's head off?"

Zhou Ze shook his head. "Theoretically, it's impossible. At most, it would just cut them."

"So this time it went beyond the theoretical scope?"

"I guess so. When I was a doctor, I did treat patients injured by falling ceiling fans, but I never heard of anyone actually having their head cut off by one.

In fact, even ancient executioners had to practice diligently to behead a condemned prisoner with one stroke. Often, the blade would get stuck in the head without severing it, and they couldn't pull the blade out either."

"Alright, this place's Feng Shui doesn't seem to be very good after all."

"It's quite good," Zhou Ze said.

"Heh." Xu Qinglang rolled his eyes.

"Actually, dangers are everywhere in life. This incident, for now, can only be attributed to their bad luck.

For example, if you rub a book page against your lips, you might accidentally cut a large gash. Or, for instance, tomatine in tomatoes is also a type of alkaloid toxin."

"Then why haven't I died from eating tomatoes all the time?"

"If you eat four tons, the toxic dose would be lethal."

"............" Xu Qinglang.

"Anything eaten at four tons would be fatal!" Xu Qinglang hissed in a low voice.

"Alright, we've seen the shop, and it's time for us to go. If we don't leave, the police uncles will ask us for a statement again.

We already gave one for the jumping incident a while ago. If we do it again and run into someone familiar, they'll really start treating us like Conan."

"Today is really unlucky. I came here all excited, and who knew something like this would happen?" Xu Qinglang tossed his cigarette butt and stepped on it.

"I thought you'd be happy about losing a competitor."

"That's going too far, isn't it? The poor young girl just died not long ago."

"Oh, then tell me, can the soul of someone who just died float out?"

Zhou Ze pointed at the storefront ahead. Standing there was a girl wearing a yellow sweater.

She was dressed differently from the deceased girl, but this girl had a graceful figure and a slender build, especially her long legs, which were simply mesmerizing to an extreme degree.

Of course, if she had a head, she would be even more beautiful.

"This..." Xu Qinglang was stunned.

No matter how great the injustice, it would take until the seventh day for a ghost to fully form into a malevolent spirit. It was impossible for it to turn into one immediately upon death, and this depended on luck and probability; out of a thousand deaths, perhaps only one soul would linger in the mortal world.

"I told you, how could a fan directly cut off a head?" Zhou Ze stood up and began walking in that direction.

That girl died; justice must be served for her!

"Hiss..."

Zhou Ze instinctively clutched his chest; it was starting to hurt again.

For performance, for performance, this is all for performance!

After taking Chen Zesheng yesterday, my performance increased from eight percent to ten percent. Catching one ghost only adds one or two percentage points. How long will it take to become a full-time employee at this rate?

This one is good; she can kill. A ghost who can kill,

Valuable!

A change of thought, a different perspective,

His chest no longer hurt.

Xu Qinglang also followed, but as soon as he entered the crowd, Xu Qinglang suddenly felt his vision blur, a little dizzy, and he fell directly to the ground.

"Damn it..."

His palm had a cut from supporting himself during the fall, the skin was broken, and beads of blood emerged.

Xu Qinglang immediately got up. There were onlookers everywhere and a police cordon, but he couldn't find Zhou Ze or the headless girl.

He was a little disoriented.

The sun seemed to become even more dazzling at this moment, and the surrounding air was very oppressive, making it difficult for him to breathe.

He was a little flustered, and a little guilty.

Although his cultivation wasn't high, he wasn't a novice, so he shouldn't have been this scared by a headless ghost. But the current feeling of agitation in his heart couldn't be suppressed.

He started searching, weaving through the crowd, looking for Zhou Ze and the headless girl. He felt that if he could find one of them, he would be able to shake off this panicked, clueless feeling he had at the moment.

Searching and searching and searching...

Searching and searching and searching...

Drops of sweat dripped from Xu Qinglang's forehead. He was already breaking out in cold sweat, his lips were dry and cracked. Xu Qinglang looked up at the sun, feeling as though he couldn't even open his eyes.

"Click..."

A crisp sound came from his oblique rear. Xu Qinglang instinctively pushed through the crowd and stumbled towards it.

He walked to the entrance of a noodle shop,

And then saw Zhou Ze sitting inside.

"You're here! I've been looking for you for ages!"

Xu Qinglang was almost crying with joy. The confusion and despair he had just experienced were indescribable, like being banished to his own nightmare.

You can't sense the beginning,

Nor can you experience the end.

Xu Qinglang ran towards Zhou Ze, very, very excited.

Actually, he wasn't gay, and his sexual orientation had always been normal. It was just that fate had given him the wrong body. Sometimes he would make jokes depending on the situation, but he never took them to heart.

But it was undeniable that at this moment, upon seeing Zhou Ze,

He was truly filled with heartfelt joy!

Like seeing an oasis in the desert, or a starving person seeing a piece of bread.

He pounced forward, he ran forward, he spread his arms.

He saw Zhou Ze also stand up,

Then he saw the ceiling fan above Zhou Ze's head,

The fan was spinning,

Spinning very fast,

Xu Qinglang's face showed a look of horror. He wanted to shout for Zhou Ze to dodge, wanted to shout no,

But his body, due to inertia, continued to run forward.

He seemed to foresee his own end,

Zhou Ze would pick him up,

Then lift him up,

And then his head,

Crack...

Like a cucumber being snapped.

However, he didn't see outstretched arms,

He saw Zhou Ze raise his leg.

"Bang!"

One kick,

A forceful kick to the abdomen.

Xu Qinglang fell to the ground, only to find himself lying by the side of the road, a small car having just sped past him,

And Zhou Ze was standing by the side of the road.

Covered in cold sweat, Xu Qinglang touched his forehead.

"Did I fall into a trap?"

"You almost ran out and got hit by a car," Zhou Ze said calmly, as if saying, "Oh, the weather's not bad today."

"Is that thing that fierce?" Xu Qinglang said, still shaken.

"She must have sensed that we were tracking her, so she struck first. This isn't like a pure ghost; she kills as easily as drinking water. If I hadn't stopped you just now, you would have been hit by a car."

"If it's not a ghost, what is it?"

"Have you ever seen a Monkey King who masturbates?"

Xu Qinglang shook his head.

"I have," Zhou Ze sighed. "She crossed the street and went into the mall opposite. You don't go; I'll go after her alone."

"What a joke! She almost killed me. How could I let her off!"

Xu Qinglang got up from the ground, dusted himself off,

"I'll go back and cook first. You kill her, and then come back for dinner."

Zhou Ze nodded. Last night, he felt that the priest was very sensible, and now he found his neighbor was quite sensible too.

The light turned green,

Zhou Ze waved his hand and walked directly across the crosswalk. After entering the mall opposite, Zhou Ze continued his search.

Actually, sometimes Zhou Ze felt a bit depressed. His abilities seemed very powerful, able to make Bai Yingying scream,

But sometimes, they seemed quite useless.

He was now a licensed professional, but his abilities were often not suitable for catching ghosts. For example, now that the headless woman had entered the mall, amidst the crowd, Zhou Ze had indeed lost his way.

And one reason Zhou Ze thought the other party wasn't an ordinary ghost was that the demonic aura on her wasn't very strong. To be able to kill in broad daylight and use illusions in a crowd to almost make Xu Qinglang get hit by a car himself.

Ordinary ghosts really didn't have that kind of ability.

At this moment, Zhou Ze suddenly saw a woman in a yellow sweater emerge from an oblique direction. But she had a head, with some freckles on her face.

Zhou Ze instinctively walked over, but then he saw other women in yellow sweaters in another direction. Immediately after, he saw many more.

Zhou Ze then realized that yellow sweaters were the theme uniform for the employees of this mall today.

How was he supposed to find her now!

Zhou Ze walked to the freezer, opened it, took out a bottle of mineral water, twisted off the cap, and started drinking it.

"Sir, our food here must be paid for before it can be opened and consumed," a saleswoman in a yellow sweater walked up to Zhou Ze and reminded him.

She was very young, probably a student working part-time.

"Sorry." Zhou Ze took out a ten-yuan bill and handed it to her. "Could you pay for it for me?"

Then, Zhou Ze reached out and pinched her face.

There was a sensation of touch,

It should be a real head.

The girl, however, indignantly pointed at Zhou Ze and shouted, "What do you mean by that!"

Taking the ten yuan, with the mineral water costing two yuan, that means she was holding eight yuan,

And he wanted to do whatever he pleased!

Never mind that this grandmother isn't that kind of person,

But to flirt with someone for eight yuan, that's just too much!

"My apologies," Zhou Ze waved his hand and squatted down on the ground.

The girl was about to call for someone to catch the pervert, but seeing Zhou Ze's action, she didn't make a scene and angrily took the money to the counter to pay.

Zhou Ze extended his finger, his black fingernail grew out, and he pressed it against the ground.

I refuse to believe,

I can't find you!

A cloud of black qi permeated the ground from Zhou Ze's fingertip,

And then,

Zhou Ze saw black footprints appear beside him,

The footprints began to extend outwards,

All the way to the back of the young girl who was taking his ten yuan to the counter to pay.

title: 第八十四章 異變！
content:
Zhou Ze stood up, preparing to call out to the girl.

But at that moment, he was astonished to find black footprints everywhere in the mall. Not only the previous girl, but all the other customers, sales assistants, everyone's shoe soles seemed to be smeared with a layer of black grease. Every step left a clear print.

This was a situation Zhou Ze hadn't anticipated. Could it be that everyone in this mall was a ghost?

Even a ghost market couldn't be this exaggerated.

Last time, Zhou Ze and Xu Qinglang had witnessed Lady Bai's banquet, which was just a few tables of people making merry. It was far from as grand as this. Lady Bai, after all, had cultivated for two hundred years and had even possessed her own temple body in between.

A dizzying sensation suddenly swept over him.

Zhou Ze felt as if he were on a carousel in an amusement park.

Everything around him was so unreal, so grotesque.

You couldn't tell what was fake, nor could you figure out what was real.

You could only stumble around in a daze.

He remembered Xu Qinglang had experienced a similar vision not long ago, and then he suddenly rushed into the road. If Zhou Ze hadn't kicked him, he might have been hit by a car.

And now, that feeling was assaulting him.

Was that guy planning to attack him?

As a Soul Messenger, to be counter-attacked by the ghost he was chasing seemed a bit illogical. The most problematic part was that Zhou Ze didn't know how to resist.

His understanding of ghost-catching had always been stuck in the habitual belief that his fingernails were invincible. But this time, it seemed his fingernails couldn't help him.

Stumbling, he sat on the ground. Zhou Ze seemed to see someone handing him some loose change.

He vaguely heard someone say, "Here's your eight yuan change."

Then,

The girl's head in front of him began to blur. Everything in his sight seemed to be wrapped in a layer of paste, making him nauseous and dizzy.

It was as if he had returned to the Yellow Springs Road, mindlessly tiptoeing forward with the masses.

Buddha said, all sentient beings have distinct appearances.

But on the Yellow Springs Road, there is only one appearance.

Zhou Ze felt he couldn't even take a breath. He subconsciously reached out and clutched his own neck. He lowered his head, coughing forcefully, wanting to cry out, but no sound came.

This was a feeling that made time drag, a torture inflicted on the spirit. Earlier, Xu Qinglang had easily broken down inside it, and Zhou Ze was now trapped within it too.

Zhou Ze felt he should do something, but at this moment, he seemed to be able to do nothing but passively endure it all.

Pain,

Suppression,

Suffocation,

Torment arrived one after another, incessantly lashing at his soul.

...

"Sir, sir, what's wrong?"

The girl handed Zhou Ze the change, but then suddenly noticed the man in front of her. His eyes began to cloud, and he looked as if he was in great pain.

The girl's first thought was that this man was faking an injury for compensation, that he had drunk water from her supermarket and immediately felt unwell.

But after watching him for a while, she didn't think it was that. The man really seemed to be in pain.

"Sir, do you want me to call 120 for you?" the girl asked.

Who knew the man in front of her would reach out, push her to the ground, then stagger to his feet and run out of the store.

The girl had intended to call the police or 120, because she felt the man's condition was very unstable. But in the end, with the mindset of avoiding trouble, she didn't take out her phone.

...

Everything around him was like a mirror made of water, reflecting various colors. A few rays of light shone in, bringing no warmth, but adding a sense of agitation to his heart.

Zhou Ze didn't know where he was going, nor what he was doing. He had even prepared himself mentally, thinking he might have already walked onto the road like Xu Qinglang before, waiting for a car to hit him.

He could only passively resist. He didn't know where he was, nor where he had walked, but he constantly resisted the impulse of self-abandonment that appeared in his mind.

"Clang..."

A sound came.

Zhou Ze knocked over a trash can in front of him, then fell into the pile of garbage. The pungent, sour smell failed to wake him. In his vision, it was all lush green grass, like a paradise.

Even though the surrounding scenery was beautiful, even though the surrounding colors were vibrant,

It didn't give him the slightest feeling of comfort.

This place was more like a cage, making one instinctively reject it and want to escape.

Laughter and joy came from all around. There seemed to be a group of beautiful women dancing, and in the distance, incense smoke curled, as if countless people were worshiping at an altar.

Various images kept surfacing in Zhou Ze's mind, squeezing his nerves little by little. Any single image could become the last straw to break the camel's back.

Finally, the image froze.

Zhou Ze found himself standing at the entrance of a familiar courtyard.

A sign for the orphanage hung above.

And in front of him, a couple was leaving a baby carriage there. They seemed to be about to leave.

Zhou Ze had asked the director about his birth after he grew up. In fact, the director would not hide it from the children once they grew up. He told Zhou Ze that he had been voluntarily abandoned by his parents.

Since then, Zhou Ze had never thought about finding his biological parents. He simply assumed his parents were dead, and his life would no longer need them.

But at this moment,

Zhou Ze suddenly had a premonition,

That couple in front should be his parents,

And the child in the baby carriage,

Should be him.

He subconsciously lifted his foot,

Wanting to run over,

To see what his parents looked like, and perhaps even question them about why they abandoned him.

But that foot only lifted,

It didn't fall.

Zhou Ze's face showed a look of struggle.

He instinctively sensed something. If that foot landed, it would be an abyss!

Everything beautiful had finally solidified into the scene before him. This was a poisoned pie, a trap set by the hunter, just waiting for the prey to take that step.

...

At the edge of the skyscraper's rooftop,

Zhou Ze, already standing on the parapet, swayed precariously, leaning forward again and again as if to fall, but each time adjusting his center of gravity back.

He was struggling,

He was resisting,

And, his life hung by a thread.

On one side of the rooftop stood a headless woman.

The woman was no longer wearing a yellow sweater, but a green robe, somewhat old and with several damaged areas. But the woman stood there coldly, facing Zhou Ze, who seemed on the verge of falling at any moment.

And on the rooftop, there was a third person, a priest.

Unfortunately, Zhou Ze couldn't open his eyes to see at this moment, otherwise he would have recognized this priest, whom he had just met not long ago.

At Miss Liu's funeral, this priest had remained silent throughout, other than offering him a cigarette.

Even in the face of the two families' strangely cold banquet, the priest just stood by, quietly watching, as if admiring a ukiyo-e painting.

The priest looked at Zhou Ze for a moment, then at the headless woman in front of him.

He shook his head,

And spoke to the headless woman:

"Lady Green Robe, he is a Soul Messenger."

This was a reminder,

Reminding the headless woman of the man's identity.

But this reminder was undoubtedly like adding fuel to the fire.

The priest, without the awareness of adding fuel to the fire, continued, "If he is killed by you, it will cause a reaction in Hell."

The headless woman suddenly turned around, facing the priest.

The priest smiled nonchalantly and immediately changed his tone:

"But he is only a temporary Soul Messenger, a low-ranking one. Even if he's gone, he's gone.

At this time, anyone who dares to disturb Lady's mood should not have a good end.

Moreover, Lady herself has done nothing wrong."

The headless woman turned back to face Zhou Ze, seeming to spare the somewhat annoying priest.

The priest stood there, continuing to play the role of a bystander. This seemed to be his favorite role.

He knew the identity of this headless woman, and was even a little surprised that this Soul Messenger, whom he had met before, hadn't detected the woman's identity immediately.

How utterly incompetent was this Soul Messenger in his duties?

She's not a ghost,

She's simply not someone you have jurisdiction over.

Yet you stared at her, chased her,

And in the end,

Angered her.

Women, after all, hold grudges.

Especially this one,

A woman whose time is running out.

The priest looked behind him. The building was tall, with a great view, allowing him to see a construction site in the distance, undergoing demolition. Dust was flying there.

The most direct memory an era leaves people with is truly its architecture. And the current urban renewal and upgrading is undoubtedly a process of gradually erasing many past imprints.

Turning back,

Looking at Zhou Ze, who was still standing at the edge, swaying back and forth,

The priest was also somewhat surprised,

This temporary Soul Messenger was really persistent.

Even if it were him, he might not be able to last this long.

But at this moment,

The priest suddenly saw Zhou Ze's fingernails slowly melting, but the dripping liquid didn't fall, instead flowing back into his body.

Zhou Ze's skin, at this point, began to gradually take on a bronze luster. This wasn't the bronze color created by sunlight and exercise, but a color imbued with

Darkness,

Curses,

Coldness,

Many negative existences.

At the same time, the priest noticed green light slowly emanating from Zhou Ze's tightly closed eyes, like a fierce beast that had been dormant.

Now,

It was gradually being stimulated to awaken.

At the corners of Zhou Ze's mouth, two fangs gradually protruded through his lips.

Bai Yingying had always been curious about one thing: she was, after all, a zombie who had slept for two hundred years, but why did Zhou Ze's fingernails pound her so badly?

Before him,

The priest, with a look of disbelief on his face, gave her the answer.

His mouth twitched,

And he uttered two words:

"Zombie!"

title: 第八十五章 猴哥！
content:
On the rooftop,

Zhou Ze, positioned at the edge, was slowly turning around.

The priest’s lips parted in surprise.

The headless woman remained standing there. The wind on the rooftop was strong, yet her skirt was perfectly still.

“That shouldn’t be right. As a **Ghost Messenger** [1], his previous physical body must be gone. Most of them can only inhabit others’ bodies to walk among the living.

How did this zombie just appear?”

The priest muttered to himself, his forehead furrowed with questions.

As a qualified observer, keen observation and diligent thought are essential virtues for a bystander.

And when Zhou Ze turned around, the priest’s previously open lips slowly curved into a smile, as he suddenly realized:

“**So desu ne** [2]!”

Unlike Zhou Ze’s arms, which were beginning to show a bronze hue, the skin on Zhou Ze’s front, though also showing a faint bronze luster, was very light and uneven.

At the same time, some areas of his skin began to wrinkle and crack, and blood was slowly seeping out, presenting a terrifying sight.

“He inherently carries a small portion of the zombie legacy within his soul. Now, under extreme mental stimulation, the zombie part of his soul has manifested.

But his body is still that of an ordinary person, simply unable to bear or inherit such a load, leading to this strange, neither-one-nor-the-other situation.

He’s a zombie, and yet not a zombie.”

The priest spoke to himself, a hint of excitement in his eyes. His hands under his sleeves slightly parted, and two scalpels appeared in his palms.

“Which part should I cut off and take back for slow research, or perhaps, take the whole thing back?”

His tongue licked his lips; the priest seemed troubled.

The other party was a **Ghost Messenger**. While **Madam Qingyi** [3] might disregard his identity as a **Ghost Messenger**, he could not. And if **Madam Qingyi** were to kill him completely, then a corpse he brought back would lose its research value.

“It’s truly vexing.”

The priest scratched his head, looking very conflicted, but the two scalpels in his hands gleamed in the sunlight, instantly drawing the gazes of both the headless woman and Zhou Ze toward him.

“Oh!”

The priest’s expression froze,

He immediately dropped the two scalpels to the ground and took a step back,

Bowing slightly,

He said very sincerely:

“I’m sorry to have disturbed you. Please continue.”

For a bystander to draw themselves into a battle and then die inexplicably is a great taboo.

Zhou Ze’s gaze once again fell upon the headless woman. Honestly, the previous Zhou Ze was purely a “back-killer” [4]; now, the constantly seeping blood and tearing skin on his front truly revealed Zhou Ze’s extremely poor physical condition at this moment.

Instead of saying Zhou Ze was a zombie now, it would be more accurate to say he was Mr. Zombie A, a background extra from a Western zombie film.

The only difference was,

Zhou Ze’s eyes glowed green,

This made him seem more advanced than the extras in Western zombie films who could be easily killed with an axe.

Well, upgraded from an extra to an extra with fifty cents worth of special effects.

“Ah!”

Zhou Ze opened his mouth,

And let out a roar,

Without earth-shattering volume,

Nor surging grandeur,

More like the wail of damaged vocal cords.

The headless woman continued to stand there, motionless.

And then,

Zhou Ze moved. His movements were exaggerated, like a sprinter in a hundred-meter race, with huge body swings, directly pouncing on the headless woman.

There was no collision sound, no dazzling sparks,

Just like a drunken man in a fit of madness tackling a delicate woman.

There was no beauty whatsoever.

“*Whoosh…*”

Zhou Ze, having tackled her, pressed the headless woman beneath him and directly raised his fist to strike.

“*Thud!*”

“*Thud!*”

“*Thud!*”

Punch after punch,

Each landing on the concrete slab of the rooftop,

All around, there was bloodstains,

Not **Madam Qingyi**’s blood, but Zhou Ze’s.

“Because in this state he’s left with only instinct and no capacity for thought, he is therefore no longer affected by **Madam Qingyi**’s abilities, is that it?

And because he carries the aura of a zombie, he can touch spirit entities and thus launch his own attacks.”

The priest opened his mouth and said, “Oh,”

“How did such a person become a **Ghost Messenger**? Has the Underworld’s review system collapsed to this extent?”

Under repeated heavy blows, it appeared each time as if Zhou Ze was hitting the concrete slab, but in reality, **Madam Qingyi**’s body was slowly distorting, like a pool of water, constantly rippling.

The surface of the water,

Was no longer calm.

“It seems **Madam Qingyi** is doomed to lose. Although she doesn’t belong to the ghost sequence, she doesn’t possess any physical offensive abilities apart from mental influence.

Now, she can only passively take the blows.”
