What's more, the ghost before him was about to be sent to hell by him. At this point, there was no need for him to make up stories to deceive himself.

This was a good police officer, worthy of three drinks.

Zhou Ze pointed to the wine glass.

This was all he could do.

In this world, turmoil, various injustices, and tragedies are happening every moment. Zhou Ze couldn't manage so much, nor was he willing to.

Managing this bookstore well and getting his second life on the right track was what he was thinking about now.

"Is there judgment in Hell?"

The man in black asked Zhou Ze.

Zhou Ze was startled by the question.

He suddenly thought of the teacher wearing the tall hat, on which was written "beast in human clothing."

Zhou Ze had tried to help him remove that hat, but couldn't; the hat was very solid and hard, completely unmovable.

This also meant that the Yama's Palace in Hell didn't seem to be the place of clear judgment as rumored, nor were all the Judges all-seeing and all-knowing.

Most of them were probably muddled through, muddling along day by day.

People always hold an inexplicable hope for things they don't understand, like Heaven, like Hell.

People always believe that in places they haven't been, there will be more beautiful fragrances.

This is a spiritual anesthesia, a form of self-hypnosis.

At least for now, Hell, it seems, isn't much different from the human world.

But Zhou Ze still nodded.

"Yes, everything will come to light in Hell."

The man in black stood up, looked at Zhou Ze, and said, "I don't need you to send an anonymous letter for me, just help me find my body. If you consider yourself a ghost messenger, I beg you. If you consider yourself a living person, as a citizen, you have an obligation to cooperate with our police actions."

The man spoke a place name:

Qiming Road, Huangjia Town section.

"Your bodies haven't been discovered yet?" Zhou Ze was a bit surprised.

"No, not yet. So I haven't been identified. Besides my superior who knows my identity, everyone else thinks I've absconded with this group."

"I'll try."

Zhou Ze rubbed his brow.

Trouble, it's really troublesome.

As a newly-minted homebody, all he wanted was to open a shop, do some business, and then lie on Bai Yingying's lap at night, eating grapes she peeled for him.

Now, having to go on a long trip, it truly made him feel very annoyed.

"Please send us down. Send us all down together. On the road to the Underworld, I also want to escort them to see the Judges. I want to personally see them brought to justice."

Zhou Ze nodded, opened the gate to Hell, and at the same time asked, "Are they drug traffickers?"

The man in black shook his head.

"Then smugglers?"

"It was gambling," the man in black said in a deep voice.

"Oh." Zhou Ze was a bit puzzled. Was catching gamblers worth all this trouble?

"Gambling with human lives as stakes."

The man in black looked at Zhou Ze but didn't continue, knowing Zhou Ze wasn't very interested in the matter.

He grabbed the three little ghosts and walked into the gate of Hell.

A moment later, the smoke dissipated.

Zhou Ze clapped his hands, took out his notebook, and checked. The performance chart showed 20%.

There was still 80% completion, but judging by the business of the new shop, it shouldn't take too long to become a regular.

He picked up his teacup, preparing to walk to his bar counter to continue being his leisurely Old Man Zhou, but found that at some point, someone was standing behind him.

It was Tang Shi.

She was still chewing on White Rabbit milk candy.

"Why didn't you agree to investigate? It would be so interesting?" Tang Shi asked.

"I don't have that much free time." Zhou Ze walked back to the bar counter and sat down.

"Gambling with lives as stakes, it sounds quite interesting," Tang Shi continued. "If he were here, he would go and take a look."

"He is him, I am me."

"Oh, business seems to be going well today. It really seems like a change of scenery is good for people." Tang Shi walked to the doorway, looking at the two female university students still sheltering from the rain outside.

"The rain hasn't stopped."

"You're not staying upstairs, coming down here to play the sentimental type?" Zhou Ze asked, somewhat surprised.

Tang Shi shook her head, then she spread out her hand.

A paper crane folded from paper fluttered gracefully, exquisitely lifelike.

"Zhou Ze, you know, sometimes it's not about actively avoiding trouble; trouble won't just avoid you."

"But at least it can reduce the amount of trouble." Zhou Ze lit a cigarette.

"I haven't had much to do these past two days, so I investigated you."

Said as if you usually have something to do.

In Zhou Ze's opinion, if one disregarded her special abilities and her identity as a reincarnated being, Tang Shi was merely a pretty face, incapable of doing anything and unwilling to do anything.

Except her legs looked good, could play with them for a year.

"Where are your eyes looking?"

The ballpoint pen on Zhou Ze's counter floated up, dangling in front of his eyes, seemingly ready to poke them out at any moment.

"You look much better in black stockings than in nude ones."

Zhou Ze commented.

Tang Shi tossed out her phone, which floated in front of Zhou Ze.

On it was a news screenshot.

A prison in Subei had a riot, resulting in one inmate dead and over ten injured.

"What does this mean?" Zhou Ze asked, looking at the screen.

"How afraid of trouble are you?" Tang Shi shook her head helplessly. "You don't even recognize the person who drove the big truck that killed you?"

Zhou Ze's pupils immediately constricted.

"It wasn't me," Zhou Ze said.

"I know it wasn't you," Tang Shi said, "but he's dead."

"Accident, perhaps? What if they also like to play hide-and-seek?"

Zhou Ze shrugged.

Just then, Xu Qinglang came down. He patted his forehead and said to Zhou Ze:

"Old Zhou, sorry, I forgot something a few days ago. Your uncle was looking for you when you went missing. He said his son, your cousin, died in a car accident and he wanted you to attend the funeral.

I figured since you're Zhou Ze, Xu Le's relatives have nothing to do with you, plus you weren't around then, so I forgot. Just remembered now, so I'm telling you. The funeral was probably half a month ago, it's long over."

Upon hearing this, Zhou Ze's expression finally became serious.

For some reason, it seemed as if a whirlpool had already, unbeknownst to him, begun to stir.

title: 第九十三章 牆壁後的福馬林
content:
Zhou Ze was very afraid of trouble, genuinely afraid, but this didn't mean that when something was pointedly directed at him, he would foolishly cover his eyes with two leaves and pretend not to see anything.

Xu Qinglang, seeing Zhou Ze's face turn so serious after he finished speaking, was also startled and subconsciously asked,

"Is something wrong?"

Zhou Ze shook his head, "Nothing."

"Then I'll head up first?"

"Mm."

Xu Qinglang went up, looking back three times with each step. Instinctively, he felt something was amiss, but since Zhou Ze wasn't willing to share, he didn't press him. Everyone had their little secrets and their own calculations.

"You're serious now?"

Tang Shi looked at Zhou Ze, a half-smile on her face.

Zhou Ze also looked at Tang Shi, flicking the ash from his cigarette. He said,

"Why are you investigating me?"

"I told you, it's out of curiosity." Tang Shi voluntarily walked to the bar counter, closing the distance between herself and Zhou Ze. At the same time, her fingertips glided across the counter. "You know, you're different from us, truly different."

"You said that before, that I haven't truly experienced hell, while you all have been tortured."

"No, this matter isn't that simple. I, and that person, barely escaped after experiencing the great horror of hell, while you just started on the Yellow Springs Road and managed to escape alive.

You know,

One event, one experience,

Is enough to completely change a person.

For example, whenever I and that person talk about the word 'hell,' we instinctively tremble a little, because those two words 'hell' and all its associated images are a great horror branded in our hearts.

Even if we've both 'lived' again, our personalities and ways of handling things have been greatly altered because of it.

You're different. You just went on a picnic to hell and came back.

So, you can sit at a small table with that police officer and chat about hell with a laugh, quite cheerfully."

"So, what exactly do you mean? What else have you found?"

The driver of the large truck that ran him over died.

Xu Le's cousin, who helped Xu Le hire a killer, also died.

Two people, dying in a short period of time;

An ordinary person might not connect the deaths of these two people, but for Zhou Ze, this matter was very unusual.

Xu Le died, his body given to him.

The driver died.

His cousin also died.

Everyone who was involved in that incident before had died.

Could there really be such coincidences?

"We are anomalies in this world. We are even different from the ghost messengers; we are stowaways, and you are an anomaly among anomalies.

We are different."

"Get to the point." Zhou Ze tapped the blackboard (bar counter).

"Have you never suspected that your death and your rebirth were not an accident?"

Tang Shi lowered her voice and asked slowly,

"Think carefully, are there any details you overlooked before?"

…………

"They're chasing me, they've found me…"

The old man's nails dug into his arm, and his final relieved smile.

At the traffic light, his car had just pulled out.

A large truck ran a red light and drove out,

Heading straight for him.

The fire and scorching heat of the crematorium;

The numbness and desolation on the Yellow Springs Road to hell.

The faceless woman's roar and resentment,

The black fingernails that grew on his fingertips.

Himself swaying dizzily by the roadside,

A man in a hoodie ran out of the bookstore,

He bludgeoned Xu Le to death with a baseball bat,

Then he entered Xu Le's body.

…………

Zhou Ze slowly raised his head, opening his eyes.

What happened to the person who killed Xu Le,

After he reported the incident that time?

Zhou Ze had always overlooked this matter.

He had been going in circles between the bookstore and Dr. Lin's matters, largely attributing Xu Le's death and his own "cuckoo's nest" to a karmic cycle and just retribution.

It was also another kind of "heaven has eyes."

But since the old man, who was taken to the hospital for resuscitation, intentionally dug his nails into his arm,

The truck driver who ran a red light and killed him was intentional,

So many people, all intentional,

Then,

That man who had previously explained his actions as a temporary fit of madness, intending to rob some money and bludgeon Xu Le with a baseball bat,

Could he,

Also have been intentional?

If he was intentional,

That would mean his death leading to his rebirth,

This entire sequence,

Was all deliberately planned, and he was like a toy car on a race track, appearing to be speeding, but in reality, merely following a predetermined path.

"It seems you've thought of something."

Tang Shi put another White Rabbit milk candy into her mouth.

Zhou Ze picked up his phone, preparing to call the police station. The last time he reported the case, he also gave a statement at the police station. His first meeting with Dr. Lin was also at the police station.

The female police officer led Dr. Lin to him and said, "Your wife is here to pick you up."

Zhou Ze was in a daze for quite a while.

However, before dialing, Zhou Ze looked at Tang Shi and asked,

"How did you find out?"

"You know, compared to us,

You're like a cute husky,

Who snuck into a wolf pack."

………………

The rain continued to fall, showing no sign of stopping. Tongcheng, located in the Yangtze River Delta region, naturally had abundant rainfall this season.

There were no earthquakes here, nor tsunamis. The only recurring issue that might cause some impact was internal flooding.

Dressed in a raincoat, Zhou Ze walked beneath the old apartment building. The trash cans were soaked with rainwater, and some trash had floated out.

Tang Shi wore rain boots and a black raincoat, her legs vaguely visible in the rainwater, but Zhou Ze had no leisure to admire such a scene.

After calling to inquire, the person he sent to the police station was only detained for half a month, charged with violating public order regulations. After all, although he "assaulted" Zhou Ze in his shop, he was ultimately subdued by Zhou Ze, making it difficult to press a major charge.

And Zhou Ze couldn't possibly say:

Officer,

He's a murderer,

He killed me,

And I'm not me,

I'm borrowing a corpse to return to life!!!

If he said that,

He'd probably end up being forcibly sent to a mental hospital instead of the other guy going to jail.

However, Zhou Ze still managed to get the person's address from there, which was in this area.

"This is the one."

Up on the second floor, Zhou Ze stopped in front of a door.

Most of the apartments in this community were rented to migrant workers in Tongcheng. The facilities were quite poor, and they used shared bathrooms.

"Are you sure?" Tang Shi asked.

"The house number should be correct."

Zhou Ze tried to peer through the window, but a screen and old curtains blocked the view, making it impossible to see inside from the outside.

"I'll go find something to pry the door open first..."

"Click..."

The door lock opened automatically.

Tang Shi made a "please" gesture to Zhou Ze.

Zhou Ze was stunned for a moment,

Then smiled,

And walked in.

He thought to himself that it was a pity he wasn't doing this kind of "thievery" with her all the time.

The room was actually a one-bedroom apartment,

One room,

Containing a bed, a wardrobe, and a small cooking area with an induction cooker.

The room was tidily kept, but some areas had accumulated dust, indicating that no one had lived there for a long time.

"How long has he been out?"

"Several months. I sent him to the police station the day after I was reborn, and he was released half a month later."

Zhou Ze looked around, examining the details.

"Did he move?" Tang Shi asked.

Zhou Ze shook his head, "Not sure."

The guy who bludgeoned Xu Le to death with a baseball bat,

Had he disappeared?

Zhou Ze suddenly noticed an unusual area on the wall behind the bed. He stepped onto the bed, reached out to feel that section of the wall, and then said,

"This wall looks like it was painted over recently."

"Is there something hidden inside?" Tang Shi asked.

Zhou Ze put his ear to the wall and tapped it with his hand. "It doesn't sound hollow."

Actually, in this type of housing, hollow spots in walls are very common. When decorating a new apartment, the construction team usually sends an experienced foreman to tap on the walls and floors with a ruler. If they find problems, they ask the developer for rectification before starting the renovation.

"Just open it up and see," Tang Shi said.

Zhou Ze nodded, about to say he would go find tools, then glanced at Tang Shi and instinctively stepped back a few paces.

Tang Shi's gaze fell upon the kitchen knife and other hard objects near the induction cooker. Then these objects flew out, continuously hitting and chiseling at the wall, in a repetitive motion.

The idea of starting a construction company once again flashed through Zhou Ze's mind.

Bai Yingying alone could match the labor of a construction team,

Tang Shi could match a batch of engineering equipment,

He would just need to sit there and count money.

However, as the wall continuously cracked, Zhou Ze immediately discarded those random thoughts from his mind.

"Bang!"

A section of the wall shattered and fell,

A human face was revealed,

This face still maintained a horrified expression, seemingly perfectly preserving its emotional state before death.

It was that person,

The one who bludgeoned Xu Le to death with a baseball bat!

In the air,

A sour smell permeated.

Zhou Ze reached out, examined the corpse inside, frowned, and said,

"The body looks like it died less than a week ago."

"You're not a forensic doctor, are you?" Tang Shi reminded him.

"It's common knowledge for a surgeon; you can roughly estimate the time of death based on the body's post-mortem state," Zhou Ze explained.

"Then I can tell you, the wall I just broke open was definitely not sealed up less than a week ago; at least three months ago."

Tang Shi unwrapped a piece of milk candy, put it in her mouth, and continued,

"Unless you think he was killed a week ago and then moved into a wall sealed three months ago."

Zhou Ze immediately realized something was wrong.

Obviously, the corpse couldn't have been "teleported" into the wall later, and the wall was perfectly intact before Tang Shi started to break it open.

He sniffed,

That sour smell,

He had previously thought it was just the scent of the corpse,

But now,

Zhou Ze suddenly realized something, pushed aside the hair on the corpse's head,

Indeed,

He found a small hole, an injection site.

"Yes, the body died a long time ago, but he was injected with formaldehyde, which is why the body is so well-preserved.

Furthermore,

The formaldehyde was likely slowly injected into him while he was still alive,

Because the effect would be better if it diffused throughout the body via blood circulation."

title: 第九十四章 陪葬？
content:
Outdoors, Zhou Ze smoked a cigarette while Tang Shi stood beside him, chewing on a milk candy.

Inside the house, the corpse on the wall hung limply, its face frozen in an expression of horror and shock, as if the murder and body concealment had just taken place.

They were all dead.
Not a single one left.

Xu Le was dead.
The person who killed Xu Le was dead.
The hit-and-run driver was dead.
The younger cousin was dead.

All the points on that line were dead.
Even Zhou Ze, in fact, was dead.

As Tang Shi had said, sometimes it’s not that you intentionally avoid trouble; trouble simply won’t come looking for you.

A pocket had opened long ago, and whether you wanted it or not, liked it or not, you were already inside that pocket.

"They're all dead, so the clues are probably gone," Tang Shi said, looking at Zhou Ze with a smile. She seemed to enjoy seeing Zhou Ze in this emotional state.

In a pack of wolves, each one looked grim and sullen all day, but then a husky appeared, only wanting to lie there looking cute.
It was really an annoying sight.
Why should we all be burdened with heavy thoughts,
While only you are innocent and carefree?
It's not about scarcity but about unfairness, and this isn't just true in financial distribution.

"Currently, that seems to be the case." Zhou Ze reached up and rubbed his temples. "Also, I have to worry about one thing: whether the police will eventually investigate me."

The mastermind, the one who paid, was Xu Le.
The driver was dead, and the intermediary, the cousin, was also dead.
The reason Zhou Ze had held back from seeking revenge before was precisely this: he didn't want to expose himself, as it would destroy his current life.

Modern society is vastly different from ancient times; even if there were household registration systems in ancient times, it wasn't hard for someone without an identity to hide and live as a recluse.
In modern society, however, a person's identity information and labels are crucial. Of course, Zhou Ze could hide if he wanted to, but the cost would be a rapid decline in his quality of life, constantly living on the run.

Now, although Zhou Ze didn't kill anyone, he would naturally have to bear the potential repercussions of their deaths.
He didn't get to enjoy the satisfaction of revenge,
And now he had to take the blame.
So frustrating!

Taking out his phone, Zhou Ze dialed the police station.
"Hello, I'd like to report a crime."

Tang Shi didn't accompany Zhou Ze to the police station. Instead, she returned to the bookstore. Walking through the mud in a raincoat to inspect a murder scene with Zhou Ze on a rainy day was the most she could do. She couldn't possibly accompany Zhou Ze to face the complex interrogations and investigations at the police station.

As for Zhou Ze, he had no choice; he had to do it. After all, he had just called the police station to inquire about the deceased's residence. If he didn't report it now, his suspicion would only increase when the bodies were discovered later.
As for secretly disposing of the bodies, Zhou Ze was unwilling to do so. Until he could figure out who was manipulating everything behind the scenes, Zhou Ze didn't want to be clever and clean up someone else's mess.
He might accidentally dig a pit and bury himself in it.

…………

The investigation and questioning lasted until past eight in the evening. Several waves of police officers rotated, making it clear that they were treating Zhou Ze as the murderer.

Don't assume that a murderer wouldn't voluntarily report a crime.
In fact,
According to police big data statistics, more than 80% of murderers in homicide cases will disguise themselves as "bystanders" and return to the crime scene to observe.
Most murderers' mindsets are to disguise themselves and gather information, while a smaller portion harbors a perverse desire to admire their "artwork" after committing a killing.
If the victim's body remains undiscovered for too long, it's like a pearl hidden in the dark for the murderer, or the Mona Lisa's smile covered by a black cloth—it gnaws at them. So, they simply report the crime themselves to have that cover lifted.

Finally, a grey-haired old detective sat in front of Zhou Ze, closed his notebook, and said, "Mr. Zhou, you may leave, but please do not leave Tongcheng for the next month. We may need to speak with you again for further information."

"Alright."
Zhou Ze stood up and left the interrogation room, walking to the police station entrance.
He turned back, looking at the police officers coming and going and the row of police cars parked inside. A pressure weighed on him for some reason.
Perhaps, before long, the truth of the staged car accident would also surface. At that time, what he would face might be a real storm.
The victim was himself, but the true murderer,
was also himself.

Zhou Ze was preparing to return to the bookstore; he was tired and wanted to rest. His phone rang at that moment—his sister-in-law was calling.
"Hello, Xu Le, your uncle is here again. He's sitting by the stairwell. I asked him to come in, but he refused, saying he just wanted to wait for you to come back."

Uncle?
"Just tell him I won't be back, and don't tell him the address of my new shop either." Zhou Ze didn't want to deal with irrelevant people right now.

*Bang!*
A sound of banging on the door came from the other end of the phone.
Zhou Ze frowned slightly and asked, "What's wrong?"
"Uh, your uncle is banging on the door. He said if you don't come back today, he'll make sure you go to jail."

Upon hearing this,
Zhou Ze looked up, gritted his teeth, and said, "Tell him I'll be right back."

…………

No one wants to live like a punching bag, no one wants their life to be constrained. Everyone wants to be spontaneous, but that's just how life is.
When you're a few months old, you can pee anywhere, wet the bed freely, and your elders and relatives will still smile at you, flicking your little dick.
But when you're in your teens or twenties, it's impossible to pee freely or have your dick flicked anymore.
It's hard to imagine a forty-five-year-old elder flicking a twenty-something young man's dick:
"You peed again, how naughty."
That image is too much to bear.

And so, when Zhou Ze appeared before Xu Dachuan,
Xu Dachuan's face was grim,
and Zhou Ze's face was equally gloomy.
No one was happy,
No one was joyful,
But they still had to meet.

Xu Dachuan hadn't harmed anyone inside the house. When Zhou Ze arrived, he was squatting there, smoking his dry tobacco pipe. Seeing Zhou Ze approach, he stood up, patted his trousers, and said, "Come for a walk with me."
This time, Xu Dachuan didn't bring any local specialties; he came empty-handed.
Zhou Ze and Xu Dachuan walked out together. He didn't bother to greet his sister-in-law or Dr. Lin peering through the door crack.
The two walked out of the residential complex.
It was already completely dark.
Under the streetlights, there weren't many people.
Xu Dachuan walked a distance, then squatted down again, puffing on his dry tobacco pipe.
Zhou Ze stopped beside him.

"Xiao Chuanzi has already been cremated," Xu Dachuan said.
Xiao Chuanzi was likely the cousin's nickname.
"Mmm," Zhou Ze responded. "I wasn't in Tongcheng at the time."
"It's fine."
Xu Dachuan tapped his tobacco pipe, then looked up. His face was full of wrinkles and the marks of age. He was an honest, simple old man who had worked hard to support his family; Xu Le, the university student, had actually been put through school by him.
"Ah Le, you not coming to Xiao Chuanzi's funeral was really a bit heartless."
Xu Dachuan's eyes welled up. He squatted there, wiping tears from the corners of his eyes with his chapped hands.
"I said, I wasn't in Tongcheng at the time."

Xu Dachuan suddenly stood up, grabbed Zhou Ze's collar with one hand, pushed him back, and pinned him against a utility pole.
"Ah Le, tell your uncle the truth, did you kill Xiao Chuanzi?"
Zhou Ze's eyes narrowed slightly. The information in Xu Dachuan's question was extensive.
Before this, Zhou Ze had had some goodwill towards Xu Dachuan;
Right and wrong, good and bad, had nothing to do with him, and besides, Xu Dachuan was the first stranger who had truly cared about him since his rebirth.
He could endure the Lin family's disdain and bring local specialties to visit him,
Even on his sickbed, he would smile amiably at Dr. Lin, his niece-in-law, clearly pleased,
And he even said that if being a live-in son-in-law didn't work out, he could just come back and farm with him.
In Zhou Ze's view, he should have been simple, kind, and a clean slate.
But now, it seemed this clean slate was not as pure as he had imagined.

"It wasn't me." Zhou Ze reached out and gripped Xu Dachuan's wrist.

"Don't think I don't know about Xiao Chuanzi and your business. I also know that Xiao Chuanzi has been coming to you often recently to ask for money. He's insensible, he's a failure, he has a thousand faults.
But he's still your brother!"
Xu Dachuan's eyes began to show bloodshot veins; he was on the verge of going crazy.
"I don't know what you're talking about." Zhou Ze suddenly felt a great dislike for the man in front of him,
This honest, simple man.

"Don't know what I'm talking about?"
Xu Dachuan leaned his face close to Zhou Ze's, articulating each word:
"That driver, is he dead? He's from the village next to mine. Do you think Xiao Chuanzi could know anyone, could know anyone who keeps their mouth shut?
He's just a nobody; what right does he have to negotiate with anyone?
That driver, I went and found him, went and negotiated with him.
Your uncle wanted you to have a good life; your wife fell for someone else, and you were living a stifled life, so your uncle helped you kill that mistress!
Your uncle wants all the children in our family to live comfortably, not to be bullied, not to be looked down upon.
But,
Ah Le,
You can't kill Xiao Chuanzi to silence him,
Your father died young; it was your uncle who supported your schooling. Your uncle has always treated you like his own child!
Tell your uncle the truth, from the bottom of your heart,
Was Xiao Chuanzi intentionally run over by someone you hired, like last time?
Were you trying to silence him?"

Zhou Ze took a deep breath.
Xu Dachuan had asked the wrong person.
In fact,
Every question he asked was like adding fuel to the fire.
One must remember that the person standing before him,
was not his nephew Xu Le,
but the true victim and aggrieved party in that incident!

*Bang!*
Zhou Ze kicked out, sending Xu Dachuan sprawling to the ground.
At this moment, Zhou Ze felt an uncontrollable urge to expose everything;
He regretted it, deeply regretted it. If he had known it would come to this, he should have voluntarily surrendered to the police when he first reincarnated.
Xu Le's cousin,
Xu Dachuan,
That driver,
Let them all face justice under the law, even if he were implicated as Xu Le—he wouldn't care.
To use this second life he gained to avenge his first life seemed like a satisfying revenge.
At least,
It would be far better than his current predicament.

But now,
The cousin and the driver were dead, and the person who killed Xu Le was also dead. They died decisively, leaving Zhou Ze's revenge nowhere to begin.
You have strength, you have power, but hitting a cotton ball is always frustrating.

Xu Dachuan, who had been kicked to the ground, immediately scrambled up and yelled at Zhou Ze,
"Ah Le, you're the one who turned your back on us,
I'm going to report you to the Public Security Bureau,
You're a murderer,
A murderer!
I want you to be buried with Xiao Chuanzi, buried with him!!!"

Zhou Ze looked at Xu Dachuan,
Looking at this old man, who still appeared weathered and honest despite everything,
His left hand, held behind his back,
Slowly grew black fingernails.
Zhou Ze curved his lips into a smile,
As if savoring the word:
"Buried with him?"

title: 第九十五章 幕後黑手
content:
Xu Dachuan was screaming, going insane. This man had been under immense psychological pressure and torment since the death of his son.

He felt wronged.

He felt pain.

He felt his life had been difficult and full of hardships.

If it had been anyone else standing in Zhou Ze’s place, they might have felt some sympathy and pity for him.

But unfortunately,

Standing before him was Zhou Ze.

Anyone could sympathize with him,

But not Zhou Ze.

He was dead.

This rough man, now crying, insane, and hysterical,

Was also one of the accomplices in his own murder.

Why do you all think you’re pitiful?

Why do you all think you’re wronged?

What about me?

Who will pity me?

Who will spare a thought for me?

Zhou Ze naturally walked up to Xu Dachuan. He raised his chin. At that moment, countless emotions were wildly urging him to kill the man in front of him.

To tear him to shreds,

Not just his body,

But his soul!

He had to make him endure the greatest pain and torment to quell the rage in his heart!

Life, it seemed, always had many coincidences. A police car drove over from a distance.

Zhou Ze watched the flashing lights on the police car. At this moment, he felt no fear or dread; instead, he felt a sense of carefree abandon, as if he had nothing left to lose.

If all of this truly was just a trap,

Then,

He might as well go crazy with it.

Instead of suffering and feeling wronged alone,

It would be better if everyone,

Hurt each other!

Xu Dachuan was still shouting and jumping. The police car stopped nearby, and two police officers got out. They might have been on patrol or just passing by, but they got out to understand the situation.

The police walked over. Xu Dachuan suddenly quieted down. He looked at Zhou Ze with hateful eyes, then at the police.

He began to walk towards the police of his own accord.

Meanwhile, Zhou Ze’s hands, clasped behind his back, had completely grown out their fingernails, and wisps of black energy continuously swirled around his ten fingers.

He closed his eyes.

In the depths of his pupils,

A black torrent seemed to be flowing.

At this moment, Zhou Ze seemed to gradually rediscover the feeling he had on the rooftop that day, as if he had been completely abandoned by society and by life itself.

That loneliness, that helplessness,

Continuously released the suppressed emotions accumulated deep within him.

I am a psychopomp.

I died once.

I cultivated my mind and body,

But I don’t like to swallow my anger.

If an upcoming storm is truly upon me,

Then in this downpour,

I shall indulge myself one last time.

Before, Zhou Ze had always been very wary; he feared becoming an example of someone suppressed, like that person in Rongcheng.

But sometimes, it’s truly difficult to control yourself.

Of course, what’s even harder to control is the vortex around you; it actively pushes you, tempts you, and forces you,

Step by step,

Towards the abyss.

“What’s going on?” one police officer asked Xu Dachuan, while the other middle-aged officer looked at Zhou Ze.

Instinctively, the middle-aged officer sensed a dangerous aura from Zhou Ze. This was his sixth sense, honed by years of police experience.

Although the young man in front of him was somewhat thin, looked a bit frail, and had his eyes closed, the middle-aged officer’s lips felt dry.

It was a bit embarrassing to admit, but at this moment, he actually felt a little nervous.

“Damn it, what am I nervous about?”

“It’s nothing, I had a bit to drink, just lecturing my junior. He’s disobedient and wants to divorce his wife; he needs a good talking-to!”

Xu Dachuan said, his eyes bloodshot.

The two police officers exchanged glances. Since it was a family matter, they didn’t interfere. They immediately got back in their car, and the police car drove away.

The middle-aged officer turned his head again to look behind.

“Brother Cui, what are you looking at?”

“Nothing.”

The middle-aged officer sat upright and shook his head.

By the roadside,

Xu Dachuan turned his head and looked at Zhou Ze again.

“Hmph… Bah!”

He spat a glob of thick phlegm heavily on the ground.

Xu Dachuan, who had just been yelling about calling the police and reporting Zhou Ze, did not report him to the police.

As a father who had lost his son, he wasn’t worried about getting involved and therefore didn’t dare to report; it could only be said that at that critical moment, he softened.

“You’d best find someone to kill me too, so no one will ever know what you did before!”

Xu Dachuan growled.

His son was dead, and he was unwilling to send his nephew to the execution ground as well, otherwise, his family would be cut off.

His thoughts were very simple,

Truly, very, very simple.

His nephew’s wife had found someone else she liked,

So he helped kill that guy!

Now that his son was dead, he couldn’t let his Xu family line die out.

Very noble?

Yes,

Very noble.

But in Zhou Ze’s eyes,

It was utterly disgusting.

Xu Dachuan bent down to pick up his dry tobacco pipe. He was ready to leave, ready to go home. He had thought about it for a long time and had been angry for a long time, but at this moment, he still didn’t have the courage to truly drag Xu Le to his son’s grave.

However, Xu Dachuan’s dry tobacco pipe was stepped on by Zhou Ze.

Xu Dachuan looked up, a bit stunned.

Zhou Ze slowly bent down and picked up the dry tobacco pipe.

*Bang!*

The dry tobacco pipe struck Xu Dachuan heavily.

Xu Dachuan let out a muffled groan, looking at Zhou Ze with disbelief.

“You dare…”

*Bang!*

Another fierce blow landed. Xu Dachuan was knocked to the ground. His leg had been operated on recently and wasn’t fully recovered, so at this sudden outburst from Zhou Ze, he could only curl up on the ground.

The police had already driven far away, naturally unable to see the scene unfolding.

“I’ll teach you about being noble!”

*Bang!*

Another blow landed.

“I’ll teach you about being soft-hearted!”

*Bang!*

Another blow landed.

“I’ll teach you about feeling wronged!”

*Bang!*

“I’ll teach you about feeling life is tough!”

*Bang!*

“I’ll teach you about feeling life is difficult!”

*Bang!*

“I’ll teach you about feeling pitiful!”

*Bang!*

…

Zhou Ze, who had suppressed his emotions for so long, unleashed a furious barrage of blows on Xu Dachuan, making him tremble on the ground.

Finally,

He dropped the tobacco pipe,

Zhou Ze stumbled back a few steps,

And leaned against the utility pole.

“Cough, cough… cough, cough…”

Heavy coughing sounds came from his mouth.

He looked up,

At the dim night sky.

Some of the anger in his heart had been vented,

But deep down, he didn’t feel much better.

These people,

They were filial sons to their fathers,

They were harmonious brothers,

They helped each other, they cared for each other,

But the more they were like this, the more disgusted Zhou Ze felt.

Turning around, leaving Xu Dachuan bruised and curled up there, Zhou Ze walked away slowly by himself.

He lit a cigarette, took a deep drag,

Then pinched out the flame with his fingernail, crumbled the remaining tobacco, put it in his mouth, and slowly chewed it.

He took out his phone to call a taxi, but there were none nearby.

Left with no choice,

Zhou Ze dialed Xu Qinglang’s number:

“Hello, Old Zhou, what are you doing? Not opening for business today, huh?”

“Come pick me up.”

Zhou Ze gave the address.

“Hold on, I’ll call Old Dao. He just took my car to buy candy for that woman. I’ll have him pick you up on his way back.”

Hanging up the phone,

Zhou Ze spit out the tobacco bits from his mouth and leaned against the utility pole, lost in thought for a long time.

He didn’t kill Xu Dachuan.

Under this trap,

No one was truly innocent,

But everyone seemed to be a puppet on a string, doing what they were supposed to do at predetermined junctures,

Until the end,

Used and discarded.

Someone was guiding all of this, like a catalyst, accelerating its operation.

That person,

Was the true instigator, the culprit who caused his death in a car accident in his previous life.

After about twenty minutes, a black Nissan pulled up beside Zhou Ze. The window rolled down, revealing Old Dao.

“Boss, I found you.”

Old Dao eagerly got out first and opened the car door for Zhou Ze.

Zhou Ze got in. Old Dao then eagerly took out a piece of milk candy from a large bag and handed it to Zhou Ze:

“Boss, have some.”

Zhou Ze pushed Old Dao’s hand away, indicating he wasn’t in the mood.

Old Dao gave an awkward smile, unconcerned.

One had to know, compared to Zhou Ze, his previous boss at the Underworld Shop was much harder to get along with.

Zhou Ze was actually much more peaceful and amiable than the previous one. Of course, it wasn’t to say the previous one had a bad temper, but as soon as he sat behind the counter, Old Dao naturally didn’t even dare to speak too loudly.

“No candy, have a cigarette instead.”

Old Dao handed Zhou Ze a cigarette and lit it for him, then returned to the driver’s seat.

The car started, and Old Dao made a turn, heading back.

At the next intersection, Old Dao turned right. As he passed the entrance of a residential complex, he instinctively slowed down and peered inside.

This was the residential complex where the Lin family lived.

Earlier, Zhou Ze had come here and picked up Xu Dachuan. The two had walked for a while, but they couldn’t have gone too far.

“What are you looking at?” Zhou Ze asked.

“Boss, this is the place, didn’t you know?”

“What?”

“Didn’t Miss Tang tell you before that when she was injured, she could only choose a blind spot to hide? There are only two blind spots in Tongcheng.

One is your bookstore,

And the other is this residential complex.

But Miss Tang said the lights in this place seemed to have a problem, so we ultimately chose to hide near your place to escape the pursuit.”

Old Dao chattered on,

Not noticing,

Zhou Ze’s hand holding the cigarette,

Was slightly trembling…

title: 第九十六章 結婚照中的血淚
content:
"Old Taoist."

"Yes, Boss, what is it?"

"Stop the car."

"Oh, okay."

Getting out of the car, Zhou Ze flicked his cigarette butt to the ground and stomped on it with his shoe.

"You go back first."

"Huh?" The Old Taoist was stunned. "Boss, I can wait for you to come out."

"Go back."

"It's fine, Boss, I'm not afraid of waiting..."

"Go back."

Zhou Ze turned his head and looked at the Old Taoist.

The Old Taoist shivered in fright.

Tsk, tsk, tsk,

Indeed, these guys who climbed out of hell are essentially the same. This one, who seemed quite approachable before, was all a disguise.

A disguise!

The Old Taoist immediately saluted, "Alright, Boss, call me when you need a car."

The Old Taoist drove away.

Zhou Ze lingered at the entrance of the residential complex for about fifteen minutes.

Tang Shi had told him before that, after the little loli left Tongcheng, besides his bookstore, there was another "light under the lamp" place.

However, there might have been a problem with that lamp, which was why Tang Shi didn't choose to hide there but went to his bookstore instead.

Tang Shi hinted that he could go there and see, perhaps there would be unexpected discoveries and gains. "Strike while the iron is hot," or at least, he could take some advantage.

Zhou Ze was afraid of trouble at the time, so he didn't go, nor did he ask for details.

And so, it wasn't until just now, from the Old Taoist's mouth, that Zhou Ze learned that this "light under the lamp" place was actually the residential complex where Doctor Lin lived.

One by one, the dots formed a circle.

Even if those dots were gone, the circle was still ultimately formed.

His changing perception of Doctor Lin before and after.

Doctor Lin keeping her house from before her death, buying it, and meticulously maintaining it.

Xu Le's identity.

Sleeping in separate beds.

The true murder disguised as an accidental car crash.

Killing people one by one to eliminate evidence.

In fact, many, many details had long pointed the way.

Including that day when he pretended to be a doctor at the hospital, performed surgery, and then confessed to Doctor Lin,

Doctor Lin actively embraced him.

At the time, he just thought it was all beautiful, perhaps not noticing the slight curve that might have appeared at the corner of the mouth on the face in his arms.

A hand,

It stirred the water, making the fish in it churn, until finally, the fishing net dropped, and the catch was brought in.

People cast nets to catch fish, and they catch fish to eat them;

House renovations are for aesthetics, and aesthetics are for livability.

Everything, in the end, has a purpose. Even sitting there doing nothing but staring blankly, that is to enjoy the leisurely state of emptying one's mind.

His previous death, his subsequent resurrection.

His new identity, his new family relationships.

In the end,

Who benefited the most?

The woman who had always secretly loved him had a husband she didn't like. She adhered to the constraints of decorum, the rules of family.

She didn't violate them, nor did she break them, but within those rules, she successfully replaced her original disliked husband with another person.

Someone completely unknown to outsiders, completely unaware, completely impossible to discover.

She lay comfortably by the bed, continuing to be the gentlewoman she was, living the life her parents expected her to live, but still doing things for her own ideas and pursuits.

Many thoughts, chaotic and noisy,

Kept swirling in Zhou Ze's mind, making him feel disoriented. At this moment, his mind was so chaotic that he couldn't even grasp himself.

If all of this was truly as he suspected, if she was truly the one manipulating the entire course of events, then how should he face her?

Should it be anger, resentment, that she killed him and destroyed his original life?

Should it be emotional, helpless, after all, the more she did, the more it proved her feelings for him?

Before, Zhou Ze could easily take his dry tobacco pipe and furiously beat Xu Dachuan without any psychological burden. But now, Zhou Ze didn't have the heart to pick up a tree branch from the ground and rush into the Lin family's house.

Humans are such complex creatures; they are not robots that simply follow the directives of a program, making their choices naturally based on a series of trigger codes.

Fifteen minutes of hesitation, fifteen minutes of wavering,

Finally,

Zhou Ze still took steps and entered the residential complex.

Some things needed to be made clear, some words had to be said.

This was him,

Giving himself an explanation,

Giving his past life an explanation.

"Ignorance is bliss"

Did not apply here.

"Knock, knock, knock..."

He knocked on the door.

Actually, Zhou Ze had the house keys, but they weren't on him. He hadn't been back to the Lin family's house in a long time.

"Coming!"

His sister-in-law's voice came from inside. She opened the door, saw Zhou Ze, and asked,

"Xu Le, your elder uncle left?"

"Yeah, he left."

I beat him away.

"Oh." His sister-in-law hadn't fully opened the door yet.

Seeing Zhou Ze not leaving, she was a little surprised and said,

"Do you want to come in?"

Zhou Ze didn't move.

His sister-in-law stuck out her tongue. Zhou Ze hadn't been home in a long time, and his sudden return caught her off guard. But Zhou Ze was her brother-in-law after all, so she opened the door.

Zhou Ze walked in and sat on the sofa in the living room.

His sister-in-law brought Zhou Ze a bottle of orange juice and an ashtray. Her relationship with Zhou Ze had been good lately, as Zhou Ze often helped her cover for her when she went out to play, so her attitude towards Zhou Ze at home had changed significantly compared to the beginning.

"Where's your sister?"

"She just went out to buy groceries. My parents were discharged from the hospital yesterday; an old friend from out of province has a child getting married, so they went to attend. By the way, your elder uncle sitting at our doorstep just now really scared me.

Especially when he said he wanted to send you to prison. Tsk tsk, Xu Le, why are your relatives so strange?"

His sister-in-law sat on the opposite sofa, turned on the TV, and propped her bare feet on the coffee table, a completely unrefined posture.

Compared to Doctor Lin's graceful and proper demeanor, they really didn't seem like sisters.

Truly,

They don't.

"Hey, Xu Le, you haven't answered me yet. Do you have some leverage over your elder uncle? Did he come to ask you for money?"

Xu Le was the live-in son-in-law of the Lin family. The Lin family naturally didn't have a good impression of Xu Le's relatives who liked to freeload, as Xu Le's money in the past actually came from the Lin family.

"It's nothing."

Zhou Ze lit another cigarette, waiting for Doctor Lin to return.

"Are you sure it's nothing?" His sister-in-law looked at Zhou Ze.

"You're so annoying."

Upon hearing this, his sister-in-law's cheeks puffed out, and she let out a displeased哼.

She felt that Xu Le was becoming more and more presumptuous, but considering she would still need him to cover for her when she went out to play, she decided not to argue with him.

A cigarette lay on the ashtray, and Zhou Ze watched it slowly burn down.

The smoke curled upwards, gathering and dispersing.

Just then,

The sound of the door opening came from the entrance, and Zhou Ze instinctively stood up.

Doctor Lin returned with some groceries. Her hair was in a braid, and since she was on holiday today, she looked very refreshed.

Zhou Ze being home surprised her a little.

"Sis, you're cooking today, huh?" His sister-in-law, holding a cushion, watched TV and playfully pointed at Zhou Ze.

"Have you eaten?" Doctor Lin asked Zhou Ze.

Zhou Ze shook his head, "No."

"Then wait a moment, I'll go cook." Doctor Lin seemed to be deliberately maintaining a calm relationship, then she walked into the kitchen.

Zhou Ze stood still, somewhat unsure of what to do next.

His heart was in turmoil right now.

"Hey, why are you just standing there? Go help!"

His sister-in-law lightly kicked Zhou Ze's leg with her foot.

Such a good opportunity to strengthen their relationship, and he was just standing there dumbfounded, truly lacking in emotional intelligence.

His sister-in-law felt that her brother-in-law was much worse than the boys who pursued her at school, simply a blockhead.

Zhou Ze finally walked into the kitchen.

In the kitchen, Doctor Lin had already put on an apron and was chopping vegetables.

"It's fine, I can do it myself. You go keep Xiao Yi company and watch TV," Doctor Lin told Zhou Ze.

"There's something I want to ask you," Zhou Ze said, looking at Doctor Lin.

"Hmm?" Doctor Lin looked up in surprise. "How about you ask after I've finished cooking this meal? I don't want to be distracted. I actually rarely cook, so I'm afraid it won't be to your taste."

Watching her meticulously chop vegetables, methodically and precisely, Zhou Ze suddenly found some words very difficult to say.

"I'll go back to the room first. You come up later."

"Okay, once I've finished the dishes, I'll come up and call you down for dinner."

Zhou Ze walked out of the kitchen and, under his sister-in-law's surprised gaze, went upstairs.

Pushing open the bedroom door, Zhou Ze saw the large bed. He had slept on that bed before, while Doctor Lin slept on the floor beside it.

He didn't have much attachment to this place.

He looked up and saw the wedding photo hanging on the wall above the headboard.

In the wedding photo,

The two people in wedding attire were a bit far apart. The woman was dignified and serene, the man shy and reserved. It was the wedding photo of Doctor Lin and Xu Le.

A wedding photo, in fact, could reveal many problems.

And now,

The one with the face of the man in the wedding photo,

Was himself.

Zhou Ze kept staring at the wedding photo.

If this entire matter, including the murder process, was orchestrated by Doctor Lin behind the scenes, watching from above, completely aware of everything.

Then,

The former Xu Le,

The former Xu Le, who slept alone on this large bed every night,

What kind of role, exactly, did he play?

Like a piece of dough, and this piece of dough finally mustered the rare madness and courage of a lifetime,

But in the end,

All of his actions were actually seen by his wife, who treated him like a puppet on strings,

Watching him walk forward step by step.

Even, in the end, she personally cleaned up the traces,

Those who should have died, all died,

Xu Le also died,

And,

Even his body was cleaned out and vacated,

Just to welcome the arrival of a soul she favored.

His vision, at this moment, seemed to blur.

Zhou Ze seemed to see,

In the wedding photo above the bed,

In Xu Le's eyes,

Two lines of bloody tears,

Slowly trickling down...

title: 第九十七章 呵呵
content:
"Hey, Xu Le, dinner's ready!"

The sister-in-law shouted from the top of the stairs.

This shout startled Zhou Ze out of his recent daze.

The bedroom was still that bedroom.

The bed was still that bed.

The wedding photo on the wall was as usual, without the slightest change.

Reaching out, Zhou Ze rubbed his eyes, turned around, pushed open the bedroom door, and walked downstairs.

On the dining table in the living room, there were three dishes and one soup.

Stir-fried celery with beef, Kung Pao chicken, stir-fried cabbage with glass noodles, and a bowl of vegetable and tofu soup.

Dr. Lin was standing by the table dishing out rice, while the sister-in-law was already seated, impatient.

"Some people, really, are heartless. Their wife is cooking in the kitchen, and they're leisurely upstairs."

The sister-in-law swayed her body while eating.

Zhou Ze also sat down, and Dr. Lin handed him a pair of chopsticks.

"From now on, come home for dinner."

Dr. Lin suddenly said.

Like a gentle wife advising her husband, everything seemed normal and as it should be, like spring rain nourishing the earth.

"Huh?" The sister-in-law's eyes widened.

Xu Le was coming back?

And her sister personally asked him to?

Zhou Ze didn't answer.

The sister-in-law couldn't hold back and kicked Zhou Ze under the table.

You fool, why aren't you responding?

My sister just told you to come home for dinner!

She's willing to cook for you,

Aren't you going to be more proactive?

"We'll see," Zhou Ze replied perfunctorily.

"Would it be alright to live in that apartment complex?"

Dr. Lin spoke again.

That apartment complex, of course, referred to the one Zhou Ze lived in during his previous life.

Evidently, Dr. Lin also knew that Zhou Ze living with her parents was unpleasant, so she was willing to go to that home with Zhou Ze,

A place,

With only her and him.

The chopsticks in Zhou Ze's hand trembled slightly. He could sense that this woman hadn't fully overcome the psychological barrier she mentioned before, but she was trying hard to look forward.

If life was already muddled, then let it continue to be muddled, and even better.

Many people have always yearned for a refined life, but a truly refined life doesn't exist, just as some glittering actresses might have worked at a bar when they were young.

Upon closer inspection, any perfect thing will always have its flaws at some point.

Seizing the present is the true meaning of life.

At this moment, Zhou Ze hesitated.

He didn't ask some questions, because Dr. Lin sent her sister-in-law to call him down, instead of coming up herself. But undeniably, Zhou Ze himself was also somewhat afraid to ask that question.

Once the pretense was completely broken,

What he had seen as a gift from heaven,

Stripped of all its disguises,

Might become something he couldn't bear to look at.

Zhou Ze admitted that he, like most men, liked beautiful women, but this time, he was a little scared.

In his mind, he couldn't imagine the scene of living with Dr. Lin and eating at the dining table together in his own home.

This feeling,

Was like being a pet cat, favored by its owner. All of your actions, including resistance, would seem more like coquetry.

"No need."

Zhou Ze replied.

Then he picked up a mouthful of food and put it in his mouth, his expression serious, swallowing it with great difficulty.

"Is it not good?" Dr. Lin asked.

She saw Zhou Ze eating with difficulty.

"Hey, Xu Le, you're putting on airs now, you old man!"

The sister-in-law couldn't stand it.

In her opinion, Xu Le was bullying her sister.

Zhou Ze put down his chopsticks, deciding not to force himself to eat, and turned to Dr. Lin, saying:

"Come with me, I have some things to discuss."

Dr. Lin nodded and put down her chopsticks.

"Hey, what can't you two say in front of me!"

The sister-in-law said indignantly, feeling like she was a big lightbulb, yet unaware that she had become one.

Zhou Ze went upstairs, and Dr. Lin followed him.

The two stood at the bedroom door on the second floor. Zhou Ze didn't push the door open; he didn't want to see that wedding photo again, always feeling as if the Xu Le in the photo was looking at him.

And Xu Le,

Actually, was no different from himself.

Everyone was a tool,

One was a high-level tool, the other a low-level tool,

No need for the pot to call the kettle black.

"You speak," Dr. Lin looked at Zhou Ze, bowing her head slightly.

Zhou Ze hesitated for a long time, the words on his lips, but he didn't know how to speak them,

Was it an accusation?

Was it seeking confirmation?

Was it a reprimand?

Was it a curse?

Or perhaps, a mutual outpouring?

In the end, the deed had already been done.

All those who should have died, had died,

The emptied body had been entered by him.

The matter, in fact, had entered its final stage.

"Let's just end this."

Zhou Ze said.

As he spoke these words, Zhou Ze kept staring at the woman in front of him.

As if this gentle and upright woman would, in the next moment, tear off all her disguises, pin him against the wall, and mock his overestimation of himself.

You are merely my doll,

My favorite toy,

To get you,

I spent so much effort,

As a toy,

Do you have the right to say it's over?

Human overthinking,

Is the most terrifying kind of instinct.

It contained too many psychological hints, just like the last time Zhou Ze was at Wang Ke's house.

What kind of meat did Wang Ke eat?

Who knew?

Even if he clearly analyzed the matter of psychological suggestion for you, was it frankness or a cover-up?

It was hard to say.

Just like the scene in front of Zhou Ze,

After listening to Zhou Ze's words,

Dr. Lin just smiled and nodded. Zhou Ze saw her eyes redden, as if with a kind of heartbreak. She had spent a lot of time adjusting her emotions and trying to comfort herself.

At the dinner table just now, she decided to cast aside her past burdens and try to get along with Zhou Ze, but Zhou Ze refused. Immediately after, she heard Zhou Ze's actual words of breakup.

She lost her legal husband, even though her husband was still alive. She lost the person she liked, because the person she liked said he no longer wanted to continue this bond.

She was like a small boat, constantly floating and sinking in the waves.

Listening to her parents, listening to her family, listening to Zhou Ze, listening to her mentor, she lived strongly, and lived very strongly.

Fate played a trick on her,

Some things, once pursued, once overcome, but ultimately, they would still be missed.

"The divorce agreement, I'll bring it tomorrow. Do you agree?" Zhou Ze looked at Dr. Lin.

Like a tourist looking at a tiger in a zoo through a fence.

A very complex emotion,

As long as she didn't truly reveal her true colors,

This complexity would continue to linger in Zhou Ze's heart.

After all,

This was a society that valued appearances,

And she was so beautiful.

Right,

When hitting Xu Dachuan, since his face was full of wrinkles anyway, there was no psychological pressure whatsoever.

But if you asked Zhou Ze to take something now and hit Dr. Lin,

He really couldn't bring himself to do it.

"Okay, let's get divorced." Dr. Lin looked up at Zhou Ze. "You can also start your new life."

You agreed?

You really agreed?

You really, really agreed?

Zhou Ze looked at Dr. Lin,

Fearing that in the next instant, Dr. Lin would simply flip out and attack him, telling him that a toy should know its place!

But Dr. Lin's every expression seemed so natural, so natural that Zhou Ze even found it somewhat unreal.

Was she the director,

And at the same time,

Also the actor?

"Xu Le is dead." Zhou Ze said, "Is it related to you?"

What needed to be asked, ultimately had to be asked.

Dr. Lin nodded.

In her view, fate seemed to be a game that teased people; it was her obsession that caused this tragedy.

"Actually, all of this might be my fault. It was my fanciful thinking that caused fate to play such a trick.

You're right,

Now is the time for the joke to end."

"Sister, are you crying?"

The sister-in-law walked up the stairs at this moment and saw her sister crying.

"It's nothing, just dust in my eyes."

Dr. Lin didn't want her sister to see her like this and directly pushed open the bedroom door and entered the bedroom. The sister-in-law glared at Zhou Ze and also followed her sister into the bedroom.

Zhou Ze let out a long sigh,

At this moment,

He felt somewhat relieved,

Like a heavy burden had been lifted.

She admitted it,

And she agreed to end it,

If it's over, it's over.

He couldn't go back to his previous life anyway, and everyone who should have died was dead, except this woman.

But if he searched his conscience,

If he were truly given the chance to kill her, could he really bring himself to do it?

And was the purpose of killing her merely to vent anger?

He walked into the bathroom,

Zhou Ze cupped a handful of water and splashed it on his face,

The coolness washed over him, making his mind clearer.

It's over,

It's over,

It's finally over,

He would go back to the bookstore later and no longer concern himself with any disturbances brought by this "Xu Le" identity, preparing to live his own life.

To be a ghost runner,

To become a regular,

In his previous life, he could climb the ranks as a doctor step by step,

In this life,

He had merely changed environments,

But it was the same workplace.

He looked up,

Zhou Ze saw someone standing behind him in the mirror,

It was the sister-in-law.

"You made my sister cry, she's very upset."

"The situation here is very complicated, not something a child like you can understand."

Zhou Ze picked up a towel and wiped his face.

But at this moment,

Zhou Ze froze,

Stopping all his current movements,

He saw the sister-in-law in the mirror,

Her head was tilted to the left at an extremely exaggerated angle, an angle a normal person simply couldn't achieve.

Her face was pressed tightly against her left shoulder, her entire face tilted a perfect ninety degrees, but her body remained perfectly straight.

"I know my sister likes you,

I know my sister doesn't like Xu Le,

I know my sister doesn't want to make Mom and Dad sad and doesn't want to ruin this marriage,

To make my sister happy,

I made Xu Le die,

Made you die and come back,

Made you become Xu Le.

I did all of this, and my sister should have been happy,

But you,

You made her sad again,

Hehe..."

title: 第九十八章 你之前，就是個死人
content:
The night was hazy. In the bedroom, Doctor Lin, who had just been crying alone, was now lying sideways on the bed, her delicate eyebrows slightly furrowed, already asleep. However, between her brows, a black halo seemed to envelop her.

She didn't want to sleep, but she had to.

Her sister didn't want the upcoming events to disturb her.

In the bathroom, just a wall away, Zhou Ze continued to hold the towel;

His sister-in-law tilted her head, standing ramrod straight, still staring at him.

The scene,

at this moment, seemed to freeze, heavy as if the ink on an ink painting was so dense it was about to drip.

Zhou Ze had never thought it would be her, truly never.

In Zhou Ze's view, she was just an innocent child, a little arrogant, but also a little naive and playful. Plus, she had previously been in this very bathroom, opening the door and seeing him during a backlash he suffered from saving someone in the hospital, which scared her so much she wet herself.

If this was also a form of acting,

it was too dedicated.

Moreover, the reason she gave, while seemingly valid, was actually quite far-fetched. Of course, some people's thought processes might just be this peculiar and unique.

She had her own individual worldview, only cared about her own feelings, and only understood right and wrong as she perceived them.

This world,

whether it contained seven billion people or just one, made no difference to her.

The sister-in-law began to move forward.

Zhou Ze was a gift she had given to her sister, a gift to amuse her sister. But now, this gift had made her sister even sadder.

As a gift, he was unqualified.

Unqualified things,

had to be discarded,

had to be destroyed,

and thus, he had no reason to continue existing.

Zhou Ze put down the towel. Black claws slowly grew from between his fingers.

"Buzz!"

A vibrating sound came,

Zhou Ze felt a sharp pain in his eardrums and his vision blurred. Then, that tilted face appeared directly in front of him.

She tilted her head, looking at him, with the innocent playfulness of a young girl, retaining the cute purity of immaturity.

"Slap!"

His shirt ripped open, and Zhou Ze flew backward, smashing the mirror behind him. A bloody wound appeared on his chest, blood gushing out.

"Why couldn't you just live well?"

The sister-in-law murmured,

Then,

another sharp crack echoed from Zhou Ze's body. If Zhou Ze hadn't instinctively turned aside, his neck might have been severed. But even so, a clear bloody gash appeared on his neck.

"Why couldn't you just be together well?"

The sister-in-law smiled,

She seemed to be asking Zhou Ze,

and also asking herself,

but the essence was the same:

she had no intention of receiving any answer.

"You're a Ghost Messenger?" Zhou Ze was somewhat confused. "If you're a Ghost Messenger, how can you kill so many people indiscriminately?"

The sister-in-law ignored him, her smile only growing wider.

Zhou Ze's pupils constricted, and he rolled forward. The sink and all the glass in the bathroom behind him collectively shattered at that moment.

"Bang!"

Glass fragments shot out everywhere, making the narrow bathroom suddenly beautiful.

Blood streaked,

glass glittered,

this was a perfect spot for wedding photos,

as long as the bride wasn't afraid of being disfigured.

"You people, why are you so troublesome?"

The sister-in-law raised her hand,

And at this moment,

Zhou Ze's hand also reached out,

His sharp black claws directly aimed for the sister-in-law's palm.

However, the once sharp claws instantly became "as pliant as silk." The sister-in-law's palm skin was delicate and flawless, but Zhou Ze's claws simply couldn't pierce it.

"Can't you just make things easy for me?"

The sister-in-law grabbed with her fingers. To an outsider, it looked like she was tightly intertwining her fingers with Zhou Ze's.

Then,

Zhou Ze felt a piercing pain,

As if his ten fingers were connected to his heart,

And now, Zhou Ze's fingernails were slowly peeling off, as if someone was using pliers to pull out his nails. That kind of pain, stemming from the depths of his soul, was even more despairing, completely transcending the boundaries of physical torture.

Until now, his claws, which had been invincible, completely lost their former might in front of the sister-in-law.

The sister-in-law's smile grew even wider,

"You're using what I gave you to deal with me?"

The next moment,

the sister-in-law's fingertips also grew long black claws, which directly pierced into Zhou Ze's palm.

First, the pain of his fingernails peeling from his body, followed by the torture of being pierced by claws.

This punishment, which he had previously inflicted on others, now fell upon Zhou Ze himself for the first time.

"I'm not wrong; you are."

The sister-in-law continued to murmur, then pushed Zhou Ze forward.

"Why don't you live a good life?"

"Buzz!"

Zhou Ze was thrown backward, crashing into the wall. Blood flowed from his right hand, flesh mangled, with five shocking nail holes.

"I put so much effort into this, why can't you just... live well?"

The sister-in-law kept asking herself,

like a curious child,

but her current appearance was truly not cute at all.

"Crack..."

The sister-in-law raised her arm,

She was still half a meter from Zhou Ze,

But Zhou Ze felt as if a hand had already clutched his neck, lifting him up. The piercing and burning pain in his neck was so clear, and he could no longer breathe.

His feet were off the ground, he was like a prisoner on a pyre, awaiting judgment from the destiny before him.

Tilted head,

smiling,

"Who gave you the courage to question me, even after knowing the shadow behind these events?

You are just a puppet controlled in the palm of my hand.

Who gave you the illusion that you could resist?"

"Uh... uh..."

Zhou Ze wanted to make a sound, wanted to speak, but because his neck was clamped so tightly, Zhou Ze couldn't form any clear syllables.

As a death-row prisoner,

even the right to a final word had been stripped from him.

The sister-in-law was asking questions, but she didn't give him the right to answer.

"Lin Yi, I tried my best, but this game really isn't that fun."

The sister-in-law murmured to herself,

Then,

she turned her head in another direction,

still,

tilted.

"Your sister is still unhappy, your sister is so annoying."

Immediately after,

she tilted her head in yet another direction,

"After we kill him, we'll kill your sister too, and then we'll have no more worries.

Right?"

Zhou Ze felt the force on his neck suddenly intensify.

That terrifying suffocating sensation overwhelmed him,

His lungs burned, almost exploding.

His eyes began to roll back, and his body's convulsions were uncontrollable. This was a sign of impending death, a prelude to his body's complete demise.

In front, the sister-in-law kept tilting her head ninety degrees in different directions, muttering to herself, as if conversing with someone else.

Just like two little girls with Peppa Pig backpacks standing in front of a claw machine,

discussing which doll to grab,

which doll was easy to get,

which doll looked cuter,

"Cough... cough..."

A coughing sound came,

The sister-in-law looked up at Zhou Ze, somewhat surprised,

She was a little surprised,

Not dead yet?

Then,

the smile on her face slowly became serious,

"What's wrong with you?"

Yes,

what's wrong with you?

Zhou Ze's eyes began to glow green, and a bronze luster slowly spread across his body. The fingernails on his right hand, which had been broken off earlier, actually grew back.

This time, they weren't as black as before, but showed a mottled color of ancient vicissitude.

Zhou Ze's lips parted,

Two fangs slowly emerged,

With a green face and fangs,

he was ominous and terrifying, exuding a repulsive aura.

The force that had been binding Zhou Ze's neck suddenly dissipated. Zhou Ze slowly landed, crouched down, one hand on the broken tiles, and then slowly raised his head.

Those eerie green eyes stared intently at the sister-in-law who was tilting her head.

"What does this mean?"

"What's going on now?"

She was confused,

Because the toy she had created, or rather, the gift she had personally chosen and wrapped for her sister, had undergone an unexpected change.

A change she had not foreseen.

"Ah..."

A hoarse sound emanated from Zhou Ze's throat. He slowly spread his arms and slowly stood up,

Very slowly,

but very steadily.

Just like last time,

Half of Zhou Ze's skin appeared bronze, while the other half began to crack and bleed slowly.

The head-tilted sister-in-law watched Zhou Ze walk towards her step by step.

She was somewhat confused,

and helpless,

"Are you Zhou Ze?"

This time, the sister-in-law needed Zhou Ze to answer.

But now, Zhou Ze couldn't be bothered to give her any answer.

The sister-in-law reached out her hand, but this time Zhou Ze was not thrown back. He still walked steadily, step by step,

Just like that,

he walked up to her.

The sister-in-law's claws pierced into Zhou Ze's body.

"Pfft!"

The claws pierced in,

However,

as soon as the claws penetrated the skin, the muscles at the wound instantly contracted, firmly holding the sister-in-law's claws inside.

She tried to pull them out,

but couldn't move them at all,

as if countless small mouths inside were sucking on her claws,

very tight,

very suppressed.

The sister-in-law looked at Zhou Ze, at those green eyes. A look of realization appeared on her face as she murmured,

"You... you were already a dead person before..."

And Zhou Ze reached out,

and grabbed the sister-in-law's head.

The sister-in-law wanted to resist, but couldn't.

"Creak, creak..."

Like the sound of bones slowly shifting,

Zhou Ze's hand held the sister-in-law's head,

He didn't crush it,

he didn't pierce it,

but slowly turned her tilted face,

back to straight.

Phew,

her face was straight,

and it looked,

much more comfortable.

title: 第九十九章 吃掉！
content:
Two faces,

staring at each other.

The sister-in-law desperately wanted to resist, but with her face held in Zhou Ze's palm, she had no room to fight back.

At this moment,

she understood how Madam Qingyi must have felt on the rooftop.

No matter how many transformations you possess, there's no place to bite.

A zombie is a being born from death; it is despised by gods and ghosts because it exists outside the original rules of the game, an anomaly.

It's like when everyone else has cut their queues, but you haven't,

or when everyone else has kept their queues, but you've cut yours.

Being different from others naturally leads to being disliked and rejected.

Zhou Ze slowly opened his mouth,

revealing two fangs, bringing a chilling pressure.

The sister-in-law furrowed her brows, her body trembling, filled with dread.

A game that was originally hers had taken an uncontrollable turn, even dragging her into it. Now, pulling the plug to shut down the game was impossible.

She didn't know what kind of monster she had unleashed, and she was even certain that Zhou Ze himself probably didn't realize he was a monster.

This was a beautiful misunderstanding, and a sudden, unexpected landmine.

Unfortunately,

she had stepped on it,

and even danced a Latin dance on top of it.

The fangs slowly pressed down, already touching the skin of the sister-in-law's neck.

That smooth skin,

that tender epidermis,

with a maiden's vivacity,

pregnant with the essence of youth.

How many young men yearned to taste its sweetness there,

how many young men longed to leave their teeth marks there.

"I am her, and she is me."

The sister-in-law spoke,

"If you bite me to death, she dies too."

This was a threat,

a desperate threat.

If the situation hadn't been so dire and urgent, the sister-in-law wouldn't have resorted to such a threat.

Because this meant she was bowing to a toy, begging a toy for mercy.

She had her pride,

but at a moment when her life was threatened, pride suddenly became worthless.

Zhou Ze paused, his green eyes scanning the sister-in-law's face with an eerie glow, as if hesitating, contemplating, or perhaps circling.

Then,

he lifted his head, pulling his fangs a little further from her skin. The intense, suffocating pressure from before instantly faded.

The sister-in-law let out a long sigh of relief, a feeling of having escaped death washing over her, making her dizzy.

Then,

Zhou Ze suddenly lowered his head again!

"Pfft!"

Without any foreplay,

and without giving you much psychological preparation,

just like that, dryly, sharply, thickly,

firmly,

straight in!

The previous upward movement seemed more like a playful tease, a jest, a deliberate concealment, a... flirtation.

As if to say:

I'm just rubbing outside, not going in, don't worry.

Then,

a fierce, direct thrust!

Without any tenderness,

and not understanding what tenderness even meant.

As the fangs pierced,

blood and bodily fluids began to spurt.

At such a moment, the human body appeared incredibly fragile.

The sister-in-law's head was still pressed down by Zhou Ze's hand. Her face showed an expression of extreme pain, and in the depths of her eyes, panic and struggle appeared.

Her previous composure was long gone.

Earlier, in the bathroom,

she had questioned and answered herself,

while pushing Zhou Ze to a dead end.

Now,

what goes around, comes around.

Zombies actually don't eat people or drink human blood.

Early ancient Chinese novels and supernatural records rarely mentioned zombies eating people or blood. Modern understanding of zombies largely comes from Hong Kong zombie films of the era, which were influenced by Western zombie movies and incorporated these settings.

Zhou Ze did not suck the other's blood; he simply enjoyed the feeling of injecting his will into the other's body through his fangs.

This was a declaration of sovereignty, the most direct form of revenge.

To assert his aura, to dominate her,

to torment her,

to bite her,

to return everything she had just inflicted upon him!

"Ah ah ah ah ah ah ah!!!!!!!!!!"

A wisp of black mist suddenly rose from the sister-in-law's body. These black mists slowly solidified into the form of a woman in black.

As soon as the woman appeared, the surrounding temperature began to drop, and even white frost appeared.

One might say this was the special effect and grand entrance for a major boss,

but in reality, it was a sign that the woman's soul power was uncontrollably dissipating. She was like a block of ice removed from the freezer; though still exuding coldness, she couldn't last much longer.

"Roar!"

Zhou Ze retracted his fangs. The wound on the sister-in-law's neck instantly scabbed over, not a single drop of blood flowing out.

His hand released,

and the sister-in-law's body fell directly to the ground,

landing with a "thud."

There was no pity, no concern,

even if the girl were to fall and become mentally disabled,

it would have nothing to do with Zhou Ze.

The woman's soul was slowly wilting. She seemed to desperately want to re-enter the body, but with Zhou Ze standing below, she dared not descend.

At the same time, beside the woman, a booklet was flying. It was identical to the one Zhou Ze possessed, and this booklet signified the woman's identity.

She was also a Soul Ferryman.

However, the woman's booklet was almost white and severely damaged; as it flew, bits of it continuously flaked off, clearly unable to bear the burden any longer.

"I'm also a Soul Ferryman, you can't kill me."

The woman said tremblingly. She wasn't afraid of Zhou Ze to this extent, but she felt incredibly cold.

Separated from her physical body,

she was like an ordinary person standing naked on an Antarctic glacier.

That feeling truly couldn't be resisted by sheer mental willpower.

Zhou Ze raised his head,

looking at her,

his mouth slightly open,

as if smiling.

Then,

Zhou Ze slowly,

tilted his head.

His joints continuously made crisp cracking sounds,

but his head still tilted down.

Mockery,

the most direct mockery.

A faint blue flame slowly began to emerge on the woman's body. Her soul was being frozen, gradually losing vitality. She was very cold, desperately needing a warm haven.

She couldn't wait any longer, had no way to wait any longer.

Biu!

Her form moved downwards, attempting to re-enter the sister-in-law's body.

"Roar!"

Zhou Ze swung his arm. His nails, which were less transparent than before but appeared more ancient, directly struck the woman. The woman let out a sharp shriek and was forcefully seized by Zhou Ze, held captive before him.

The woman's waist truly could be grasped with one hand, not because of her exceptionally good or exaggerated figure, but meaning that the woman's soul body was continuously being tormented and twisted under the restraint of Zhou Ze's palm.

"Let me go, I'm a Soul Ferryman!"

The woman roared.

Zhou Ze opened his mouth wide,

then began to bring his hand towards his mouth.

The woman's struggles and roars intensified. She already sensed what was about to happen. At the same time, she realized one thing: the man before her had lost all sanity. Now, he was acting purely on instinct.

He was hungry,

his body was in great pain,

his physique was worn out,

just like a person who is sick and needs nourishment to recover from injuries.

He, too, now needed nourishment.

This body simply couldn't withstand his current form.

"I am a Soul Ferryman, and no matter what I've done, only the Underworld can judge me. You cannot, you cannot!

Have you thought about bearing the cost of this?

Wake up,

wake up!"

This was like the monsters in "Journey to the West" who, cornered, would declare their lineage to their Bodhisattva or Immortal Venerable to be taken back home; it was revealing one's backing.

However,

before that,

Zhou Ze was also a Soul Ferryman, albeit a temporary one.

But the woman was still preparing to kill him.

Kill him, then kill Doctor Lin,

and the other will in her body would no longer interfere with her.

Zhou Ze's hand stopped.

He didn't continue to put the other's soul into his mouth.

The woman looked at Zhou Ze, still very tense. After the previous lesson, she no longer harbored any illusions of escaping.

Zhou Ze, holding the woman, began to move.

Each time his foot landed, it left a lingering black mark on the floor. He walked downstairs, into the kitchen.

His green eyes roamed the kitchen,

then,

he found it,

a jar of Laoganma.

He crushed the jar, spilling the chili sauce into his hand.

First, he put the chili sauce into his mouth,

and then,

Zhou Ze raised the hand holding the woman again,

opened his mouth,

and put the woman's soul into his mouth.

The woman's final screams and curses,

were like a soothing melody playing from speakers during a meal, giving the dining experience a strange charm.

After swallowing her,

Zhou Ze spread his arms,

"Burp………………"

A deep burp echoed,

comfortable,

satisfied,

full,

but oh, how he wished for another.

………………

"Why didn't you say so earlier!"

Bai Yingying cursed from the car.
