Tang Shi ignored the almost raging female zombie, continuing to unwrap a White Rabbit candy and put it in her mouth.

"He didn't ask in detail before, wasn't interested.

Besides,

how was I supposed to know that the other Soul Ferryman in Tongcheng was actually in his wife's house?"

"Alright, grandmas, we're here, we're here!"

Old Dao was still the driver.

He returned to the bookstore and spoke of Zhou Ze's whereabouts,

which Tang Shi overheard.

Then this not-so-secret secret was revealed, and subsequently, Zhou Ze's phone couldn't be reached, so everyone rushed over.

Xu Qinglang sat in the passenger seat, his face gloomy.

The car stopped,

everyone got out and walked inside.

Bai Yingying walked first.

As she reached the stairwell,

Bai Yingying suddenly stopped,

she sensed a familiar aura not far ahead, as if the evil energy within her was being pulled and began to tremble.

"What's wrong?"

Tang Shi asked when Bai Yingying stopped moving.

Bai Yingying bit her lip tightly.

The resonating aura inside became increasingly apparent, and it seemed to have reached a peak, clearer and more stimulating than before.

This connection of bloodline and racial bond, like currents, continuously surged through her body.

She instinctively clamped her legs together,

and said tremblingly,

"Down there, I suddenly feel,

so itchy!"

title: 第一百章 周老闆的輪椅
content:
Ding dong...

Like a stone falling into water, the sound was crisp and melodious, and the original tranquility was disturbed by ripples.

Zhou Ze found himself lying on a pond, beneath him, the water surface, which was like glass, supporting his body.

Everything around him was blurry at first, but slowly began to clear, and after clearing, it became familiar.

In the distance,

The Yellow Springs Road is always bustling, because even without world wars or plagues, people are dying every moment in this world.

Many TV shows often have a line: "I'm afraid you'll be too lonely on the Yellow Springs Road, so I'll (or send someone) go down to accompany you."

Actually, there's no need to worry about that at all.

When you go down, you'll find the Yellow Springs Road very crowded, and there will be many white brothers, black brothers, men, women, old, and young around you.

Plump or slender, handsome or ugly—these external appearances cannot prevent the established rule that you will die.

Princes, marquises, generals, and prime ministers may have their moments of glory, but in the end, they all become a mound of earth.

However, most people don't perceive loneliness after descending to the Yellow Springs; everyone is like a shapeless zombie, slowly moving forward, following the crowd.

If the human world were a factory workshop, then hell would be the subsequent factory for waste collection and raw material transformation. Compared to the dazzling human world, hell emphasizes a kind of rule and order,

An order that makes you despair and feel helpless, yet exists as if forged from iron.

Zhou Ze slowly stood up.

This must be a dream, he thought.

He,

Shouldn't be dead.

He didn't have many memories in his mind, only remembering that he almost died in front of his sister-in-law, and then, like being drunk, he blacked out again.

It was just like the last time on the rooftop, as if he had given up his body, given up everything.

Zhou Ze didn't want to die, especially at this moment. If he could choose, Zhou Ze would rather choose to walk on numbly like those "walking dead," to the next end or beginning.

But now, he wasn't numb, nor was he in a daze. If he died, he would have to endure the torment of all this loneliness in full consciousness.

It would be like undergoing a protracted major surgery,

And the doctor tells you,

"I'm sorry, we're out of anesthetic."

His palm rested on the pond.

The pond was empty; he could see straight through to the bottom, and everything around was crystal clear.

The faceless woman hadn't returned yet, but things over there were nearing a conclusion.

The little loli, the faceless woman, Rongcheng—there had to be a resolution eventually.

Looking around,

Zhou Ze didn't see the man with the cat whom he had seen the last time he dreamt of this place. In fact, Zhou Ze was rather looking forward to seeing him again.

He didn't know why, but that man seemed to possess a special magic; being with him made one feel at ease.

Perhaps, this was charismatic charm?

Walking on the water, a mist began to rise around him, a hazy feeling slowly enveloping everything, gradually covering it all.

Returning to an old place, there was no surprise, no unexpected turn; everything seemed unchanged, but Zhou Ze knew that something had changed: himself.

For example, this time, when he dreamed of this place again, he seemed much more composed.

When the thick fog completely enveloped everything,

Zhou Ze felt a sting in his eyes, and then he smelled the earthy scent of mud.

Damn it,

It's that earthy smell again.

Opening his eyes, Zhou Ze saw himself lying in the bedroom on the second floor of the bookstore. The old Taoist and that monkey were sitting there playing with mud, and then started smearing it on him.

"Hehe, this is the way to knead it! Watch, I'll sculpt him some big pecs!"

The old Taoist bragged to the monkey while kneading a bun of mud, then prepared to stick it on Zhou Ze.

Only the old Taoist could turn a healing session into a vulgar game.

However, just as the old Taoist was about to stick it on, he saw Zhou Ze on the bed open his eyes. He immediately froze in shock, then held the mud bun in his hands, at a loss.

"Is it tasty?"

Zhou Ze asked.

For some reason,

This injury should be much lighter than the last time. Although he didn't know how long he had been unconscious, at least he could speak directly after waking up.

"Is it tasty?"

The old Taoist remained frozen.

"Is it tasty?" Zhou Ze asked again.

The old Taoist pulled a long face, lowered his head, took a bite of the mud bun, and then nodded, tears in his eyes.

"Fragrant, truly fragrant."

Zhou Ze looked away, no longer watching him.

The old Taoist quickly spat out the mud from his mouth, then offered solicitously, "Boss, you're awake! You scared me to death, you were unconscious for three days."

Only three days?

How long was he unconscious last time?

But why did they always smear mud on him every time?

Zhou Ze looked at the dirty stains on the bed and his own grimy body. For someone with a洁癖 (cleanliness obsession), it was truly unbearable:

"Call Bai Yingying."

"Boss, are you hungry?" the old Taoist asked.

"I want to take a bath."

"Let me help you, Boss. In the past, when I went to bathhouses to catch ghosts and save the common people, I used to scrub backs. My skills are top-notch!"

The old Taoist patted his chest.

"......" Zhou Ze.

The monkey on the side covered its mouth, giggling "吱吱吱" (squeaking sound).

Zhou Ze really wanted to say, "Look, even the monkey is laughing at you.

Why do you have no self-awareness at all right now?"

"Call Bai Yingying."

"No need, Boss, come on, I'll carry you to the bathroom. This humble Taoist guarantees to scrub you squeaky clean."

Saying this, the old Taoist eagerly prepared to pick Zhou Ze up from the bed.

If Zhou Ze still had strength now, his nails would probably have grown out,

And he would have opened several new air holes in the old Taoist's body.

Unfortunately, Zhou Ze was just a weak patient right now.

Fortunately, Bai Yingying happened to push open the door at this moment, holding a cup of tea. Seeing Zhou Ze awake, Bai Yingying happily put down the tea and walked to the bedside.

Zhou Ze let out a long sigh of relief.

...

Having had the experience before, Bai Yingying was quite natural this time helping Zhou Ze bathe.

"How are things with the Lin family?"

Zhou Ze asked.

"Boss, when we got there, you were already unconscious on the floor. The Lin sisters were fine, but their house was a mess, especially the bathroom—the glass and tiles were all broken.

We brought you out, and afterward, no one from the Lin family came to ask anything. I know what you want to ask, the younger Lin sister is back to school normally, and Doctor Lin is also back at work."

Zhou Ze nodded, looking in the mirror. His hair seemed a bit long. He said to Bai Yingying, "Help me trim my hair, make it shorter."

"Alrighty."

Bai Yingying went out to get scissors and came back to cut Zhou Ze's hair.

After everything was neatly tidied up, Zhou Ze was placed in a wheelchair. The wheelchair was new, shiny, and electric, with a joystick, like a bumper car at an amusement park.

"Who bought this?" Zhou Ze's face darkened.

"Boss, do you like it? This was specially prepared for you by this humble Taoist. I thought you'd probably need it often in the future,

So I just got you one.

Boss, look here, this button can be pressed!"

The old Taoist pressed the button for Zhou Ze as if presenting a treasure,

And then the whole wheelchair started glowing, multi-colored lights,

"Woo woo woo woo woo"

And a train whistle sound effect.

The old Taoist thought Zhou Ze would be very satisfied,

Little did he know that if Zhou Ze wasn't so weak right now,

He would have died twice today.

Instead of sitting in the wheelchair, Zhou Ze chose a soft sofa seat by the window in the bookstore.

Xu Qinglang wasn't in the shop; it seemed he had some family matters and had gone back, but he left a lot of juices,

Saying that if Zhou Ze woke up, he could drink them.

Life seemed to have returned to its familiar rhythm.

After all that fuss, in the end, nothing had changed.

The truth was laughable, yet it had truly happened.

Perhaps,

To truly understand the matter of the Ghost Messenger's spirit on his sister-in-law, they would have to wait for the little loli to return. As a Ghost Messenger who had originally been in the same city, it was unlikely that the little loli knew nothing about that Ghost Messenger.

Of course, that's assuming the little loli could even come back.

Zhou Ze, the boss, leaned on the sofa, basking in the sun through the glass, while Bai Yingying was busy attending to customers. Although Xu Qinglang wasn't there, Bai Yingying had learned how to prepare ordinary pastries and drinks.

At the table next to Zhou Ze, sat two long-haired women, but their voices were a bit hoarse and somewhat affected. The two women were flipping through fashion magazines while chatting, and they grew more and more animated.

"I'm telling you, I recently discovered something that really worries me."

"Tell me, quickly tell me."

"Last week, I noticed that the stockings and bras I had left on the washing machine in the bathroom, waiting to be washed, had been touched."

"Ah, who touched them? Did someone get into your house? Could it be a thief?"

"But nothing was stolen from the house. At first, I thought it was a thief too, but then I found out it wasn't."

"Then who touched them?"

"It was Xiao Wen. I noticed it that time. Xiao Wen went into the bathroom after I finished showering, and when I went back in, I found that my stockings, bras, and other underwear had been rummaged through, and there were wet marks on them."

"Ah."

The other woman covered her mouth,

"How could Xiao Wen do something like that?"

"I'm really distressed too."

"It's nothing, maybe Xiao Wen is just growing up and developing a bit of curiosity about women's things. Most boys go through that phase."

"I looked it up online, if it was just these issues, then fine."

"Just these issues? No, it's not fine. You need to try to guide him and help him establish correct values."

"I originally planned to talk to him frankly, but then I discovered something else. One weekend, I came home early from work and saw Xiao Wen in my bedroom, wearing my usual stockings, bra, and skirt, standing in front of the mirror, looking at himself."

"This..."

"If it were just the previous things, I think I could still guide him, but now things have become very serious. He's actually wearing my clothes and looking in the mirror. This is clearly not a typical issue of a boy in his youth."

"Oh, my son's call, I'll take it."

The woman answered the phone, then said to her best friend, "Sorry, my son says he's hungry, I need to go back and feed him."

"Mmm, you go back quickly."

"Waiter, check please."

Bai Yingying walked over and settled the bill.

Zhou Ze watched the two long-haired women walk out of the shop, deep in thought.

"Boss, do you want some more hot water?" Bai Yingying asked.

"No need." Zhou Ze shook his head and picked up his teacup.

Bai Yingying stood with one hand on her hip, the other holding the money, and said helplessly:

"Those two guys just now were really sick, weren't they? Clearly men, but dressed up as women. Good thing I have sharp eyes."

"Cough, cough..."

Zhou Ze, who was drinking water, suddenly choked.

title: 第一百零一章 回來了！都回來了！！！
content:
In life, what one fears most is acceptance of fate.

Because accepting one's fate implies no more struggle, and thus your life will follow its existing predetermined path, smoothly continuing without too many ripples or surprises.

You can see what you’ll be like in five years, and you can guess what you’ll be doing in ten years.

However, what life needs most, in fact, is also the acceptance of fate.

To be down-to-earth, stable, free from miscellaneous thoughts, living your own life; plainness leads to lasting peace.

Whether to accept one’s fate or not is purely a matter of personal choice.

Zhou Ze sat on the sofa in the bookstore, staring blankly for an entire afternoon, seemingly thinking a lot, yet also thinking of nothing at all.

In the glass, a blurry reflection of himself appeared; unknowingly, he no longer felt awkward when looking in the mirror.

Human adaptability is indeed strong; even if it's your appearance, even if it's your life's trajectory, once you get used to it, you no longer feel anything particular about it.

This is his bookstore, this is his future life.

He reached out and touched his short, cropped hair, which Bai Yingying had just trimmed for him.

It was crisp and neat.

Zhou Ze saw Tang Shi standing at the door. She had been standing there for three hours, from noon until the afternoon, barely moving.

Zhou Ze didn’t ask her what she was doing standing there; everyone needs time alone to clear their mind, and at such times, they don't need anyone else's comfort.

He took out his phone, logged into his WeChat; there were no messages, no replies.

Clinging to his past life, clinging to Xu Le in this life,

Zhou Ze truly felt tired.

Actually, it would be better to just live this life, as his new self, in a down-to-earth manner.

Whether he saw things clearly or not, it made no difference,

After all, the past is past,

And the future has not yet arrived.

He took out his small booklet, flipping through it, feeling its texture.

Zhou Ze felt that his future life would be entangled with it, at least, for a very long time.

It seemed that the female ghost messenger also had a booklet, but when Zhou Ze asked, Bai Yingying said they hadn't found it. Perhaps the booklet had vanished with the wind; after all, at that time, the booklet already showed signs of collapse, and with the female ghost messenger's demise, its final meaning of existence would also disappear.

Tang Shi finally moved. She slowly squatted down, hands supporting her knees. Perhaps she had been standing too long, so her legs were numb or cramped.

Zhou Ze smiled,

Then Tang Shi turned her head, looked at Zhou Ze, who was gloating through the glass, and a smile also appeared at the corner of her mouth, but this smile seemed somewhat reserved.

It was as if she had transformed into a different person at that moment.

The old her was not this serious.

The little monkey jumped in front of Zhou Ze, waving a toy hammer. Zhou Ze reached out and patted its head.

All along, Zhou Ze never understood what was going on with the mud the little monkey brought, but it seemed to work very well. He thought that if opening a bookstore didn't make enough money in the future, he could still open a medicine shop.

"Ancestral Five Finger Mountain Black Jade Mending Plaster Set"?

That’s not a bad idea.

"Squeak, squeak, squeak, squeak..."

The little monkey held a mobile phone in its hand, waving it at Zhou Ze.

The monkey’s phone was bought by the old Taoist, which clearly showed the old Taoist’s doting on the monkey.

"What are you doing?" Zhou Ze asked.

The monkey pointed to the speaker on the bookstore wall, then pointed to the phone.

"Connecting to the Bluetooth speaker?" Zhou Ze asked.

The monkey looked bewildered,

But it seemed likely, so it nodded.

Taking the monkey's phone, Zhou Ze helped it connect to Bluetooth. The monkey tried it, played a song from "Monkey King: Hero is Back," and the speaker immediately made a sound.

The monkey was very happy.

Immediately after, the bookstore's background music kept changing in the monkey's hands. Fortunately, there weren't many customers in the bookstore at the moment, so Zhou Ze let the monkey play around.

Actually, the background music in many large shopping malls is quite particular.

For example, if Li Yugang's "A Thousand Miles of Rivers and Mountains" is played at first, if a security guard or an internal staff member of the mall sees a familiar habitual thief entering the mall, they will immediately notify the communication room, and the person there will immediately change the background music.

Next, perhaps Michael Jackson's "Beat It" or "You Are So Poisonous" might be played, and then vendors will remind their customers that a thief is around and to be careful.

Shopping malls everywhere basically have this kind of unwritten rule; sometimes even on a bus, if the driver sees a habitual thief they recognize getting on, they will press a button to send a warning.

So, sometimes when you hear "Passengers, please take care of your belongings..." on the bus, don't take it as a perfunctory voice message.

And these thieves,

Basically, they come with their own background music,

When they walk in,

Their unique BGM plays.

Above the bookstore counter was a hanging television playing "Shaolin Soccer."

At this moment, Zhou Ze realized he hadn’t seen the old Taoist all afternoon. However, soon, three "drip" sounds came from inside.

The little monkey understood and adjusted the music. Soon, the Bluetooth speaker played:

"The waves rush… the waves flow… the endless river flows on and on…"

Accompanied by the theme song of "The Bund," the old Taoist, dressed in a brand-new Taoist robe, a stark contrast to his previous disheveled appearance, slowly emerged from the staircase.

A fan was likely placed in the hallway behind him, blowing his long robe, giving him a truly ethereal and immortal aura.

Holding a peach wood sword,

He performed a sword flourish,

The old Taoist strode in the Big Dipper steps, majestic and awe-inspiring!

Zhou Ze rubbed his chin. It was fortunate it was the old Taoist; if it had been another Taoist or monk daring to show off like this in a bookstore run by a ghost, they would have died countless times over.

The little monkey held its phone, the camera pointing at the old Taoist, looking for an angle. Zhou Ze glanced over and saw that the little monkey was live-streaming for the old Taoist.

Alright,

This monkey was indeed smart,

A little too smart.

On the live-stream screen, a bunch of bullet comments scrolled by:

"First floor is mine, hope no one saw me eat poop?"

"Holy cow, Old Taoist, good afternoon, you son of a gun!"

"Old Taoist, it’s been almost half a year, you’re finally back!"

"Taoist Priest, I miss you so much, you’ve been gone for so long, I really miss you!"

"Taoist Priest, you're naughty, hiding for so long, *ying ying ying*, gonna stroke your little pipe, *ying ying ying*."

"Are you still selling冥钞 [ghost money]? It’s out of stock!"

"Did you guys see that, a tuft of yellow fur on the left side of the camera, what is that, could it be a monkey?"

"Hahaha, are you suggesting a monkey is filming him? The upstairs commenter must be an idiot, right?"

"Agreed, upstairs is an idiot."

"First floor is right!"

"First floor is absolutely freaking right!"

"First floor is sooooooo right right right!"

"Damn it, are the guys upstream trolling the first floor, forcing OCD to flare up!"

As the old Taoist resumed streaming, the popularity of the live broadcast room began to soar.

The old Taoist, big or small, was an internet celebrity, somewhat famous in the outdoor live-streaming field, and had a loyal fan base that stuck with him.

After all, those who were willing to spend more than the equivalent in RMB to buy ghost money from the old Taoist,

Those were absolute die-hard fans!

The old Taoist performed a display of sword dancing and martial arts,

Warming up the crowd,

Having not practiced for a long time, he seemed a bit out of breath, but in the next moment, he still scattered a handful of paper money into the air:

"Immeasurable Heavenly Venerable!"

He raised the peach wood sword upwards,

"Wind, rain, thunder, lightning, obey my command!"

The paper money pieces began to automatically swirl around the old Taoist, perfectly aligned, continuously flying into various shapes, cooperating with the old Taoist's commands, complementing each other beautifully.

"Damn, this special effect is awesome, definitely not the cheap 50-cent kind!"

"First floor is right!"

"This time, the first floor is really right."

"This time, the first floor didn't eat poop."

"Is this a live broadcast or a pre-recorded video, hey!"

"Yeah, someone with a big dick confirm, is this a post-processed video?"

"This is live, doesn't look like a video!"

"Old Taoist, I'm going to change my opinion of you. I used to think you were just a joker, but now I realize you're a joker who can do magic tricks!"

"*Ying ying ying*, teasing the upstairs idiot, *ying ying ying*."

"Damn, upstairs is a pervert!"

"One punch will kill an *ying ying* monster!"

Zhou Ze looked at the doorway,

Tang Shi was standing there,

Clearly, the old Taoist's flying ghost money was a result of Tang Shi's manipulation.

Zhou Ze was curious what, given Tang Shi's nature, made her willing to cooperate with the old Taoist in this live-streaming trick.

The ghost money fell neatly, stacking in the old Taoist’s hand. The old Taoist took the phone from the monkey, checked the system notifications, and his wrinkled face immediately crinkled into a smile, like an old, tender chrysanthemum.

"Thank you, Typhoon Hotel Bro, for the super rocket!

Thank you, Old Qiu Bro, for the super rocket!

Thank you, Miss Lan Xue, for the air-drop supply crate!

Thank you, Book Friend 160107110901124, for the... the... the big airplane!

Old Taoist, I’m back on stream today,

Water friends,

Are you still there?!

Dear audience,

I’ve missed you all so much!"

On the TV above the counter, the movie "Shaolin Soccer" was playing, and it had just reached the middle segment where Stephen Chow shouted to his martial arts brothers:

"I feel it,

It's back,

Everyone,

Everyone is back..."

title: 第一百零二章 他從地獄來！！！
content:
April 1, 2018,

00:20 AM,

Rongcheng,

Light rain,

Gentle breeze, 3 knots.

The underworld shop on the old street had been closed for a long time. Even the neighbors didn't actually know when it had opened.

Because it wasn't like a breakfast shop where many people went every day, nor like a clothing store where you could browse after work, even if you didn't buy anything.

Most people would rather never step into an underworld shop to buy things in their entire lives.

Naturally, in their daily lives, they deliberately ignored this underworld shop.

Of course,

When it closed,

Naturally, not many people cared, only occasionally passing by and finding the shop door closed, which was slightly surprising.

A胖子 (Fatty) would drive a police car and park in front of the door every few days. He would look at the closed shop, smoke a few cigarettes, and then leave.

The小姐姐s (young women) at the hair salons on the old street, who conducted the oldest and most enthusiastic business, were truly bothered by this. Every time, they would be so scared that they would usher out the customers they had just invited into their rooms for a drink,

They didn't even dare to ask for the water fee.

The massage parlor next to the underworld shop had also been closed for a long time. It was said that the owner was involved in a murder case before the New Year. Although she was later cleared, she had too many family matters and hadn't returned to Rongcheng for a long time.

Occasionally, old customers would come by, reminiscing about the owner's skills. Little did they know that if they frequently sought her massages, while comfortable, they would probably be getting closer and closer to the day they'd walk into the underworld shop next door to pick out a shroud.

Life remained as it was,

The teahouses and mahjong parlors in the streets and alleys of Rongcheng were filled with ease and leisure.

This was a relaxed city, and also a city that knew how to enjoy itself. With the cold winter just past and summer yet to arrive, the entire city was immersed in its own slumber,

Comfortable,

Content,

Occasionally turning over,

Wrapped in a thin blanket,

Hmm,

Continue sleeping.

The old street in the early morning was naturally deserted, except for a few late-night food stalls still waiting for scarce business.

That underworld shop,

However, it was lit.

The light was very dim, only faintly visible. Ordinary people couldn't even see it.

Inside the underworld shop, two rows of chairs were arranged. In the center, on two chairs, sat a long-bearded man on one side and a small girl on the other, pink and cute, a little loli.

And on either side of the lower seats,

Some wore hempen clothes, with long sleeves fluttering;

Some wore tall hats, swaying;

Some had their eyeballs aligned, occasionally rotating;

Some had large bellies, fat and greasy.

The rouge on their faces was much heavier, even appearing somewhat unreal.

Whether they were laughing, picking their ears, or making noise, they always gave off an eerie sense of oppression, like the one hundred and eight Arhats in a temple—no matter how endearing their expressions,

As an adult, one wouldn't dare to truly laugh at them.

It was as if, in the unseen, a pair of eyes were watching you from above.

If one looked closer, they would find that the style of clothing worn by these people was actually very similar to the paper figures displayed in a corner of the underworld shop, as if the clothes had been truly stripped from the paper figures and put on themselves.

Very comical,

Very ridiculous?

But that was truly the feeling.

On everyone's lips was a strange, vivid crimson, like rouge deliberately applied to the lips, very exaggerated and very garish.

Jia Baoyu said he loved to eat the rouge from his sisters' lips, but if he saw the rouge here, he would probably be scared out of his wits.

In the air,

The scent of ashes permeated,

In the middle of the seated figures, there was a small brazier with charcoal fire. At the same time, stacks of hell money on a rack would automatically fly over, falling into the charcoal fire to burn.

At the door stood a woman, a long-haired woman.

She had her head slightly bowed, her long hair obscuring her face.

Her figure was graceful, her physique alluring...

For ordinary people seeing her, they would probably hope she'd let down her hair to see her true face; everyone has curiosity and a desire for beauty.

However, no one present had such thoughts, because they knew this woman... had no face.

"Not here yet."

The long-bearded man sitting next to the little loli said in a deep voice, frowning slightly.

"Let everyone wait a bit longer."

The little loli said.

The long-bearded man nodded, then said, "Protect your vitality, and try to prolong our stay in the human world."

Black talismans flew out from the long-bearded man's sleeve, scattering around.

Everyone present reached out and took a talisman, sticking it on their forehead. Even the long-bearded man himself applied one.

Immediately,

The entire shop became silent. Those with talismans on their foreheads stopped moving, as if under a spell of paralysis.

This made them look no different from the paper figures already in the underworld shop.

The little loli got up. She also held a talisman in her hand and walked over to the faceless woman.

The faceless woman slowly raised her head,

"My doppelgänger is destroyed."

"Just a doppelgänger," the little loli said indifferently.

"She was meant to monitor him," the faceless woman reminded.

"You say, after I return, will there still be a place for him?"

The little loli smiled slightly,

"He's just temporarily covering for me, helping me manage the keys to hell. A single Tongcheng cannot accommodate a third ghost messenger."

"What about me then?"

The faceless woman asked sharply,

"Without me, you wouldn't be able to lure him over."

"Tongcheng already has two ghost messengers, including myself, and one of them is on the verge of collapse. This is the position I reserved for you." The little loli reached out and grasped the tip of the faceless woman's hair. "Once things here are settled, I will arrange an identity for you to stay in the human world."

The faceless woman lowered her head again.

"I'm curious about one thing, why are you so fixated on that guy? He's just a plaything created by the other one in Tongcheng, oh no, a gift."

"A gift?"

The faceless woman's head, hidden beneath her long hair, chuckled twice,

"In my opinion, this gift is more important than the person you are waiting for."

The little loli's eyes narrowed slightly. She could hear the hidden meaning in the faceless woman's words. This woman, born by the side of the Yellow Springs, in a pool of resentment, had existed for a very long time and naturally knew more untold things.

"Oh, in that case, it seems I'll have to thoroughly interrogate him after I return."

The hair on the faceless woman's face suddenly spread apart. Her faceless visage began to coalesce into a girl's face, her expression one of great pain, as if she were struggling.

"Her, you still haven't managed to control her?" The little loli was somewhat surprised.

"She's struggling very hard," the faceless woman replied. "Her will is firm, no worse than you ghost messengers."

The little loli smiled faintly, reaching out to toss the talisman in her hand into the charcoal fire,

"After all... it's just a meaningless struggle."

The firelight flickered dimly,

The night was dim,

Sparks flew from the brazier:

"Plop"

………………

"Plop!"

"Plop!"

"Plop!"

The old street in the light rain carried a hint of chill, with small puddles visible everywhere on the uneven road.

A man in a hoodie walked slowly along the slightly muddy path,

His head was hidden beneath the hood of his hoodie, and his figure seemed to completely merge with the darkness behind him.

"Meow."

Beside him,

A pure white cat, with elegant steps, followed him closely.

One man, one cat,

Under the dim streetlights, they cast two long shadows.

Occasionally, the sound of wind could be heard,

Empty and eerie, it swirled above the old street, lingering.

The man's build wasn't burly, but he exuded a sharp aura. He was like a silent blade, capable of splitting the dark curtain once drawn.

Ahead was a late-night food stall, run by a husband and wife.

Business wasn't good tonight; the husband sat nearby, coughing incessantly, clearly having a cold.

The man walked to the stall,

The proprietress looked up, saw the man, and smiled, saying:

"Long time no see."

"Mm," the man replied.

"Meow," the white cat also replied.

The proprietress began to make soup, fish paste soup; she knew he only ate that.

Drinking a bowl of fresh, tender fish paste soup late at night was a pleasure, a serene moment, nothing less.

The owner was still coughing. Seeing the customer frown while eating, he thought the customer was disgusted and could only apologize with a smile, turning away.

The man was startled; he knew the owner had misunderstood. His expression while eating was always like that.

It was just a bit cold tonight,

Otherwise, regarding eating, he would save as much as possible, ignoring it if he could.

Putting down his bowl and chopsticks, he paid and turned, walking deeper into the old street. The white cat still followed him, inseparable.

No matter how deep the night,

People can always find their way home.

The man walked to the door of the underworld shop and stopped.

The white cat darted onto the steps, finding its familiar spot.

Yes,

A familiar spot.

Once upon a time,

His favorite thing to do was to pull out a chair and sit on the steps, basking in the sun motionless.

The owner of the massage parlor next door would even tease him, saying he looked like an old man.

He glanced sideways at the next door. She hadn't returned yet.

Some people leave and never come back, but there are also those who, after walking far away, are still watching you.

He thought he had always been alone,

Even if he suddenly disappeared from this world, no one would notice. People who love solitude always like to imbue themselves with a lonely color to gain more security.

It was precisely because someone was watching him,

It was precisely because someone cared about him,

That he came back,

He needed an explanation,

An explanation for those who cared about him,

And an explanation for himself.

He walked up the steps,

Came to the door,

He didn't knock,

This was his home, he had the key.

The moment the key entered the lock,

The faceless woman's long hair behind the door suddenly floated up,

The little loli straightened her back like a miniature adult,

The talismans on the foreheads of all the underworld officials in the two rows of chairs instantly dissipated,

Everyone collectively opened their eyes,

Looking towards the door!

"Creak..."

The door was pushed open from the outside.

The little loli looked at the person outside and smiled:

"Finally caught you."

The man slightly shook his head, indicating the other party was mistaken,

He corrected:

"No,

It's me,

I've returned."

title: 第一百零三章 葬歌，為誰而奏！（第一更！）
content:
"Brothers, let's get hyped!

If you have gifts, shower us with them!

If you have money, support us financially!

If you don't have money, just show up and cheer!

Wave your free glow sticks!

Finally,

Let's do a wave of 66666666!"

The old Daoist roared himself hoarse, his voice almost gone, yet his arms still waved incessantly, vigorously. Sweat dripped from his temples, and his clothes were nearly soaked through.

When he first appeared, he had an air of a Daoist immortal, with every gesture exuding an authentic touch of immortality.

But now, he looked like an elderly rock enthusiast. He had already sung over a dozen songs, all of them belted out with all his might, so loudly that it seemed he might cough up blood at any moment.

"Daoist priest, we're all on the same side, just us folks, please stop singing!"

"Daoist priest, Mom asked me why I'm watching the live stream on my knees. I'm kneeling for you, Daoist priest, please stop singing!"

"Actually, I think it sounds pretty good."

"Upstairs +1!"

"Those who don't appreciate it, get out! The Daoist priest is using bel canto, combining classical music rhythms and some ethnic influences... I'm sorry, I can't make this up anymore."

"The Daoist priest hasn't live-streamed in half a year. He must have run into some trouble and needs to vent."

"Victory's Dawn sent an airplane: Daoist priest, keep it up, keep singing! You're making me hard."

"Evil Shotacon sent an airplane: Daoist priest, keep going, rub your little willy, uwu!"

"Damn, that guy's here again, kill him!"

"Catch him, beat him!"

The old Daoist panted heavily, then looked at the bullet comments and chuckled, "What program do you all want to see next?"

"Flying Hell Bank Notes, do that trick again!"

"Upstairs +1!"

"Sword dance, martial arts!"

"Rap!"

"Anything but singing..."

"..."

"Alright, then I'll sing another song for everyone!"

The old Daoist cleared his throat, seemingly ready to continue singing.

"..." Viewer 1.

"..." Viewer 2.

"..." Viewer 3.

The old Daoist directly selected a song.

It was "Funeral Song" by Xiao Yiqing.

"Sleep, sleep,

Please don't waver anymore!

Sleep, sleep,

Forget all your sorrow..."

"Do you think he's crazy?"

Tang Shi, standing beside Zhou Ze, suddenly asked.

Zhou Ze shook his head and calmly said, "The person you've been waiting for, he's returned today. That's why you're happy."

"Actually, he's just feeling down," Tang Shi said, her expression gradually turning cold. "Do you know? The old Daoist gave that monkey a name."

"Oh? What is it?"

"Xiaoqiang."

Zhou Ze wouldn't be so gauche as to point out that it sounded like a certain cockroach's name.

"Xiaoqiang was the old Daoist's former roommate. They met in Rongcheng."

"Where is he now?" Zhou Ze asked.

"Dead."

Zhou Ze pursed his lips.

"He died helping us escape."

At this point, Tang Shi paused, then continued:

"So, this isn't just a celebration of his return.

Actually,

This is a revenge.

Today,

Is not a joyful day for an old friend's return,

It's a day for revenge.

Blood debt,

Must be paid in blood."

Tang Shi waved a hand, and the red ink on the counter immediately splashed out, coiling around her wrist like a blood-red bracelet, dazzlingly eerie.

"I don't understand." Zhou Ze shrugged. "Since you've already escaped, and someone sacrificed themselves for it, why would he voluntarily go back?"

"Before I answer that, can I ask you a question first?"

"Go ahead."

"Why couldn't that temple god last time, and that problematic senior ghost messenger from Tongcheng recently, kill you?"

Zhou Ze didn't know how to answer.

He couldn't say that he wasn't entirely sure himself, like getting drunk, falling asleep, and waking up to find:

Oh,

The person who wanted to kill me,

Is dead.

Hahahaha,

That idiot actually died just like that,

And I don't remember anything,

Hahahaha!

Tang Shi answered for him:

"Because, you're not the only one,

who can improve."

"Are you that confident? Then I really should have more expectations."

Zhou Ze didn't hope for the little loli to return safe and sound.

He wouldn't be fooled by the little loli's appearance; he knew that if she returned unharmed, and even completed her mission, then it would be her turn to settle accounts with him.

The identification booklet in his hand, the key to the gates of Hell that he controlled, which originally belonged to the little loli, might all have to be surrendered.

The driver's death incident hasn't been resolved yet, but it at least shows that the little loli isn't a kind-hearted person.

What everyone wants is nothing but profit. Living people are busy all day for profit, and even after death, it's still the same.

Before Madam Bai's merits were complete and she was about to descend into Hell, she specifically instructed him to dispose of her corpse, Bai Yingying. She worried that her body remaining in the mortal realm might cause uncontrollable events and affect her in Hell, so she instructed Zhou Ze to burn Bai Yingying with bamboo during the next Cold Clothing Festival.

In many myths, even the immortals in Heaven have their own selfish motives and schemes, so there's no need to expect those ghost messengers to truly care about the country or its people.

Tang Shi flipped her wrist, and the red ink spilled onto the ground, creating a gruesome effect of flowing blood. Under Tang Shi's deliberate control, it became extremely eerie and horrifying, with a dripping blood effect.

"One more thing, why didn't you go back?" Zhou Ze asked.

Revenge, after all, is like a gang fight.

You call your people, I call mine, we pick a spot, and we fight.

The little loli called a lot of ghost messengers, and also brought the Faceless Woman, but on this side, it seemed there was only that one guy.

"I asked him if he needed me to go back. My injuries are almost healed, and he said no."

"Is he comforting you and worried about you getting into danger again, or does he have enough confidence?"

Tang Shi smiled,

Her smile was as beautiful as a flower.

Zhou Ze had never seen Tang Shi like this.

She bent over,

Clutching her stomach,

As if laughing so hard her stomach hurt, glistening tears slowly dripped from the corners of her eyes,

She choked out:

"He said, 'Airfare isn't cheap!'"

...

Inside the underworld shop,

Two rows of ghost messengers stood. When they fully awakened, the area around the shop was immediately covered in frost, forming ice crystals.

It was as if this was an ice chamber.

The immense Yin energy seemed so dense it was almost dripping, suffocating.

If a living person accidentally wandered in here, they would likely fall seriously ill upon returning.

Ghost messengers,

Are still ghosts, after all.

Liang Chuan frowned slightly,

He was a little unhappy,

Because his house was getting dirty. Later, the frost would melt into water, what a shame for the shop's fine redwood furniture.

The most uncomfortable part was,

The people dirtying his house,

Were all uninvited guests, not welcomed by him.

"We've been looking for you for a long time."

The long-bearded man, who had been sitting next to the little loli, now stood up and walked over.

The situation was set.

This long and extensive capture operation, involving ghost messengers from all over, was finally coming to an end.

A stowaway who escaped from Hell to the human world without gaining an identity was inherently an anomaly to be eradicated, not to mention this fellow actually killed people in the mortal realm, acting as a judge without the official title.

Utterly arrogant,

Seeking his own death!

The Faceless Woman stood beside Liang Chuan, looking at him. She remembered several times when she almost caught him, preventing him from leaving Hell, but he always managed to escape.

This time,

She would no longer be the one filled with reluctance and anger.

Liang Chuan's gaze swept over everyone, his expression blank. Behind him, the white cat idly wagged its tail, even occasionally licking its paws to groom its fur.

"I can give you a choice."

The little loli took a step forward, standing before Liang Chuan.

"Docilely let your soul leave your body, and we'll take you directly back to Hell. You secretly escaped from there; now, returning is your rightful path."

The long-bearded man pondered, "If we are forced to act, you must understand that this time you will absolutely not escape. If your soul returns, at most you'll suffer some punishment and enter the animal realm, which is better than complete annihilation."

"Oh."

Liang Chuan responded.

He understood.

These ghost messengers wanted to save effort, to subdue him without a fight. Their activities in the human world were difficult. Unless they chose to inhabit a physical body, which carried significant risks and uncertainties, they remained very low-key in the human world and dared not act too openly.

Then, Liang Chuan looked at the Faceless Woman beside him and said:

"You captured her?"

The Faceless Woman lifted her head, her hair fanning out. On her flat face, a woman's features began to emerge. She was in pain, she was struggling, she was roaring, and simultaneously howling.

She had died,

And her soul had been taken by the Faceless Woman.

Liang Chuan licked his lips,

Slowly lowered his head,

"The second one."

They used his friends' lives to force him to show himself.

They,

Had succeeded.

"Killing living people harms our Yin virtue; we are also unwilling to do so. This is your own fault for being obstinate."

The little loli continued:

"If you had obediently not resisted back then, those two wouldn't have died. And, we also know you have a few other close acquaintances."

"Is this... another threat?"

Liang Chuan asked, still looking down.

"I'm merely stating a fact. We are ghost messengers, guardians of the order between Yin and Yang. You cannot resist us."

"Heh heh..."

Liang Chuan slowly raised his head,

His eyes,

Were blood red!

The little loli's heart suddenly palpitated. She braced herself, anticipating the young man's sudden outburst.

However,

Her body suddenly trembled.

A skeletal hand had, at this moment, pierced her soul body. She froze almost completely in place, then, she turned her head in disbelief, looking behind her.

The long-bearded man,

His eyes blood-red,

His face showing struggle,

He was clearly being controlled!

But,

How could this be!

In a single instant,

Directly controlling one of the most senior ghost messengers present!

Why was this happening?

Why was this happening?

Liang Chuan raised his head,

Opened his mouth,

Tilting his neck slightly,

His ten fingers began to tap in the air before him, as if playing a piano:

"Hush,

This melody,

Do you hear it?

This is,

The 'Funeral Song' I play for you."

title: 第一百零四章 普洱！（第二更，求訂閱！）
content:
Without too much preamble,

No lengthy self-introductions,

And no idiotic back-and-forth exchanges of moves;

This slaughter, taking place in a冥店 and not meant for the living,
began abruptly in this manner.

"Funeral Song"

For whom does it sound?

The roles of prey and hunter swung back and forth. The side that had been utterly confident and poised suddenly had a misconception: perhaps they wouldn't be the ones to laugh last.

The skeletal hand, radiating cold flame, pierced through the loli's soul, leaving a large, burning hole. The loli could only retreat, her face dark as she looked at the injury to her soul.

They wanted to conserve their strength because they knew that the guy who had escaped their last encirclement wasn't an easy opponent.

But they had also firmly believed that this second encirclement, with so many ghost messengers gathered, would surely result in victory, especially since the opponent had no choice but to walk into their trap.

However,

Does this current situation look like a sure victory?

The twisting and stinging pain from deep within her soul continuously assailed the loli.

She dared not move carelessly. This flame came from the long-bearded man; it was his signature technique, and she had been caught off guard, truly without any defense.

She even worried,

If she couldn't suppress this injury, she might just vanish into thin air.

The soul, seemingly more ethereal and elusive than the body, free from the worries of birth, aging, sickness, and death, was, in reality, far too fragile, at least in this mortal realm.

And her physical body wasn't with her; now, she regretted it.

If the physical body she temporarily inhabited had been here, she wouldn't have been so passive.

"Ugh..."

Her mouth opened,

And the loli's tongue began to extend, growing very, very long, trying to extinguish the flames still flickering at her abdomen.

Her tongue continuously melted,

But it also continuously regenerated,

This was a method of healing using her own vital energy. Normally, she wouldn't dare, but at this moment, she had no choice.

Because,

The throbbing deep within her heart,

Was becoming clearer and clearer!

For the first time,

She began to ponder,

Tonight,

Would she be able to leave this place alive?

And the long-bearded man was visibly struggling to resist. He was the most senior ghost messenger present, with a good chance of becoming a Ghost Captain.

One must know that in the mortal realm, Yama Kings rarely appear, and Ghost Captains mostly operate in the Underworld. Those who can move more freely between the human world and Hell are the ghost messengers.

But such an experienced ghost messenger, in the short time after that person opened the door,

Was controlled and became a puppet!

Rewind half an hour,

This scene,

Who among them would have expected it?

Resistance and struggle were for dignity and for their own existence,

But in the next moment, when Liang Chuan spoke, he also spoke in unison,

Perfectly synchronized:

"This funeral song."

"This funeral song."

"Is for everyone."

"Is for everyone."

"Listen well, then be on your way."

"Listen well, then be on your way."

The long-bearded man extended his withered arms; both arms were almost just skin covering bones. At his palms, there were even exposed white bones, without even that layer of skin for embellishment.

For so many years,

Countless souls had been captured by his hands, sent to Hell, entered the cycle of reincarnation, and became his own merits and achievements. And now, he was like a marionette, controlled by another,

Controlled by his original prey.

You take me as your prey?

Fine,

Then I'll be your master.

The faceless woman let out a sharp shriek, her long hair flying out, wrapping around Liang Chuan. She knew that if she failed tonight, she would gain nothing.

Leaving Hell, leaving the water pool, even with the ghost messengers' assistance, was a huge drain on her. If she returned empty-handed, she wouldn't even be able to leave Hell next time.

The water pool would become her eternal confinement, and she'd even have to worry if her weakened self would be influenced by the reincarnated souls on the Yellow Springs Road, eventually falling completely and merging into their group, moving from one end to another.

She refused to lose,

And she couldn't lose,

She didn't want to be like before, standing in the water pool, watching these people leave while she could only rage!

Liang Chuan turned his head, looking at the faceless woman. His deep red eyes seemed to hide two blood-red moons. At the same time, two lines of blood tears flowed from his eyes, showing that he wasn't as carefree as he appeared.

However, Liang Chuan's finger tapping became lighter than before.

There was no piano in front of him, so naturally, no sound could be made,

But that urgent rhythm,

Felt like it was tapping deep in everyone's hearts,

Striking their heartstrings again and again!

They were ghost messengers, guardians of the order between the Yin and Yang realms. From ancient times, they had always escorted deceased souls to Hell,

And today,

Someone was beginning to send them off!

The faceless woman's facial expression twisted. She had no expression initially, but now, her face began to undulate unevenly. Even her long hair, imbued with special abilities, turned into venomous snakes on Medusa's head, not attacking others, but retaliating against herself.

The silent piano music, omnipresent.

This was a vortex,

No one could escape!

An unusual sound came from the faceless woman's body, as if calling out to something, creating a resonance with Liang Chuan.

"You said you wanted to be an envoy of Hell.

I,

Grant you that wish."

This sentence wasn't spoken for the faceless woman, but for the soul she had swallowed.

A lone wolf, it's not easy to have friends, and this time, he lost two.

He had found Xiao Qiang's soul; although it was in slumber, it would awaken one day.

Yuecheng's soul was right before him; he would send her to her desired destination.

You say I am the Yama King,

Then I shall be this Yama King,

So what?

Liang Chuan raised his hand, then sharply pressed it down.

The faceless woman suddenly looked up, her body beginning to twist. The soul she had suppressed, deliberately not fully devouring, now, with external help, began to counterattack her.

That girl's soul, which she had originally used to threaten him, had now become a bomb hidden within her own body, seemingly capable of blowing her up.

Two different kinds of shrill cries and screams erupted from the faceless woman's body; two women were biting, fighting, and devouring each other.

Liang Chuan provided the arena,

Set the stage,

The rest,

Was their own struggle.

He had confidence in her; she was even more suited for the identity of Hell than himself.

The surrounding ghost messengers naturally didn't stand by and watch but attacked in unison. At this point, they no longer cared whether it would deplete their vital energy or affect their stay in the mortal realm;

They knew the situation had already begun to spiral out of control,

Now, they had to forcefully bring everything back to their desired rhythm.

Immediately, pacification sticks, soul-suppressing banners, soul-snatching bells, and other implements surged towards Liang Chuan. However, the long-bearded man, in an almost selfless manner, stood in front of Liang Chuan.

He was powerless to counterattack, but he steadfastly bore all the blows, his soul quickly beginning to shatter.

Clearly the hunter,

Yet now sacrificing himself to protect his prey,

Even more selfless than the most loyal servant!

The faceless woman knelt on the ground, emitting continuous sharp shrieks. Ordinary people couldn't hear them; the nearby residents continued to sleep, but the cats and dogs on the old street sensed the sensitive anomaly, yet dared not stir, only curling up in their nests, trembling.

This was a struggle that living beings could not participate in,

A battle among death gods in the human world,

The outcome of the battle,

For the losing side,

Was not even being a ghost!

"Bang!"

The black pacification stick pierced the long-bearded man's chest. At the same time, Liang Chuan swayed slightly, feeling a bit dizzy, and the crimson color in the long-bearded man's eyes had vanished.

He lowered his head, looking at the black pacification stick that had already pierced his soul, and then at his shattered soul body, which seemed as if a gust of wind could blow it away.

In his eyes,

There was nothing but disbelief,

Why was this happening,

Why did it become like this!

"Kill him, refine his soul!"

From a distance, the loli, still suppressing her severe injury, shrieked:

"He's finished, completely exhausted. I want him to suffer worse than death, I want to personally brand his soul for ten years!"

Strike while the iron is hot,

The long-bearded man collapsed to his knees,

The ghost messengers in front bypassed him and continued to rush towards Liang Chuan,

The order of the Underworld cannot be desecrated. If today's events spread, they would become the laughingstock of the Underworld, so this man must be dealt with!

Liang Chuan's body swayed as he leaned against the door panel,

His fingers had already fallen limply, and his body was soaked in sweat.

His vision,

Seemed a little blurry too.

In a daze,

He saw ferocious ghost messengers pouncing on him, and now, he was so tired. What he really wanted to do was just lean against this doorframe,

Lean there forever,

Waiting for tomorrow's sun to rise,

Waiting for the golden sunlight to warm him,

Waiting for that warm and lazy comfort to envelop him.

Two thousand kilometers away, an old Taoist priest was live-streaming to cheer him on,

But he never used a smartphone, so he couldn't watch the broadcast.

There was a cold girl, biting her lip, smiling and crying, crying and smiling for him.

Liang Chuan looked up,

He didn't regret what he had done, not one bit,

But,

He had people he was bound to, people he had wronged,

Taking responsibility for one's own actions is often just a simple, beautiful fantasy.

As the pacification stick was about to smash onto his head,

He raised his hand,

Looking at the white cat below, still grooming its fur,

He called out:

"Pu'er!"

Instantly,

Under the dim streetlights,

The cat's shadow began to stretch,

Longer and longer,

So long,

That it seemed to engulf the entire old street...

————

Long has no drafts, this is known to everyone. These two chapters were written in the first half of the night. Long will continue to write immediately,

Today, at least five updates!

Long will publish each chapter as soon as it's written.

Within two months,

We went live twice,

Two months is not too long, but some people have already forgotten the achievements and position we gained when we went live on February 1st.

It's time,

To remind them,

We're back!

title: 第一百零五章 我入地獄時，終將再度歸來！（第三更！）
content:
A white cat, its fur like snow, appeared as the most exquisite and pure white in this world, carrying a rare spiritual vitality and clarity.

But its shadow was black, a despairing black, like a demonic tentacle extending from underground, continuously spreading, continuously covering.

Accompanying it,

Were curses and despair!

In the cat's eyes shimmered the exact same look that Liang Chuan's eyes had held deep within them earlier; that crimson depth, like swirling magma, oppressively suffocating!

If one looked closely,

One could still faintly discern countless wailing spirits and grieving ghosts, and mountains of piled bones in the cat's eyes.

A pair of cat's eyes,

Etched with the deepest and most terrifying imagery of hell,

That was Purgatory,

That was Asura,

That was the place where all beings found rest and their final madness,

It was the origin of life,

It was the destination of all!

And that place,

Was somewhere even ordinary Hell Guards weren't qualified to approach.

Because there, Hell Guards and ordinary vengeful spirits were fundamentally indistinguishable.

"Meow!"

The cat's meow,

Resounded throughout the entire old street,

Instantly causing the swarming Hell Guards to tremble, their hearts shaking.

At this moment, they seemed to forget that they were currently in the Human Realm, as if they had returned to Hell, to that dark and sunless place.

In the Human Realm,

They were mysterious beings existing beyond human sight, existing in tales of the strange and myths, not much different from the old immortals on high mountains. In fact, they were more down-to-earth, and people feared them like tigers!

But in the Underworld, in Hell, they were merely the lowest-ranking civil servants.

At the same time as the cat's meow,

The red in Liang Chuan's eyes, which had previously dimmed, gradually returned. No more blood flowed from his eye sockets; what needed to flow had already dried up, but that deep crimson still re-condensed,

Even,

More intensely than before!

Tonight's theme,

Was revenge,

Previously,

That was the prelude!

Now,

Is the true movement!

My departed friends,

I will carry your souls,

To witness everything tonight!

My blood has run dry,

Now,

It's your turn to bleed…

His ten fingers twitched again, pale, slender knuckles twisting and dancing. He was playing, he was performing, in the dead of midnight, he was unleashing his own musical notes.

All the listeners,

Must die!

Among the Hell Guards, three more suddenly had their eyes turn crimson, and then, without hesitation, they attacked their comrades beside them.

You arrested me,

You threatened the lives of those around me, forcing me,

You thought you stood on the side of justice,

You were arrogant,

You looked down on a lowly ant like me who returned as a smuggler,

You thought yourselves to be superior,

You thought yourselves incomparably noble,

You thought your will was correct,

Then today,

I'd like to see,

Just how noble,

You,

Can truly be!

I want to see,

Will you cry?

Will you feel pain?

Will you panic?

Are you,

After all, just like ordinary people,

And after stripping away your glamorous facade and status,

Do you,

Also possess fear!

His ten fingers interlaced, the frequency of their trembling doubled from before, and the notes of death poured out. Inside the Underworld Shop, the Hell Guards descended into chaos, beginning to slaughter each other.

One person, a second ago, was controlled and struck a blow at their comrade,

But in the very next second,

They broke free of the control, and while still disoriented, the comrade who had just been attacked retaliated.

One after another, the Hell Guards at this moment seemed to have become puppets on strings before Liang Chuan.

He could move whichever he wanted,

He could play with whichever he wanted,

He could mess with whichever he wanted,

To mock you,

To toy with you,

To watch you kill each other in fear and bewilderment,

This is my,

Gift to you!

You said I wanted to become a Judge of the Underworld, committing a great taboo,

Then today,

As you wished,

I will judge your lives and deaths!

In the corner of the Underworld Shop, the little girl was licking her wounds with her tongue,

Watching all of this with wide eyes,

She saw her comrades in front of her fiercely slaughtering each other, without mercy,

She saw the crimson in their eyes flickering constantly,

She saw the man they were pursuing leaning against the doorframe,

His gaze crimson,

Yet a smile on his lips,

Enjoying it all!

Everything felt so unreal, so utterly despairing,

This is a dream,

This must be a dream,

I must be dreaming,

Must be dreaming!

Yes,

This isn't real,

This definitely isn't real,

How, could this possibly be real!

If Zhou Ze were also here at this moment, seeing the little girl completely terrified and stunned, he would probably feel an immense sense of irony. The little girl, who had previously been the biggest threat in his eyes,

Was now truly scared into a common, naive loli,

Cowering there,

Trembling.

Unfortunately, she was a soul body, without a physical body,

Otherwise, if Zhou Ze were here, he could even lift her skirt to see if she would be scared to pee herself.

Of course, in Tongcheng, over two thousand kilometers from Rongcheng, Zhou Ze was not entirely without sensation. The mark on his right palm continuously throbbed with a stinging pain, so unbearable that Zhou Ze could only clench his fist.

Although he wasn't sure what exactly was happening,

Zhou Ze had a premonition,

That the little girl who would bring him trouble if she returned to Tongcheng was now in immense trouble. The key to the Gate of Hell she had left him was shifting, meaning she was gradually losing control over this key!

Once she truly couldn't return,

This key,

Would be his, and completely… entirely his!

With the ID in hand and the key also in hand,

He would be a legitimate Hell Guard!

...

Rongcheng,

Old Street,

Chaos,

Chaos,

Complete chaos,

The entire north of the old street,

Was in utter pandemonium.

"When I enter Hell,

I will walk on a path paved with white bones;

When I enter Hell,

I will pluck the most beautiful Mandala flowers;"

Looking at the scene of madness before him,

Liang Chuan smiled very happily,

He softly chanted, as if he were the narrator of this insane and tragic farce,

Providing voice-over for this blood-soaked stage play, where the scent of blood was so thick it could almost drip.

His fingertips were still dancing,

The melody was still pouring out,

It wasn't over yet,

It couldn't stop yet.

The white cat was already soaked in fresh blood, slowly dyeing its pure white fur red, but the white cat stood there resolutely, beside Liang Chuan.

Liang Chuan's eyes were no longer visible, sunken deep into their sockets, and his entire being had become somewhat emaciated, as if a gust of wind could blow him over.

But the bloody glow deep within his eye sockets,

Still rippled,

Not enough,

Still not enough,

Truly,

Still not enough!

"When I enter Hell,

I will drink the most turbid waters of the Yellow Springs;

When I enter Hell,

I will traverse endless curses;

When I enter Hell,

I will face the void and darkness."

The chanting sounded like a death knell to these Hell Guards, urging them to continually push this internecine battle to a climax, compelling them to more forcefully plunge their weapons into their comrades' bodies.

Souls were shattering,

Screams were echoing,

Roars were bellowing,

They knew what they were doing,

But the most painful thing was that they knew what they were doing!!!

They couldn't stop,

Absolutely couldn't stop,

They had lost themselves, and could only, under the man's gaze, complete their actions,

At this very moment,

They seemed to truly feel that a Judge of the Underworld stood before them, holding a judgment brush, recounting their sins, sending them to the execution ground!

But throughout history,

Only they, the Hell Guards, escorted others into Hell to be fried in oil and collected offerings.

When had it ever happened that they themselves were bound and subjected to such cruel torture?

The slaughter,

Continued,

Despair,

Also continued to spread.

"When I enter Hell,

I will be buried in a boundless sea of blood;

When I enter Hell,

I will be offered to demons;

When I enter Hell,

I will indulge in solitude;

When I enter Hell,

I will never look back."

The chanting began to quicken, the rhythm becoming clearer. Liang Chuan became increasingly lost in it, immersed in a non-existent melody, wandering in the atmosphere he had created for himself.

An ordinary person seeing this would think he had a problem, that he was a mentally ill person amusing himself,

Only,

This group of Hell Guards in the Underworld Shop,

Truly experienced this terror and perceived this despair!

"When I enter Hell,

I will no longer be lost;

When I enter Hell,

I will no longer hesitate;

When I enter Hell,

I will abandon thought;

When I enter Hell,

I will cast aside confusion."

The faceless woman, who had been kneeling in the corner, now slowly began to chant the exact same words as Liang Chuan. She slowly stood up,

She extended her hand,

Pulled back her hair,

Her formerly faceless self,

Her features were slowly emerging.

At this moment,

There was no struggle,

Nor resistance,

Amidst these chants,

It seemed many things had already been settled!

Her mouth, split open,

Revealing red lips, a graceful tongue, and pearly teeth, her entire face became clear.

It was a moving face,

It was a pretty face,

It was a young face.

The woman looked at Liang Chuan, accompanying him in his chanting.

Liang Chuan reached out and patted the woman's head, as if stroking his own younger sister.

Her dream was to become an apostle of Hell; she was devoted to it, consecrated to it,

So,

He gave her this opportunity,

This was her choice, without hesitation, without sorrow, without concern.

The two looked at each other and continued to chant together:

"When I enter Hell,

I will bury the past;

When I enter Hell,

I will conceal the future,

When I enter Hell,

I will no longer exist in the world!"

As the chanting reached this point, the white cat had already become a blood-red cat. It had collapsed, unable to support itself, and Liang Chuan slowly sat down, leaning against the doorframe,

Using his last bit of strength,

He chanted the final verse:

"When I enter Hell,

I will ultimately return!"

"Boom! Boom! Boom! Boom!..."

The souls of the Hell Guards,

One by one, exploded,

One by one, dissipated into the world,

As if to draw, for this movement,

Its unique,

Rest.

title: 第一百零六章 死早了！（第四更！求訂閱！）
content:
"Boss, are we doing business today or not?"

Bai Yingying walked up to Zhou Ze, a mournful expression on her face.

Zhou Ze smiled, took a sip of water, shook his head, and said, "They're happy today; let them make a fuss."

Then,

Zhou Ze saw the hell money and the bloody ink paintings Tang Shi had made on the floor. He looked at Bai Yingying sympathetically and comforted her:

"Tonight, they'll be responsible for cleaning up."

"Oh, okay!"

The silly girl Bai Yingying immediately cheered up.

"Get me another cup of coffee and a newspaper."

Zhou Ze rubbed his right palm. The pain was slowly fading, but the sense of belonging to the Key to the Gates of Hell was constantly strengthening. However, this series of stimuli made him feel somewhat mentally fatigued.

He was already seriously injured and had only recently woken up. His body was still a bit weak and couldn't handle too much exertion.

Bai Yingying diligently brought the coffee and newspaper, then scurried upstairs. Since the boss said they weren't opening today, she went back to her room upstairs to play PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds.

She heard new gun skins had just been released, and she had already decided to pawn another one of her funerary objects to buy them.

It was a pity that Bluehole didn't know about her existence,

Otherwise, they would really give her an award — a true "ashes-level" gamer!

Zhou Ze continued to sit by the window, flipping through the newspaper.

The ruckus on the other side continued. Zhou Ze initially thought no more customers would come, but one actually did.

This gave Zhou Ze a misconception:

Ha,

Is there really someone not afraid of death?

It was a familiar customer, walking a Corgi. She was Zhou Ze's first client when he opened his old shop. At the time, her beloved dog had gone missing, and with Zhou Ze's help, she found it.

Xu Qinglang had originally wanted to show off his twenty-odd apartments to her,

But she told him her family's resettlement housing was provided by her family's real estate company, which depressed Xu Qinglang for several days. Trying to show off and falling flat on his face naturally didn't feel good.

"Boss, it's quite lively here, isn't it?"

The young woman sat down in front of Zhou Ze.

Zhou Ze pushed his coffee towards her. "Haven't drunk it."

The girl shook her head. "I don't drink this. What's going on with them?"

The girl pointed to Tang Shi and the old Taoist, who were still making a racket.

"Oh, we just opened, so we hired a circus troupe to liven things up."

The girl smiled, not sure if she believed him or not. She walked over to the counter, poured herself a glass of water, and then walked back, saying:

"Boss, remember I told you I could invest if you opened a new shop?"

"It's a losing business; I'm afraid of implicating you."

"I happened to be passing by today and saw the 'Midnight Bookstore' sign. I hesitated for a moment, but sure enough, you've moved. Alright, this location is pretty good. I just came in to say hello. See you next time."

The girl came and went quickly.

Zhou Ze picked up his coffee, took a sip, and continued reading the newspaper, but then he noticed a dark silhouette by his bed.

Zhou Ze turned his head and looked out the glass window. An old woman stood there, gaunt and expressionless.

He reached out and tapped on the window glass. She turned her head and looked over.

Still bewildered.

"Hey, are you done yet?"

Zhou Ze shouted to Tang Shi and the old Taoist.

They were nearing the end. The old Taoist was breathless from singing and collapsed on the floor. Tang Shi stopped laughing and crying.

Zhou Ze gestured for Tang Shi to look outside his window. Tang Shi understood, went out, and soon, the old woman was forcibly ushered into the shop.

"Can you send her to hell?" Zhou Ze asked.

He was a bit weak now; the Gates of Hell wouldn't open.

"The kind where her soul scatters?"

Tang Shi asked.

"Never mind."

Zhou Ze looked at the old woman and saw that her eyes were vacant. Except for an initial glance at people, she just stared blankly in one direction.

Following her gaze, Zhou Ze found she was staring at the clock hanging on the wall.

A customer had come,

He wasn't feeling well right now and it was inconvenient to receive her,

But he couldn't just kick a customer out.

"Leave her in the shop. Tomorrow, when I've recovered some energy, I'll see if I can open the Gates of Hell and send her down."

Every little bit helps, Zhou Ze wasn't particular and wouldn't let it slip.

"Who's going to watch her?"

Tang Shi asked.

In the bookstore, there were only four people who could effectively keep an eye on a ghost.

Zhou Ze, Xu Qinglang, Tang Shi, and Bai Yingying. The old Taoist was a half-measure and didn't count.

But Xu Qinglang had gone back to his hometown today and wasn't here.

Zhou Ze was weak and couldn't watch her.

That left Tang Shi and Bai Yingying. Miss Tang's meaning was for him to call his maid, who was playing games upstairs, down to watch the ghost. She didn't have time to do his odd jobs.

However, Bai Yingying had just gone up to play games. Calling her down again now, Zhou Ze felt a little sorry for her.

This silly girl had even pawned her funerary objects to open a bookstore for him. She was busy with everything, inside and out,

And she had to serve him in the bath and sleep with him,

He really couldn't bear to deprive her of her hobbies.

"Alright, just leave her here. It doesn't look like she'll run away." Zhou Ze could only shrug.

"Heh heh, the ghosts around will be attracted by you, but they'll quickly realize what kind of place this is, then they'll get scared, start to avoid it, and finally, when you're not paying attention, they'll slip away.

Fear of death is human nature, and ghosts are no exception."

Zhou Ze pointed at the old woman. She was still staring at the clock, saying:

"I always feel like something's wrong with her brain. Can ghosts get Alzheimer's?"

"I haven't done research on that."

"Never mind. If she leaves, she leaves. Since I can't send her directly to hell, I can't just shatter her today, can I? This is a delivery station, not a slaughterhouse."

"Suit yourself." Tang Shi prepared to go upstairs.

"Hey." Zhou Ze called out to her.

Tang Shi didn't stop, walking faster.

Clearly, she knew what Zhou Ze wanted to say, something even more unwilling than watching a ghost!

"Boss, I feel so good!"

The old Taoist got up. He had already turned off his live stream, and the monkey had put down his phone and gone to the counter to find something to eat.

"Old Taoist, feeling comfortable?" Zhou Ze asked.

"Comfortable, very comfortable. Haven't been this comfortable in a long time."

The old Taoist was so simple that Zhou Ze felt a little sorry for him.

But Zhou Ze still opened his mouth: "Clean up the place."

"..." The old Taoist.

Perhaps it was truly because of Tang Shi and the old Taoist's loud commotion that night, but for the entire latter half of the night, no other customers came, except for the old woman.

Zhou Ze leaned on the sofa, playing on his phone for a while, then reading the newspaper. He was currently injured and couldn't move very easily, so he could only obediently rest and recover.

The old Taoist spent over two hours cleaning the shop, then sat down in front of Zhou Ze, rubbing his back and moaning:

"Oh, my back, it's gonna break."

"Anyway, you're so old, it doesn't matter if your back isn't good," Zhou Ze teased.

The old Taoist said plaintively, "I'm old, yes, but just as silkworms spin till death and candles weep till they're naught but ash, at my age, I should help as many fallen women as I can.

People, living in this world, need to help each other."

Zhou Ze couldn't be bothered with the old Taoist's vulgar jokes. He turned his head and craned his neck, only to find the old woman still standing there.

The old Taoist couldn't see her because he hadn't smeared his eyes with cow's tears, so he didn't know there was an unfamiliar ghost standing in the shop.

As for Zhou Ze, to be honest, he had been distracted. After experiencing the Temple Goddess Lady Qingyi and the large-scale event with that problematic Ghost Messenger, Zhou Ze honestly didn't pay much attention to these small fry now.

However, after a few hours, this old woman was still there.

She was still standing in her original spot, motionless, just staring at the wall clock.

Could it be that this old lady used to be in the clock business?

But that's not right,

Zhou Ze's wall clock was only a few hundred yuan, a cheap one, not some antique collection. Was it worth looking at for so long?

At this moment, Bai Yingying came downstairs. She had finished her game and looked very happy, probably because she had gotten a chicken dinner.

"Boss, should we go upstairs to sleep?"

The silly girl was always so straightforward.

The old Taoist looked at Zhou Ze with some envy,

A strange thought suddenly occurred to him: Do all male ghosts who climb out of hell have such luck with women?

His previous boss, when he ran a冥店 in Chengdu, also had pretty women coming over punctually every night to sleep with him. At the time, it really made him and Xiaoqiang incredibly envious.

Xiaoqiang,

The old Taoist sighed.

"Oh, there's someone standing here."

Bai Yingying saw the old woman, walked up to her, and waved her hand. The old woman remained unmoving, still staring at the time.

"Hey hey hey, hey hey hey, look at me, if you don't look at me, I'll eat you."

Bai Yingying poked her head in front of the old woman, but the old woman still didn't react.

"Boss, did you or that Miss Tang make her stupid?"

"She's been like this ever since she came in."

Zhou Ze forced himself to get up and, with Bai Yingying's support, walked over.

Just then,

The hour hand reached the six o'clock position,

"Dong... dong... dong... dong... dong... dong!"

The wall clock began to chime,

The old woman, who had been looking dazed just moments before, suddenly spread her arms and let out a hysterical laugh, which startled Zhou Ze.

Not scared by a ghost,

It was purely the feeling of someone suddenly shouting behind you when you're walking down the street.

"Hahahahaha, it's time, it's time!

I can die,

I can die,

I can finally die!"

The old woman excitedly jumped up and down on the floor,

As if she had been freed,

Happy, like a seventy-year-old child.

"Granny, do you have a screw loose?" Bai Yingying said, somewhat perplexed. "You're already dead. Your soul has been out for a long time."

The old woman heard this,

Suddenly paused,

She looked around incredulously,

She must have realized that this wasn't her home,

This was a strange place,

A strange bookstore.

The old woman pointed to her face, looking at Bai Yingying in confusion:

"I've been dead for a long time?"

"Yeah," Bai Yingying said as a matter of course.

The old woman suddenly collapsed to the floor,

And burst into tears,

"Dead too soon, it's over, it's over!

Dead too soon, dead too soon,

It's completely over,

It's all ruined..."

title: 第一百零七章 賭命！（第五更，求訂閱！）
content:
"Is there something wrong with her brain?" Bai Yingying was a little perplexed.

Zhou Ze also shook his head. To be honest, he couldn't figure out what was going on. When he was a doctor, he often encountered C-sections scheduled for auspicious dates.

But he had never heard of someone insisting on dying at a specific time.

She probably lay in her hospital bed, staring at the clock at home, counting down to when she would breathe her last.

Given how much the old woman was crying and wailing, it definitely wasn't an act. She was already dead, what was there to pretend about? Who was she being hypocritical for?

However, her incessant crying was starting to irritate Zhou Ze. The old Taoist couldn't hear it, but he could. His sleep quality was already poor; how was he supposed to rest later with this noise?

Zhou Ze didn't have a compassionate heart, and his conscience had been eaten by himself not long ago.

The old woman's crying wouldn't elicit any sympathy from Zhou Ze, only annoyance.

"Scare her a bit, make her shut up," Zhou Ze gestured to Bai Yingying.

Bai Yingying nodded, revealing her fangs. The aura of a zombie instantly manifested, and the old woman indeed stopped crying. She was terrified.

At the same time, the old woman's obsession was slowly dissipating.

Ordinary wandering souls linger in the human world solely by a wisp of obsession. Once that obsession dissipates, they naturally return to where they belong.

What the Ghost Messengers need to apprehend and send to hell are those souls whose obsessions are difficult to dissipate or who turn into vengeful spirits. These are the "achievements."

In other words,

If Zhou Ze had sent the old woman away before, it would have counted as an achievement, albeit a small one, like a mosquito's leg of meat.
