What the old man didn't know was that nine years ago, when he wasn't yet comatose, a man named Li Shi had planned to drive to the sanatorium to find him. He could have arrived here nine years earlier.

But the original poster of that thread, after all, couldn't defy his fate. The fact that he could enter Sanxiang Village meant that his life was already nearing its end.

Li Shi, in the end, couldn't outrun his destiny.

Perhaps, nine years ago, the villagers of this village weren't as insane as they were now. There were still people... who could talk, who could communicate.

They told Li Shi some things, and Li Shi intended to go out and help them find the person they had been waiting for.

At this moment, Zhou Ze saw the old man and the little girl walking from the village entrance again.

Both the old man and the little girl walked with stiff postures. The little girl clutched her sugar figurine, tugging at it repeatedly, while the old man carried a hoe, his face pale.

In the corners of their eyes, a red glow flickered, and drool continuously dripped from their mouths.

It's getting worse,

Here.

The young man walked forward, along the paddy field ridge, onto the road.

He showed no fear, for there was no need for him to be afraid.

The debt of gratitude that had remained deep in his heart for nearly eighty years,

Today,

Would finally be released.

The young man was a centenarian, but at this moment, he took off his hat, waved it vigorously, and shouted:

“Grandpa Xu, Ah Hua!”

Just like eighty years ago!

The old man heard the voice and froze.

The little girl also suddenly paused.

The old and the young,

Suddenly stood still.

Xu Qinglang stood beside Zhou Ze, hands on hips, a little worried, “Nothing bad will happen, right?”

“We can only try,” Zhou Ze said.

A moment later,

The crimson in the old man’s eyes began to recede, and he shouted, “Xiao Chenzi (little boy), hey, you’re back!”

The little girl’s expression also changed from sinister to innocent and joyful. She happily ran towards the young man: “Uncle Chen, you’re back!”

The old and the young both ran to the young man’s side, overjoyed.

The young man turned his head, glanced at Zhou Ze and Xu Qinglang who were standing in the distance, then nodded heavily at the old man and the little girl in front of him, saying:

“Yes, I’m back, I’m back!”

“What about the troops? Have the troops returned? I heard yesterday that the Japanese devils were still killing people in the city, and bodies were hung on the city walls.”

“The troops, the troops are back too,” the young man shouted forcefully. “We’re preparing to fight the devils!”

“Good!” The old man waved a fist, then said, “Come on, before you left, you told us to help collect grain for the troops when the main force fought back. All the grain in our village is collected and hidden underground in the ancestral hall. The devils came a while ago, but they couldn’t find it.”

“Does everyone still have food at home?” the young man asked worriedly.

“Heh, it was all voluntary. Everyone just ate some wild vegetables to fill their stomachs. We won’t die from being hungry for a while. Of course we’re hungry, but it’s nothing.”

The old man pulled the young man’s hand and walked towards the village, while the young man happily held the little girl.

Zhou Ze, hearing this conversation from a distance,

Was deeply moved,

The old man said it was okay to be hungry for a few days,

But they had been hungry for eighty years.

Being hungry for a while is indeed fine for a human;

But eighty years of continuous hunger is enough to break even a ghost. It is an unimaginable torture!

“Xiao Chenzi is back, the main force is coming back!”

As soon as they entered the village, the old man shouted.

The entire Sanxiang Village instantly erupted.

The old woman sitting at the doorway, who had been drooling while sewing shoe soles, jolted, stood up, and shouted:

“Xiao Chenzi is back!”

The widow who was drawing water from the well and chewing on her own hair immediately spat out the hair from her mouth.

Her face flushed with spring,

Revealing a touch of her charm, she swayed her waist and shouted:

“Xiao Chenzi, if you don’t come back soon, my breasts will shrink from hunger, and then if this granny can’t find a man, you’ll have to take me in!”

Inside the tiled house, the man who was boiling water immediately dropped the firewood in his hand, grabbed his wife’s hand, and rushed out of the house.

Villagers gathered,

Crowding around the young man and walking towards the ancestral hall.

The blind old man sitting at the entrance of the ancestral hall shakily stood up. He had heard the voices and the commotion. Xiao Chenzi, who had recuperated in the village before, was back.

He had said that the main forces would soon fight their way back.

He had said that the little devils wouldn't jump around for long.

He had asked everyone to help prepare food for when the main forces fought back.

The blind old man dropped his cane and knelt on the ground of the ancestral hall, his hands fumbling along the floor tiles. Then, he lifted a few bricks.

He reached his hand under the bricks. As the crowd surged to the ancestral hall entrance,

The blind old man held up a handful of gleaming white rice,

And shouted:

“Xiao Chenzi, the grain!

The grain the folks prepared for the main forces,

We’ve kept it hidden all this time,

The devils didn’t find it.

It’s been kept for the main forces!

You eat your fill, so you can fight the devils well!”

The young man stood at the entrance of the ancestral hall, watching the grains of rice continuously fall from between the blind old man’s fingers.

Slowly, he raised his head.

He cried.

Back then, he was full of confidence, telling the villagers while recovering from his injuries that the main forces would soon fight their way back.

The villagers believed him.

But in reality,

The main forces didn’t return until nearly seven years later. The villagers didn’t live to see those seven years. In fact, less than a week after he recovered and went out to find the main forces, the news of this village sheltering wounded soldiers leaked out.

The Japanese army and puppet forces rushed here and slaughtered everyone in the village, young and old, as a warning.

This was also why he didn’t want to fight in the civil war and eventually defected:

Some people,

Were still waiting for him,

Waiting for him to return.

The Japanese had been driven away, and he should return too.

“Can there really be such deep obsession?” Xu Qinglang was shocked.

“There must be external factors influencing it,”

Zhou Ze looked up and saw the blood moon in the sky slowly becoming clearer, and the malevolent aura in the village was also gradually dissipating;

At the same time, a crystalline object fell from the sky, landing in the hay pile ahead.

Zhou Ze walked over, searched, and found a bronze ring in the hay pile. Its patterns were bizarre, and it felt heavy in his hand.

He hadn’t finished his sentence just now.

Picking up the ring, Zhou Ze continued:

“But external things are external things. Some obsessions are bone-deep, and external factors cannot stop them.

Otherwise,

Eighty years ago, we would have been annihilated.”

title: 第一百三十五章 周老闆的業績！
content:
If you look closely at the ring, there are some cracks, a feeling of imperfection, which makes one feel a strong sense of pity.

Zhou Ze didn't hastily put the ring on his finger, but placed it in his pocket.

This ring was unusual; Three Villages' ability to maintain itself in this way for eighty years must be inextricably linked to it. Zhou Ze was afraid of an accident if he rashly put it on his finger.

Moreover, now was not the time to study the ring. There was still one thing left undone, one that was the most essential and most important.

Zhou Ze walked purposefully towards the ancestral hall. Looking at the boisterous crowd there, his gaze met that of the young man for a few seconds. The young man nodded slightly.

A tacit understanding had formed between them.

The young man had lived to be ninety-nine, experiencing wars and various turbulent times. Such a life was one in ten thousand, and the wisdom his life experiences brought him was difficult to imitate or surpass.

Many things didn't need to be said, but they both understood.

Zhou Ze crossed his hands, slowly spreading them apart.

The Gates of Hell slowly opened.

This was the end.

This was the final resting place for the dead.

It was the inevitable path for all beings!

"Villagers, let's go!"

The young man led the villagers towards Zhou Ze.

Eighty years of trials and tribulations,

They had suffered hardships,

They had endured difficulties.

At this moment, the young man felt it was time to close his eyes, and with his fellow villagers, close their eyes together.

The young man was very satisfied with this ending. It was the ending he had been waiting for, and the ending he had yearned for.

In the past, the villagers had died because of his involvement. When he heard the news, he knelt for an entire night in front of the old locust tree at the army's entrance.

Then, over seven years, he fought in bloody battles again and again, wanting to sacrifice his life on the battlefield against the devils, in exchange for having no regrets towards the villagers!

But on the battlefield, the less afraid of death one was, the more one couldn't die. He survived battle after battle and even got promoted.

When the devils surrendered, he also grew weary, feeling that his mission was complete and it was time to end. Therefore, he hated civil war, which he saw as a complete desecration of the Three Villages' people and the heroes who died on the anti-Japanese battlefield!

The devils had been driven out, World War II had ended, but at that time, on the land of eastern China, a million-person-scale great melee was still happening.

So he revolted.

He hoped this chaotic situation could end soon.

From his youth to his twilight years, his life had passed through many turning points, but only today, at this moment, did the young man feel that his life was complete.

The half-missing full stop was finally rounded out.

The young man was the first to walk into the Gates of Hell.

The villagers followed, one after another, entering.

No one resisted.

No one cried or fussed.

Everyone had a smile on their faces.

Deep within the smile, there was a sense of release.

They were tired, everyone was tired.

Some things were fake, but how could people living in a fake world not discover anything at all?

This was a dream, a dream everyone was holding onto.

And now, the dream had ended, but the outcome was beautiful.

Therefore, there was naturally no unwillingness, no complaints.

Only freedom and straightforwardness.

Xu Qinglang stood by, silently counting the heads.

The last one was the little girl with the sugar figurine. The little girl looked at Zhou Ze, smiled, her eyes narrowed into cute crescents, and then she skipped into the Gates of Hell.

Zhou Ze released his hands.

The Gates of Hell dissipated.

"Rest in peace."

Zhou Ze said slowly.

Xu Qinglang bowed his head slightly, respectfully:

"Rest in peace."

To be honest, maintaining the Gates of Hell was also a very tiring task, and it had been maintained for so long.

But Boss Zhou had never felt this good.

Alright,

Talking about performance in front of the villagers was indeed inappropriate,

Especially in this atmosphere,

One should cry,

Everyone, cry your hearts out!

But the satisfaction of continuously accumulating performance points kept stimulating Boss Zhou's nerves.

He tried,

He tried very hard,

But he couldn't cry.

He really couldn't cry.

Not laughing was already a great struggle.

Xu Qinglang watched from the side, a little speechless. "If you want to laugh, just laugh. You already have issues; suppressing it will only make it worse."

Zhou Ze turned his head, looked at Xu Qinglang, and said, "Let's build a monument for them, a memorial stone or something."

"I have no problem, you decide."

"But I have no money. I still owe you money and money to my Yingying."

"............" Xu Qinglang.

Xu Qinglang suddenly had a bad premonition.

No,

Cannot,

Refuse!

"As someone with over twenty properties, selling one to build a memorial should be acceptable, right?" Zhou Ze asked.

"............" Xu Qinglang.

"You have to consider, without their dedication and sacrifice eighty years ago, you wouldn't be living in an era of peace and prosperity, and property prices wouldn't be this high.

Right?"

"............" Xu Qinglang.

"So, you're willing, right?"

"How do I feel like you're trying to morally blackmail me?" Xu Qinglang said, displeased.

"It depends on your mood. Actually,冥钞 (hell money) is something visible, but some things are invisible." Zhou Ze patted Xu Qinglang on the shoulder.

"We'll talk about this when we get back."

Zhou Ze didn't continue the topic, but instinctively took out his ID book.

So many villagers,

The performance should be enough, right?

His "temporary" badge should also be removable; he should be able to become a permanent employee, right?

However,

When he opened the ID book,

Zhou Ze was stunned.

Performance: ninety-nine percent.

This means, I'm just rubbing it on the outside, I'm not going in!

It kept its promise, it really didn't go in.

Going in makes you a beast.

But not going in, makes you worse than a beast!

"How much is it?" Xu Qinglang leaned over to also take a look. "If you become permanent, should we get some hell money as a bonus?"

When Xu Qinglang saw ninety-nine percent, he laughed ungracefully.

He laughed exaggeratedly,

Very unrestrainedly.

Zhou Ze sighed, looking at the charmingly laughing Miss Xu, and said:

"Old Xu, I want to discuss something with you."

"Speak."

"Will you help if you can?"

"Mm, I'll help if I can."

"You're a Xuanxiu, the probability of turning into a ghost after death is much higher for you than for ordinary people, right? How about this, let me kill you, collect your soul, and let me round up my score, okay?"

"............" Xu Qinglang.

Shaking his head, Zhou Ze smiled and said, "Don't be nervous, it's fine. Isn't there still a little girl in the bookstore?"

Sending that girl off would also make it complete, truly complete.

This time, there was no drilling into haystacks. After the ring fell and was collected by Zhou Ze, and the villagers entered the Gates of Hell one by one, the environment here slowly faded.

Eventually,

It reconnected and overlapped with reality.

Xu Qinglang and Zhou Ze stood on the road, while the old Taoist and Monkey were opposite them.

They got into the car, with Xu Qinglang still driving. Zhou Ze sat in the passenger seat, constantly fiddling with the ID book in his hand.

To be honest, Zhou Ze felt a bit like when his primary school teacher appointed him as a group leader.

Very childish,

But also a little excited.

"Hehe." Xu Qinglang chuckled twice. "You're already so happy. When you get promoted to open an office on Mount Tai, won't you just die of happiness?"

"If that day ever comes, after your death, I will help you."

"At least you have some conscience." Xu Qinglang said, greatly comforted.

"I will help you be reborn as a woman in your next life, completely relieving your pain and discomfort."

"Click..."

Suddenly, an abrupt brake, and everyone in the car jolted.

Xu Qinglang took a few deep breaths, suppressing the urge to strangle Zhou Ze.

Damn it,

He was truly afraid,

Because theoretically speaking,

Zhou Ze had the possibility of making this happen!

"Is there any benefit to removing the temporary employee badge?" Xu Qinglang asked.

Zhou Ze didn't answer.

"Is it a great increase in power? An extra magic weapon? Or will it add some special effects for you?" Xu Qinglang pressed on.

Zhou Ze shook his head. "I asked the little loli. She said that after becoming a permanent employee, a judgment poem will automatically appear in the book every time someone is sent to hell."

"Judgment poem?"

"Similar to the judgment poems in *Dream of the Red Chamber*."

"What's the use of that?" Xu Qinglang asked, puzzled.

"It increases 'B-grid'."

"Huh?"

"Meaning, it makes it a bit more prestigious."

After saying that,

Zhou Ze raised his head and looked out the window,

Gazing at the sky.

............

When the car arrived at the bookstore entrance, Zhou Ze got out first. Ninety-nine was only one short, and that one was inside.

Previously, for fear of other accidents, Zhou Ze had made a contingency plan: he hadn't sent the little girl to hell yet, but let Bai Yingying watch her.

So, after pushing open the bookstore door, Zhou Ze called out directly:

"Yingying?"

"Yingyingyingying............"

A sound came from behind the counter.

"Hello?" Zhou Ze called out again.

"Yingyingyingying............"

"What are you doing, don't play tricks. Bring the girl's soul over."

"Yingyingyingying............"

Zhou Ze realized something was wrong, immediately went around the counter, and found Bai Yingying tied hand and foot with a black rope, sitting there. Her mouth was also gagged with a rope.

She could only make "Yingyingyingying" sounds.

Zhou Ze immediately went to help Bai Yingying untie the ropes, but his fingers stung when they touched the black rope. Bai Yingying trembled with pain.

Taking a deep breath, Zhou Ze let his fingernails grow out and used them to break the rope. The broken rope immediately turned into ordinary straw rope and scattered.

"What happened?"

"Boss! Yingyingying............"

Bai Yingying lunged into Zhou Ze's arms, hugging his neck and crying bitterly, as if she had suffered a great grievance.

"What exactly happened?" Zhou Ze asked again.

"That little girl... the little girl... I couldn't beat her. Yingying is useless. I've embarrassed you, Boss."

Zhou Ze patted Bai Yingying on the back, his expression a little grave, and asked again:

"That little girl?"

"Yes, she wanted to leave, and I stopped her. Then she just tied me up."

"Where is she?"

"She left."

"Left?"

"Oh, she also left a note, it seems to be written on the counter."

Xu Qinglang walked over at this time and also heard what happened. He immediately searched the counter, found a piece of paper with very firm handwriting, and said directly:

"When I was little, I was afraid of ghosts, thinking they were hideous and terrifying;

When I grew up, I was afraid of people, even if they were well-dressed.

It's really well-written." Xu Qinglang said.

"I wrote that." Zhou Ze said, and as he spoke, Zhou Ze also walked over, pushed aside the papers and books on the counter, and continued searching.

"You wrote it? Then where's what she wrote? It should be even more profound, right?" Xu Qinglang asked curiously.

Then,

Xu Qinglang was stunned.

After Zhou Ze pushed aside the clutter on the counter,

On the counter table, there was a line of crooked words, like those written by a child:

"Braised pork, really delicious!"

title: 第一百三十六章 判官！
content:
Two more days passed. It was strange, these two days; not a single ghost came to the door. Boss Zhou sat in the bookstore every night,

waiting,

waiting,

waiting until his eyes almost popped out, but still nothing.

Even Bai Yingying couldn't stand it. With the boss's lazy nature, it was rare for him to throw himself wholeheartedly into the fervor of work, but there were no customers.

As for the little girl who tied up Bai Yingying, she hadn't reappeared, and her identity remained a mystery.

She might be an anomaly in that village,

but it was also possible she wasn't from the village at all.

Her appearance might have just been to act as a go-between and guide him to pay attention to the matters of Three Villages, using his hand to deal with Three Villages.

Zhou Ze had speculated about her identity, even thinking she might be of a higher status than a ghost messenger?

Like a Constable?

Or even... a Judge of the Underworld?

It was just that Zhong Kui's image was too deeply ingrained in people's minds. If a Judge was that little girl, it made Zhou Ze worried about the aesthetic and atmosphere of Hell.

A loli might be one thing, but if a Judge was also a delicate little girl, would the Ten Kings of Hell all be manly girls with big pectorals?

Of course, this was just a joke; it was probably impossible.

The loli was still investigating the whereabouts of the priest. She sent a message once saying she was close to finding him, so Zhou Ze didn't ask her to look for that little girl anymore. Someone who could directly overturn Bai Yingying, a 200-year-old female corpse, and play BDSM with her, as long as she had no ill intentions, he didn't need to provoke her.

Besides, the other party hadn't played any bad role in the whole affair.

But when would he find the next ghost?

Just one more to go.

"Come back quickly!

I can't wait any longer!

Come back quickly..."

The bookstore's speaker started playing this song. Zhou Ze coughed and looked at the monkey beside him. The monkey silently skipped the song.

The old Daoist sat opposite him. Since there weren't many customers, he sat there cracking melon seeds and watching TV, quite leisurely. Recently, international news had been quite rich, with one after another, making it dazzling.

Zhou Ze stood up, poured himself a glass of water. As he passed by the old Daoist, the old Daoist suddenly asked:

"Boss, does Hell have a TV station?"

"What do you think?"

"It should, right?" the old Daoist guessed.

"Heh." Xu Qinglang, who was mixing new cocktails in the distance, chuckled.

"What's so funny? You've never died, so you have no right to speak," the old Daoist retorted.

"Then tell me, if Hell has TV programs, what do they show?" Xu Qinglang teased the old Daoist.

"Hmph hmph."

The old Daoist subconsciously cleared his throat, then said:

"Now broadcasting the Underworld News Broadcast. Here are the highlights:

The King of Hell, representative of the Eastern Underworld, met with Hades, Lord of the Western Underworld.

The two sides held friendly consultations on the issue of ferrying souls of the deceased between East and West;

Judge Zhong Kui of the Underworld inspected the land registration work in the Underworld, resolutely cracking down on the phenomenon of evil spirits occupying land."

Zhou Ze listened for a while, shook his head, and walked back to his original seat.

Xu Qinglang was stunned for a moment. He was impressed by the old Daoist's glibness.

At this moment, it started raining outside, and the rain became heavier and heavier.

Zhou Ze initially didn't think much of it, but gradually his expression became serious. In the depths of the rain curtain, there was a woman in a qipao holding a red paper umbrella, standing there.

Her red umbrella covered her head, but from that angle, she was actually looking at him.

However, this time, not only did the old Daoist not notice anything, but even Xu Qinglang didn't feel anything at all.

The qipao woman's feet didn't move,

but her whole person was drawing closer to Zhou Ze in segments,

after a few moments, she stood directly outside the glass window next to Zhou Ze's seat.

A graceful figure, beautiful face, the most exquisite skin in the world, but inside, it was a nest of vipers and maggots.

Zhou Ze had seen these qipao women walking with umbrellas and chanting on the Yellow Springs Road more than once, but this time, she appeared in the Human World.

Zhou Ze walked out of the bookstore door. The qipao woman turned around and started to distance herself again. In this rain curtain, her figure appeared so hazy.

If it were an ordinary person, they might develop a fascination and pursuit of affection for this. In the rain, such a woman could often make you ignore fear and strangeness, and instead, completely prostrate yourself at her feet.

"Hey."

Zhou Ze called out,

but the other party kept walking. Her arrival seemed to be only to attract Zhou Ze's attention and then lead him to another place. She should be like a messenger.

To have a qipao woman who could walk back and forth on the Yellow Springs Road act as a messenger, the person behind her must be extraordinary.

However, seeing that the qipao woman had already distanced herself, Zhou Ze directly turned and went back into the bookstore.

What a joke,

You come coolly, without a word,

You leave coolly, do I have to keep chasing and shouting like the male lead in a melodramatic TV show?

This isn't Hell, it's the Human World,

This bad habit,

is really spoiled rotten.

Closing the bookstore door, Zhou Ze stretched lazily, sat back in his seat, and asked Bai Yingying to pour him a cup of coffee.

What he didn't know was that the moment he turned and walked into the bookstore,

the ethereal qipao woman in the distance made a "creak" sound, stepping into a puddle.

She turned her head,

revealing her face, which was a feast for maggots,

with a hint of disbelief!

He,

actually went back just like that?

Then, she seemed to hesitate, wondering if she needed to walk the path again?

With the same posture, with the same demeanor as before?

"Splish."

A pair of black rain boots stepped into the puddle. A man with completely white hair reached out and flicked the raindrops from his hat brim. His slightly pale hand rested on the qipao woman.

The qipao woman immediately began to wither, transforming into a paper doll, slowly getting soaked in the rain, and finally, completely disintegrated in the puddle.

"Forget it, since I can't invite him, I'll visit him myself."

The man wore a coffee-colored coat, distinctly English in style, but his head of white hair made his temperament seem a bit out of place.

At this age, with that hair,

he was a walking example of the "Shamate" trend popular ten years ago.

But the man continued to go his own way, walking slowly. Finally, he reached the bookstore door and pushed it open.

What greeted his eyes was a woman mixing drinks at the bar,

oh no,

on closer inspection,

there was an Adam's apple,

it was a man?

The white-haired man couldn't help but glance at Xu Qinglang again.

Interesting,

a man who looked better than a woman was working as a bartender here.

Looking further, Bai Yingying appeared in the white-haired man's line of sight. She carried coffee over, small and demure.

A zombie?

Kept in the shop?

The man pondered silently. He had arrived, but no one in the shop could see him, including Zhou Ze, who was sitting there, taking the coffee and preparing to read the newspaper.

People inherently feared one thing:

what they couldn't see.

And Zhou Ze could previously see the umbrella-wielding woman, but he couldn't see that a person, whom even he couldn't perceive, was now standing at the entrance of his shop.

A small monkey ran past the white-haired man, carrying its toy hammer. Naturally agile, it didn't notice anything unusual, completely unaware that there was a person beside it, looking down at it.

And in the white-haired man's eyes, this monkey exuded a strong malevolent aura.

It was originally a spiritual monkey, but it had cultivated the feeling of a fierce ghost, only these things were suppressed and not revealed.

"Achoo!"

The old Daoist sneezed loudly.

The white-haired man looked at the old Daoist,

then,

his gaze fell directly on the old Daoist's crotch, where a cluster of bright yellow light talismans covered the old Daoist's two walnuts.

The white-haired man closed his eyes. He felt it was a bit jarring to the eyes.

This shop,

is really interesting,

a small ghost messenger has arranged his residence so richly, filling it with so many strange people and things.

Finally, the white-haired man looked at Zhou Ze,

and walked to stand in front of Zhou Ze.

Zhou Ze frowned slightly, his hand suddenly trembled, and some coffee spilled onto his sleeve.

Bai Yingying, quick-witted, immediately came over to help wipe it, and at the same time, took off Zhou Ze's stained jacket to get him a clean one.

When the boss cared about cleanliness, he was truly meticulous,

but fortunately, Comrade Yingying was already used to it.

The white-haired man sat down in front of Zhou Ze, the two of them essentially sitting face to face.

"Temporary ghost messenger?"

The white-haired man murmured,

"Tongcheng, this small place, the ghost messengers are being replaced so quickly."

Zhou Ze looked around in confusion, always feeling something was off. Did that umbrella-wielding, cool-looking qipao woman just leave?

She left,

and there was nothing else?

What Zhou Ze didn't know was that the "nothing else" was sitting right in front of him.

A brush appeared in the white-haired man's hand, which he gently rubbed between his fingers.

"Ninety-nine percent, just a little bit more and he can become a regular."

The white-haired man smiled,

"Then, I'll do you a favor and help you with that last bit, so you can become a regular.

But since this is official business,

you must kneel before me,

and pay your respects to this humble one."

Zhou Ze suddenly felt a soreness in his knees, and this feeling was intensifying, all coming inexplicably.

The white-haired man held the brush, sitting calmly. Seeing that Zhou Ze merely stood up and massaged his legs, he was somewhat surprised. Why was Zhou Ze so slow to react?

An ordinary ghost messenger, after being stimulated by a wisp of his leaked aura, should immediately tremble and kneel down.

Are you,

any different from others?

The white-haired man frowned slightly, and at the same time, softly said:

"Kneel."

Zhou Ze's pupils suddenly contracted,

his body also stiffened directly, like someone who was lying in a warm bed suddenly being sent naked into the icy cold and snow.

"Boss, your ID, you forgot to take your ID out of the dirty clothes."

Bai Yingying came over with Zhou Ze's ID and handed it to him.

The ID returned to Zhou Ze's hand,

and the previously calm white-haired man suddenly opened his mouth.

Behind Zhou Ze,

he saw a large mountain, and beneath the mountain, faintly, the figure of a monkey;

A monkey moving mountains, a mountain-moving ape,

its body tens of thousands of feet tall,

bearing only Mount Tai!

With a crisp "thump,"

the white-haired man instantly fell to his knees, startled,

and asked in disbelief:

"Lord... of the Manor?"

After saying this, the white-haired man's already imperceptible figure directly disintegrated, dissipating into nothingness.

............

In a dark place,

the white-haired boy, who was dozing against the old locust tree, suddenly opened his eyes.

He looked as if he had a dream, covered in cold sweat. Behind the boy, he carried a huge brush, which seemed somewhat out of place.

The boy looked disheveled.

Suddenly,

below,

under the old locust tree,

a pair of blood-red eyes, as large as two houses, appeared, like two giant lanterns hanging in the sky.

The old locust tree was growing on its body.

It had horns like a deer, a head like a camel, a mouth like a donkey, eyes like a turtle, ears like an ox, scales like a fish, whiskers like a shrimp, a belly like a snake, and feet like an eagle, truly a "nine-unlikes," even more exaggerated and bizarre than the so-called "four-unlikes."

"Didn't I allow you... to wander... for three months... Woke up... a bit early..."

The boy pursed his lips, a fawning expression on his face, and said:

"I thought I'd wake up early to weed and catch lice for you, Old Ancestor."

The boy,

didn't tell the truth.

The giant beast below seemed satisfied with this answer, slowly lowered its head, and said:

"You have a heart... It wasn't in vain that I... asked the Bodhisattva... for a Judge's position... for you..."

"That's right, that's right. Without you, Old Ancestor, I'd still be just a wandering soul in the Underworld. How could I have today's good fortune?"

The boy began to weed for the locust tree,

very diligently,

with meticulous care.

title: 第一百三十七章 宿舍詭談
content:
"My name is Sun Qiu, and I'm a third-year junior high student at Pingchao Middle School.

Our school is very big, with many students, and most of them are boarders. So, generally after 9:30 PM, students finish evening study and return to their dorms to prepare for rest.

Evening study usually ends at 9:30 PM, and lights are required to be off by 10:00 PM for bedtime.

Our dorm is on the sixth floor and houses eight people. Actually, the time between the end of evening study and lights out is really too short. During this time, we usually rush back to the dorm, then wash clothes, socks, and complete our personal hygiene. Basically, by the time these tasks are done or even before they're finished, a whistle will sound in the hallway outside, signaling the dormitory supervisor's demand for us to turn off the lights and go to bed.

The dormitory supervisors are all very strict, middle-aged men who look quite fierce. And, to be honest, most of them have a very strong sense of wielding power arbitrarily.

They see us as students and scold us at every turn. They aren't highly educated, but each one loves to play the role of a teacher, sometimes deliberately looking for trouble to reprimand students.

And it's quite funny when they scold students, like a high-ranking leader holding a meeting. First, they scold us to their heart's content, treating students who return late to the dorm or read novels or use their phones in the dorm as criminals to be educated. After they've finished speaking and tired themselves out and gotten their fill, they'll even ask students to grasp the 'spirit of their speech.'

At the same time, they make students stand in the office and write so-called 'self-criticisms' and 'thought reports,' deeply reflecting on their problems, and even set a word count.

Actually, they just pick on us junior high students because we're more obedient and younger. With high school students, they don't dare to be so arrogant.

So, we all dislike them. They wander outside the dorms after lights out. Our dorm doors have a window in the middle, through which they can see inside, and they love to watch from there.

If someone talks after lights out, or uses a flashlight or phone, they'll immediately pull out their keys and rush in like mad dogs, confiscate your belongings, drag you off your bed, and take you to the hallway outside or to their office for a scolding.

So, every time after lights out, my roommates and I don't dare to speak loudly, afraid they'll hear us from outside. If a roommate uses a phone, they always hide under the covers.

I particularly like reading novels, and my phone was confiscated a while ago, so I'd pull my blanket over my head and hide inside, shining a flashlight to read novels.

In the past, I could read like that all night. After all, school life is too boring. We only get two days off a month to go home and leave school grounds; otherwise, we're stuck in school.

Morning study starts at 6:30 AM and continues until evening study ends at 9:30 PM. Both our morning and evening study sessions are used by teachers for classes, so there's no such thing as being 'voluntary.'

Therefore, for me, the only pastime and joy was reading novels in the dorm during sleep time.

That night, I started reading novels very early, wrapping myself tightly in my quilt.

It's actually quite hot now, and being wrapped in a quilt makes it easy to sweat, it's stuffy and uncomfortable, but I couldn't care less. I just had to turn off the flashlight occasionally, poke my head out to breathe some fresh air, and then dive back in to read.

Around 2:00 AM, my roommates were all asleep, and I got out of bed to use the restroom.

Oh, by the way,

Our dorm has four bunk beds, meaning it can house eight people. My bunk is the upper one near the window balcony.

The dorm has a small, self-contained restroom, just big enough for a toilet.

I didn't dare to bring my book into the restroom to read, because if the light in your restroom stays on for too long, a dormitory supervisor might notice and directly use their key to quickly open the door and push open the restroom door to check on you. They open doors with keys incredibly fast, they've practiced!

One of my roommates was once watching an MP4 in the restroom while, um, performing 'air defense' by himself, when

a dormitory supervisor suddenly rushed in,

person,

"loot,"

all caught,

which made him write several self-criticisms and had his parents called in. Later, that roommate never watched those things again, but he got closer and closer to his male deskmate.

Excuse me, I got off topic. That night, I was sitting on the toilet, doing my business and thinking about the plot of the novel, when I heard footsteps from outside.

My heart immediately skipped a beat. I was lucky I hadn't brought the novel into the restroom, otherwise, if that mad dog had set his sights on me, it would have been over.

When I finished my business and came out of the restroom, I suddenly heard "rustling" sounds from outside the door. I silently lowered my head, and through the crack in the door, I saw a pair of leather shoes.

Someone was indeed standing outside. He was watching me, waiting for me. I silently took a deep breath, preparing to go back to bed. But after a few steps, a question suddenly occurred to me.

Our dorm door's glass is actually not high; I can stand there and see inside through the glass. But why did I only see the dormitory supervisor's shoes when he was standing there, and not his face?

Was he perhaps squatting there, deliberately waiting for me to expose myself?

Was he that sneaky?

Damn,

what an old fox!*

"Swish, swish, swish, swish..."

There was a scratching sound from the door, very subtle and light. I heard it, like someone was rubbing keys against the wooden dorm door.

I wasn't holding my novel, so I had nothing to fear. Hearing the sound, I wasn't in a hurry to get into bed anymore. I walked directly to the door, pressed my face close to the glass, intending to see what was happening outside, to see what the dormitory supervisor was doing.

But when I pressed my face to the glass, I found it was empty outside; there was no one there at all, and no one was squatting.

I pulled my head back, then bent down again to look through the door crack, but there really was a pair of leather shoes there.

Who took off their leather shoes here?

I opened the dorm door. To be honest, at that moment, I really wasn't very scared, nor did I think much. After opening the door, I found there were no leather shoes outside the dorm door at all.

I paused, a bit baffled.

"What are you doing? Why are you opening the door!"

A shout came from a distance. I saw a dark figure walking from the end of the hallway, pointing at me. I couldn't clearly see which dormitory supervisor it was; the hallway light there was a bit faulty and not very bright. But I was still startled and immediately closed the dorm door, then quickly climbed onto my bunk.

I didn't dare to immediately wrap myself in the quilt and open the flashlight to read my novel. I was afraid my actions just now had attracted the attention of that dormitory supervisor. He might specifically watch our dorm, and if he discovered even a tiny bit of light from my area, I'd be finished.

Moreover, I was worried he would use this as an excuse to open our dorm door and scold me for why I had just opened the dorm door and poked my head out.

I waited and waited, I waited for a long time.

This was a test of patience, a confrontation.

This was a game of hunter and wolf.

Really, this is no exaggeration.

I really wanted to keep reading my novel, to continue immersing myself in the world of the story, but I didn't dare. Because after I got into bed, I kept vaguely hearing the sound of leather shoes echoing in the hallway outside, sometimes near, sometimes far.

I checked the time on my watch; it was already 2:30 AM.

Damn it,

they were still hunting for prey at this hour!

The sound of those leather shoes bothered me for a long time. I really wanted to turn on my flashlight and keep reading, but I truly didn't dare.

From 2:30 to 3:00, the sound of leather shoes barely stopped, appearing intermittently. In my mind, I cursed that dormitory supervisor countless times.

If he didn't leave, I wouldn't dare to read my novel. I was really frustrated.

At that moment, I even wondered if he had just gotten divorced, which made him moody, and he just wanted to find someone to scold tonight, which was why he was so persistent even at this hour.

Just then, our dorm door was opened.

I was startled and immediately closed my eyes, pretending I was asleep.

My novel and flashlight were already in my quilt, and I was lying on my bed doing nothing else when he opened the door and came in, so I wasn't scared.

The sound of leather shoes,

began to slowly approach;

Drip,

Drip,

Drip...

Accompanied by the sound of something dripping.

And, I suddenly felt a breeze, I was a bit cold, and my body started to tremble slightly, uncontrollably.

Maybe it was because the dorm door was open and the balcony window wasn't closed, causing a draft.

The leather shoes came to my side and stopped for a while. I kept my breathing even. At that moment, I thought my acting was pretty good.

The leather shoes lingered by me for a while, then he silently left, and the door was closed.

I didn't dare to move,

continued lying there.

After about two minutes, the door opened again, then I heard the sound of leather shoes again, and the door closed.

Son of a bitch!

The first time he closed the door, he didn't leave; he was just waiting for me to make a move!

Good thing I was quick-witted!

Son of a bitch!

Finally, I couldn't hear the sound of leather shoes outside anymore.

I let out a long sigh of relief,

then pulled the quilt over my head, turned on my flashlight, and continued reading my novel.

I read for about another half hour, thoroughly enjoying it, it was a particularly exciting part.

"Thud..."

I heard a sound from the balcony.

I somewhat doubtfully turned off my flashlight and poked my head out from under the quilt. I wasn't scared of sounds from the balcony; as long as it wasn't from the corridor, it was fine.

I leaned my head out of the bed and looked towards the balcony. Actually, due to the moon, visibility on the balcony was quite good. I thought maybe someone's clothes had fallen off the line while drying, but I found no clothes on the balcony floor.

Then,

I was so scared my mouth fell open.

I saw it,

I saw a pair of leather shoes fallen on the balcony!

Leather shoes!

How could there be leather shoes here?

We're on the sixth floor, the top floor. No one lives above us, so nothing could be thrown down. And it's impossible for the dorm next door to throw things over at this hour, especially leather shoes.

Then,

as I was still in shock,

a face,

an inverted face,

slowly slid down from the wall above the balcony.

My body almost froze. I just instinctively watched this adult male's face slowly slide down.

His eyes were narrowed,

a very exaggerated smile on his lips,

then,

he opened his mouth,

and blew a puff of air onto my face,

saying:

"Hey,

I got you, didn't I?

Reading novels."

---
*老硬幣 (lǎo yìngbì) - Literally "old hard coin," an internet slang term used to describe someone who is cunning, experienced, and perhaps a bit manipulative or tricky, often in a humorous or slightly exasperated way. It implies they are a seasoned player in some game or situation.

title: 第一百三十八章 恐怖的慣性！
content:
"Then what?"

Zhou Ze asked while drinking coffee.

Xu Qinglang was also listening to the story beside him. Well, it was quite interesting to listen to as a late-night tale.

As for feelings of tension or fear,

forget Xu Qinglang; even the old Taoist priest beside him wasn't scared in the slightest.

In the old Taoist priest's words,

"Scared of what the hell?

I spend all day with a ghost and a zombie.

Was I ever scared?

Did I ever chicken out?

I wasn't scared, I didn't chicken out.

I just...

played it safe."*

"What else?" The young man paused, then smiled and said, "Then I woke up, it was just a dream. But this dream felt so real, hehe."

After speaking, the young man yawned, then picked up the novel he had taken from the bookshelf and started reading. He seemed to have found something amusing and burst out laughing.

What a simple child,

still thinking he only had a dream.

Then why did you come to my bookstore in the middle of the night?

Are you sleepwalking?

Xu Qinglang also looked at Zhou Ze in surprise, pointed at the young man, and then pointed at his own head.

Zhou Ze nodded.

The young man didn't know he was already dead.

He thought he was still alive, but he had already become a ghost and had been wandering for a while.

"Aren't you going to collect him?" Xu Qinglang asked. "Aren't you just one short?"

Xu Qinglang had just come downstairs and saw Zhou Ze sitting opposite the young man, listening to his story. He wouldn't believe that Zhou Ze was worried about some evil spirit causing trouble in the school and was keeping the young man as a clue, preparing to act on behalf of heaven and save the common people.

He knew that Boss Zhou had been yearning for that last one percent, practically starving for it.

"Can't collect him, his soul isn't complete."

Zhou Ze shook his head, a bit helpless.

Xu Qinglang frowned and looked carefully at the young man, only then noticing some details. The young man's soul was incomplete; some of his three spiritual and six corporeal souls were missing. This was why he was so "innocent and carefree" even after becoming a ghost, still unaware that he had died.

Even with so many illogical things around him, even though he was not at school in the middle of the night but in the bookstore,

he didn't feel anything was amiss and still believed he was alive.

Simply put, there's something wrong with his brain right now.

A very advanced...

intellectual disability.

Zhou Ze, in fact, opened the Gate of Hell the moment he saw him.

"How did you die?"

"What injustices do you have?"

"Are you hungry? Are you thirsty?"

He didn't ask anything; he didn't have time to listen to his babbling. He just planned to send him in so he could get promoted, but he couldn't send him in, which left Zhou Ze frustrated and speechless.

"Then what are you going to do?" Xu Qinglang looked at Zhou Ze, reminding him, "A ghost that can kill people, can you remain indifferent?"

Xu Qinglang was right; Zhou Ze really couldn't remain indifferent to this matter. Although this wasn't the "with great power comes great responsibility" nonsense that Spider-Man's foster father told him in superhero movies, since Zhou Ze was the infernal constable here, he had a duty to ensure that no ghost troubles occurred in this vicinity. If they did, they had to be resolved as soon as possible.

The Underworld authorities,

they were watching.

"Let's go." Zhou Ze nodded. "Are you coming with me?"

"No, I came down to get a face mask. I'll go back up later for a beauty sleep."

Xu Qinglang lounged lazily on the sofa, his posture so lithe it could bend steel plates.

Zhou Ze sometimes felt helpless with Xu Qinglang. He was clearly normal in that aspect; he could make a woman, after sleeping with him like a male escort, feel he was good in bed and leave three thousand yuan on the nightstand.

This proved Xu Qinglang had no problems in that area. But sometimes, when he was relaxed, the way he carried himself, even without makeup, Bai Yingying couldn't compare.

Naturally enchanting,

Xu Qinglang was lucky to be born in modern times. If it were ancient times, he would probably have been exploited by emperors and nobles who generally had a preference for homosexuality.

The old Taoist priest immediately volunteered, eagerly stepping forward to take the car keys from Zhou Ze, saying:

"Boss, Yingying's upstairs playing 'Eat Chicken,' she's busy. I'll accompany you, resolving demons and guarding the Tao is the responsibility of us righteous people."

And so, the old Taoist priest drove, with Zhou Ze in the passenger seat, heading to Pingchao Middle School.

The distance was actually a bit far, about a half-hour drive.

This middle school was indeed very large. The school gate was a memorial archway with "Provincial Key Pingzhong" written on it, followed by a guardhouse. Even more exaggerated was a canal behind it, with the school on the other side of the canal. There was a bridge here, spanning the canal, which was internal to the school, and another guardhouse on the other side of the bridge.

So, for students boarding here, skipping class was a pipe dream. With two guardhouse checkpoints, they'd have to swim across the canal to reach the outside streets and towns.

The old Taoist priest, relying on his eloquent tongue, directly tricked the gatekeeper into believing his grandson had a sudden heart attack inside and they needed to rush in to check on him. The gatekeeper dared not delay and immediately opened the gate. For people who clearly weren't students, the gatekeeper wasn't too vigilant.

The car drove into the campus. Zhou Ze and the old Taoist priest got out and walked to the residential area, which truly resembled an independent small town with bathhouses, a supermarket, and multiple canteens.

The students were like chickens confined in assembly-line cages, unable to even turn around, drinking and eating at fixed times, then laying eggs.

By the time they arrived, it was almost midnight. The dormitory buildings were mostly dark, except for the ground-floor dormitory supervisor's office, which was still lit. All other floors were pitch black, and despite being full of people, they gave off a ghostly, eerie feeling.

"Boss, which building is haunted?"

"He said he lives in Building B." Zhou Ze pointed to a building diagonally opposite. "It should be here."

"Which dorm room?" the old Taoist priest asked.

"Sixth floor, I think. I don't know the specific dorm room. We'll go up and ask any student which one had someone recently die."

"That's a good idea." The old Taoist priest offered an insincere compliment.

Damn it,

didn't ask for details back at the shop before coming out.

Inside the dormitory building's ground-floor supervisor's office, several men sat chatting loudly, occasionally bursting into laughter, seemingly discussing dirty jokes.

Even when Zhou Ze and the old Taoist priest walked into the hallway, they didn't notice them. The management here was indeed quite lax.

Or rather,

was this "loose on the outside, tight on the inside"?

On the sixth floor, all lights were off. The old Taoist priest randomly knocked on a dorm room door. The students inside, thinking it was the dormitory supervisor, instantly fell silent after their earlier chatter.

The old Taoist priest knocked a few more times.

A student in slippers came over and opened the door. Seeing the old Taoist priest and Zhou Ze, he paused, clearly realizing these two were not the dormitory supervisor.

"Police."

The old Taoist priest flashed his wallet, quickly putting it away in the dark as a show of authority.

"Which dorm room here recently had someone die?" the old Taoist priest asked.

The student was completely bewildered.

What was going on?

Police knocking on dorm doors at midnight, asking where someone died?

"Someone died?" The student looked at the old Taoist priest in surprise.

"Yes, I'm asking you where someone died."

"When did they die?" the male student asked in astonishment.

"Stop pretending!" The old Taoist priest stepped forward, scolding, "Is the school trying to hide the news and told you to keep quiet? We're the police, lying to us is useless.

If any problems arise later, you'll also be held responsible."

The student was utterly terrified. He turned his head and asked his roommate on the bed behind him, "Did someone die here?"

The roommates also started chattering, everyone very confused.

To the old Taoist priest's surprise, these students seemed genuinely confused. It didn't look like an act; this was high school, not some film academy.

"Sun Qiu, which dorm room is Sun Qiu in?" Zhou Ze asked.

"Sun Qiu? He's in the room across the hall."

The male student pointed to the dorm door opposite and said.

"Alright, you're fine. Go back to sleep, don't make any noise." The old Taoist priest ordered imperiously.

Turning around, the old Taoist priest went to knock on the opposite dorm room's door.

Soon, a male student wearing glasses came over and opened the dorm room door.

The old Taoist priest and Zhou Ze walked straight in, leaving the opening student a bit bewildered.

"I remember he said his bed was the top bunk by the window, is that right?"

The old Taoist priest pointed to that bed. To his surprise, someone was actually sleeping in that bed, covered by a quilt.

"What's going on? Someone's sleeping in a place where someone just died?" The old Taoist priest was a bit surprised.

"Who are you?"

A male student in the dorm asked.

"Is Sun Qiu in this dorm? How long has he been dead?" the old Taoist priest asked.

"Sun Qiu?" That male student paused, then called out, "Sun Qiu, wake up, someone's looking for you."

What?

The old Taoist priest turned his head in shock,

and then,

he saw the male student on that bunk throw off his quilt, rub his eyes, and sit up. He looked at the old Taoist priest and Zhou Ze, and asked:

"Who's looking for me?"

He looked very sleepy.

It wasn't a coincidence of the same name,

this appearance,

it was clearly the young man who had been telling stories in the bookstore just an hour ago!

The old Taoist priest's eyes widened.

What was going on?

Hadn't the person already died?

His ghost had already floated out, so who was this person lying in bed?

At this moment, Zhou Ze directly grabbed Sun Qiu's wrist. Sun Qiu frowned, but didn't yell, as if his reaction was a bit sluggish.

Zhou Ze pulled up Sun Qiu's sleeve and shone his phone flashlight on it.

On Sun Qiu's arm,

was densely covered with lividity!

This was not a living person,

this was a corpse that had been dead for quite some time!

The old Taoist priest, seeing this scene, also gasped.

Zhou Ze calmly pulled Sun Qiu's sleeve back down, "It's nothing, you all go to sleep early, don't make a fuss."

With that, Zhou Ze walked out of the dorm.

The old Taoist priest immediately followed him out, eagerly asking, "Boss, what's going on? Is this person dead or not?"

"Dead," Zhou Ze replied.

"Then this..." The old Taoist priest couldn't understand.

"Because of inertia," Zhou Ze replied.

"Inertia?"

"Yes, inertia. In this school, students' daily schedules are strictly managed. When to wake up, when to go to class, when to eat at the cafeteria, when to return to the dorm, when lights out—everything is fixed.

So, even if he died, the long-standing inertia from this lifestyle allows him to maintain the state of 'being alive.'

Because every day, for him, is almost identical.

It's like a small ball rolling down a track; it continues to roll forward due to its inertia. He is like that now.

Didn't you notice?

His reactions are already very sluggish,

but none of his classmates or teachers around him noticed,

that he had already died."

"That's so mystical?"

"When I was a doctor, I also encountered a few similar cases. Autopsies showed bodies that had been dead for many days, yet their colleagues or family members said they had seen them going to work and living normally just yesterday."

"How can that be?" The old Taoist priest smacked his lips, unable to comprehend.

"An unchanging life, with daily behaviors that are fixed, like an automated machine;

Does it matter whether the driver is alive or dead?"

---
* The phrase used, "从心 (cóng xīn)", literally means "from the heart" but is a common internet meme derived from "怂 (sǒng)", meaning "to chicken out". It is used as a humorous way to say "I chose to be a coward" or "I played it safe" by twisting the character for "counsel" or "instigate" (怂) to mean "follow one's heart" (从心), implying the "heart's desire" was to be cowardly. Here, it maintains the humor of the original.

title: 第一百三十九章 熄燈了！
content:
Death isn’t terrifying; what’s truly terrifying is being forgotten.

Sun Qiu died, a long time ago, but his classmates didn't know, his teachers didn't know, and even he himself didn't know. Driven by this inertia, he seemed to still be "alive."

However,

This kind of living was inherently a very desolate and pitiable thing.

Imagine, your life, your existence, the trajectory of your every day, whether your consciousness is present or not, remains unchanged.

Then, what meaning is left in your life, your existence, if you strip away the superficial?

Zhou Ze remembered an incident in Hong Kong that was quite famous online, often compiled into one of Hong Kong's top ten or eight supernatural occurrences.

It told of a restaurant deliveryman who went to deliver food. Standing outside, he could still hear the sound of Mahjong inside, but after knocking and entering, he found that the four Mahjong players inside had all died a long time ago.

This was a very typical example.

"Boss, he's already dead, so what do we do?" The old Taoist asked the question.

Because living people seeing ghosts is rare.

But if dead people see ghosts, that's not rare; it’s as common as fellow villagers seeing each other and shedding tears of recognition.

Moreover, Sun Qiu's death was likely not caused by a ghost. In the story he recounted, he was probably already dead at the time, which is why he witnessed some strange phenomena.

Zhou Ze frowned slightly. The problem now was that he couldn't determine Sun Qiu's time of death, which meant he couldn't ascertain whether Sun Qiu died a natural accidental death or was harmed by a ghost.

As for Sun Qiu's incomplete soul, there were many possibilities for that as well; it wasn't necessarily controlled by a more powerful ghost.

"Let's go down and ask. Ask those dorm supervisors."

Since Sun Qiu was now a "highly impaired" individual, much information was broken and irrecoverable from him. The only option was to find a breakthrough elsewhere.

In short, what Zhou Ze needed was a ghost. If Sun Qiu couldn't be captured, then capturing the dorm supervisor's soul would be the same.

It was quite like the saying, "Three years in the army, a sow is more beautiful than Diao Chan."

They descended the stairs and arrived at the dorm supervisor's office on the first floor. Two middle-aged men were still chatting inside. The other few had either gotten off work or perhaps gone to search for "prey."

This time, Zhou Ze and the old Taoist finally caught their attention.

"What are you doing here!"

One of the men with a flat-top haircut pointed directly at Zhou Ze and asked.

Zhou Ze took out a cigarette and bit it between his lips. This time, he didn't let the old Taoist ask but spoke himself:

"I want to ask you something. Has a dorm supervisor died here recently?"

As soon as Zhou Ze's words fell, the faces of the two dorm supervisors immediately changed.

"Are you police or something?" The flat-top man asked.

Zhou Ze shook his head.

"Then a student's parent?"

Zhou Ze shook his head again.

"Then why are you asking so many questions? This is a school. Unrelated personnel, please leave." The flat-top man walked over and pushed Zhou Ze.

Zhou Ze reached out and grabbed the man's wrist, his pinky fingernail extending and directly touching the other's skin.

"Hiss..."

The flat-top man immediately fell to his knees, his face contorting in obvious agony.

The other dorm supervisor, seeing this, didn't flinch and charged over.

"This humble Taoist has come to protect!"

The old Taoist proactively rushed forward. After their shoulders collided, the old Taoist executed an over-the-shoulder throw, slamming the other man to the ground. This dorm supervisor almost had the wind knocked out of him.

The old Taoist actually knew some martial arts. In the bookstore, he seemed to have the least presence, but that was compared to the Ghost Messengers and the zombie. Compared to ordinary people, he wasn't afraid.

"Speak."

Zhou Ze dragged over a chair and sat down, letting the man remain kneeling before him.

The flat-top man looked at Zhou Ze with intense fear, but he didn't answer Zhou Ze's question. Instead, he asked, "Who exactly are you, and what do you want... Ahhh!"

Zhou Ze's fingernail touched the flat-top man's skin again. At the same time, Zhou Ze pulled up the man's clothing to cover his mouth, preventing him from screaming.

"Go ahead and scream. No one will pay attention to you even if you scream yourself hoarse."

The old Taoist gloated from the side.

"You answer what I ask."

Boss Zhou had been mentally exhausted for a long time due to that one percent performance goal; he really didn't want to waste any more words with irrelevant people.

"Has a dorm supervisor died recently?"

The flat-top man was crying tears and snot from the pain. This time, he was truly scared and immediately nodded:

"Yes, there was one. He died last month. His name was Wang Baogang."

"How did he die?" Zhou Ze asked.

"He jumped. He jumped to his death from the dorm building. His head hit the ground and he died instantly."

"Oh, did he have any special habits, like liking to wear leather shoes?"

Generally speaking, it's normal for adults to wear leather shoes, especially in certain work environments. But this was a school. Dorm supervisors, while called "teachers" to sound better, were actually just young, strong men hired by the school to act as "enforcers." They had nothing to do with being teachers.

The two men in the room, one was still wearing slippers, and the other just sneakers. Wearing leather shoes to formally check rooms in a dorm building was quite unusual.

"Yes, he liked wearing leather shoes and suits. We used to tease him, saying he really thought of himself as a people's teacher, always coming to work here in a full outfit for roll call."

"Where did he die?" Zhou Ze asked.

"Right in the flowerbed in front of this building." The flat-top man pointed and said, "His room was on the first floor. He used to share a room with me. After he died, I moved out and lived with someone else."

Zhou Ze nodded. There were still some clothes in the wardrobe, and crucially, two pairs of leather shoes under the bedside table.

"These are the leather shoes he usually wore," the flat-top man explained.

Zhou Ze squatted down in front of the leather shoes, picked up one, and felt the sole. There was some still-wet mud on it.

The dorm was very damp, especially the hallway.

Generally, when dorm supervisors checked rooms, their shoe soles would often get wet. But according to the flat-top man, this Wang Baogang had died last month, and his shoes should have been left here. How could they be wet?

"Why did Wang Baogang jump?" Zhou Ze asked.

"I don't know," the flat-top man shook his head. "He didn't seem to have been provoked or anything. That night, everything was as usual. He took his keyring and went to check rooms."

Zhou Ze looked around, searching.

Regardless of whether Wang Baogang's soul killed Sun Qiu, one thing could at least be proven: Wang Baogang's soul was still wandering this dorm building.

"You can go. You can call the police," Zhou Ze said.

The flat-top man was stunned for a moment, then backed out of the room. As for whether he would call the police, Zhou Ze wasn't really worried.

After that, only Zhou Ze was left in the room. Zhou Ze's right fingernails had all grown out, and a black aura swirled in his palm. Then, Zhou Ze touched the ceramic tiles with his fingertips, and the black aura seeped into the tiles.

Before long,

Starting from where the shoes were placed by the bedside table, black footprints, visible only to Zhou Ze, began to appear. The footprints extended outward.

Zhou Ze opened the dorm door and followed the footprints upstairs.

Up the stairs,

The footprints moved back and forth through the hallway,

At the entrance of the student dorm rooms, they were sometimes complex, sometimes varying in depth,

This meant that even though Wang Baogang was dead, he was still performing his duties as a dorm supervisor.

He was still inspecting the dorms, still watching the students, still checking on their bedtime. In the dead of night, he would wander the hallway, standing at doors for a long time, waiting for a long time.

He was dead,

So he had plenty of time,

To dedicate himself better to his work.

The students in the dorms were unaware that they had to contend with living dorm supervisors while also facing the gaze of a ghost!

Suddenly, Zhou Ze's eyes narrowed slightly. He saw that at the end of the hallway, outside a certain dorm room, the black footprints were most concentrated.

This meant that Wang Baogang had lingered here for a very long time; one could even discern his hesitation and indecision from the footprints.

Zhou Ze walked to the door of that dorm room. Somewhat surprisingly, a white paper note reading "Storage Room" was on it, indicating that this dorm room was abandoned and no students lived there.

Zhou Ze reached out to open the door, but it was locked. His fingernail sank in, and with a slight force, the lock was pried open. Zhou Ze still walked in.

The bed inside the dorm room was empty, and below it were stacked mops, brooms, and other miscellaneous items. It didn't seem out of the ordinary.

But Zhou Ze knew that since Wang Baogang had deliberated here for so long, there must be something special about this place.

Zhou Ze sat down on the dust-covered bed frame, which let out a creaking sound.

Night,

Was very quiet,

Unnaturally quiet.

Slowly, Zhou Ze's vision began to blur. He suddenly stood up, and the blurring sensation instantly disappeared. As a Ghost Messenger, he couldn't fall asleep normally.

Sometimes, Zhou Ze felt this was a kind of torture, but he later slowly discovered that the inability to sleep normally might also be a guarantee that Ghost Messengers were unaffected by specters.

"Gurgle... gurgle..."

"Gurgle... gurgle..."

Below, the sound of gushing spring water appeared, and a strong smell of blood wafted from all around.

Zhou Ze slowly began to retreat. However, when Zhou Ze turned around, he found that the door he had entered through had become a solid wall.

And beneath this dorm room,

Crimson blood began to spread,

In the distance, it was as if a sea of blood was surging forward, a wave, roaring, instantly engulfing the entire dorm room.

"Gurgle... gurgle..."

Zhou Ze was completely submerged in the blood. Everything around him was bathed in a crimson glow, giving Zhou Ze a feeling similar to his first time entering the pool of water in the Yellow Springs.

Just then, a "drip-drop" sound came from outside the wall,

As if someone, wearing leather shoes, was slowly approaching,

He grew closer and closer,

Then he stood in a position separated from Zhou Ze by just a wall,

He knocked on the wall,

And said in a deep voice:

"Lights out, turn off the lights!"

"Clack!"

A mass of black ink seemed to rapidly spread within the blood,

The crimson expanse instantly transformed into a gloomy darkness,

As if,

The lights,

Had been turned off...

title: 第一百四十章 滴答！滴答！
content:
It was pitch black, one couldn't see their hand in front of their face, and the sticky, restrictive feeling all around was so clear that Zhou Ze found it hard to distinguish whether this was an illusion or reality.

This counted as a very high-level treatment, meaning this ghost's depth and spiritual power had reached a certain realm. It wasn't the usual run-of-the-mill kind that would just walk into his bookstore.

Zhou Ze remembered that when Madam Bai invited him and Xu Qinglang to a banquet, she also used a similar ability. Virtual and real were indistinguishable, and Xu Qinglang even ate many dishes made of flies and earthworms at that time.

Wang Baogang might not be the true mastermind. He wasn't qualified. He had died such a short time ago; it was impossible for him to become so powerful. This meant that the one who killed Sun Qiu and prevented Sun Qiu's soul from being complete was also someone else entirely.

Zhou Ze slowly spread his arms. The swaying feeling around him gave him the illusion of walking in outer space, as if gravity had been completely removed at this moment.

But as Zhou Ze's fingernails extended, black smoke scattered wildly, and the surrounding thick black blood began to retreat rapidly, as if encountering a natural enemy.

Having come step by step to this day, the present Zhou Ze was no longer the naive Wu Xia Ameng of old. Even in such a situation, a sense of composure and confidence still exuded from him.

"Clang!"

A crisp sound,

A broom fell to the ground,

The blood color completely disappeared,

The dormitory room was empty.

Zhou Ze turned his head and looked behind him. The dormitory door was open, and outside, a pair of black leather shoes lay quietly there.

It was as if a person was standing in front of him.

A moment later,

The leather shoes moved by themselves, beginning to walk out—no, to run out.

Zhou Ze rushed out, chasing the leather shoes down the stairs. The leather shoes ran faster and faster, but Zhou Ze's speed was not slow. In fact, Zhou Ze deliberately slowed his pace, waiting to see where these leather shoes would lead him.

He was only one lost soul away from becoming a regular, but the problem was that this one percent share had given him an enormous presence. Zhou Ze even speculated that the one manipulating all of this behind the scenes, even if not as powerful as Madam Bai, wouldn't be far off.

After all, the previous scene and feeling of the surging blood water were not very different in quality and resonance from when Madam Bai hosted her banquet that day.

"Drip... drip... drip..."

This was the sound the leather shoes made as they moved. Zhou Ze hadn't noticed it before, but now he did. Why did the leather shoes make a "drip-drip" sound when walking?

As he walked, Zhou Ze suddenly realized that after going in a circle, going down one flight of stairs and up another, he had followed the leather shoes back to the outside of the dormitory room that was used as a storage room.

The leather shoes walked in, and Zhou Ze followed again.

However,

This time,

The dormitory room no longer looked like a storage room, nor was it a sea of blood. Everything was very ordinary. There were neatly folded quilts on the beds, washbasins and plastic cabinets under the beds, and toothbrushes and towels neatly arranged by the sink.

This was a dormitory room where students lived.

Zhou Ze looked at the changes around him and a smile appeared at the corner of his mouth. He didn't know the other party's purpose, but the other party was making a grand display within the confines of a single dormitory room.

Zhou Ze waited for a while. This time there was no sea of blood, no "gurgling" sounds. Everything seemed very quiet, as if he had walked into an ordinary dormitory room.

But anyone with a brain could see the unusualness here. Not to mention why the dorm room was empty at lights-out time, the fact that there was sunlight streaming in from outside the window,

Why was there sunlight shining in at midnight?

"Scrape... scrape... scrape..."

A scraping sound came from the tiles on the balcony.

Zhou Ze was about to walk to the balcony to look, but he stopped immediately, because whatever was making the noise on the balcony had already crawled in.

Yes,

It was crawling.

This was a boy.

His lower body was completely severed at the waist, leaving only his upper body. He was constantly crawling on the ground with his hands. His body was covered in bloodstains, and especially where he crawled, he left dense, hair-raising bloodstains.

The boy tilted his head, watching Zhou Ze as he crawled.

He seemed to be observing Zhou Ze, full of curiosity about him, but he did not stop crawling towards Zhou Ze.

Zhou Ze slowly squatted down, leveling his gaze with the boy in front of him.

"I..."

The boy opened his mouth, but as he prepared to speak, fresh blood began to gush out of his mouth, endlessly. He looked at Zhou Ze, his mouth opening and closing repeatedly, but he couldn't produce any clear syllables.

He seemed a little anxious, but the more anxious he was, the more his voice failed him. In the end, it even turned into a sound similar to a dog's bark!

His severed body trembled; he was enraged.

He wanted to speak, he wanted to tell Zhou Ze something, but he couldn't!

He was utterly frantic, his half-body rolling on the ground, ceaselessly pounding the tiled floor with his fists.

Zhou Ze reached out, touched the bloodstains on the ground with his finger, and then lightly drew on the tiles.

Meaning,

If you can't speak,

You can write.

The boy paused, as if just realizing there was this method. He immediately nodded, dipped his finger in his own blood, and prepared to write on the ground.

But just as he wrote a horizontal stroke,

"Crack!"

The boy's index finger snapped off directly.

The boy was stunned,

Zhou Ze's gaze also sharpened,

But the boy was not convinced. He continued to write with his ring finger, but this time, he didn't even manage a single stroke before his ring finger snapped off as soon as it touched the tile.

The boy used his thumb, and his thumb snapped.

The boy used his pinky, and his pinky snapped.

In the end,

The boy was desperate. He raised his arm,

Holding up his only middle finger,

Roaring incessantly.

This middle finger was his, but it was another existence's mockery of him.

The boy looked at Zhou Ze, then at the cabinet on one side.

It was an iron cabinet, divided into eight compartments, meaning each of the eight people in the dormitory could use one cabinet to store their belongings.

The boy's gaze was fixed on the lowest cabinet. Zhou Ze walked over and opened it.

"Creak... creak..."

What was revealed was a leg, and then there was something else inside, like a piece of clothing neatly folded and placed there.

But in reality,

This was a person's,

Lower half!

The boy desperately crawled towards that cabinet, while the two legs inside the cabinet thrashed about, as if responding. But this entire lower body was folded too neatly; in this narrow space, it couldn't move freely or crawl out on its own. It could only kick and squirm in anxious desperation.

This was a very strange scene, enough to make one's scalp tingle.

Just as the boy was about to touch his feet,

Suddenly,

It was as if something was dragging the boy from behind. The boy was pulled back towards the balcony, struggling, roaring, and howling continuously, his body rolling up and down on the tiled floor.

But he was like a fish on a cutting board; all his struggles seemed so pale and powerless.

Zhou Ze stood up and chased after him, but as soon as he took a step, his vision began to rapidly retreat.

The next moment,

Zhou Ze found himself standing at the dormitory door,

And the dormitory room,

Had returned to its original state.

No bloodstains, no boy, no exasperated roars.

What did this mean?

Zhou Ze found it difficult to understand. This dormitory room was like walking into a cinema playing a horror movie late at night; every time he entered, he would get a new experience.

"Drip... drip..."

The familiar sound rang out again.

Turning his head,

Indeed,

The pair of leather shoes had reappeared in the hallway behind the door.

Zhou Ze finally understood why the leather shoe prints were so dense outside this dormitory room. He seemed to be doing the same thing over and over again.

Taking people away,

Then bringing them back,

Then waiting there to lead people away again,

And then bringing them back.

Like a waiter in a restaurant,

"Welcome, esteemed guest?"

"Oh, please come again, esteemed guest."

The leather shoes seemed to wait for Zhou Ze to turn and look at them before they started to leave.

Again, the "drip-drip" sound. Zhou Ze walked over, but this time, the confusion in his mind couldn't be resolved. First, why did these leather shoes make a "drip-drip" sound when walking?

Shouldn't it be "pat-pat-pat"

Or "scrape-scrape-scrape"?

Zhou Ze reached out, and the black mist from his fingertips began to release, directly enveloping the black leather shoes.

Like a net cast down, finally catching the fish.

Slowly,

The owner of the leather shoes began to reveal his true form. He was still walking forward, still making the "drip-drip" sound;

Carrying his stubbornness,

Carrying his persistence,

Continuing to walk forward.

"Drip... drip..."

His head,

Was half-rotted,

Upside down,

Half his head repeatedly struck the tiled floor;

"Drip... drip..."

He kept bouncing, each landing a collision between his head and the ground.

His hands, thrust into the leather shoes, swung back and forth.

He was actually walking on his head,

But his two hands were supporting the leather shoes, pretending that the shoes were moving forward step by step.

Xiao Pingtou had said that Wang Baogang, when alive, always liked to wear leather shoes and a suit when checking rooms. He considered himself a teacher, not a mere dorm manager or thug.

Therefore,

Even after his death,

He would maintain his dignity,

Even if,

He walked with his hands in his leather shoes.

"Drip... drip..."

Sun Qiu said he saw Wang Baogang's head slowly slide down the wall from the balcony,

Including Wang Baogang walking by touching the ground with his head,

There was a reason for that,

Because Xiao Pingtou also said that when Wang Baogang jumped off the building,

His head,

Hit the ground first.

title: 第一百四十一章 老道的遺言
content:
"Creak..."

Pushing open the concealed dorm room door, the old Taoist priest poked his head in:

"Boss?"

However, no one was in the room. This was Wang Baogang's dorm. The old Taoist had asked Zhou Ze, the short-haired young man who returned from the dorm supervisor's office, where Zhou Ze was, and the latter replied that Zhou Ze was here.

But where was he?

The old Taoist scratched his head. The boss wouldn't leave without a word. Did he go upstairs?

The old Taoist started walking up the stairs. Actually, this dorm building housed many, many people. Six floors, with thirty to forty dorms on each floor, and eight students crammed into each dorm. If you did the math, how many people must be in here?

But at night, the damp environment and almost silent corridors still gave one a chilling feeling. It had to be said, this was also a strange contrast.

You were clearly in a crowd, but you still felt afraid.

And tonight, that feeling seemed even more intense.

As the old Taoist went upstairs, he saw a student standing in front of him. The student wore a yellow sweater and held something resembling a drawing board, staring motionlessly at him.

"What are you looking at? Go back to sleep!"

The old Taoist rebuked, sounding exactly like a possessed dorm supervisor.

The student nodded, turned around, and walked into the wall by the stairwell.

"Uh..."

The old Taoist smacked his lips,

Damn it,

Is this a school or a ghost domain?

This dorm supervisor job is not for humans. Is he managing students or playing a game of ghost survival?

His hand,

Reached into his crotch and pulled out a yellow talisman. The old Taoist sniffed it at his nose. The paper scent of the ancestral talisman gave him a great sense of security.

The next moment, the old Taoist didn't rush to move, but took out his phone, ready to call the boss.

Boss, the ghost you've been searching for, I found it!

However, when he dialed, it showed no signal.

Damn it, this is bad.
