*Alas, blind in eye and also blind in heart, fortune is cold and fate is cold;*
*Please, sir, do not deal in ill-gotten gains, for home is shattered and kin are shattered;*

These three lines of judgment should summarize the ghost husband's life. As for the ghost son who was shot, since Zhou Ze collected him first, he was the one who helped Zhou Ze get his promotion. Because Zhou Ze collected the ghost husband later, the first judgment after his promotion was for the ghost husband.

The meaning of the judgment was simple: for this man, if nothing unexpected had happened, he should have lived an ordinary life. But his greed consumed him, and he squandered all his modest blessings, ultimately losing his fortune and even implicating his children and relatives.

Stepping out of the house, which had been set up in a garage, the old Taoist priest felt a bit heavy-hearted. This room full of dolls, this woman who had escaped that drug-trafficking village alone with her three children.

Alas,
How pathetic,
Truly pathetic.

The old Taoist priest looked up and saw Zhou Ze stretching in front of him, looking quite pleased, showing no distress or sadness over the family's plight.

"Finally promoted."

Zhou Ze muttered. He hadn't felt it before, but being stuck at 99% of the performance points for a while had been truly agonizing.

Now his performance chart had refreshed to 0.3%.

This meant that to qualify as a "Ghost Constable," besides finding a few more ghost catchers like Little Lolita to serve as his subordinates, just on performance alone, he had a long way to go.

"Boss, that family is truly pitiful."

After leaving the residential area, the old Taoist priest couldn't help but say.

"Pitiful for what?"

"That woman and those three children, their lives will be difficult from now on."

"Why are you feeling sorry for them? When they were prosperous from crime, enjoying the finest things, they didn't offer to treat you to a takeout meal."

"Uh..." The old Taoist priest felt his boss made a lot of sense, but also seemed to make no sense at all.

"When their family was wealthy, the eldest son could casually use drugs, the children could wear new clothes, use more expensive toys, and attend better schools, and his wife could wear gold and silver.

Since they enjoyed the good times together, they should share the burden when things go bad, isn't that the logic?
Using dirty money earned from drug trafficking consumes the most blessings. Enjoying it for a while brings retribution for a lifetime. This is fate, and it's self-inflicted. There's no need to pity them.
I think you should pity yourself instead. You ate so many paper-filled steamed buns, will you be alright?"

"Boss, please don't mention that steamed bun..."

Before the old Taoist priest finished his sentence,
He suddenly let out an extremely foul fart,
Long and lingering,
Like "Erquan Yingyue,"*
Heartbreaking.

"Boss, wait a moment. I need to find a place to relieve myself. I can't hold it in."

The old Taoist priest said, and without bothering to find a restroom, he headed straight for a nearby patch of grass.

After about fifteen minutes, the old Taoist priest returned with shaky legs, clearly on the verge of collapsing from diarrhea. It was no surprise; he had eaten too many steamed buns. Others who accidentally bought and ate those buns might also have stomach problems, but the old Taoist priest had witnessed what the buns were made of. The double stimulation, both mental and physical, had directly led to his current situation.

The two returned to the car. Just as the old Taoist priest was about to drive, he immediately clutched his stomach, saying he couldn't take it and had to go again.

When the old Taoist priest walked back this time, his face had started to turn pale.

"Damn it, they deserve it! That family truly deserves it!"

After such a terrible bout of diarrhea, the old Taoist priest felt no sympathy for that family whatsoever.

This perfectly illustrated the saying: most people's kindness is actually an emotional response based on their own perspective.

Zhou Ze sat in the driver's seat. He dared not let the old Taoist priest drive. After all, Zhou Ze had died in a car accident last time, and he didn't want to experience that again.

"I'll take you to the hospital."

The old Taoist priest nodded. He had to go to the hospital, otherwise, he might just "pull" his old life away.

The morning had cleared up for a while, but soon it started raining again. The weather lately had indeed been fickle and unpredictable.

Zhou Ze drove the car into the People's Hospital parking lot and accompanied the old Taoist priest to register for a consultation. He didn't know if Dr. Lin was there, and he didn't intend to check.

Ever since the incident with his sister-in-law, he hadn't contacted her again. This relationship, he thought, should just end there. It was complicated and troublesome, and endlessly agonizing over it was meaningless.

The old Taoist priest took a glass cup to the restroom to collect a sample for testing. Zhou Ze sat on a long bench outside, taking out the notebook. He didn't dare open it, just fiddled with it in his hands.

The black cat pattern on the back of the notebook was much clearer than before, and looking at it gave him the feeling that it was also staring back at him.

In the hospital, people came and went. Not long after Zhou Ze held the notebook, it would occasionally give off a faint tremor. It was very subtle, but through his fingers, it clearly transmitted a sense of agitation to Zhou Ze's mind.

Zhou Ze noticed that the notebook would only tremble slightly when people wearing patient gowns or those pushed in on stretchers passed by him, and the degree of tremor varied.

This was a major discovery. It seemed this notebook could predict the life and death of people around him. When those who were about to die or were critically ill passed by, the tremor became more intense, serving as a warning to its owner that someone nearby was about to kick the bucket.

His phone rang at this moment. Zhou Ze answered; it was Bai Yingying.

"Boss, are you alright?" Bai Yingying asked anxiously from the other end of the line.

"I'm fine, what's wrong?" Zhou Ze asked.

"Xiao Ke found the Japanese priest's location. She's waiting for you at the bookstore. She's also very worried about your safety, terribly afraid that something might happen to you."

At the bookstore, while saying this, Bai Yingying specifically glanced at the little loli sitting in front of her.

The little loli's cheeks puffed out in anger!

She was furious. Even the dullest person could tell that Bai Yingying was trying to put her in a bad light in front of Zhou Ze!

This just goes to show that women are born strategists in palace intrigues. The seemingly naive Bai Yingying had managed to teach herself and was now miles ahead on the path of vying for favor.

*Yingyingying!*

"Heh." Zhou Ze chuckled. Of course, he could understand the implication in Bai Yingying's words.

Little Lolita wanted him dead,
That was certain,
Just as he had wished for Little Lolita to meet with an accident in Chengdu and not return.

"I'll be back in a bit. The old Taoist ate something bad, so I'm with him at the hospital."

"Mmm, okay, boss. Love you, *yingyingying*."

After hanging up, Bai Yingying looked at the little loli as if to provoke her.

The little loli's cute nose tilted upwards as she snorted,
"Heh, childish."

"I wonder who's childish. I can bet you, if the boss really gets into an accident, he'll definitely drag you down with him before he dies, but not me."

"..." Lolita.

Scheming bitch!
Scheming zombie!

"Because someone has to attend the boss's funeral," Bai Yingying said calmly. "The boss said he doesn't want ordinary people to attend his funeral anymore. He doesn't want to experience being sent to a crematorium when he's not even dead."

...

On the hospital bench, Zhou Ze was idly scrolling through Weibo when he discovered a major news item: a tornado and hail had struck Yancheng, a city adjacent to Tongcheng.

The geographical location of Jiangsu and Zhejiang has always been excellent, rarely experiencing earthquakes or other natural disasters. In that area, at most, there might be a heavy rain that causes waterlogging in farmlands. But this time, the tornado strike truly left everyone in the Jiangsu region feeling helpless.

When Sichuan suffered earthquakes, many ordinary people in Chengdu were accustomed to it. People could even orderly move their tables and chairs outside to open spaces without buildings, continuing to play Mahjong while waiting for aftershocks to end.

But people in Jiangsu truly had no experience with such extreme natural disasters.

Some doctors and nurses started running around, as if something had happened and they needed to gather urgently.

Dr. Lin, wearing a white coat, also ran past Zhou Ze, then stopped and looked at him with some surprise:

"Why are you here?"

Dr. Lin was much thinner than before, and her clothes seemed a bit too large for her. A beauty's emaciation is the most disheartening sight, making one involuntarily feel sorrow for her.

"Accompanying a friend to see a doctor," Zhou Ze replied.

"There's been a tornado strike in the neighboring city, and there are many injured. Our hospital is organizing medical teams to go there for disaster relief. I'm leaving right away.
By the way, I've already signed the divorce agreement and mailed it to your bookstore, but you haven't sent it back."

"Oh, my bookstore has moved," Zhou Ze explained.

"Alright, we'll talk about it when I get back."

Dr. Lin left in a hurry; everyone else had already gathered and was ready to depart.

Zhou Ze slowly stood up,
His expression grave,
Not because this was his first meeting with Dr. Lin in a while and they were discussing the divorce agreement; in fact, it was a release for both of them.

The crucial point was,
While Dr. Lin stood in front of him and spoke,
The notebook in his hand had trembled very violently.
After Dr. Lin moved away from him, the notebook suddenly became quiet again.
This meant,
She was very likely to die soon!

---
*Erquan Yingyue (二泉映月)*: "Moon Reflected on Erquan Spring," a famous traditional Chinese erhu piece known for its melancholic and emotional melody.

title: 第一百四十九章 死神的……預言？
content:
Old Taoist Priest walked out of the restroom, holding his "secretions" to hand over to the lab for testing. Zhou Ze looked at Old Taoist Priest and said,

"I have something urgent, I'm leaving first. Can you handle it yourself?"

"..." Old Taoist Priest.

When I need care the most, you...

"Should I call Monkey to keep you company?"

"..." Old Taoist Priest.

Are you sure you're not joking?

"That's it, take care of yourself."

Zhou Ze took his car keys and walked out of the hospital.

Old Taoist Priest stood still and sighed, lamenting the hardship of his life. Both of his bosses were a bit heartless and lacked basic human decency.

But then, Old Taoist Priest felt relieved,

It's precisely because they don't know how to be human that they all became ghosts.

Heh heh.

Old Taoist Priest chuckled and went to the lab himself. It must be said that maintaining a cheerful disposition definitely played a big role in his ability to stay healthy and live to such an old age.

As Zhou Ze walked out of the main hall, he saw a minivan and three ambulances driving out. Immediately, he went to the parking lot, drove out his own car, and followed them.

He didn't call Doctor Lin to tell her not to go. He was also a doctor and clearly understood that doctors indeed have a responsibility to step forward in such situations.

More than ten years ago, when SARS was rampant, many media reported that numerous doctors and nurses in affected areas resigned or took leave, causing a public outcry. However, in reality, far more doctors and nurses continued to fight on the front lines, and some even contracted SARS themselves.

Zhou Ze's car followed behind the hospital vehicles, and together they got onto the provincial highway.

Yancheng is truly not far from Tongcheng, and coupled with the fact that the Yangtze River Delta region is mostly plains with an incredibly developed transportation network, rescue forces from various places could quickly arrive and provide assistance when a natural disaster struck Yancheng. The Wenchuan earthquake back then suffered greatly due to transportation issues, as it was a mountainous region with truly worrying road conditions.

It was precisely after the Wenchuan earthquake that the country has been investing heavily in recent years to rebuild Xichuan's transportation network. If another disaster were to occur, the People's Liberation Army hopefully wouldn't have to risk their lives parachuting in.

Half an hour later, the highway began to jam. The ambulance siren blared as it used the emergency lane. Some inconsiderate drivers who had occupied the emergency lane immediately made way upon seeing the ambulance, creating a very harmonious scene.

Zhou Ze felt a bit awkward. As he followed the ambulance, many drivers nearby gave him the middle finger for his shameless cutting in.

This made Zhou Ze wonder if he should call Doctor Lin and just ride in the ambulance with her to participate in the rescue. After all, Doctor Lin knew his medical skills. But he decided against it.

Last night, first the school incident, then the breakfast stall incident, and then he successfully became a full-time employee. He hadn't slept for two days and was truly too tired. On this trip, Zhou Ze only wanted to ensure Doctor Lin's safety. If he were to participate in rescue work again, he'd be too exhausted; his body couldn't take it.

Besides, there wasn't a shortage of doctors anyway.

It must be said that his life as a bookstore owner since his resurrection had indeed changed Zhou Ze a lot. His originally diligent personality had been worn down to be much lazier.

The rescue teams from Jiangsu's thirteen cities and those arriving from Shanghai certainly weren't foolish enough to all rush to Yancheng city center. Instead, they were dispatched to various reported disaster areas according to unified arrangements.

Doctor Lin's team quickly exited the highway and drove into a village under Funing County.

At this time, hail was still falling, and even further away, there were small swirling winds, making one wonder if another tornado might form.

More than half of the houses in the village had collapsed to varying degrees. Most of the old-style houses had completely fallen down. There were many pedestrians on the road, and everyone looked somewhat flustered.

After all, many local elders had never witnessed such an extreme natural disaster in their lifetime, so no one had much experience. They used to frequently see mudslides, earthquakes, or typhoons happening elsewhere, but they never expected it to happen to them.

When the ambulances arrived, injured residents spontaneously gathered to orderly receive wound treatment and care. Not far away, firefighters were searching and rescuing people from collapsed houses.

Zhou Ze parked his car behind and didn't get out. Instead, he sat in the car, watching Doctor Lin busy at the tent. Of course, for now, the situation here seemed fine. The residents' injuries were only minor, nothing serious.

Even those with blood-soaked faces only had superficial wounds; no one was dying, so Zhou Ze didn't need to get involved.

About half an hour later, a firefighter ran over and informed them that there were trapped individuals under a collapsed old house over there, and the situation might be urgent, requiring doctors to assist in the rescue.

Doctor Lin and a male doctor immediately ran over. Zhou Ze tossed his cigarette butt and had no choice but to get out of the car.

Under the collapsed old house, firefighters were already digging, but they clearly encountered difficulties. There were people trapped below, seemingly pinned down. Blind digging might cause the house to collapse again, endangering those trapped.

Some villagers nearby also spontaneously participated in the rescue, but everyone dared not act rashly and could only follow the firefighters' instructions.

When Zhou Ze walked over, Doctor Lin was calling out to the trapped people below, confirming their physical condition. Her hair tie was gone, and the wind was strong, blowing her hair around, yet she didn't look disheveled.

In such a chaotic post-disaster environment, these people in white coats were truly beautiful.

A short firefighter walked past Zhou Ze. The notebook in Zhou Ze's pocket suddenly trembled violently, a tremor no less intense than Doctor Lin's earlier!

Subconsciously, Zhou Ze reached out and grabbed the man's shoulder.

The firefighter stopped, somewhat surprised, and looked at Zhou Ze: "Is there something?"

"You... be careful."

Zhou Ze didn't know what to say, momentarily speechless. How could he say, "Don't go forward, you might die"?

But if he didn't go,

Who else would?

The young, short firefighter also paused,

He seemed to have never encountered such a situation, but a warmth flowed through his heart. He smiled and said,

"Understood."

Then, this firefighter went to the front and began to tie ropes around himself. Because the collapsed house was originally three stories high, the internal situation was complicated. After discussion, the fire brigade decided to send a short firefighter down first to explore and carry out rescue from inside.

Watching the firefighter tying ropes around himself, Zhou Ze, standing in the crowd, pursed his lips and kept looking up and down.

So conflicted,

So annoying.

If you hadn't walked past me, I wouldn't have known anything. Then, if you sacrificed, I could just feel sad for you and pay my respects.

But now, I can actually foresee that you're going to sacrifice.

Zhou Ze decided that after this incident, he had to find a way to turn off or not carry his notebook with him.

"Damn it!"

After cursing himself for being a fool,

Zhou Ze still pushed through the crowd and walked to the short firefighter, picking up a rope and tying it around himself.

The firefighters nearby were stunned. One asked, "Who are you? What are you doing? Don't hinder the rescue!"

Rescue work really needed professionals. Many people participated in rescue out of pure passion, which was truly touching, but such reckless amateur behavior could sometimes lead to themselves and the trapped individuals falling into even more dangerous situations.

Doctor Lin also saw Zhou Ze. She didn't know Zhou Ze had been following her car the whole time, and was a bit surprised.

"I used to be a special forces soldier, good with my hands. Let me go down."

Zhou Ze said calmly.

"Special forces?" The captain paused.

"Yeah, have you seen *Wolf Warrior*?" Zhou Ze asked in return.

"*Wolf Warrior*?"

The captain's face was full of black lines.

What the hell are you talking about?!

"You can ask her, she's my wife."

Zhou Ze pointed to Doctor Lin.

The captain looked at Doctor Lin, who suddenly wanted to laugh. What was this about?

But she knew Zhou Ze's identity and understood that if Zhou Ze was willing to participate in the rescue, he could indeed be much more capable than an ordinary person. At that moment, she also nodded and said,

"Yes, he's a retired special forces soldier."

With the doctor's assurance, the captain felt relieved. At this time, when help was needed, he was naturally very happy to accept the participation of someone with professional skills.

Immediately, the captain pointed to the short firefighter next to Zhou Ze and said,

"He Li, you go down with this warrior... no, this comrade."

"Yes, Captain."

"No, I can go down by myself. I find him in the way." Zhou Ze said lightly.

"I won't be in the way!"

He Li had already secured his safety rope and walked straight over. With the help of his comrades, he was lowered down through a small opening. Before going down, he glared fiercely at Zhou Ze.

Clearly, he was furious at being underestimated by Zhou Ze earlier.

Zhou Ze was truly helpless.

I'm rushing to make a selfless contribution, and I still can't stop your sacrifice?

In the future, whoever wants to be a behind-the-scenes hero can go. It's too frustrating.

Zhou Ze could only quickly tie his safety rope and go down with him. The space below was really cramped. Zhou Ze and the firefighter named He Li were about two meters apart, both looking for space to step and descend, trying to make contact with the trapped people below first.

"Wah wah..."

Not long after going down, Zhou Ze heard a baby crying below.

"Hey, hey!"

Zhou Ze called down.

"We're down here." Someone shouted from below.

"Don't move, we'll be down to rescue you soon, don't act rashly..." He Li also shouted.

"My leg is pinned, and my daughter-in-law and grandson are also there. You save them first, save them." It seemed to be an elderly person below.

"Don't worry, old man, we're already starting the rescue..."

"Clang..."

There was a sound of something being pushed open from below.

The old man below seemed to have heard his grandson crying and was pushing hard to remove what was on him, intending to check on his daughter-in-law and grandson first.

But this obviously illegally built three-story house was already in a precarious state. When he moved below, the entire structure was affected. Zhou Ze felt the concrete slab under his feet start to shake again.

"Old man, don't move, don't move! We're coming down right away, right away!"

But the movement continued below.

"Damn you, you old bastard, stop moving!"

Zhou Ze immediately cursed.

Sure enough, cursing was more effective. The old man below stopped moving immediately.

Zhou Ze used his fingernails to snap several obstructing steel bars, even prying open concrete seams, and quickly got down. Not far from him, a woman holding a child lay there. The woman's head was bleeding; she wasn't dead, but clearly somewhat disoriented.

"Give me the child first, the child!"

Zhou Ze yelled at the woman.

The woman's gaze cleared slightly, and she struggled to crawl over, passing the child through the partition to Zhou Ze. She knew that getting the rescue team to save the child early would get the child out of danger sooner.

Zhou Ze took the child and, across the steel bars, handed it to He Li, shouting to him, "You take the child up first!"

"You take the child up first!" He Li said.

"Get out, you go up first!"

Zhou Ze's attitude was firm. He wasn't sure if the trapped people below could be rescued, but if this firefighter continued to stay inside, there was a high probability he would truly perish.

Forced by Zhou Ze's attitude, He Li could only take the child and return the way he came.

Zhou Ze, meanwhile, continued to tear away obstructions with his fingernails, pulling the woman out. Then he untied his own safety rope, tied it around her, signaling for them to pull her up, while shouting:

"Has the child gone up?"

"The child's up, be careful down there!" Doctor Lin shouted from above, "The wind's picking up again, be careful."

Heh heh,

Although they were practically divorced, the sound of a wife caring for her husband was truly enjoyable.

Zhou Ze gave the woman a push from below, and she was finally slowly pulled up.

Alright, only one old man left.

Zhou Ze passed through and saw the old man sitting on the ground with a bitter expression. A wooden board was pressed against his leg, its ends firmly pinned by concrete slabs.

"Comrade, you go out first, I'm not in a hurry, this house is about to collapse."

Zhou Ze rolled his eyes at him,

Earlier, you almost caused us all to die by moving around down here,

And now you're starting to light up the lamp of your soul again?

"Don't talk. I'll lift the board, you try to get your leg out."

"Okay."

Zhou Ze used his fingernails to tear open the concrete slab's cracks. At this point, a sharp pain shot through his fingertips. Zhou Ze looked down and saw that all ten of his fingers were already bleeding.

Even though these fingernails were miraculous, they weren't electric drills. Constantly dealing with steel and concrete was taking its toll.

"Push hard!"

Zhou Ze supported the wooden board with both hands.

"My leg is out, it's out."

The old man shouted.

"Can you still move?"

"Yes, my leg isn't broken, I can move."

"Alright, follow this. You climb up first, grabbing that rope."

...

"You're injured, let me treat your wound."

A female nurse treated He Li's wound.

He Li had several scratches on his body from sharp objects when he was down below.

"I'm fine, I still need to go down and save people." He Li refused.

"Don't move. That woman is out too, there's only one person left down there. You don't need to go down. Your wound must be treated immediately, otherwise, what if it gets infected?"

The female nurse was firm.

He Li had no choice but to let her treat his wound.

At this moment,

The wind picked up again,

Much stronger than before. The tent rustled loudly, as if it could be blown away at any moment.

He Li suddenly saw the tree in front, which had been leaning due to the wind earlier, beginning to sway again. He immediately pushed away the female nurse who was treating his wound and rushed out.

The female nurse fell to the ground, annoyed, and said, "What are you doing!"

That tree couldn't fall, because the direction it was falling was towards the collapsed house. If that tree smashed down, the already precarious collapsed house would surely face a second collapse.

He Li had been down there and naturally knew that the situation below was unstable, and many areas were not balanced in terms of stress points.

"Creak..."

The big tree began to tilt and fall. It couldn't hold on.

Others around also noticed this, but they had no time to react and could only watch as the big tree slowly fell.

At this moment,

A short figure rushed out. He ran towards the direction the big tree was falling.

"Thud!"

The trunk of the big tree hit his shoulder. He immediately spat out a mouthful of blood and knelt down, his knees directly hitting the ground, which even caved in. But the big tree, due to his deceleration, did not directly smash into the ground.

The surrounding firefighters and villagers immediately rushed over, hugging the big tree, trying to move it away by all means possible.

The big tree was finally safely moved to the ground.

But the short figure kneeling on the ground,

Could no longer stand up.

The old man was pulled up,

Then,

Zhou Ze also came up.

Doctor Lin rushed over crying and hugged Zhou Ze. At this moment, Zhou Ze was covered in dust and ash, but Doctor Lin didn't mind at all.

Patting Doctor Lin's back, Zhou Ze indicated that he was fine.

Except for his fingernails,

It hurt so much.

"Whew..."

He let out a long sigh of relief.

Doctor Lin began to examine Zhou Ze's body, checking for any wounds that needed treatment.

Zhou Ze, meanwhile, pulled out a crushed cigarette from his pocket, lit it, and asked,

"Where's that short firefighter?"

He went up a long time ago, he should be fine, right? If he's fine, you should be fine too.

This broken notebook couldn't possibly be as mysterious as the omens in *Final Destination* movies, it's not that profound, after all, it's degraded.

Upon hearing this, Doctor Lin's body suddenly stiffened,

Zhou Ze slowly furrowed his brows and asked,

"Where's that firefighter?"

When Zhou Ze walked to the tent,

And saw the short body covered by a white sheet,

He subconsciously clutched the burning cigarette between his fingertips, then suddenly pulled Doctor Lin's hand, dragging her towards his car.

"What are you doing? What are you doing... you're hurting me."

"Come with me, let's leave here!"

"I still have work, I still need to save people." Doctor Lin retorted.

Zhou Ze's gaze swept over Doctor Lin,

Doctor Lin saw that Zhou Ze's eyes were bloodshot, which was terrifying.

At the same time,

Zhou Ze put one arm around Doctor Lin's head, resting her face on his chest. To outsiders, it looked like a young couple talking,

But Zhou Ze said:

"If you don't come with me,

I will kill you,

Right now."

title: 第一百五十章 當意外來敲門！
content:
In the Nissan, Zhou Ze sat in the driver's seat, and Doctor Lin sat in the front passenger seat.

Normally, a newlywed couple, full of youthful vigor, sitting in a car together would easily find themselves in a romantic situation. Under the spark of passion, even the car itself might shake a little to show respect.

But at this moment, here, the atmosphere was somewhat awkward.

Zhou Ze continued smoking, the image of the small firefighter constantly appearing in his mind.

He felt a little sad. Perhaps that firefighter still held resentment and hatred towards him at the end, because Zhou Ze had scoffed at him face to face. Yet, at the last moment, he had used his frail shoulders to support the large tree.

Otherwise, if that building had collapsed again, he and the old man would probably not have made it out.

Zhou Ze knew his own limits. His body was made of flesh and blood; even as a Ghost Messenger, in that environment, he would still die. If he had entered his zombie state, there might have been a sliver of hope, but at that moment, he was caught completely by surprise and had no time to enter that state.

So, in the final analysis, that firefighter had saved his life. He had intended to save the firefighter, but in the end, he was saved by him.

This feeling left Zhou Ze quite emotional, but it was also the firefighter's sacrifice that made him incredibly anxious about the prediction ability of that broken notebook.

Would Doctor Lin also be fated to die?

"When Yama calls for a man to die at the third watch, he dare not stay until the fifth."¹

Zhou Ze had already thrown the notebook into the car; he didn't plan to carry it with him anymore. Otherwise, if he walked down the street, seeing "this one will die soon," "that one might die," he would truly be more exhausted than even those super-heroes overflowing with compassion.

"Out of sight, out of mind." Birth, aging, sickness, and death are the norm for humans; you do as you please.

Doctor Lin bit her lip. She didn't know what to say. Zhou Ze's forceful demeanor made her a little uncomfortable, but at the same time, she understood that Zhou Ze wouldn't act this way unless something very serious was about to happen.

"Can you... explain clearly to me what's going on?" Doctor Lin asked, wanting an explanation.

Zhou Ze licked his lips and said, "I have an item that can predict a person's recent life and death. It predicted that you would die soon. Before, it predicted that firefighter would die. I tried to save him, but he still died in the end."

Upon hearing this, Doctor Lin's expression became solemn.

She didn't refute Zhou Ze or forcefully demand that he let her out, shouting that she had to die at her post, or that there were many injured people who needed her care, and so on.

She was very calm. After listening to Zhou Ze's explanation, she calmly accepted his course of action.

Zhou Ze was very satisfied with this point; it was also Doctor Lin's most attractive quality. She was truly gentle and understanding. When he was with her, she always made him feel at ease.

He reached out and took Doctor Lin's hand, feeling that her palm was a little cold. Zhou Ze smiled, "I'm with you, you'll be fine."

Doctor Lin nodded and continued to sit in the front passenger seat. However, she seemed to think of something and asked, "Will I affect you?"

Doctor Lin was worried that something unexpected might happen to Zhou Ze because he was trying to save her.

"We haven't divorced yet, after all."

Doctor Lin stopped talking and continued to sit quietly.

The rescue efforts quickly got on track. Although the wind was still strong, extreme weather like the previous tornado was no longer occurring. With rescue teams arriving from various places, the disaster relief work was proceeding in an orderly manner.

People from the hospital had inquired about Doctor Lin's situation, but Zhou Ze had put them off, saying his wife wasn't feeling well.

Given Zhou Ze's previous "wolf warrior"-like rescue performance, the hospital staff wouldn't say anything about Doctor Lin's absence. After all, he and his wife had already done enough.

There were some snacks and water in the car. Zhou Ze told Doctor Lin to eat something, while he took out his phone and called the little loli.

The call was quickly connected, and the little loli's dissatisfied voice came through: "I found the priest for you, but when are you coming back? What if he runs away? Do you know I almost got discovered several times while tracking him? He might already be alerted..."

"Shut up."

The little loli immediately fell silent.

"I have a Book of Yin and Yang in my hand. It's said to be something used by a Judge."

"You actually found that thing?" The little loli had guessed something when she saw Sun Qiu's ghost before, which was why she thought Zhou Ze would likely die there.

But what she hadn't expected was that Zhou Ze not only survived safely but also managed to get his hands on that item.

This matter was absolutely shocking. One must know that the Underworld had a strict hierarchy, and Ghost Messengers were the lowest rank in the Underworld's sequence.

It was somewhat like two gatekeepers in ancient times, and one day one of them pulled out the Imperial Seal to show off to the other.

"Can it predict life and death?" Zhou Ze asked.

"It can sense life and death," the little loli corrected.

"Is it 100% accurate?" Zhou Ze asked.

"I'm not sure about that, but its accuracy should be quite high. However, it can't be 100% accurate. Even the Books of Life and Death in the hands of the Ten Yama Kings can have problems, let alone one at the Judge's level. Moreover, if I'm not mistaken, the Book of Yin and Yang in your hand should have a problem, its quality has dropped?"

"Yes."

"Then it shouldn't be that accurate."

"Alright."

With that, Zhou Ze hung up the phone.

In the bookstore, the little loli angrily threw her phone onto the table!

What kind of person was this! He just hangs up after he's done talking? Does he only seek me out when he needs something, and kick me aside when he doesn't?

She had even wanted to remind him that since he went to another city, he should greet the local Ghost Messengers, otherwise it would be a provocation to them.

Besides, that area just had a natural disaster, and they were probably dizzy with busyness. If an outside Ghost Messenger came without giving a heads-up beforehand, it could easily cause misunderstandings.

Forget it. You handle it yourself. This old lady isn't serving you anymore.

...

"You eat some too." Doctor Lin handed Zhou Ze a piece of bread.

Zhou Ze took the bread, took a very difficult bite, and chewed it with extreme pain.

"Let's stay here for now," Zhou Ze said. "I'm also not comfortable driving home like this."

Doctor Lin nodded in agreement.

As dusk fell, Zhou Ze told Doctor Lin to sleep and rest for a while, while he stood outside the car.

The rescue team had already left this village and gone to help in other disaster areas. At present, this village was relatively quiet. Half of the houses, being of good quality, had not been blown down, and many villagers were staying there, while some had already gone to relatives.

Zhou Ze stretched. He had a premonition that if they could make it through tomorrow safely, this hurdle would be overcome.

When Zhou Ze looked into the car, Doctor Lin was on the phone, telling her younger sister to do her homework properly and not to be lazy watching TV.

Zhou Ze also thought that if the Ghost Messenger possessing his younger sister was still around, he could now have one more person to share the burden, as both sides were united in protecting Doctor Lin.

Unfortunately, some things could only be thought about. Zhou Ze did not regret killing that Ghost Messenger.

As night deepened, Zhou Ze returned to the car and turned on the interior light.

After finishing her call, Doctor Lin fell asleep. Zhou Ze kept his eyes open, observing his surroundings.

Honestly, if it were like "Final Destination," where various bizarre coincidences linked together to ensure your death, it would truly be impossible to resist. But he imagined it shouldn't be that terrifying.

Around midnight, Zhou Ze, feeling tired but unable to sleep because Bai Yingying wasn't by his side, suddenly heard the sound of tools striking.

It was very close, not far in front of where they were parked, at a two-story building that had also been collapsed by the tornado.

It was possible that villagers were trying to salvage their property from their collapsed homes. Zhou Ze didn't plan to meddle. At this time, he couldn't leave Doctor Lin alone here and go outside to ask if they needed help or anything.

Just then, Doctor Lin, who had slept for a while, woke up. She looked at Zhou Ze with some heartache and reached out to cover him with her clothes.

"I'm not cold," Zhou Ze said.

"Mm."

"What's wrong?" Zhou Ze asked.

"I want to... relieve myself."

"I'll go with you."

Zhou Ze looked around. "Just in the bushes behind the car, no one will see."

Doctor Lin was a little embarrassed but nodded nonetheless.

Then, Zhou Ze accompanied her out of the car.

Doctor Lin hesitated for a moment, then, without any shyness or asking Zhou Ze to turn away, right in front of him, she pulled down her pants and squatted.

In many horror movies, there's always this idiotic plot point where, even though they know it's dangerous nearby, if a girl in the group needs to pee, they foolishly ask their protector to turn away and not look.

"It's embarrassing, you know."

And then, an accident happens at that very moment.

Zhou Ze certainly wouldn't repeat such a brainless plot and setup. So, he stood perfectly straight, staring intently! Seriously looking! Carefully observing! Ensuring safety, safety first!

Soon, Doctor Lin stood up, her cheeks flushed, and walked back to the car with Zhou Ze.

"You get in first, I'll get some water from the trunk."

Doctor Lin obediently got into the car first and sat in the front passenger seat.

However, once she sat down, her body suddenly stiffened.

"What do you want to drink? Old Xu stored a lot of things here—drinks, mineral water, and milk." Zhou Ze called from behind.

Doctor Lin didn't answer, because she found that, at some point, someone had already sat in the driver's seat, and this person looked exactly like Zhou Ze. This person turned his head and smiled at her, softly saying:

"Quick, he's asking you, what do you want to drink?"

***

¹ A Chinese idiom meaning that when one's time has come, there's no delaying the inevitable.

title: 第一百五十一章 同行的侵犯
content:
The man in the driver's seat indeed looked identical to Zhou Ze, but Doctor Lin knew that the real Zhou Ze was in the trunk getting drinks.

Coupled with what Zhou Ze had told her earlier, she understood that danger could strike at any moment, and now, it already had.

The man held a notebook, one Zhou Ze had been holding earlier. He was toying with it, seemingly interested, but he didn't open it; he just kept flipping it over in his hands.

However, he looked at Doctor Lin much more often than at the notebook. Clearly, in his eyes, Doctor Lin was more important than the notebook.

"Heh."

The man chuckled softly, leaning back slightly.

Then, a wisp of green smoke drifted from his mouth, carrying a strong hallucinogenic effect. Doctor Lin tried to call out to Zhou Ze in the back, to warn him, but in an instant, she lost consciousness.

Everything happened too quickly, giving her no time for further thought or reaction. She was just an ordinary person, not some special forces agent or queen.

The man calmly straightened his clothes, opened the car door, and stepped out.

The moment he exited the car, he transformed into Doctor Lin, her clothes and demeanor perfectly identical, leaving no room for error.

Even the blush that hadn't completely faded from her cheeks was still there.

This showed that he was an absolute perfectionist, a person who meticulously focused on details.

Unlike the Faceless Woman, his transformations were a refined art, whereas the Faceless Woman's were simply crude applications of change.

He walked to the back and saw Zhou Ze, who had just closed the trunk and was holding drinks.

"What's wrong?" Zhou Ze asked.

"A little scared," he said, his voice as gentle as Doctor Lin's.

"I'm here, don't be afraid."

With that,

Zhou Ze put down the drinks and directly pulled him into a hug.

"..." he thought.

Simple,

Brutal,

Even he was somewhat caught off guard.

Feeling the warmth from another man, a flash of anger and disgust appeared in his eyes, but he didn't resist. Instead, in an instant,

He opened his mouth.

"Pfft!"

Before the green smoke could be exhaled,

A hand directly covered his lips, pressing down firmly.

Zhou Ze turned his face, looking at him with a half-smile.

He was a bit confused, but most importantly, the green smoke in his mouth couldn't be coughed out or swallowed, making him very uncomfortable.

"Bang!"

A knee heavily struck his abdomen. He opened his mouth, letting out a painful groan, and began to curl up on the ground.

He was somewhat puzzled and looked up at Zhou Ze.

"On the Road to the Underworld, there's a woman who always likes to cosplay others. Sorry, I've been trained by her, so you're out of luck. Now, whenever someone imitates someone close to me to approach me, I get a special premonition."

Having experienced "special training" from the Faceless Woman, Zhou Ze's sensitivity in that regard had been almost completely awakened, like an instinct.

Zhou Ze reached out and grabbed his neck. His body was somewhat weak, still in Doctor Lin's form. Dragging him, Zhou Ze walked to the car door and checked on Doctor Lin, finding that she was only asleep and unharmed.

Dragged like a dead dog by Zhou Ze, his body twitched slightly.

Zhou Ze let go, and he fell to the ground, smoke rising from all over his body, as if a leak had sprung in many otaku's girlfriends, and he began to shrivel.

In the distance,

A man and a woman approached. The man was very tall, about 1.9 meters, wearing military camouflage, revealing his muscular arms, looking very strong.

The woman was short, with a face full of freckles, chewing gum and blowing bubbles non-stop.

A wisp of green smoke slowly condensed behind the woman, forming the figure of a female ghost. The ghost wore a long green dress and stood behind the two, somewhat timid, seemingly anxious about being discovered and failing her mission.

However, she lowered her head and whispered something to the tall man and the woman.

The tall man rotated his neck, producing several crisp cracking sounds from his joints, then squeezed his fists without speaking, but this was still a form of intimidation.

The freckled woman, meanwhile, spat out the gum from her mouth and casually stuck it onto the muscular arm of the man beside her. She took a few steps forward, looked at Zhou Ze, and asked with a smile:

"Brother, you've crossed the line."

Were they local Ghost Messengers?

Zhou Ze wasn't entirely sure how Ghost Messengers from one area should interact with those from another, nor was he clear about the tacit understandings between Ghost Messengers. Of the two Ghost Messengers he knew:

One he had killed,

One he had captured.

It seemed Zhou Ze had always been so simple and brutal when dealing with his peers.

Little Loli had originally wanted to remind Zhou Ze that when he arrived in Yancheng, it would be best to greet the local Ghost Messengers, just as Monk Laitou had visited Zhou Ze when he came to Tongcheng.

Sometimes a greeting, a heads-up, could save a lot of trouble.

But at the time, Zhou Ze had directly hung up the phone, preventing Little Loli's reminder from being said. Perhaps, even if Little Loli had said it, Zhou Ze wouldn't have abandoned Doctor Lin to go "socialize" with his Yancheng counterparts.

Moreover, in Zhou Ze's view, the other party had made the first move. The previous stance clearly indicated they intended to use the female ghost to knock out both him and Doctor Lin.

"So what?"

Facing the other party's questioning, Zhou Ze retorted.

He was here to save someone, to save Doctor Lin. At the same time, he had also saved a family. He wasn't here to steal or be a bandit.

"Brother, your tone makes me mistakenly believe you are the Inspector General himself."

The freckled woman smiled slightly, then reached up, swept her hair aside, and said:

"Leave the woman in the car, and you can go. We won't pursue the matter of you crossing the line without a greeting."

Zhou Ze looked at her,

And said nothing.

At first, the freckled girl thought Zhou Ze was considering it,

But slowly,

The freckled girl realized Zhou Ze's gaze was like looking at an idiot.

Zhou Ze couldn't be blamed; he truly didn't know how to interact with his peers. He had no concept of these tacit understandings, so-called forbidden territories, and such.

Perhaps Zhou Ze's biggest concept of the Ghost Messenger group came from the one who returned severely injured from Rongcheng,

Who, in one night, killed dozens of Ghost Messengers, their Ghost Messenger IDs strewn across the ground like roadside cabbages, easy to pick up by the handful.

So, it's very possible that Zhou Ze had been led astray at that time.

He always felt that his peers were just small fry, like experience-giving mobs in an online game.

"We must keep this woman. She has something we want."

With that,

The freckled girl took a step forward,

As she strode,

A gust of陰風 (yin wind) swept over, carrying a thick, oily sensation.

Zhou Ze felt his body suddenly become much heavier, and the air around him instantly grew incredibly thin.

The tall man also walked over at this moment, approaching Zhou Ze.

Zhou Ze extended his fingernails,

But the other party was faster, directly seizing Zhou Ze's wrist, then flipping it over.

"Bang!"

Zhou Ze was thrown against the car door, which consequently dented inwards.

Little Loli had once given Zhou Ze immense terror,

But now Little Loli was under his control,

And now, that feeling of dread, of being dominated by a senior Ghost Messenger, seemed to return.

The tall man smiled at Zhou Ze, then reached out and clutched Zhou Ze's neck.

"You should have just stayed in your Tongcheng. Why run around, and bringing her too? You're bringing a car full of treasure to stroll in front of a bandit's den, deliberately looking for trouble, aren't you?"

"What's... wrong with her?"

Zhou Ze was very confused.

If the other party was after his notebook, that would be easy to understand, as it was the Judge's Yin-Yang Scroll, still a Yin-Yang Scroll even if its quality had fallen.

But the other party seemed to have the meaning of "buying the casket and returning the pearls," valuing Doctor Lin instead.

What was wrong with Doctor Lin?

"Someone who has been blessed by a Ghost Messenger at the cost of sacrificing their own merit, what do you think she signifies?"

The freckled girl looked at Zhou Ze,

"A rookie is a rookie, can't even see this, or perhaps you can see it, but you're just pretending not to, wanting to play some cliché 'human-ghost forbidden love' story?

You are a ghost, a dead person, not a person of the Yang realm. Too many ties with ordinary living people will harm her. This is my advice to you, kid."

The freckled girl took the chewing gum from the tall man's arm, put it back into her mouth to chew, then opened the car door and looked at Doctor Lin, who was unconscious inside.

"I'm very curious, that Ghost Messenger who willingly gave up so much just to bless her, should be of a higher rank than us, how could she be so generous?"

Zhou Ze understood that the Ghost Messenger the freckled girl spoke of was likely the one who had possessed his sister-in-law. Her kindness to Doctor Lin was natural.

It had even reached a point of obsession. Zhou Ze's current situation was also thanks to her.

Zhou Ze seemed to recall that when he killed her, her Ghost Messenger ID was already on the verge of collapsing and ultimately didn't remain. Did this mean that she had already overdrawn her power before, perhaps by dedicating it to the blessing the freckled girl mentioned?

"Don't touch her."

Zhou Ze said.

The tall man held Zhou Ze's neck and found it amusing that Zhou Ze was still warning and threatening him at this moment.

"Of course, we won't kill her. We only want the blessing on her. We are Ghost Messengers, enforcers of the Underworld; we definitely won't kill living people.

Don't worry, even though you're a rookie, you're still our colleague. We'll give you that much respect. At most, she'll get a severe illness and recover in a year or two, no problem."

The tall man reached out and patted Zhou Ze's face, praising him:

"You chose a really good skin. Much more handsome than me, this big brute. I'm actually a bit envious of you."

The freckled girl spat the re-warmed gum into her palm and then placed it on Doctor Lin's forehead.

"Hey, be careful. Don't suck out her soul. If you really kill her, you and I will have to take the blame together," the tall man reminded her.

"Don't worry, she's such a beautiful woman, I wouldn't bear to kill her."

Saying this,

The freckled girl even specifically glanced at the "rookie" beside her,

"After all, she's still the heroine of our colleague's forbidden human-ghost love story, you say..."

She suddenly froze,

Because she saw the rookie, whose neck was being clutched by her companion,

The malevolent aura on him,

Was getting stronger and stronger...

title: 第一百五十二章 裝逼！
content:
The tall man only felt a bone-chilling cold transmit from his palm. He subconsciously wanted to let go, because this coldness seemed to have stimulated his soul through his flesh, making him feel a terrifying tremor.

However,

his hand could not be retracted.

Before, he had been gripping Zhou Ze with his hand.

But now, Zhou Ze deliberately lowered his jaw, trapping the other's palm firmly against his neck.

The freckled girl stood up straight, looking at Zhou Ze. She was very wise and rational. The moment that inexplicable ominous aura rose from Zhou Ze, she began to scheme something.

She immediately smiled and said,

"Sir, if you are a police chief or patrol inspector in disguise, please reveal your identity directly. We will apologize as we should, and today's matter can be considered as if it never happened?"

Those who have died once are always smarter than the living and know better when to be pragmatic.

Just as the little loli, gravely injured, submitted to Zhou Ze, it was precisely because they had died that they deeply understood how precious this opportunity was to continue living in such a way.

Hell is truly a terrifying place.

If it were the old Zhou Ze, he might have taken the hint and backed down, but unfortunately, the current Zhou Ze had lost his sanity.

A bronze luster slowly began to rise on his skin, staining his entire body.

Two fangs slowly grew out, revealing a glaring, chilling sight.

A greenish face,

silent eyes,

carrying a natural coldness.

"Crack..."

"Ah!"

The tall man let out a cry of pain.

Zhou Ze's two fangs directly pierced his hand, and instantly, his entire body began to convulse. This single bite seemed to have almost entirely crippled his physical body.

The tall man kicked out, wanting to send Zhou Ze flying, at least to break free from him. However, his foot was directly caught by one of Zhou Ze's hands.

He wanted to kick, he wanted to exert force,

but his foot remained motionless.

This young man, whose face he could pat and call "pretty boy" just moments ago, seemed to possess terrifying strength within his body, completely dominating him.

Zhou Ze raised his head,

with a "whoosh,"

his fangs tore off a large chunk of flesh from the tall man's palm.

At the same time, Zhou Ze's fingernails turned a dark red, and the five fingers gripping the other's shoe began to exert force.

"Snap!"

A crisp sound,

like a small firecracker exploding during Chinese New Year.

The tall man's shoe burst open, along with his foot.

The tall man retreated with a look of terror, collapsing onto the ground.

Zhou Ze lowered his head slightly, leaning sideways, looking at him.

His gaze was as still as an ancient well.

A moment later, Zhou Ze raised his hand, looked at his palm with some disdain, then squatted down and wiped his hand on the other person's body.

What if there was athlete's foot?

What then?

It seemed some habits truly couldn't be changed,

for example,

cleanliness?

The tall man lay there on his back, not daring to move. The power dynamic had now completely reversed.

"Buddy, we can talk this out. You know, even a soul messenger only gets one chance to choose a body."

The freckled woman said to Zhou Ze.

Zhou Ze did not respond, as if the woman didn't exist at all.

His hand slowly moved to the man's chest, his fingertips gently pulling down from the neck.

His fingernails were like the sharpest scalpel.

A crisp sound of tearing flesh,

the tall man's chest was completely cut open, but he didn't even bleed. These fingernails were simply too sharp!

The tall man looked at the woman beside him, his gaze pleading for help.

The freckled woman could no longer remain calm. She spread her palm, and the surrounding air once again solidified. Immense pressure began to bear down on Zhou Ze.

"Roar!"

Zhou Ze let out a suppressed roar from his throat. The black mist on his body instantly boiled, and even the air seemed to be tainted with an agonizing heat.

The freckled woman staggered, took two steps back, and sat on the ground.

Her gaze at Zhou Ze held a heartfelt terror.

Damn it,

was this still a soul messenger?!

How could this possibly still be a soul messenger?!

The freckled girl felt at this moment as if a traitor had emerged among them.

People used to say that there was a husky in a wolf pack. Now it was the other way around; a real prairie wolf had infiltrated a group of huskies.

Zhou Ze squatted beside the tall man. Wisps of black smoke continuously emanated, and if one looked closely, they could see that the tall man's limbs were completely bound by the black smoke, rendering him unable to move.

Zhou Ze was a doctor,

so he was very experienced in performing surgery.

He meticulously examined the tall man's pathology,

liver,

lungs,

intestines,

taking them out one by one,

dangling them in front of the tall man,

and then,

tossing them aside.

At this point, it would have been even better if there were a few medical students present to take photos and notes, and incidentally, offer "66666" as flattery to the teacher.

Heaven help him, the tall man was utterly stunned, but he couldn't pass out. He was even numb to the point of not feeling any pain, which was the most excruciating torture—to make you watch with your own eyes!

Zhou Ze continued to do as he pleased, like a boy who had discovered a fascinating new toy.

It had been so long since he had played this kind of human body research game.

He was a little nostalgic.

Mm,

that was the feeling.

The human body was truly the most marvelous existence in the world.

Its harmony,

its beauty,

the structure of every single blood vessel, all so ingenious, coming together to form the framework of life, bearing the weight of the soul.

"He's a soul messenger, you can't kill him! Aren't you afraid of punishment from the Underworld?"

The freckled woman, slumped on the ground, shrieked.

She was going crazy.

She was truly going crazy.

The scene before her,

the atmosphere before her,

was even more horrifying than a Shura field in hell!

"We didn't mean to kill her! We told you, we didn't mean to kill her! We were wrong, but not to the point of death! We didn't want to make mortal enemies with you, really! We didn't want to kill anyone, nor did we want to kill you. You were the one who crossed the line, you crossed the line without warning, so you're also at fault, you're also at fault!"

The freckled girl continued to shout.

Zhou Ze turned a deaf ear, continuing with his task. A moment later, he clapped his hands, his examination finished.

Then,

he lowered his head,

opened his mouth,

and began to inhale.

"Hiss..."

Like a bowl of water poured into a boiling oil pot, it instantly exploded.

The tall man's black soul was pulled out and vanished into Zhou Ze's mouth.

His corpse began to rapidly decompose, turning into a putrid liquid.

Zhou Ze raised his head,

closed his eyes,

the taste of a soul,

truly delicious.

Slowly, Zhou Ze stood up and walked to the freckled girl.

The freckled girl instinctively scrambled backward. She was scared, truly scared. Even in front of the Patrol Inspector, she had never felt such clear fear!

Zhou Ze tilted his head, slowly moving forward, but still faster than her crawling.

Slowly,

Zhou Ze caught up to her speed,

slowly,

Zhou Ze reached her side,

slowly,

Zhou Ze lifted his foot,

slowly,

Zhou Ze brought his foot down, stepping on her abdomen.

Everything was slow, like a melodious piano piece, with its unique rhythm.

"Pfft..."

One kick,

piercing through,

like a nail,

pinning the woman down directly.

Blood foam continuously bubbled from the woman's mouth, and her body trembled and contorted incessantly.

I said so much,

analyzed so much with you,

explained so many principles,

told you so many consequences,

you still want to kill me, then kill me,

but can you, from beginning to end,

not say a single word?

This was the freckled woman's biggest grievance at the moment. It seemed that in the other's eyes, the two of them were ants not even worthy of dialogue.

Zhou Ze had already landed the first kick.

He let out a burp,

looking somewhat helpless,

it was truly conflicted to face delicious food when already full.

Then,

he raised his foot again,

still slowly raising it,

still slowly bringing it down,

"Bang!"

Her head exploded,

solving the woman's problem with freckles.

Along with the woman's soul, which was pulverized by the surrounding black mist, her corpse quickly decomposed, merging with the ground.

Then,

Zhou Ze seemed somewhat bewildered.

He stood in place,

apparently contemplating something.

It seemed that having swallowed a soul messenger's soul once before, and then again now,

this time,

his existence lasted a bit longer than the previous two times.

But a longer duration also brought more trouble.

For example:

Who am I?

Where am I?

Where am I going?

He was indeed pondering these questions. After much thought, he turned his head and saw Dr. Lin sitting in the car.

He walked over, leaned in,

lowered his head,

and rubbed his fangs against Dr. Lin's delicate face.

Some drool also dripped, landing on Dr. Lin's forehead, and then flowing down, covering her entire face, making Dr. Lin's face somewhat blurry.

He seemed to enjoy this feeling, to be very infatuated with it.

Then,

his gaze fell upon the notebook that had been left on the driver's seat, not taken by the female ghost in green.

He reached out and picked up the notebook.

As the notebook neared Dr. Lin, it began to tremble violently, signifying that she would soon die.

This was the warning from the Yin-Yang Record. It was said that the Book of Life and Death in Yama's hands recorded everyone's time of birth and death, possessing supreme rules.

The Yin-Yang Record, derived from the Book of Life and Death, also possessed similar functions.

The notebook trembled violently, continuously warning its owner,

this woman,

is about to die!

Zhou Ze looked at the notebook with some bewilderment, as if looking at a strange new toy.

However,

it was clear that this toy was not much fun; the vibrating sensation annoyed him even more.

"Roar!"

Holding the notebook in front of him,

Zhou Ze let out an angry roar at it.

Then,

then,

then,

it really did quiet down.

It stopped shaking...

title: 第一百五十三章 善良的老人
content:
It was morning, and the sun had finally come out. It was a beautiful day with a gentle breeze, a stark contrast to yesterday's windy, rainy, and tornado-ridden chaos.

Dr. Lin squinted, finally waking up from her comatose state of last night.

Upon waking, she noticed her face felt dry, as if something was clinging to it, even sticking to her eyes. She gently wiped her face with her hand, opened her eyes, and saw white streaks on her palm.

Pulling down the rearview mirror, she saw her face was covered in these white stains, with a strong odor.

Though Dr. Lin was inexperienced, she was a doctor, and information was readily available in this era. It was no longer the ancient times when mothers showed erotic paintings to their daughters before marriage to impart knowledge.

These marks on her face…

...seemed to be... semen stains.

Instinctively opening the car door, Dr. Lin felt a surge of panic. The bizarre events of last night still left her with a lingering fear. Then, she saw Zhou Ze, covered in blood, sitting on the ground leaning against the car door.

Zhou Ze was truly miserable, his entire body seemed to have no good skin, like a prisoner who had just been tortured and thrown out to fend for himself.

"Ah Ze, Ah Ze!"

Dr. Lin immediately knelt down, calling Zhou Ze's name. She was terrified something might have happened to him.

This time, the coma duration was much shorter than before, as if his body was slowly getting used to it. Perhaps it was also due to devouring a few souls of the Underworld Messengers, which had nourished and strengthened some parts of him.

In any case, after only half a night in a coma, Zhou Ze actually opened his eyes at Dr. Lin's calls.

His eyes met Dr. Lin's face, and Zhou Ze gasped, complaining with difficulty:

"Still putting on a face mask this early in the morning."

Dr. Lin was both exasperated and amused, but Zhou Ze, in his current state, couldn't be hit nor could she bear to scold him. She could only pull out a wet wipe from the car and clean her face.

As she wiped, she also tried to discern if it was indeed semen. It seemed not to be.

"I'll call for an ambulance," Dr. Lin said.

"Don't..."

Zhou Ze weakly shook his head,

"Call the bookstore... let Old Daoist bring... bring his monkey... here."

Dr. Lin hesitated, suppressing her professional instinct to call 120, and chose to follow Zhou Ze's instructions. She used Zhou Ze's phone to call the bookstore.

Old Daoist answered the phone. He immediately understood that his boss must have gone on a rampage again.

Without further ado, he said he would set off immediately with the monkey.

"Where are we going now?" Dr. Lin asked Zhou Ze.

"Let's just find a place to settle down first," Zhou Ze said. "Help me into the car. You drive and find a small motel. Oh, right, check the bushes over there, see if there's anything like a driver's license, and pick it up for me."

Dr. Lin immediately went to search the bushes ahead. It was actually quite easy to find. There were two spots in the bushes with obvious oil stains, as if pork lard had been splashed on them in the middle of the night.

Of course, Dr. Lin couldn't possibly discern that it was actually corpse oil.

"Is this it?"

Dr. Lin found two small notebooks and handed them to Zhou Ze.

Both Underworld Messenger certificates were yellowed but not damaged, meaning they were still usable.

"This is it."

Zhou Ze motioned for Dr. Lin to put these two things away, then, with her help, he got into the car.

There was almost no large, intact, uninjured part on his body, but fortunately, Zhou Ze was used to it by now, and with Dr. Lin sitting beside him, he wasn't screaming in pain.

However, because of the recent tornado, many residents whose homes were damaged or collapsed chose to temporarily stay in motels. Consequently, all motels, large or small, from this village to the small county town, were basically full.

Dr. Lin drove to the end of the county town and got out to inquire at a small motel.

Zhou Ze, meanwhile, slumped in the passenger seat,

Looking out the car window,

At the sky.

At that moment, an old man carrying a vegetable basket walked past the car door.

The old man was truly ancient, with a full head of white hair and a goatee. His figure was stooped, but he still walked with a sturdy gait.

Most importantly, as the old man walked past Zhou Ze, Zhou Ze clearly felt his gaze being pricked.

The old man stopped, looked at Zhou Ze in the car, a bit puzzled. He knocked on the glass and asked:

"Young man, were you affected by the disaster?"

Meaning, was he injured in the tornado?

Zhou Ze nodded.

"Why aren't you going to the hospital?" the old man asked curiously.

"Poor."

"..." the old man.

After a moment of hesitation, the old man reached in, examined Zhou Ze's injuries, and said, "These superficial wounds are really evenly distributed, all over your body."

"Hm."

At this moment, Dr. Lin returned. She glanced at the old man standing by the car window and said to Zhou Ze:

"Still no rooms."

"Where would there be rooms now?" The old man shook his head and said, "Never mind, come stay at my house. My courtyard is large."

Dr. Lin looked at Zhou Ze, asking for his opinion.

Zhou Ze nodded. He actually didn't know why the old man suddenly decided to help him. After all, in this day and age, if you didn't have tens of millions in wealth, you wouldn't dare casually help people on the street.

The old man's house was indeed very large, built in a courtyard style. As Zhou Ze got out of the car, the old man helped Dr. Lin assist Zhou Ze into a room.

He was quite strong.

After lying down in the room, the old man said he would go prepare some Chinese medicine for Zhou Ze and then left.

Dr. Lin sat by Zhou Ze's side. She was also a bit incredulous that they could meet such a warm-hearted person on the road who even took them back to his home.

"There are still many good people in this world," Dr. Lin sighed.

Zhou Ze, meanwhile, looked at the photo frame hanging on the wall beside the bed. It contained many medals and certificates, as well as some group photos. If he wasn't mistaken, the old man must have been a soldier before.

"Are you hungry?" Dr. Lin asked.

"Not really," Zhou Ze shook his head.

"Girl, can you cook?"

The old man walked in, holding a jar of ointment.

"Yes, I can," Dr. Lin replied.

"Then you go cook. I'll apply some ointment to him. It's very effective for external wounds."

Dr. Lin glanced at Zhou Ze again. Evidently, she was still a bit uneasy leaving Zhou Ze alone in the room.

Zhou Ze nodded at her, signaling her to go.

The old man sat by Zhou Ze's bed, patted the bedspread, and said, "Isn't it shameful or ill-mannered?"

Zhou Ze shook his head.

"Then take off your clothes. Never mind, I'll help you."

The old man reached out and helped Zhou Ze take off his shirt. Looking at the dense, numerous injuries on Zhou Ze's body, he smacked his lips and said:

"Tsk, tsk, injuries like yours were rare even on the battlefield."

"Sir, you used to be a soldier?" Zhou Ze asked.

"I was. When we fought the Japanese devils, I was still young and only knew how to use a red-tasselled spear. When we fought Chiang Kai-shek, I formally enlisted, and then I went to Korea, and also to Southern Tibet.

I was lucky; I didn't die and wasn't badly injured."

"You're blessed with great fortune."

"The King of Hell won't take me, what can I do? You tell me, I still get such a large stipend every month, and I can't contribute anything to the country. It would be better if the King of Hell sent an Underworld Messenger or something to take me away."

"..." Zhou Ze.

"Alright, it's applied. Your physique, though it looks delicate, feels quite robust to the touch. You have a good foundation, are you a martial artist?"

"Sort of," Zhou Ze said evasively.

"Do you know why I brought you into my home?" the old man asked.

Zhou Ze shook his head.

"You're pleasing to the eye."

"That's a good reason."

"When a person lives to my age, they can do whatever they please. I don't want to worry or consider so many things."

Dinner was prepared by Dr. Lin, but Zhou Ze didn't eat much.

After dinner, the old man invited Zhou Ze to play chess, while Dr. Lin went to the old man's inner room, a collection room, to look at antiques.

Zhou Ze lay on the bed, facing the chessboard. The old man made a move, Zhou Ze said a move, and the old man placed the piece for Zhou Ze.

Zhou Ze's chess skills weren't great, but the old man deliberately let him have a rook, which he never moved, allowing for a back-and-forth game.

As they played, it got dark. Zhou Ze received a call from Bai Yingying.

She said that Old Daoist encountered traffic police on the way. His car and he were impounded because of unlicensed driving. The monkey had no choice but to hide in the nearby bushes, not daring to let the police see it, otherwise the charge of privately raising a nationally protected animal would add to Old Daoist's crimes.

This caught Zhou Ze off guard. He had thought Old Daoist would come with the monkey sooner so he could recover better. He didn't expect Old Daoist to run into trouble himself. It seemed not only did he not have a driver's license, but Old Daoist had also been driving without one all this time.

"What's wrong?" the old man asked after Zhou Ze hung up.

"My friend who was coming to pick me up ran into some trouble on the way. They probably can't make it tonight."

"If they can't come, just stay here. You're pleasing to my eye."

"..." Zhou Ze.

After the chess game, the old man yawned, looking ready for bed. He waved at Zhou Ze, put away the chessboard, and said he was going to his room to sleep.

After the old man left, Dr. Lin came in.

However, her expression was grave.

"What's wrong?"

Zhou Ze asked.

"Ah Ze, this old man is a bit strange."

"What's so strange? Didn't you say he was very kind before?" Zhou Ze asked.

"It just makes me a bit uncomfortable. Also, this courtyard house is a bit peculiar."

"It's alright, I'm here," Zhou Ze comforted her.

Dr. Lin nodded, feeling a little more at ease.

Who knew Zhou Ze hadn't finished speaking, and continued:

"I'm here, but you know my current condition. If something happens, you have to remember to carry me and run. Don't leave me behind."

"..." Dr. Lin.

"I'll go get some hot water to wipe your body."

Dr. Lin got up and left. When she returned from the kitchen with hot water, she happened to see that the room next to Zhou Ze's, which was the old man's room, seemed to be lit.

As she got closer, she heard the sounds of drinking and finger-guessing games, and the old man's voice was among them, a cacophony of human voices.

"Old Li, you have guests tonight?"

"Yes, a girl and a boy."

"That girl is really pretty, like a landlord's daughter."

"You were secretly looking at her?"

"Looking doesn't cost a piece of flesh, so what?"

"That boy is even better looking," a voice suddenly said.

"You rascal, I've always thought there was something off about you. So you really don't like women, you prefer that kind."

"Like him? I don't dare to like him. It depends on whether he likes us or not."

"What do you mean?"

"If he doesn't like us, then we won't be able to drink or eat meat or live like this anymore."

title: 第一百五十四章 大夢誰先覺！
content:
Doctor Lin quickly entered Zhou Ze's room. This time, she was certain there was something wrong with this courtyard. Before, there were only three people in the courtyard: herself, Zhou Ze, and that old man. Now, suddenly, the old man's room next door had a large group of people having a lively time drinking and chatting at night. How was that possible?

Moreover, what they were saying clearly had a hidden meaning.

"Ah Ze, there's something wrong with this courtyard. We should leave."

Zhou Ze put down his phone and yawned. Honestly, he was indeed tired, but he couldn't sleep without Yingying beside him. The most painful thing was needing sleep both physically and mentally but being unable to fall asleep.

"The room next door, I just heard a lot of people talking."

Doctor Lin continued.

"It's fine, it's fine."

Zhou Ze waved his hand,

"You were startled yesterday. Just rest for a few more days and you'll be fine."

Actually, after close contact with ghosts, living people inevitably get affected, similar to being infected with a similar magnetic field. Then they can see and hear things that are normally invisible. After a while, when the magnetic field dissipates, they'll be back to normal.

Ox tears have a similar effect.

Doctor Lin picked up a towel and began wiping Zhou Ze's body. Zhou Ze seemed to enjoy it, though from her technique, Doctor Lin's serving skills were indeed not as good as Yingying's.

After wiping him clean, Doctor Lin put down the towel, bit her lip, and said:

"I didn't mishear. If you know what's going on and want me not to overthink it, I can try not to."

Zhou Ze nodded.

Doctor Lin said no more, took off her coat, and lay down on the bed, but on her side, arm propped under her head.

From Zhou Ze's perspective, he could only see her back, a slender yet curvaceous figure, very enticing.

Actually, women like this, with a bit of flesh, are indeed more attractive.

Zhou Ze continued to scroll on his phone. Since he couldn't sleep and was bored, he could only blame that unreliable Daoist priest. If the Daoist priest were here now, with Monkey's help, his injuries would heal much faster.

The old man's ointment was indeed effective. The wound still felt cool, but it was still far from Monkey's mud.

Doctor Lin's breathing gradually became steady. He didn't know if she was asleep or not.

But slowly, the sounds from next door grew louder: the sounds of drinking games, bragging, and even a man singing Huangmei Opera in a falsetto voice.

It felt like someone had placed ten televisions next door, all playing different programs.

Zhou Ze saw Doctor Lin's body stiffen on one side, and one hand instinctively covered her ears.

She wasn't asleep.

And trying to sleep while living next door to a group of "those things" was indeed too difficult for her.

Zhou Ze tapped the wooden bed frame with the corner of his phone and rebuked:

"At this late hour, show some class! Don't disturb others' rest."

After Zhou Ze shouted, the other side immediately quieted down, becoming silent as a tomb.

Zhou Ze continued to play with his phone.

He didn't know how long he played, but his phone was connected to the charging cable, so he wasn't worried about it running out of power. It was past 2 AM.

Zhou Ze couldn't hold it in anymore.

He had actually been thinking about it all day.

He had held it in until now.

He looked at Doctor Lin, who was still lying on her side beside him, reached out to support himself on the edge of the bed, and tried to get up. However, his injuries were indeed quite severe, and Zhou Ze couldn't lift himself, falling back with a "creak."

Doctor Lin turned over and looked at Zhou Ze, asking directly:

"Need to use the restroom?"

Zhou Ze nodded.

Doctor Lin helped Zhou Ze out of bed, and they walked out of the room together.

There were no toilets in the rooms of the Siheyuan. There was a toilet in the diagonal corner, a separate small room, a rural squat toilet, with a wooden frame above for people to sit on, and a pit or a large jar below.

Actually, this old man didn't seem to be short on money. His monthly allowance was probably quite substantial. Moreover, Doctor Lin had been invited to visit the old man's collection room, which contained many excellent artifacts. Selling one or two of them could easily buy a house.

Zhou Ze leaned one hand against the wall and was about to unbuckle his belt with the other when Doctor Lin directly reached out and unbuckled it for him.

This surprised Zhou Ze. At this moment, Doctor Lin truly acted like a wife tending to her sick husband; everything was so natural, without the slightest pretense.

Zhou Ze let her do as she pleased, slowly closing his eyes, waiting for his "water pipe" to be taken out by a pair of soft hands, and then he just needed to open the valve and let the water flow. After he finished, his "water pipe" would probably be held and shaken dry.

However,

Just then,

A very unfriendly voice came.

"Need help?"

It was the old man's voice.

The old man had gotten up in the middle of the night to use the restroom.

Doctor Lin, who was just squatting down to unbuckle Zhou Ze's belt, looked up at Zhou Ze upon hearing the voice.

Zhou Ze really wanted to shout "continue" "don't stop,"

But he gritted his teeth and pretended to be calm, saying, "Let him come."

Doctor Lin looked at Zhou Ze with some concern.

"He can't possibly push me into the latrine pit, can he?" Zhou Ze smiled. "I know what I'm doing."

Doctor Lin nodded and walked out of the restroom. The old man walked in.

"What a coincidence. When you get old, you don't sleep soundly at night, always getting up to pee. That thing also has problems; it's not like you young people. Always frequent urination, urgency, and incomplete voiding."

With the old man's help, Zhou Ze finished urinating. The old man supported Zhou Ze with his arm, his back to Zhou Ze, which allowed Zhou Ze to free his hands to turn on the tap, thus avoiding embarrassment.

The old man helped Zhou Ze walk out of the restroom, and Doctor Lin was waiting outside to take over.

Zhou Ze shook his head, "You go back and rest first. I'll go chat with the old man in his room."

The old man was stunned for a moment when he heard this, but he still nodded and said, "Alright."

This old man was similar to the old Daoist priest, switching between different regional dialects. The old Daoist priest had traveled widely across the country when he was young, and the old man was probably similar, having followed the army to fight since he was very young, so his accent naturally became mixed.

Entering the old man's room, the room was a bit small because a large black curtain divided it into two halves.

Zhou Ze only saw the old man's bed and a small tea table. There was only room for these things here.

The old man settled Zhou Ze on the bed and made him a pot of herbal tea.

"Lift the curtain, let me see," Zhou Ze said.

"Nothing to see. It's not suitable to look at these things at night."

"I want to see it," Zhou Ze insisted.

"Alright, if you want to see it, I'll show you. Actually, there's nothing shameful about it."

The old man also seemed to be in high spirits. He stood up, walked to the side of the black curtain, and then vigorously pulled it open.

This action was somewhat like a flag bearer at Tiananmen Square unfurling the national flag during the flag-raising ceremony.

The curtain was pulled back,

Revealing a six-tiered platform, with each tier progressively higher. And on the platform were densely packed spirit tablets.

Below the platform was a table with offerings such as aged yellow wine, cured meat, and two incense sticks burning there.

"How lively,"

Zhou Ze said.

The old man was excited, rubbing his hands excitedly, and said, "I don't know why, but I just like the look of you, kid."

You've said that many times today.

"I just wanted you to come to my house and stay."

The old man picked up the yellow wine from the offering table, took a sip, smacked his lips, and his spirits grew even higher. He pointed to the tablets on the shelf and said:

"Come, let me introduce them to you.

This is our Company Commander Chen. I was young then, only knew to call him Company Commander Chen with everyone else, didn't know his full name.
