He sacrificed himself in '45, hit by an enemy mountain cannon, his body wasn't even fully recovered. What a pity, the Japanese surrendered that year, and he didn't live to see it.

These are Wang Gouzi, Zhao Sanquan, Wu Wazi, also from my squad. They sacrificed themselves during the push into the Dabie Mountains. Our regiment was responsible for rear-guard action.

These are Zhou Zhou, Sun Decai, Qin Liangyou, who sacrificed themselves in the Huai'an Campaign. That battle, tsk tsk, was fierce.

These are Zhao Peng, Sun Zhigang, Zhai Dazhuang, Ge Shufeng... They sacrificed themselves in Korea. Do you know about the American gasoline bombs? When I went to find them, they were all roasted. Damn it, even now I remember the smell of roasted human flesh. It made me not dare to eat meat for ten years afterward. Of course, it wasn't easy to get meat back then either.

This is Zhu Houquan, this is..."

The old man rattled off many names, including where these people sacrificed themselves, and whether they were in his squad or company at the time. He spoke in great detail, meaning he had kept the information of these deceased comrades firmly in his heart and had never forgotten it.

And Zhou Ze sat by the bed,

Constantly nodding,

A little awkward, as he was injured and couldn't get up.

Actually, Zhou Ze had figured it out: the old man couldn't see. He couldn't see that the room was actually densely packed with people.

Everyone was either sitting on the floor, leaning against the wall, or sitting by the table with the offerings, some picking their ears, some reading a book, some dozing off.

Whenever the old man introduced someone's name,

That person would look up, glance at Zhou Ze, and smile kindly, as if to acknowledge and meet him.

Zhou Ze returned the smile and nodded.

The old man finished his introductions, his voice seemingly a bit hoarse. He picked up the yellow wine from the table and took another sip.

"Great, how about it, young man, were you scared?

I'm telling you, with our lineup, even a ghost official wouldn't dare enter this door!"

"..." Zhou Ze.

The old man let out a long sigh and lamented, "Young man, I truly like the look of you!"

"..." Zhou Ze.

"Don't laugh at me, but as I said earlier today, I was never a coward in battle back then. I always charged to the front, but damn it, I just couldn't die. It was always my comrades falling around me. Sometimes, after a battle, I'd be the only one left in the whole squad.

I don't understand why I never died and have lived until now, and quite well too. Just dabbling in antiques or whatever, and the money comes in."

"A life of wealth."

Zhou Ze said.

This was truly a life of wealth. If the old man hadn't joined the army and had instead gone into business or something else, he surely would have risen to success and prosperity.

"Hehe, to hell with a life of wealth. I've realized it. My comrades sacrificed themselves one by one, but I didn't die. Heaven wants me to live, to make a home for them, so that after they sacrifice themselves, they can still have a place to gather.

In the past, we couldn't afford wine or meat. Now that times are better, we can eat meat, drink wine, and snore while sleeping without worrying about marching the next day. My purpose in living is precisely this."

Zhou Ze looked at the old man and said nothing.

Zhou Ze also looked at the room full of people. To be honest, this was the first time Boss Zhou hadn't looked at these ghosts with a performance-oriented mindset.

"Don't laugh at me, but in recent years, as I've gotten older, I don't sleep as soundly. So every night before bed, I have a bit of yellow wine.

Heh,

It really works.

Every night after I fall asleep,

I dream of my old comrades. We all sit around a table, drinking, eating meat, and chatting up a storm.

It's such a joy,

It's as if they all really live in my house!"

title: 第一百五十五章 有鬼啊！
content:
Zhou Ze didn't say anything until he finally walked out of the old man's room. He just silently admired in his heart that the old man was indeed born with a blessed life. Living with dozens of亡魂 (dead souls), he was completely unaffected and even his luck remained good.

This kind of fate was enviable.

Zhou Ze also didn't ask if those military souls were willing to go to hell. Perhaps their obsession was simply because the old man was still alive, and the old man was willing to offer sacrifices to them. Coupled with their past camaraderie, they were able to gather at the old man's house, drinking and chatting every night as the old man fell asleep.

It was a leisurely and peaceful life, and it didn't affect anyone around them. As a ghost messenger, he could completely let them be.

It was estimated that when the old man reached the end of his life, his soul would truly join the ranks of his comrades. Then they would all go to hell together, and the journey on the Yellow Springs Road wouldn't be lonely.

It was like fighting battles, traveling north and south in the past; as long as they were together, they wouldn't feel fear. It was all the same path, just follow the red flag.

If Zhou Ze forcibly took away these military souls, the old man would be greatly affected, almost completely disrupting the old man's original rhythm of life. Zhou Ze was genuinely worried that the old man might suffer some accident as a result.

No matter what, the old man had sincerely helped him. It would be a bit unreasonable for him to harm the old man in return.

However, because of Zhou Ze's interruption, tonight's gathering in the old man's house ended quickly, and there was no more sound from the next room.

Perhaps those military souls knew in their hearts that whether they could continue to stay here was entirely up to Zhou Ze's whim.

After returning to the room, Dr. Lin helped Zhou Ze lie back on the bed. She was still lying on her side, looking at Zhou Ze. There had been a few twists and turns tonight. Zhou Ze couldn't sleep to begin with, and Dr. Lin hadn't slept very soundly either.

He reached out and gently caressed her hair in his hand. Zhou Ze enjoyed this feeling very much.

It had nothing to do with kinship, nothing to do with love, nothing to do with responsibility. Any normal male would feel happy with a beautiful woman lying next to him, even if he couldn't do anything.

"The experiences of the past two days have been very rich," Dr. Lin said.

Zhou Ze nodded. For an ordinary person, it was already difficult to accept that her husband had been brought back to life through borrowed corpse. At the same time, she had also experienced a series of supernatural events. It was a good thing Dr. Lin was very strong.

"Will I always see those things?" Dr. Lin asked.

"No, it'll be fine in a couple of days. When we go back, you should take some time off and rest well."

Dr. Lin nodded; she was always very obedient.

"Are you doing well recently?"

"Very good," Zhou Ze replied.

"That's good."

Dr. Lin snuggled up to Zhou Ze and slowly closed her eyes, seemingly falling asleep again.

Zhou Ze still couldn't sleep. He simply took out the two ghost messenger badges. The centers of both badges had turned white and had obvious creases, meaning they could only endure one more "owner recognition" at most.

Two badges meant two official positions in hand. In the human world, people who could get official positions could walk with their noses in the air. In the underworld, these two items were even more sought after.

However, Zhou Ze hadn't thought about how to use them. He had originally thought of finding two of those dozens of military souls to inherit them, but then it seemed impossible.

It wasn't that Zhou Ze had some kind of psychological潔癖 (purity obsession), but purely because the conditions for inheriting a ghost messenger badge were truly strict: it had to be a soul with a physical body.

Ordinary souls, even if they could possess a body, were not truly "borrowing a corpse to return a soul" and did not meet the requirements.

Those who could truly inherit this could only be him, Tang Shi, and Liang Chuan—these "hell stowaways." The purpose of this badge was not to give you magical power or strength. In fact, it was only a symbolic function.

It could add luster, whitewash your gray identity, nothing more.

It was like bandits in ancient times, after their power grew, accepting the imperial court's amnesty to gain official positions. Ordinary commoner farmers didn't have this kind of treatment.

Therefore, these two badges were actually quite useless—"食之無味棄之可惜" (tasteless to eat, a pity to discard).

To find other "hell stowaways" was incredibly difficult. Tang Shi once said that she searched in the human world for half a year before finding Liang Chuan, and then later found Zhou Ze himself.

Now, all told, there were only three people.

Zhou Ze's fingertips rubbed against the ghost messenger badge. Suddenly, Zhou Ze discovered that under the stimulation of his fingernail, the badge actually emitted a blue smoke.

The smoke had a pleasant, refreshing scent.

Then Zhou Ze saw that the badge seemed to be more damaged than before, so he stopped this action immediately.

This was indeed too luxurious, more luxurious than smoking the highest-grade cigars.

He put down the badge booklet and took out his phone, planning to get through tonight. Tomorrow, he would have Dr. Lin drive him back to the bookstore in Tongcheng. Xu Qinglang and the others should be working on the old Taoist's matter, which would probably require burning a large sum of paper money.

Fortunately, whether the old Taoist returned or not wasn't a big deal.

The key was to find that monkey.

But soon, Zhou Ze heard "faint, rustling" movements from the courtyard wall, as if something was climbing over it.

The sound grew louder, and it seemed there were quite a few things climbing the wall. Gradually, the noise also woke up Dr. Lin.

Dr. Lin's sleep quality tonight was truly concerning; she was woken up shortly after falling asleep each time.

It was like people with yin-yang eyes often had troublesome lives. When you could perceive things that ordinary people couldn't, it was indeed a very vexing matter.

Dr. Lin's current state would probably last for another day or two. She would only return to normal after her body's "magnetic field" dissipated. Moreover, she had to be careful not to catch a cold, otherwise she would easily get sick.

"Outside, there's a sound?" Dr. Lin asked Zhou Ze.

Zhou Ze nodded.

Dr. Lin thought it was the "noisy" people next door from earlier, but it wasn't. One could only blame Zhou Ze for being idle just now, damaging the ghost messenger badge to make it emit a fragrance. This fragrance wasn't just pleasant to Zhou Ze; it also instinctively attracted some nearby solitary spirits and wild ghosts.

This was business, Zhou Ze thought, and he planned to get up and "sign for a package" outside.

But at this moment, from the next room, the old man came out again, seemingly heading to the outhouse.

When one gets old, pipes are prone to rust, dripping and leaking; it's quite common.

This made Zhou Ze a little worried. Although solitary spirits and wild ghosts were usually just a few here and there, incapable of causing major trouble, the old man was old after all. If he were to be affected, the consequences could be quite serious.

If the old man had stayed in his room, protected by that group of comrades, there would naturally be nothing to worry about. But now that he had come out, there was a certain probability of an accident.

Military souls were very different from ordinary dead souls. Their range of activity was actually very small, and they adhered to their "discipline." The restrictions of this world on them were indeed stricter than on other dead souls.

General Chen Yi once wrote the poem, "去泉台招舊部，旌旗十萬斬閻羅" (Going to the netherworld to gather old troops, ten thousand banners will cut down King Yama). However, in reality, as a stability-maintaining institution of the underworld, it could tolerate you, a solitary spirit, floating around generally, making minor mischief. But if you were to form a group to cause trouble, then sorry, the underworld was not to be trifled with.

Moreover, when Zhou Ze entered the courtyard earlier, he hadn't sensed the presence of those military souls. It wasn't until he entered the old man's room and the old man lifted the curtain that he saw the room full of people. This meant that these military souls could only move within the limited area of the room.

No matter what, he was the one who attracted the ghosts. He couldn't let the old man suffer because of him.

"Help me up," Zhou Ze said.

Dr. Lin helped Zhou Ze out of bed.

As the two of them reached the doorway, they heard a conversation outside.

It sounded like a man and a woman.

"In the room on the left, there are so many people, they look so fierce," the woman said.

"Yes, but they can't come out. Don't be afraid, I'm here," the male ghost said.

"The room on the right, like us, also has a man and a woman. The man seems to be injured," the woman added.

Dr. Lin also heard the conversation and looked at Zhou Ze with some concern.

Zhou Ze, however, wasn't worried. He actually hoped they would rush directly towards his side, saving him the trouble of going out.

"No, that man is even more terrifying than everyone in the left room combined. He gives me goosebumps. Don't provoke him."

Dr. Lin looked at Zhou Ze in surprise.

Zhou Ze subtly raised his head,

Playing along with the man and woman's rhythm to show off in front of his girlfriend.

This ghostly couple knew their place.

"We can't go to the left, and we can't go to the right. So where is that scent coming from? There's only an old man in the outhouse. Maybe it's from him," the woman muttered.

"We can only try our luck there. This siheyuan is too spooky, even spookier than our graveyard."

The male and female ghosts seemed to have reached a consensus and prepared to target the old man.

Actually, Zhou Ze had underestimated the attraction of that scent to ghosts. This male and female pair had clearly been ghosts for many years, almost becoming *ghost spirits*.

The common saying "ghostly clever" was not just a simple adjective; it was also a noun. Any being, after cultivating to a certain degree, could become a *spirit*.

The old man, having had some wine, was a bit dizzy. His hand kept fumbling, but he just couldn't grasp his "water pipe." He was very frustrated.

The male and female ghosts rushed directly into the outhouse.

Just as Zhou Ze, supported by Dr. Lin, walked out of the room to deal with the situation,

They heard two horrified screams from the man and woman:

"There are ghosts!"

"There are ghosts! There are ghosts!"

Then, as Zhou Ze watched, the man and woman swiftly shot through the courtyard wall and fled in a panic.

Dr. Lin looked disbelieving, even finding it unsettling, and murmured:

"That old man, is he also a ghost?"

A ghost, walking around alive, and even leading himself and Zhou Ze home? Eating with them, playing chess?

Zhou Ze shook his head and corrected her:

"They weren't shouting 'there are ghosts,'

But 'there is nobility,'

The nobility of a distinguished person."

With a distinguished person here, gods and ghosts retreat.

title: 第一百五十六章 紅杏出牆
content:
Zhou Ze suddenly felt that this old man was a treasure. Not long ago, the old Taoist priest had chatted with him about whether to enshrine a God of Wealth or a Guan Gong statue in the bookstore.

Now that he thought about it, there was no need for those statues; simply inviting this old man to live in the bookstore would ensure its flourishing *feng shui*.

Zhou Ze had met noble people before, but this old man was almost noble to the point of being a *bug*.

Still, the same could be said: he went to serve in the military. If he had pursued other professions, or if the grand historical background of his era had been different, he would undoubtedly have achieved extraordinary success.

However, everyone's fate is different, and so are their choices. Perhaps for the old man, choosing to be a soldier and fighting alongside his comrades was the most unregretted choice.

Even at ninety years old, he could still happily reunite with his comrades "in his dreams" every night. In this lifetime, he never felt that he had lived in vain, nor that he had wasted his life by giving up other more wonderful things.

The old man had said that he had no children, so if he left, he would truly be gone completely.

Perhaps, he was still alive now, genuinely treating his home as an inn, a gathering place for his comrades who sacrificed themselves years ago.

Actually, from another perspective, Zhou Ze felt that the couplet hanging at the entrance of his bookstore would be more suitable for the old man's doorstep:

*Listen to it as a hypothesis; this is what I heard.*

Zhou Ze himself, in his current state, found it difficult to reach such a level. Especially after achieving success, he had become very pragmatic in his actions and lost his former lazy and leisurely disposition.

Meanwhile, the old man, in this *siheyuan*, was living in a state of "who first awakes from the great dream, I myself know my life's course."

He was free and unconstrained. Though the *siheyuan* was small, his memories stretched far.

Everything remained quiet until daybreak.

In the morning, Xu Qinglang drove to the *siheyuan*, with the old Taoist priest in the passenger seat. The monkey had also been found.

When Zhou Ze was helped into the car, the old Taoist lowered his head, feeling very embarrassed.

His boss was very weak after his *Wushuang* attack.

Yet, on his way to deliver *mana potions* and *health potions*, he was pulled over by traffic police for driving without a license.

For Xu Qinglang to bail him out, he not only used some connections but also burned quite a bit of *joss paper*. Even though Boss Zhou hadn't said anything, the old Taoist himself felt a pang in his heart.

"Old Taoist," Zhou Ze began.

"Yes, Boss," the old Taoist glanced at his boss in the back seat, feeling very guilty.

"Let's go learn to drive together sometime soon, and get a driver's license."

"Uh... alright."

Actually, both Zhou Ze and the old Taoist knew how to drive, but Xu Le didn't have a license, and the old Taoist had never bothered to get one. If they were to actually take the test, it would just be a formality.

All the way, Xu Qinglang kept looking at Doctor Lin in the back through the rearview mirror;

Watching her wipe Zhou Ze's face, watching her peel fruit for Zhou Ze, watching her carefully ask Zhou Ze where he felt uncomfortable.

In short, the entire car was filled with the smell of *dog food*.

The old Taoist didn't care. Anyway, every one of his ghost bosses always had endless romantic luck with women and female ghosts. This kind of thing couldn't be envied. If one wanted to envy it,

they would have to die first.

The old Taoist didn't want to die, so he was willing to endure the loneliness of being a bachelor. Zhou Ze used to ask him why he didn't find a partner and live a good life. The old Taoist replied that his ambition was to roam the four corners of the world.

If he married, he would have to disappoint so many fallen women waiting for his comfort; it would truly be their loss. So he could only sacrifice himself for the sake of everyone.

Two hours later, Xu Qinglang parked the car in front of Doctor Lin's house.

Before Doctor Lin got out, she specifically said, "I'll send another copy of the agreement. Just sign it and mail it back to me."

Zhou Ze felt a bit disappointed. Although this trip wasn't long, it was quite eventful. However, after all their detours, it seemed they had resumed the rhythm they had before they set off.

Divorce agreement.

Zhou Ze nodded, not trying to make her stay, nor saying anything else. He just waved to her, reminding her to rest well. After these uninspired, unnecessary words were spoken, Doctor Lin went upstairs and home. Xu Qinglang restarted the car, and twenty minutes later, they were back at the bookstore.

The old Taoist got out first, taking the monkey to dig in the mud.

Xu Qinglang opened the car door for Zhou Ze, handed him a cigarette, and chuckled, "If you're really interested, be a bit bolder."

"And then Doctor Lin will think I'm good in bed and leave me 3,000 yuan in the nightstand?" Zhou Ze countered.

"............" Xu Qinglang.

"Actually, this is good. I'm not a person of the living world. Too much entanglement with me wouldn't necessarily be good for her."

"This isn't a romance drama; where would there be so many convoluted plots? Frankly, if it had been Doctor Lin who arrived in that Maserati that day instead of the Faceless Woman, you two would probably be nearing your delivery date by now."

Zhou Ze suddenly felt that Xu Qinglang made a lot of sense, and he couldn't find a retort.

"Of course, if all else fails, IVF is very convenient now anyway, and the Lin family has money. You can tell her parents that they've found a son-in-law who 'can't get it up,' and if they want grandchildren, they'll have to do IVF. I reckon the Lin family would be very willing to spend money on you."

Zhou Ze looked at Xu Qinglang in surprise.

He thought Xu Qinglang had gone bad.

The formerly honest and loyal Old Xu had actually learned to retaliate, and right after Zhou Ze had just satirized him.

Truly, the world was going to the dogs and people's hearts were no longer pure.

Zhou Ze wanted to get out of the car with Xu Qinglang's help, but a white figure ran straight over, gently picked Zhou Ze up, and carried him into the bookstore, saying at the same time:

"Boss, the water temperature is all set."

After Bai Yingying bathed Zhou Ze, she carried him upstairs to the bedroom. Tea and fruit were already laid out in the bedroom. Zhou Ze drank half a cup of tea, and Yingying, with great care, used her thigh as a pillow for Zhou Ze. Her hands massaged Zhou Ze's head just right, helping him slowly fall asleep.

This,

was life.

This,

was existence.

When he woke up, it was already night. He ate something with plum juice, and then, with Bai Yingying's help, Zhou Ze went downstairs and sat on the sofa.

Soon, Xu Qinglang also came downstairs. He was wearing a burgundy suit, his hair perfectly combed, and he seemed to have sprayed some cologne.

"So flashy, where are you off to?" Zhou Ze asked, waving the newspaper in his hand.

"None of your business," Xu Qinglang glared at Zhou Ze.

That look perfectly conveyed the meaning of "cheating on one's spouse."

After tidying himself up in the mirror again, Xu Qinglang, feeling pleased with himself, asked Bai Yingying:

"How's this outfit?"

"Very beautiful," Bai Yingying said.

"Before this outfit, you were a streetwalker fluttering in the Parisian night. After this outfit, you're the highest-priced male escort king in Shanghai."

Zhou Ze said, then took a sip of coffee.

"I didn't ask you."

Xu Qinglang dismissively waved his hand at Zhou Ze,

"Someone who can't get it up isn't qualified to talk so much."

Xu Qinglang said, looking at Bai Yingying and giving her a knowing look.

Bai Yingying's face turned red, and she clasped her hands, twiddling her fingers. Actually, the boss's...

Xu Qinglang left, taking a taxi. The bookstore still seemed to faintly carry his flamboyant scent.

Bai Yingying refilled Zhou Ze's coffee and said, "Boss, Xiao Ke is still waiting for your reply about that Japanese priest."

"Tell her to keep an eye on it. I'm not feeling well lately."

Bai Yingying nodded, indicating she understood.

............

When he reached the door of the room,

Xu Qinglang hesitated.

At the same time, in his pocket, he had six thousand yuan in cash.

She had contacted him again. He didn't want to come, but he felt that some things needed to be made clear.

For example, he wasn't the male prostitute she mistook him for. So, he came, not only to return the three thousand yuan she left him last time but also to give her another three thousand yuan.

Then he would very solemnly and seriously tell her,

You were great,

I was very satisfied,

This is your service fee.

Whew...

A man,

must rise from wherever he was looked down upon.

He pressed the doorbell of the guest room.

The door opened.

The woman inside was graceful and poised. She must have just showered, without makeup, yet she was even more alluring. Her exposed skin stirred an impulse as if a devil had descended.

"I..."

Xu Qinglang cleared his throat. He had just uttered one word when his lips were blocked by another pair of lips.

Then,

*heavenly lightning struck earthly fire*,

friction generated heat, igniting a raging inferno,

everything proceeded logically,

and then,

they had a fantastic time.

After three rounds,

Xu Qinglang did not fall asleep. Although he was very, very tired, like an old ox exhausted from plowing, he forced himself to keep his eyes open.

He reached for his clothes. He had to pay, this time he would pay first!

Dignity,

he could not forget his dignity!

A man with over twenty properties,

must have his dignity!

"What are you doing?"

The woman lay in bed, holding a slender cigarette.

"Paying."

Xu Qinglang was unbuttoning his suit pocket.

"Slap!"

A stack of money was taken from under the woman's pillow and thrown in front of Xu Qinglang,

easily tens of thousands.

Xu Qinglang was stunned.

He suddenly felt that the few thousand yuan in his pocket,

seemed a bit too little to offer.

His dignity seemed to have been trampled upon once more, riddled with holes.

"I'm very satisfied with you, extremely satisfied," the woman said.

"I'm also very satisfied with you," Xu Qinglang retorted without weakness.

"Satisfied with my price, right?"

"............" Xu Qinglang.

Soon, Xu Qinglang regained his composure, stacked the money on the bed, grabbed the woman's hand, and put the money back into her hand.

"I don't want your money, and I'm not... huh? Your wrist?"

He hadn't noticed it last time.

He hadn't noticed it during the three rounds just now.

Now Xu Qinglang noticed it.

On the woman's left wrist, there were twenty dense scars. A few of the scars were new, not yet fully healed.

"Every time I make love with a man I'm satisfied with, I feel very pleased. When I'm pleased, I want to leave something to commemorate it, something to remind me of this joyful and beautiful time in the future.

Like today."

The woman pulled out a razor blade from somewhere with her right hand,

right in front of Xu Qinglang,

*Pfft*

A sound,

a fresh red cut appeared,

The woman looked up,

opened her mouth,

and kept inhaling sharply,

She must have been in great pain, but her expression was one of extreme pleasure, like someone addicted to drugs finally getting their fix.

Then,

the woman took the still-burning cigarette butt and directly pressed it onto the new scar.

"Hiss...!"

The woman took a deep breath,

then sighed:

"Comfortable..."

title: 第一百五十七章 向金錢勢力低頭的周老闆
content:
Xu Qinglang felt his scalp tingle. He had seen many ghosts and wasn't afraid of them, but this living, breathing person who had just "shared a cloud and rain"* with him filled him with an unspeakable dread.

The woman glanced at him, seemingly amused by his trembling, terrified demeanor. She reached out and gently tapped his chin.

"So cute, like a little quail that makes one's heart ache."

The woman's fingers were somewhat cold. Xu Qinglang shivered, immediately put on his clothes, and got out of bed, not daring to look at her. He left the money on the bed, didn't pick it up, and practically fled, opening the door and running out.

Compared to last time, when he woke up to three thousand yuan on the nightstand, Xu Qinglang felt like he was an even bigger failure today.

He felt somewhat lost. After leaving the hotel, he squatted by the roadside curb and lit a cigarette.

This woman has mental problems.

But ignoring her scarred wrist, she was truly beautiful.

It seemed there was no such thing as absolute perfection in this world. Heaven always seemed to habitually create a flaw in beautiful things, as if that conformed to its aesthetic.

For most men, a beautiful, high-skilled woman from a respectable family who was willing to give you money and be your friend with benefits seemed like a very pleasant arrangement.

In fact, Xu Qinglang had somewhat entertained such thoughts before. That feeling of having no worries, no impact on one's life, solely pursuing a moment of fleeting pleasure, was enough to make one drop all defenses and willingly sink into it.

He reached up and ruffled his hair, feeling a little distressed.

Just then, a pair of high heels appeared behind Xu Qinglang. He turned his head and saw the woman.

The woman was still smoking. Her wrist was covered by her sleeve, showing no trace of injury. She bent down, looking at Xu Qinglang. The deep cleavage of her chest was so unfathomable, enough to make most men's eyes fixated.

"Little brother, was big sister scared you?"

Xu Qinglang shook his head, avoiding her gaze, and continued smoking his cigarette.

"Well, I'm leaving. I'll call you again when I'm in a better mood. Oh, and here's your money."

The woman took money from her bag.

"I don't want it. I'm not short on money."

The woman paused, as if looking at a stubborn baby, and said,

"What a coincidence, neither am I."

"Whoosh!"

The woman tossed several tens of thousands of yuan in cash directly into the air. Banknotes began to flutter, drawing the attention of many passersby. Then she got into her car parked nearby and drove away.

Xu Qinglang sat amidst the fluttering banknotes, which made him involuntarily recall a scene from the movie *God of Gamblers* he watched as a child.

There, too, money was thrown into the air, and Chow Yun-fat and the woman danced gracefully in the rain of banknotes.

Sniffing, Xu Qinglang silently stood up.

He walked a few steps away,

Then stopped,

And looked back. There was a pile of money on the ground.

Heh,

Am I short on money?

He turned around and continued walking forward.

At this moment, several passersby on the street, seeing Xu Qinglang leave, instinctively began to gather, intending to pick up the money.

Xu Qinglang stopped again,

And quickly walked back to where he was,

"I'm not short on money, but that guy is. If he knew I didn't even pick up the money on the ground for some 'face,' he'd curse me to death!"

***

"Achoo!"

In the bookstore, Boss Zhou, who had been reading newspapers for half the night, let out a loud sneeze.

"Boss, are you catching a cold?" Bai Yingying asked with concern.

"Heh, someone must be thinking of him," the old Daoist priest muttered, counting on his fingers. "Tsk tsk tsk, so it must be."

"The floor is a bit dirty, needs another mop," Zhou Ze said slowly.

The old Daoist priest immediately pulled a long face, begrudgingly picked up the mop, and started cleaning.

Just then, a Porsche stopped in front of the bookstore. A finely dressed, elegant woman entered. The woman was around thirty, exuding a graceful air from head to toe.

"Wow, she's so beautiful, like a lotus emerging from water," Bai Yingying exclaimed from the side.

This was normal, as the woman was indeed beautiful, the kind that became more captivating the more you looked at her.

"The dewdrops on the lotus haven't been wiped off yet."

Zhou Ze chuckled.

The woman's cheeks were flushed, her eyes moist, and she carried a relaxed air, like the earth newly nourished by spring rain, pregnant with new life.

"Who is the boss?"

The woman scanned her surroundings and asked.

Zhou Ze frowned. Who was the boss?

Could this high school girl holding coffee be the boss?

Could that old farmer grunting and mopping the floor be the boss?

There were only three people in the shop.

Who was the boss?

Are you blind?

Zhou Ze curled his lips, ignoring her. Anyway, she was a living person, not a ghost.

As a result, no one actually responded to the woman.

Bai Yingying went to organize the counter, the old Daoist priest continued mopping,

Zhou Ze continued to lounge on the sofa.

"I have something important to discuss. I'm looking for your boss. Wang Ke recommended me."

Upon hearing Wang Ke's name, Zhou Ze slowly sat up straight.

The woman saw Zhou Ze, walked over, and sat on the sofa opposite him.

She spoke directly:

"My husband has been having some psychological issues recently. He keeps thinking he's seeing ghosts. I asked Dr. Wang to see him, and Dr. Wang recommended me here to you. He said you're an expert in this field."

Zhou Ze didn't answer the woman. Instead, he took out his phone, intending to chew out Wang Ke. They had agreed Wang Ke wouldn't create trouble for him, but here he was pushing a difficult case his way.

Did his previous promises mean nothing?

There were limits to helping and caring for friends, after all. Zhou Ze had never considered himself a living Lei Feng.

Before he could dial the number,

A bank card was thrown onto the coffee table by the woman.

"There's a million in this card. The password is 003003."

Zhou Ze's process of calling Wang Ke to reprimand him was interrupted. Zhou Ze felt angry. Didn't you see I was about to make a call?

What's the meaning of throwing a card on the coffee table, saying there's a million inside, and even telling me the password?

Don't you know that a single piece of burial goods my maid casually throws out is worth hundreds of thousands?

Don't you know that the old man who mops my floor can make a fortune by just livestreaming sales of冥鈔*?

Haven't you seen that my hired cook owns over twenty properties?

Zhou Ze put down his phone,

Reached out,

And picked up the card.

Sigh,

He was still too kind, too focused on friendship.

He still had to help his friends.

"This is a deposit,"

The woman added.

Zhou Ze's hand trembled slightly.

Sigh, his injury hadn't fully healed yet, so his body was a bit weak. His hand was trembling just picking up a small card.

"Yingying, we have a guest. Why aren't you serving coffee?" Zhou Ze called out to the counter, clearly displeased.

"Coming!"

Bai Yingying immediately brought over the coffee.

The woman calmly watched Zhou Ze. She enjoyed the feeling of using money to make people submit.

Whether in bed or out of it, whether men or women, her money was always effective.

"Tell me about your situation. How old is your husband?" Zhou Ze asked.

"He's ninety-three this year," the woman replied.

Zhou Ze unexpectedly looked at the woman a second time.

"Yes, I'm with him because I'm after his money and inheritance. Then I told him we were true love, and the old man, feeling good about himself, believed it."

The woman continued to speak calmly:

"Thank you for your honesty."

"Even if I weren't honest, you'd still think that way."

The woman picked up the coffee, took a sip, and frowned slightly.

"No sugar."

"I don't like sugar," Zhou Ze said.

The woman put down the coffee. "Anyway, whenever you have time, you can come to my house and see my husband. He's been too paranoid recently, making normal married life impossible."

"Pfftt..."

Zhou Ze, who was drinking coffee, choked.

Bai Yingying carefully helped her boss wipe his mouth with a tissue, then retreated.

"Begging your pardon, but I think you should be hoping he kicks the bucket soon."

"Hm, he was almost dead before, practically bedridden. But ever since he started claiming to see ghosts, his spirits have visibly improved."

The woman continued, looking troubled:

"At this rate, I don't think he'll be dying anytime soon, I mean, of natural causes."

"I understand. And then, what's your intention in asking for my help?"

"To fix his current state. I don't care if it's a psychotic version of senile dementia or if he's truly being haunted. I want him to return to normal, and then continue to lie in bed and quietly wait to die, just like before."

"Alright, I agree. I'll do my best to cure your husband's illness."

A cold smile surfaced on the woman's lips,

"Hypocrite."

"By the way, did your husband say who was bothering him?

I mean, what's the identity of the ghost haunting him?

Does he know them?"

"His ex-wife, his son, his daughter, his grandson, his granddaughter, and his great-grandson, great-granddaughter."

The woman counted on her fingers,

"Many, many people."

"Excuse me, are they already...?"

"Five years ago, their entire family had a gathering on a cruise ship, and then they encountered an accident. The cruise ship sank, and everyone on board perished. That is, his entire family, except for him, who happened to be ashore on business that day, all died."

"Hmm."

Zhou Ze nodded upon hearing this.

In that case, it was entirely possible that the old man was being tormented by lingering spirits, or it was a mental issue caused by excessive psychological pressure.

"Then how long have you been married to him?"

"Five years."

The woman still replied calmly.

Zhou Ze didn't ask further questions, instead continuously weighing the bank card in his hand.

This was a muddy water, no, quite possibly a cesspit.

If he stepped in, he might get himself dirty, at the very least, he would smell the stench.

"A deposit of one million, and five million upon completion," the woman looked at Zhou Ze, her smooth fingers lightly touching the back of Zhou Ze's hand.

Bai Yingying watched from the side and pouted. So old, and still trying to seduce men!

Yingying hadn't considered that in terms of age, everyone else in the bookstore, including the old Daoist priest, combined wouldn't be as old as she was.

"Plus, I'll sleep with you three times."

The woman added.

Bai Yingying's face grew even uglier.

Gānlínniáng!*

Shameless!*

Zhou Ze calmly moved the woman's hand away,

And said:

"How about canceling the latter condition and changing it to eight million?"

---
* 巫山雲雨 (wūshānyúnyǔ): A Chinese idiom literally meaning "clouds and rain over Mount Wu," often used euphemistically to refer to sexual intercourse.
* 冥鈔 (míngchāo): Spirit money or joss paper, paper offerings burned in traditional Chinese ancestor worship and funerals.
* 甘霖娘 (gānlínniáng): A vulgar expression in some Chinese dialects, roughly equivalent to "damn your mother" or "motherfucker."
* 湊表臉 (còubiǎoliǎn): A colloquial and somewhat crude term meaning "shameless" or "disgraceful."

title: 第一百五十八章 東海缺少白玉床，龍王來請金陵王
content:
The woman gave him her business card, set a time, and provided the address, indicating that Zhou Ze should visit her home tomorrow at noon.

As soon as the woman left, Bai Yingying stood beside Zhou Ze, timidly saying:

"Boss, tomorrow, can you let the old Taoist priest mind the store? I'll go with you."

"Hm? What's wrong?"

"Look at you, Boss, you're still injured. The old Taoist priest's meager skills are fine against ordinary people, but against ghosts, he's useless beyond fumbling in his pants. It's not safe to take him, so take me instead."

"…………" The floor-mopping old Taoist priest.

"Alright," Zhou Ze nodded in agreement. Actually, from how Bai Yingying single-handedly pulverized that Corpse Ghoul last time, her combat power was indeed very strong.

"It's fine, Boss has problems in that area, you know that. What are you worrying about?

Although one million for sleeping with a woman is indeed too expensive, for such a top-tier beauty, one million for one night isn't a loss. See, even this Boss gave up."

The old Taoist priest, having finished mopping the floor, wiped his sweat and comforted Bai Yingying.

Though the old Taoist priest had never been married or started a family, hadn't he at least seen a pig run even if he hadn't eaten pork?

"Old Taoist priest," Zhou Ze called out, holding his coffee cup.

"Here, Boss, what's up?"

"The floor is dirty."

"Dirty? Impossible! I just mopped it clean!"

"Oh."

Zhou Ze gently tilted his coffee cup, spilling coffee onto the floor.

"It's dirty now. Mop it again."

"…………" The old Taoist priest.

In the latter half of the night, Zhou Ze went upstairs to rest. Xu Qinglang returned close to morning, completely drunk, and went straight to his room on the second floor after arriving at the bookstore.

By the time Zhou Ze woke up the next morning, Xu Qinglang hadn't emerged from his room yet.

"Where is he?"

Zhou Ze looked at the takeout breakfast in front of him, immediately knowing that the household chef was absent.

"He got drunk last night and hasn't woken up yet. He reeked of alcohol when he came back," the old Taoist priest explained.

Zhou Ze nodded, saying nothing more.

After breakfast, Zhou Ze changed into casual clothes, then turned his head and called out to Bai Yingying:

"Bring me my cane."

Bai Yingying and the old Taoist priest were arguing about something behind the counter. Hearing Zhou Ze call her, she immediately ran over with the cane, then frantically winked at the old Taoist priest.

"What's wrong?" Zhou Ze asked.

"Nothing, I was just reminding the old Taoist priest to tell Old Xu to wake up and cook dinner tonight. Boss, you're still recovering, and takeout isn't nutritious."

"It's fine."

Leaning on his cane, supported by Bai Yingying, Zhou Ze walked out of the bookstore and took a taxi.

Standing behind the counter, the old Taoist priest scratched his head helplessly and pulled out an electric wheelchair.

To curry favor with the boss, he had ordered this electric wheelchair immediately after the boss went 'Rampage' in Yancheng last time. He had just been thinking of giving it to the boss as a surprise gift.

Who knew that the zombie insisted she wouldn't let him present it, even saying he might die if he did?

Oh dear,

This female zombie is becoming more and more jealous. I'm a man, surely I can't compete with you for favor?

She even dared to threaten to kill me.

Thinking this, the old Taoist priest helplessly reached out and pressed a button on the wheelchair.

The wheelchair began to play music:

"Woo woo woo woo woo... Little, little scholar, carrying his schoolbag to school..."

While playing music, the wheelchair also started moving on its own, spinning in place.

So joyful, so joyful.

"I'll give it to the Boss when he comes back tonight."

………………

After taking a taxi to the address, Zhou Ze was somewhat surprised to see not a mansion, but a rural residence.

A three-story house with its own courtyard wall. While such a house was spacious and offered much freedom, it wasn't actually expensive, at least not compared to the woman's casual gesture of throwing down a card worth a million. Living here seemed a bit mismatched.

He rang the doorbell.

A woman wearing house clothes and an apron emerged from inside. Only after she opened the door did Zhou Ze realize that this woman, who looked more like a respectable housewife than a respectable housewife, was the same one who had visited his bookstore yesterday.

Clothes make the man, or woman. The woman now looked completely different, at least in temperament, compared to yesterday.

"Please come in."

The woman bowed slightly, motioning for Zhou Ze and Bai Yingying to enter, then closed the door.

"After my husband fell ill, he insisted on moving here. This used to be his old home, treated as an ancestral residence for decades, unused. A few years ago, it was renovated and this house was rebuilt."

Zhou Ze nodded, simultaneously stepping into the hall. The hall's layout was also very ordinary, like any regular home. On the south wall hung a divine image, whose identity Zhou Ze honestly didn't recognize.

There were also incense and candles, and a table.

"My husband is on the second floor. Please follow me."

The woman kept her gaze down, seemingly this was her demeanor at home—a perfect, good wife.

Bai Yingying kept staring at her. Although she had faith in her boss,

But,

Heh, men!

They went up the stairs to the second floor. As soon as the balcony door was pushed open, Zhou Ze saw the hallway of the balcony covered in talismans of all kinds.

Bai Yingying instinctively took a step back. Zhou Ze shook his head, signaling her not to be afraid.

These talismans were all merely for show.

Walking further in, the door to the second room was opened. Zhou Ze saw it was a tatami-style room. An old man with white hair, just skin and bones, sat there, mumbling to himself, as if chatting and talking with someone.

Zhou Ze also noticed one thing: from the main entrance, or rather, from the road outside the main entrance all the way to every corner of this house, there were surveillance cameras.

Presumably, even the bathroom was no exception.

Therefore, in this place, the woman had to keep up appearances. The old man must have had contingencies for his inheritance; wealthy people weren't usually too foolish.

Zhou Ze sat down next to the old man, reached for a bottle of red wine, poured a glass, and took a sip.

It tasted good. He was a man who knew how to enjoy himself.

The old man was probably "playing" with his great-grandchildren, constantly making cooing noises like he was teasing children and telling them stories.

Zhou Ze leaned back and listened. For now, it seemed the old man had mental problems, as Zhou Ze didn't see any ghosts in the room.

Bai Yingying stood at the doorway, then after a while, felt a bit bored and walked out onto the balcony, looking at the view of the farmland outside.

The woman brought over some dim sum and placed it before Zhou Ze.

Zhou Ze shook his head, indicating he didn't need any, then clapped his hands and called out:

"Old man, is this your great-grandson?"

"Ah?" The old man's eyes were somewhat cloudy, but within that cloudiness, there was an unusual excitement.

The woman had previously said that her husband was already bedridden, waiting for him to pass away so she could inherit the estate. Now, however, the old man was sometimes delirious, sometimes perfectly normal, but his spirits were improving day by day; he could eat, move, and get out of bed. It was said to be a final burst of energy before death, but wasn't it lasting too long?

"Yes, my great-grandson. Come, Junjun, say hello to this uncle."

The old man motioned for the 'great-grandson' in front of him to come over.

"Oh, so well-behaved."

Zhou Ze praised, even though he saw absolutely nothing.

Next,

It was time for Boss Zhou and the old man to chat. The old man talked about his business, recounting how he started from humble beginnings in middle age and how he later improved his family's life.

Zhou Ze initially didn't know much, but later learned that the old man's ancestral home was Tongcheng, but he had smuggled himself to Southeast Asia when he was young and made his fortune there. After the reform and opening up, he returned, cut off his previous smuggling business, whitewashed his identity, and invested as an overseas Chinese returnee.

Truly, this old man was a minor legend; his rags-to-riches story could be a motivational autobiography.

Zhou Ze listened with great interest. The old man even had his great-granddaughter and great-grandson recite ancient poetry and sing. Zhou Ze still saw nothing, but he clapped and cheered nonetheless.

The whole process was a bit like those young celebrities filming movies with green screens, where a stunt double films the scene, and then the star's face is digitally pasted on later.

As they chatted, the woman came again.

"Husband, Mr. Zhou, lunch is ready. We can eat now."

At the woman's words, the old man's previous amiability vanished. He became fierce, a ferocity that seemed like bravado, yet he roared with fear:

"They're all downstairs, they're all downstairs! I'm not going, I'm not going! They're all downstairs waiting for me!"

The old man, shouting, curled up on the tatami, looking utterly terrified.

The woman, somewhat helpless, looked at Zhou Ze, motioning for him to come down for a meal.

Zhou Ze stood up and bid the old man farewell.

Just as he was about to leave, his hand was gripped by the old man.

The old man said very seriously, "Don't go down. They are down there. They are down there. They were sent back by the Dragon King of the Sea. They will eat you. Seriously, if you go down, you'll die!"

"Hmm, don't worry. I'm sent by Sun Wukong to return the Ruyi Jingu Bang. Don't worry."

Zhou Ze reached out and patted the old man's shoulder, taking advantage of the old man chewing on his last sentence to slip away.

The three walked together from the balcony towards the staircase.

The woman quietly asked, "Is there a way to treat him?"

Zhou Ze shook his head and said, "Let Wang Ke examine him. This old man probably has psychological issues or a rare type of Alzheimer's. There are no ghosts around him."

"Then there's no need to refund the deposit. Just have lunch before you go. I'm better at French and Japanese cuisine; my Chinese cooking skills are only average."

If there were ghosts, Zhou Ze would have seen them.

It was a pity; this business couldn't be done.

"Come back! Come back!"

The old man suddenly stood at the room door and shouted.

Zhou Ze looked back, then continued to walk downstairs with the woman.

"Then there's no need to refund the deposit. Just have lunch before you go. I'm better at French and Japanese cuisine; my Chinese cooking skills are only average," the woman said modestly.

They descended the stairs and reached the hall. Honestly, Zhou Ze truly wanted to sample the woman's cooking.

Therefore, to marry into a wealthy family and achieve the status of an old husband and young wife, one truly needed some real skill. This path was not easy.

If you just wanted to lie on your dorm bed watching TV and fantasizing, it would likely remain a fantasy forever.

However,

When Zhou Ze turned into the living room,

He froze.

Bai Yingying behind him also froze.

Around the table in the hall,

People were seated,

Old and young, male and female, four generations under one roof.

Their entire family, neatly seated there,

Each person staring at the rice bowl in front of them, with a pair of chopsticks stuck upright in each bowl.

At the same time,

Every one of them was soaking wet,

Water droplets occasionally dripped from their chins and the hems of their clothes,

The living room floor was already wet,

As if it had just been mopped.

title: 第一百五十九章 別拿村官不當幹部！
content:
Zhou Ze's lips parted, then he instinctively grabbed the woman who was still walking forward.

The woman looked at Zhou Ze, somewhat surprised, not knowing what he intended.

"I take back what I just said."

Zhou Ze gently twisted his neck,

"Your house, it's really not clean."

A thoughtful expression appeared on the woman's face.

"Don't worry, I'm not some charlatan."

"I believe you're not a charlatan." The woman said very seriously, "Besides, it's only a few million; being scammed, it's no big deal."

That remark,

It stung,

So grating.

A few million like a few hundred, just for peace of mind?

What a spendthrift woman.

Zhou Ze silently mourned for the old man upstairs. Why bother at such an old age? All the family wealth he painstakingly built up would fall into this woman's hands?

Fortunately, Zhou Ze still had some professional ethics. This woman hired him, so he wouldn't stir up more trouble.

Of course, in Bai Yingying's eyes, Zhou Ze and this woman at this moment truly seemed like partners in crime, a living, breathing modern-day version of Wu Dalang and Pan Jinlian.

If it were made into a TV series, the boss and this woman would be typical villains!

"Your husband isn't mentally disturbed; there really are unclean things here. Let's not talk about money for now; we can discuss it slowly after I've handled things here.

Yingying, take her upstairs."

"Boss, you alone..." Bai Yingying didn't want to go up; the boss was injured.

Zhou Ze wanted to poke his maid's forehead with his middle finger right then. It didn't matter if something happened to him, but if something happened to this woman, who would he get his final payment from?

The woman was very obedient. Even though she couldn't see anything, she at least showed an attitude of "I believe," actively stepping back.

She really was a smart woman, sensible, capable of changing her demeanor; wanton in bed, ladylike out of bed, good at cooking and acting, and could even pretend to be understanding.

Zhou Ze glanced at Bai Yingying again. Sigh, his own Yingying had so much to learn.

Under Zhou Ze's stern gaze, Bai Yingying could only accompany the woman upstairs; she needed to protect this woman and the old man.

Next, the entire hall was left with only that family and Zhou Ze.

These people had maintained upright postures, like elementary students in class, sitting perfectly straight, even the oldest grandmother.

That grandmother should be the old man's original wife upstairs.

Ordinary people, even if a deceased relative's soul lingered to visit, would at most be one or two. But this old man, good heavens, an entire family, four generations under one roof. Zhou Ze counted, and there were actually twenty-some people.

The scale of this "family reunion" was indeed immense; no wonder the old man was so terrified.

If it were his old wife returning, or a child, or a granddaughter, that would be acceptable. But an entire family returning together would scare anyone stiff.

Leaning on his crutch, Zhou Ze approached them. The closer he got, the more clearly Zhou Ze perceived a chilling sensation constantly assailing him, and the surrounding air carried a strong salty and damp smell.

This family of the old man's was said to have perished at sea when their cruise ship had an accident. As for whether there were any hidden truths, Zhou Ze didn't know, nor did he want to know.

Regardless, this family before him, when counted, was a considerable achievement. He could just collect them.

"Gulp..."

"Gulp..."

The sound of water began to emanate,

The water sounds came from these people's necks. From the oldest grandmother to the youngest child of a few years old, their necks were distended, like bloated frogs.

Immediately after,

"Ugh..."

In the hall, everyone began to vomit.

Turbid seawater mixed with sand poured from their mouths, even carrying some dead fish and shrimp!

The hall before had only looked like it had just been mopped,

But now,

It was like a seafood market, emitting a strong stench of seafood, like the smell of a certain room in a love hotel that had been used continuously for a month without the sheets being changed.

Zhou Ze covered his nose with his hand and lifted his foot, only to find that the seawater had risen to his ankles.

The hall was like a reservoir, and these twenty-odd people were like twenty-odd faucets at the edge of the pool, releasing water into it.

The water accumulated without dispersing, slowly filling the hall.

Zhou Ze leaned over and placed a hand on the shoulder of a middle-aged man, his fingernails growing out and piercing directly into the man's shoulder.

"Sizzle, sizzle, sizzle..."

The sound of oil frying echoed, and thick black smoke began to rise from the middle-aged man's body, but he remained seated, motionless, as if completely submitting to Zhou Ze's actions.

"Snap..."

A crisp sound came from under Zhou Ze's foot,

And then,

A greenish belt wrapped around Zhou Ze's arm. Zhou Ze subconsciously retreated; this belt was very agile and shot right over.

When one end of the belt lifted and was less than a millimeter from Zhou Ze's eyes, it stopped.

This was no belt; it was clearly a sea snake, entirely green.

The sea snake flicked its tongue. After gaining a perfect attacking posture, it stopped, seeming to only want to deter Zhou Ze.

The water around them began to increase, as if the contents of these twenty-odd people's stomachs would never run out. At this point, the water level in the living room had reached Zhou Ze's waist.

This was false, yet it was real.

Zhou Ze could choose to escape this sensation, then choose to leave, but that would mean admitting defeat, stepping down from the ring.

Not to mention whether he'd get his service fee, he wouldn't be able to collect these souls for his业绩¹.

"Plop..."

The painting hanging on the living room wall was also washed down by the water and slowly floated towards Zhou Ze.

Zhou Ze had previously thought this idol was strange, because in ordinary homes, people usually hung images of Maitreya Buddha, Guanyin, or the God of Wealth in their halls, but the deity in this painting was clearly not a common one.

The figure in the painting was a man, with a fish-like body but human hands and feet, riding a two-headed dragon. It was definitely a god, but ordinary households almost never hung this; it was quite unconventional.

At this moment, the sea snake seemed to be slowly contracting its body. Zhou Ze also felt a clamping force on his wrist; this was a warning, the second warning.

Warning Zhou Ze,

That this matter,

He didn't need to interfere.

The painting slowly floated in front of Zhou Ze, touching his body.

Zhou Ze frowned slightly and thought hard. Finally, he remembered who this deity in the painting was!

So, he really had to thank himself for reading more books after becoming a bookstore owner. He'd sit on the sofa downstairs, drinking coffee and reading books when he had nothing to do, and he'd specifically brushed up on ancient supernatural stories.

This was...the Sea God!

For people today, when the Sea God is mentioned, the first thoughts are usually Mazu or Poseidon. However, in Chinese mythology, there is actually an older Sea God.

A passage from "Shanhaijing, Great Wilderness East": "In the isle of the Eastern Sea there is a god, with a human face and bird body, wearing two yellow snakes as earrings, and treading on two yellow snakes, named Yu Guo. The Yellow Emperor begat Yu Guo, Yu Guo begat Yu Jing, Yu Jing resides in the Northern Sea, Yu Guo resides in the Eastern Sea, thus being the Sea God."

The ancient Sea God. Moreover, considering the old man upstairs started his business in maritime smuggling, hanging this idol in his home was understandable.

But what did this mean?

A group of deceased relatives who died at sea suddenly returning for revenge five years later?

Who brought them back?

Who allowed them to return?

People who died in remote places, especially those who died unnaturally, their souls are actually very difficult to return. That's why in folk customs, when burning scriptures and joss paper, there is an indispensable step called "summoning the soul," meaning to bring back the souls of those being commemorated to enjoy the incense and offerings from their descendants.

And those who died at sea, they either went directly to hell, or even if they could remain as souls, they'd be like in "Pirates of the Caribbean," only able to sink to the bottom of the sea or drift around with some ghost ship.

Now, this entire family, neat and tidy, came back together, sitting properly, to visit the old man. Without external force pushing them, without the tacit approval of a certain party,

Is it possible?

Could it be,

Did the Sea God truly become enraged?

It's almost certain that there was something suspicious about the deaths of the old man's family, and the old man married this woman that very year.

If a certain great deity truly became enraged and came to mete out punishment and retribution,

Would he, a mere ghost messenger,

Truly have no right to stop it?

Moreover, to go against a sea entity for the sake of "making money,"

Isn't that a bit foolish?

Zhou Ze looked up. The woman and the old man should be upstairs. The woman wanted the old man to die of natural causes to inherit his estate, and spiritual entities wouldn't be caught on surveillance.

"Hey, buddy, let's talk about something. Can the old man die a more natural death?

And then, can I take the old man's new wife upstairs with me?"

Zhou Ze asked the painting.

"Hiss!"

The sea snake suddenly became enraged,

And directly opened its fangs, biting towards Zhou Ze's chest.

Zhou Ze's eyes narrowed. He had been on guard against this snake. He immediately gripped the snake's tail with his fingertips, and the tongue stopped mere centimeters from Zhou Ze's chest.

"You won't even talk? Give me some room for negotiation, Big Brother."

Zhou Ze said with a bitter smile.

Although I'm a ghost messenger, the lowest-ranking Yin Division cadre, I'm still a cadre, after all. Don't ignore me like this, big shot.

"Hiss, hiss, hiss, hiss!"

The sea snake twisted its body frantically,

With a "crunch,"

The snake's body broke directly, and its head flew to Zhou Ze's chest, biting into his body.

In an instant,

Zhou Ze felt not bodily injury, but a sharp pain in his soul, as if his soul had been pierced by the snake's fangs, leaving two holes.

Cold sweat immediately poured down, and Zhou Ze knelt down, one hand on the ground to prevent himself from falling into the "water."

"Hoo... hoo..."

Zhou Ze forcibly pulled the snake's head out,

His black fingernails directly crushed the snake's head.

"You're being unreasonable..."

Zhou Ze muttered, his face growing darker and darker,

Then, he slowly looked up, and in the depths of his eyes, black light flowed,

"Then I'd like to see if you can actually come ashore from the sea and show off!"

***
¹ 业绩 (yèjì): performance, achievement, accomplishment. In this context, it refers to the number of souls Zhou Ze collects as a ghost messenger, which would count towards his professional performance or quota.

title: 第一百六十章 海神的憤怒！
content:
"I say, little sister, is your boss's side job a Taoist priest or a monk?"

On the balcony, the woman took out a thin cigarette and silently puffed on it. At home, under surveillance, she would never smoke; she always deliberately maintained the image of a good, virtuous wife.

But for some reason, at this moment, she felt restless and wanted to calm her emotions with a cigarette.

"You've got it backward. Running the bookstore is the side job," Bai Yingying replied.

"Oh, how interesting."

The woman reached out to help Bai Yingying tidy her hair bun, and said softly, "Did he brainwash you? You worship him so much?"

Bai Yingying looked at the woman with a gaze that suggested she was looking at an idiot.

The woman shook her head. She didn't believe it, but as she had said, since Wang Ke recommended him, she was willing to throw a few million *yuan* away to try.

The old man, curled up at the bedroom door, looked at his wife and Bai Yingying, waving and shouting, "Come in! Quickly, hide inside! They'll come, they're coming, they really are coming!"

The woman ignored her husband and continued to smoke her cigarette.

Bai Yingying paid him even less mind. She was worried about her boss downstairs, wondering if anything unexpected would happen to him.

The boss had just unleashed his full power in Yancheng, and now his physical condition was very poor. In other words, his skills were still on cooldown, and the risk factor would naturally increase.

"Bang!"

The living room door downstairs was pushed open.

Zhou Ze, covered in cold sweat, stumbled out. He was drenched from head to toe, as if soaked in sweat.

"Huff… huff…"

Lying on the ground, Zhou Ze gasped for air, as if air was precious to him, extremely cherished.

"Boss!"

Bai Yingying on the balcony called out anxiously.

Zhou Ze scrambled to his feet, picked up the cane that had fallen beside him, and waved to her, signaling Bai Yingying not to come down. Then he walked back into the living room.

About ten minutes later,

Zhou Ze tumbled out again. This time, Zhou Ze lay for a full five minutes before slowly getting up. Supporting himself with his cane, Zhou Ze looked a bit shaky.

"Boss…"

Bai Yingying called out again.

"Don't come down. Protect them. I refuse to believe that a mighty dragon can't overpower a local snake!"

Zhou Ze continued to walk inside.

The woman blew out a smoke ring and said, "What a convincing performance."

Evidently, she thought Zhou Ze was putting on a show, just like those Taoist priests performing rituals, simply to entertain the audience and earn money.

"Uh…"

The woman was speechless,

Because Bai Yingying's hand was directly gripping her neck,

Her feet were already off the ground. This high school girl had effortlessly lifted her with just one hand.

"This isn't a performance."

Bai Yingying said very seriously,

"If anything really happens to the boss, rest assured, I will definitely take it out on you."

"He… he himself… for… for money…" the woman struggled to retort.

"You're a woman, don't you know a basic principle?" Bai Yingying retorted.

"What… what…"

"That is, don't reason with a woman."

...

Zhou Ze re-entered the living room. By now, the living room was almost completely flooded with liquid, and the twenty-odd people were still continuously spitting out water.

It was truly endless, a genuine deluge.

And the sea snake, which Zhou Ze had initially decapitated, had now transformed into a water python, with a thick, barrel-like body, swimming back and forth, exuding immense pressure.

However, upon closer inspection, the giant python's body was also bruised and battered, with many places missing scales. Clearly, it had been severely wounded in its repeated clashes with Zhou Ze.

"Hiss hiss hiss…"

The water python charged again.

Zhou Ze raised his head, gritting his teeth, and extended his hands. The tips of his fingernails were bleeding again, clearly reaching their breaking point from the strain.

His body was indeed somewhat weak from the previous exertions in Yancheng.

If he were at his peak, Zhou Ze felt he wouldn't be in such a sorry state.

This was just a sea snake, even if it claimed the title of a Sea God; it was still just a snake. In a one-on-one fight, he wouldn't be intimidated.

Zhou Ze was actually worried that if a 'Sea God' truly existed in this world, his choice this time might provoke them.

Of course, they hadn't given him a choice either.

Zhou Ze wanted to back down, to retreat. He preferred not to fight, to avoid poking the tiger's whiskers if possible, but the other party's attitude was too aggressive, not giving him any room to back down.

Boss Zhou loved money, and he loved performance, but he loved his life more.

"Hiss hiss…"

The water python's body collided with Zhou Ze again, sending him tumbling to the ground, his face pale. But Zhou Ze's fingernails, seizing the opportunity, plunged into the water python's body, extracting a red halo of light, which he instantly crushed!

Next, the water python and Zhou Ze lay on the ground together, staring at each other.

The water python tried to coil up several times but failed. Zhou Ze also wanted to get up, but he couldn't.

One man and one snake, staring each other down, refusing to concede defeat, locked in a stalemate.

"Aren't you tired?" Zhou Ze said.

The water python didn't respond, just stared intently at Zhou Ze.

"Did the Sea God really send you?" Zhou Ze continued to ask.

The water python still didn't respond.

Zhou Ze took a deep breath. You could actually talk to a person, but with a beast,

How do you talk?

As if discerning Zhou Ze's thoughts, the water python suddenly raised its head, its gaze filled with anger as it stared at Zhou Ze.

Huh,

Just like that monkey,

Can it directly sense people's thoughts?

"Buzz!"

The water python began to tremble. In an instant, its body started to disintegrate, but from its shattering body, countless thumb-sized small snakes began to emerge.

This dense swarm of creatures began to surge towards Zhou Ze like an overwhelming tide!

"Get lost!"

Zhou Ze propped himself up with both hands, forcibly raising his head. His fingernails directly pierced into the floor, and wisps of black energy were squeezed out, forming a protective circle around him. All the small snakes that touched the black energy were annihilated.

The stalemate between the man and the snake seemed destined to continue. Both were at the end of their ropes, but they stubbornly persisted.

And at this moment, the twenty or so people who had been acting as "faucets" uniformly closed their mouths. Then, they slowly began to stand up.

They didn't walk towards Zhou Ze, nor did they walk towards the water python. Instead, they lined up, like elementary school students leaving school in the evening, and headed towards the staircase.

They were,

Going upstairs!

Zhou Ze wasn't sure if his arrival had stimulated them to act, or if he had just coincidentally arrived at the right time.

"Hiss hiss hiss..."

One fearless little snake actually penetrated Zhou Ze's black aura, its body compressing, then springing up, directly burrowing towards Zhou Ze's ear.

Zhou Ze felt a slick sensation in his ear; the thing was still trying hard to burrow deeper.

But there were even more small snakes all around. Zhou Ze didn't dare pull his hands out of the floor, otherwise he would experience the feeling of a "snake pit." It's said that ancient tyrannical rulers liked to play this game, throwing condemned people into snake dens.

But the disgusting sensation coming from his ear was truly too clear. If he didn't stop it, who knew where that thing would burrow to.

Tongcheng had a tradition of temple fairs. Zhou Ze remembered going to one with the orphanage when he was little. At the fair, there was a tent where for two *yuan* a ticket, a woman lay on a bed covered by a mosquito net, surrounded by many small snakes.

The woman would perform for the ticket-buyers, which involved taking a small snake, stuffing it into her nostril, and then the snake would slowly crawl out of her mouth.

As an observer then, it was astonishing, but Zhou Ze certainly didn't want to experience it himself.

But Zhou Ze had no other options now. He hadn't brought the Yin-Yang Scroll with him, because that thing would vibrate like a dildo when it encountered someone near death, annoying him endlessly.

Right,

He also had a bronze ring, but he didn't know what it was for. He had the ring on him, but what if putting it on killed him instead? Then he'd truly have no one to cry to.

Deep breaths, deep breaths, continuous deep breaths.

The slick thing in his ear was still burrowing inward, causing an unbearable itch.

Zhou Ze could only subconsciously lean his face, pressing his ear with his shoulder and arm, hoping to dislodge the thing.

At this moment, Zhou Ze suddenly remembered he still had two Ghost Messenger badges in his left pocket.

All in!

Pulling his hands out of the floor, Zhou Ze quickly took out a Ghost Messenger badge. Before the surrounding snake swarm could rush in, Zhou Ze rubbed his bloodied fingernail hard against the badge. Green smoke continuously rose from the badge, and then the badge began to crack, clearly rendered useless.

But the green smoke continued to rise, like a match being lit.

"Crack!"

Zhou Ze tossed the Ghost Messenger badge out the door.

The massive swarm of small snakes instantly abandoned Zhou Ze and pounced towards the Ghost Messenger badge outside.

It seemed that because the water python had split into so many tiny fragments, the intelligence of each individual had also been averaged out. Zhou Ze felt as if he had just been playing fetch with a dog.

And the family who had been heading upstairs also frantically rushed down, running into the snake swarm outside the living room. Clearly, the peculiar scent emitted when the Ghost Messenger badge burned had an incredibly strong attraction for ghostly entities!

At that moment, Zhou Ze didn't relax or pause to catch his breath. He immediately reached out and grabbed the portrait, unhesitatingly tearing it open with his fingernails.

"Rip!"

With a crisp sound,

The portrait tore open, and the small snakes inside and outside the house slowly began to evaporate. The family also slowly melted away.

"Bang!"

A gust of ghostly wind blew through, and the living room door closed.

Finally,

Everything returned to calm.

"Huff… huff…"

Zhou Ze knelt on the ground,

So tired,

Completely exhausted,

But,

Now it seems,

Perhaps the Sea God wasn't so impressive after all.

Boss Zhou was momentarily filled with a strong sense of accomplishment, feeling incredibly good about himself.

"Bang!"

"Bang!"

It seemed like the wind was picking up outside,

The wind continuously battered the door frame,

At first, Zhou Ze didn't pay it any mind, but slowly, he realized something was wrong. The floor was still shaking and tilting.

Zhou Ze used his last bit of strength to prop himself against the wall and stood up, staggering to the door,

Reaching out,

He pushed open the living room door,

Outside,

To his shock,

Lay a vast, boundless ocean!

title: 第一百六十一章 海中祭祀！
content:
"Oh, great sea, you are all water..."

Zhou Ze leaned against the doorframe, looking at the surging waves outside. He felt a bit helpless and had a headache, much like the feeling of standing up from a pile of corpses after a battle, only to find a group of enemy cavalry appearing before him.

It was as if all his previous efforts were a joke, a farce, utterly meaningless.

"Boss! Come quickly, Boss!"

Bai Yingying suddenly called out from above, as if in an emergency.

Zhou Ze looked up, then tried to stretch his hand outside. The touch was cold, exceptionally real.

In truth, everyone knew this was fake, it had to be fake.

This wasn't some mythical tale of the Dragon King flooding Chentang Pass to kill Nezha. Zhou Ze couldn't possibly believe that the Sea God would really cause a great flood to drown Tongcheng, just to bother him, a Ghost Messenger.

Firstly, the other party probably didn't possess such exaggerated powers.

Secondly, even if he did, he wouldn't dare to do so.

The seawater was fake, but the problem was, it could deceive all your senses, making you feel from top to bottom that you were drowning.

This could be a form of hypnosis, but it surpassed mere hypnosis. Ghosts typically used such methods to lure and kill people, but when this one used it, it was even more terrifying.

Zhou Ze believed that even if he made a wooden raft and drifted out now, the Sea God could probably make him drift on the sea for ten days to half a month without change, literally letting him die of thirst, hunger, or drowning.

Leaning against the wall, Zhou Ze slowly walked up the stairs. Bai Yingying had just called him.

As Zhou Ze laboriously came up the stairs, he found that he wasn't standing on the second floor of a residential house, but on the deck of a cruise ship.

"Boss, it's changed here."

Bai Yingying stood on the deck, calling out to Zhou Ze.

"Where are that old man and woman?" Zhou Ze asked.

Bai Yingying had been assigned to the second floor to protect the old man and the woman, but now Bai Yingying was alone.

Then, Zhou Ze instinctively sat down on a nearby chair, letting out a long sigh. There was a parasol above him, and drinks and alcohol next to him.

Zhou Ze was truly tired. His body, after being subjected to his continuous exertions, was incredibly lucky not to have fallen apart. Now, even a slight movement would cause all his joints to protest and ache.

"I'm not sure. I just felt a blur before my eyes, and then I found myself on a cruise ship."

Bai Yingying looked around and continued:

"Although I know all this is fake, similar to the illusion my Lady used before, it's really so realistic. Even the salty taste in the air is the same."

Zhou Ze nodded, picked up the cup next to him, poured himself some ice water, took two sips, and said:

"If I'm not mistaken, this cruise ship should be the one that had the accident five years ago. Look around, that family should be here." Zhou Ze reminded her.

"What do we do if we find them?"

"I don't know either. I can't perform illusions."

Zhou Ze reached out and massaged his temples. *When in Rome, do as the Romans do*, he thought. Since the Sea God wasn't willing to give up, he could only wait and respond. The disparity in their strengths was, after all, on different levels.

In fact, Zhou Ze had always been on the hot seat. The crucial reason was that the Sea God's position was too high, disdaining to talk to him, and naturally even more disdainful of negotiating terms with him.

Bai Yingying obediently went upstairs to search. The cruise ship had three levels: a middle deck level, an upper level, and a cabin level. Soon, Bai Yingying came down from above and said:

"No one upstairs."

"Then go down and check again."

Bai Yingying went down again. When Zhou Ze had come up earlier, the downstairs was still the original living room, but when Bai Yingying went down again, it had turned into the ship's cabins.

"Boss, still no one." Bai Yingying reported after checking.

"No one?"

This surprised Zhou Ze as well.

"Yeah, I checked every room downstairs, confirmed no one. Not even a single crew member. This cruise ship is just stopped on the sea by itself."

"This shouldn't be."

Zhou Ze muttered to himself,

Those in high positions always liked to play tricks with "cause and effect" cycles, perhaps because it seemed more prestigious, just like Patriarch Bodhi tapping Sun Wukong's head three times.

Before, when he saw the sea and then the cruise ship, Zhou Ze thought that the Sea God intended for them to witness what exactly happened five years ago.

Or perhaps, the Sea God wanted to both punish those he intended to punish and also display a high-level maneuver, leaving you thoroughly impressed, clapping your hands and exclaiming:

"Oh,
so that's how it is,
indeed,
how unexpected,
666666666!"

But now you only produce a vast sea and a cruise ship, and besides me and Bai Yingying, there are no extras?

How is this script supposed to proceed?

Could it be that the Sea God's battery is low, so he only managed half and couldn't complete the rest?

"Check again, see if there's any other information."

Zhou Ze could only grit his teeth and stand up, first heading downstairs. Bai Yingying went upstairs to check again.

"Please don't be a half-finished product due to low battery."

Zhou Ze could only inwardly plead. Because if the Sea God was just setting up a stage to show off in front of him, a Ghost Messenger, the worst outcome would be the Sea God's success, having shown him up, then the people who were supposed to die would die, he wouldn't have saved anyone, and the final payment would be gone. But after that, they could all go home.

But if it's a half-finished product, how is this script supposed to continue?

Are he and Bai Yingying just going to stand here awkwardly?

God knows how long this illusion can last. He's completely clueless about this, and Bai Yingying might know a little, but she's just a dabbler. He can't possibly stay in this wretched place for decades, a whole cycle, waiting for Bai Yingying to become more powerful or for himself to evolve further before they can leave?

During this time, not only was there no plum juice, but there was no food either. His body couldn't endure going without food for so long.

Lost in thought, Zhou Ze even specifically stuck his head out the porthole to look at the sea below.

Are there any fish?

If there were fish, he could survive by eating them.

But upon looking, Zhou Ze suddenly noticed a mass of black material below the waterline on the side of the ship, clinging there like seaweed, continuously swaying with the waves, but never leaving the deck area.

Zhou Ze instinctively bent down, extending his cane to try and poke it in the water, but failed, almost falling into the sea himself.

With his current physical state, comparable to an eighty-year-old grandfather, falling in would truly mean drowning. He wouldn't even be able to thrash a few times in a dying struggle.

"Yingying."

Zhou Ze called up to her.

"Thump-thump-thump..."

Bai Yingying quickly ran down.

"Boss, what's wrong?"
