"Go into the water and see what this is." Zhou Ze pointed below and said.

Bai Yingying leaned over and also noticed the black mass of seaweed. She immediately leaped down.

Her posture was graceful,
her movements standard,
the splash was minimal.

After entering the water, Bai Yingying continued to dive due to inertia. Zhou Ze waited above.

About half a minute later, Bai Yingying surfaced. At this point, the female zombie was completely soaked, and even her skin color was somewhat pale. Zhou Ze didn't think it was because the seawater was too cold and Bai Yingying was freezing.

Zombies afraid of cold?

Is that even possible?

"What is that?" Zhou Ze asked.

"Boss, they... they..."

"Hurry up and tell me." Zhou Ze urged.

This concerned whether he and Bai Yingying could leave this cursed place.

"They're all down there, Boss, the whole family, all of them."

Bai Yingying pointed below.

"All down there?" Zhou Ze was surprised, and then realizing something, he pointed at the black seaweed below and said, "Is that hair?"

"Yes, it's hair." Bai Yingying affirmed.

"They all drowned?"

"Uh..."

Bai Yingying showed a very bewildered expression, a little conflicted, a little difficult, and a little helpless.

If it weren't for the distance being too far and his cane not being long enough, Zhou Ze would have wanted to raise his cane and tap her head. At a time like this, she was still soaking in the water and trying to be cute?

"Boss, you jump down and see for yourself. It's not easy to describe." Bai Yingying simply said.

"..." Zhou Ze.

If I could jump down, why didn't I just jump down earlier instead of calling you?

"Boss, come down, I'll catch you." Bai Yingying opened her arms. "The things down there, you really have to see them for yourself."

Zhou Ze hesitated for a moment, then simply dropped his cane, turned around, and actually leaped off the deck.

There was a "plop" as he entered the water,

and then Zhou Ze was held by Bai Yingying.

"Boss, take a deep breath. I'll take you down. If you need to breathe, just pinch my chest."

"..." Zhou Ze.

Immediately after, seeing Zhou Ze take a deep breath, Bai Yingying directly took Zhou Ze down. Her physical quality was very strong, even surpassing professional swimmers, so even with Zhou Ze as a burden, she was still agile underwater.

Once underwater,

Zhou Ze first saw a large iron cage leaning against the side of the ship, as if nailed in place.

Inside this iron cage was a large offering table, on which sat a deity statue and a spirit tablet, unmistakably belonging to the Sea God. Even the offerings on it were fixed in place, remaining stationary relative to the iron cage underwater.

At the same time,

inside the iron cage,

twenty-plus people,

men, women, and children,

were constantly drifting with the waves inside the iron cage.

Some were at the bottom,
some in the middle.

A woman, probably around twenty years old, was the most pitiful.

Her head was caught in a gap at the very top of the iron cage, accidentally fixed in place,

and her hair extended outwards,

above,

floating,

floating...

——

Sorry, everyone, Long is feeling a bit unwell today and also has some matters to attend to, so the update is late. There will be another chapter in the early hours of the morning.

Don't panic,
Hold tight to Long!

title: 第一百六十二章 人家真的好怕怕呢！
content:
Zhou Ze looked on in shock; this display was too grand.

Even the Taoist priests in TV shows, setting up an altar for a sacrifice, didn't have such a grand setup. In ordinary temples, a sacrifice with some fruit and a pig's head was already considered quite well-off.

And here,

It was a live sacrifice!

More than twenty living people,

That whole family,

Were intentionally placed here, as offerings, to the Sea God!

Zhou Ze had a unique background; he had even been to hell and had seen many people and ghosts over two lifetimes. Logically, there weren't many things that could shake his mind.

But the scene before him caused Zhou Ze to lose control of his composure in an instant.

It must be known that among them were not only elderly women with completely white hair and wrinkled skin but also very young children. These people should have had their own lives, their own laughter and joy, but now they were all confined here. They couldn't even drift freely like fish, only crashing from one side of the cage to the other with the waves.

Even after death, they were still kept in captivity!

The person who arranged and prepared all this seemed almost afraid that their meticulously prepared offerings would spill out, causing the Sea God to not eat fully, comfortably, or sufficiently, showing such thoughtful care.

"Gulp..."

His body was a bit weak now, which meant his breath-holding time was shorter. Zhou Ze reached out and lifted Bai Yingying's wrist, which was wrapped around his waist, signaling her to bring him up for air.

However,

Bai Yingying was unresponsive, as if she felt nothing.

Zhou Ze pinched her hand,

She remained unresponsive, unmoving.

Zhou Ze grabbed her arm,

She still seemed completely unaware.

Zhou Ze turned his head and glared at her.

He then realized that Bai Yingying had her eyes closed!

"I can't see,

I can't see anything, la, I can't see."

Zhou Ze's right index fingernail grew longer,

Bai Yingying's body suddenly trembled,

She immediately embraced Zhou Ze and surfaced,

"Hoo... hoo... hoo..."

After catching his breath, Zhou Ze felt much better. He didn't dwell on Bai Yingying's earlier little trick and simply said,

"Let's go up."

"Alright, Boss!"

Bai Yingying also didn't mention what had just happened. Then, like a small King Kong, she wrapped her right arm around Zhou Ze's waist, carried him like a rag doll, grabbed the side of the boat with her other hand, and climbed straight up.

Clean, swift, and effortless.

Zhou Ze sat on the chair first, catching his breath while waiting for some of the water to drip off his clothes, otherwise, his clothes would be too heavy and difficult to wear.

"Boss, what exactly was going on down there just now?"

"You don't know?"

"How could I know?"

"Wasn't your lady once found having an affair with a scholar and then drowned in a pig cage?"

"Uh..."

"Someone is using living people as sacrifices, offerings to the Sea God," Zhou Ze said.

"As sacrifices? Offerings?" Bai Yingying was astonished. Even as a zombie, she found such a thing too cruel and utterly inhumane.

"So what's going on now? We're here, and there's an iron cage full of corpses down below. What's all this for?"

"I'm not sure, but I have a feeling that this matter might be inextricably linked to that old man or that woman. At the very least, that old man definitely has a hand in it."

Why would the old man definitely be involved?

And the fox spirit might be an exception?

Bai Yingying thought to herself.

Just then, the wind picked up, and it was strong. The previously calm sea suddenly became turbulent with waves, causing the yacht to sway back and forth constantly, as if it could capsize at any moment.

Zhou Ze continued to sit in the chair. To be honest, he was feeling a bit helpless right now. If he were a Judge now, perhaps he would have the qualifications for an equal exchange with the other party, but his current self was clearly not taken seriously by them.

Of course, the most important question at hand was, in traditional beliefs, was this Sea God considered good or evil?

Did he accept the offerings and give the sacrificers a corresponding return, or did the sacrificers' actions make him feel anger and desecration, so he specifically came to punish them?

At his level, traditional notions of good and evil should be difficult to constrain his actions, right?

"Clang..."

Waves of seawater crashed over, and the yacht's swaying motion grew increasingly violent. Bai Yingying stood firm, one hand gripping Zhou Ze's shoulder, helping him stabilize on the deck.

"Boss, the boat's going to capsize."

"I know."

Zhou Ze leaned on Bai Yingying's arm and managed to stand up. When he looked ahead, he found what appeared to be land—no, to be precise, it should be an island, an island of considerable size.

"Whoosh!"

A harsh sound of metal friction rang out, and the yacht finally gave way, completely flipping over. Bai Yingying was quick-witted, grabbing Zhou Ze and leaping into the sea before the yacht capsized.

So, Zhou Ze was lucky. How many drowning victims, before they drowned, wished they had a Bai Yingying by their side.

Bai Yingying swam while keeping Zhou Ze's head above water so he could breathe fresh air. Zhou Ze was meticulously cared for, like a baby kangaroo nestled in its mother's pouch.

He could only tilt his head up, breathing and spitting out the splashes of water that got into his mouth and nostrils,

While... looking up at the sky.

Finally, Bai Yingying reached the shore.

Zhou Ze lay on the beach, breathing heavily.

"Boss, there's another person lying over there."

Bai Yingying suddenly pointed towards the beach and said.

Zhou Ze turned to look and, indeed, there lay a young man, dressed in tattered clothes. If Zhou Ze himself was a salted fish before, then that one was a salted fish about to be roasted dry.

"I'll go kill him."

Bai Yingying said, adhering to her policy of nipping any potential danger in the bud.

Zhou Ze reached out and stopped Bai Yingying, shaking his head and saying, "Don't you feel like that guy looks a bit familiar?"

"Familiar?" Bai Yingying strained to look, and finally, she seemed to recall something, saying, "He looks so much like that old man. Is he the old man's son? Oh no, or maybe his grandson."

"No, that's not right," Zhou Ze denied.

At this moment, a python crawled out of the seawater.

This python also looked somewhat familiar to Zhou Ze; it really resembled the one he had fought before, except this snake now appeared smaller, and its scales weren't as thick as before.

The snake slowly crawled onto the young man's body. There was no hint of murderous intent or ferocity about it, and it seemed completely unaware that Zhou Ze and Bai Yingying were standing right beside it. It simply stared at the person beneath it.

"Boss, this snake is almost a spirit," Bai Yingying suddenly said.

"I can tell."

This python exuded a sense of wisdom and human-like emotion, somewhat reminiscent of the monkey Zhou Ze first encountered.

The python opened its mouth, not to bite the young man in front of it, but to bite its own body, creating an opening. Then, the snake's body coiled around the young man, bringing the wounded part of itself to the man's mouth.

At first, the python's blood slowly dripped into the man's mouth. Soon, the man seemed to regain some consciousness and began to actively suck the snake's blood. The color in his face also slowly returned.

Finally, the man let go, let out a long sigh, and then opened his eyes. When he saw the python for the first time, the man trembled all over in fear.

The python didn't linger, but swam directly back into the sea from the beach, leaving a puddle of blood on the ground.

After the python entered the sea and swam away, the man immediately scrambled up, kowtowing several times towards the direction the python had gone, muttering something, and then reached down to pick up a remaining snake scale from the ground.

"What is he shouting?" Bai Yingying asked. The man's dialect was quite thick, and Bai Yingying couldn't hear very clearly.

"He's thanking the Sea God for saving him," Zhou Ze replied.

The man walked into the island's forest and disappeared.

"So the question is, Boss, how do we leave?"

Bai Yingying asked, tilting her head. Then, as if something occurred to her, she asked,

"I think being Robinson Crusoe here would be quite nice too."

There was "Robinson Crusoe" in the bookstore, and Bai Yingying had read it in her spare time.

Zhou Ze felt that his maid had been acting a bit strangely lately, as if she had watched too many Korean dramas and gone a bit silly.

Just then, the yacht that had capsized earlier reappeared on the sea.

"Wow, Boss, the boat is back."

"I can see that."

The yacht had returned again, but this time, there were people on board, and many of them.

An old man sat in a wheelchair, being pushed off the boat by an attendant. The attendant was a woman, her face veiled in white gauze, but from her figure and demeanor, she also looked somewhat familiar.

"Her chest has sagged a bit, her butt has gotten a bit fatter, and her waist has thickened a bit. Boss, if you reverse the aging process a bit, wouldn't she resemble a certain someone?"

It was that woman, the old man's wife.

Many people disembarked from the ship. The old man sat in a wheelchair, with an IV drip hanging, evidently, he didn't have much time left.

Just then, Zhou Ze's gaze sharpened instantly. He saw another priest disembarking from the yacht—an Asian priest.

Yes, that's right,

This guy was the one who stole his ashes!

However, this priest looked a bit younger now, with fairer skin, a round face, and an innocent appearance.

He walked up to the old man, who motioned for the woman to leave. The woman walked away, quite far, as some things were not convenient for her to know, and she was very self-aware and discreet.

The old man seemed to be saying something to the priest, who nodded in agreement.

Then,

The old man pulled a black scale from his embrace.

The priest looked at the scale, then lowered his head and whispered something in the old man's ear.

Upon hearing this, the old man's face first showed shock, then struggle. He seemed to be hesitating, agonizing, and finally, he looked at his still-hanging IV drip and then at the graceful woman standing in the distance.

His fingers clenched the scale tightly, veins protruding.

Then he gritted his teeth, his face full of brutality,

At the same time, he nodded.

The priest bowed slightly beside him.

"Boss, their voices are too low, I can't hear them."

Bai Yingying said with some helplessness. She tried to walk forward to get closer to the old man and the priest, but no matter how far she walked forward, the distance between them and her increased proportionally.

Zhou Ze waved his hand,

Saying, "No need to listen."

"Then how do we leave here?" Bai Yingying was a little anxious.

"We can leave," Zhou Ze smiled. "Actually, there is no Sea God at all."

Bai Yingying didn't understand, but Zhou Ze himself didn't understand. Yes, there was no Sea God.

"Huh?"

"There is no Sea God, only a snake that was mistaken for one."

Zhou Ze looked up at the sky and shouted,

"You couldn't beat me, and I seriously injured you. This illusion can't last much longer, can it?

Especially now that I know you're not actually the Sea God, this illusion has lost ninety-nine percent of its deterrent power. Do you think you still have a chance to kill me in here?"

"Fizz, fizz, fizz..."

A snake's head slowly emerged from the sand next to Zhou Ze.

All the surrounding illusions began to shatter.

Zhou Ze was now sitting on the living room floor, and Bai Yingying was standing next to him. Everything around them had returned to normal.

"I didn't intend to kill you with this..."

The python, scarred from Zhou Ze's fingernails, actually spoke human words at this moment, though its voice was somewhat sharp.

"Tsk, tsk." Zhou Ze reached out, patted the snake's head, then looked up, somewhat helplessly, and said, "You actually wanted to kill me directly at first. You didn't expect that I could get you into this state, so you changed your approach and resorted to circumvention."

If the hard way didn't work, it tried the soft way.

"He deserves to die..." the python said.

"I have a monkey at home; you two should have something in common. But given your condition, you clearly won't live much longer before turning to dust. It's a pity."

"He deserves to die..." The python seemed capable of only that one sentence.

Zhou Ze did think of the monkey, recalling his struggle with that monkey in the hospital back then, and the eventual outcome, including how his conscience was "eaten" because of it.

The same choice, but this time, Zhou Ze's choice was different. He raised his hand and said very seriously,

"That woman shouldn't die."

The python hesitated for a moment, then nodded slightly, as if agreeing.

Then, Zhou Ze lowered his hand and looked elsewhere.

The python nodded at Zhou Ze, rubbed its forked tongue against Zhou Ze's arm, and then, dragging its broken body, slithered towards the stairs.

Bai Yingying was a bit confused, looking at Zhou Ze and asking, "Boss, didn't that snake save him? If it saved him back then, why does it want to kill him now?"

"It's simple. Sixty years ago, this python had just gained sentience and was cultivating to accumulate good deeds. So, it actively saved the young man who was washed ashore and near death after a shipwreck.

The young man survived, then prospered, earning a lot of money and becoming very wealthy and influential. Then the young man became an old man, riddled with disease and close to death.

The old man didn't want to die; he still had so much money and wanted to continue enjoying his life.

For others, beyond medical intervention, extending one's life was basically impossible. But the old man was different; he had seen the 'Sea God' when he was young. He regarded the snake that saved him as the Sea God.

So, the old man decided to use this to extend his life. He believed that if the Sea God saved him once sixty years ago, then sixty years later, the Sea God should be able to save him again.

He also found a rogue sorcerer..."

When speaking of that Japanese priest, Zhou Ze's eyes flashed with intense killing intent.

That scoundrel, this time, once his injuries healed, he must be killed. No matter what else came up, he absolutely had to be killed!

"That priest gave him a method for sacrificing to evil gods, which was to use the lives of his own relatives to extend his own life."

"Ah..." Bai Yingying exclaimed, "So the family who drowned on the yacht five years ago?"

"Didn't you see it? They were specially arranged by the old man for the sacrifice. He used his wife, sons, daughters, grandsons, great-grandsons, and so on, all as sacrifices to extend his own life."

"Then what?"

"He succeeded. Because he had that scale in his hand, and the method the priest gave him wasn't baseless, so he succeeded.

Didn't you see? Five years ago, the old man was in a wheelchair, ready to kick the bucket at any moment, but five years later, he can actually walk on his own and even have marital relations with his charming wife from time to time.

He succeeded, he really succeeded."

"So that means this python and the old man reached an agreement?" Bai Yingying asked. "Then why does this python want to kill him again five years later?"

Zhou Ze shook his head,

"There was no agreement. The python was tricked, badly tricked by that old man. It was originally cultivating for many years, following a very orthodox path, but because of the old man's sacrifice using its scale, it was passively forced into the sequence of evil gods, which is abhorrent to heaven and earth. Its efforts of the past century were largely ruined.

It was like a poisoned blessing; the python was unknowingly knocked out.

Perhaps that python even suffered some problem because of it, and it took five years to partially resolve it. Then, at all costs, even risking its own life and death, it came to land to seek revenge on this old man!

It was the one who saved him, but he ended up tricking it."

Bai Yingying nodded thoughtfully, "So, there's no Sea God at all?"

"I don't know."

"Then, Boss, did you let it go up for revenge this time?" Bai Yingying asked.

The implication was, you didn't do that with the monkey last time.

"I'm severely injured and can't beat it anymore. I don't want to risk my life," Zhou Ze explained.

Bai Yingying pouted, pointing to herself.

Meaning, "A snake that you nearly beat to a pulp, I can handle it."

"You're just a little girl, you're even afraid of mice and cockroaches, how could you possibly stop it, right?"

Upon hearing this, Bai Yingying understood,

She immediately clasped her hands over her chest and swayed,

"Ying ying ying,

Yes, really,

I'm so scared."

——————

PS: This chapter is over 5,000 words. I finished the story before posting it, no cliffhangers.

title: 第一百六十三章 她必須死
content:
The matter had concluded; the previous voyage, including the island and all, felt like a fleeting dream, ultimately, it was over.

Speaking ill of it, spirits and monsters truly can't be presented in a dignified manner; otherwise, this world wouldn't revolve around "humans." However, the deficiencies in human nature always provide them space to act, and some people even enjoy digging their own graves.

Zhou Ze wasn't sure if he should immerse himself in the worldview of ghosts or humans. In many instances, his own self-positioning was somewhat vague, so most of the time, he simply considered himself an observer.

Watching flowers bloom, watching them wither; watching people laugh, watching ghosts cry.
After seeing too much of anything, one eventually becomes numb.

Zhou Ze let Bai Yingying help him back up to the second floor. Everything here remained unchanged; even upon entering the room, Zhou Ze still saw the old man sleeping soundly on the sofa.

Bai Yingying was puzzled and asked, "Not dead?"
That python was released by Zhou Ze; could it be that it failed to kill the man?

Zhou Ze shook his head. The man was already dead; the dark aura on the old man’s *Yintang* (space between eyebrows) couldn't be concealed. Even if he didn't die instantly, he would perish in an extremely painful manner within the next few days, suffering immensely.

The woman lay on the ground, her skirt lifted, revealing a large expanse of her body.
Zhou Ze stared for a while.
Bai Yingying pouted beside him.

After a moment, Zhou Ze walked over and helped the woman tidy her clothes. They were both sound asleep. Many of the things that had happened to them earlier were akin to a dream, yet their fates had already changed several times over.

Zhou Ze walked around the house two more times. Behind a wall, he discovered half a snake's body, a small, green snake, already dried into a jerky.

Moreover, the house's door was somewhat unusual, with many strange patterns carved onto it. Zhou Ze asked Bai Yingying to help him make rubbings of these patterns.

Then, Zhou Ze didn't wake the woman to ask about the remaining payment and left directly with Bai Yingying.

After returning to the bookstore, about a week passed. Xu Qinglang also recovered from the terrifying atmosphere of that night and began to be responsible for everyone's three meals at the bookstore.

Coupled with one or two ghosts visiting the bookstore every night for business, Boss Zhou's life was quite fulfilling. Most importantly, his body had largely recovered.

Some matters that should have been resolved long ago also needed to be put on the agenda, such as the priest who had been causing trouble for five years; he deserved to go to hell.

"Call Lin Ke, let's meet at the bookstore tomorrow at noon," Zhou Ze told Bai Yingying, who was pouring him tea.

"Okay." Bai Yingying immediately pulled out her phone to send a message, then asked, "Boss, are we going to find that priest?"

Zhou Ze nodded. Although the primary reason for the old man's family's death was the old man's own "deluded" selfishness, that priest also played a significant role in promoting it.
Furthermore, the priest had stolen his ashes; this debt definitely needed to be settled.

"Boss, you seem to have forgotten something very important," Bai Yingying reminded him.

"What is it?"

"The final payment, there's still eight million due."

"Heh."
Zhou Ze chuckled.

"Boss, you can't be like that. Just because she's pretty, you're not going to charge her? Being pretty doesn't put food on the table."

"That one million *yuan* deposit should last for a long time. I already gave you the money I borrowed from you, right? Go redeem your two burial objects."

"No, Boss, how can you live like this? You don't know the cost of living unless you manage a household. You casually dismiss eight million as nothing; how are you going to live your life in the future?
It's eight million *yuan*, not eight hundred *yuan*!"
Bai Yingying spoke with the tone of someone who believes men are indeed unreliable.

"Boss, there's news in the paper." The Old Taoist, who had just finished mopping the floor, walked over with a newspaper.

The old man had died, and it made the newspaper. Many people attended his funeral. The cause of death was attributed to severe illness, which he couldn't overcome.
The old man had been a respectable person in life.
His funeral was grand. In fact, that's how this world is: many people might be glorious in public, but who knows about their debauchery behind the scenes? One persona in front of people, another behind them—this kind of reversal has long made the public numb.

"Ah!"
Bai Yingying suddenly cried out!

"What's wrong?" Zhou Ze, who was holding his tea, was startled by her scream and spilled some tea.

"Look here, Boss," Bai Yingying pointed to another page and said.
Zhou Ze looked over. The headline read:
"Wealthy Widow Donates All Assets."

It was that woman; she had donated all the assets she could inherit.
"Why would she do that?" Bai Yingying found it difficult to understand.

Then, Bai Yingying looked at the calm-faced Zhou Ze and asked, "Boss, did you know this already?"
Zhou Ze shook his head.

"Eight million *yuan*, your eight million was also donated to Project Hope."
"Let it be donated then."

"Boss, what do you mean, 'let it be donated'?
This is money being donated, not eight million *yuan* of essence being donated.
Besides, Boss, I'm poor too. I want to buy more burial objects. Why don't you donate some to me too?"
Bai Yingying leaned in, acting cute.

"What eight million *yuan*?" Xu Qinglang walked over, holding coffee.

"It's about that very rich female client I told you about last time. She said she'd pay an eight-million-yuan final installment after her troubles were resolved, but her husband died, and she donated all the inheritance," Bai Yingying explained to Xu Qinglang.

"Is it that exaggerated?" Xu Qinglang was also startled; the donated amount must be in the hundreds of millions.

"Oh, look who's here," the Old Taoist pointed at the doorway and said.

Standing at the entrance was a woman, dressed in a black gown, veiled in black gauze.
Many men are familiar with this attire:
the attire of a widow.

The woman walked in, nodded slightly at Zhou Ze, and said, "I'm returning to my hometown county to live. My apologies for your final payment."

"Hey, what do you mean, 'my apologies'? Do you know how poor my boss is? He can't even pay salaries, and you swallowed eight million *yuan* of his!" the Old Taoist boldly exclaimed.

"Old Taoist, the floor's dirty."
"Huh?"
Then, the Old Taoist saw Zhou Ze pretend to spill his tea on the floor and immediately shut up, wisely.

"I'm truly sorry, but you won't mind, will you?" the woman looked at Zhou Ze and said.

"I don't mind. I just hope that when my living conditions improve and I go eat barbecue on a cruise ship, it'll be calm."

"You jest."

The woman turned around and pushed open the door, walking out. She seemed to have come specifically to say these words.

At this moment, Xu Qinglang finally came to his senses. She was too similar, truly too similar. Although she wore a black veil over her face, her voice and figure were exactly like that woman's!

Xu Qinglang immediately prepared to chase after her, but his hand was firmly clasped by Zhou Ze.

"What are you doing!" Xu Qinglang yelled at Zhou Ze.

"No matter what relationship you have with her, you'd best not go."

"Impossible, there are some things I must get clear!" Xu Qinglang insisted.

Zhou Ze shook his head somewhat helplessly, then stood up, "Alright, I'll go with you."

Immediately, Zhou Ze and Xu Qinglang walked out of the bookstore together. The woman was still walking ahead. Xu Qinglang quickly caught up and directly grabbed the woman's shoulders with both hands.

The woman's body trembled, and she asked, "Little Quail, what do you mean by this?"

Xu Qinglang's Adam's apple bobbed a few times, but he didn't know what to say—should he mention his own fleeing in disarray?

"Your hand."
After all, she was a woman he had been intimate with; though it was a fleeting affair, it was a bond forged through the exchange of bodily fluids.

Xu Qinglang reached out and grasped the woman's wrist. It was covered in scars. "This is a special ointment I brought from my hometown; it can remove scars."

The woman looked at Xu Qinglang with a half-smile, then at Zhou Ze standing beside her. Finally, her gaze settled on Zhou Ze.

"I didn't know you had a relationship with him," Zhou Ze explained.
The woman nodded, indicating she believed him.

Then she actively hugged Xu Qinglang tightly.
Xu Qinglang was stunned.
She was wearing a widow's dress, and Zhou Ze was standing beside them. Xu Qinglang immediately felt at a loss.

Then,
a dry retching sound ended the awkwardness.

"Ugh..."
The woman threw up.
She vomited blood.
It splattered all over Xu Qinglang.
Then she slumped down weakly.

"What's going on! What's going on!"
Xu Qinglang yelled, looking at his blood-soaked hands.
The woman had collapsed to the ground, unconscious.

"She took poison," Zhou Ze said.

"Then resuscitate her, save her, what are you standing here for, what are you doing!"
Xu Qinglang shook Zhou Ze's arm with one hand.

"Can't save her," Zhou Ze said calmly.

"Why?"

"She chose to die."

"How could she choose to die?" Xu Qinglang asked, puzzled.

"She has to die."

Zhou Ze lit a cigarette and said, "Call 120. She took the poison herself, it has nothing to do with you. Or, you can burn some joss paper. Anyway, come back after you've handled her."

Turning around, Zhou Ze walked back into the bookstore.

Bai Yingying saw Zhou Ze return alone and immediately asked, "Boss, where's Handsome Xu?"

"He has something to take care of."

"With that woman?" Bai Yingying looked enlightened. "That woman must have been overcome by his looks, abandoned you, and taken a liking to Handsome Xu, right?"

"She died."

"What?"

"Died."

"How could she have died?"

"Committed suicide."

"How could she commit suicide?"
In Bai Yingying's view, that woman was materialistic, a gold-digger, and loved enjoyment. How could such a person commit suicide?

"Why did Daji die?"

"What?"
Bai Yingying didn't understand why her boss suddenly asked her that.

"You know the story of *Investiture of the Gods* (Fengshen Bang), right?"

"I know," Bai Yingying replied.

"Then, why did she die in the end?"

"Because she was a bad woman! She harmed loyal officials and the innocent. She deserved to die!"

"Hmm, initially, it was because King Zhou was disrespectful in the Nuwa Temple. Nuwa was enraged, so she sent down three fox spirits, including Daji, to bewitch King Zhou and accelerate the end of the Shang Dynasty's destiny.
In the end, Daji succeeded. The Shang Dynasty fell, and Daji originally thought she could return to report her mission because her task was indeed completed.
Jiang Ziya chased her, and she ran to find Nuwa. Nuwa said:
You deserve to die.
I told you to bewitch King Zhou to end the Shang Dynasty's destiny early, but I didn't tell you to harm loyal officials and exploit the common people.
Then,
Nuwa killed Daji."

"This... Boss, do you mean..."

"The design of the house, and the snake jerky hidden in the house for several years, plus the old man eventually living in that house only with her."

"That's how it is..." Bai Yingying mused thoughtfully.

"So, she had to die."

title: 第一百六十四章 二十四道疤
content:
Zhou Ze closed his eyes. He couldn't sleep, but he liked the feeling of lying on the sofa by the glass window, bathed in sunlight.

In his previous life, he was always working, operating by the surgical table, rarely stopping. In this life, he could finally make up for it.

After listening to Zhou Ze's explanation, Bai Yingying seemed to understand, and yet not entirely. But at least one thing was certain: Zhou Ze had actually known about this beforehand.

And because of that, the boss wasn't bothered about the remaining eight million yuan final payment. No, it was probably because the boss knew that the woman wouldn't come to a good end, so he couldn't be bothered to ask her for it. It wouldn't be recouped anyway.

Bai Yingying ran her hands through her hair and stomped over to the bar counter.

The old Taoist was eating peanuts with the monkey, one for him, one for the monkey. Man and monkey were eating with relish. When Zhou Ze and Bai Yingying were explaining earlier, the old Taoist had listened nearby, then smiled and walked away.

"Old Taoist, let me ask you a question. Did you understand what the boss just said?" Bai Yingying reached out and nudged the old Taoist's shoulder.

"Huh?" The old Taoist turned his head, looking at Bai Yingying with some surprise, then said, "Didn't the boss just explain it to you?"

"I didn't entirely get it." Bai Yingying took a deep breath, then exhaled heavily.

Though the old Taoist looked old, he wasn't even half her age. Bai Yingying felt that she wasn't as perceptive as him on some matters.

This was natural, actually. Although Bai Yingying was two hundred years old, most of her time was spent lying in a coffin, only talking and chatting with Mrs. Bai's ghost. So, essentially, she still maintained the innocence of a sixteen or seventeen-year-old girl.

"Actually, this matter is very simple. It's like why Nuwa wanted to kill Daji. A sage, naturally, must be glorious and pure. How can there be any blemish?

So, whether Daji completed her mission or not, she was destined to die. To overthrow the Shang dynasty, what else could be done besides harming loyal officials and oppressing the common people?

You know, in *Investiture of the Gods*, even if King Zhou was tyrannical, there were still many immortals and forces helping him. Jiang Ziya's fight wasn't smooth either. Therefore, Daji was definitely the best teammate.

But, in reality, from the moment Daji was sent out, she had already been condemned to a suspended death sentence.

How many powerful figures in ancient times treated their 'blades' this way? When the powerful needed them, these 'blades' helped them eliminate those they didn't want to see. When the mission was complete, they were discarded like 'dead rabbits and cooked hounds'.*

Break the blade and show it to the world.

See,

The criminals have been executed by my great self. I am still so pure and untainted."

"Then that woman?"

"Didn't the boss say he found some formation and that half-dried snake in the house?

That was placed by that woman, of course. The old man was so rich, why did he end up living in the ancestral house? Whose hands designed and arranged the house?

Clearly, the old man was tricked, though he brought it upon himself and doesn't deserve sympathy. But speaking objectively, someone led him step by step into a trap.

Even if the snake in the sea hadn't had problems, it would have been hard for it to come to land for revenge, let alone it already had problems. So, it's certain that someone acted as a go-between. Who could it be? Only that woman fits best."

"She was the snake's accomplice?" Bai Yingying said, then shook her head. "No, the boss and that snake had an agreement not to kill that woman. The snake agreed to that back then."

The old Taoist looked at Zhou Ze, who was still "feigning sleep" over there, and said, "It's not about some snake or whatever. This matter is very simple. Lord Haishen was annoyed with that old man. It's unclear if it was because the old man did something wicked when he made his fortune years ago, or if he committed many dirty deeds under Lord Haishen's name. Didn't that old man do sea smuggling?

So, that woman was like the Daji sent by Lord Haishen. In fact, this humble Taoist even thinks that the old man was so selfish to an inhuman degree that he could sacrifice his entire family, which might have been due to that woman's bewitchment.

Or, another possibility, Lord Haishen was annoyed with that snake and felt that if the snake became a spirit, it might affect him. So, he set up a trap to ensnare the snake as well. In the end, the snake came to land for revenge even at the cost of its own demise, and Lord Haishen was happy to see it happen.

Anyway, no matter what, that woman had to die. If she died, Lord Haishen would still be Lord Haishen, maintaining his greatness and purity."

"Then, that woman is really pitiful," Bai Yingying sighed.

"There's nothing pitiful about it. This is fate, unchangeable. Look, even the boss has accepted it."

Zhou Ze stood up at this moment, glanced at the old Taoist and Bai Yingying who were still muttering, and walked upstairs.

Pushing open the bedroom door, Zhou Ze walked to the window, lit a cigarette. On the windowsill, there was a scroll painting. This was what Zhou Ze had asked the old Taoist to buy the day after that incident.

The old Taoist had gone to great lengths to find an identical portrait of Lord Haishen, as very few households still hung his image.

Zhou Ze unfolded the scroll,

Looked at the painting for a long time,

Finally,

He took out a lighter, lit a corner of the paper, and placed it on the security bars of the windowsill, watching it slowly burn to ashes.

"What are you sad about?"

The little loli's voice came from behind Zhou Ze.

"Don't you know to knock before entering?" Zhou Ze said, a little displeased.

*Biu!*

The little loli's figure appeared outside the door, then knocked.

"Dong dong dong..."

"Come in."

*Biu!*

The little loli's figure appeared inside the room again.

"Whose portrait are you burning?" the little loli asked.

"None of your business."

"Alright, I won't meddle. I came because I received information from that stupid zombie."

"I said tomorrow."

"But he's going to Shanghai tonight, then taking a 10 PM flight back to Japan," the little loli reminded him.

"Why didn't you tell me about this earlier?"

"I just found out about his flight information," the little loli said, as if she had been very quick.

"Then where is he now?"

"One of his three hiding spots, I guess. Before, he would rotate them daily, but today, I'm not sure if he'll stick to the pattern.

However, I think it's more likely he's at one particular location."

"Why?"

"Because when I was tracking him, I noticed that in the house at that location, I could always sense another inexplicable aura. Although it was very faint and insignificant, it had some peculiarities compared to the other two places.

Since he's preparing to return to Japan, he probably wants to take some things back, like his most successful research results?"

After saying that, the little loli took two steps back and said to Zhou Ze:

"Anyway, it's your decision."

"Call Yingying, you and I will go to that place."

"Okay."

Zhou Ze changed into a black hoodie and went downstairs, simultaneously calling out to Bai Yingying. Bai Yingying immediately followed him into the car, without even asking what they were going to do.

Once Bai Yingying was in the car, she noticed the little loli sitting beside her. This time, the little loli was clearly only bringing her soul form, not her physical body.

"Stupid zombie, you wouldn't even know if someone sold you off one day," the little loli scoffed.

"You're jealous of me."

"Who's stupid enough to be jealous of you?"

"You're just jealous of me."

"I am not jealous of you!"

"You're still jealous of me."

The little loli stopped talking. She felt it was too foolish to continue arguing on this topic.

Zhou Ze took out his phone and said to the little loli, "Give me the address."

The little loli rattled off the address. After Zhou Ze successfully located it, he started the car. Not long after driving off, a call came in.

Zhou Ze initially wanted to hang up, but seeing it was Xu Qinglang, he answered directly.

"Hello, how's it going over there?"

"How many people were in the old man's family?"

"Why are you asking that?"

"Just answer me."

Zhou Ze closed his eyes, thought for a moment, and said, "Including the old man, twenty-four."

...

Meanwhile, in the emergency room of the affiliated hospital, Xu Qinglang sat alone on a bench in the hallway, his head bowed, looking at the tiled floor.

Finally, the doctor came out, and the police also approached.

Perhaps because burning joss paper had avoided much trouble and complications, neither the doctor nor the police questioned Xu Qinglang about the woman's death. Of course, Xu Qinglang was not a suspect in this matter anyway, because the woman had left a suicide note selfie on her social media before taking her own life.

This suicide was a foregone conclusion.

Watching the nurse push out the stretcher, covered with a white sheet, Xu Qinglang stood up, walked to the stretcher, and said:

"I'd like to see her again."

The two nurses exchanged glances. Misunderstanding that Xu Qinglang and the woman who had committed suicide by poisoning were in a romantic relationship, they hesitated for a moment, then nodded.

Xu Qinglang lifted the sheet and looked at the woman's serene face. She was still so beautiful.

Xu Qinglang had witnessed her charm and romance in bed,

But now, she was cold.

He couldn't say he was sad, nor terribly upset, just a little disappointed and wistful.

Xu Qinglang took the woman's wrist and looked at the scars on it, his fingers gently tracing over them, counting each one. These scars must have been self-inflicted, one by one, over the past two months or so.

She seemed to have been preparing, and counting down, for the end.

Xu Qinglang raised his head, walked to the window in the hallway, pushed it open, and let the wind blow in.

He felt he shouldn't be sad or feel pity for the woman lying there, but humans are such emotional creatures.

What she had done, what she had done to others, who she was, etc.,

But she had been in bed with him, so there was an instinctive sense of affection and closeness.

Taking a long breath,

Xu Qinglang instinctively reached for a cigarette, then remembered he was in a hospital, and put it back.

He had just counted,

On the woman's wrist,

There were,

Twenty-four scars.

---
* *狡兔死走狗烹 (jiǎo tù sǐ zǒu gǒu pēng)*: An idiom meaning "when the cunning rabbit is dead, the hounds are cooked." It describes the act of discarding or eliminating subordinates or tools once they are no longer needed.

title: 第一百六十五章 爸爸！
content:
大人物有大人物的算計，小人物有小人物的目標，很多時候，兩者之間並不矛盾。



  富豪老頭的事兒那位海神到底在其中有多少的戲份，周澤不得而知，或許，等以後有朝一日，當周老闆賺到足夠的錢覺得可以去享受一下買艘遊艇去海上飄一飄的氛圍時，興許可以找到一個答案。



  眼下，他需要做的是，將那個從頭到尾不停搞事情出鏡率奇高的日本神父，給掐死，然後送到火葬場焚化了之後用他的骨灰拌咖喱雞腿飯。



  按照導航，周澤將車到了一個老小區門口，這個小區應該是某個事業單位很早以前的集資建樓，已經快要拆遷了，裡面的住戶也搬得差不多了，顯得有些破舊和雜亂，但還有零星幾戶里依舊還住著人。



  通城已經入夏了，但走進這裡之後，你卻能感到絲絲涼意，這不是什麼鬼怪的影響，只是純粹的人少地方所給人的一種特殊的心理暗示。



  「三樓最左邊的那個屋子，裡面住著一個在通城打工的青年，租的房子。」小蘿莉解釋道。



  周澤點點頭，沒做太多的猶豫，直接走了上去，雖說現在還不確定那位神父到底在不在裡面，但如果自己三人只是在下面傻傻地等的話那就未免太傻了一些。



  來到三樓，屋門是鎖著的，周澤用自己的指甲打開了門，推開進去之後，發現裡面一塵不染，乾淨得讓人有些違和。 



  人住的地方，真的不可能這麼幹淨，甚至連每個角落，都沒有一絲一毫的灰塵，再貼心的保潔公司也很難做到這個程度。



  牆壁，



  瓷磚，



  窗台，



  甚至連馬桶，都泛著一種光澤。



  白鶯鶯看著裡面的情況，忽然有些擔心，她知道老闆是有潔癖的，所以她生怕自家老闆對這裡的乾淨程度很是喜歡之後也以這種方式來要求自己和老道把書屋弄得這麼幹淨。



  如果這樣的話，自己以後除了陪老闆睡覺就只能不停地打掃衛生了，連吃雞的時間都沒有了。



  屋子裡，沒人，小小的套一，也藏不住人。



  周澤蹲下來，指甲在瓷磚上颳了刮，然後看了看自己的指甲縫，裡面夾著一些晶瑩的物質。



  是的，



  這間屋子這麼幹淨的原因就在這裡，倒不是說它真的被打掃得多好，而是因為有一層類似油蠟一樣的物質附著在上面，給出了一種「這裡很乾淨」的欺騙視覺。



  甚至，連床上的被褥上，都附著著這個東西。



  「人不在。」小蘿莉說道。



  「我沒瞎。」周澤回答道。



  「那去換下一個地方？」 



  小蘿莉聳了聳肩，找那個日本神父是周澤給她的第一個任務，她之前監視和跟蹤了很久，付出了很大的心力，如果在收網之時沒有成功的話，那自己之前的辛苦也就都白費了。



  吃力不討好，做了這麼多卻功虧一簣，還不如這頭蠢殭屍在人家旁邊只知道傻乎乎「嚶嚶嚶」所增加的好感多。



  「啪。」



  小蘿莉抽了自己一巴掌，



  我這是在想什麼鬼東西？



  「你幹嘛？」白鶯鶯看著小蘿莉問道。



  「打蚊子。」



  白鶯鶯搖搖頭，



  你忘了今天是靈魂體來的，打蚊子？



  「那人應該會很快回來。」周澤伸手指了指灶台位置。



  說是灶台，其實也就是一個電磁爐放在小桌上，旁邊還有一些調味品以及蔥姜蒜。



  因為周澤注意到了，整個房間，只有這塊區域沒有染上那種蠟油，意味著它剛被使用過，砧板上還有切好的配菜。



  可能是對方做飯時切好了配料，卻記起來自己似乎沒買菜。



  好吧，這個解釋有點傻，但目前來看，好像真的有這麼傻的可能。



  「去外面再等等。」 



  周澤把屋門關上，然後站到了樓道口那裡。



  小蘿莉的靈魂慢慢地飄了起來，然後坐在了欄杆上，兩條小腿一搖一晃，天真爛漫可愛至極。



  白鶯鶯嘟了嘟嘴，也不知道為什麼，她就認準了這個小蘿莉最終會走向和自己爭寵的道路，或許，這就是女人的知覺吧。



  所以，白鶯鶯也不甘示弱，雙手撐著欄杆，像是在眺望遠處的風景，但把自己後面的曲線凸顯得淋漓盡致，一副蓬門今始為君開的架勢。



  周澤站了一會兒，在旁邊的台階上背對著兩個較勁的女人坐了下來，點了一根煙。



  其實，



  有時候想想，



  周老闆上輩子混得並不差，但三十歲的人了，卻一直是光棍兒，連戀愛都沒談過，這並不是沒有原因的。



  當初的林醫生哪怕沒現在有氣質沒現在發育得好，但也絕對不差，且對自己有著小迷妹的崇拜，結果自己連人家名姓都沒記得住，純當是一條分配到自己手下實習的醫學狗來使用。



  這樣子的人不注孤生，



  誰注孤生？



  一大一小兩個女人在那裡爭相鬥艷得起勁兒，現在卻有種表演給瞎子看的感覺，當下，兩個女人也就安分了下來。

 

  抽完一根煙，周澤想起了老許，反正現在也只是在等人，周澤正好抽空給老許打了個電話。



  老許在感情方面還很嫩，是個雛兒，所以很多時候難免走心過多，那個女人死了，他心裡應該不是很好受。



  電話打通了，那邊傳來一聲有氣無力地「餵」。



  「你還好吧？」周澤問道。



  「還好。」



  「看開點。」



  「嗯。」



  「有些事情，往後看，只能算是你人生中的一次經歷，一次回憶，等以後你就明白了。」



  電話那頭沉默了許久，



  周澤以為許清朗在感傷著，因為自己的安慰而受到了觸動，但過了一會兒，許清朗稍微提了點聲音回應道：



  「你是過來人？」



  這是反問的語氣。



  大家都是雛兒，我還開了苞，你還是個處，你來安慰我？



  「我結婚了。」周澤提醒道。



  許清朗那邊又沉默了，他忽然覺得周澤真是自己這輩子所見過的最不要臉的一個人。



  「我還快離婚了。」周澤又道。



  此時應該有《一剪梅》的BGM響起，襯托出周老闆的憂鬱和故事。 



  許清朗繼續沉默，這不要臉的等級又提升了一個量級。



  強行給自己加戲加故事加滄桑？



  一時間，老許都不知道如何去反駁。



  「總之，你看開點吧。」



  說完，周澤掛斷了電話，他覺得再通話下去，惱羞成怒的老許會開始反擊。



  嗯，這種假意安慰其實是傷口撒鹽的行為才是真朋友！



  「有人來了。」



  白鶯鶯開口道。



  因為這棟樓住戶真的很少很少，所以前面也很少有人經過，現在有一個穿著白色短袖的男子提著一個塑膠袋往這裡走，很大可能就是他們想要找的人。



  周澤側過身，看向了下面。



  果然，那個年輕男子提著塑膠袋從這個樓道開始往上走。



  男子沒什麼異常，白淨的臉蛋，精緻的皮膚，給人一種弱化版許清朗的感覺。



  周澤覺得自己的審美似乎出現了一些問題，別的男人都是在外面看女人時習慣性地拿外面的女人和自家老婆去比一比。



  而自己現在是在外面看男人時，習慣性地把那些看起來還不錯的小白臉拿去和許清朗對比。



  男子手中的塑膠袋沉甸甸的，他走上來後，先是看見了坐在台階上的周澤，又看見了站在欄杆邊的白鶯鶯。 



  到最後，



  他的目光又看向了坐在欄杆上搖晃著雙腿的小蘿莉，



  且特意在小蘿莉的身上多看了幾眼，臉上露出了垂涎的目光。



  「就是他。」



  小蘿莉開口道。



  她是靈魂體來的，



  能看見自己的人，絕對有問題。



  白鶯鶯向前一步，企圖抓住男子的肩膀，男子猛地後退一步，手中的塑膠袋砸了過去，白鶯鶯伸手拍開了塑膠袋，結果灑落出十幾隻豬蹄子滾落在了地上。



  「咔嚓…………」



  白鶯鶯的手指扣住了對方的肩膀，但對方卻在此時不退反進。



  只聽得「嗡」一聲響，白鶯鶯沒動，她力氣比對方大得多，但對方這種氣勢和反應讓白鶯鶯一時沒有準備。



  扣住對方肩膀的手指剎那間鬆開了。



  好滑，



  不光是皮膚滑，



  連他身上衣服都好滑！



  男子翻身，想要跳過樓梯下去逃跑，而坐在台階上的周澤卻在此時伸手，指甲瞬間長出來，刺入到男子的小腿位置。



  「啊！」 



  男子發出了一聲慘叫，摔落在了地上，周澤上前，手指直接扣住了對方的脖頸。



  男子的身體不停地抽搐著，大概是周澤那一指甲的傷害其實還在繼續的發酵。



  小蘿莉飄然起身，來到了男子面前。



  男子翻了翻白眼，他看著周澤，目光裡帶著畏懼和驚恐，他似乎想要說些什麼，但他好像連話都說不利索了，只能在喉嚨里不停地發出：



  「啊啊……啊啊……啊啊……」



  「那個日本神父，在哪裡？」周澤問道。



  「啊啊……啊啊……啊啊……」



  「你能好好說話？不能說話的話我只能把你解決了。」



  「啊啊……啊啊……啊啊……」



  小蘿莉此時低下頭，伸手放在了男子的喉嚨位置，像是在傾聽著什麼。



  「他說什麼，你翻譯一下。」周澤問道。



  小蘿莉皺皺眉，很是不可思議，



  然後看著周澤，道：



  「他在喊你，



  爸爸？」

title: 第一百六十六章 開打！（求月票！）
content:
“Ah, ah… ah, ah… ah, ah…”

The young man was tied up in the corner, unable to move, but he kept yelling at Zhou Ze.

Zhou Ze already knew what he was yelling about after the little loli translated it for him earlier.

“Ah, ah… ah, ah… ah, ah…”

“Gag him.” Zhou Ze was getting impatient.

He’d just gotten a million *yuan* and hadn’t even had time to enjoy it before a son popped out.

Tsk, tsk.

Bai Yingying nodded, picked up a rag, and directly stuffed it into the man’s mouth. The man couldn’t make a sound now, but his excitement was still evident.

It was as if the ugly duckling had found the swan’s home; his joy was truly overflowing, as if he couldn’t wait to burrow into Zhou Ze’s embrace and rub against him.

“What exactly is this thing?” Bai Yingying asked the little loli beside her.

The little loli tilted her nose upward and let out a soft “hmph,” adopting a posture that said, *I don’t talk to people with low intelligence.*

“What exactly is going on?” Zhou Ze asked.

“It’s obvious. You said your ashes were stolen. Setting aside the extreme possibility that the Japanese priest is a fanatical admirer of yours and wanted to collect your ashes to take home, the rest is actually easy to guess. That Japanese priest knew some of your secrets and began to research them.

For example, cultivating zombies similar to you. Actually, the Japanese really do have that tradition. For instance, many so-called demon gods in Japanese mythology were cross-bred. They’re a mix of you and me, with very messy characteristics.”

Bai Yingying looked at the little loli explaining endlessly, and her sense of crisis intensified again.

“Heh.”

Zhou Ze let out a dry laugh.

Using his own ashes to develop derivatives of himself?

Thinking about it, it was quite interesting.

“Actually, I’ve always been curious about one thing.” The little loli tilted her head, looking at Zhou Ze, “You don’t seem curious about your past secrets at all.”

“What do I need to be curious about? I am who I am.”

“Mmm-hmm, a different kind of fireworks.”

The little loli stood up, her figure drifting, passing through the door,

“I’ll go out and take a look. If that priest returns here, I should be able to spot him in advance.”

Inside the room, only Zhou Ze, Bai Yingying, and the captive remained.

Bai Yingying pointed at the captive and asked, “Boss, how do we deal with your son... this guy?”

“Is there any chance of saving him?” Zhou Ze asked.

“He’s actually infected with zombie poison, and very deeply. If it were at the beginning, there might have been a way to solve it, but now, it’s basically hopeless. Moreover, if left unchecked, he could very well turn completely into a walking corpse, with an instinctive urge and craving for fresh human blood and flesh.

He’s not a zombie, and he doesn’t qualify to be in our sequence.”

“But he still seems to have some consciousness now.”

“That’s just an illusion, Boss. From the moment he started calling you 'Papa,' it meant that the original him, that soul, that consciousness, had already been annihilated. He’s more like an infant now, relearning and perceiving this world from his new perspective. And because he has countless ties to you, he instinctively feels a sense of closeness to you.”

“Then dispose of him.”

Zhou Ze said.

Since he couldn’t be saved, it was better to deal with him. Keeping him was like keeping a ticking time bomb that could harm ordinary people. Zhou Ze wasn’t so soft-hearted at this moment.

Bai Yingying nodded, reached out and grabbed the man’s neck. Then, as if she remembered something, she said to Zhou Ze:

“Boss, can you turn your head away and not look?”

Bai Yingying didn’t want the boss to see her rough side.

Zhou Ze turned his head away.

Then, he heard only a “crunch,”

When he turned back, he saw that the man’s head had already been twisted off by Bai Yingying.

A high school girl, holding a human head,

Still curiously examining the wound on the neck; this scene looked very bizarre.

It was full of youthful vitality mixed with hair-raising horror.

The head was twisted off, but no blood splattered out. It was clear that the blood vessels at the broken part of the wound had long since clotted and shriveled, with black threads intertwined within.

Just then, a wisp of black mist spewed from the nostrils of the head in Bai Yingying’s hand. A man’s face condensed in the black mist. He looked towards Zhou Ze, expressing gratitude, and then slowly dissipated.

He was liberated.

He was indeed liberated, but he also lost the chance to re-enter reincarnation due to his special encounter. However, this kind of ending was actually a form of happiness.

Zhou Ze gently rubbed the tip of his nose, his breathing also becoming slightly heavier.

To be honest, his desire to kill that Japanese priest had grown even stronger now. From the moment that guy stole his ashes, many of the things he’d experienced recently had continuously increased his hatred for that Japanese priest.

Bai Yingying put down the head and washed her hands at the faucet.

“Boss, you must kill that priest. He actually wants to add cross-breeds to our species, and that person, he was so pitiful.”

Bai Yingying said seriously.

This sounded as if she was worried that her and Zhou Ze’s future offspring would be impure.

“He’s here. I’ll hold him off; you two come down!”

The little loli let out a piercing shriek that ordinary people couldn’t hear, then plunged down from the balcony.

That Japanese priest wasn’t an ordinary person. Letting him walk up the stairs and into the room by himself would introduce too many variables. Who knew if he’d sense something was wrong and just run away?

So the little loli charged in directly. Her goal was to entangle the opponent at all costs, giving Zhou Ze and Bai Yingying time to surround him.

The Japanese priest stood there, having just sneezed. He pulled out a handkerchief to wipe his nose, his eyes a bit red, clearly having a cold.

But just as he put down his handkerchief, a large tongue appeared in his line of sight!

The priest quickly retreated. The tongue swept horizontally multiple times, drawing a circle around him, trapping him inside.

“It’s you again. You’ve been following and monitoring me multiple times. Do you really think I didn’t know?!

I thought you were just fulfilling the local ghost messenger’s duty of supervision, but I didn’t expect you to actually make a move. I’m a living person; you can only manage the dead!”

The priest was calm and composed. Clearly, he had long been aware of the little loli’s surveillance.

The little loli remained silent, her feet hovering in the air, her mouth wide open, her long tongue twitching incessantly.

“I’m leaving Tongcheng today. You could have turned a blind eye as before. Although the Underworld is strict and inviolable, do you, a ghost messenger like you, truly have the face to represent the Underworld?!”

The priest made hand seals,

Stepping in a *Yu* gait,

In an instant, gusts of strong wind raged. The little loli’s tongue began to break, and after supporting for a short while, it shattered into pieces.

The little loli closed her mouth, her lips wriggling for a moment, and then her figure began to retreat.

“Are you scared already?”

The priest smiled faintly, with a hint of smugness.

But in the next moment, his expression changed. A white figure charged directly towards him.

The priest flipped his hands downwards, and two scalpels appeared in his grip, cutting directly at the rapidly approaching white figure!

“Clang!”

The sound of metal clashing rang out.

This was the sound of the scalpels cutting into the opponent’s body.

The priest’s eyes narrowed. To possess such a formidable physique, this was a zombie!

Bai Yingying took the two slashes from the priest head-on, while her shoulder slammed hard into the priest’s chest.

“Bang!”

The priest was sent flying backward, falling heavily to the ground.

Bai Yingying didn’t pursue him further. Instead, she stood still, as if calming the *sha* energy within her body. The opponent’s scalpels carried a sacred power that stimulated the flow of *sha* energy within her.

In comparison, the physical damage was secondary.

After landing, the priest quickly stood up, propping himself with one hand. The little loli’s presence here didn’t surprise him; she had maintained a mutual understanding of non-interference for a while.

But the appearance of this female zombie made him feel a bad omen.

Turning his head,

The priest indeed saw Zhou Ze appearing not far behind him.

“Heh…”

Zhou Ze squeezed his wrist, walking step by step towards the priest.

“Sir, I think there might be a slight misunderstanding between us. You can let me explain.”

Zhou Ze didn’t respond, continuing to walk towards him.

“Sir, you should know the general course of events, but I truly bear no ill will towards you. I’m just very curious about your past. I just want to help you find your past and uncover your secrets.”

Zhou Ze still didn’t respond, continuing to close the distance between himself and the priest.

“Sir, you must understand my sincerity. You know, I have always admired Chinese culture and revered Chinese myths and legends.

This is a cultural centripetal force and cohesion. I am deeply impressed by Chinese culture and am willing to dedicate my heart and soul to understanding it.”

Zhou Ze still didn’t respond, continuing to walk forward. At the same time, Zhou Ze’s long, inky black fingernails slowly grew out.

“Everything I said is true. In my opinion, you are also a part of Chinese culture, so I couldn’t help but want to study you.

You see how fluent my Chinese is? That just shows how fascinated I am with Chinese culture.

Don’t believe me?

I can even sing Chinese songs for you!

Don’t you Chinese people just love it when foreigners speak Chinese and sing Chinese songs, making your hearts swell with pride and joy?

So incredibly hyped!”

The priest took a deep breath. At first, he still harbored a sliver of hope, but seeing Zhou Ze approach him step by step without hesitation, he simply stopped pretending.

He plunged the two scalpels into his palms, and blood flowed out, soaking the scalpels.

The priest slowly put away his previous smile and said in a deep voice:

“I’ve said so much; you should at least say a few words before you make a move, or else I’ll be so embarrassed.”

“*Baka*.” Zhou Ze said.

“…” The priest.

title: 第一百六十七章 爸爸愛你！（求月票！）
content:
For a long time, no, to be precise, his entire last life, Zhou Ze was someone who couldn't fight.

He hadn't learned martial arts, nor had he practiced Taekwondo; he wasn't even very familiar with basic martial arts forms.

Because of this, when he first saw Bai Yingying wake up, in Xu Qinglang's words, Bai Yingying stood in the bookstore, her "tyrant's aura" fully unleashed, like a big burly man.

And Zhou Ze, with his fingernails, charged forward scratching wildly like a betrayed wife attacking a mistress, scratching Bai Yingying until her spirit exploded, directly causing her to turn from "Bai Yingying" to "Bai Yingying (whining)".

In the half-year he had been a grim reaper, Zhou Ze had become aware of some of his own issues, but he hadn't tried to improve.

There were many reasons for this, but the biggest reason was... laziness.

A single skill, well-honed, was enough to conquer the world; when facing ghosts and ordinary people, his fingernails were already sufficient.

Even if he encountered a stronger opponent, he could still activate his "Musou."

Although he knew little about how his "Musou" came to be, following the lazy principle of "when in Rome, do as the Romans do," Zhou Ze used it quite happily. The only side effect was that he would be paralyzed for a long time afterward.

So, even though he knew he couldn't fight, Zhou Ze wasn't afraid when facing a fight, and he gradually developed the misconception that "I'm very good at fighting."

The priest stepped forward, brandishing a scalpel with extreme speed, the blade aimed directly at Zhou Ze's glabella.

Zhou Ze didn't dodge; "no matter how many paths you take, I take only one." His right hand shot out directly towards the priest's face.

The result of this would be that the priest's scalpel could pierce Zhou Ze's temple, but the priest himself would have five "skylights" opened on his head by Zhou Ze to let some air in.

The priest hadn't expected Zhou Ze to be so resolute. Even with the advantage of an ambush, he still chose to fight in a fierce, life-for-life manner.

Then,

The priest chickened out.

He withdrew his hand and retreated. Zhou Ze didn't grasp the priest's face, only brushed his chest.

"Slam!"

Black mist swept out like a whip,

The priest was knocked to the ground. Although he quickly rolled and stood up on his knees, in this single exchange, he was clearly at a disadvantage.

Bai Yingying watched her boss's ferocity, her mouth wide open.

Vaguely, she seemed to recall the fear of being "violently poked and prodded" by her boss the first time she met him in the bookstore.

That was truly her and her boss's "life is but a first meeting."

The little loli watched from the side, chewing on her tongue as if it were chewing gum, then suddenly let out a giggle.

She had figured it out: Zhou Ze actually couldn't fight at all.

Pitiful, that idiotic zombie next to her was still infatuated.

Don't you know your boss might really die at the hands of that shit priest if you don't help?!

Can't you have some idea of how much stamina your boss actually has?

The priest sprang up again, moving quickly. This time, he didn't dare to charge directly at Zhou Ze but chose to maneuver, as he was also somewhat intimidated by Zhou Ze's "wide-open" fighting style and couldn't quite get a read on him.

Moreover, he knew that Zhou Ze's true terror was when he transformed into a zombie. He had fought Zhou Ze in that state before, breaking several ribs, and his injuries were considerable. And at that time, Zhou Ze had just battled the Temple God, Lady Qingyi.

Just like that, the priest and Boss Zhou fought back and forth, truly like a proper duel: you advance, I retreat; you retreat, I advance; you maneuver, I maneuver. It was quite exciting.

Zhou Ze was full of confidence, and the priest was trembling, truly creating the impression of a master-level showdown. At least from the perspective of special effects and action scenes, it was more aesthetically pleasing to the audience than contemporary so-called martial arts masters just throwing wild "turtle punches."

Finally, Bai Yingying realized what was happening and charged forward again, joining the fray.

The little loli also didn't dare to continue watching from the sidelines. Although she greatly hoped the priest could kill Zhou Ze instantly, allowing her to gain her freedom, she didn't dare to gamble. If Zhou Ze didn't die and discovered she had been watching idly from the sidelines, then she would be the one to die.

Bai Yingying's fighting style was more direct than Zhou Ze's. She actively took on damage for Zhou Ze, completely devoted to protecting her master. Combined with her excellent physical condition, she wasn't at a disadvantage even when directly confronting the priest. This freed up more opportunities and space for Zhou Ze to attack. Additionally, with the little loli constantly providing sneak attack support, the priest was truly miserable.

After several gruesome wounds were inflicted on him by Zhou Ze, the priest's gaze sharpened. Blood once again covered his scalpels, and then he plunged both knives into the concrete ground, simultaneously forming a hand seal.

Instantly, a barrier appeared. The little loli, during a sneak attack, directly crashed into the barrier, causing her soul to become unstable, forcing her to retreat.

This barrier had a restraining effect on all dark entities, and Zhou Ze and his two companions, strictly speaking, were not of the righteous path; they would all be restrained.

The little loli knew when to quit, absolutely refusing to give herself a chance to be severely injured.

But Bai Yingying was much more straightforward,

She continuously slammed herself into the barrier. Even though evil aura scattered from her body with each impact, making her visibly suffer, she still gritted her teeth and continued to ram it, intending to smash the barrier into pieces!

"What a big simpleton."

The little loli snorted disdainfully.

And it was at this moment that Zhou Ze also plunged his fingers into the ground, a black light beginning to emerge in his eyes. Then, he slowly began to pull his hands outward!

The scalpels the priest had plunged into the ground slowly began to be drawn out by an invisible force. Coupled with Bai Yingying's continuous impacts, the barrier began to become precarious.

Beads of sweat had appeared on the priest's forehead. His peripheral vision began to dart around, clearly understanding that in this situation, it would be difficult to win. Especially knowing that Zhou Ze hadn't even unleashed his full power yet, and he was already so passive, continuing to stalemate would only lead him deeper into trouble, and he might even truly perish here.

So, he decided to flee, to find an opportunity to escape.

Blood began to seep from Zhou Ze's fingers, as if they had been cut by sharp blades. At the same time, Zhou Ze roared at the little loli nearby:

"If he doesn't die today, you'll die in his place."

A threat,

A naked threat!

The little loli was stunned. She hadn't expected Zhou Ze to say such a thing. Although she had always been Zhou Ze's subordinate, subdued by him, her proud nature refused to truly become a servant like Bai Yingying. She had always maintained her haughtiness.

She constantly reminded herself that she was different from that idiotic girl, Bai Yingying!

But Zhou Ze's words completely shattered her pride.

These words could be translated to mean: you are my dog, and if you can't catch the prey, then this dog can be cooked and eaten.

It was very realistic, tearing apart all tenderness.

The little loli glared angrily at Zhou Ze. She now wished she could kill this man directly, dismembering him!

But she still flashed, transforming into a black light, and charged directly at the priest.

"Rise!"

Zhou Ze forcibly pulled out his bloody hands,

The scalpels the priest had plunged into the ground immediately flew out.

Bai Yingying delivered a blow, which the priest barely blocked by bringing his arms together. But the little loli appeared directly behind the priest, her entire soul taking the opportunity to pierce into the priest's body.

"Ah ah ah ah ah!!!!!"

From the priest's mouth, the pained screams of a man and a little girl erupted.

Bai Yingying delivered an elbow strike, slamming it heavily into the priest's chest. The priest was sent flying like a fly, and Bai Yingying quickly followed up, directly pinning him down, simultaneously smashing her fists repeatedly onto his chest.

"Thud!"

"Thud!"

"Thud!"

A continuous barrage of heavy punches,

Dull thuds echoed throughout the neighborhood, but the priest's body showed an unusual toughness. Under Bai Yingying's zombie-like punches, it only emitted sounds of bone grinding. If it had been an ordinary person, they would have probably been pounded into a pulp by Bai Yingying long ago, and a very chewy kind of pulp at that.

"Ah!"

Just then, the little loli, who had previously burrowed into the priest's body, shot out, her soul somewhat fragmented, much dimmer and more transparent than before.

She pointed at the priest and said, "There's something wrong with his body!"

Yes,

There was definitely something wrong with this body.

Bai Yingying, who had been fiercely pummeling him, knew this deeply, as if she were chewing a piece of beef full of tendons, unable to break it down no matter how much she chewed!

"Whew..."

The priest seemed to have made some kind of decision. His eyes began to be replaced by crimson, and his muscles started to shrink.

Bai Yingying was stunned,

Holy crap,

Why did this feel so familiar?!

The priest seemed to be in great pain, and it was clear that he was doing this out of necessity, because he also knew that his research had not been successful at all; it was still in the failed stages of experimentation.

But he had no choice,

Otherwise, he would soon be pounded into elastic meat pulp by this female zombie, mixed with a little flour, and kneaded into "peeing beef balls" to be boiled in a hot pot.

"Roar!"

The priest's body stiffened. Bai Yingying delivered a punch to his head.

"Thud!"

The priest crashed down again, creating a pit in the ground before bouncing back and directly colliding with Bai Yingying, sending her staggering back several steps.

"Ugh... Ugh..."

The priest slowly stood up, his body swaying slightly, half his face green, half gray, looking like Ouyang Feng who had practiced the Toad Skill. In short, his entire being was filled with a sense of chaos and eeriness.

Bai Yingying was about to charge again but was held back by Zhou Ze's hand.

"Take a rest, don't get yourself too badly injured."

Bai Yingying nodded obediently upon hearing this, but looked at Zhou Ze with some concern, meaning, 'Boss, can you handle this alone?'

Zhou Ze appeared very nonchalant,

And walked a few more steps forward,

"Cough cough..."

He coughed a few times softly,

Seemingly trying to get the priest's attention.

The priest's eyes fixed on Zhou Ze,

His expression constantly shifting,

First hatred,

Then anger,

Then doubt,

Followed by confusion.

"What did you call me?" Zhou Ze asked.

The priest tilted his head, continuing to stare at Zhou Ze, his throat making "gurgling" sounds,

He covered his mouth, tightly covering his mouth, as if trying to stop something,

But the craving was overflowing, utterly unstoppable.

Zhou Ze opened his arms,

His expression gentle,

"Come,

Daddy loves you."

Finally,

The priest couldn't hold it in any longer.

His experiment had one major flaw that he didn't know about, because he had only stolen Zhou Ze's ashes from his previous life for the experiment, but he hadn't been able to capture Zhou Ze to participate in the experiment!

Finally, the hand covering his mouth slipped,

The priest shouted excitedly:

"Otou-san..." (Daddy)
