The original text uses "支、、、那逼" with ellipses, indicating a self-censorship or hesitation in fully writing out the slur, which is reflected here by only partially translating the phonetic sound and the accompanying ellipses.

title: 第一百八十三章 英魂鎮壓！
content:
Zhou Ze stood to the side, as if watching a stage play, the actors utterly absorbed in their roles, completely oblivious to whether or not an audience was watching their performance.

In fact, they really were very self-absorbed.

Music played, a Japanese song with a strong rhythm.

Then the three men, dressed in Japanese military uniforms, began to dance, brandishing imitation samurai swords, presumably ordered from Taobao, swirling to the beat while humming along, like they were celebrating and cosplaying.

"What song is this?" Zhou Ze asked the girl's head beside him, as he really didn't understand Japanese well.

"'Batto Tai,' it's a type of Japanese Army song," the girl replied.

"Oh, I thought it was an Ultraman theme song."

The three guys were having a blast, clearly fully immersed, quite self-forgetful.

Actually, they looked pretty idiotic. These three guys weren't Japanese, but genuine Chinese, which he'd already deduced from their accents and what they said earlier.

Yet they were so focused and invested now, as if performing some noble ritual, which made one think of the idiom, "a monkey crowned with a hat."*

Liking their manga, action films, songs, movie stars, and so on, none of that mattered and was perfectly normal. Even having a fondness for a certain country was everyone's freedom. But the words and actions of these three clearly went beyond that feeling.

Especially uttering words like hoping the Japanese had been more thorough with the Nanjing Massacre, simply because of a soccer game's outcome, was an unforgivable crime.

That contempt for their own identity, that yearning for a foreign identity, made Zhou Ze uncomfortable. He had once experienced Sanxiang Village, where even after death, the villagers still endured immense hunger pains, yet stubbornly guarded their "military provisions."

The actions of the dead and the living formed a stark contrast.

Just then, Zhou Ze heard a woman's voice, asking a question in Japanese.

The voice sounded a little familiar.

Zhou Ze looked at the girl's head.

"At the time... I thought the neighbors were also Japanese, so I... voluntarily greeted them," the girl said, gritting her teeth.

"Tsk tsk." Zhou Ze shook his head. Did she just walk right into it?

The three men, who were dancing as if marching, stopped immediately upon hearing the woman next door greet them in Japanese. They then went outside the living room to talk to her. They couldn't speak Japanese, which was ridiculous. They yearned to be Japanese but hadn't even learned the language.

But in the end, when the long-haired man opened the door, the girl was standing there.

For the girl, it was probably like meeting a familiar face in a foreign land. After all, being in a foreign country, and having a compatriot next door, would always bring an irresistible urge to connect.

The girl was invited to join their gathering, and she even performed a Japanese song. Although the three men didn't understand Japanese, they fully conveyed the look of "impressed despite not understanding."

Afterwards, everyone started drinking.

Then, the buzz-cut guy started getting handsy. The girl had been drinking, but she was still somewhat sober. She immediately stood up to refuse and said in Chinese that she was going back to her room.

As the story progressed to this point, Zhou Ze turned his head and asked the girl's head, "You must have realized they weren't Japanese much earlier, right?"

"I thought they admired Japanese culture, so I..."

Hearing this explanation, Zhou Ze found it quite amusing. When he fought with the priest earlier, the priest had ironically remarked that Chinese people loved hearing foreigners speak Chinese, gaining immense inner satisfaction from it.

The rest of the story was simple. The girl resisted, and the men forced themselves on her. All three of them forced themselves on her. Since all three were drunk, the final scene was a mix of the girl's muffled sobs and struggles after her mouth was gagged with a towel.

After it was over, the girl lay on the floor, her eyes vacant, her body contorted, while the three men were like Japanese soldiers in that era who would regularly be issued comfort station tickets, finishing their release and clocking out.

During that period, the Japanese set up many comfort stations in areas where they had troops stationed, forcing women from various countries into them to be brutalized. In Japanese military camps, this was like an amateur activity such as watching movies, with the number of movie tickets issued each month varying according to rank.

At this point, Zhou Ze narrowed his eyes, as if the climax was about to begin.

The girl was eventually dismembered.

Did these three men kill her to silence her?

But even if they wanted to silence her, would they go to such an extreme as dismemberment?

The reason was simple: dismembering and disposing of a body in a hotel would be very difficult to do without leaving traces. If they merely wanted to cut off the roots, there was no need to do it in such a manner.

Zhou Ze continued to watch from the side; the answer would come out soon enough.

The three men seemed to have sobered up, and looking at the Japanese girl lying on the ground, almost unconscious, fear showed on their faces.

Indeed, generally speaking, people who enjoy online regional attacks or are "Japan-worshippers" are usually quite cowardly in their social lives, typically insignificant small fry. That's why they desperately hope to find another distorted sense of satisfaction for their failed lives elsewhere.

The three men were clearly panicking. The long-haired man even ran over, apologizing repeatedly, hoping the girl would forgive him and not call the police.

The other two, the buzz-cut and the cap-wearing guy, were also somewhat flustered.

But just then, on the floor beneath their feet, three shadows suddenly appeared. These three shadows appeared strangely, with no prior warning, then silently merged with the men's shadows, becoming indistinguishable.

And in the eyes of the three men, a hint of bloody light slowly emerged.

Next was the most brutal and difficult to watch scene.

The girl was dismembered, her body laid out like a sacrifice on the edge of the hot spring pool, and then the three men actually knelt down facing the hot spring pool.

They began chanting what sounded like incantations or prayers, this time in perfectly pure Japanese.

They were possessed!

And their nests had been usurped!

As someone who had returned from a borrowed corpse, Zhou Ze was actually quite familiar with this scene.

The girl's head, upon hearing the words spoken by the three men, appeared to be in great pain. Her headless body ran from the courtyard into the living room, reaching up to cover her ears.

This posture was very strange.

The headless body stood to the side, reaching up to cover its ears, while its head rested on the coffee table.

It was imaginable that the sound of these Japanese chants was a great torment and torture for the girl.

*Whoosh*...

The surrounding scene began to distort,

and then gradually dissipated.

Zhou Ze only remembered the final image: it was a ritual, seemingly to summon something, and the bodies of the three men slowly shriveled into husks, finally turning into pus that soaked into the pebbles in the courtyard. The girl's body was likewise, completely dissolving into the hot spring pool, like food boiled away.

Afterwards, Zhou Ze walked over to the girl and asked, "When did you die?"

"A year ago," the girl replied.

"You've been here since you died?" Zhou Ze asked again.

"Yes, I've been here since I died, and they were next door to me. I couldn't get out. All I could do was look through the mirror and see the activities of the guests who moved in later. Then, I noticed the restaurant getting more and more crowded. Some of the dead nearby, their souls would gravitate here, move in, and then dine in the restaurant punctually."

"Then why didn't you go find them for revenge before?" Zhou Ze asked.

"Because I couldn't get through before. Now I can, because they've left, and something is about to awaken."

Zhou Ze was silent for a moment, then continued, "What exactly is that 'something'?"

"I don't know, I really don't know," the girl replied.

"Then one last question, not long ago, was there a family of three, parents with a girl about five years old, who stayed here?"

"Yes, they stayed here." The girl looked at Zhou Ze, somewhat bewildered, and said, "When they were here, I heard those three men say that this family of three would be the best sacrifice.

Then a few days later, I saw that family of three dining in the restaurant. They were... headless."

"Were they killed by those three men? But they're already dead, aren't they? Without physical bodies, sealed in the mirror like you, they shouldn't be able to get out.

Also,

what did those three men want with their heads?"

"They were probably trying to awaken themselves," the girl replied. "I've heard many of their conversations. They all spoke in Japanese. They yearned to regain their freedom, to be released from someone's suppression."

"Suppression?"

"Yes, they're different from me. Those three are different from the other souls who gathered here later. They have greater freedom. In fact, if they wished, they could even enter my room at any time, but they weren't interested in that. They were always waiting for an opportunity, a suitable opportunity."

Zhou Ze sat down on the sofa.

This case, originally about a family of three being murdered, had now unearthed far too many things.

The incident began a year ago.

Three idiotic Japan-worshippers held a gathering here, which attracted a Japanese girl visiting China from next door. Then these three Japan-worshippers became aroused. After all, they dreamed of being Japanese, so they truly couldn't resist a Japanese girl who presented herself.

Perhaps their malice was perceived during the "crime," or maybe their wearing Japanese military uniforms and singing Japanese songs produced an effect similar to a "planchette session."

In any case, three Japanese ghosts, originally suppressed here by some unknown entity, were summoned, possessed them, and simultaneously, this poor Japanese girl was dismembered and sacrificed by her own compatriots.

Those three Japan-worshippers also died. This was their first step towards freedom, transitioning from a state of suppression to souls sealed in mirrors. While seemingly all sealed and confined, they should have gained more freedom than before.

They must have been waiting for the appearance of the next round of sacrifices, which was the family of three. So, that family of three must have met a terrible end, allowing them to gain a further degree of freedom.

What angered Zhou Ze was that he himself was the key for those three Japanese ghosts to gain even greater freedom.

That ghostly phone call lured him here, then he would take their place in prison, allowing them "complete freedom"!

He was clearly the hunter, yet he was ensnared by what should have been his prey, and he walked right into it.

But how did these three Japanese ghosts come to be?

Zhou Ze could sense that those three souls, whether in terms of their power or methods, were not comparable to ordinary souls. This wasn't Zhou Ze trying to explain away falling into a trap; it was because Zhou Ze, as a Soul Ferryman, couldn't even perform that kind of sacrificial ritual. He even believed that Little Loli, an experienced Soul Ferryman, probably couldn't either.

Three souls, more professional than Soul Ferrymen?

"Oh, right." The girl suddenly seemed to remember something and said, "Throughout this past year, I often heard them curse a person. I don't know who that person is, but it's probably largely related to their suppression."

"What's that person's name?" Zhou Ze looked up and asked.

"Cao Ding."

___
*沐猴而冠 (mù hóu ér guàn) - Literally "monkey wearing a hat." An idiom used to describe someone who, despite appearing important or dignified, is actually still uncivilized, foolish, or not truly qualified for their position; putting on airs without substance.

title: 第一百八十四章 越獄！
content:
Zhou Ze knew who Cao Ding was. After all, the little loli was a late bloomer, having taken up residence in the body of little girl Wang Rui. Zhou Ze didn't know where she was from or when she died, and he didn't bother to ask, but he guessed she wasn't a local.

As for Bai Yingying, she was a naive soul who had been lying in a coffin for two hundred years. Her conversations with Mrs. Bai usually revolved around typical girlish chatter. Have you ever seen a girlfriends' gathering where they start discussing patriotic sentiments?

So, neither of them were truly local Tongcheng people. But Zhou Ze, having lived two lives, was always a Tongcheng native. Cao Ding was quite famous in Tongcheng; of course, the most renowned figure in Tongcheng was Zhang Jian, who drafted the Qing Emperor's abdication edict. After him, Cao Ding could be counted among the top ten.

He was an anti-Wokou hero, though his official position and fame weren't particularly high. Zhou Ze only knew this much, having long forgotten the specifics. He only remembered that Cao Ding was a figure from the mid-Ming Dynasty, a time when the Wokou were at their most rampant. The coastal areas were plagued by Wokou, and the government forces were useless, often collapsing at the first encounter. It wasn't until generals like Qi Jiguang gradually emerged that the Wokou threat slowly subsided.

In other words, for a long period, the Ming Dynasty's official army was basically at the level of "five-combat-scum,"* much like the early stages of the Anti-Japanese War, when the Japanese army swept through almost unopposed. Therefore, generals who dared to go against the current during that time were particularly rare and valuable. Because at that point, there was practically no hope of winning, which truly embodied the spirit of "though a million men oppose me, I shall go forth."

Since those three Japanese ghosts hated Cao Ding, Zhou Ze could only boldly speculate that the identities of those three ghosts might also be "five-hundred-year-aged"?

This speculation was terrifying, making Zhou Ze ponder it carefully.

Most importantly, the heroic spirit had suppressed these ghostlings here for so many years. What if he ended up falling into a trap and releasing them instead? His sin would be immense. If those three scoundrels were released and caused trouble in Tongcheng or nearby areas, would that karma eventually fall on him?

Boss Zhou never denied being a lazy loafer who feared trouble, usually adopting a "less is more" attitude to muddle through life. But he wouldn't just accidentally open Pandora's Box and then shrug it off to go back to sleep.

"How do we get out?"

Zhou Ze asked the most crucial question. Of course, Zhou Ze knew that the Japanese girl in front of him probably didn't know how to get out either.

This place was like a special container. Zhou Ze guessed it was likely due to the unique environment of General Mountain. Cao Ding's heroic spirit had suppressed these Wokou for five hundred years. It was originally a first-level prison, but the Wokou's lingering spirits began to play "Count of Monte Cristo"-style escape.

Not a single-stroke escape, but a continuous increase in their freedom, similar to moving themselves from the deepest, most strictly guarded cells of the prison to the outermost, least guarded cells.

This was somewhat like a compromise, which created this hybrid place. In this mirror world, the lingering spirits couldn't significantly interfere with the outside world; this was already the final layer of restriction.

The Japanese girl shook her head. She had already put her head back on her neck.

She didn't know how to get out. If she did, she would have gone out for revenge long ago; why wait until now?

Zhou Ze felt a bit helpless and took out his phone. The phone still had no signal, but Zhou Ze remembered something: those three Japanese ghosts had been able to call him here and play a "ghost call" trick. Could he do the same?

He tried calling Xu Qinglang. The phone kept ringing; it actually connected.

Zhou Ze, somewhat surprised, walked over to the painting frame and looked at Xu Qinglang's situation inside.

His call kept ringing, and the "beep... beep..." sound came from the other end, but in his eyes, Xu Qinglang had no intention of answering the phone.

It connected, but there was no response from the other side?

Zhou Ze couldn't hear the sounds from inside, nor did he know if Xu Qinglang's phone was ringing, but it was highly likely that the phone on that end wasn't reacting.

Zhou Ze also tried calling Bai Yingying and the little loli, but they all connected, and no one answered.

...

While Zhou Ze was trying to make calls, Bai Yingying, the little loli, and others had already entered the hotel and knocked on the door.

Xu Qinglang opened the door, looking somewhat haggard, truly like a wife worn out from caring for her sick husband.

This was indeed the case. He remembered that night Xu Qinglang was still sleeping when the old Daoist priest screamed and peed blood, and then Zhou Ze lay unconscious on the ground. From that moment until now, Xu Qinglang had been like an ant on a hot griddle, never getting a moment's rest.

Bai Yingying immediately found her unconscious boss lying on the sofa, knelt by the sofa, took his hand, and kept calling for him to wake up quickly and not abandon Yingying.

Everyone around unconsciously twitched their mouths at this scene.

Please,

Zhou Ze wasn't dead yet,

You're exaggerating a bit too much, exactly like an ancient aristocratic family's concubine, who, after crying at the funeral, would pack her belongings and prepare to run away.

The little loli seemed much calmer. From her perspective, she seemed more concerned with whether Zhou Ze was conscious right now. If he was consciously unconscious, then her life was still in his hands. If he was completely unconscious,

Then would she be free if she killed him now?

Of course, the little loli only thought about it, just like men walking on the street unconsciously fantasize about the curvaceous beauties they see. She didn't dare to do it, nor did she dare to gamble.

Finally, the little loli walked to Zhou Ze's side and examined his condition.

The old Daoist priest next to her began to recount in detail what had happened these past few days.

"How is he?" Bai Yingying asked the little loli.

"His soul is still here," the little loli frowned, "but it's incomplete."

"Incomplete?"

The little loli looked around, as if searching for something.

"Yes, it's incomplete, so he can't wake up."

The old Daoist priest on the side heard this and said, "I seem to remember a villain in 'Investiture of the Gods' who had a magic treasure that could take away part of a person's soul."

The little loli ignored the old Daoist priest's words and had no time to discuss "Investiture of the Gods" with him. She began to walk around the room, especially after seeing the shattered glass in the bathroom, her gaze turned more towards reflective objects.

Finally, the little loli even stood in front of the "Eight Steeds" painting frame in the living room, looking into the mirror frame.

...

From Zhou Ze's perspective, the little loli was now more like she was looking at him directly, but she shouldn't be able to see inside. This was enough to show the little loli's superior skill and insight compared to those around her.

Old Xu and the old Daoist priest had been trying to figure out how to wake up the unconscious Zhou Ze, but they never thought that Zhou Ze was actually right beside them, just trapped.

"Can she see you?" the Japanese girl beside him asked.

"Given enough time, she should be able to figure it out." Zhou Ze continued to look at his phone. In fact, the problem was quite awkward now: even if the little loli was given more time, and even if she could confirm that he was in the mirror,

How was he supposed to get out?

There must be a way out, Zhou Ze believed. It was like facing a complex game, but you needed enough time to play through it, at least countless failures and exploratory experiences. However, Zhou Ze didn't have that much time now, considering those three Japanese ghosts had been here for a year, and most importantly, they might have been playing this game for five hundred years!

"Crack..."

The sound of shattering glass came from outside the door.

The Japanese girl looked at Zhou Ze and said, "It's mealtime."

"..." Zhou Ze.

"Aren't you going?" the Japanese girl continued to ask.

"Are you hungry? Or, do you get hungry?" Zhou Ze asked.

"Just want to go for a walk."

Zhou Ze understood. Eating for those in the mirror was like prisoners in a cell being regularly let out for fresh air and outdoor activities.

"I'm not inte..."

Before Zhou Ze could finish his sentence,

"Crack... crack... crack..." sounds suddenly kept coming from outside.

Zhou Ze immediately rushed to the door and opened it.

Yes,

Originally, outside should have just been a glass corridor leading directly to the restaurant, but the surrounding glass began to shatter one after another at this moment. More and more lingering souls began to wander aimlessly, as if they had lost their original restraints, becoming at a loss.

"What's going on?" Zhou Ze asked the Japanese girl behind him.

"I don't know either," the Japanese girl also showed a surprised expression.

Zhou Ze rushed out the door. The glass around him, from far to near, continued to shatter. This gave Zhou Ze a very ominous premonition. He was actually a prisoner confined here, and the glass could be understood as the iron bars of the prison. The iron bars were now constantly shattering and disappearing, which was actually a good thing for prisoners because they would regain freedom.

But for Zhou Ze, it was different, because it meant that the restrictions and restraints here were fading away, and what had been suppressed was poised to escape.

The lingering souls here were becoming more and more numerous, because due to the special nature of General Mountain, the souls of those who died nearby would unconsciously gather here, somewhat like a treasure basin.

And now, these people began to walk blankly forward, as if guided by something.

Zhou Ze walked among the crowd, desperately wanting to know the source of all this.

Finally,

Zhou Ze saw a flag in front,

And beneath the flag,

Lay three sets of black Japanese samurai armor. The armor bore many scars and damages, yet exuded a unique grimness.

The flag emitted black light, enveloping a circle. Any lingering souls attracted to it, once they entered the circle, would be bound by black threads. And those three sets of armor, which had been neatly stacked and still,

Inside,

Began to slowly expand...

------

Apologies, after the interview last night, I got back to the hotel, set an alarm to sleep for two hours and then write, but the alarm didn't wake the dragon, and I ended up sleeping until early the next morning...

Translator's Note:
* "战五渣" (zhàn wǔ zhā): Literally "battle five dregs," a slang term originating from the anime "Dragon Ball Z," meaning someone with a power level of 5 (the lowest possible), thus "combat useless" or "scum in battle." It implies someone is extremely weak or incompetent in a fight. I adapted it to "five-combat-scum" for literalness while retaining the implied meaning.

title: 第一百八十五章 武士！
content:
"The wind's picking up outside," the old Taoist said as he walked to the living room's French window and closed it. For some reason, the wind had suddenly grown stronger, rustling the trees and wicker chairs in the yard.

The little loli, however, tore her gaze away from the Eight Horses painting, then deliberately walked over and opened the window the old Taoist had just closed. She poked her head out, then returned with an extremely grave expression.

Looking at Zhou Ze, who still lay unconscious on the sofa, a hint of murderous intent flashed in the little loli's eyes.

"What are you doing!" Bai Yingying immediately reprimanded.

The little loli pointed at Zhou Ze and cursed directly, "What the hell did this bastard release? He's trying to get me killed!"

"What's wrong?" Xu Qinglang asked.

*Bang!*

Suddenly, the door was blown open by the wind outside, and even the glass of the French window shattered, sending shards flying everywhere in the living room.

The old Taoist and Xu Qinglang immediately crouched down, wrapping their heads with their clothes for protection. Bai Yingying threw herself over Zhou Ze to shield her boss. The glass shards that flew onto Bai Yingying were directly repelled; the female zombie's physique was indeed formidable.

The little loli stood amidst the flying glass shards. It was quite a sight, actually, and with her cold loli expression, it really looked like a scene from a blockbuster movie.

Spider-Man, who had been sitting in a chair ever since he entered, seemed to be used to this. Normally, after cleaning the bookstore, he would find a spot to sit down and remain motionless. Even the old Taoist, who was a people-person, couldn't rouse him, finding him less entertaining than his own monkey.

Now, the little loli stared directly at Spider-Man.

Spider-Man continued to sit, seemingly unaffected by the little loli's gaze.

The little loli took a deep breath and said directly, "Let's deal with the problem here first."

Spider-Man remained motionless.

When customers first visited the bookstore, they would often see him sitting there motionless and think he was a sculpture, like a model placed in a movie theater before a Spider-Man movie.

"I've always wondered why you stayed in Tongcheng. That guy's ashes were just an accidental discovery, weren't they? Not the real reason you stayed in Tongcheng for so long."

Spider-Man remained unmoved.

"I investigated. This hot spring resort on General Mountain belongs to the Xu family."

No matter how big the world, this was still China. Tongcheng was a second-tier city, but in reality, it was just a small place, especially since Shanghai was just across the river. So, there weren't many foreigners in Tongcheng. Citizens on the street would still curiously stare at foreigners, unlike those in big cities who were long accustomed to blond hair, blue eyes, or dark skin.

The little loli knew that Zhou Ze had first met the priest at a funeral. At that time, the priest stood beside several women of the Xu family, somewhat like a family chaplain.

And General Mountain was the Xu family's property.

And now, the *Wokou*<sup>1</sup> vengeful spirits, suppressed by heroic souls, were actually, of all things, on the verge of rioting. Could this be a coincidence?

Spider-Man remained as steady as a mountain.

The wind grew stronger, carrying a howling shriek. To ordinary people, this would just seem like a sudden change in weather signaling rain, but even Xu Qinglang could tell that the wind carried a strong malevolent aura. This was a sign that something immensely ominous was emerging!

The little loli took a deep breath.

She was so angry!

Why was it always Zhou Ze who caused trouble, and she had to desperately clean up his messes?

Moreover, the little loli had to clean up this mess whether she wanted to or not, because she was also a Ghost Catcher of Tongcheng. This meant she was responsible for dealing with all supernatural incidents within Tongcheng's borders. If a supernatural event spiraled out of control and affected too many innocents, she would bear direct responsibility.

This was like trouble falling from the sky while sitting at home. The little loli suddenly felt so wronged; it seemed she hadn't lived a single comfortable day since meeting this slacker.

*Gurgle... gurgle... gurgle...*

The hot spring pool began to bubble. The faucet wasn't on; the water was flowing backward from the drain plug at the bottom. Then, the entire courtyard began to collapse. The cobblestone ground directly caved in, and even more than half of the living room collapsed along with it.

Bai Yingying, quick as a flash, carried her boss's body and retreated to avoid her boss falling in with it.

Inside the resort, a pit appeared, and at the bottom of this pit was a dilapidated plaque with many bullet holes.

It was said that when the Japanese invaders entered Tongcheng, they learned there was a *Wako*<sup>2</sup> tomb and a General's Temple here, so they specifically came to destroy them. The bullet holes on the plaque were likely left from that time.

This clearly indicated that it had been deliberately relocated, and the entire resort itself could even be called a deliberate "cover-up" for it.

Beneath the plaque was a headless statue, its paint long faded and damaged. It depicted a man on horseback wielding a saber, conveying a sense of desolation.

Beside the man's statue were three boxes, mostly rotted away. From inside, one could see what appeared to be armor.

*Buzz! Buzz! Buzz!!!!!!!!!!!*

A series of vibrating sounds emanated from the boxes below. Immediately, a black shadow suddenly shot out and plunged into one of the boxes. Then, the rotten box instantly exploded, and a set of armor slowly rose up, becoming human-sized, but the armor floated, with no one wearing it inside.

"Oh..."

A weathered voice emanated from within the armor,

Like someone who had slept for too long and was awakened.

"Hai..."

*Bang!*

A rusted *katana*<sup>3</sup> materialized from some unknown crevice below and instantly appeared in the warrior's hand.

The warrior first looked at the other two sets of armor at his feet, seemingly curious why his two companions hadn't awakened with him. Then, he looked at the statue behind him.

Five hundred years ago, it was this very person who stopped them. But five hundred years later,

It was time for it to end!

The little loli's gaze sharpened. She opened her mouth, and her tongue swiftly coiled out, transforming into a whip that lashed fiercely at the warrior.

As if he had eyes on his back, the warrior's *katana* sliced horizontally, blocking the tongue. At the same time, his figure flickered, pulling on the little loli's tongue as he retreated.

The little loli was pulled up like a kite, but she clung on stubbornly, not giving up. She knew she couldn't let the stone statue collapse, or the remaining two would also be released, and they would be even more unrestrained.

Someone might ask, why didn't they just destroy the statue earlier?

But in reality, if the statue had been destroyed earlier, it would have destroyed all three of them along with it, like digging up the roots of a fruit before it was ripe.

"Baka..."

The warrior's blade cut horizontally. The little loli's body trembled, and she instinctively retracted her tongue, but she also leaped into the pit. She had no choice; she had to stop it, and she had to meet it head-on.

Bai Yingying, by this point, had also recovered her wits and shouted to the old Taoist, "Protect the boss."

Then, she looked at Spider-Man, who was sitting at the side, "Come with me!" After that, Bai Yingying directly jumped into the pit. Spider-Man, who had shown no reaction to the little loli's cold remarks earlier, immediately stood up and jumped down with her.

The old Taoist looked at Xu Qinglang and said, "I'll protect the boss. You go too."

"..." Xu Qinglang.

Taking a deep breath, Xu Qinglang took out his heart-protecting mirror. Before he could jump down, the little loli flew out backward, crashing heavily into Xu Qinglang, sending him tumbling backward with her.

The little loli quickly got up, a trickle of blood at the corner of her mouth, but she immediately flipped her tongue, licking the blood back into her mouth, then charged back in.

Next was Bai Yingying. Bai Yingying was directly struck by the *katana*. Although it didn't cause substantive damage, the *Oni*<sup>4</sup> energy on the blade directly dispersed the malevolent aura on her, causing Bai Yingying to stagger backward repeatedly.

Spider-Man, however, continued to trade blows with the warrior, who repeatedly let out sounds of surprise.

Clearly, he recognized the priest, but he couldn't understand why his fellow countryman and junior was now turning against him.

...

Zhou Ze had no idea how critical the situation was in reality. He didn't have time now to return to the room and look out through the glass mirror.

Currently, he was in the midst of a crowd, watching more and more souls walk into the circle where the flag was, like batteries, being rounded up.

And between the flag and the armor, three figures in Japanese military uniforms, holding *katana*, were singing Japanese military songs and constantly running in circles.

They were already dead, yet they hadn't realized their demise. They still believed they were alive, dreaming their dreams of being Japanese.

Their actions were actually designed to attract nearby souls to constantly approach.

In fact, behind the flag, a huge, blurry phantom could be seen. Within the phantom was a man on horseback, very dignified, but his shadow was constantly twisting and blurring.

"What is this, a suppressed demon?" The Japanese girl found Zhou Ze and stood beside him, asking.

She didn't feel any connection to the warrior as one of her own, after all, she had been dismembered and offered as a sacrifice precisely because of these three sets of armor.

In her eyes, these things were not her kin, but thorough and utter demons.

"Yes," Zhou Ze nodded.

"Why can these demons break free?" The Japanese girl asked.

Zhou Ze pointed at the three figures in Japanese military uniforms who were still jumping around.

He said:

"Because those who unsealed them are Chinese."

---
<sup>1</sup> *Wokou* is a term used in East Asia for Japanese pirates, but it can also refer to invaders or bandits. Here, it refers to the Japanese invaders/soldiers.
<sup>2</sup> *Wako*: Another term for Japanese pirates or invaders, same as Wokou.
<sup>3</sup> *Katana*: A Japanese long sword.
<sup>4</sup> *Oni*: A type of demon or ogre in Japanese folklore. Here, it refers to evil or malevolent energy.

title: 第一百八十六章 請神上身！
content:
Actually, the samurai’s combat strength wasn't that high. Of course, his movement and experience were indeed rich, so he often gained the upper hand in clashes, but the damage caused by his attacks was not very serious.

The little loli could confidently maneuver around him. Bai Yingying, after being hit, could always endure the damage with her powerful physique and quickly rush back into the fight. Spider-Man could also fight back and forth.

However, the most crucial point was that a soldier wearing armor, while the armor was just protective gear to mitigate some damage, it was still possible to bypass the armor or even attack the soldier directly through it.

But,

The samurai before them,

He had no flesh and blood,

No discernible presence,

It was as if a mass of air was sustaining this black samurai armor in battle. Therefore, Bai Yingying and the others' attacks could only land on the armor, and the effect was, in fact, negligible.

Unless they could instantly tear or shatter the armor, but this armor was likely no ordinary item five hundred years ago, and after five centuries of nourishment, it had long surpassed the usual scope of armor hardness. To directly smash it was extremely, extremely difficult.

And because of this, even though this samurai was now fighting one against three, he still held his ground without falling behind.

"Seal him!"

The little loli shouted to Bai Yingying and Spider-Man. Now, they could only settle for a temporary retreat, because if she hadn't been intentionally blocking him from behind, this samurai might have long since found an opportunity to destroy Cao Ding's statue.

One was already so tough to chew on; if two more appeared, the situation here would be completely reversed.

Bai Yingying nodded, then charged forward again. This time, Spider-Man cooperated with Bai Yingying, moving at the same speed but from different directions to outflank him.

The katana was reversed, its tip piercing directly into Spider-Man's thigh, then quickly cutting horizontally upwards. The entire process was fluid and decisive.

Spider-Man's body was nearly split open with a gash. He began to stumble backward, finally collapsing onto the ground. Spider-Man's clothes were also sliced open and scattered on the ground. From the wound, foul-smelling pus continuously oozed out, a truly shocking sight.

Bai Yingying's eyes narrowed. For some reason, she sensed that this samurai's strength seemed to have sharply increased since their initial engagement!

This feeling was quickly confirmed.

"Bang! Bang! Bang!"

The samurai exchanged three punches with Bai Yingying. He stood perfectly still, while Bai Yingying began to retreat continuously. The next moment, the samurai appeared behind Bai Yingying, with astonishing speed, followed by a horizontal cut.

"Buzz!"

The blade made a harsh grinding sound as it made contact with Bai Yingying. Bai Yingying was sent flying backward, her malevolent energy constantly dissipating. After falling, Bai Yingying couldn't stand up as quickly as before; she could only lie on the ground, struggling to support herself with her hands, clearly in great pain.

Beneath the helmet, a pair of crimson eyes seemed to be observing everything. Then, the samurai accelerated again, charging directly towards the little loli's position.

The little loli was in an awkward spot. She could dodge, but behind her was Cao Ding's statue. She hated the feeling of having no retreat. After all, not everyone had the courage or willingness to be a hero.

But at this moment, she still spread her hands, stood on her tiptoes, and after extending her tongue, a black vortex swept out.

"Swish! Swish! Swish!"

With each slash of the katana, the little loli's body trembled once, but she still didn't retreat.

Most importantly,

She suddenly realized with astonishment that the samurai's strength was like a roller coaster. It started flat, then suddenly soared, defeating Spider-Man and Bai Yingying in an instant. But at this moment, his strength seemed to have plummeted again.

"Heaven and Earth without limits, Righteous Heart True Law!"

Seizing this opportunity, Xu Qinglang appeared, holding his heart-protecting mirror. He knew that with his strength, he could hardly play a significant role in a direct confrontation, so he simply chose to strike at the opportune moment.

It must be said, the timing Xu Qinglang chose was truly excellent.

The heart-protecting mirror directly pressed against the armor, causing the samurai's body to tremble as if electrocuted. But immediately, the katana suddenly swung horizontally, aiming straight for Xu Qinglang.

Even though Xu Qinglang had anticipated it and quickly retreated after a successful strike, he was still grazed by the blade's energy. His body arced gracefully through the air, flying directly out of the pit. Fortunately, he landed on a sofa, otherwise he might have been killed by the fall.

The old Taoist immediately scrambled over to check Xu Qinglang's condition. Seeing him unconscious, he quickly slapped Xu Qinglang's face.

"I'm not dead..." Xu Qinglang said with difficulty.

"Damn it, this guy is really tough. All of you together couldn't take him down."

The old Taoist poked his head down and saw that the little loli was still in a standoff with the samurai. If the little loli were to be defeated, then this round would truly be over.

"You... go down and help..."

Xu Qinglang lowered his head and glanced at his abdomen, where a wound had appeared. It was truly a close call; if he had retreated even a little bit later, he might have been cut in half.

"Don't talk. Your injury means you shouldn't talk much," the old Taoist said sternly.

While using one hand to staunch the flow of blood from his wound, Xu Qinglang gripped the old Taoist's arm tightly with his other hand, glaring at him.

The old Taoist felt very uneasy under the stare.

Damn it,

Don't you know my level?

Make me go up?

The old Taoist really didn't want to go up.

"Can you invite a deity?" Xu Qinglang asked.

"Uh, I used to play around with it, but that was just to fool people." At this moment, the old Taoist didn't mind revealing his shortcomings.

Xu Qinglang took out a very small talisman from his upper jacket pocket, much smaller than the old Taoist's talismans.

"Stick it on your forehead and try to invite a deity into your body!"

"Will it work?" The old Taoist clearly didn't believe it.

Simple tools, simple operation, simple process,

Is inviting a deity that easy?

Then why would those charlatans on the street still need to lie?

"The Yin energy is heavy here right now, and there are many ghosts. Just inviting any one of them to possess you will at least make you more capable than you are now!"

After saying these words, Xu Qinglang coughed heavily a few times, spitting out some blood.

The old Taoist opened his mouth, as if hesitating. The old Taoist was afraid of death, truly afraid of death. And such a simple method of inviting a deity, while sounding good, in plain terms, it just meant letting any nearby minor ghost possess him to stimulate his potential. The side effects would surely be terrifying.

But at this moment, the old Taoist clearly saw the little loli suddenly kneeling down on one knee, blood oozing from the corner of her mouth. Clearly, she was also close to collapsing.

The old Taoist also understood that once the little loli retreated, then regardless of whether the samurai broke the statue, they would all be finished.

The strongest boss,

Was still in deep sleep!

The old Taoist immediately felt a sense of "the wind whistles, the Yi River is cold," but he still pasted the talisman Xu Qinglang handed him onto his forehead.

"I invite the Immortal to possess me!"

The old Taoist couldn't recite the Taoist incantations for inviting deities. Instead, he ended up jumping around like a Northeast Chinese shaman, looking quite comical.

Suddenly, the old Taoist's body twitched, then he supported his knees with his hands, his upper body drooping.

Xu Qinglang, while struggling to cover the wound on his abdomen, looked at the old Taoist with hopeful eyes. At this point, there was nothing else they could do. Asking the old Taoist to invite a minor ghost to possess him was a last resort. Having one more combatant, no matter how small, was better than nothing.

That talisman wasn't a proper talisman for inviting a deity either. In fact, it was the key to Xu Qinglang's ability to enter Sanxiang Village in the first place. The talisman's purpose was to suppress the Yang energy in a living person, obscuring the three lamps on their body, allowing a ghost to enter.

The old Taoist slowly raised his head, his gaze falling upon Xu Qinglang who was lying on the ground. He then gave a bitter laugh:

"Damn, it's useless, could it be that my Yang energy is too strong?"

Xu Qinglang slumped his head to the side, despairing.

The talisman remained on the old Taoist's head. He had just tired himself out jumping around. His hand instinctively reached for his crotch, but unfortunately, the talisman had already been used.

"Roar!"

A roar from the soul erupted from within the samurai's armor.

Then the samurai ignored the little loli's attacks, absorbing everything head-on. With one downward slash, the little loli raised both hands, clamping the katana, while her tongue directly pierced the samurai's armor. But the samurai also landed a powerful kick to the little loli's body.

"Bang!"

The little loli was sent flying backward,

And crashed heavily onto the ground.

The samurai armor was severely damaged and continued to crack, clearly nearing its limit, but he still desperately charged towards Cao Ding's statue.

"It's over!"

The old Taoist slapped his thigh. At this moment, his reckless spirit emerged. He directly picked up a broken concrete brick nearby and jumped down, rushing towards the samurai.

The old Taoist was fighting for his life; there was no other option.

The feeling at this moment was like a siege battle where the regular army had fallen, and only the old, weak, women, and children were left to continue the fight.

It must be said,

The old Taoist's self-assessment was very accurate.

Although the samurai was severely wounded by the little loli, a centipede dies but never falls. As he turned around, the katana thrust horizontally, making the old Taoist's body shiver with fear.

But in that instant, the talisman on the old Taoist's forehead suddenly broke off. At the same time, the old Taoist's entire demeanor abruptly changed. He immediately shifted his body, dodging the blade. Then, the old Taoist's palm pressed down along the back of the katana, causing the blade to plunge into the ground with its momentum. The old Taoist himself then bravely moved closer to the samurai, ramming his shoulder hard into the samurai's helmet.

"Bang!"

A crisp sound,

The samurai's armor was once again extensively damaged, and his body swayed continuously, beginning to retreat, like a plastic toy about to completely fall apart.

But the samurai paid no attention to his injuries. Those crimson eyes fixed intensely on the old Taoist, glowing with a special light.

In those eyes, there was apprehension and solemnity,

And even,

Something called fear.

The old Taoist pulled the katana from the ground, skillfully twirled the blade, then raised it to point at the samurai. With a hoarse yet firm voice, he uttered two words:

"Kill the Japanese!"

title: 第一百八十七章 殺倭！
content:
Zhou Ze chose not to enter the area encompassed by the banner, as he wasn't sure if the banner would have a special effect on him.

However, not entering the area didn't mean there was no other way.

At this moment, Boss Zhou waved his fingernails from outside the circle, intimidating the attracted lost souls, preventing them from entering the banner's range.

The three sets of armor relied on the malevolent energy provided by these lost souls entering the area to awaken and act. Cutting off their entry was akin to pulling the rug out from under them.

The Japanese girl stood beside Zhou Ze, her eyes red, her body twisting in various places, emitting her aura to help Zhou Ze intimidate these lost souls.

Actually, most of the lost souls here could only be called "lost souls," not even "ghosts," because they were supposed to go to hell. However, after death, they were "detained" by General Mountain's unique magnetic field environment and gathered here.

The Japanese girl, on the other hand, was a genuine ghost with a deep desire for revenge. Therefore, she was able to maintain her lucidity in this environment.

She didn't have any other thoughts just because this was a Japanese setup. For her, her promising life had been ruined by her "compatriots." All she wanted to do now was take revenge!

Zhou Ze actually felt pretty stupid himself, like an adult threatening a bunch of kindergarten kids with a knife, telling them not to move. It was a classless act, but it was the only thing Zhou Ze could do at the moment.

Zhou Ze didn't dare take risks. If he rushed in and was affected by that strange banner, things would truly become troublesome.

It was important to remember that he was different from these lost souls. If they were individual batteries, then he was a nuclear power plant.

Zhou Ze also tried to open the Gates of Hell to take all these lost souls away, but presumably, because they were in the mirror world, the Gates of Hell couldn't be opened. However, Zhou Ze could at least be clear about one thing: the outside world must be in chaos right now, and he wondered if Bai Yingying and the little loli could hold out.

And in fact, if it weren't for Zhou Ze's timely intervention, which caused one of the awakened armors to lose its continuous source of malevolent energy, the situation outside might have already deteriorated to an extreme degree.

The previous rollercoaster-like changes in the samurai's power were precisely for this reason.

Zhou Ze kept an eye on the confused lost souls in front, who were instinctively trying to enter the area, while also monitoring the situation behind him. He noticed that the floating black armor was already seven or eight parts damaged, and he breathed a sigh of relief, guessing that the situation outside shouldn't be completely out of control, right?

However, at this moment, the three men who had been wearing Japanese military uniforms, singing and dancing around the flagpole to attract lost souls, simultaneously drew their swords and rushed towards Zhou Ze, shouting something.

Zhou Ze didn't care about the swords in their hands. When the first person charged, he directly backhanded, pinching the hilt of the opponent's sword, and then lifted it. The opponent, due to the momentum of his charge, actively stumbled towards Zhou Ze. Zhou Ze directly clasped the opponent's neck, his five fingernails mercilessly piercing into the opponent's neck!

"You want to be a Jap so badly, don't you?" Zhou Ze said in a deep voice.

"Ahhhhhhh!!!!!!!!!"

The man let out a tragic scream. At this moment, he seemed to gain a moment of clarity.

Basic "survival" instinct at play, at this moment, he actually looked at Zhou Ze and pleaded:

"I'm not Japanese, I'm Chinese, I'm Chinese..."

Zhou Ze showed no politeness whatsoever, directly twisting his neck. At the same time, the black mist on his fingernails transformed into the sharpest "blades," instantly shredding his lost soul!

Against such scum, there was no need to show any mercy. Annihilation of the soul, never to be reincarnated, was their rightful destiny.

However, perhaps Zhou Ze's simple and brutal killing of one of their companions instilled immense fear in the other two. They dared not advance further, dared not leave the area delimited by the banner. Instead, they directly walked in front of the two still-unawakened armors and began to put them on.

…

The old Taoist held the katana,

His legs slightly spread, in a pigeon-toed stance.

Originally, his appearance was quite good, exuding an air of immortality and Taoist grace. Now, he exuded a sense of simplicity and unpretentiousness.

One person,

One knife,

Five hundred years ago, when Japanese pirates ravaged Tongcheng, the defending soldiers scattered, and the garrison troops were useless. He had many times gone against the tide, actively moving towards the areas where the Japanese pirates were causing trouble.

At the age of forty-four, already old (people in ancient times aged faster and had shorter lifespans), upon hearing the warning, he still unhesitatingly mounted his horse, took his sword, and actively charged forward. The local gazetteer of Tongcheng has detailed records of that battle: he fought his way in and out three times, leading the local villagers of Tongcheng to repel the Japanese pirates, and was killed in pursuit.

There are many statues of Cao Ding in Tongcheng. If you look closely, you can see that Cao Ding's statues are missing two fingers on his left hand.

The reason was that upon hearing of the Japanese pirates' invasion, Cao Ding began to sharpen his sword, personally testing the sharpness of the blade with his fingers. As a result, two of his fingers were directly cut off. Cao Ding laughed loudly, took his sword, mounted his horse, and went to kill the Japanese.

At that time, Cao Ding had already left the army. His identity at the time was merely the owner of a noodle shop in Tongcheng.

The old Taoist had never felt so exhilarated!

First-person perspective!

First-hand experience!

First audience!

Although his body was not under his own control, clearly controlled by an external will, the old Taoist felt very satisfied.

The only regret might be that no one had the time to take out a phone and record a video for him to commemorate it,

It's not easy to find an opportunity to show off!

Cao Ding didn't say much, which greatly displeased the old Taoist. Say more! Give more flashes! While not necessarily instantly causing sand and stones to fly and a blood moon to pierce through the clouds, at least help him make this act of showing off more perfect, right?

Of course, these were just the old Taoist's inner musings.

However, in reality, before Cao Ding died in battle, he merely bandaged his finger wounds and shouted:

"Kill the Japanese pirates."

Until his death, he said nothing else, but he used his entire life, even pledging the next five hundred years, to embody these two words.

The old Taoist walked directly forward. The samurai began to retreat, but in the next moment, the old Taoist sped up. God knows how fast the old Taoist could run.

The samurai was forced to meet the attack head-on. His aura had weakened significantly, for he knew that he was not only facing this old Taoist, but also an existence that had instilled fear in him for five hundred years.

One strike,

Just one strike,

Without any fancy moves,

Without the slightest hesitation,

Everything seemed so easy, revealing an unexpected and almost unsatisfying nonchalance.

The samurai's helmet was pierced through and directly exploded. Shattered along with it was the already nearing broken armor.

This strike was merely the final push that sent the samurai to the cliff's edge. Bai Yingying, Xu Qinglang, and the little loli had already depleted this samurai to the point of being a spent force.

However,

This was not over yet.

The armor that had been quietly sitting in the rotten box now slowly filled up, as if someone had put them on.

The old Taoist continued to walk towards them, still walking very quickly.

If there are Japanese pirates,

Kill them,

No need for words.

The two newly appeared samurai seemed to be still somewhat unaccustomed to the situation, but they instinctively sensed danger. One samurai immediately raised his katana and slashed down at the old Taoist.

"Clang!"

Sword met sword.

The old Taoist's knees buckled, and he directly knelt on one knee.

The old Taoist felt embarrassed. He knew that it was his old arms and legs that were not strong enough for the heroic spirit to display its might; he was somewhat holding it back.

But at the moment of kneeling, the katana in the old Taoist's hand smoothly lifted from bottom to top!

"Pfft..."

The blade qi deeply pierced into the armor, leaving an incredibly deep mark there.

The old Taoist slapped the ground with one palm, quickly stood up, then bent his arm, thrusting the blade from back to front. At the same time, his shoulder and thigh continuously and forcefully collided with the samurai's body, forcing the samurai to lose his balance for a moment.

"Scratch..."

A harsh scraping sound was heard.

The katana in the old Taoist's hand was already resting at the samurai's neck, or rather, the samurai had no neck, but the blade of the katana was pressed just below his helmet.

Effortlessly,

The situation was brought under control!

However, at this moment, a face appeared from under the helmet, a distorted and panicked face. At the same time, this face roared:

"I am Chinese, I am Chinese, I am not Japanese, I am not a Japanese pirate, not a Japanese pirate, I am Chinese! Don't kill me, please don't kill me, I am Chinese!!!"

The old Taoist felt extremely anxious!

Unfortunately, the old Taoist did not have the right to control his own body, at least not at this moment.

Generally speaking, in the old Taoist's opinion, such heroic figures often have a high degree of spiritual purity. He truly worried that Cao Ding, because there was a Chinese soul inside the opponent, would hesitate or let the opponent go, adhering to the idea of not killing his own countrymen.

In fact, the old Taoist had already sensed that the consciousness controlling his body was becoming increasingly weak, and might have to leave at any moment!

At this time, there could be no hesitation, and even less softness!

Brother,

My friend,

Old senior,

Don't stick to principles, absolutely don't stick to principles! Kill him, kill him!

Fortunately,

The old Taoist's worries were unnecessary, very, very unnecessary.

As soon as the opponent revealed his Chinese identity and pleaded,

The blade went straight in,

Directly splitting the armor's helmet.

Incredibly refreshing,

Utterly simple and brutal,

That person's pleading and crying were of absolutely no use.

It was so fast that the old Taoist even felt a little unaccustomed to it.

Cao Ding looked at the broken armor that had turned into a puddle at his feet,

And said in a deep voice:

"Most of the Japanese pirates back then were also our countrymen."

…

PS: According to "Jiajing Records": "For the maritime alarm in Jiangnan, thirteen parts were Japanese pirates, and seventeen parts were Chinese rebels."

title: 第一百八十八章 未接來電！
content:
其實，並不是說老道被附身之後就一下子打通了任督二脈然後神功大漲可以神擋殺神佛擋殺佛了，曹頂的上身確實激發出了老道的潛能，但實際上再怎麼激發，老道的潛能也不可能激發到超過白鶯鶯和小蘿莉的層次。



  之所以能夠砍瓜切菜一樣連續解決倆武士，實際上是因為曹頂當年殺了他們，同時還鎮壓了他們五百年，這是一種烙印在靈魂深處的恐懼。



  在曹頂的面前，這三名兇悍殺人如麻的武士，只能淪為瘦弱的鵪鶉。



  這就像是白鶯鶯一個人時會很高冷，但在面對血統壓制自己的周老闆時馬上就變成「嚶嚶嚶」一個道理。



  曹頂很爽脆，直接殺死了第二名武士，現在，只剩下一個了。



  而且可以看出來，這名武士明顯有些惶惶不安，這種恐懼真的不是喊一句「人定勝天」這種口號就能抵抗得了的。



  這是天敵，是難以逾越的鴻溝。



  老道心下長舒一口氣，現在只要把最後一個殺了，自己這個逼也就能裝結束了。



  曹頂也沒有耽擱時間，他也清楚自己耽擱不起，是故直接沖了上去。



  老道身形矯健，宛若煥發了第二春，那名武士開始躲避，甚至不敢去主動反擊，但躲避也起不到太大的效果，在十餘招之後，武士開始不支，終於被曹頂找到了一個漏洞一腳踹中跪伏了下來，緊接著，曹頂的刀口順勢橫亘了上去。 



  快，



  砍了他，



  砍了他！



  砍了他，我們就可以喊「咔」，然後回家吃飯收衣服了！



  老道在心裡狂喊著！



  然而，



  就在這時，一股濃重的虛弱感自老道體內傳來，這種虛弱感，像是一晚上安慰關懷了十來個失足一樣，天都開始在旋轉了。



  「娘咧！」



  老道心下暗道不好，



  然後整個人倒退著最後仰面倒在了地上，疲倦的感覺直接襲來，老道更是在剎那間昏厥了過去。



  武士刀垂落在了地上，這最後的一刀，並沒有砍下去。



  上頭躺在地上卻一直觀察著這邊情況的許清朗下意識地一口血自嘴角溢出，



  這太狗血了，明明給了莫大的希望，但卻在最後關頭出了問題？



  標準的狗血電影套路，卻真實地在自己面前發生了。



  白鶯鶯強撐著慢慢地靠著牆壁站了起來，她其實體內一片混亂，煞氣更是脫韁的野馬不停地肆虐著，但她清楚，這個時候不是自己休息的時候了，無論情況多糟，她都要站起來。



  渾身是血的小蘿莉嵌在牆壁上，看見老道倒下去時，她的嘴角抽了抽，她的脾氣本就不是很好，所以在這個時候，如果不是身體實在有些吃不消的話，她真的很想罵人。 



  但想來想去，似乎也沒誰能給自己罵了。



  罵曹頂？



  他沒多BB，也沒多廢話，更沒有像一些腦殘電視劇里的正派角色喜歡在殺人前廢話一大通，他已經夠果決夠迅速的了。



  罵老道？



  他好像也沒什麼可以罵的，他已經做了自己所能做的一切。



  事實上，當下這批人里，只有老道是一個純粹的人，所以，曹頂想要上身的話，也只能上老道的身，他已經做出自己的貢獻了。



  最後，小蘿莉覺得，還是有一個人可以罵的。



  是那個ZZ，



  他自己跑過來挖了坑，



  然後當大家累死累活拼命幫他填坑的時候，他卻躺在那裡呼呼大睡！



  這個ZZ！



  咬著銀牙，小蘿莉從牆壁內掙扎著走了出來，雖然身形很不穩定，止不住地在搖晃，但她沒得選。



  沒有配樂，也沒有鮮花，更沒有什麼血紅的旗幟在後面搖擺。



  明明做著挺光偉正的事兒，但沒有歡呼也沒有啦啦隊，小蘿莉很不喜歡這種感覺，也很反感這種場景。



  蜘蛛俠沒死，但他站不起來了，他受的傷太嚴重，不過之前出現的巨大創口在此時已經開始結痂。 



  武士在原地愣了許久，他似乎還沒從剛剛絕望的情緒中走出來，帶著些許的彷徨，他試探性地站起了身。



  然後，



  他看見倒在地上已經昏厥過去的老道，看見了自己前面一個個身受重傷連保持站姿都止不住搖晃的對手。



  他很想笑，



  幸福，



  來得太突然！



  一種絕望的情緒在這裡瀰漫起來，這個片段這個畫面這個劇情以及這個節奏，適合放在電影的開頭，而不是片尾。



  按照電影的劇情，隨後的一大段內容就是這次失敗未能阻止惡魔之後，又有一批新的勇士誕生和出現，最後殺死了惡魔。



  實際上，小蘿莉自己也清楚，自己這邊戰敗後，大不了就是身死道消，而這個日本武士在禍害了一陣之後，馬上會有附近各地的鬼差捕頭甚至還會有巡檢大人親至趕來。



  這個日本武士，到最後也逃不脫滅亡的宿命。



  長舒一口氣，又深深地吸了一口氣，小蘿莉張開嘴，但只是伸出舌頭舔了舔自己有些乾裂的嘴唇。



  武士撿起了自己的武士刀，



  他的盔甲伸展開，



  四周刮來了風，

 

  風很大，



  像是他在作無聲放肆的大笑。



  在犧牲了兩個同伴之後，他笑到了最後。



  雖然這個過程有不少的波折，雖然剛才的自己還在曹頂的追殺下萬分的狼狽，但局面，最終還是被自己掌控住了！



  「鏗鏘！」



  武士舉起了自己的武士刀，一開始指向了前面的老道，隨後又指向了一側的白鶯鶯，最後又指向了另一側的小蘿莉。



  反派很多都死於話多，不是因為反派都很蠢，而是因為在勝券在握時多裝會兒逼是一種難以拒絕的誘huo，讓人下意識地去沉浸其中。



  不過，武士也沒有過多的拖延，他先走向了躺在自己面前的老道。



  舉起刀，



  「咔嚓！」



  武士愣了一下，



  扭過頭，



  看向身後，



  那座屬於曹頂的雕塑，在此時忽然砸落了下來。



  「砰！」



  武士被壓在了下面，雕塑揚起了巨大的塵土，其內部，居然還有火星在四散，不一會兒，焦煙也瀰漫了出來。



  小蘿莉站在了原地，然後馬上沖了過去，不顧自己的傷勢！ 



  白鶯鶯也發出了一聲厲害，強撐著跟著一起沖了過去。



  兩個女人站在倒塌的雕塑面前，看著雕塑不斷地起伏，顯然，裡頭的武士正在拼命地掙扎企圖脫困。



  一聲聲來自靈魂的厲嘯自下面發出，但隨之而來的，是更為熾熱的溫度。



  有一種叫花雞的做法，就是把處理好塞入其他食材的雞放入溫度極高的泥土下面，等到一定時間後取出，剝開泥土，裡面的雞肉將十分美味。



  而此時，這名最後的武士，其實就相當於那隻叫花雞。



  「這是怎麼回事？」



  白鶯鶯顯然有些難以理解，



  「他要被壓死了？」



  一個剛剛呼風喚雨的鬼武士，就這樣被砸死了？



  這就像是電影裡給了極大篇幅的反派boss結果還沒出場就因為吃飯被噎死掛了一樣，讓人有些莫名其妙。



  小蘿莉單膝跪地，對著面前已經倒塌下來的雕塑低下了頭，這是一種鬼差表達自己敬意的方式。



  「曹頂，燃燒了法身，他本可以成為白夫人以及青衣娘娘那種的廟神，事實上他的功德和世代在通城享受的香火比前兩者要高得多得多。



  但他放棄了這一切，只為了拉著這名武士的亡魂，一起魂飛湮滅，連下地獄謀求一個官身的機會都丟掉了。」 



  白鶯鶯聞言，愣了一下，然後跟著一起跪了下來。



  上頭，



  躺在地上看著這邊情況的許清朗，心裡也是無比的唏噓，英雄的落幕，也著實很讓人感傷。



  隨後，



  許清朗看向了自己身邊還在昏迷著的周澤，有些無奈道：



  「事情都結束了，你還不醒來？」



  無奈之中，



  帶著強烈得不滿和幽怨，濃郁得似乎都要化作水滴淌出來。



  …………



  「所以，這是怎麼回事？」日本女孩有些好奇地看著周澤。



  背後的雕塑虛影在燃燒，剩下的一套鎧甲和那杆旗幟也在燃燒，熊熊的火焰將前方完全覆蓋。



  「是在燃燒自己的神魂和功德。」周澤解釋道。



  五百年前，曹頂戰死，通城百姓給他建立了曹公祠，修建了倭子墳，五百年的香火供奉，是當地百姓對他的懷念，而今，他將這些東西一個不留通通還了回去，只為了帶走這隻即將出土的惡魔，保地方一個安寧。



  周澤覺得自己雖然是個通城人，但自己可能做不到這個地步，如果不是因為有著鬼差身份的羈絆，他很可能會在一開始就選擇明哲保身。 



  正是因為大多數人做不到，所以人們才更加地崇拜英雄，給英雄再多的禮遇再多的香火再多的敬意，也絲毫不為過。



  火還在燃燒，這片白茫茫的鏡子世界，仿佛在接下來很快會被燒得乾乾淨淨，在失去了曹頂失去了被鎮壓的這些鬼子亡魂之後，將軍山的奇特之處，也將不復存在。



  周澤覺得自己很快也會得以離開，這些聚集在這裡的亡魂也會在隨後自己進入地獄，他們本就是該進地獄的，所以這幫亡魂周澤送不送，都不算業績的。



  哦，



  還是有業績的，



  比如站在自己身邊的這個日本女孩。



  周澤覺得自己在這件事上，一直都在打醬油，但好在也不是全無收穫，自己至少可以把這個女孩給送進地獄能賺一點是一點吧。



  四周的玻璃，開始扭曲和揮發，亡魂們開始四處遊走，他們在等待這裡禁制的徹底消亡，從而去他們應該去的黃泉路。



  一想到自己即將去見外面的那群朋友，周澤還有些怕怕的，這件事是因為自己要追查所以才捅破的，結果到頭來，自己反倒是被關在鏡子裡頭啥都沒幹成，而外面的那幫人，估計忙壞了吧。



  這個，不是很好交代啊。



  從自己衣服里取出了一根煙，再拿出打火機，周澤看見自己的煙和打火機都有些扭曲了起來，連帶著自己的手掌也有些模糊了。 



  這是即將回去的徵兆，



  但周澤還是點了煙，



  隨後，習慣性地拿出了手機。



  「我們，能出去了麼？」日本女孩問道。



  「等出去後，我送你去該去的地方。」周澤說道，「如果你有親人的話，我可以事後幫你聯繫他們，給一個最後的交代，不好意思，這是我能做的極限。」



  「我懂。」女孩很善解人意。



  周澤聳聳肩，其實，有一件事周澤一直很奇怪，為什麼那個鬼來電可以在鏡子裡撥打出去聯繫到自己，但自己在鏡子裡卻沒辦法撥通出去，難道說這玩意兒是單向聯繫？或者只能聯繫給當地的鬼差？



  但小蘿莉不也是鬼差麼？



  還有一件事，既然曹頂能燃燒法神將這些魑魅魍魎都燒個乾淨，為什麼一開始沒燒，難道說一開始他還是存著能保存自己的心思，到最後見局面可能會失控才決定犧牲自己的？



  當然了，周澤這個念頭並沒有褻瀆英魂的意思，英魂也是人，有這種念頭也很正常。



  鬼使神差地，



  周澤點開了電話簿，



  在這個時候，



  手機屏幕已經開始變得模糊起來了，四周的一切也都在慢慢地模糊。 



  周澤選中了那個未知號碼，點了過去，之前其他人的電話他都撥通出去過，但能撥通卻沒人接，這個號碼，周澤反而沒撥過。



  「嘟…………嘟…………嘟…………」



  電話居然打通了，



  「嘟…………嘟…………嘟…………」



  自己身邊居然也有了電話的聲音響起來。



  周澤有些意外地放下了手機，



  看向自己面前的日本女孩。



  手機的聲音，



  是從她身上傳來的。



  女孩愣了一下，



  扭過頭，



  看向了周澤，一臉茫然道：



  「什麼聲音？」



  周澤看著她，平靜地看著她，她沒穿衣服，之前從溫泉池裡走出來時就沒穿衣服，之後跟著周澤從房間裡跑出來時也沒穿，所以，她身上其實沒有可以放手機的地方。



  不過，女孩臉上的笑容和迷茫很快消失不見，



  她伸出手，



  放在自己胸口，



  隨後撕開了自己胸口的皮肉，



  在肋骨夾層之中，有一隻個頭小巧的手機被嵌在裡頭。 



  「咔嚓！咔嚓！」



  她扳斷了自己的兩根肋骨，取出了裡面的手機，



  然後當著周澤的面，將手機貼近自己的臉龐，



  壓低了嗓門，



  沉聲道：



  「餵…………救我…………救我…………我在將軍山…………救我…………」



  女孩舔了舔自己的嘴唇，像是玩笑被大人看穿了一樣，顯得有些嬌羞。



  緊接著，她的手輕輕地拍打在剛剛被自己撕開的位置，有些後怕地嬌呼道：



  「好險呢，



  我就說這個缺了手指頭的老不死的東西不是那麼好對付的吧，



  當初神父還很不以為然，說他已經死了五百年了，還能有什麼威脅？



  只可惜，



  神父不知道什麼原因居然放了我鴿子，這次居然沒來，不然我真想指著他鼻子罵他一頓，讓他睜開眼看看：



  剛剛如果我也跟著衝進去，



  可能現在也被燒死了吧？」

title: 第一百八十九章 瘋魔！（修）
content:
Everyone was wounded, scarred all over.

The little loli sat on the ground, eyes closed, occasionally kneading the aching parts of her body. Her body was delicate and indeed needed more attention.

Old Tao and Spider-Man were laboriously carried up by Bai Yingying. Old Tao was still unconscious, his face pale, looking like he'd overindulged.

His eye sockets were sunken and dark, lips chapped and white, body weak and covered in cold sweat, twitching occasionally.

Of course, no one would mock him now. Among the people present, Zhou Ze and the little loli were ghost servants, Bai Yingying was a zombie, Spider-Man was a living dead, and Xu Qinglang was a Mystic Cultivator. If Old Tao hadn't been there, Cao Ding wouldn't have had a suitable body to possess and help even if he wanted to at that time.

Besides, Old Tao didn't chicken out even before Cao Ding possessed him. He grabbed a brick and charged forward; he was quite the man.

Spider-Man's muscles were constantly rippling, seemingly undergoing self-repair, but the process was very, very slow.

Bai Yingying looked at him and found it somewhat amusing. The once clean-cut priest now looked like this; it was quite ironic, she had to admit.

And according to the little loli, the priest had been deeply involved in this matter previously, but who told him to go research his boss's ashes halfway through when he had nothing else to do, ending up like this?

Bai Yingying also felt a shiver of fear. If the priest had been here in full form, perhaps even Cao Ding, sacrificing everything, might not have been able to successfully prevent the revival of these wandering souls.

This priest's ability to stir up trouble was simply too strong. It seemed he had been constantly causing problems for many years, and then he messed with his own boss,

And then,

Got himself killed.

Xu Qinglang leaned on the broken sofa, coughing occasionally. He had already bandaged his wounds himself; they weren't too serious. The main issue was the significant blood loss that left him feeling weak.

Of those present, the one who seemed least affected was Boss Zhou, who had been sleeping from start to finish.

Xu Qinglang, annoyed, gently kicked Zhou Ze:

"Hey, it's over. Time to wake up, isn't it?"

If Zhou Ze had joined earlier, perhaps everyone wouldn't have been so miserable. Even Cao Ding wouldn't have had to completely vanish. He would still have had a chance to seek an official position in Hell with his merits and incense offerings, or reincarnate for a happy and smooth next life.

No need for him to be completely annihilated, turned to nothingness, as he was now.

It wasn't that Xu Qinglang blamed Zhou Ze, but when a man isn't capable at crucial moments, when one greatly needs and craves his prowess, but he just turns his head and sleeps soundly, feigning ignorance, it's always very uncomfortable!

The little loli let out a long breath, exhaling a faint bloody mist, but her body seemed much lighter than before. She was using a breathing technique to regulate her internal injuries.

Opening her eyes, she looked at the still unconscious Zhou Ze.

The little loli strangely reached out and touched Zhou Ze's forehead.

Bai Yingying watched the little loli's every move closely, worried that she might take a desperate measure and kill her boss while he was vulnerable.

"He should be awake,"

The little loli said.

Then, the little loli pointed to all the reflective surfaces around them, such as mirrors, picture frames, and even tiles. Without exception, all of them had dense cracks.

The barrier was broken.

The little loli had previously speculated that Zhou Ze's consciousness might be in the mirror world. Now that everything was over, he should have returned.

But then, the little loli suddenly let out a gasp, quickly retracted her hand from Zhou Ze's forehead, and examined her palm. There was actually a frostbitten mark on it.

"What's going on?" The little loli looked at the still unconscious Zhou Ze with a solemn expression.

At this moment, Zhou Ze's face gradually began to change. His skin started to shrivel, turning a strange bronze color, and two fangs slowly pushed through the gaps in his lips. His body emanated a chill more terrifying than Bai Yingying's during combat.

This was the first time the little loli had seen Zhou Ze in this state. Before, she had only heard Old Tao jokingly say how amazing her boss was when he went "berserk."

Now, she believed it.

"Boss?" Bai Yingying immediately leaned over, looking at Zhou Ze with concern.

"Is he...?" Xu Qinglang frowned, looking at the scene before him, muttering, "Is he having a nightmare?"

...

The collapse within the mirror world was unstoppable. Even the wandering souls in the outer regions had begun to disappear, returning to reality and naturally entering Hell, their rightful destination, which had been delayed by the peculiar environment here.

The girl faced Zhou Ze, a smile on her face. Her expression had lost its initial panic and senseless anger, appearing somewhat calm.

"Regardless, I really have to thank you."

The girl bowed deeply to Zhou Ze, a gesture of politeness.

"Only by following you could I be百分百 (100%) sure of escaping from here."

Yes, the girl was telling the truth. She could have chosen to act with those three Japanese samurai, but she was worried about unforeseen circumstances, such as the one who had suppressed her for five hundred years.

And indeed, that fellow had actually abandoned his merits and incense offerings just to completely annihilate them!

That flame, now extinguished, still made the girl feel a shiver of fear.

And by choosing to follow Zhou Ze, entering the game as one of the "obstructors," if Zhou Ze won, she would be free; if Zhou Ze lost, she would be even freer. It was like betting on both sides in a war; no matter the outcome, she couldn't lose.

The phone was clutched in the girl's hand, constantly shaking up and down.

"Old people become spirits" is a common saying to describe wise elders, because they have lived long and experienced many changes.

And this woman had lived for five hundred years. On the basis of those five hundred years, using a little scheming and playing a few tricks was perfectly normal.

"I really didn't expect things to turn out this way," Zhou Ze said.

Now, Zhou Ze finally understood why Cao Ding hadn't chosen to directly annihilate all the aspiring samurai with a simple, brutal method from the start.

Because Cao Ding knew,

There was still one person who hadn't entered the circle,

But in the end, he had no choice but to leave a loose end, because this loose end was too cautious and too careful.

Cao Ding had wanted to take care of all future troubles in one go,

But he failed.

"Do you want to see what I looked like before?"

The girl twisted her waist,

Soon,

She appeared in a professional office suit, intellectual and capable.

Immediately after, a dress appeared, shy and adorable.

Then, a graceful Hanfu, fresh and refined.

Slowly, she changed into a casual outfit, wearing white hotel slippers. These were the clothes she wore on the day she had her incident, when she was violated by the three Japanophiles.

Finally,

Her clothes began to melt, transforming into black fabric that slowly clung to her body. This was a female ninja's attire, her original outfit, the clothes she wore when she died!

More than five hundred years ago, she and her comrades had just landed and broken through the city gates when they were repelled by Cao Ding leading the villagers. She herself had her head severed by Cao Ding's blade during his pursuit.

"I told you, mirrors can record images. They are very objective and fair; they faithfully record everything that happened back then.

But precisely because of their fairness, they can give people a false impression that the scenes within them are all true.

And the more real something appears, often the more lies lie behind it."

The female ninja tilted her head slightly, looking at Zhou Ze as if teasing a younger brother,

"Do you feel terrified now? Do you feel a sense of humiliation, as if you've been played in the palm of my hand?"

The female ninja stepped closer, nearing Zhou Ze a little, and continued to provoke him:

"Didn't you ever wonder why those three guys coincidentally gathered here?

Didn't you ever wonder why there just happened to be me next door, a Japanese girl who heard Japanese music and proactively knocked on the door wanting to join the party, only to then inexplicably resist shyly when things went wrong?"

Zhou Ze nodded, admitting, "I was careless."

From the very beginning of the whole affair, Zhou Ze had been caught in the game. Whether it was "serving time" in someone else's place or his final actions, he had actually been manipulated.

"Hehe."

The female ninja laughed, very happily, and continued:

"You know, seducing those three guys was quite interesting, but they were no good, they finished quickly, their bodies were really weak. I really hadn't even started to feel comfortable, just a light squeeze and they'd already burst their dam."

There were a total of four ghosts,

One responsible for seduction,

Three responsible for possession,

Clear division of labor,

Done in one go.

That's how she was able to enter Zhou Ze's room from the adjacent one.

Of course, when she was dismembered by Zhou Ze, she still managed to maintain her composure, flawlessly portraying a vengeful female ghost, which was indeed her skill.

Zhou Ze's body slowly began to change,

In fact,

The change in his body in reality was merely a conscious manifestation.

In the mirror world,

Zhou Ze's skin had slowly turned bronze, his flesh began to shrivel, and deep within his eyes, flickering, was a gloomy darkness like black flames.

The female ninja was a little surprised, surprised by Zhou Ze's transformation, and by the terrifying aura emanating from him now.

But she wasn't afraid.

She continued to smile:

"It's too late. This place will soon shatter. When it does, I can find any intact mirror to leave. You won't find me, and you can't catch me.

I am free!"

Zhou Ze slowly lowered his head,

As if he hadn't heard the girl's words at all.

The girl began to retreat. The restriction here was almost completely broken; she could leave now.

"Why... wake me... up...?"

The girl froze, looked back, and found Zhou Ze still bowing his head.

Not talking to her?

Then who was he talking to?

The girl was a little confused.

"Oh... I see..."

Zhou Ze seemed to be talking to himself,

In fact,

He was indeed talking to himself.

He reached into his pocket,

And pulled out a bronze ring,

"Got it... Interesting... This thing... You can't use it... Can you?"

Still talking to himself,

But the female ninja sensed a strong sense of danger,

This sense of danger was clearer than when Zhou Ze's appearance changed and his aura became terrifying!

She started running outwards, she had to leave this place!

Cao Ding was dead,

No one could bind her anymore,

Freedom,

Was right before her!

"Ding..."

Zhou Ze's black fingernail lightly flicked the ring,

The ring emitted a clear sound,

And then,

A blue light curtain radiated from the ring,

Instantly enveloping this space.

The female ninja's body crashed heavily into the light curtain and was bounced back,

Her eyes were filled with fear and disbelief,

The restriction that had clearly been mostly shattered just now,

Had actually recovered at this moment!

No,

It wasn't that,

The female ninja realized,

It was a new restriction, re-covering this place!

She was trapped again!

Zhou Ze slowly raised his head, his back still slightly hunched,

His arms hung naturally, very long, with long fingernails that looked like they could touch the ground at any moment.

A hint of mockery played on his lips,

The black flames in his eyes stared at the female ninja ahead with a hint of excitement,

The more he looked, the more he liked her,

Like looking at a bottle of,

Five-hundred-year-old aged wine...

title: 第一百九十章 失控的局面！
content:
Zhou Ze's body still swayed slightly, like an old man on the verge of death, or a drunken alcoholic, as if he could collapse at any moment.

But the terrifying aura emanating from him was intensely oppressive.

The female ninja tried to open the blue light barrier. She wanted to leave. She and her three companions had gone to great lengths to destroy the restrictions left by Cao Ding, but reality was so cruel.

She had finally escaped her original cage, only to enter an even larger, more solid one.

Zhou Ze slowly walked over, his figure still swaying slightly. As he approached, the female ninja's expression grew more serious.

She didn't dare to actively attack Zhou Ze, just like someone who accidentally falls into a tiger's cage. Their first instinct is to climb out of the cage, not foolishly fight the tiger.

Zhou Ze was that tiger in the cage, ready to devour people.

Previously, Zhou Ze had thought of letting the others from the bookstore fight for their lives outside while he, the boss, just watched the show, not even acting as a cheerleader. That was indeed a bit inexcusable.

Now,

it was rather good.

Zhou Ze even had to thank the woman in front of him for giving him a chance to do something, so he wouldn't be scorned by Xu Qinglang and the others after leaving the mirror world.

"We can make a deal."

Every prey, before dying, would try every means to find a chance to escape. The female ninja was no exception.

"Before you died... you were just an ordinary person..."

The sarcasm on Zhou Ze's lips grew more intense.

Yes,

five hundred years ago, when you were killed by Cao Ding, you were just ordinary Japanese pirates. No matter how ruthless, you were still ordinary people.

Since you were ordinary people, and you've been suppressed here for five hundred years, what could you possibly have that would interest me?

The female ninja showed a look of pleading.

Zhou Ze approached step by step.

At that moment, the female ninja's figure vanished from where she stood, instantly reappearing behind Zhou Ze. In her hand was a black dagger, which she thrust directly towards Zhou Ze's neck.

Everything happened in an instant.

"Poof!"

The dagger plunged in!

The female ninja's face lit up with joy.

Her sneak attack had actually succeeded!

Was he arrogant enough to think he had her completely?

The female ninja wanted to laugh at that moment, but she restrained her emotions, ready to twist the dagger and slice off Zhou Ze's entire head.

But then came the sound of "creak, creak" from muscle friction.

No matter how much strength the female ninja exerted, she couldn't move the dagger at all, because Zhou Ze's muscles and bones had directly jammed the dagger tightly, as if embedded in his body.

The female ninja's eyes narrowed, and she immediately chose to retreat.

"Thwack!"

But then came a crisp sound.

Zhou Ze twisted his head.

And then,

the female ninja felt her entire body fly through the air. All she heard was the rushing wind, a despair-inducing speed.

"Bang!"

Zhou Ze gripped the female ninja's neck with one hand, pressing her directly to the ground, sliding for nearly a hundred meters!

"Agh................"

A low murmur escaped Zhou Ze's throat, like a prayer before a meal, thanking God for such abundant food.

The female ninja's body trembled. This was not the tremble of facing an enemy. Even more than five hundred years ago, when she, as a female ninja, came to the Chinese coast with others, whether facing Ming Dynasty soldiers or finally Cao Ding, whether in victory or defeat, she had never been afraid. What's more, she now possessed five hundred more years of psychological experience than before.

But at this moment, she truly felt a fear from the depths of her soul, because she felt she wasn't facing a person, but a pressure from the food chain.

It seemed she was inherently his food. This sense of oppression was like a zebra, lost, encountering a lion.

Zhou Ze's nails pierced into the female ninja's neck, while the surrounding black mist instantly compressed.

Around them, the sound of a juicer operating could be heard. In fact, that's what was happening.

Simple,

direct,

brutal,

astonishing,

and also somewhat shocking, difficult to behold.

A wisp of green smoke rose. Zhou Ze raised his head and inhaled sharply.

The green smoke entered his nostrils,

bringing immense pleasure,

like a pampered old woman smoking a hookah.

He smacked his lips,

licked them,

then shivered slightly.

Everything,

was comfortable.

The existence of a soul, even if she had existed for five hundred years and undergone special cooperation and conditioning with the priest, was, in Zhou Ze's eyes at this moment,

nothing but a puff of smoke.

Slowly exhaling,

Zhou Ze slowly sat down.

He reached out and gently placed his hand on his forehead,

like an old man after a full meal, ready to bask in the sun and take a nap.

About a quarter of an hour passed,

Zhou Ze lowered his hand.

His eyes still gleamed with a strange green light,

but the expression on his face was somewhat unusual.

It was confusion,

puzzlement,

panic.
